Comprehensive Pain Management Specialists, LLC in Wilkes-Barre Township, PA offers specialized care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our board-certified physicians and medical professionals utilize advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment protocols to address a wide range of pain disorders. Located conveniently at 1177 PA-315, our state-of-the-art facility serves patients throughout Northeastern Pennsylvania with compassionate, individualized care focused on improving quality of life and restoring function.

At Comprehensive Pain Management Specialists, we take a multidisciplinary approach to pain treatment, combining interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health support. Our team specializes in treating conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, and cancer-related pain. Each treatment plan is customized to address the unique needs of our patients, with the goal of minimizing pain while maximizing daily function.

Our Facility and Accessibility

Our modern facility in Wilkes-Barre Township is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technology. We offer convenient scheduling options, accept most major insurance plans, and work diligently to ensure patients receive timely care. The clinic is easily accessible from Interstate 81 and Route 315, with ample parking available for patients and their families.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 570-270-5700. Additional information about our practice, including patient resources and educational materials, can be found on our website at http://www.cpmspecialists.com/. Our address is 1177 PA-315, Wilkes-Barre Township, PA 18702, United States.

I Love Kerri Orr and for the first time i didn't see her and all of a sudden this happened, they didn't even write on my bottle this time like they usually do they just left it sitting there, but I'm getting accused of something i didn't do... Lebanon Pain Relief Center serves Lebanon, Pennsylvania with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Established as a trusted healthcare provider in the Lebanon community, our center combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives and reduce suffering from chronic pain conditions.

At Lebanon Pain Relief Center, our board-certified physicians and pain specialists utilize advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment approaches to address various pain conditions. We offer interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and integrative therapies designed to target pain at its source while minimizing reliance on opioid medications.

Conditions We Treat

Our expertise extends to treating numerous pain conditions including but not limited to:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Fibromyalgia

  • Headaches and migraines

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in developing personalized treatment plans that consider each patient's medical history, lifestyle, and goals. Our multidisciplinary team works collaboratively to ensure comprehensive care that addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain management.

Visit Our Center

Located at 600 Isabel Dr, Suite 3, Lebanon, PA 17042, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide effective pain relief solutions. To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please call +1 717-272-7272.

For more information about our services or to request an appointment online, visit our website at https://yourpainreliefcenters.com/locations/pennsylvania/lebanon-pain-relief-center.

column40: Dr Lozenzo is the best. As far as his assistant Ashley they need to get rid of her. She is by far very unprofessional. She took me off of medication without slowly taking me off. She was rude and blamed me for my surgery doctor calling her and leaving her multiple messages because I was in pain after a total knee surgery. I would not recommend seeing her ask for Dr lozenzo. I might have spelled his name wrong.|Doctor Lorenzo is hands down the best for treating your pain and still treating you with dignity and respect a true caring and prelesional person I would give this office a higher rating if I could.|Dr Lorenzo is the best he's helped me so much and the staff are the best thanks for all your hard work Sam|Practise has greatly improved in the last 4 months. I received a call from new office manager asking about certain issues. Very nice and caring person who goes above and beyond. New PA Ashley is excellent !!|This review has nothing to do with the medical staff at Lebanon Pain Relief Center because I never got to see them.  My doctor's office sent a referral to this practice twice in one week.  The practice never contacted me.  I called and left a message inquiring about my referral and got no response.  I stopped by in person one day to ask about my referral.  I was told there was no referral and the person I spoke with seemed annoyed that I was looking for information.  I was also told that this office has "a process."  Apparently the "process" is to ignore potential patients?  There is a large sign on the window at the front desk warning patients not to knock or tap on the window.  So if there is no one behind the window, you just sit and wait?  How would they know someone is waiting?  Maybe that's part of their "process?"  I moved on to another practice where humans actually answer the telephone and are pleasant.  This practice might have some great docs if you can only get past the receptionist at the front desk?|I have lived in PA for 2 years now.  I have been seen by a couple of Pain Specialist before Dr. Lorenzo.  Dr. L is the only one who has truly listened to what I had to say.  He gave me clear options and discussed with me what we both thought would be my best options.  The staff was very nice and easy to work with.  I was referred by another patient.|1 star is 1 too many for this pain management facility.|Absolutely top notch Dr's with an emphasis on the patients care.  I highly recommend this place as their target is to improve patients health.

column2: Art of Pain Management & Regenerative Medicine
column3:
Art of Pain Management & Regenerative Medicine serves Philadelphia and Upper Darby, PA, with specialized care for patients suffering from chronic pain and sports injuries. Our dedicated team of pain management physicians understands that physical discomfort often leads to emotional distress, which is why we take a comprehensive approach to pain management. We focus on both alleviating immediate symptoms and developing long-term treatment plans that restore your quality of life and help you return to your daily activities with comfort and confidence.

At Art of Pain Management, we offer a wide range of treatments designed to address various pain conditions. Our regenerative medicine approaches help the body heal naturally, while our interventional procedures target specific pain sources. We understand that each patient's experience with pain is unique, which is why we create individualized treatment plans tailored to your specific needs, medical history, and lifestyle goals.

Patient-Centered Approach

We recognize that scheduling medical appointments can be challenging, especially when you're dealing with pain. That's why we provide flexible scheduling options and convenient office hours to ensure you receive timely care. Our physicians take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and explain all available treatment options in terms you can understand.

Our Commitment to Quality Care

Our doctors firmly believe that everyone deserves high-quality pain management care regardless of the type or cause of injury. We strive to provide compassionate, evidence-based treatments in a comfortable environment. Our team stays current with the latest advancements in pain management techniques to offer you the most effective solutions available.

If you're struggling with chronic pain or recovering from a sports injury, contact Art of Pain Management & Regenerative Medicine at +1 215-375-7107 or visit us at 7000 Terminal Square Suite 100B, Upper Darby Township, PA 19082. Learn more about our services at philadelphiapainmanagement.com.
column11:
If you are searching for Philadelphia or Upper Darby, PA, pain management physicians to help with a sports injury or chronic pain, our team at Art of Pain Management may be able to help. We understand that physical injuries can cause emotional suffering, so we work hard to help you manage your pain or eliminate it through treatment so that you can continue to lead a high-quality life.

It is sometimes hard to schedule an appointment with a pain management physician that works with your schedule, so we aim to provide flexible scheduling and convenient office hours for you to receive care. Our Doctors believe that you deserve the highest quality care regardless of your type of injury, so we strive to provide:

column40: "Dr." Teller is VERY unprofessional. (He isn't a doctor, he is a chiropractor) My mother has been dealing with severe back pain (ruptured disc, herniated disc, and arthritis) for over 12 years, and has tried over the counter medications, natural supplements, yoga, physical therapy, and found no relief. She FINALLY found the medicine on the dosage that works for her (everyone manages their pain differently, it is the doctor's job to analyze everyone individually) and Dr. Teller told her to take ibuprofen and try yoga. As if she hadn't tried this before. She isn't someone desperate for an opiate or trying to get her fix. She is a woman that works 12 hour days and needs to be able to get out of bed and move. She tried his recommendation, and could barely move for weeks because she was in such pain. The next time she saw him, she asked for a stomach medicine because the OTC medications were hurting her stomach. He then proceeded to YELL at her. He said, and I quote, "Well, if it hurts your gut, why are you taking it?! That doesn't make any sense!" She said "Because you TOLD me to". So unprofessional he cannot even remember what recommendations he gives to his patients. He then proceeded to go on, yelling, about how successful he is. That he can get out of bed, work out everyday, and still come to work with no pain. That's amazing, Chiropractor Teller, but you cannot tell someone else how much pain they're in. You need to listen to your patients and meet them where they're at. Disgusting. Aside from all that nonsense, she was literally taken out of the doctor's office to sit in the waiting room again, because she hadn't paid yet. Most practices accept payment after the appointment. I'm simply appalled by this place.|This service stinks they have new doctor well they cleaned them to be a doctor but their practitioner. You wait for 3 hours to be service when I call you meds in your scripts are wrong. You have to call back to get it correct and then it takes days. 69th St. office stinks that very unprofessional.  You say good morning no one responds. They even have nerve enough to put a visually impaired person through the ringer and refuse her service after two appointments.  Employees less joke around play around and do hardly any work the whole day.  They really need to be reported. Business office like that gives other business offices a poor reputation|Dr Teller and Dr Schina are committed to wellness, not just giving pain medicine. They want to ensure that we fee better long term and live a healthy and full life. I'm truly grateful for their treatment and support, recommendation, and advice on how to improve my chronic pain and symptoms from my time in the service and MVA. It's not often doctors care about helping you NOT to need them forever, and that's their goal.|The secretary was very unprofessional, she had my client sitting in the waiting are over 3 hours because he couldn't supply urine.  She knew a month ago at the last appointment that he was on dialysis again and can't produce it. I came to her at least three times to find out she never gave the doctor his paper work when we first got there, I had to get someone to cover me at my job because I was still there at that appointment. Come to find out they can do the labs by blood. VERY UNPROFESSIONAL|Don't waste your time! They schedule you for 11:20 am for injections then make you wait almost 2 hours while the whole staff " eats their lunch". Other more serious problems also seen that will be reported Health Department.|Timing has greatly improved, I spend no more than 1 hour in the office, I highly recommend Dr. Lorna Cheng she actually cares about your health and well-being.|ABSOLUTELY the most unprofessional doctors office I have ever been too! Do not accept Friday appointments! This is the 2nd time they have left with no way of getting a hold of anyone, that they did not phone my husbands medication to the pharmacy leaving him in pain and sick from withdrawal! Very irresponsible on their part!|If I could give no stars I would.   I was seen 3x....last visit I saw a different person AGAIN...I saw 3 different drs.   3 different times.   Poor lack of communication between everyone including Dr to me.  Nothing is explained just this is what you will do.   Plus they insisted I change my insurance.   Since I cannot...I was told u will have to transfer out....which is what I will do....keep walking ...the will force you to....while in pain.

Comprehensive Pain Centers in Allentown, PA offers specialized pain management services to residents throughout the Lehigh Valley region. Our board-certified physicians and medical professionals are dedicated to diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches that address both symptoms and underlying causes. Since our founding, we have helped thousands of patients regain mobility, reduce dependence on medication, and improve their overall quality of life through customized treatment plans.

At Comprehensive Pain Centers, we utilize a multidisciplinary approach that combines interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and behavioral health techniques. Our team specializes in treating conditions including back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs, medical history, and lifestyle goals.

State-of-the-Art Facilities

Our modern facility at 1146 S Cedar Crest Blvd in Allentown is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technology. The center features comfortable consultation rooms, procedure suites for minimally invasive interventions, and rehabilitation spaces designed to support your recovery journey. We've created an environment that prioritizes both clinical excellence and patient comfort.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in empowering patients through education and active participation in their treatment plans. Our staff takes the time to thoroughly explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes. This collaborative approach helps patients make informed decisions about their care while building the confidence needed for successful pain management.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 610-366-9000 or visit our website at www.comprehensivepain.com. Our office is conveniently located at 1146 S Cedar Crest Blvd, Allentown, PA 18103, with accessible parking and wheelchair access. We accept most major insurance plans and work with patients to navigate coverage options for specialized pain treatments.

column40:
I have suffered with chronic migraines since 2007. Ended up in agony all the time. Took 32 milligrams of Dilaudid and still no help. Out of desperation and no medications that help I decided to have experimental migraine surgery. The surgeon ruined every area of my head he touched. More surgeries to fix his damage. Ended up in daily agony since 2015. I finally found Dr Khan. They cannot do anything to me physically to fix my pain so I may lead a normal life.  He recommended a morphine pump. Every visit he barely spoke just kept upping my dose. After getting up to over 3mgs in my pump and still no relief. He handed me a script for Percocet.  I immediately left his unprofessional office and ended up with a new pain doctor who helped me wean off the morphine. I was down to 1/4 mg per day. Last October I had the pump removed and was so sick with opiate withdrawal from October to January.  He rarely talked to me. Made me wait in the waiting room for over two hours on one occasion.  I'd never return to see Dr Khan.|They are very incompetent when it comes to clerical work and tell you one thing and do another. They misapplied my payments and when I try to resolve the issue with them they do not do as discussed. Additionally, I requested a billing summary for my appointments to help resolve the issue and they refused. I requested a statement of my account and they provided a difficult to read report which was also not provided by date. The clerical staff require additional training. When I brought up a clerical error they made on my last appointment the supervisor Kate proceeded to say that she did not do it and after pointing it out they also refused to fix it.

She also said she would provide a better report via email and instead of providing a report she proceeded to send a me link to create an account; creating additional work for me to solve the issue.

BE SURE TO REQUEST A BILLING SUMMARY WITH THE CORRESPONDING DATES AFTER EACH APPOINTMENT.

The nurses and doctors are friendly and provide you with resources and options.|Dr Khan is hands down the best pain management Dr I have ever been to. I have had chronic pain for over 20 years and have been to alot of pain centers over those years and Dr Khan and is staff our hands down the best!!! Dr Khan truly cares about his patients he listens to you!!!! Truly cares about your health and comes up with the best way to relieve the pain. I highly recommend Dr Khan and his staff to anyone!! You will not find a better Dr who truly is compassionate and concerned about you as a person! Thanks Dr Khan and your staff for all you have done for me you have given me my life back!|Dr Khan is the best! He is so nice and very efficient. The place is very clean and getting an appointment is fast. I recommend all my family and friends to him. I've gone to other places back in the early 90s and forget it. His bedside manner puts you at ease. I would highly recommend  comprehensive pain centers  to everyone! Can't wait to get my next injection.!|I started with Comprehensive Pain Center in 2018 with neck and back issues. I received a brace for my neck and had a shot then a rhisotomy and my neck is now pain free and I can turn it freely to both sides. I am so grateful to Dr Khan he listens to you and makes a plan for you  then implements the plan. Dr Khan is highly educated and I am confident in his skills. I have a complex issue with my back and we are working on that. Right now I can walk without a cane or crutches. I feel relief and will continue to work with Dr Khan to continue treatment. I have to also say that the staff is friendly , quick to help you and they are very competent. I go to the Hazleton office, which is very quick paced and everyone stays on top of the workload. Thank you all !! If you have chronic pain this is the place to go!|Dr khan and the entire office employee staff at the comprehensive pain center seem very knowledgeable and caring in there field  of medicine. I can only  imagine the expertise it takes to judge one's pain levels, how to alleviate one's pain levels and lead them back to a normal life. For mine own personal experience it may be a long road to recovery but I know I am in good hands. Dr. Khan will guide you and talk to you in terms that are very understanding to a common person. For people seeking help with their pain management I would highly recommend Dr Khan and his team.|Overall I am very satisfied with this practice. The ladies at the front desk and in the billing dept always answer my questions in a helpful way. The nursing staff is also willing to assist you. I have not waited too long for any service. Dr. Khan will discuss my treatment options with me, and when the decision is made he completes my on-site spinal treatments efficiently.|Because of them my way of life has improved SIGNIFICANTLY. All the providers are friendly and helpfull. I have been going to them for about 5 years. Would not want to go anywhere else. I always have great conversations with Dr Khan while getting my injections. He talks to you like a normal human being and you can tell he has great personal values as well.
They actually care about helping you and helping you manage your pain. THANK YOU FOR ALL YOUVE DONE FOR ME. BECAUSE OF YOU I CAN ACTUALLY PLAY WITH MY KIDS. You guys rock.

column2: New Jersey Advanced Pain Management Center: Ajay Kumar, MD
column3:
New Jersey Advanced Pain Management Center serves patients across New Jersey, Pennsylvania, and New York with comprehensive pain management solutions. Led by Dr. Ajay Kumar, the practice offers specialized interventional treatments for chronic pain conditions through their multiple locations in Hackettstown, NJ, Matamoras, PA, and Warwick, NY.

New Jersey Advanced Pain Management Center provides state-of-the-art interventional spine and pain management services tailored to each patient's unique needs. The practice combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain functionality and improve their quality of life. Their multidisciplinary approach addresses various chronic pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, and neuropathic disorders.

Meet Dr. Ajay Kumar

Dr. Ajay Kumar, MD, DABPM brings exceptional credentials and extensive experience to his role as the practice's lead physician. After earning his Doctor of Medicine from the prestigious All India Institute of Medical Sciences in New Delhi, India, Dr. Kumar completed his residency in physical medicine and rehabilitation at Temple University Hospital in Philadelphia. His specialized training includes a fellowship in interventional pain medicine, and he maintains board certification in physical medicine while serving as a diplomate of the American Board of Pain Medicine.

Services and Approach

The practice specializes in minimally invasive procedures and comprehensive pain management strategies. Dr. Kumar's expertise in interventional techniques allows patients to explore alternatives to surgery and long-term medication dependence. Each treatment plan is customized following thorough evaluation and diagnosis, ensuring targeted relief for specific pain conditions.

Contact Information

Patients can schedule consultations at any of their three convenient locations, including their Pennsylvania office at 905 Pennsylvania Ave, Suite B, Matamoras, PA 18336. For appointments or inquiries, call +1 908-860-8705 or visit their website at [www.advpainmd.com](https://www.advpainmd.com/) for more information about services and treatment options.
column11:
About The Practice
Ajay Kumar MD, DABPM, DABPM, is an interventional spine and pain physician at New Jersey Advanced Pain Management, which has locations in Hackettstown, New Jersey, Matamoras, Pennsylvania, and Warwick New York
Dr. Kumar earned his Doctor of Medicine from the prestigious All India Institute of Medical Sciences in New Delhi, India. He completed his residency in physical medicine and rehabilitation at Temple University Hospital in Philadelphia. He is fellowship-trained in interventional pain medicine, board certified in physical medicine, and a diplomate of the American Board of Pain Medicine.
In India, Dr.

column40:
Dr Kumar and his staff are caring and helpful. Highly recommend him and his staff. I moved from another state where I went to my pain management Dr for 14 yrs. I
tried another Dr. before and I didn't get treated like a 68 yr old woman in constant pain, so I tried Dr Kumar and he made my transition easier. I was seriously thinking of moving back to Alabama until he walked in the room and I had my first interaction with him. Instantly I felt comfortable.
It's hard to trust a new Dr. and he listened to me, and I felt at ease in a new Dr's office.|When you are looking for pain management options, it's wonderful to find a doctor who is sympathetic, caring and professional.  Dr. Kumar takes the time to really listen to you.  His office staff is very friendly and efficient.   It's a great office!|Dr. Kumar and his staff are terrific!  They are organized, efficient and compassionate.  They always have smiles on their faces.  You are taken on time, listened to and offered recommendations for your situation.  Dr. Kumar is very knowledgeable and takes time to make sure your needs are met.   I highly recommend them!|Dr. Kumar and his staff are the best! Friendly, responsive and professional. Dr. Kumar listens and provides a treatment plan. Thank you to all of you.|Dr. Kumar is a thoughtful, strategic, and well-researched doctor. Over the course of months he was able to diagnose the source of my pain when other doctors didn't believe me, or weren't concerned with investigating when the answer wasn't obvious. Dr. Kumar also listens, even considering my self-diagnosis based on my own research (which was correct). The office staff is professional and always polite, which goes a long way when you're in pain. Dr. Kumar is also always willing to speak with my other doctors to discuss my case, which no doctor has offered before. The office is pretty bare bones and could use some upgrading, but the treatments available are always up to date with what is newly medically available. I was suffering so much and I am so grateful to Dr. Kumar for helping me heal and be physically and emotionally available to my family aftet what I had been through. I really could not recommend him and his team enough.|Dr.Kumar and his staff are great. They have always treated me professionally. And Dr. JyDr. Kumar is the only pain management Dr. that has actually given me help with the pain in my back. He is fantastic!|Dr Kumar is a kind and knowledgeable doctor who cares about his patients.|I have found Dr Kumar to be extremely kind and caring with my care. He has offered me solutions to continuing problem that made my life unbearable. I am beginning to enjoy activities again and I am sure my physical therapy being will improve with each visit.

column3:
Center for Pain Control, PC serves Wyomissing, PA and surrounding communities with specialized pain management solutions. Our medical practice is dedicated to helping patients find relief from chronic and acute pain conditions through comprehensive, personalized treatment plans. With a team of board-certified physicians and pain management specialists, we've established ourselves as a trusted resource for those suffering from debilitating pain throughout Berks County and beyond.

At Center for Pain Control, we provide effective pain management for a wide variety of pain-related disorders. Our expertise extends to treating:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Cancer pain

  • Arm and leg pain

  • Nerve pain

  • Chronic regional pain syndrome

  • Headaches

  • Peripheral neuropathy

Advanced Treatment Options

Our dedicated pain care physicians utilize the latest evidence-based pain relief methods to address your specific condition. Treatment options include:

  • Nerve root blocks

  • Trigger point injections

  • Radiofrequency neurotomy

  • Referrals for physical and occupational therapy

  • Medication management

  • Minimally invasive procedures

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our team takes the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop a customized treatment plan designed to improve your quality of life. Help starts here at Center for Pain Control.

Contact Information

Location: 1235 Penn Ave, Suite 302, Wyomissing, PA 19610

Phone: (610) 374-2927

Website: www.centerforpaincontrol.net
column11: We provide comprehensive, effective pain management for a wide variety of pain related disorders. We provide advanced solutions for back pain, neck pain, cancer pain, arm pain, leg pain, nerve pain, chronic regional pain syndrome, headaches, peripheral neuropathy, and more. Our dedicated pain care physicians use the latest pain relief methods including nerve root blocks, trigger point injections, referral for physical therapy and occupational therapy, and radiofrequency neurotomy. Help starts here.
column38: Roger Reichert|Kate Johnson|Russell Emrich|Theresa Blackwell|Curt Krassowski|Deepak Khanna|Donald Sindall|Melanie Sickafus
column40:
My experience with The Center for Pain Control thus far is exceptional.Dr.Bundy along with his nursing staff truly care about you as a person not just a patient. They keep you well informed of your situation and how they can help you and proceeded to do it with dignity and respect. They really did help me rid my pain in my lower back and continue to treat me professionally and promptly. Dr. Bundy's knowledge, empathy, personality, attention to your needs, and treating you with dignity& respect are PARAMOUNT.He is quite an amazing doctor.

I would have given this practice 5 stars however office staff "Sonji" is very unwelcoming, rude, arrogant,  and conveys a very negative attitude when no other staff is around. It is very clear that she don't want to be there. This makes me very uncomfortable and when I'm finished dealing with her I feel like I never want to go back. We patients are not beneath anybody. We are going through enough pain and agony and don't need to deal with an attitude like that anywhere especially a pain control center.

In closing, I have the utmost respect for everyone that I have encountered there as they really have helped me getting relief from my excruciating back pain that I consistently experience. As far as a receptionist that is miserable, that is on her and eventually it will catch up with her.|My doctor sent me here for an epidural injection for a ruptured disc in my spine. I was so afraid of getting a shot because I've had some not-very-pleasant medical experiences in the past, but there was absolutely no reason to be (as April patiently explained, thank you!) Everyone is so friendly! They are all very highly trained, and it shows the whole time. Dr. Bundy is very kind and funny and he put me at ease immediately with a dad joke, and I could see that his eyes and face (behind the mask) were smiling. Everyone focuses on you and your needs, and you aren't rushed through prep or recovery, which is important. They really treat you very well! I look forward to seeing them when my next shot is due in a few months, as I know that I'll be well taken care of and feel better ASAP. Thank you to all of you!|Dr. Bundy and his entire staff were fantastic. He was extremely thorough despite keeping the appointment moving due to my considerable pain. The procedure was completed quickly, painlessly and professionally. I would absolutely recommend him for any pain management needs in the future.|I have been treating here for many years and am very satisfied with the care I receive. The staff is very knowledgeable, professional and caring. They are diligent in getting an understanding of and providing targeted treatment for pain issues. I have worked closely with April Palmer and Dr. Jason Bundy and am very confident in the care I receive from them. I highly recommend the Center for Pain Control.|Dr. Bundy and staff work very well to help reduce your pain to a manageable level.
Many options discussed, with your input, and their suggestions.
Friendly, personable  support staff in office, and surgical services center.
I have been a patient  for approximately  ten years, and have been able to reduce pain levels with treatment and avoid surgery(s) that may cause more limitation of mobility.
I have nothing but positive experiences with  The Center For Pain Control. They have helped me to continue living a life  with less pain, more manageable pain.
They get 5 stars from me.  I  would highly recommend  this practice.|Dr. Bundy is a caring and careful health provider. He gives generously of his time, and patiently addresses a patient's concern. The supporting staff is also very professional, and yet very pleasant. I recommend this practice strongly. My being a patient of Dr. Bundy for more than fifteen years bears testimony to my foregoing comments.|Dr. Bundy and his staff are the most diligent medical professionals I have ever met. His office staff is always welcoming and his medical assistant Brenda is wonderful.

Dr. Bundy has assisted and counselled me through some difficult post op complications....he not only understands surgical procedures he can mitigate the impact of less than optimal outcomes.

I would highly recommend Dr. Bundy for any long term chronic pain issues.

Donald Sindall|Dr. Bundy is very personable and gives detailed explanations as well as all options available.  I have been going here for years and I always receive the best care.  Brenda and the rest of the staff are pleasant, knowledgeable and get the job done.  I would recommend them to anyone needing this type of service.

Westmoreland Pain Management in Greensburg, Pennsylvania offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Westmoreland County and surrounding areas. Our specialized medical practice focuses on diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. With a team of board-certified physicians and pain specialists, we provide compassionate care in a comfortable, modern facility conveniently located on US-30.

At Westmoreland Pain Management, we utilize advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment protocols to address various pain conditions. Our multidisciplinary approach combines interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications to create personalized treatment plans that maximize pain relief while minimizing medication dependence.

Conditions We Treat

Our practice specializes in treating a wide range of chronic pain conditions, including but not limited to back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, fibromyalgia, and pain resulting from workplace injuries or automobile accidents. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we're committed to helping you regain functionality and improve your quality of life.

Pain Control Center of Pittsburgh serves patients throughout Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and surrounding areas with comprehensive pain management solutions. Established with a mission to improve quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain, our center combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care. Our board-certified specialists develop personalized treatment plans addressing various pain conditions, from back and neck pain to complex regional pain syndrome.

At the Pain Control Center of Pittsburgh, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that includes interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary therapies. Our team specializes in treating conditions such as fibromyalgia, arthritis, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain using evidence-based protocols tailored to each patient's unique needs.

State-of-the-Art Facilities

Located at 3627 Brodhead Rd #1, Monaca, PA 15061, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technology. The center provides a comfortable, supportive environment where patients can receive comprehensive care in one convenient location. Our staff prioritizes creating a welcoming atmosphere to help ease the anxiety often associated with pain management treatment.

Expert Medical Team

Our physicians bring decades of combined experience in pain medicine, anesthesiology, and rehabilitation. Each specialist stays current with the latest advancements in pain management through ongoing education and research. This commitment ensures our patients receive the most effective and innovative treatments available in the field.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in building strong doctor-patient relationships based on trust, respect, and open communication. New patients receive thorough evaluations to understand their pain history, previous treatments, and goals. This collaborative approach helps us develop effective strategies that address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit our website at www.paincontrolcenter.net or call us at +1 724-728-7880. Our dedicated team is ready to help you take the first step toward effective pain management and improved quality of life.

column40: I've been a patient at the Pain Control Center of Pittsburgh under Dr. Myers' care for a year now, and it's been a transformative experience. The injections I've received have helped make my chronic pain and discomfort manageable, truly making a significant difference in my daily life. The team is incredibly client-focused, ensuring each visit is as comfortable and effective as possible. Dr. Myers and his staff (Maggie, Maria, Mary, etc.) have genuinely turned my life around, and for that, I am forever grateful. I highly recommend their services to anyone seeking relief from chronic pain.|I wanted to share how impressed I am with the care I have received at the Pain Control Center of Pgh. I have had 7 failed back surgeries. I started with the Pain Control Center in July. They were a new pain management center for me. I saw the same pain management doctor for 27 yrs. He re-tired last March. I went to 4 other pain management centers . None of them compared to the compassion, and the care I receive at the Pain Control Center of Pgh. I see Dr.Meyers registered nurse.Maggie for treatment. I am extremely happy with the care I get. I would highly recommend this Pain Management Center to anyone that has legitimate chronic pain. I give them 5 stars.|This was my first visit to Dr Myers' office. Long story short, after dealing with a doctor who wouldn't listen to what I was going through, Dr Myers restored my faith again. 6 months of pain, 6 months of different scans, x-rays, MRIs, 6 months of being brushed off by the other pain doctor....Dr. Myers was able to give me a diagnosis for both of my issues, literally within minutes. He laid out a clear plan on how the treatment will go moving forward, and what to expect. Very professional, great "bedside" manner, and above all else, he takes the time to listen, to treat you like a person, and not just another co-pay.|Excellent pain management  for those that have chronic pain,  All of the  staff from the young ladies that greet you when you come in to the office to the  nurses that take you to the exam room to the Doctor and the physician's assistant. column2: Pain, Spine & Joint Center of the Alleghenies
column3:
Pain, Spine & Joint Center of the Alleghenies serves patients throughout central and northwestern Pennsylvania with comprehensive pain management solutions. Under the leadership of Dr. Timothy Vollmer DO, our practice delivers personalized care using evidence-based approaches to address chronic and acute pain conditions. We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why our multidisciplinary approach focuses on improving function, reducing discomfort, and enhancing overall quality of life for our patients.

Dr. Timothy Vollmer brings exceptional credentials as a board-certified anesthesiologist with specialized training in multidisciplinary pain medicine. His compassionate approach to patient care stems from his understanding that each person's pain experience is unique. Dr. Vollmer stays at the forefront of pain management techniques, continuously incorporating the latest evidence-based therapies to provide optimal outcomes for his patients.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Our center offers a wide range of treatments for various pain conditions, including but not limited to:

  • Spine-related pain management

  • Joint pain therapies

  • Interventional procedures

  • Medication management

  • Innovative non-surgical approaches

Improving Access to Advanced Pain Therapies

One of our core missions is improving access to cutting-edge pain management solutions for residents in underserved areas of Pennsylvania. We believe everyone deserves relief from chronic pain, regardless of their location. Our practice bridges the gap in specialized care for communities throughout central and northwestern PA.

Visit Our Practice

We welcome new patients at our comfortable, modern facility located at 10 Timberview Ln, Russell, PA 16345. To schedule a consultation with Dr. Vollmer, please call us at (814) 593-1215 or visit our website at www.vollmerpain.com for more information about our services and approach to pain management.
column11: Dr. Timothy Vollmer DO is an extremely compassionate board certified anesthesiologist and multidisciplinary pain medicine physician focused on improving access to the latest evidence based pain therapies in central and northwestern PA.

Comprehensive Pain Management Center - Brinton Lake serves residents throughout Glen Mills, Pennsylvania and the surrounding Delaware County area with specialized pain management solutions. Located in the Crozer Medical Plaza, this state-of-the-art facility brings together a multidisciplinary team of board-certified pain specialists dedicated to addressing both acute and chronic pain conditions. The center's patient-centered approach focuses on creating customized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each individual, combining innovative medical interventions with comprehensive care strategies.

At the Comprehensive Pain Management Center, patients receive expert care for a wide spectrum of pain conditions including:

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Neuropathic pain from nerve damage

  • Joint and musculoskeletal pain

  • Pain associated with cancer and other serious health conditions

Advanced Treatment Approaches

The center employs a comprehensive range of treatment modalities, from medication management and minimally invasive procedures to innovative interventional techniques. Their holistic approach may include physical therapy, behavioral health support, and complementary therapies to address all aspects of pain management and improve patients' quality of life.

This office is absolutely top notch! Dr. Garg helped me tremendously over the last few years. He has not only kept my pain in check from a botched operation in 2019 but last year he also found a problem with my heart/lungs that had nothing to do with that operation. He insisted that I had to go to a cardiologist and a pulmonologist right away. Thank goodness I did because the cardiologist told me that if I hadn't seen him, my condition would have probably killed me within 12 months! Not only is Dr. Garg a FANTASTIC physician, but his bedside manner is wonderful. He is kind, professional, VERY knowledgeable and he really cares. His wife (who runs the office) even called me once just to see how I was feeling.....she's great too! I can't say enough about Integrative Pain Clinic. They are the best!!!|I had a very positive experience working with Dr Garg this past year after developing at times crippling back and sciatic pain that interfered with all aspects of my life.

Dr Garg came highly recommended by a nurse friend of mine who knew of him through several other patients.  He was both responsive and respectful.  I appreciated his honesty and experience and his insights were extremely helpful.  I did end up with the right surgeon and had a completely successful surgery. I am now completely off all medications, but happy to recommend Integrative Pain Clinic.|I have had nothing but great experiences with Dr Garg over several years that I have been a patient. There is no long wait to be seen and there is no rushing you out of the office while you are being seen. He takes his time to answer questions and to see how things are going with you and your meds. No assistant, nobody fake that will push you out the door just to get to the next patient...just an honest and really cool doctor and I wish there were more like him....he saved my life!|Dr Garg has been my doctor for years now. If I could give a hundred stars I would!  This is my first ever Google review~|I met Dr. Garg years ago when my father was his patient. Advanced Pain Management Specialists in Plains, PA provides comprehensive interventional pain management solutions for patients throughout Northeastern Pennsylvania. Under the expert guidance of Mark H. Bell, MD, our specialized medical practice focuses on non-surgical treatment options designed to alleviate suffering and improve quality of life. We understand that chronic pain can be debilitating, which is why our team is dedicated to developing personalized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient.

At Advanced Pain Management Specialists, we offer effective treatments for a wide range of pain conditions, including:

  • Acute, chronic, and radiating pain of the neck, back, and spine

  • Arthritis-related discomfort

  • Headaches and migraines

  • Local and widespread joint pain

  • Muscle and musculoskeletal conditions

  • Nerve pain and neuropathy

Our Interventional Approach

Rather than simply masking symptoms, our interventional techniques target the source of pain to provide lasting relief. Dr. Bell combines his extensive medical expertise with state-of-the-art technology to deliver treatments that minimize dependency on medication while maximizing functional improvement. Our goal is to help patients return to their daily activities with reduced pain and enhanced mobility.

Patient-Centered Care

We believe in creating collaborative relationships with our patients, taking the time to listen to concerns and thoroughly explain treatment options. Our compassionate team works diligently to ensure each visit is comfortable and productive, with minimal wait times and maximum attention to detail.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us:

Phone: +1 570-970-1030

Address: 11 Gallagher Dr, Plains, PA 18705, United States

Website: www.painreliefdoc.com

Advanced Pain Management Specialists is committed to helping you find relief from pain and reclaim your active lifestyle. Contact us today to take the first step toward effective pain management.

column38: rick young|Bradley Cardinale|Greenlands Lodge|Courtney Brown|Mary Shepherd|Wanda Pluto|David spicher|Leisa Johnstonbaugh
column40:
Had my injection procedure this morning. While I won't know the full effects right away I can tell there is relief. I wanted to share that if anyone is Leary of injections - this doctor and staff were great. They were thorough, listeners and professional. I would have no problem repeating injections down the road ( IF ) needed.
Injections > It really sounds worse then it is.|BEWARE of this clinic's billing practices. I got a referral from my primary care physician to visit the pain clinic to explore upper back pain. For a single visit, I received three separate bills totaling $3,086. These included:

$251 for an 'office outpatient visit' to see the doctor (note: I saw a physician's assistant, PA, not a doctor)
$491 for a 'facilities charge' for entering the pain clinic
$130 for trigger point injections by the PA
$833 for a 'facilities charge' for use of the room that injections were made in
$232 for the medicine used in the injections
$1,075 for two x-rays of upper back
$74 for interpretation of the x-rays

While some of these charges are reasonable, the multiple 'facilities charges' tacked onto the bill by Mount Nittany Medical Center are simply a way to pad the billing and charge more money to patients and/or their insurance companies. The clinic warns you that there 'may be' facilities charges billed separately from provider chargers in the small print when you sign in. But if you pay out-of-pocket or have a high deductible insurance plan, you may find yourself shocked to receive a bill that not only charges you for an outpatient office visit, but that tacks on an additional 75% charge ($1,324) for the building and room that your 'office' visit occurs in. Imagine buying an airline ticket for $500 and then receiving a second bill a week later from the airport charging you an additional $375 for an airport 'facility fee'.

If you do a little research online, you'll see that medical facilities charges are a highly controversial practice in which hospital-owned outpatient clinics add charges for use of their buildings and treatment rooms. The US Congress and legislatures in numerous states are working on laws to crack down on these unethical billing practices. Until the time laws are in place to protect you, you should (a) be aware of the billing practices and use providers that don't charge facilities fees when possible; (b) report your charges to your insurance company and potentially appeal; (c) report your experience to the PA Attorney General and the Better Business Bureau to build up the number of consumer complaints required to trigger state or federal action.

(Note: Mt. Nittany posted its standard response to my review below, the same they post on every review that mentions a billing problem. But of course I contacted the billing department and got nowhere. The billing department is about as unhelpful as it gets.)|Thank you to Mt Nittany Health for the outstanding care they take for their patients.  I have been seeing Dr. Victoria about the pain in my right hip and leg. She takes time to evaluate my condition and then she refers me to Dr. Jennifer Gilbert.  Thank you Dr. Gilbert for all your knowledge and care to find the right injections for my condition.  She does an amazing job of finding just the perfect spot to give me pain relief.  My pain recently went from about 9 to 1.  I am so thankful.  They even call me the next day to be sure I am feeling ok or if I need anything.  Who does the anymore?  They are the best!  Kathy Greenland|You should definitely make yourself aware that this isn't a pain management clinic, it's a cancer treatment center. When my spine surgeon from Hershey tried to transition my care to here for long-term care and/or suggestions that he may not have thought of yet due to 3 spine surgeries, degenerative disc disorder and arthritis before I hit 40, they told me that they only offer pain management to cancer patients. Please change the name then. They explained that all they would ever provide would be injections, which are not FDA approved (educate yourself unless you want to end up with permanent nerve damage, or worse) and the other injections possible, I already receive from my other physician (trigger point, Botox). My surgeon was irate as I sat in the parking lot to call his office to let them know I wasted 2 months waiting for the appointment for absolutely no resolution and he has been handling my treatment from 3 hours away ever since, without hesitation, so that I don't have to give up a Ph.D. to resort to living on SSI for being unable to work normally. It's a true shame what the medical field has become. Age does not nor should it ever dictate treatment, medical diagnoses do. Pain is subjective, didn't you learn that in nursing school before you became an NP? Regardless, don't waste your time here. Mount Nittany is one of our primary providers in central Pennsylvania and residing in rural areas leaves us with very few options. It's a shame that you can't even maintain a reputable pain management clinic for patients who need it instead of having to travel 3 hours for basic care.|I went in for all the problems that I have which causes me so much pain making me not able to work or even do light house work. I have so much problems with my neck, back, and legs. A fusion & herniated disc in the neck, degenerative disc disease all through my back, bulging disc in my lower back, sciatica in my lower back & legs. and arthritis through out my whole spine, now i have to get an MRI for my knee bc it keeps locking. I have tried so many different medication which has cause some minor reactions to serious reactions. All they said was bc of my age they would not do any narcotics only injections which I was fine with but the lady doctor there did not even send in the request form to my insurance so that it would be approved and covered. When I called to find out why she argued with me saying she did when my insurance went through everything and found nothing. They are just rude and unprofessional plus I cant do injections since i have a really bad reaction to them (went to another pain management) they will not help me with the pain since i cant take anything that they can give me since they wont give me anything stronger bc of my age. If the doctors here are like the emergency room doctors I feel bad for those that are a complicated case like me bc the mount nittany ER has misdiagnosed me three times and Im sure mount nittany does not screen their doctors that well.|Dr. Gilbert and staff were wonderful. They were very nice, attentive, and answered all of my concerns from my first visit to my procedure visit. They took  time with me to explain what medical procedure they were going to do and discussed with me all the details for preoperative and postoperative of that procedure. I highly recommend them.|I've seen them all, and they've all taken the time and explained what was going on. I know Scott personally and that didn't get in the way of him being professional. I recommend them to my stepdad and he's happy with them and I'll keep recommending them.|Staff and Dr's are all so helpful and friendly!

Delaware Valley Pain & Spine Institute serves Chalfont, PA and the surrounding Delaware Valley region with specialized pain management services. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians brings decades of combined experience in treating both acute and chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches. We understand that persistent pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we develop personalized treatment plans that address not only the physical symptoms but also the psychological and emotional impacts of chronic pain.

At Delaware Valley Pain & Spine Institute, we offer a wide range of minimally invasive procedures and interventional techniques designed to reduce pain and improve function. Our specialists are experts in treating conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and pain resulting from injuries or surgeries. We utilize advanced diagnostic tools to identify the precise source of your pain, allowing for targeted treatment approaches.

Our Patient-Centered Approach

Chronic pain can lead to physical, psychological, and mental distress, affecting every aspect of your daily life. Our multidisciplinary team works collaboratively to address all dimensions of your pain experience. We take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop a comprehensive treatment plan tailored to your specific needs and goals. Our ultimate aim is to restore your quality of life and help you return to the activities you enjoy.

Advanced Treatment Options

Our physicians employ the most current, minimally invasive techniques to effectively manage pain while minimizing recovery time and potential complications. Treatment options may include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, joint injections, and medication management. We continuously stay at the forefront of pain medicine to offer our patients the most effective solutions available.

Visit Our Chalfont Location

Our modern, comfortable facility in Chalfont is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide the highest standard of care. We're conveniently located at 1300 Horizon Dr STE 101, Chalfont, PA 18914. To schedule a consultation or learn more about how we can help manage your pain, call us at (215) 489-9170 or visit our website at https://dvpainandspine.com/chalfont-location/.
column11:
Dedicated to the Treatment of Acute and Chronic Pain

Delaware Valley Pain & Spine Institute is dedicated to providing the highest quality of care to treat patients with pain. Our team of highly specialized physicians uses the most advanced, minimally invasive techniques to restore function and renew hope in our patients.

Chronic pain can lead to physical, psychological, and mental distress. At Delaware Valley Pain & Spine Institute, we understand the complex nature of pain and offer a comprehensive treatment plan in hopes of restoring quality of life

I'm writing on behalf of my brother, Mr.Ackley. Dr Patel is a wonderful, talented medical professional, whose care is patient oriented! He communicates well, is compassionate and understanding. Great bedside manner! Thank you for the outstanding care you provide!|Really lovely facility. Super friendly staff when I visited, and really loved my experiences with Dr. Patel. Was super engaged and friendly throughout the visit. Didn't rush me or my partner at all and I think that contributed to a really positive experience. I'm still feeling really great weeks later; was shocked my chronic pain had a pretty conventional root cause and that it was treatable through a minimally invasive procedure! Will definitely be going back for any additional pain needs in the future.|My wife was experiencing severe neck pain that made it impossible for her to turn her head or get a good night's sleep. After struggling to find relief, we visited Dr. Patel, who carefully assessed her condition and recommended a series of injections to help alleviate the pain.

My wife has an extreme fear of needles, so we were initially very hesitant about the treatment. However, Dr. Patel's calm, gentle, and encouraging demeanor completely put her at ease. He took the time to explain every step of the process and ensured she was comfortable throughout the procedure. To our amazement, not only did the injections significantly reduce her pain, but the experience itself was far less stressful than we ever imagined, thanks to Dr. Patel's compassionate care. We are incredibly grateful for his expertise and kindness, which have made a world of difference for my wife's health and quality of life.|Dr. Patel has excellent bedside manor and goes above and beyond for his patients. Each patient receives a personalized care plan developed by our expert clinicians who understand the complex nature of chronic pain. I recommend them to everyone!!! I couldn't even stand up straight when I started going here. Within a week I was. Give them a try you won't regret it.|(Tracey Collier)
Was rec to try the facility out, due to my pain in my feet. Was very skeptical at first, however the staff and office personnel helped tremendously with assisting to ensure I can get done treatment with the offset of insurance costs. Laser therapy is great !
Jillian, Devon, and Jerad along with Dr K and Kevin hung in there with me. Would def recommend if you are looking for an alternative solution or second opinion.|I definitely recommend coming here, I've been in pain for awhile and every time I come here I always feel great! They make sure you are heard and try to help in everyway possible to make you feel better! You won't leave disappointed, such an amazing environment!:)|My husband and I have both been coming to NuMedX for a few weeks. We are dealing with neuropathy and following a well established plan. And seeing results as well!!! The staff here are awesome - make you feel like family! If you have a medical need, this is your one stop shop. Highly recommend them.|Very friendly staff, they do their very best to help you heal. Easy scheduling, Lazer therapy, ultrasound, traction, rehab,chiropractor, spine injections with kevin, Dr Bisousky office in same building, I like him as well, been my family doctor for many years.|I arrived at numedx after 3 visits to the local medical center where I was diagnosed with a lower lumbar injury. I was getting no relief from the pain - so I decided to go to Newmedx. Best decision ever!!!
I was able to see s medical professional the same day I called - he immediately determined my issue, in addition to my lower lumbar injury - my one leg was now quite a bit longer than the other. This was causing the sever pain I was experiencing. I was then was immediately walked to rehabilitation where I had consultation with the chiropractor. She then did an adjustment on me and put me in traction for a bit. Being older I was aware it would take me longer to heal, but even after my 1st visit I was finally getting some relief from the pain. I just had my 4th visit today and I can say I am not 100% yet, but so much better and definitely on my way. The pain is minimal and the muscle spasms have almost completely stopped. Every staff member that I have had any contact from the front desk to the medical professionals have been knowledgeable, friendly, and so helpful. If you are experiencing any form of muscle pain or similar issues I highly recommend Numedx  - they are amazing.|In general, all the providers have done an above & beyond job in treating me with my back. Went to two other facilities before coming here and didn't help me. With injections, physical rehab, & chiro I am able to enjoy my hobbies more than in the past without severe pain. Have talked to others about the place.|I called NuMedx for having severe back pain. Their friendly staff got me in the same exact day to be seen! I was immediately set up with a treatment plan to start the very next day. NuMedX is a one stop shop! No more going to the doctor, then going to another office for physical therapy - it's all in their building! Every staff member is eager to help you on your healing journey. It's not the typical in and out visit. They truly care when they ask how you're doing. Their building is clean and easy to navigate. I'm glad I was referred to NyMedX by a friend!

I have had many pain injections by Dr Simon's and he has always been concerned that my my pain has been diminished and has discussed different options in the event the injections stop working.  Dr Simon's is very professional but most of all caring for his patients.  I highly recommend his company if ever in need of pain management!|This office is a disgusting example of greed. I was referred here to be evaluated for a pain pump placement to help manage my pain since other options "weren't available". The doctor refused to listen to a word I said. He did not look into my condition and the benefits it would have with the pump. No. He turned around and told me "We can offer you Ketamine infusions. They are $750 a month and you'll need a driver. It isn't guaranteed to work and insurance is NOT accepted for this procedure." This office would rather give a disabled single mother a horse tranquilizer than something that is actually feasible. Not to mention ketamine DOES NOT HELP EHLERS DANLOS SYNDROME. Do your research aka your JOB. Find a place that doesn't operate on greed. If you can.
PS. When I called to ask about another option that could work for my situation , they hung up on me|Dr. Simons listened, diagnosed, cared for, and treated my back pain that I have been living with for 20+ years. I can't thank he and the entire staff enough! Quick and thorough procedures, great explanations, easy recovery...couldn't ask for a better doc!|Dr Rao and his staff are amazing. And they treated me very well.
I'll highly recommend Premier pain centre for the neck pain.|I was very happy with the care I received at this office.

Innovative Pain Solutions serves King of Prussia, PA and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management services tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our practice combines evidence-based interventional procedures with medication management strategies to provide effective relief for those suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Under the direction of our experienced medical team, we offer a multidisciplinary approach that addresses both the symptoms and underlying causes of pain.

At Innovative Pain Solutions, we specialize in a variety of treatment options including advanced interventional procedures that target pain at its source. Our medication management protocols are carefully designed to maximize pain relief while minimizing side effects and dependency risks. For qualifying patients, we provide Medical Marijuana certifications and consultations to explore this alternative treatment option. Additionally, we offer Suboxone/Sublocade treatment programs for those dealing with opioid dependency issues, helping patients reclaim their lives while effectively managing their pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

Our team is committed to developing personalized treatment plans that consider each patient's medical history, lifestyle, and specific pain challenges. We believe in empowering our patients through education and active participation in their care plans. This collaborative approach has helped countless individuals throughout Pennsylvania find relief and improve their quality of life.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please call us at +1 610-857-7771. Our office is conveniently located at 625 Clark Ave #17A, King of Prussia, PA 19406. For more information about our physician and services, visit our provider profile.

Hi Kent!

We are an interventional pain management facility that provides non-invasive treatment options such as various joint injections, radiofrequency ablations, spinal cord stimulator trials, chiropractic care, physical therapy, and massage therapy. We do not provide medical marijuana cards at our office. If you are interested in trying one of the many therapeutic options we do offer, please give us a call at 570-322-1245. column3:
Independence Pain Associates LLC serves Meadowbrook, PA and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. For over two decades, our dedicated team has been helping patients throughout the Abington area reclaim their lives from chronic pain through personalized treatment plans and cutting-edge interventional procedures.

At Independence Pain, we understand that each patient's pain experience is unique. That's why we develop individualized pain medication plans tailored to address specific conditions and concerns. Our approach combines medical expertise with compassionate care to ensure optimal outcomes for every patient we serve.

On-Site Procedural Capabilities

One of our distinguishing features is our in-office fluoroscopy suite, which allows us to perform epidurals and injection therapies on-site. This advanced capability means our patients benefit from:

  • Significantly reduced wait times for procedures

  • No additional ambulatory surgery center fees

  • Convenient, same-location care from consultation to treatment

  • Precise, image-guided interventions for better results

Established Community Presence

With over 20 years serving the Abington community, Independence Pain Associates has helped thousands of patients regain their quality of life. Our longstanding presence reflects our commitment to excellence and the trust our patients place in our care.

Contact Information

Phone: +1 215-938-1999

Address: 1650 Huntingdon Pike #357, Meadowbrook, PA 19046, United States

Website: https://independencepain.com/
column11: At Independence Pain, we pride ourselves on ensuring a personalized pain mediation plan, with specialized care and comfort provided onsite for patients, so that they can experience the best possible outcome. With an in-office fluoroscopy suite for epidurals and injection therapies, we are able to deliver timely care for any procedural-based intervention, minus the long waits and with no added ambulatory surgery-center fees. We have been providing care here in Abington for over 20 years, helping thousands of patients regain their quality of life and get back to living.

column2: Center for Interventional Pain & Spine - Fort Washington
column3:
Center for Interventional Pain & Spine serves Fort Washington, PA and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians specializes in treating chronic pain conditions through minimally invasive techniques and personalized treatment plans. Located conveniently at 535 Pennsylvania Ave #100, we've established ourselves as a trusted healthcare provider committed to improving patients' quality of life through effective pain relief strategies.

At the Center for Interventional Pain & Spine, we offer advanced treatments for various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our interventional procedures include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and regenerative medicine options. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the unique needs of our patients, focusing on both immediate pain relief and long-term management strategies.

Patient-Centered Approach

We pride ourselves on delivering compassionate care in a comfortable environment. Our Fort Washington facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment, enabling our specialists to provide precise interventions. Now accepting new patients, we offer convenient scheduling options Monday through Friday with our friendly staff ready to assist with insurance verification and appointment coordination.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 844-365-7246. Our Fort Washington office is located at 535 Pennsylvania Ave #100, Fort Washington, PA 19034. For additional information about our treatments and patient resources, visit our website at https://www.centerpain.com/.

column40: My husband has been a patient of Dr. Winas and Meghan since his motorcycle accident in 2017. They are great and truly care about a person's entire well being, not just the pain. We have seen front office staff come and go, and everyone has been friendly and professional until this past year. The heavy caucasian woman (receptionist) is a complete racist. I have witnessed her be welcoming to everyone that looks like her, and have a complete attitude when assisting my husband. She goes out of the way to make his intake difficult,  even though he has been coming to the office longer than she's been employed. She has unnecessarily rescheduled his appointments and delayed his medication paperwork. I really with the Ft Washington office would hire a new professional that can be courteous to everyone!|Dr Winas has been helping me with my never ending Spinal Cord pain in my C-spine, T-spine, Lumbar Spine, Broken R Arm, and Headaches due to a bad concussion. I have been seeing him for over 9 years now. He's my favorite Doctor. Very Professional, knowledgeable, and friendly. He has given me lots of Spinal Injections and  has never hit a nerve!  He is very qualified and a kind empathetic Doctor/Human being! I highly recommend him if you suffer from any tupe od pain.|I've been being treated by this facility, every since the gov't changed the law that your primary doctor can't write narcotic prescriptions. I went from paying $30/month to paying $125/month. I paid this change for over 3 years and a couple of times having to post date a check to keep up with the increase. I went to my scheduled appointment today to be told that we've changed our policy and no longer except post dated checks. The check was post dated for 48 hours. When I got upset about being denied service I was told that my being upset was abusive! But the fact of the matter is that if your going to change your policy then each of your clients should be notified. Not embarrassed at your office window and denied medical care. If they cared just a little about their clients and notified folks whenever they decide to change operations, things like this wouldn't happen. The doctors here are very nice but I can't say the same about the facility.|Dr. Winas is an amazing provider. Caring, patient, listens to your needs. I drive a considerable distance to see him and would choose to drive even further if I had to!|Dr Nasr is really great. Prompt and careful. Had no issues with the office or the staff and I hope it will stay like that. I can only recommend this place.|The best pain management provider I have been to! The doctors are understanding and  caring, easy to talk to, and work with you to manage pain. Very friendly and professional staff. Have helped me tremendously.|I see both Justin Winas and Meaghan Descher.  Both are outstanding listeners and compassionate people.  I highly recommend them!!|I absolutely love everyone from Dr. Winas to his staff!! He has been my life saver.

column3:
Relievus serves Philadelphia, PA and surrounding areas throughout New Jersey and Pennsylvania with comprehensive pain management solutions. As a premier medical practice specializing in chronic pain treatment, Relievus has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider for patients suffering from debilitating pain conditions. Their team of board-certified physicians combines cutting-edge technology with compassionate care to address a wide spectrum of pain-related issues, helping patients regain functionality and improve their quality of life.

At Relievus Pain Management, doctors are dedicated to the art and science of pain medicine, offering specialized diagnosis, management, and treatment for various chronic pain conditions and neurological disorders. The practice employs a multidisciplinary approach that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and alternative treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Conditions Treated

The medical team at Relievus specializes in treating numerous pain conditions including:

  • Back pain (acute and chronic)

  • Neck pain

  • Shoulder pain

  • Work-related injuries

  • Headaches and migraines

  • Neuropathic pain disorders

  • Joint pain and arthritis

Convenient Locations

With multiple clinics strategically located throughout New Jersey and Pennsylvania, Relievus ensures accessible care for patients across the region. Their Philadelphia office is conveniently situated at 9815 Roosevelt Blvd, Unit J, Philadelphia, PA 19114.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Relievus is their commitment to patient-centered care. Understanding that chronic pain affects every aspect of a person's life, their physicians take time to listen to patients' concerns, thoroughly evaluate their conditions, and develop comprehensive treatment plans aimed at long-term relief rather than temporary fixes.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit www.relievus.com or call +1 888-985-2727.
column11:
Welcome to Relievus Pain Management

At Relievus, pain doctors are devoted to the art of pain management: diagnosing, managing, and treating chronic pain conditions and neurological disorders. We treat symptoms such as back pain, neck pain, chronic pain, shoulder pain, work injuries, and headaches. Our clinics are located throughout New Jersey and Pennsylvania.

SEPA Pain & Spine serves the communities of Southeast Pennsylvania with comprehensive pain management solutions. For over 25 years, this dedicated medical practice has been helping patients overcome chronic pain conditions through personalized care and innovative treatments. With six convenient locations in Horsham, Langhorne, Meadowbrook, Chalfont, East Norriton, and Limerick, SEPA Pain & Spine has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider throughout the region.

At SEPA Pain & Spine, patients benefit from a multidisciplinary approach to pain management. The practice brings together a team of experienced physicians, physician's assistants, and nurse practitioners who specialize in interventional pain management techniques. This collaborative approach ensures that each patient receives comprehensive care tailored to their specific needs.

Specialized Treatment Options

The medical professionals at SEPA Pain & Spine are experts in treating a wide range of painful and debilitating conditions, including arthritis, fibromyalgia, multiple sclerosis, migraines, and nerve injuries. Using cutting-edge diagnostic tools and treatment modalities, they develop customized treatment plans that effectively address back pain, neck pain, and joint pain. Their goal is to help patients regain their independence and improve their overall quality of life.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets SEPA Pain & Spine apart is their commitment to patient-centered care. The team takes the time to understand each patient's unique pain experience, medical history, and treatment goals. This thorough approach allows them to create highly effective treatment plans that provide lasting relief and improved functionality.

For those seeking relief from chronic pain, SEPA Pain & Spine offers hope and solutions. Their main office is located at 508 Prudential Rd #500, Horsham, PA 19044. To schedule a consultation, patients can visit www.sepapain.com or call +1 855-235-7246.
