column40:
Dr. Fall is an excellent doctor who truly cares about his patients. He took the time to thoroughly explain my condition and my treatment options.
He performed several epidural injections and made  injection process as comfortable as possible .
His staff was also very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend Dr. Fall to anyone looking for a compassionate and knowledgeable pain management doctor.|My first time visiting this facility and I was more than impressed with the service I received. They were so reassuring and helpful even though my Records did not make it in time for my visit.  Within the next day, I had everything I needed to prepare for my next visit with them, and I am so excited to start this new journey. I feel confident in them as we go through this process. You can definitely tell they know what they're doing!  I am an HR manager for our company and this is a new opportunity for us and I will be sure to tell every employee here my excellent experience with them.|Cynthia is very efficient. Asked all the right questions, explained everything very well and what the plan is for my long term pain management. I would recommend Cynthia to anyone who needs the help I do.
Excellent care and true makes you feel like you are as important to her as a family member.|I was referred here by my PCP, who provided me 3 providers to research for nerve pain issue from my shoulder that had left my arm numb down into 2 of my fingers. After a horrible experience with 1 office personnel at another office, this office  was my next call.
Seamless experience from the pleasant young ladies at check in, minimal wait time and triage. Dr. Fall was very attentive to my concerns and explained thoroughly what my steps for care would be during the consultation. I was seen the next week for my procedure and which went seamless as well. In and Out. Greatest experience here considering most specialists have appointments so far out that by the time you are seen, the problem has resolved itself.
DEFINITELY WOULD RECOMMEND!|He's tough but honest and cares. Very straight forward doesn't sugar coat things and pat ya on the head. He's good at his job if you go along with the process. He does care but won't over prescribe and honestly perscriptions don't help anyway. Follow his plan keep open line of communication and just be comfortable knowing you have a Dr who will help you to the best of his ability and won't make false promises.. I like that about him the most. Would recommend him to anyone.|I've been going to Dr Fall for almost 3 yrs for my back and shoulder injections. I was scheduled to see him 1/21/25 but when I woke up yesterday and was unable to raise my arm and in severe pain, the office got me in with Dr Fall. He listened to what I was saying and had no problem fitting me for the injection even with a packed schedule. I would recommend him to others. The office personnel is efficient and very personable with their patients.|I came to Dr Shah for a second opinion about an issue I am having with my feet. I was extremely impressed. Rather than just treat the issue, which he said he could do, Dr Shah was more interested in finding out what caused my issue in the first place, as just treating the issue won't prevent it from happening again. Within minutes of my appointment, he recognized an underlying issue with my back that was actually the root cause of my foot pain. I've been seeing a foot doctor for months and not once did they even question what was the cause of my foot pain, it was just how do we treat it. Had I not made an appointment with Dr Shah, I would be having surgery on my feet, instead of treating the issue in my back.|From the first visit I felt at ease. As a new patient I was expecting rudeness as I have experienced in the past. The staff from the reception to check out are awesome. Dr. Sanjay Shah and his beautiful assistant are really caring. I feel I have found a new and caring facility and would recommend them to anyone dealing with pain.

Dr. Mikhail J. Artamonov, MD in East Stroudsburg, PA offers comprehensive pain management services through his specialized clinic. With a patient-centered approach, Dr. Artamonov combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to address chronic and acute pain conditions. The clinic serves residents throughout the Pocono region, providing relief and improved quality of life for those suffering from debilitating pain issues.

At his East Stroudsburg practice, Dr. Artamonov utilizes advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment protocols to address a wide range of pain conditions. The clinic offers interventional procedures, medication management, and integrative approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Dr. Artamonov's extensive medical training and ongoing commitment to the latest pain management developments ensure patients receive cutting-edge care in a compassionate environment.

Patient-Focused Care

Understanding that pain affects every aspect of a patient's life, Dr. Artamonov takes time to thoroughly evaluate each case, considering medical history, lifestyle factors, and personal goals. This comprehensive approach allows for the development of customized treatment plans that address not just symptoms but underlying causes. The clinic staff prioritizes patient education, ensuring individuals understand their conditions and treatment options.

Facility and Accessibility

Located at 391 E Brown St in East Stroudsburg, PA 18301, the clinic offers a modern, comfortable environment designed with patient comfort in mind. The facility features state-of-the-art equipment for diagnostics and treatments. New patients are welcome, and the clinic accepts most major insurance plans. For appointments or consultations, patients can call +1 570-872-9800 or visit the clinic's website at https://www.amira-health.com/ for more information about services and to access patient resources.

column40:
I saw this doctor in 2006 after a car accident. I was seeing him for 2-3 years over on Rt. 447 then he left without any notice. Before he left he did a procedure where he goes in to burn a nerve in my spine and then he left. The doctor who took his place couldn't answer any of my questions about the procedure he did . The procedure starting causing numbness in my feet . I remembered that he went into my feet with the electric current and asked me if I felt that he scared the heck out of me. Weeks after that procedure the numbness got way worse!! Years later now I have nerve damage up to my calves.|Went for my medical card a couple years ago. Got everything done, then was told an issue on there end needed to be resolved. I said okay and I figured they would process the issue. Guess what, i never received my medical card. I tried calling numerous times with no one answering the call or calling back. It's a shame. I got recommended by my doctor and let her know of this bad experience. My partner also got recommended this place from the doctors and I advised him to go to someone else to prevent losing money.|It took me until 2005 to find a good pain doctor after becoming disabled with FEMA at the 9/11 event. Dr. Artamonov found the cause of the pain and addressed it rather than mask it
like every other so called pain doctor. He has given me a reason to live. Priceless! 10 stars!|This practice is terrific! Dr. Artamonov combines expertise and a willingness to listen and discuss every detail of my problems.  Also, the staff is very friendly and professional.|Dr. A has always been such an amazing doctor and treats all his patients with the same respect. I have never met a doctor who cares so much. & as for his staff they're all wonderfully and friendly and will do everything in their power to make sure their patients are satisfied. Excellent office and staff.|I have been here for over 4 months now and I have not received any of my pain medication and I have not had any of my  Epidaurals.

The only relief in sight was medical marijuana which I registered for and paid $250 They said they are sorry but they forgot to register me for the medical marijuana program that I paid $250 for.

So now I am stuck in so much pain that I cannot go anywhere or leave the house at this point and I just found out that I will have to wait 2 or 3 more weeks now for relief so I am extremely depressed. I have been waiting the arrival of the card every day because the doc wont prescribe  my medication and the doctor will not give me any or perform epidurals.
His office just called me today to let me know they forgot about me.  How  I have been bed ridden for over a week now and have not eaten in 4 days and I am facing on emergency Room trip after being treated.|If I could have made it zero stars I would have! My husband went to him when his office was still on 447, he was looking for pain relief.  A Cortisone Shot was discussed, and he gave him one so quickly Dr didn't even bother to clean the skin or wipe with alcohol on his wrist.  The shot hit a nerve, I guess that is what happens when your in such a hurry.  On leaving the building Dr Mikhail was having a very vocal hissy fit and yelling at his staff. Very unprofessional, we never went back!!!!!!!!|It is my privilege to write this review on behalf of Dr. Mikhail Artamonov and his staff because almost a decade ago when I became a patient, my life of chronic pain finally changed for the better. I have a pain disorder that was very difficult to diagnose. I had countless exams over my life with a variety of specialists who could not pinpoint my actual disorder. Finally, thanks to Dr. Artamonov and his vast training and in-depth knowledge, I am receiving the care and treatments I never knew existed before becoming his patient. Though my condition is permanent, he attends regular training for the newest technologies available today including participating as a certified physician in the state's Medical Marijuana Program. He and his staff are equipped to perform all the latest diagnostic tests and procedures available in spine and pain management.

From healthcare related issues to scheduling, billing, and every department I have had occasion to communicate with, the staff is extraordinarily professional and makes me feel like a part of a
family. Particularly, Dina Cascioli, Medical Assistant, Cassidy C., Front Desk Receptionist, Amanda B. in the billing department, and Practice Manager, Arifa A., treat me with the dignity and respect every patient deserves.

If I could rate this Harvard-trained specialist any higher than 5 stars, I would. Advance Pain, Spine, and Sport Medicine has been a blessing. This community is extremely fortunate to have Dr. Artamonov and his practice.

Nick B.
Saylorsburg, PA

column2: Center for Pain Management at Saint Vincent
column3:
Center for Pain Management at Saint Vincent in Erie, Pennsylvania offers comprehensive pain management services as part of the Allegheny Health Network. Located in the heart of Erie, this specialized medical center provides evidence-based treatments for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Their multidisciplinary approach combines advanced interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative therapies to address the complex nature of pain.

The center's board-certified pain specialists treat a wide range of conditions, including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, cancer-related pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Their treatment options include nerve blocks, epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and other minimally invasive procedures designed to provide relief while minimizing medication dependence.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes the Center for Pain Management at Saint Vincent is their commitment to personalized care plans. Each patient receives a thorough evaluation to determine the underlying causes of their pain, followed by a customized treatment strategy. The center emphasizes improving quality of life and functional capacity, helping patients return to their daily activities with reduced pain and enhanced mobility.

Location and Accessibility

Conveniently situated at 311 W 24th St, Suite 302, Erie, PA 16502, the center is easily accessible to residents throughout Northwestern Pennsylvania. Patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 814-452-7246 or visiting the Allegheny Health Network website at www.ahn.org. The facility offers modern amenities and a comfortable environment designed to put patients at ease during their treatment journey.
column38: Shannon Small|Diana Endo|jake s|Andrea Dobbs|Khristopher LaChance|Donna George|Jodie Marie|Laural Lewis
column40:
It was so much better when Dr  Feno Monaco was there he actually listened to his patients he has empathy and now that he has left and I'm pretty sure most of their business will too. very hard to make contact with anyone and by the time they get back to you they still don't help ...very disappointed in what this place is becoming|Dr Bingham is excellent and takes his time with you. I've never received prejudgment from him regarding my chronic pain issues. I've had two procedures by him and he has been patient and calm throughout both.

His staff is mostly responsive, but at times they may be overworked.

The last time I was there I had quite a wait, but I didn't mind because I knew he was taking care of patients and not goofing off. If you are working and time is an issue, I recommend getting an early am appointment. For those unable to work, just take a good book.  I've seen him several times and only remember one appointment that ran late. I just want to give others a few tips if there is a wait. Conversely, you'll not feel rushed when he sees you. He'll be totally focused on you.|Treated like another number. Staff are just trained to protect the doctor's licenses and best interests. Zero compassion from any staff, as if you're not at a PAIN management clinic, for no reason at all. Don't expect anything to be properly managed or done in any timely manner. They do not care if you live in pain or not.|5 stars for Dr. Bingham! He was amazing, kind, respectful, knowledgable, patient. Everything you could want!
2 stars less for the frustrating wait times for people to call back from that office! It takes them multiple days to call people back. I called the refill line and it was a week, no response. Maybe they are under staffed and need more help with returning calls.|This place never answers its phone. They return your message and tell you to call them back, and ... they never answer their phone. Their awful. If they have this lack of attention with their communications,  I would run away from their care as fast as possible|I used to see Matt and he was wonderful, he's moved on, The doctor I was assigned to, wasn't great as far as I am concerned, unfortunately I don't even remember his name, but he did drop my meds down  4.0 mg told me I was fat and that could contributed to my abdominal pain, now I am overweight no Denying, but I was 103 pounds for my whole adult life,  it has nothing to do with this I've been suffering with this for years 4 decades, 13 major abdominal operations,I'm full of scar tissue,I found a great pain management provider and of course now he's gone; this also causes pain in my back as well, the last doctor that did surgery on me came out and said to family and friends that he had never seen so many, no wonder I was in such pain,he had been doing surgery like for three decades, he tried to take care of some of them but he was giving me a hysterectomy and trying to save my colon, so when a doctor says that you know there is a lot in there, not much choice to get rid of them one of those things is your need  pain meds, his logic was that I would only need the dose,that he gave me because I had not been taking what I was a usually  taking, I  didn't have any more  of course Covid, what was I to do about getting in there to get a prescription? I'm sure there are good reviews about him as well all doctors have that, but I'm not happy with him  quite sad and mad the pain along with neuropathy is unbearable, I have been popping ibuprofen prescription dosage, so I don't know how good that is but that's not even helping, good luck with him, hoping someone will be happy with him,|Everyone was very helpful. They gave me choices of trying multiple therapies or procedures. They didn't treat me like a drug addict.|They are great here. Very helpful and friendly. Also, extremely knowledgeable and compassionate. Would recommend to anyone with the misfortune of having chronic pain.

Dr. Yasin N. Khan, MD serves Allentown, PA and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management services. As the founder of Comprehensive Pain Centers, Dr. Khan brings decades of specialized experience to patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. His practice combines cutting-edge interventional techniques with compassionate care, offering hope to those who have struggled to find effective pain relief through conventional treatments.

At Comprehensive Pain Centers, Dr. Khan provides comprehensive evaluations and personalized treatment plans for a wide range of pain conditions. His approach integrates advanced diagnostic methods with innovative therapeutic interventions, including minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and rehabilitation strategies. Patients benefit from his expertise in treating complex conditions such as spinal pain, neuropathic disorders, joint dysfunction, and post-surgical pain syndromes.

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Khan's philosophy centers on treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. He takes time to understand each patient's unique circumstances, medical history, and pain experience before developing customized treatment protocols. This patient-centered approach has earned him a reputation for exceptional care throughout the Lehigh Valley region.

Facility and Accessibility

Located at 1146 S Cedar Crest Blvd in Allentown, PA 18103, Comprehensive Pain Centers offers a modern, comfortable environment equipped with state-of-the-art technology. The facility is designed to provide patients with a calming atmosphere during their visits. For appointments or consultations, patients can call +1 610-366-9000 or visit the practice website at http://www.comprehensivepain.com/ for more information about services and treatment options.

column40:
This doctor never took the time to listen to me.  I waited in his waiting room over two hours to see him. He felt an intrathecal morphine pump would be good relief for me from my chronic conditions.  Every appointment after waiting a very long time to see him. He barely spoke and he just kept raising my morphine dose. By my last appointment with him. My morphine dose had reached an astounding number of over 3.5 mugs every 24 hours. Then he prescribed me a bottle of Percocet.  I left his office. Never filled that script and I found the best pain mngmnt doctor in the world. In the beginning of 2022 after the morphine pump was in for two years. My new doctor helped me ween every month. I finally got down to .35 mg every 24 hours. I had surgery in 10/23 and had my pump removed.  36 hours after surgery I was in the worst withdrawal I have ever experienced at 60 years old.  I temporarily went on Methadone to ease the withdrawal. It made me so sick.  I then weeded off that and was given just a small dose of Extended release morphine.  Today is Christmas Day and I'm not taking any of it.  I've been ill fighting this terrible battle since October.  Dr Khan never discussed other treatments with me.  I now get Radio frequency ablation every 6 months. To burn the nerves causing me such occipital neuralgia and migraines. And I get the most wonderful relief for about 6 months.   Think twice before choosing this physician.   The best thing I ever did was not return to his practice.|This man violated me by implanting a device in me I didn't agree to. .. Not once did he apologize . They wouldn't release my records either.  This man only cares about the money. ... He doesn't care about you .|This was my first procedure with Dr Khan and I was very impressed with how informative he was with all of my questions. I was extremely nervous and he continuously and patiently kept me calm, consistently asking if I was ok and announcing everything that he was doing so I was aware. He seems genuinely concerned about getting patients better, getting them off meds and helping live pain free. I am very pleased so far with my results although I still have a long road ahead of me. If you're serious about living a pain free and better quality life then I would definitely recommend seeing Dr Khan.|I have been a patient of Dr. Khan since 2016, after seeking a pain doctor that could provide some relief after 20 years of martial arts training and the process of aging had taken its toll. I then went to Dr. Khan.  I have degenerative disc disease in my neck, an arthritic spine and other pain producing problems.  When Dr. Khan injects me, I know that I will be pain free quickly.  I also enjoy talking with him as he will take the time to explain what is causing the pain and how he will cure it. My search for a pain doctor ceased after being treated by Dr. Khan. I can recommend Dr. Khan, without reservation, and encourage others who have pain issues to become his patient.|Only intake appointment but Dr Kahn listened to what prior treatments and surgeries had been tried and following an extensive intake and neurological exam, done by Dr Kahn, together we came up with a treatment plan including diagnostic treatments and pain management interventions leaving us hopeful.  Change is never easy but Dr Kahn's patience made it easier.|Dr Khan is  the  most capable pain management doctor that  you could  ever  treat  with he and his  very capable  staff are the  best  in the field  of  pain . I had neck  pain  shoulder pain  also carpal tunnel  my wrist. Dr Khan made my life very liveable once again. Thank  you|Dr kahn is very good. Dr ko is ok. Haven't met dr. Stiles yet, but he sounds nice.

They have a nurse there that sees follow ups & writes prescriptions. (Beth / Melissa?) A big girl who should not be allowed to practice. Ever. Anywhere. She is definitely on some kind of power trip. She has wrong information from my files. Made up a lie that she had already had some information that would been impossible because it never happened (medication allergy). She takes her time calling in medications. I'm waiting 4 days now & it's the weekend so it will over a week I'm waiting.

She has said some very disrespectful things to me. Condescending. Rude. Tries to Intimidate me. Actually raised her voice & pointed her finger at me. That's all unacceptable.

That's just cruel & very messed up. They're supposed to be helping with pain.

If they get rid of "nurse rachet," it would be great place.|Dr. Khan and his staff are very professional and caring.  He is very accurate and gental when
when injecting medication for pain. He and his staff provides answers to any questions asked. Any devices or supplies, are provided ,and explained on  how to properly use. I'v reduced my medication and my pain was substantial reduced. As in any medical profession, emergencys occur  and  schedules can run off time.

Valley Pain Center LLC serves Huntingdon Valley, PA and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Established as a premier medical facility, our center specializes in treating chronic and acute pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our board-certified physicians combine decades of experience with cutting-edge techniques to provide relief and improve quality of life for those suffering from debilitating pain.

At Valley Pain Center, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options, including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. Our multidisciplinary approach addresses various pain conditions such as back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating personalized treatment plans that consider each patient's medical history, lifestyle, and goals. Our compassionate team takes the time to listen, educate, and involve patients in their care decisions, fostering a supportive environment where healing can begin. Many of our patients report significant improvements in mobility, sleep quality, and overall well-being after receiving treatment at our center.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 1800 Byberry Rd, Suite 1101 in Huntingdon Valley, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and therapeutic technology. The center is designed with patient comfort in mind, offering a calming atmosphere that helps reduce the anxiety often associated with medical visits.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (215) 947-7992 or visit our website at valleypaincenter.com. Our friendly staff is ready to assist you on your journey toward pain relief and improved function.

Academic Pain & Spine in Bensalem, Pennsylvania serves communities throughout Bucks County with specialized pain management solutions. Our comprehensive clinic focuses on delivering effective treatments for chronic and acute pain conditions without resorting to complicated or risky surgical procedures. With a patient-centered approach, we welcome individuals of all ages and backgrounds who are seeking meaningful relief from persistent pain issues that affect their quality of life.

Led by anesthesiologist specialist Beth Chekemian, DO, our team combines medical expertise with compassionate care. Dr. Chekemian's advanced training and dedication to pain management ensures that each patient receives personalized treatment plans based on the latest medical advancements. Upon entering our facility, patients immediately feel the difference in our approach—where your comfort and confidence in your treatment plan are our priorities.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Our clinical expertise extends to a wide range of conditions including:

  • Neck and back pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

Patient-Focused Approach

Our supportive staff creates a welcoming environment where patients feel heard and valued. Visit Our Bensalem Location

column3:
Pain Relief and Wellness Strategies Center serves Grove City, PA and surrounding areas with exceptional care focused on non-drug, non-surgical pain management solutions. Established in 1989, our center brings together a comprehensive team of medical doctors, nurse practitioners, physical therapists, doctors of chiropractic, and trained assistants who work collaboratively to address your pain concerns. We pride ourselves on utilizing state-of-the-art equipment and innovative technologies to deliver lasting relief and promote overall wellness for our patients.

At the core of our practice is The Vinton Method™, a proprietary treatment protocol that combines multiple highly effective procedures to achieve superior results. While each individual treatment we offer demonstrates remarkable effectiveness on its own, our integrated approach produces the highest possible success rates for our patients. This comprehensive methodology addresses not just symptoms but underlying causes of pain, providing sustainable relief where other approaches have failed.

World-Class Facility and Care

Our facility is designed to provide a safe, comfortable environment where healing can take place. Every aspect of the Pain Relief and Wellness Strategies Center reflects our commitment to excellence in patient care. From your first consultation through your entire treatment journey, our team focuses on delivering personalized attention and developing customized treatment plans that address your specific needs.

Get Started Today

We invite you to experience the difference our approach can make in your life. Contact us today at +1 724-458-1100 to schedule your free consultation. Our center is conveniently located at 190 George Jr Rd, Grove City, PA 16127. For more information about our services and The Vinton Method™, visit our website at http://drkenvinton.com/.

column38: Ryan Hovis|Jolene Hartle|Home TV|Pauline Shuler|Marcia Best|Rhonda Shipley|Gary Maras|Janal Crissman
column40:
Looking for someone to do intranasal PRP for a devastating facial nerve injury and complex trigeminal neuralgia, I found this clinic. Lacking any clinical trials to support any of their claims, I decided to treat elsewhere.

Anyone offering stem cell therapy in a town as small as Grove City and in a facility this small without an expensive lab is likely a scam. If your stem cell therapy failed it was because your injections didn't contain any viable stem cells. I have been treated by Regeneration Pittsburgh and Regenexx and didn't notice any chiropractors on staff. Chiropractors are not medical doctors.|My mom is 91 years old. She was in constant pain in both knees. This was our last option. It has been awesome!  She now has no pain and is walking around great and it's only been 3 months!  This has been years of other painful procedures that never worked. I am so thankful to have found this for my mom. She now has a good quality of life again. The staff was great and very caring. Dr Vinton spent a lot of time explaining every question she had asked. I highly recommend Dr Vinton and their wonderful staff!  It was a life saver for my mom.|Big scammers and all about money! First it should have been a big red flag that I had to pay up from for 10 sessions of soft wave therapy! Second when I ask the woman that was doing the soft wave about her only doing it for three minutes she rolled her eyes at me and had a very annoyed look on her face! I was just voicing my concern as I was facing another spinal cord surgery and saying that I was reading that treatment was longer than three minutes!

I finally decided this wasn't the proper place and felt strongly in my heart that I was being scammed! I was forced to pay 1,250 dollars up from, not allowing me to pay per session and they were only doing three minute treatments! I prayed for god to guide me in the right direction as I didn't want to have another spinal cord surgery and I wasn't getting any relief from my terrible pain! My prayers were answered and now I go to the guy the created the soft wave machine and he confirmed my suspicion about being scammed! He does 15 minute treatments which equals 2,200 shocks compared to 3 minute treatments equals 450 shocks! I am finally seeing results! Pain and Wellness was just taking my money probably hoping that I would buy another 1,25O package! I would highly recommend to stay away from this place!|The treatment I received here is nothing short of AMAZING!!! The stem cell treatment has almost completely eliminated my constant knee pain, and I'm not even completely done with the treatment! Dr. Vinton is truly a miracle worker, and his staff is wonderful too!  If you have chronic joint pain,  RUN, don't walk, to this place...you won't regret it!|The staff and Dr. Vinton are the very best!  Friendly, accommodating people who remember you after one visit.  They go out if their way to make sure your appointment is timely, you comfortable and answer any questions as often as you need.  Over all great people, great experience and what's even better, IT WORKS!|Awesome  staff. Tia, Theresa are the best. My husband can now walk without pain and I have no back pain. Thanks Dr. Vinton, Dr Flynn and staff.|The staff were so kind and helpful. My neck is back to 100%. My shoulder is back to 100%. My knees are signficantly improved. Absolutely my best decision for treatment.
Life changing results for me!|After dealing with a headache for 6 months, I found Dr. Vinton who was willing to help.  After just seven sessions of VaxD therapy, my headache is gone.  It has been life changing.

Sharon Regional Pain Management Center in Sharon, PA offers comprehensive interventional pain management services to patients throughout Mercer County and surrounding areas. Established as part of the Sharon Regional Medical Center network, this specialized facility provides evidence-based treatments for both acute and chronic pain conditions. The center's multidisciplinary approach combines advanced medical interventions with personalized care plans to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

The center offers a wide range of interventional procedures including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and joint injections. Their team of board-certified pain specialists works closely with each patient to develop customized treatment strategies that address the underlying causes of pain while minimizing reliance on opioid medications.

Patient-Centered Approach

At Sharon Regional Pain Management Center, patients benefit from a comprehensive evaluation process that considers medical history, physical examination findings, and diagnostic imaging to create targeted treatment plans. The center emphasizes collaborative care, often coordinating with primary care physicians, neurologists, orthopedic surgeons, and physical therapists to ensure integrated pain management solutions.

Facility Information

Located at 32 Jefferson Ave, Sharon, PA 16146, the center provides a comfortable, modern environment equipped with state-of-the-art technology for pain interventions. Patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 724-983-5521. Additional information about services and treatment options is available on their website at sharonregionalmedical.org/services-directory/interventional-pain-management.

The center accepts most major insurance plans and works with patients to navigate coverage options for specialized pain procedures. Their dedicated staff assists with appointment scheduling, insurance verification, and answering questions about treatment protocols.

column48: How  good is the doctor I have chronic pain
column49: That depends on what you are looking for. If you want a solution to pain, and don't mind the usual parade of back shots, then they are on par with most pain management centers. If you are looking for solutions like pain pump tech., oral medications that actually work, or doctors willing to go the extra mile to find something for you that works, then here in PA that does not exist.  Only one doctor I know of that fit that bill and he died last year.

Janerich Pain Specialists serves patients throughout Pennsylvania with exceptional pain management solutions. For years, our dedicated team has been at the forefront of innovative treatment approaches, helping countless individuals find relief from chronic pain conditions. Our specialists combine extensive clinical experience with cutting-edge techniques to deliver personalized care that addresses each patient's unique needs.

Our practice stands out for our advanced expertise with neurotoxins, allowing us to effectively treat neck pain and spasticity with remarkable success rates that surpass many other pain management specialists. We take pride in our comprehensive approach that focuses not just on symptom relief but on improving overall quality of life for our patients.

Revolutionary New Technologies

We're excited to announce the addition of two groundbreaking devices to our practice:

  • EMSCULPT NEO - The world's only non-invasive technology that simultaneously builds 25% more muscle and reduces fat by 30% on average

  • EMFACE - A breakthrough treatment utilizing the first and only technology that synchronizes radiofrequency and HIFES energies to treat both skin and muscle

Visit Our Practice

Experience the difference at Janerich Pain Specialists, where cutting-edge technology meets compassionate care. We're conveniently located at 901 Wyoming Ave, West Pittston, PA 18643.

I went to Jen for emsculpt maintenance and I learned about all these other great new advanced laser treatments that she does. The worst part about it is I had to walk 1 mile for the appointment.|My dad, who has been going through a particularly stressful time this year had an appointment today with Dr janerich. The woman at the front desk should be ashamed of the way she spoke to him, and Dr Janerich lost a potential new patient due to her behavior. I hope that going forward the woman who took his call can remember that on the other end of these calls is a human being, likely going through a very difficulty time. Patience, kindness, and empathy should be considered when patients  are asking SIMPLE questions well within the scope of a receptionist position to answer.|I absolutely LOVE Dr. Janerich. He is so kind and patient. column40:
I had a fantastic experience at Dr Berry's office! From the moment I walked in, the front office and clinical staff were incredibly welcoming and professional. They made sure I was comfortable and took the time to explain everything clearly. Dr. Berry is knowledgeable, attentive, and truly cares about his patients. It's rare to find such a great combination of a skilled doctor and an amazing team. Highly recommend!|Dr Berrys bed side manner is awful. I'm in pain it's not funny. He did not spend much time to figure out the issue. SI injection and lumbar injections were painful and unhelpful. He sent me to Dr Boniratti who looked at me and said "why are you here"   I've switched to Dr Toshok. I highly recommend Tochak.|I had seen. Dr. Berry He was cold and judgmental did order mri but I have not heard anything . He clearly did not care or show compassion.Told me to go to pain and Spine specialist!!He clearly did did not want me as a patient!|When I first saw Dr. Berry it was a car insurance claim and he treated me wonderfully. That being said, he was over 45 minutes late for that appointment and every subsequent appointment thereafter. Once he realized after the car insurance money ran out and I was on Medicaid, his "bedside" manner was horrible. He was very short and rude to me. Then they sent me a bill for $2,000 which is illegal to do when someone is on Medicaid. I would not recommend him at all.|Dr. Barry himself is wonderful up until I had a miscommunication with one of his nurses and then everything went down hill, they treated me like I was a drug addict, a liar, and totally irresponsible and I have been upset ever since they sent me to a different pain specialist guess they didn't want to be called out on something they did wrong, his staff is absolutely horrible!!|I have a HUGE review below but do not speak  up for yourself to his staff not even kindly !!! His nurses are rude and I asked that they please treat me with kindness because I wasn't rude to them I expected the same treatment so when other issues came up dr Berry said the surgery center was refusing to let me have my procedure done there because I'm a hard stick (a surgery center?) so I had to have it with a different doctor at the hospital but that doctor said no because he didn't want to do sedation so a friend was having the same thing done with that doctor that next day (I know crazy but true) so she asked him and he said he had no issue with it. Sooo I go back to doctor Berrys nurses and I ask questions I had every right to ask I still wasn't rude one just a few days ago I got a letter saying all advanced pain centers will not see me due to my treatment of the staff! Thank god it was ALL in emails and Ivan see an attorney that won't be left on my records and his staff will not get away with this! Really really glad I used the app and the emails I have everything on record!!!!|Dr Berry is currently withholding pain medication from my elderly friend who's dying from cancer because she was traveling for the holidays and could not respond to his office's request to count her pills. My friend has supplied various forms of proof, including a signed affidavit from the people she was with at the time, that she was out of town when they called, but Dr Barry and his associates are refusing to refill her prescription.

Please tell me how withholding medication from a dying patient is doing no harm!

Update: My friend switched doctors to someone who trusts her when she says she's in pain and understands what a burden trips to the doctor's office can be, especially unplanned ones.|I liked Dr Berry personally but he wants to do a nerve block on my back i told him I can't do the needles in my back I get really sick and I can't handle it. So he brought up iv sedation but said my insurance won't cover it. So he said he could give me an Ativan well I take klonopin 4 times a day I know Ativan isn't going to work. My husband said after we left the office that if I really wanted the iv sedation he would pay for it. So I called them back for a price. Now im told he can't do iv sedation! I was so excited to try this option and now im back to being sick already cause I do not do well with injections with out sedation. I've had to be sedated for just steroid injection!
Im just very unhappy that I was told it was an option and I got so excited to now it's a no! Why bring it up? Ugh!

Update Dr Berry has decided to do the iv sedation I'm so excited to try this procedure out!

I also changed my starts from 3 to 5 cause I honestly one had it lower because of the sedation situation! Other wise I thought Dr berry was great

Updates so my procedure was cancelled due to me being a hard stick so I've been waiting for an update on that in the mean time I did request dr Berry take over my tramadol but I'll tell you didn't now I've changed my stars from 2 to 5 back to a 2!!! The front seat lady and de Berry are very nice but whoever speaks to you in the emails they are so rude!!! And I'm very very nice it's one of the only things I really give myself credit for in life I have no been mean in anyway even tho I've had a right to be but every time I have interacted with these other ladies they are just nasty!!! Totally unwarranted!!! So I'm done until I am respected I refuse to have any respect! I even understand him not wanting to write my tramadol I said that before I got the rude reply about him not doing it!!! But damn let's get my procedure going!!! I just want to be on the road to less pain that's all I want! So I pray you ladies start having pain! Terrible pain that Motrin or anything else will help so you know what this is like! You honestly deserve it!!!
Just get me my procedure done so I can never speak to your office EVER AGAIN!
Yet even more BS today. Got an email saying dr mills won't do my procedure with sedation dr Berry after agreeing to sedation is now saying he won't do it unless it's Ativan that won't work on me I take klonopin 4 times a day now they are saying the surgery center won't allow my sedation like what??? A surgery center won't do sedation??? This is ridiculous so I've told them just to forget it I'll just be in pain the rest of my life also emails are still not being signed so I'm going to be going above their heads in regards to that because it's definitely not professional at all to not let a patient know who they are dealing with. Just avoid this office everyone unless you enjoy rude nurses and being tossed around!

column3:
Highpoint Pain and Rehabilitation Physicians in Chalfont, PA offers comprehensive pain management and rehabilitation services to patients throughout Bucks County and the greater Philadelphia region. Founded on principles of patient-centered care, our medical practice specializes in diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches that minimize reliance on opioid medications. Our team of board-certified physicians combines extensive clinical experience with advanced interventional techniques to address complex pain syndromes and improve patients' quality of life.

At Highpoint Pain, we provide a multidisciplinary approach to pain treatment that includes interventional procedures, physical therapy, medication management, and behavioral health support. Our specialists are experts in treating conditions such as spinal pain, joint disorders, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Each treatment plan is customized to address the unique needs of the individual patient, with a focus on restoring function and reducing suffering.

Our Facility and Accessibility

Located at 700 Horizon Circle in Chalfont, PA 18914, our modern medical facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology. The clinic offers convenient parking, wheelchair accessibility, and a comfortable environment designed with patient comfort in mind. We serve patients from across Bucks County, Montgomery County, and the surrounding areas, providing a convenient location for comprehensive pain care.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Highpoint Pain and Rehabilitation Physicians is our commitment to treating each patient with dignity and respect. We take time to listen to patients' concerns, thoroughly evaluate their conditions, and develop personalized treatment strategies that address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain. Our physicians maintain open communication with referring providers to ensure coordinated care across specialties.

For more information about our services or to schedule a consultation, please visit our website at www.highpointpain.com/dr-qu/ or contact our office at +1 215-395-8888. We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to making quality pain management accessible to all patients in need.
column38: Julia Keyt|Barry Letizio|Jerry McGovern|Scott Doroshow|Claire|Angie Valenzuela|Frances Ayers|Dan Cadden
column40:
Thank you Dr Jeffrey Boyd for an amazing experience with the "Median  Nerve Block" (Oblation) to my bulging disc in cervical neck.  The extremely debilitating  worsening long- lasting pain every early morning after resting my head on the pillow for more two hours has recently some what subsided.  I actually woke up with about half the level of pain that I have had in the last  about 6 months.  Hopefully this willl last-we will see?!
I want to thank you Dr  Boyd for your exceptional kindness and precise navigation through the procedure and wise counsel afterwards.  Also I want to thank the attending staff and especially "Liz" who was so supportive and compassionate during and after the procedure.  Thanks for  the apple juice and sticking by me "Liz " till my dizziness subsided.  Also thank you to KaitIyn who is so wonderful to greet at check in and helpful at checking out, along with friendly and supportive Lisa!!! Dare I forget to thank P.A. Judy H. and Jen G. who encouraged me much to proceed with this nerve block. I felt very cared for all the way through and the results of the Oblation Nerve Block is quite better than expected.  So as always, I highly recommend Pennsylvania Pain and Spine Institute to anyone who wants compassionate caring guidance and relief in the relentless struggle with chronic debilitating pain.|I have been using PA Pain & Spine for pain relief for many years. The staff including all Physicians, Physician Assistants and the administration are very professional and knowledgeable. Injections are pain free with great results.|Pennsylvania pain and spine deserves more than 5 stars. I have been a patient off and on for many years. I cannot say enough about the care I have received from all the doctors and physicians assistants at the Chalfont office. Dr. Qu was the first doctor I saw many years ago, next was Dr. Bozak. I give these 2 excellent physicians 10 stars. The past year or so I have been seen by Dr. Jeffery Boyd and I cannot express the thanks I give him knowing he saved me from surgery. Dr. Boyd takes the time to listen and explains every step of the injection process during the procedures. Dr. Boyd really makes you feel comfortable, so he gets 10 stars also.  I also want to commend the front desk ladies, always very pleasant.|Dr Boyd is ver attentive, knowledgeable and a very good listener! I am so happy to have met him, despite having another scary flare up coming from my lumbar / pelvic region. He thoroughly explained and showed me the MRI photo area of concern and advised me the recommended option should I have a flare up again. Additionally, he spent more time with me yesterday than a previous Pain Management Dr. that I had 2 appointments with. Also, Dr Boyd probably spent more time with me than the Dr who performed my Lumbar Spinal Fusion & Laminectomy last July 23.|I am very pleased with my care at PP&S Inst.  Everyone there is kind & helpful.  I will continue to go there for my pain management.  Highly recommend!!|Dr. Boyd was Extremely knowledgeable in my concerns & condition, giving me peace of mind to move forward with my decision to receive treatment. We were able to work together to set goals for my care. I highly recommend this office and look forward to working with them and finally getting relief from my herniated disc. Thank you Dr. Boyd for being so kind and helping me understand the procedure.|I am a long time and ongoing patient. The staff listens to my symptoms, my concerns and provides professional and compassionate care. I highly recommend this practice.|Dear Dr. Vikoren,

I wanted to express my sincere appreciation for the exceptional service I received during my recent appointment. The efficiency and proficiency of both you and your staff left a lasting impression on me.

My appointment was scheduled for 9:00 am, and I was pleasantly surprised to find myself out the door by 9:30 am. This timeframe included a thorough series of x-rays, which you reviewed with me. Your willingness to address all of my questions and concerns made me feel much more confident about my 12-week recovery from knee surgery.

Thank you for your dedication and expertise. I am grateful to have you as my orthopedic healthcare provider.

Sincerely, Daniel R. Cadden Sr.

column2: Tower Health Medical Group Pain Management - Wyomissing
column3:
Tower Health Medical Group Pain Management - Wyomissing serves patients throughout Wyomissing, Pennsylvania and the surrounding Berks County area with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized medical practice focuses on diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Located conveniently at 1991 State Hill Rd in Wyomissing, our facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and therapeutic technologies to address a wide spectrum of pain-related disorders.

At Tower Health Medical Group Pain Management, our board-certified physicians offer multidisciplinary treatment options including interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy coordination, and innovative pain relief techniques. We treat conditions ranging from back and neck pain to complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, neuropathic disorders, and arthritis-related discomfort. Our goal is to improve quality of life while minimizing medication dependence through comprehensive care plans.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating individualized treatment strategies that address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain. Our team works closely with primary care providers and other specialists within the Tower Health network to ensure coordinated care. New patients benefit from thorough evaluations that consider medical history, previous treatments, and personal goals to develop effective pain management solutions.

Location and Accessibility

Our Wyomissing office is easily accessible from Reading and surrounding communities, with convenient parking available for patients. The facility at 1991 State Hill Rd, Wyomissing, PA 19610 is designed with patient comfort in mind. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, patients can call us directly at (484) 628-6283 or visit our website at https://towerhealth.org/locations/tower-health-medical-group-pain-management-west-reading for additional information and online appointment scheduling options.

Our Specialized Services

Our clinic offers an extensive range of treatment options including:

- Regenerative medicine therapies

- CBD-based pain management solutions

- Interventional pain procedures

- Physical rehabilitation programs

- Customized exercise protocols

- Medication management

Patient-Centered Approach

At Advanced Pain and Rehab Specialists, we believe in treating the whole person, not just their symptoms. Advanced Technology & Expertise

column2: Jorge Rivero Becerra, MD: Vital Pain Center
column3:
Vital Pain Center, located in Pittsburgh, PA, is a premier pain management clinic dedicated to providing comprehensive and compassionate care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Under the expert guidance of Jorge Rivero Becerra, MD, the center has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider in the greater Pittsburgh area, offering evidence-based treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Dr. Rivero Becerra brings extensive training and experience to his practice, specializing in interventional pain management techniques that address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. The center offers a wide range of treatments including nerve blocks, epidural injections, radiofrequency ablation, and medication management, all designed to improve patients' quality of life and functional abilities.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets Vital Pain Center apart is its commitment to personalized care. Dr. Rivero Becerra takes time to thoroughly evaluate each patient, developing customized treatment plans that may combine multiple modalities for optimal pain relief. The center's compassionate staff ensures patients feel supported throughout their pain management journey, from initial consultation through ongoing care.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 363 Vanadium Rd #106, Pittsburgh, PA 15243, the Vital Pain Center features modern equipment and comfortable treatment rooms designed with patient comfort in mind. The clinic's convenient location serves residents throughout Pittsburgh and surrounding communities, offering accessible pain management solutions close to home.

For appointments or consultations, patients can reach Vital Pain Center at +1 412-279-1231 or visit their website at www.vitalpaincenter.com to learn more about available services and treatment options. The center accepts most major insurance plans and works diligently to ensure patients receive the care they need with minimal financial burden.
column38: Kathy Barry|gina caruso|Brittany Toth|Dee Selepec|Brooke Mirenna|Robert Hoag|Amy Russman|Heidi C. Franks
column40:
Dr. Becerra is a Very Caring & Concerned doctor. I'm Very Grateful that i found him. He's Truly interested in your well being . He takes the time to listen to your concerns and address your issues. Dr. Becerra's Staff are also Very Pleasant, Knowledgeable people. I Appreciate each one of them.|Dr Beccera is kind caring and on time within 15min.
His staff is wonderful! Past mean receptionist is gone!
Heather is a stand out for finding answers to questions that come up.
Nicest and most thorough clinic I've gone to.
Been receiving treatment for 6 years!|Dr. Becerra is wonderful! I have been going to him for over 4 years now. I travel 3 hours each way to see him every other month- it's a long haul but totally worth it- I am 35 and he is the only doctor that takes my chronic pain  seriously. He listens unlike so many other practitioners and does not dismiss me because of my age. We always catch up each time I'm in and he is genuinely interested in his patients' lives and ways he can help manage pain. He offers a wide array of options and even does injections right in the office. His staff is lovely as well! I am usually in and out of the office in 45 mins max. Only downside is the phone service, they rarely answer due to being busy and as the voicemail states they get back to you within a day or two. SO if it's a pressing matter you are stuck waiting. Overall I 100% recommend this practice and doctor!!|Went to him years & was told to come in for a pill count, I told them I had a migraine. They said they didn't care to get in asap or I wouldn't get my pills or injections. I told them his pain block didn't work & he/they could shove the pills where the sun doesn't shine. Consideri me no longer a patient. A week later got letter from my insurance saying they no longer cover him under my insurance. Probably cause he over schedules & sometimes people don't get their injections or seen cause he over books,|Best team of health care workers I've ever crossed paths with. Understanding, helpful, up front, and very kind.  I've got multiple injections for my neck injury, great post results. Dr.  Rivero Bercarra has a perfect technique I trust with my life. Ms.  Dena is amazing at this procedure.  No worries with this amazing team.  Since I've been a patient my quality of life went from 100 percent miserable to I have my desire to live again.  This team of professionals is beyond highly recommended.  It's a loss to not receive treatment under this office.|This is a great practice for those of us with chronic pain. My father and I both see doctor Rivero For treatment of spinal injuries and neuropathy. The staff is amazing.
Amy at the front desk always greet you with a smile Heather is helping me with billing information in paperwork and  Deana does the scheduling and she works to get my father and I both in at the same time just for our convenience. Doctor Rivero Has given me quality of life and provide a comfort to my father and his last years|I am sharing this review on behalf of my mother, Christine Richards who was a patient for two years. When she got to her appointment today, she was notified that she was no longer going to be seen at this practice due to not doing a pill count. The front office gave her a paper stating they tried calling her but her mailbox was full. She asked why they didn't call back and was told it was computerized and random. They then mailed a letter to her old address and told her it was "her problem" the address was not current. Wouldn't let her speak to the Dr. She is 73 years old with mounds of physical issues and to be shut out, without weaning off her meds, which could cause withdrawal is the most scary thing she is facing. Never had an issue with the Dr, but the front office should be ashamed of themselves in treating an elderly woman that way.|Pain comes in many forms and Dr. Becerra cares and his knowledge seems endless. The Staff are an amazing team that also are there in every way. You can call anytime with any issue and they will respond. Coming there is like dealing with a trusted family. I will always recommend my Doctor to anyone, for I would be the first person to say, He and the Ladies are the best, truly. Not to mention, the office is always extremely clean even near the end of a day. If you are searching for a trustworty, caring, Knowledgeable and always there for you Doctor, you found him here. The Staff, 5 Stars as well!    Thank you, Dr. becerra and the Team, you are truly the best! I'm so  thankful! Absolutely, loving and caring!  A Billion Stars to you all!

column3:
Waynesburg Interventional Pain Management serves patients throughout Waynesburg, Pennsylvania and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Located in Greene County, our specialized medical practice combines evidence-based interventional techniques with personalized care plans to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Our board-certified physicians bring decades of combined experience in pain medicine, offering patients relief through minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and integrative therapies.

At Waynesburg Interventional Pain Management, we provide a wide range of advanced treatments including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, joint injections, and nerve blocks. Our approach focuses on identifying the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms, allowing for more effective long-term management of conditions like back pain, neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that consider each patient's unique medical history, lifestyle needs, and treatment goals. Pittsburgh Pain Management serves Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania with innovative pain relief solutions. Our specialized clinic focuses on treating all types of pain conditions through advanced Myofascial Acoustic Therapy techniques. Whether you're suffering from chronic discomfort or injury-related pain, our expert team provides personalized treatment plans designed to address the root cause of your symptoms rather than simply masking them.

At Pittsburgh Pain Management, we understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. Our Myofascial Acoustic Therapy targets muscle tissue, fascia, and connective tissues to promote healing and provide lasting relief. This non-invasive approach has proven effective for patients with various conditions including back pain, neck pain, fibromyalgia, sports injuries, and post-surgical discomfort.

Our Approach to Pain Management

Unlike traditional pain management centers that rely heavily on medication, our therapeutic techniques address the underlying mechanical and physiological issues causing your pain. Each treatment session is tailored to your specific needs, with our specialists continuously adjusting your care plan based on your progress and response to therapy.

Visit Our Pittsburgh Location

Located at 300 Chapel Harbor Dr, Suite 103, Pittsburgh, PA 15238, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to ensure you receive the highest quality care. column38: Cassidy Graham|Chase Schemm
column40:
Pittsburgh Pain Management is truly a blessing. I have been suffering from severe back pain for years, so severe at times that even the smallest task was daunting. I have been affected not only physically but emotionally and mentally, as well, and was ready to give up. But after continually wasting money on pain meds, chiropractors and more and years spent looking for relief, I am thrilled with the success I have had with the treatments here.

The staff, Jon and Gary, were kind and professional and made me feel comfortable from the very start. They were patient and thorough, answering all of my questions and explaining the process in a way that even I could understand.

I grew up swimming and it is something that brought so much joy to my life. My back pain kept me from the pool for the last 8 years but after just one month of treatments I have been able to return. I would recommend Pittsburgh Pain Management to anyone.|Gary and Jon were excellent. I had a meniscus tear years ago and it brought down the inflammation in my knee so much. After a couple of treatments the knee pain was gone.

Dr. Dwarki is AMAZING! I highly recommend him. He has done both lower back and neck injections and a neck ablation and every procedure has gone smoothly. I just can't recommend enough! Very satisfied patient right here.|I have been seeing Dr Karthik Dwarki for my low back pain for the past couple of years. I have seen great results after starting to see him. The injections are helping a lot, and I am able to sustain for longer periods without injections. He is very friendly, and listens to me patiently. I also had an injection once from Dr Plowey, and he was great too. The front desk is also very nice and handles appointments promptly. Highly recommended for pain injections.|I had a great experience at Keystone Pain Consultants. Dr. Dwarki was professional, attentive, and helped me understand my condition. Pain Management of Williamsport, LLC serves Williamsport, PA with a comprehensive approach to cosmetic and regenerative medicine. As a skilled solo physician clinic, we combine advanced techniques with personalized care to address both aesthetic concerns and functional limitations. Our practice stands at the intersection of cosmetic enhancement, pain management, and addiction treatment, offering evidence-based solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Our cosmetic medicine portfolio includes professional-grade dermal fillers, neurotoxins, and lifting threads designed to restore youthful contours and reduce signs of aging. We specialize in complete facial rejuvenation treatments and effective hair removal procedures, all performed with meticulous attention to natural-looking results.

Advanced Pain Management Solutions

For patients suffering from chronic pain or sports injuries, we offer cutting-edge regenerative medicine treatments including:

  • PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma) therapy

  • PRF (Platelet-Rich Fibrin) treatments

  • Exosome therapy for cellular regeneration

  • Cold Laser technology for non-invasive pain relief

  • Sarapin injections for natural pain management

Compassionate Addiction Treatment

Our clinic provides a patient-centered approach to addiction recovery, helping individuals overcome dependencies on alcohol, heroin, and other substances. We emphasize dignity and comprehensive support throughout the recovery journey.

Visit our state-of-the-art facility at 427 Hepburn St, Williamsport, PA 17701, or contact us at (570) 505-3257 to schedule a consultation. Learn more about our services at www.painmanagementandaddictiontreatment.com.

column40:
My wife had been going to Dr. Upadhyay for over 12 years. He has a very mild and calming voice during appointments. He was very up to date on new pain medicines. We were recently told (5 weeks ago) and then were subsequently notified by letter (this week) that his practice has closed.|The
Staff is so rude espically the front desk and this doctor does not work with you for pain control.  How dare you ask for certain medication he will label you immediately and say big brother is watching he's so unprofessional.  I found a new doctor that is wonderful and he's controlling my pain not talking to me like I'm and addict.  He is a horrible person I don't know how he's still practicing.|I have seen Dr. Upadhyay for over two years.  He knows how to treat pain.  If you go in and dictate to him what you need, he is not your doctor.  If you're open minded and listen he will find a way and method to resolve your pain issues.  I highly recommend this doctor and his practice.  I also find his staff very accommodating and helpful. The office is now closed. Dr. Upadhyay  I wanted to thank you for treating me the nine years.  You will be in my thoughts and prayers. I hope all is well or everything gets better.|Dr. Upadhyay is the best doctor I see--and I have a handful of them due to multiple health problems. He truly listens. That's not common in doctors. He respects my intelligence and takes me seriously. It's clear that he is up to date with the research and new medications. Because I have other health problems, there are some meds I can't take, and he is careful to prescribe what's safe for me. I've been seeing him for several years and my pain is reduced so much that I have my life back.
Also. Some people may hesitate to go to a doctor with a "foreign" name because they're afraid they won't understand him. Dr. Upadhyay has no accent whatsoever, and in fact is a US Army veteran. His name is pronounced "you-PA-zhah"--it's easy!
I would recommend him to anyone who is suffering in pain. He will do his best for you.|READ ENTIRE REVIEW! Dr. Upadhyay and staff are wonderful.  They work hard to keep your pain at a minimum.  They also work hard to keep you safe from narcotic abuse. Being in pain is hard and you can tell they do everything they can for you. So glad I found them!
Edited: I spoke too soon!  I gave the front office staff my medical marijuana card on my first visit.  I was prescribed narcotics which I took as ordered. I even stopped taking a benzo without a problem in order to treat my pain.  Then I was kicked out of the practice for having marijuana in my system! Watch out for this trap!!!!|Called for 1 month to get an appointment.  When I was finally able to get one I gave my insurance information over the phone and they said it wouldn't be an issue. I get to my appointment and the front desk says, "What is this?" The office staff are rude, unprofessional,  and judgmental.  If you want respect treat your patients with respect. Don't act surprised when someone treats you the way you treat them. I have Highmark through my employer and Gateway as a secondary. God forbid you have Gateway. That's poor people insurance.  I would give a BIG ZERO if it was an option.|As a potential new patient I had to reschedule two appointments due to family emergencies. I was given a reschedule date for October, when I called to find out when as I couldn't find the paper I wrote it on, I was told that the Dr. would not be seeing me because I cancelled my first two appointments. Must be great to be so lucky on having the perfect life and family members where there are no EMERGENCIES. What happened to the Hippocratic Oath he took? Seems more like I WANT MONEY OATH.

I had a pain management Dr. for over ten years. I drove 11/2 hours to Lebanon every month. In all those years I rarely had to reschedule and he NEVER had any problems with me. Sadly he retired.|I spent a year seeing Dr.Upadhyay and what I got for my effort is a partially crippled foot because of a Dangerous operation which was caused mostly by an Incompetent Surgeon Dr. Heather Theime.
He told me I had a possible Neuropathy that had to be confirmed by a Biopsy of the foot Sural Nerve. I went to a supposedly good surgeon who turned out to be completely incompetent for this problem and my foot is now damaged after over 7 years running.(9/2016)
I found out through University of PA Neurology that you RARELY use this Biopsy method and always use basic electrical testing (EMG) or NEEDLE BIOPSY to diagnose Neuropathy. This Biopsy typically causes problems regularly and shouldn't be used unless absolutely necessary. But just recently I learned it is a excellent way to diagnose Neuropathy but the problem was I didn't get a chance to really discuss the Alternative type of biopsies that were available and how this one could be so bad!
I apologize for the previous review I had making Dr Upadyaha the problem with the outcome of this Biopsy which was 100% caused by the Surgeon.
I woke up screaming after surgery from this procedure and was driven by anger and hate following 6 years of crippling foot pain from a woman who knew nothing of this procedure and blamed the Dr. for the bad outcome when he was only trying to do what he felt was the best possible diagnosis of Neuropathy.

Penn Pain Medicine Center Radnor serves patients throughout Radnor, Pennsylvania and the greater Philadelphia region with comprehensive pain management solutions. As part of the prestigious Penn Medicine network, our center combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. Our multidisciplinary team of board-certified pain specialists, neurologists, and physical therapists work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that focus on improving quality of life and restoring function.

At Penn Pain Medicine Center Radnor, we offer a wide range of interventional and non-interventional approaches to pain management. Our specialists are experienced in treating complex conditions including back and neck pain, neuropathic pain, cancer-related pain, post-surgical pain, and various chronic pain syndromes. Using state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and evidence-based treatments, we strive to identify the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Our Comprehensive Approach

We believe in a holistic approach to pain management that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy, psychological support, and complementary therapies. Our center features advanced treatment rooms equipped with the latest technology for procedures such as nerve blocks, spinal injections, radiofrequency ablation, and neuromodulation therapies.

Patient-Centered Care

Understanding that pain affects each person differently, we take time to listen to our patients' concerns and develop individualized treatment strategies. Our team coordinates care with your primary physicians and other specialists to ensure a cohesive approach to your overall health management.

Steven Grossinger, DO serves patients in Wilmington, Delaware and the Philadelphia area with exceptional pain management care. With over 30 years of experience as a physician, Dr. Grossinger brings a unique perspective to identifying and eliminating the sources of chronic pain. His extensive training at the Philadelphia College of Osteopathic Medicine provided him with a comprehensive understanding of the body's functions, particularly focusing on the spine and nervous system. This foundation allows him to deliver personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain rather than just managing symptoms.

Dr. Grossinger's approach to pain management combines his osteopathic training with decades of clinical experience. His diverse background enables him to view each patient's condition through multiple lenses, considering how various bodily systems interact to create or perpetuate pain. Patients benefit from his thorough diagnostic process and comprehensive treatment strategies that aim for long-term relief rather than temporary solutions.

Services and Expertise

At his practice locations in Wilmington and Springfield, Dr. Grossinger offers a range of specialized pain management services. His approach emphasizes identifying the underlying causes of pain through careful evaluation and advanced diagnostic techniques. Dr. Grossinger's osteopathic training gives him particular insight into musculoskeletal and neurological conditions that many patients struggle with for years before finding effective treatment.

Jeffrey R. Conly, M.D. serves Lancaster, PA and surrounding communities with specialized pain management services focused on restoring patient mobility and independence. As a board-certified specialist in both pain management and physical medicine and rehabilitation, Dr. Conly brings extensive expertise to patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. His practice emphasizes comprehensive evaluation and personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain while minimizing reliance on medication alone.

Dr. Conly's practice offers advanced interventional pain management techniques including:

  • Spinal injections for targeted pain relief

  • Discography for precise diagnosis of disc-related pain

  • Spinal cord stimulation for chronic pain management

  • Comprehensive rehabilitation protocols

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Dr. Conly's practice is his commitment to functional improvement. Rather than simply masking symptoms, his treatment philosophy centers on helping patients regain their ability to perform daily activities and achieve greater independence. This approach combines cutting-edge interventional techniques with rehabilitation strategies tailored to each patient's specific needs and goals.

Professional Qualifications

With dual board certifications in pain management and physical medicine and rehabilitation, Dr. Conly possesses the specialized training necessary to address complex pain conditions. His advanced training in techniques such as discography and spinal cord stimulation allows him to offer patients innovative solutions when conventional treatments have failed.

WellSpan Pain Management Center in Ephrata, Pennsylvania offers comprehensive pain management services to residents throughout Lancaster County and surrounding areas. Specializing in both acute and chronic pain conditions, our center combines evidence-based medical treatments with integrative approaches to help patients regain control of their lives. Our team of board-certified pain specialists works closely with each patient to develop personalized treatment plans that address the physical, emotional, and psychological aspects of pain management.

At WellSpan Pain Management Center, we provide a wide range of interventional and non-interventional pain management solutions. Our services include diagnostic evaluations, medication management, nerve blocks, epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and physical therapy referrals. We treat conditions such as back and neck pain, arthritis, fibromyalgia, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

Our multidisciplinary team believes in treating the whole person, not just the pain. We take time to understand each patient's unique circumstances, medical history, and pain experience to create effective treatment strategies that improve quality of life and functionality. Our goal is to reduce reliance on opioid medications when possible by offering alternative and complementary therapies that address pain at its source.

Facility Information

Located at 4150 Barrett Blvd, Ephrata, PA 17522, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology for accurate diagnosis and treatment. We're easily accessible from Route 222 and offer convenient parking for our patients. To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please call us at +1 717-738-6782. As part of the trusted WellSpan Health network, we maintain the highest standards of care and patient safety.

For additional information about our services or to request an appointment online, visit our website at wellspan.org/locations/wellspan-pain-management-center. Most major insurance plans are accepted, and our staff is available to assist with insurance verification and scheduling.

Oxford Valley Pain & Spine Center in Langhorne, Pennsylvania offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Bucks County and surrounding areas. Our board-certified specialists combine advanced interventional techniques with personalized care plans to address chronic pain conditions affecting the back, neck, joints, and nervous system. State-of-the-Art Facility
