column3:
UPMC Pain Management in Carlisle, Pennsylvania offers comprehensive pain management solutions through a team of highly specialized physicians dedicated to improving quality of life for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Serving the Central Pennsylvania region, our practice combines evidence-based medical interventions with personalized treatment plans to address the unique needs of each patient. With state-of-the-art facilities at our Sprint Drive location, we provide a full spectrum of pain management services in a compassionate, patient-centered environment.

At UPMC Pain Management, we offer a diverse range of interventional procedures and treatments including:

  • Epidural Injections - Cervical, thoracic, and lumbar approaches to target spinal pain

  • Radiofrequency Lesioning - Advanced technique for interrupting pain signals from damaged nerves

  • Spinal Cord Stimulation (SCS) Trials - Innovative approach for managing chronic back and limb pain

  • Joint and Soft Tissue Injections - Precisely delivered steroid treatments to reduce inflammation

  • Sympathetic Nerve Blocks - Specialized procedures for complex regional pain syndromes

  • Trigger Point Injections - Targeted relief for muscle pain and myofascial pain syndromes

Our Approach to Pain Management

Our board-certified physicians employ a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, combining interventional procedures with comprehensive care strategies. We understand that pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we work closely with each patient to develop customized treatment plans that address both the physical and emotional components of pain. Our goal is not just to mask symptoms but to identify and treat the underlying causes of pain whenever possible.

Visit Our Carlisle Location

Located at 19 Sprint Dr #2, Carlisle, PA 17015, our modern facility is equipped with the latest diagnostic and treatment technologies. We welcome new patients and referrals from throughout the Central Pennsylvania region. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (717) 218-1861 or visit our website at www.upmc.com/services/pain-management/locations/central-pa/carlisle.
column11: UPMC Pain Management is a leading group of pain management physicians in Carlisle, Pennsylvania. Our services include epidurals (cervical, thoracic, and lumbar), radiofrequency lesioning of painful nerves, Spinal Cord Stimulation (SCS) trials, steroid shots to the joints and soft tissues, sympathetic nerve blocks, and trigger point injections. For more information, please visit our website.

Today on the other hand I felt bad for them as an ignorant patient caused a ruckus, do these patients realize it is thee Doctors office and they cannot tell him what they want. If you are going to be snotty then you should  go somewhere else.|This place is a joke. Let me rephrase that, the doctor here is a joke. I bring papers in from an orthopedic spine doctor with my diagnosis of arthritis and degenerative disc disease and the doctor told me and I quote "No no no you are too young for this, you don't have that it's just your nerves, those other doctors don't know anything so they just give you a diagnosis so they can send you here." I then ask him if he would like to speak with the orthopedic spine doctor who took the imaging and gave me the diagnosis and to take a look at the disc of my x-rays, cat scan and mri and he tells me no that he knows whats wrong already without even examining me. The ladies who work here are very nice, but that's about it. Id rather pay hundreds out of pocket then to go here again.|I had been going to Dr. Moin Mallhi for quite a few years. Last year in January I was in a head on car accident and my car insurance policy covered $5,000 for my medical expenses. Because I had a brain tumor removed 3 years ago as well as had a back surgery 30 years ago I had to go to the ER for a CAT SCAN of my brain immediately after the accident and then that following week had to go for an MRI of my back. I was told by my PCP to go to a chiropractor for my pain. I began seeing a chiropractor 3 times a week and was in quite a bit of pain. I decided not to get Dr. Moin involved during that time due to being worried that my insurance would go over the $5,000 and I would then be responsible for paying him should that happen. Finally I started to see Dr. Moin Mallhi again once I stopped seeing the chiropractor. However he stopped prescribing one of my medications and because he prescribed so many medications I did not immediately notice. Once I noticed I called the office and spoke to Deidre and told her to ask him why. She kept telling me that I had not gotten that medication since January and that I should have asked him when I saw him in the office. After I had seen him the first couple of times in the office they started doing phone appointments due to COVID and when I'd ask then I never could get an answer either. Whenever I called and spoke to Deidre she would get really snappy at me and treat me as though I was a drug addict or something. This medications was Xanax of which I was prescribed to take twice a day but I only would take 1 a day if I didn't need 2 so I had enough left to take them on a daily basis up until a few months prior to questions of her the reason why! All I wanted was a reason because all of the other meds he prescribed for me were still being refilled. When I spoke to her and she could never get me an answer I became emphatic and spoke to her emphatically she accused me of yelling and screaming at her and told the doctor that I was being disrespectful to her. So no sooner does this happen and I get a letter in the mail from the office saying I've been discharged as a patient and I had mentioned to her that doctors should not cut people off completely from that type of medication because they'll have withdrawl symptoms. So in the letter it states that I was given a one month supply of my medications to taper off but I wasn't. I'm going to report this Dr. because patients shouldn't be treated this way! I had called that office for months in a row seeking an answer and never got one. It was right before Christmas and my mom had passed away last year and I was ready for a nervous break down and I just needed the medication even temporarily to get me through those holidays. I was crying my eyes out day after day not knowing which way to turn and I think part of it was the withdrawals from the medication on top of my deep depression. Pain management doctors should not treat people this way he's got plenty of patients going there because he takes Medicaid so I guess I'm just another number that he could throw in his garbage can. The other thing is he pushes for shots shots shots in your back and the shots don't even help the pain but he gets paid more money for giving them so he try's to talk everyone into getting shots. He could have at least gave me a valid reason! And the girls who work for him need to learn to be professional! This Deidre is very cocky and shows absolutely no empathy for people in pain! She practically insinuated that I must have been getting them off the streets because I didn't question it sooner! I told her I would never buy drugs off the street and if I had a dealer why would I be calling her! As a receptionist she shouldn't even be talking to me about my private health record!!! This place is really screwed up! Stay away!|It took 2 hrs after my appt time to be seen. Then the doctor came in, said he wouldn't give me medication but would do nerve blocks (Inn a series up entire side of my back. Never asked to look at previous MRI's, CT scans or Xrays. When I asked if he needed notes from my previous doctors he said no its not needed. He did tell me that both of my back surgeries that were done were not necessary. I said so ur telling me that Dr Joseph Maroon (the Pittsburgh Steelers Neauro surgeon) did a back surgery PRO BONO that was not needed and he told me if i did not do the surgery I would not be walking within a year. And then the doctor in Vegas who did my fusion also did the fusion PRO BONO did it for no good reason? When the insurance I had then only covered the hospital facilities? Yeah I don't think so. I will NOT be going back to this "doctor" ever again. Ill drive to Harrisburg if I need for my pain management.|The staff here are the nicest I've had at any Dr.'s office they make you feel like your their top priority even when their busy|I   had  a  appointment  at   9-20 am   today   I  think   so  did  20  other  people.  was   taken  into   examine  room  at  9 30.   nurse  said   he   be   right  in.   I   sat  the   2  hours  and  then   went   to   front   desk   and   said   I  would   have   to   reschudle   they   say   when   you   want   to   come   in  again.   I  say  I   call   you!!!!!!!!!!!!    worst   run   business that  I   was   ever  in.    I   WOULD   NEVER   GO   BACK   THERE   AGAIN|Our house burned down and we lost EVERYTHING. Red Cross called to make arrangements to replace my scripts. When we got there "Michelle" claimed that the Red Cross never called, when it was clearly documented they had been trying to call FOR DAYS. "Michelle" continued to delay, give me an attitude and then told the doctor that I was "misbehaving." I've been a patient for 4 years. The doctor then refused to treat my pain completely. I have never in my life encountered such inhumane, incompetent and reductive people in my entire life. I've listened to staff and patients alike complain about this woman every single time I go. I couldn't recommend to my worst enemy.

column3:
Valley Pain Specialists PC serves Bethlehem, PA and surrounding communities throughout the Lehigh Valley with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians specializes in treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Since our founding, we have been committed to improving quality of life for those suffering from persistent pain through minimally invasive techniques and multidisciplinary care plans.

Our Specialized Services

At Valley Pain Specialists, we offer a wide range of treatments including interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy coordination, and advanced diagnostic services. Our expertise extends to treating conditions such as back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. We pride ourselves on staying at the forefront of pain management technology while maintaining a compassionate, patient-centered approach.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Our modern facility at 4250 Fritch Dr, Bethlehem, PA 18020 is equipped with the latest diagnostic and treatment technology. We've designed our clinic to provide a comfortable, healing environment where patients can receive the highest standard of care. Our convenient location makes us accessible to patients throughout the Lehigh Valley region.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets Valley Pain Specialists apart is our commitment to personalized care. We take the time to listen to each patient's concerns, thoroughly evaluate their condition, and develop customized treatment plans that address both the symptoms and underlying causes of their pain. Our goal is not just to manage pain but to help patients regain function and improve their overall quality of life.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit our website at [http://valleypainspecialists.com/](http://valleypainspecialists.com/) or call us at +1 610-954-9040.
column38: Barry OCallahan|Jairo Suarez|Victoria Picard|Dawn Deremer|Natascha Peaser|Emily Anne Thomson|G-MAN|Annette
column40:
I like to wait until I've had several visits with any Doctor, restaurants, hotels etc before I write my reviews.

With that said, before going here, like most people I read their reviews and read a lot of negative reviews about everyone from the staff, nurses and Dr. M. And me personally, I don't get it, since the day/minute I walked through their doors I've been met with kindness, Professionalism and respect. I realize that everyone's situation is different. Now I have a TON of issues that cause me insurmountable pain from 13 surgeries, most of which have been spinal surgeries including 2 to 3 failed fusions. My average pain levels are between 8-12 ( I know 10 is max, just making my point )

EVERYONE from the ladies at the front desk, scheduling, surgery center check in to the nurses in the back, especially Cory who took time out of her very busy day to talk to me in depth about one of my issues that are new which she was very Knowledgeable about, I am more grateful to her than she knows ( until now )

As far as the NP's, the 1st one I met was incredibly helpful, took the time to talk to me at length, went over my MRI's with me and discussed my concerns and options. Although she is no longer there my new one is just as nice, Knowledgeable who took the time to collaborate with me. I loved that neither of them have been in a rush. Keep in mind that, like I said, I have a TON of very, VERY painful problems which unfortunately have ruined my life and will interfere with my everyday activities ( I can barely take out the garbage and if I do I pretty much suffer for days )

In the grand old saying goes, I'm saving the best for last. In reference to Dr. M is concerned in my experience with him has been nothing but positive every time I've seen and talked to him. In the past every time I've needed injections the doctors I've seen preferred to put their patients under anesthesia so I was obviously a little bit apprehensive getting them without it, From the VERY MOMENT walk into the surgical room he makes me feel comfortable and has been personable, not in a rush and explained everything he was doing as he was doing it, he has a different approach to the infections than the others which, in my opinion works BETTER than all of the others. Now I've read too many negative reviews about his personality but every time we speak it's been nothing but positive both professionally and personally,

All I can say is that I'm glad I decided to go with them/him than the other places which are closer to home, the extra long drive is definitely worth it. People need to understand that in order to get respect you have to give respect. I would definitely recommend them/him to anyone who needs help as I know just as much as anyone what it's like to live in CONSTANT, horrible pain that leaves me in a fetal position a lot of the time, especially after any kind of activities.

This is an HONEST opinion because trust me, if I was unsatisfied with them/him or had any complaints I would let everyone know, I just don't have any.|They are serious with there rule about there meds like every other place i being here for the last at least minimum 6 years and they are not perfect but they try there's best  for me. ,, or in other case  there patients cause my Doctor she always ready to cooperate with me in a fare way always respecting the rules and professionalism..

If you  guys add a anesthesiology Team  will be the best in the valley small procedure when you are awake they feel painful. Imagine free of that discomfort,  and painful needle, we be niceeeee..
Just something to think..

Thanks you Team Valley Pain Specialist|It is my patient right to meet and discuss issues with my treating physician, yet staff gave me a flat out "No." when I asked to meet with the physician. Absolutely horrible office staff with VERY cocky attitude. 3 injections and $145 dollars later and I'm still in the same pain as when started. I should be able to inquire with my doctor, yet staff refuses to schedule me with him, saying they dont do that. They only schedule with PA. Changing to LVPG Pain.|Dr. M. is the absolute best. He saved me. I have been going to him for many years and would not go anywhere else. He is so knowledgeable on pain management and he and his team have always had my best interest at heart. Thank you  Dawn DeRemer|I called today and the lady was beyond rude. I have a referral that was sent in for another pain clinic, and it's been 2 weeks and still nothing so doctor asked me to call them. She was very short with me, had attitude, and hung up phone loudly. I just want to be seen and even they want all this stuff that I don't have. I guess I'll keep waiting, as even from the reviews and now my phone call they were absolutely rude.|So glad I read the reviews before scheduling. The reviews of this office have confirmed exactly what I have been trying to avoid with regard to my pain management. This place sounds bad- I know I can't speak from personal experience for this care team but as someone who struggles with a chronic life shortening illness and a lot of pain- I have seen my fair share of doctors and providers in my life and pain is nearly always an insanely touchy subject, when it does not have to be. No one should have to suffer or feel like an addict/crazy for asking to receive certain treatments or medications. Self advocacy is incredibly important. Don't settle , don't give up !|I went to valley pain specialists about 3 weeks ago it was a consultation and the thing was I didn't have my MRI because my doctor spoke to him over the phone I thought everything was set so he says I can't write any pain meds until I see an MRI and go over the disc and so I got it just 2 days ago they called me up and said come up everything's taken care of we got your results I go there this morning guess what it's not there they can't see me they told me I should stay on Suboxone I said the Suboxone makes me jittery and it doesn't do much for the pain she said okay when you come in next week we'll discuss that but once I have the disc in my hand so everything they say it's not true they back step a lot and they got me going crazy I'm done very arrogant doctor and they have no organization|I've been going to Valley pain specialist a little over a year and very comfortable with my doctor that I could communicate with effectively. Rachel left and for some reason I felt uncomfortable with the new doctor telling me I had to get a spinal shot that I wasn't comfortable with and refused. Soon after I received notification that I violated and would not receive pain meds,, first and foremost I have a right to refuse services or medication my main goal is to get well not become a junkie, I was being treated for a disabling condition and my pain is real but they'll never know until you take the mile in my shoes. Simply horrible experience!

Pain Medicine of Evangelical serves Lewisburg, PA and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized medical practice is dedicated to helping patients find relief from chronic and acute pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. Located conveniently on Westbranch Highway, our clinic combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to improve quality of life for those suffering from debilitating pain.

At Pain Medicine of Evangelical, our board-certified physicians offer a wide range of interventional and non-interventional pain management treatments. We address various conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, cancer-related pain, and post-surgical pain. Our multidisciplinary approach may include medication management, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary therapies tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Patient-Centered Approach

Our team works closely with your primary care physician and other specialists to ensure coordinated care. We emphasize education, empowering patients to take an active role in their pain management journey.

Facility and Accessibility

Our modern facility at 7095 Westbranch Hwy, Suite 1400 in Lewisburg is designed with patient comfort in mind. As part of the respected Evangelical Hospital network, we maintain the highest standards of medical excellence while providing a welcoming environment. Contact Information

You can also visit our website at https://www.evanhospital.com/ for additional information about our providers, treatments, and patient resources. We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to making quality pain management accessible to all who need it.

Pain Management Physicians serves Wyomissing, PA as a premier comprehensive pain management clinic dedicated to providing relief through innovative treatments and compassionate care. Our team of specialized physicians combines years of clinical expertise with cutting-edge therapies to address chronic and acute pain conditions that impact quality of life. We understand that pain is not just a physical sensation but affects emotional wellbeing and daily functioning, which is why we take a holistic approach to treatment.

At our state-of-the-art facility, we offer a comprehensive range of interventional procedures including:

  • Stem Cell Therapy - Harnessing the body's natural healing abilities

  • Platelet Rich Plasma (PRP) - Accelerating tissue repair and regeneration

  • Spinal Cord Stimulation - Providing relief for persistent back and limb pain

  • Radiofrequency Ablation (RFA) - Targeting nerve tissue to reduce pain signals

  • Specialized Nerve Blocks - Addressing specific neck and back pain conditions

Our Philosophy

The physicians and staff at Pain Management Physicians believe in a multidisciplinary approach to treating pain. Our primary goals are to help patients achieve the highest level of functionality while providing care in a supportive environment. Patient-Centered Care

Our convenient location at 2201 Ridgewood Rd, Suite 200 in Wyomissing provides a comfortable setting for your pain management journey.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (610) 549-1244 or visit our website at www.painmanagement-physicians.com/locations/wyomissing-pa.html.

This has to be the absolute worst office that I have ever seen my 73-year-old mother who is in pain that's why she is there for her first appointment was made to sit there for three hours. They don't do anything to help her. They just keep giving her injections that don't work or that end up, causing her pain that she has to go to the hospital to get her pain managed.
It's absolutely ridiculous and there is no reason why every single time she has to sit. Her last appointment was at 11:50. She was there at 11:35 was made to sit there until 1:15 She finally has had enough and she will no longer go there she'd rather go to Tower health Pain Management or Comprehensive Pain Management
In my opinion, giving them one star is too much there should be an option to give zero stars|My drs there are amazing!! Dr Brian Lockheart is awsome he saved me from constant pain I can't thank him enough!|I don't feel as if Dr listens to you. And office smells bad like a bunch of cats are walking around.|On my first consultation visit with Dr Eric Ratner, the waiting room was packed (during COVID-19) and I waited almost 2 hours to see him. I was on time for my appointment. I figured there must have been something odd happening to cause such a delay.      On the day of my surgery procedure, he was running 1.5 hours behind.   When I was finally wheeled into the OR, I found him on his phone playing on social media.   Then he continued to delay my procedure while chatting with the staff in the OR for another 5 minutes.    Two weeks later I go to his office for my follow up appointment & again I showed up on time.     The waiting room was packed again, I checked in, & paid my co-pay.  I was then informed that Dr. Ratner was not there, they had no idea when he would be in,  there were 3 people waiting ahead of me, & I was told he was always late.     This explains the long wait for my first visit and the day of my procedure.          I refused to see him, cancelled my appointment, and get my copay refunded.        The level of unprofessionalism and blatant lack of consideration for his patients is inexcusable.    I have never experienced this kind of behavior with a medical professional in my life.  I will not tolerate it and you should not either.   There is nothing Dr Ratner did for me that any other pain management doctor could not do.   I hope you find this review helpful in your decision for choosing against seeing Dr. Eric Ratner .|Regarding Dr. Eric Ratner only: Blatant disregard for other people's time. I was on time; he was NOT EVEN IN THE BUILDING. Not a little late, either--sauntered into the office 55 minutes after my appointment time (numerous people were scheduled before me, also waiting). Literally watched him park his car and walk in the building, his food order in hand. Props to the husband of another patient who was waiting in the parking lot. He called Dr. Ratner out on his lateness. No apology or acknowledgment of 1.5 hour wait time once I finally saw him. Staff was trying to make up for his behavior by processing people as quickly as possible. Flagrant disrespect for his patients.|I have been a patient of Dr. Ratner for years. He is the most caring and compassionate Doctor I have ever met!!! I trust him completely and although sometimes the wait to see him is longer at times for me it just shows that he listens to his patients and makes sure every question and concern is answered.|We absolutely love Dr Ratner. He helped me out for many years and now it is my husbands turn. Only the best for us|Dr. Eric Ratner is in my opinion the best that ever did this. His professionalism coupled with his down to earth, friendly pre-op manner is unmatched by any other specialist that I ever saw. I trust him completely, which is why I would recommend  him to family or friend. Definitely 5 stars for him and his staff

column2: West Penn Institute for Pain Medicine
column3:
West Penn Institute for Pain Medicine in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania offers comprehensive pain management services as part of the Allegheny Health Network. Located in the heart of the city's Bloomfield neighborhood, our specialized medical facility combines advanced diagnostic capabilities with innovative treatment approaches to address acute and chronic pain conditions. Our team of board-certified pain specialists utilizes evidence-based protocols to develop personalized care plans that focus on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

At West Penn Institute for Pain Medicine, we provide a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that includes interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy coordination, and psychological support. Our specialists are experienced in treating various pain conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint and musculoskeletal pain

  • Neuropathic pain disorders

  • Cancer-related pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-surgical pain

State-of-the-Art Facilities

Our modern facility at 5124 Liberty Ave is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies that allow our team to deliver precise, targeted interventions. We offer fluoroscopy-guided procedures, ultrasound-assisted techniques, and specialized nerve blocks in a comfortable, patient-centered environment.

Patient Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at (412) 315-3800. New patients can also find detailed information and access our referral forms through the Allegheny Health Network website at www.ahn.org/locations.html. Our office is conveniently located with accessible parking options for patients visiting from throughout Western Pennsylvania.

As part of the Allegheny Health Network, we coordinate seamlessly with other medical specialists to ensure comprehensive care that addresses all aspects of our patients' health and wellbeing.

Same thing for acupuncture therapy. They promise so many treatments for free, but they refuse to deliver on that promise. The cost is better for getting your license, but I'm not sure it's worth the savings to be anchored to this office for pain-management. If this is all you need for your pain management, then save some money on your license, but if you want honest pain-management services, keep looking. They make it hard to switch doctors, so I wish someone had warned me first. The real salt in the wounds here is that this trouble is because of the controls on opioids, and I'm allergic, so --.|Literally the worst experience I've ever had with any health provider.  They did absolutely nothing to help treat my pain and scheduled my procedure out a month after my visit because the doctor was going on vacation. Low and behold, my back pain got much worse and now I have to get surgery because they couldn't be bothered referring me to another doctor or help me in any way.  If you're referred to this facility by any doctor, seriously consider finding a better pain clinic.|Dr Till Conermann is by far the WORST doctor I have ever seen in my life. He does not listen to his patients. I moved to Pittsburgh for a job and had my records transferred from my old clinic in another state. During my first appointment he called me a liar because he did not click in the right place in the Prescription Monitoring Database. I did not want to agree to his treatment plan but felt my hands were tied so I said I would try it. My life has become a living hell. I am afraid I am going to lose my job because most days I can barely get out of bed. I told him all of this during a follow up visit and he couldn't have been less interested. Doctors take an oath to "do no harm" yet that is exactly what he has done to my body and my life. I have already contacted my insurance company to file a grievance, plan to contact CMS to file a complaint and am contacting a lawyer. Do NOT go to this doctor, he has harmed me in ways that have left me wanting to die.
If any other patients would like to join together to file a lawsuit against him, please reach out to me. I refuse to be treated this way. I had been on the same regimen for years and he did not care. He needs to lose his medical license, and I am going to make sure that happens.|I've been a patient at this facility now for about 15 years - If I were to rate this facility 1-2 yrs ago, I would have rated them 5stars, however, over the last 7/8 months- the overall service has severely deteriorated. The administrative staff has been unfriendly, unwilling to go above and beyond what their job description is, and the environment has become uninviting.  Recently the fellows that come in prior to the dr are no longer even cordial. In the past I valued my doctor, I believed he was genuinely concerned, he has always been patient, kind, and caring.  Even he has changed with this whole opioid epidemic that has taken place in the media, I feel like he doesn't have my best interest at heart anymore, Why does he bother asking me how I'm feeling? When clearly it doesn't matter, he's just interested in following protocol... I feel like I don't even have him to turn to when I have concerns about my pain...... it's sad|Everyone is so kind and courteous here.  I actually enjoy my visits here and I highly recommend Dr. Kabese treats me as if he truly cares about my pain.  Typically spinal cord injections take less than an hour from start to finish.

column2: Penn Highlands Interventional Pain Center - St. Marys
column3:
Penn Highlands Interventional Pain Center - St. Marys serves patients throughout St. Marys, Pennsylvania and surrounding Elk County communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. As part of the respected Penn Highlands Healthcare network, this specialized center combines advanced interventional techniques with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. The dedicated team of board-certified pain specialists utilizes evidence-based approaches to develop personalized treatment plans that improve quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

The center offers a wide range of interventional procedures including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and joint injections. Patients suffering from conditions such as back pain, neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain can find relief through these targeted therapies. Each treatment plan is customized to address the specific needs and goals of the individual patient.

Patient-Centered Approach

At Penn Highlands Interventional Pain Center, patients benefit from a multidisciplinary approach that may incorporate physical therapy, medication management, and interventional procedures. The clinical team works closely with primary care physicians and other specialists to ensure coordinated care. New patients receive comprehensive evaluations to identify pain sources and develop effective management strategies that focus on improving function and reducing suffering.

Location and Accessibility

Conveniently located at 761 Johnsonburg Rd, Suite 310, St Marys, PA 15857, the center provides a comfortable, modern facility equipped with state-of-the-art technology. Patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 814-788-8577. The center accepts most major insurance plans and works with patients to navigate coverage options for specialized pain procedures.

Part of a Trusted Healthcare Network

As a service of Penn Highlands DuBois, the Interventional Pain Center benefits from the resources and expertise of the broader Penn Highlands Healthcare system. This connection ensures patients have access to additional specialty services when needed. For more information about services, providers, or to request an appointment, visit their website at www.phhealthcare.org.

column40: Very good experience Dr Beth is professional Adm assist Bob very professional; clean office; don't have to wait long for appt ; very pleased so far;  hoping this knee injection works I've had 2/5 Gen-visc injections. column38: Aaron S|Neil Touchet|Teri Garman|Beverly Kreman|Dianne Stein|Rosalind Weiss|Holly Socolow|Kathleen Gibson
column40:
I had a great experience!
It started before I even entered the office, the call to schedule based on the referral was exactly as you could hope it would be.

When I arrived I was met by Kay, I don't want to minimize how wonderful the entire team was as they were all great but Kay was amazing! She was kind, compassionate and friendly. She has the perfect personality for working in an area where people are hurting and I cannot say enough nice things about her.

The rest of my appointment went well and I was happy with how I was treated by the entire staff I came into contact with.

I will say, I was not taken back exactly on time, but I also didn't feel rushed during my appointment, I felt listened to. While of course we all wish everything ran like clock work, I will take a delay in being seen knowing that it is because the staff is listening to others the same way they will be listening to me once they arrive in my room and that is not something you can consistently schedule accurately for.

This was a 5 star visit and I am happy I was referred here for my care.|I had hopes of gaining some relief from chronic pain. The PA-C, David Hallock, comes in the exam room and the first thing out of his mouth is "You know we only do injections here." Well no, I did not know that or I would not have wasted my time and energy on an appointment. This is not what their web page indicates. He simply blew me off and said come back when you are ready for an epidural. This guy had zero bedside manner and exhibited no concern for my issues. It goes without saying that I will not be going back to this so called "Pain Management Center". What a joke!|I had EMG testing done April of 2023. I'm STILL waiting for them to send my Dr the results!!!! They were contacted NUMEROUS times by my Dr, myself and my pcp!! The answer I got finally after a year was, I'm sorry you must've gotten out of our radar. Well as of today, they're "still looking for them". So no, I'm not giving a good review. I'm waiting for answers??|I love this place, if you have pain and you want relief go see Dr. Brawn, he is the best, so kind, caring and the best.
Jill at the reception desk and the nurses Robin and Darlene that are with you are totally awesome so kind, caring and knowledgeable.
This place is so clean and up to date medical equipment .|This is a money hungry practice with little regard for what a patient needs.  The wife of Dr. Momin is greedy and nasty and extremely rude!  She puts her nose into business where it doesn't belong!  I wonder if the rest of the docs there know how Mrs Momin speaks to their patients.  It's so very very sad that this practice puts money above all else!  I don't recommend this practice to anyone, go to OSS instead for real care and docs who care!|This practice does not know what the Hippocratic oath means in regard to the welfare of patients with serious issues. Seem to be more interested in $$$$ and fast payments from insurance companies. Would NEVER go to this practice.|I have always felt well cared for at this facility. They go above and beyond to accommodate my scheduling needs and provide excellent care.|First I'd like to say how wonderful the nurses and office staff were. My physician was an hour and a half late, and they checked on me to make sure I was okay.

The doctor, on the other hand, a Dr. Momin, was an absolute horror. After coming in to the room, calling me the wrong name and not acknowledging his lateness, he began asking me the usual questions. Speaking to me, of course, as if I were three years old. After making my condition seem a mere side note, not really that important, I began to cry. Nothing quite brings the tears out like being degraded about something you can't control. Ignoring my crying, the physician continues talking at me, making sure to add the quip, "I hope you're listening to me".

So I left. Being a pompous, arrogant doctor wanna-be? No one needs that. Shame on you.

column38: Kim Snyder|vanessa issaka|Crystal Goode|Clifford Houck|Amy Hollinger|Barbara Buck|Jamie Sanders|Charlotte "Charli" Haines
column40:
I have been a patient of Dr. Lorenzo for many years!  He is "The Best"!  He is compassionate, very thorough, always takes the time to explain my medical concerns, gives helpful information, suggests different procedures or things to do that will help alleviate my pain.  He explains simply and in a way that you can understand by using a model of the backbone or drawing his own illustrations.  Theresa, Office Manager and the entire staff are always friendly, helpful and personable!  It means a lot to me when you go into an office and see the staff with a smile on their face!  THANK YOU, Dr. Lorenzo and staff!!!|I would NOT recommend this office if you have been taking pain medication for a long time and want him to continue them. I was taking them for a long time and I had had surgery a few months ago , I had left over pain mediation . My family Dr. Retired , and I had no more pain medication so I took my old meds.  He told me it was illegal and I am not to take them and would not prescribe me anything.  It was MY OWN medication.  Then said I have to have clean urine when I came back in two weeks for my 2nd visit.  I told him it won't happen bc I'm not going without meds for my back.  I'll be in bed and not be able to move. I will continue to take my own meds.  He refused to see me bc of that.  He is awful and shouldn't be practicing.|I do not understand the negative reviews. I went to Dr. Lorenzo as a last ditch effort. I had completely given up and I had no faith that he could help me. But he gave me my life back. He has done procedures and prescribed medication that make life worth living again after over twenty years of pain. It's not perfect, but it is an improvement that allowed me to go back to work and find joy in life. He is kind, compassionate, gentle, respectful and reasonable. He always has a solution for every problem. He never once even came close to raising his voice to me. The girls in the office are also wonderful. Yes, the office gets busy and it is sometimes hard to communicate, but that happens everywhere, and you just have to be patient and respectful. This office has truly been a life saver for me. Thank you guys for taking such good care of me!|After being told my math doesn't add up, a 90 day x 2 or every eight hours 73 days later I was told I still had two days left. I was not able to come up with two days and told to go home. That was my help with pain management.|I do not understand all the negative reviews. I have been going here now for a year and my mom was going for 2 years I think. They both have taken the time to listen and help. I have had several injections in my cervical and lumbar, both have had nerves burned as well. I was nervous but they made me feel relaxed and I trust them with all my being. My pain will never go away but any relief will help to a little more quality of life so I can spend time with my kids. I have not had any problems with urine tests, getting tests done or with my medications. I appreciate all they have done and are doing to try to help me, the staff has always been very pleasant too. Im sure it helps that even though I am in so much pain I also try to be calm, pleasant and patient with them as well. I take time to listen to them as well, im sure that helps make their day easier. When I go for my procedures Dr L is always kind, joking and calm with me. As for me I feel he is better then any drs I had seen for my pain prior to them and I really dont want to see any other again. Thank you for your service!! Keep up the good work!!|I had been a patient of Dr. Lorenzo for approx. one year and completely agree with Charlotte Haines' previous review. I had had a series of injections for chronic back pain. When Dr. Lorenzo exhausted, what he felt to be, the extent of his treatments with only minor improvement that was short lived, he was professional and honest when he suggested that I be evaluated by another doctor. The status of my spinal problems was (and is) varied and complicated. Details of same will not serve a purpose in this review since the reason for the review is to emphasize the professionalism, caring, courtesy and knowledge were THE BEST OF ALL OTHER DOCTORS  I had seen for the past several years.  He took the time and effort to study all previous test results & possible treatment options in detail, in my presence. I never once found him (or his staff)to be rude, discourteous, uncaring and certainly never heard him "yell" or "scream".  Now, after I completely recover from a laminectomy and 5 fusions, I am planning to go back to Dr. Lorenzo.  I do not have false expections of being pain free but I have confidence that he will get me another step closer with periodic, targeted injections as suggested by my surgeon.|I read a review on here that's almost the exact issue I had, so it really makes me angry and upset. I've been on an opioid since 2015. I'm a registered nurse with chronic back and neck issues, and fibromyalgia. I was diagnosed with cancer a few months after starting the opioid, and chemo made everything so much worse. I'm cancer free, but I never got back to my baseline in regards to pain. My family physician then decided to farm me out to the pain clinic because he now doesn't manage opioids...sound familiar?
Dr. Lorenzo did nerve blocks to both sides of my lumbar spine...I felt no different after it was done at all. I then ended up in Kristi's care to manage the pain medication. I was first on Percocet, but after a couple years of taking it, I found it to be ineffective about an hour or 2 after taking it, if at all. She berated me because I had taken my last Percocet the night before my appt, so it wasn't in my system, like I was some addict or was selling it on the street. I had to request going on a long acting pain med instead so I don't have the issue of it not lasting, which she agreed. I really don't understand why it wasn't suggested by her to begin with...there's less of a chance of abuse for patients and it's continuous coverage, but I'm not a pain "specialist"...
So, I've been on the lowest dose of morphine ER since then. It works well enough for me to function...of course it doesn't take the pain away completely, but it's more tolerable. Several months ago, I thought I'd try CBD oil to see if I got any relief from that too, or if it would at least help me sleep at night. I discussed it with Kristi and she was fine with it. She had even stated that if I came up positive on a urine, then we'll know why and it's already documented. There are so many different CBD products out there, so I tried one and my drug screen was negative, but it really didn't seem to help at all. I thought I'd try a different product, and although it really didn't do anything for pain, it really helped with sleep (and anxiety), so I used it for almost 3 months (my tests were random and one month fell during vacation). That's when the issues started with the drug screens. I came up with a very low positive on my drug screen on Oct 1. She told me I couldn't use the CBD anymore, so I stopped it, but I was still positive Oct. 31. She basically accused me of "doing street drugs", and stated she would have to discharge me if I came up positive again. I had no answers for her. I don't doubt the first positive possibly from the CBD oil- that was a mistake to try, but I  have done ABSOLUTELY NOTHING that has ANY potential risk for me to come up positive again for THC, and I'm talking a really conscious effort! In no way would I risk losing the one med that keeps me functional, but she told me I had a really low positive again at the next visit, and I actually demanded to see the results, which she was completely rude and condescending about. She discharged me with nothing but the 5 days of morphine ER I had left, and then tells me to wean off of it, and I shouldn't have a problem...really?!!!
I saw at least one other review like this, and it makes me wonder. On one of those visits, there were THREE other urine specimens in the little cubby when I put mine in it that day (I frequently find at least one in there, but 3?! Oh, and the waiting room was completely empty, so I can imagine how long they were there). Doesn't that allow the chance of someone tampering or switching something, or even employee error? What I CAN say is that I have never felt more like a dreg of society.
UPDATE: I switched to HMC's family practice just after this in Jan. They felt I was misdiagnosed (and how was I given a dx. of spinal spondylosis without  diagnostics? My back was fine, and my drug test was completely clean! I have an autoimmune disorder of some type (tbd), so I started Methotrexate...what a difference! I'm on Methadone 2.5mg twice daily instead of the Morphine ER 15 mg and it's the best I've been since even before cancer!|I can not understand the negative reviews. He is the BEST when it comes to problem solving and unlike other pain management Doctors, he doesn't say, there is nothing more I can do like the others I've seen. He keeps trying to problem solve!! I won't go anywhere else and I live at least 45 minutes from his office, instead of those nearer to my home in Lancaster.
I forgot to address the comments towards Dr. Lorenzo's attitude...OMG.. MEAN?!! REALLY?!! This man is soft spoken caring and has a very kind bedside manner, meaning all my visits, he is nothing but I described anove!!

column36: 8 a.m.-4 p.m.|8 a.m.-4 p.m.|8 a.m.-4 p.m.|8 a.m.-4 p.m.|8 a.m.-4 p.m.|Closed|Closed
column38: Daniel N|Raysa Michelle|Lisa Stoltzfus|Kelly Murphy|Cristy Bernhard|George Johnson|Crystal Charles|Israel Pagan
column40:
After Dr Vanetesse and several other doctors left my treatment was taken over by Dr Philip Kim. He recommended intracept procedure, yet I was told by 2 ortho surgeons and another pain mgmt doctor that I did not have Modic changes so this procedure would not benefit me. He refused other procedures recommended by my very experienced ortho surgeon. I would avoid this place if you are not stuck here by Workers Comp.|If 0 stars was an option that is the rating I would give this place. I called to schedule an EMG and was scheduled, I filled all the paperwork. When I arrived I was told there was no way I could have been scheduled for an EMG as the doctor who does them left over a year ago. They thought my appointment was to refer me to get an EMG. Which is baffling given that my primary doctor sent them a referral to do the EMG which is the whole reason I scheduled the test with them. There was no empathy or acknowledgement of inconvenience towards me for wasting time from work and traveling there for literally nothing! I am not known for leaving negative reviews but this horrendous experience cannot go silent and if you are trying to schedule an EMG I'll save you time. Go anywhere else but here.|I had been seeing Dr. Fishman for >1 yr w/no complaints. I've had 7 spinal surgeries that have left me with chronic mod-severe pain. We were waiting on my SSDI application result & the plan was for me to remain on Oxycodone until SSDI was approved, & then I could on Medicare & get a pain pump inserted.
However, I became depressed/felt hopeless b/c my pain was worsening.& I told my husband I was going to OD on Tylenol, which caused an overnight stay at LGH's behavioral dept located in the ER. I saw a Psychiatristt the next morning & he cleared me for D/C.

I went to my next pain mngmt appt & saw Dr Matz who abruptly D/C'd my pain med & anxiety med that I had been taking for about 2 yrs w/o putting me on anything for withdrawal (b/c of my suicidal ideations). And,  yep-I went into withdrawal-I was so bad that I truly couldn't get out of my house, so I called my PCP & we had a video visit; my PCP gave me something for the withdrawal-I knew better than try to call the pain mngmt doctors b/c they seemed like they didn't care at all.

ALL of my UDS's always came back negative for substances, & I have NEVER been a drug seeker. Now, because they took me off of my pain meds (Dr Kim & Dr Matz were both very dismissive-acted like they didn't even want to talk to me, & offered no other treatment of any kind, like Iovera, trigger point injections, RFA's, etc),  my pain has ramped up SOOO much!!! I sit in my recliner, reclined all the way back 24/7. I can barely get around.

It's impossible to reach the Lancaster office staff directly-their phone system is absolutely convoluted. I left a message 2 wks ago at the main switchboard b/c I need to know if they are still planning on inserting a pain pump or not if my SSDI Appeal gets approved. I STILL haven't heard from anyone. I need an SSDI recommendation letter from them, but why bother calling. They obviously don't want to be bothered with me. I could always count on Dr. Fishman...but he left their practice. IF they DO bother contacting me (which I highly doubt), I may amend this review.

I just wonder if they would treat their mothers or sisters like that.

Poor care after Dr. Fishman left, & poor follow-up.|I can't say enough about this office...I've been suffering with pain (full neck fusion, Bi-lateral Shoulder replacement (twice), lower back, my list goes on). Have done everything from pain meds to physical therapy, nothing was working...until I was told about a pain pump (from Dr Marotti across the hall). I had that put in, in 2019,!my life has changed. I was able to go back to work (PT) and got a lil chunk of my life back. I appreciate Dr Kim (I've seen Fishman & Vanetessi), he's a very patient and understanding Dr, he explains everything and has a wonderful bedside manner, which means a great deal to me. He now has a nurse come to my home to fill my pump, so I no longer need to go to the office for this procedure. As for getting ahold of anyone on the phone, I never have any problem...it just takes a little time, which requires a little patience!!|Was having a wonderful experience with Dr. Fishman, until he left recently. Our specialized clinic has been serving the Warren community and surrounding areas with personalized care focused on addressing chronic pain, sports injuries, and various musculoskeletal conditions. Expert Care Team

Patient-Centered Approach

Koenigsberg & Associates Pain Management serves Philadelphia, PA and surrounding areas with specialized interventional pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of pain specialists focuses on providing relief through minimally invasive injection treatments designed to address a wide spectrum of painful conditions affecting the spine and joints. We understand that chronic pain can significantly impact your quality of life, which is why we offer comprehensive, personalized care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At Koenigsberg & Associates, we provide various advanced injection therapies including:

  • Epidural steroid injections for spinal pain
  • Joint injections for arthritis and inflammation
  • Regenerative medicine using your body's own healing products
  • Nerve blocks for targeted pain relief
  • Radiofrequency ablation for longer-term pain management

    • Conditions We Treat

    Our experienced physicians specialize in treating numerous painful conditions including:

  • Spinal stenosis
  • Herniated discs
  • Painful joints and arthritis
  • Carpal tunnel syndrome
  • Shingles-related pain (post-herpetic neuralgia)
  • Painful compression fractures of the spine
  • Sciatica and radicular pain
  • Chronic back and neck pain

    • Visit Our Philadelphia Location

    Our modern, comfortable facility is conveniently located at 2222 S Broad St, First Floor, Philadelphia, PA 19145. We welcome new patients and accept most major insurance plans.

    To schedule a consultation or learn more about our pain management solutions, call us today at +1 215-467-7212.
column11:

column3:
ADVANCED PAIN MEDICINE in Wexford, PA has been transforming lives since 2001, providing comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Pittsburgh region. Founded with a mission to deliver real answers and lasting relief for chronic pain sufferers, the practice stands apart in the field through its patient-centered approach and innovative treatment methodologies. Dr. Mark LoDico established Advanced Pain Medicine based on progressive thinking in pain management, leveraging his extensive background in anesthesia and related specialties developed through years of work at prestigious medical schools, universities, and healthcare institutions.

What distinguishes Advanced Pain Medicine from other pain management practices is their founding philosophy—a commitment to finding genuine, long-term solutions rather than temporary fixes. The team understands that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life and requires individualized treatment plans that address the root causes. Their comprehensive approach combines cutting-edge interventional procedures, medication management, and integrative therapies tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Convenient Pittsburgh-Area Locations

Recognizing the challenges that chronic pain patients face with travel and accessibility, Dr. LoDico strategically established five locations throughout the Pittsburgh metropolitan area. The Wexford office at 7000 Stonewood Drive serves as one of these convenient hubs, designed to accommodate both direct patients and those referred by other physicians. This network of locations ensures that quality pain management care remains accessible to residents across the greater Pittsburgh region.

Expert Leadership

Under Dr. LoDico's guidance, Advanced Pain Medicine has developed a reputation for excellence in treating complex pain conditions. The practice combines medical expertise with compassionate care, understanding that each patient's experience with pain is unique and deserves personalized attention. Their team of specialists works collaboratively to develop comprehensive treatment plans that improve quality of life and restore function.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit www.advancedpainmedicine.com or call +1 724-933-0300. Advanced Pain Medicine welcomes new patients at their Wexford location and continues their mission of providing hope and relief to those suffering from chronic pain conditions.

Dr. Mark LoDico founded the practice on new thinking in the field of pain management, drawing upon his considerable experience and expertise in anesthesia and related fields, working in leading medical schools, universities, hospitals and other institutions.
Understanding the needs of patients who suffer from severe pain, Dr. LoDico has opened in five strategic locations throughout the Pittsburgh area -- locations intended to be convenient to both patients and the offices of physicians who may refer patients.
column38: Debra Mackey|Stacie Hazlett|Tom Rovito|melissa borrelli|AJ Marshall|Rebecca C.|Nate Johnson|John V
column40:
You don't get a low 2.1 rating for nothing (to you people that think this place is so great). My husband's pain physician wanted him to get steroid knee injections and recommended he come here for that. I thought it was rather odd because steroid injections can be done very easily in a PCP office or in an orthopedic office.  Anyway, we had the unfortunate experience of coming to this joint.  Appt was at 10am and we were finally seen at 10:50. They would not let his wife come back (maybe I know too much?
The medical assistant tells him that the reason for visit today was to test which nerves in lumbar area of back would be marked for burning.  He questioned why that was planned because his pain doctor said specifically it would be knee injections she said well, I guess we are done then.  We would never agree to this method of treatment. All i can say is run, not walk from this hell hole and never look back. If you are not an educated person and know what is going on you may suffer some serious damage|Waiting an hour and a half for the doctor with no one telling you anything is unacceptable!  If any of them went to a restaurant and had to wait for their reservation they would be furious.  As the staff sit and knit a sweater is again unacceptable.  No regard for the people at the pain clinic sitting in pain for an hour after appointment time.  Should have been called to say the doctor was running late.  But if we show up late. They will not see you and bill you.  Wexford is the worst Cade Kessler is the office manager. He was not in.|Look, I will never claim anyone is perfect and there is no business that is either, but I question a lot of these negative reviews. I have been a patient at the Wexford office for years and I have never have had much of a problem. Occasionally there is a long wait that is uncalled for, but that isn't often. I have had a lot of procedures done here from a steroid injection to a rhizotomy and they have always been professional about it. If anyone has ever had problems with Lauren then I hate to say this but you had to have been rude yourself because she is nothing but professional, informative and kind. I have had issues with one PA there and made it known and now they refrain from scheduling me with him. The rest of the PAs have been incredible. Calling in can be an issue and scheduling can be rough sometimes, but all in all they have taken good care of me and I cannot complain about my care here. You have the ability to go somewhere else if you are not happy, that is what makes this country great.|West Mifflin location- From beginning to end of the appointments, you are treated with courtesy and respect from the front office staff.

Dr. Mitros and the PAs are extremely thorough with giving initial exams, then explains at length what the treatment plan will be moving forward.

He listens very well and cares about the needs of the patient. He will also take your input and recommendations into consideration before making any decisions. I can honestly say out of all the pain doctors I've seen in the last 20 years, he is the most patient and caring of them all and did not rush me during our visit.

Unlike other reviews i have read, they do no push procedures. Most people do not understand that procedures are beneficial and long lasting in most cases. it is the obligation of the staff to recommend something like that prior to more invasive techniques.

I am thrilled i found him because i know he will put my needs first|I like the doctors that being said the only person ever to rub me wrong who was rude and treated me like I wanted drugs was Jason F. , Even though the reason I found APM was to get off medicine.
The other issue is when making my appointments I only get to see a P.A. (even though they are nice and knowledgeable) when going to the office I saw a doctor 4 times in 18 months unless getting a procedure.
I can't say anyone was rude ever except Jason and I told the doctor and never had to see him since. It isn't unusual to wait for specialist but honestly if just seeing a P.A. I understand why so many on here have issues with that. In my opinion the results are worth it.|HORRIBLE experience with steroid injection appt. I was told to arrive 30 min before my 2:15 appt today. I walked in to a waiting rm and no receptionist (just a trainee who told me to wait) and waited 5 min. Check in was relatively easy...then the wait. They took 2 people before me and when I asked them at 2:35 (20 min after my appt time) what the estimated time would be to wait, I was told conflicting things. The receptionist then told the trainee to take me back...the hallway and rooms were disgusting.  Dirt everywhere, the "new" pillow case had more dried stains on it than a hotel mattress, and medical equipment (BP cuff, pulse ox) of lesser quality that what I have at home from Amazon. I waited over 5 minutes and heard from the hall that there was still a patient ahead of me, so I asked to be removed from the schedule to leave. I was then told I "came in at the wrong time" (despite my showing my appoint card that THEY mailed me with the time I arrived on it) and that I had to wait another HOUR in the dirty room for the possibility of a steroid injection. I wasn't even there for pain meds. The only provider (a PA named Lauren, not an MD) in the office came out and argued with me and was extremely rude, as was the receptionist. They blamed "scheduling" for the error even though it was the receptionist (Jill) who had called me to schedule my appt. I then asked for a co-pay refund and they charged me a SECOND TIME, giving me a receipt stating they charged my card. I will be marking it as fraud with my bank. But fair warning....this is a horrible, unprofessional office.|As another reviewer noted, I'd also give zero stars if that were an option. This may very well be the worst medical facility I've ever been to, from the insane wait times to the rude staff to the frankly unqualified physicians assistants. Some quick background - I have compression fractures of my T7 and T12 vertebrae from an accident about 9 months ago.  I waited over two hours to be seen today, in extreme pain the entire time I was in the waiting room.  Once I was eventually seen, it was only by a nurse and then by an extremely smug and incompetent physicians assistant, upon which time I was thoroughly treated like a drug addict because I am a medical cannabis patient here in PA.  So let this cautionary tale be a warning to any other MMJ patients who may need supplemental pain management:  Do not come here, as they don't think of you as a real person in severe pain.  Save your time, sanity, dignity, and money, and find a better clinic.|I just want to say that Meredith and the doctors have changed my life, they gave me a chance when nobody else would. I was in so much pain before I started seeing Meredith, Dr Mitros , Dr Hibbard and Dr Lodico and everyone have been nothing but excellent and caring the entire process. I feel so much better and owe them a lifetime of gratitude for everything they have done for me. They listen to all my corncerns and have ordered all the appropriate tests. Thank you so much for everything that you do for me! I have been feeling so much better.. thank you for everything that you have done!!!

  • Stem Cell Therapy - Harnessing the body's natural healing abilities

Our Multidisciplinary Approach

The physicians and staff at Pain Management Physicians believe in addressing pain from multiple angles. Pain Management Center in Langhorne, Pennsylvania offers comprehensive pain relief solutions for patients throughout Bucks County and surrounding areas. Our specialized medical facility focuses on diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches and innovative techniques. With a team of board-certified physicians and pain specialists, we provide personalized treatment plans designed to improve quality of life and restore function for those suffering from persistent pain.

At our state-of-the-art facility located at 820 Town Center Dr, Suite 200 in Langhorne, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options. Our multidisciplinary approach addresses various pain conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Each treatment plan is customized to the individual patient's needs following thorough evaluation and diagnostic testing.

Advanced Treatment Options

Our center utilizes cutting-edge technologies and procedures including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Nerve blocks and radiofrequency ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Joint injections and viscosupplementation

  • Medication management

  • Physical therapy coordination

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the pain. Our compassionate team works closely with each patient to develop comprehensive treatment strategies that address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain. We emphasize education, self-management techniques, and lifestyle modifications to help patients regain control of their lives.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please contact us at +1 267-212-5000. You can also visit our website at asclanghorne.com for more information about our services and providers. Our facility is conveniently located at 820 Town Center Dr, Suite 200, Langhorne, PA 19047, with accessible parking and amenities.

Don't let pain control your life. The Pain Management Center is committed to helping you find relief and return to the activities you enjoy.

Geisinger Pain Therapy in Danville, Pennsylvania offers comprehensive pain management services as part of the renowned Geisinger Health System. Specializing in both acute and chronic pain conditions, their multidisciplinary team of board-certified physicians, advanced practitioners, and pain specialists delivers personalized treatment plans designed to improve quality of life while minimizing medication dependence. The clinic's approach combines cutting-edge interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and integrative medicine techniques to address the complex nature of persistent pain.

At Geisinger Pain Therapy, patients benefit from evidence-based treatments for a wide range of conditions including back and neck pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, and cancer-related discomfort. The facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment and procedure rooms where specialists perform interventions such as nerve blocks, spinal cord stimulation, radiofrequency ablation, and targeted injections. Their holistic approach considers both the physical and psychological aspects of pain, often incorporating behavioral health strategies to enhance treatment outcomes.

Patient-Centered Care

The team at 16 Woodbine Lane prioritizes patient education and shared decision-making, ensuring individuals understand their condition and treatment options. New patients receive comprehensive evaluations to develop customized care plans that align with their specific goals and lifestyle needs. The clinic maintains close communication with referring physicians and other specialists within the Geisinger network to coordinate seamless care across all health services.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Geisinger Pain Therapy, patients can call +1 570-271-6621 or visit their website at www.geisinger.org/patient-care/conditions-treatments-specialty/pain-medicine. The clinic is conveniently located at 16 Woodbine Ln, Danville, PA 17821, and accepts most major insurance plans, including Medicare and Medicaid. Referrals from primary care physicians or specialists are typically required for new patient appointments.

Pain Med PC serves Greensburg, Pennsylvania and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated medical practice specializes in diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions through personalized care plans. Located at 438 Pellis Rd in Greensburg, we combine advanced medical techniques with compassionate patient care to help individuals regain control of their lives and reduce suffering from persistent pain conditions.

At Pain Med PC, our board-certified physicians offer a wide range of interventional and non-interventional pain management treatments. We address various chronic pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and pain resulting from injuries or surgeries. Our multidisciplinary approach ensures that each patient receives tailored care that addresses their specific needs and circumstances.

Our Comprehensive Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our team works closely with patients to develop individualized treatment plans that may include medication management, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications. This integrated approach helps maximize pain relief while minimizing medication dependence and improving overall quality of life.

Patient-Centered Care

Our practice prioritizes patient education and involvement in the treatment process. We take the time to explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. Our friendly staff ensures a comfortable experience from the initial consultation through ongoing treatment.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 412-782-1500. Our office is conveniently located at 438 Pellis Rd, Greensburg, PA 15601. Additional information about our practice and services can be found on our website at www.painmedpc.com.

NERA Spine, Sports & Pain Medicine in Lehigh Valley (Allentown, Bethlehem, Easton) provides contemporary, nonsurgical medical care for the treatment of painful or disabling musculoskeletal and neurologic conditions. Led by specialists Dr. Scott Naftulin and Dr. Bruce Zhang, our practice is dedicated to helping patients achieve pain-free living while maximizing functional capabilities without surgical intervention. Our comprehensive approach combines advanced medical techniques with personalized care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At NERA Spine, Sports & Pain Medicine, we focus our clinical expertise on evaluating and treating a wide range of disabling conditions. Our specialists utilize the most effective medical, interventional, rehabilitative, and alternative treatments currently available in the field. Whether you're suffering from chronic back pain, sports injuries, or complex neurological issues, our team provides evidence-based solutions designed to improve your quality of life.

Comprehensive Treatment Approach

Our practice offers a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that addresses both symptoms and underlying causes. We provide specialized services including disability management and medico-legal consultative services that are often required when addressing painful medical conditions. This holistic perspective ensures that all aspects of your recovery are considered and supported.

Contact Information

Visit our state-of-the-art facility located at 5325 Northgate Dr, Suite 209, Bethlehem, PA 18017. To schedule a consultation with our specialists, call +1 610-954-9400. For more information about our services and treatment options, visit our website at specialtyspinecare.com.

Lisa Makrides, MD, PC Makrides Aesthetics serves Lancaster, PA with a comprehensive approach to pain management and aesthetic wellness. Founded by Dr. Lisa Makrides, our practice combines medical expertise with advanced treatment options to address both chronic pain conditions and aesthetic concerns. We've established ourselves as a trusted healthcare provider in the Lancaster community, offering personalized care plans that focus on improving quality of life through effective pain relief and aesthetic enhancement.

As a board-certified anesthesiologist, pain medicine physician, and laser specialist, Dr. Lisa Makrides brings exceptional credentials to her practice. Our pain management solutions include:

  • Chronic Pain Management - Comprehensive treatment plans for ongoing pain conditions

  • Prolotherapy - Natural regenerative injections to strengthen ligaments and tendons

  • Ketamine Treatment Therapy - Advanced solutions for treatment-resistant conditions

  • Fibromyalgia Treatment - Specialized care for this complex chronic pain syndrome

  • Joint Pain Management - Targeted therapies for arthritis and joint-related discomfort

  • Nerve Block Therapy - Precise injections to interrupt pain signals

Aesthetic and Wellness Offerings

Beyond pain management, we provide a range of aesthetic treatments designed to enhance your appearance and boost confidence:

  • Laser Skin Treatment - Advanced technology for skin rejuvenation and texture improvement

  • Facial Rejuvenation - Non-surgical options to restore youthful appearance

Additional Services

Our practice proudly offers a full-service medical spa environment where wellness and beauty intersect. Additionally, we provide medical marijuana certification services for qualifying patients seeking alternative pain management options.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us:

Phone: +1 717-947-4325

Address: 1887 Lititz Pike #1, Lancaster, PA 17601, United States

Website: www.lisamakridesmdpc.com

Penn Pain Medicine Center serves Philadelphia, PA with comprehensive pain management solutions at the Tuttleman Center. Our specialized team of board-certified physicians combines advanced interventional techniques with integrative approaches to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. Patients throughout the Philadelphia metropolitan area trust our evidence-based treatments that focus on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

At Penn Pain Medicine Center, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, including interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and psychological support. Our specialists treat a wide range of conditions including back and neck pain, neuropathic pain, cancer-related pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the unique needs of every patient.

State-of-the-Art Facility
