column40:
I have never had such a terrible patient experience in my life. I came in for a procedure on my ear from the front desk team to the clinical staff who checks you in and evaluates you is absolutely horrible. The anesthesiologist Dr. Pope or Poe it was, whatever his name is was terrible. He came in and I told him how I was scared of needles and if he could lay me back before proceding, he ignored me, looked at the other nurse that checked me in who was named Tom and ROLLED HIS EYES at me & didnt lay me back. The nurse Tom laughed and smirked at him about me being nervous. Then, Dr. Pope walked out and said nothing. I started crying and nobody checked in on me. Absolutely DISGUSTING. If you cant be compassionate about people in the medical field you should not work in that field. PERIOD. Walked by me several times and just gave me dirty looks. Then, I complained to the other nurse who was going to take me back and all they said was "we will look into it" yeah sure okay. Then, after my procedure, i remember waking up and feeling very dizzy, the girl nurse next to me just stared at me & I said i dont feel good, i feel very dizzy. She didnt help me whatsoever & said "yeah, well thats from the anesthesia." No human compassion from anybody. & all that will happen is some robot commenting on this and just saying the same response they said to every negative review on here, nobody cares. They will get away with this behavior and its disgusting. Will never come back here and no one else should. Trust me.|I see a lot of negative reviews about this hospital but I had surgery ant this facility yesterday and I had an excellent experience. From the intake to the pre-op and recovery nurses, to my surgeon Dr. Hwa and her OR staff, everyone treated me with the highest respect and utmost care and compassion. I would highly recommend Dr. Hwa and the team at Penn Medicine Tuttleman Center to anyone looking for quality care.|If you're looking for a place where your needs are not genuinely cared for and multiple individuals handle your case without proper communication, then THIS is the place. I met with Dr. Ashburn, who barely spent 5 minutes discussing a procedure with me, failing to mention he wouldn't be performing it himself. To make matters worse, I met the performing MD on the day of the procedure, which was a new experience for me and a terrible introduction to a new physician.

After the initial visit, I was instructed to schedule a follow-up appointment for the injection three weeks later. However, when I called, the earliest available slot was six weeks away. Two weeks into the wait, I began experiencing intense pain and sought an earlier appointment. Unfortunately, my concerns were dismissed by someone other than a nurse, who suggested seeing a different provider (PA) for a quicker appointment. Reluctant to switch providers when the ordering and performing MD barely knew me, I felt ignored as my complaints of pain were brushed aside in favor of rescheduling to whoever was available.

In a further attempt to address my symptoms, I messaged again, requesting the MD to be informed. However, I received a dismissive response from the PA, solely focusing on scheduling without addressing my swelling or pain management concerns. Ending it with a real loving "I hope you feel better soon."

When I called the office again, the receptionist assumed my call was about scheduling. I clarified that my main concern was the lack of communication with the MD, as messages were being handled by someone named Carol, who didn't seem to be part of the clinical team and wasn't relaying my concerns to the MD.

I'm sharing this experience to warn others about a facility that neglects patient complaints and complications arising from procedures they've performed.|It would have been one star if it wasn't for the Resident, Aaron, he was so knowledgeable and kind! I appreciated his care. When the attending physician came in everything just felt different. Her demeanor, the whole vibe/scene just changed!! She definitely could've stayed where she was at and tried it another day.  im gonna rock with em for now see how it goes|Not sure if this is even the right place because there are multiple practices operating out of the same building. today 12/11/23 my fiance had a surgery scheduled for a cochlear implant. Before I continue this hospital system has on multiple occasions with held surgery/implant/symptoms and so on for this surgery. So today we arrive ( myself my fiance and 3 going to be 4 year old son) and am instantly greeted with hostility when entering the building by your so called security guards. That honestly if something was to actually happen here could not physically do anything to stop. Then am told by then that me and my son could not wait in the waiting room because he's under 4 (his birthday is Feb 2nd). And am told that she ( my fiance) has to do this check in and everything by herself. Mind you she is there for a cochlear implant surgery and can not hear nor understand people talking to her. We were told to arrive at 115. Then told the surgery does not start until 230 it is now 334 pm on the same Day and the surgery has not just started. I never received a text about the patient which I am connected to via the patient texting app. Further more was with held information by her doctor Tiffany hwa peng I believe is the ENT. About her cochlear implant. She was given some information detrimental to the choice of implant  the day before Thanksgiving and we were not informed about it until 6 days later after they have already know about this issue. On top of that as my fiance was checking in they then tell her there are more symptoms to getting this surgery done such as swelling that is supposed to get worse after 2 days. Which to me is information that should be given before the surgery is even a thought not the day of surgery. Next we had to wait literally 2 days before this surgery to get a time and place. Pre operation instructions and everything else. I have reached out to speak with supervisors administrators ever the doctors preforming the surgery or care and have been met with a we will call you back. No I have not received a call back about any of these issues. And this has been going on for over 6 months now. This entire penn medicine needs to be shut down. Pending an investigation into patient well-being and misdiagnosis of patients. My fiance would not have had to go through this surgery if this hospital system was able to diagnose a stroke. Or better yet give her the prenatal care she needed during our pregnancy which we lost in the process of them trying to determine what was wrong with her she has been to this hospital over 18 times not necessarily this location but as far as I'm concerned they are all the same location. Hospitals should not have their practices scattered all over the city so you need to find the exact place to leave a review. I would not have given them one star but I needed to in order to write a review. I will copy and paste this entire post to the other penn med sites. With hopes I get some type of response. I am also seeking legal assistance with this matter.|Just reached out looking for help. They told me that my doctor has to refer me, my doctor won't. So I guess that because my current doctor sucks and won't refer me, the expectation is I should just eat dirt and deal with it. Wow, good stuff. I always heard that teaching hospitals were good, I guess that will not be my experience.|This is an utter disappointment that after coming here since 2011 I have been treated in a manner no one should have to be. I have been trying to get Epidurals in my back since 2021 they know the Spinal Stenosis Sciatica and chronic pain that I suffer with.
They used covid as an excuse for not having a scheduler on hand amongst that no one called me to schedule my epidurals. When I kept calling it was like I was bothering them. I just left there today and the nurse practitioner did nothing for me . I took 3 buses
there now taking 3 to get back home. Once again
she claims the Scheduler will call me back to get me in for my Epidurals that I should have had last year before my Cervical Spine was fused. Okay
Emilee Rutherford if you say so. I am clearly talking
to my Orthopedic Doctor my Spine Surgeon my Primary Doctor and all who help with my Chronic Pain
about the UNPROFESSIONAL way this place is.
I AM IN SEVERE PAIN June 29 , 2022|Tried to make appointment with pain management and they can't see me cause they don't have access to my records from Jefferson Hospital even though my Jefferson Hospital neurologist said to see a pain management doctor. The bigger the hospital the more they don't care. I had nothing but good things to say about Penn hospital and the university school being a subcontractor to them on various jobs but not now.

Located in the Nazareth Medical Office Building, our specialized medical practice combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives. The one receptionist that works in the front always looks filthy. This place deserves zero stars!|This place is a joke! They schedule patients on top of patients. You guys need to immediately get rid of this woman and her power trip she is on. Susquehanna Health Pain Management UPMC Pain Management at UPMC Williamsport Divine Providence Campus serves Williamsport, Pennsylvania with specialized pain control solutions. Our comprehensive facility combines advanced medical technology with personalized treatment plans to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team of board-certified pain specialists utilizes evidence-based approaches including interventional procedures, medication management, and integrative therapies to help patients regain function and improve quality of life. We understand that pain affects each person differently, which is why we develop individualized care plans tailored to each patient's specific needs and goals.

At our Williamsport facility, we offer a wide range of treatments for various pain conditions, including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, cancer-related pain, and post-surgical pain. Our interventional procedures include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and joint injections. We also provide medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and psychological support to address the multifaceted nature of chronic pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We provide personalized, compassionate care to every person we serve. Our multidisciplinary team works closely with primary care physicians and other specialists to ensure coordinated care that addresses all aspects of a patient's health. We emphasize patient education, empowering individuals to actively participate in their pain management journey and develop sustainable strategies for long-term relief.

Community Commitment

As a valued member of the Williamsport community, we are dedicated to providing the highest quality of care for our patients. Our affiliation with UPMC ensures access to the latest advancements in pain management techniques and research. We strive to improve the lives of those suffering from chronic pain throughout North Central Pennsylvania.

Contact Information

For more information about our services and the conditions we treat, please visit our website at https://www.upmc.com/services/pain-management-regions/north-central-pa.

Good Samaritan Pain Clinic in Mars, PA offers comprehensive pain management services to residents throughout Butler County and the greater Pittsburgh area. Under the expert leadership of Dr. Sophie Hanna, our clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches that prioritize patient comfort and long-term wellness. We combine advanced medical interventions with rehabilitative techniques to address pain at its source while improving overall function and quality of life.

Dr. Sophie Hanna brings exceptional qualifications to her practice at Good Samaritan Pain Clinic. She holds dual board certifications: Board Certified in Pain Management by the American Board of Anesthesiology (ABA) and Board Certified in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation by the American Board of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation (ABPMR). This unique combination allows her to approach pain from multiple perspectives, offering patients comprehensive treatment plans tailored to their specific needs.

Our Approach to Pain Management

At Good Samaritan Pain Clinic, we believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our multidisciplinary approach may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and rehabilitation exercises. We specialize in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Services We Offer

Our comprehensive services include diagnostic evaluations, interventional procedures, medication management, physical rehabilitation programs, and ongoing pain management support. We work closely with each patient to develop personalized treatment plans that address their unique pain challenges and health goals.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Hanna, please contact us at +1 724-591-5583. Our clinic is conveniently located at 943 PA-228, Mars, PA 16046. For more information about our services and approach, visit our website at www.gspainclinic.com.

column40:
If I could rate lower than a one a would.

Disorganized. Dr doesnt retain information. Also advised me I "should have asked my discharging dr from a recent hospitalization for a 10 day supply of my meds"....that is 100 percent against REGULATIONS. Their drug screening is cheap and they dont do repeat drug screens if your drug screen comes up clear. No compassion. Save yourself the trouble and find a dr with better rating. Everywhere I looked she doesnt have above a 3 star rating. That is terrible for a doctor. I have collected information over the past couple months and will be filing a complaint.|A pain management clinic that refuses to manage pain "we can give you shots and you need to see a surgeon" every person we've known to get an operation on their back wishes they had not, my mother was one of those people......so surgery is off the table. Where are the elderly and disabled supposed to find any relief for their pain in America? The opioid epidemic was created by over prescribing people excessive and strong amounts for no reason.....I understand that, but now disabled people are told "they are being strict" ok so fight for your patient's, but instead they would rather "not have the hassle" while their patients are wracked with pain. My dad worked at the mill for 20+ years and it destroyed him and then he worked at a golf course maintaining the grounds for another 9 years and  that finally did the damage now he's disabled and "physicians" refuse to do their jobs, we did and do  our jobs, do your's.|My first visit to Good Samaritan Pain Clinic was January 2,2012. I have severe ostio and rheumatoid arthritis that obviously causes constant pain. Dr Hannah began with an evaluation and from there started looking at how to control my pain so i can function as best i can. She took the time to not only look at my medical issues but get to know me as to the type of activity and work i am able to do. She has fought the insurance companies for me and followed their protocol to the best of my interest not theirs. Some things she tried did not work but she kept up and found a regiment that works for me so i can function at my job and personal life. Yes there are times when Dr Hannah cant spend a whole lot of time with me but i am not her only patient and that is understandable. When i do have a concern she pays attention and does what she can to help the issue. Not only Dr Hannah but the whole staff is genuine in their care and concern about each patient they see. They are also just a friendly group of people who can make you smile when you are in serious pain. I thank them greatly for their care and concern with my medical issues.|What a great staff!  I was pleasantly surprised with the experience.  Our experiences with Pain Clinics here in Pennsylvania have not been good until now.  The staff was pleasant and professional.  We are very pleased with Dr.  Hanna  she listened and advised, we weren't RUSHED thru the appointment and we feel that everyone was very thorough with the evaluation.  My husband and I can't stop singing their praises!|While Dr. Hanna is a good doctor, the staff is unprofessional and unreliable. Do not return phone calls, give miss information, and do not follow through. Terrible to deal with when it comes to insurance and authorizations. Have been a nightmare to deal with. Even the insurance company cannot believe the level of incompetence. Would give zero stars if google would allow it.|Received spinal injections from DR Sophie Hanna and feel that she is thorough, gentle, and very accurate.  She takes the time to explain everything.  The office staff has always been kind to me.  Will not hesitate to recommend and I will be returning in the future.|The only star I give is for the staff who were very pleasant and professional. Gradam Men's Health & Testosterone Clinic serves Rumford, RI and surrounding communities with specialized care focused exclusively on men's health concerns. Established in November 2022, this physician-led practice has quickly become a trusted resource for men experiencing hormonal imbalances, low testosterone, and related health issues. The clinic combines medical expertise with personalized attention to address the unique health challenges men face as they age, offering comprehensive evaluations and tailored treatment plans designed to restore vitality and improve quality of life.

The clinic offers a range of services centered around testosterone replacement therapy and men's health optimization. Patients benefit from in-clinic laboratory testing that provides immediate insights into hormonal levels and overall health markers. Each treatment plan is customized based on individual needs, symptoms, and health goals, ensuring effective and safe interventions.

Affordable and Accessible Care

Understanding the importance of making healthcare accessible, Gradam Men's Health offers consultations for only $99, significantly lower than many competitors. This commitment to affordability extends throughout their service offerings, with transparent pricing and no hidden fees. The clinic maintains flexible hours of operation to accommodate working professionals, making it easier for men to prioritize their health without disrupting their schedules.

Patient Experience

What sets Gradam apart is their dedication to creating a comfortable environment where men can openly discuss sensitive health concerns. The professional staff combines clinical expertise with a supportive approach, ensuring patients feel heard and respected throughout their treatment journey. This patient-centered philosophy has earned them a reputation for excellent service alongside their unbeatable pricing.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about services offered:

Phone: +1 401-599-3737

Website: https://menandtestosterone.com/

Location: 225 Newman Ave Suite 310, Rumford, RI 02916, United States

column3:
The Pain Center of Rhode Island, located in Cranston, RI, stands as a premier Non-Narcotic Pain Control Institute serving patients throughout Rhode Island. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Blanki Cherubini, the center specializes in innovative pain management solutions through Regenerative Medicine and Interventional Orthopedics. Patients seeking alternatives to traditional pain treatments and surgery find comprehensive care tailored to their unique needs in this state-of-the-art facility.

Dr. Blanki Cherubini brings exceptional credentials as a Board-Certified physician in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation. Her extensive training encompasses Musculoskeletal Medicine, diagnostic ultrasound, Spine and Sports Medicine, and both fluoroscopic-guided and ultrasound-guided injection techniques. With specialized expertise in Neuro-Musculoskeletal medicine and EMG/NCV (Electromyography and Nerve Conduction Velocity studies), Dr. Cherubini focuses on delivering accurate diagnoses and developing appropriate treatment plans that effectively mitigate pain while helping patients avoid invasive surgical procedures.

Comprehensive Treatment Approach

The center's philosophy centers on identifying the root causes of pain rather than merely addressing symptoms. Through advanced diagnostic techniques and personalized treatment protocols, patients receive care that aims to restore function and improve quality of life. The Pain Center of Rhode Island emphasizes non-narcotic approaches, offering sustainable solutions for chronic pain conditions affecting the spine, joints, and musculoskeletal system.

Services Offered

Patients benefit from a wide range of specialized services including:

  • Regenerative Medicine treatments

  • Interventional Orthopedic procedures

  • Diagnostic ultrasound evaluations

  • Precision-guided injections

  • EMG/NCV studies for nerve-related conditions

  • Comprehensive pain management plans

Contact Information

The Pain Center of Rhode Island welcomes new patients seeking effective, non-surgical pain management solutions. Their modern facility is conveniently located at 1150 Reservoir Ave, Suite 200, Cranston, RI 02920. To schedule a consultation, patients can call +1 401-648-6100 or visit their website at paincenterofri.com for more information about their innovative approach to pain relief.
column11: The Pain Center of Rhode Island, is a Non-Narcotic Pain Control Institute that focus on pain management through out Regenerative Medicine and Interventional Orthopedics. Dr. Blanki Cherubini, is Board-Certified in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation. She has been trained in Musculoskeletal Medicine, diagnostic ultrasound, Spine and Sports Medicine, fluoroscopic-guided as well as ultrasound-guided injections, with extensive training in Neuro-Musculoskeletal medicine, and EMG/NCV her focus is on accurate diagnosis and to recognize the appropriate course of treatment, treatments that will help mitigate pain and avoid invasive surgery.

column40:
My 88 year old Dad has been suffering from excruciating pain in his knee due to osteoarthritis. I was in a desperate search for a quality pain management specialist in an effort to provide my Dad with some relief. His pain had been at a 10 or higher for the better part of 2 years or more. The pain was so severe that Dad could no longer walk without full assistance from me or a CNA. It was adversely affecting his quality of life.

I found Dr. Keith Perry from a Google search. I called Dr. Perry's office and had the pleasure of speaking with Ilana Burns who is the Practice Manager and was absolutely wonderful to speak with!! Ms. Burns was SO helpful and kind during our phone chat and she was able to schedule my Dad for an appointment with Dr. Perry.

Dr. Perry welcomed my Dad to his practice, took X-rays of my Dad's knee and immediately assessed my Dad's level of need.

As of the writing of this review, I can confidently say that my Dad's pain level has been reduced to a consistent 2 (from a previous 10+). In my humble opinion, Dr Perry has given my Dad a quality of life that he has not known in years!

Without hesitation, I would recommend Dr. Perry to anyone who is seeking relief from chronic pain. Thank you, Dr. Perry, Ilana Burns, and Dr. Perry's assistant, Giovanna for giving my Dad relief from his pain. You all should be commended for the work that you are doing.

Kindly,
Steven Palumbo
Providence, RI|In 2010, I had under-eye surgery from Dr. Perry. I asked repeatedly to have the skin lifted, due to a section of sagging skin under my right eye. He was persistent that I should have fat injections instead. I finally gave in to his advice and got the fat injections. For about 3 months, it looked ok, but as time went on, it became worse than it was before I saw him. Now, it's just over 12 years later and my right eye looks absolutely horrible!! The fat STRETCHED the sagging skin! If I could go back in time, I never would have walked through his door! Now I am faced with having corrective surgery because of his failure. Do NOT trust this so-called doctor!!! His only concern is making sure he gets paid. I speak from experience after numerous calls about my eye, only to hear nothing. You all have been warned. As a side note, I found out AFTER I had my surgery that he had his license suspended before because of allegedly allowing non-certified people do injections in his clinic. Feel free to do a checkup on him to see for yourself. Guess that explains why he put a clause in the contract, before surgery, stating that I can not sue him. Smart move on his part because I definitely would have dragged him through court! I just wish I could rate this MINUS 5 stars!|I go here for pain management.  Ive gotten nerve blockers injected into my shoulder, back, and neck. The staff is very friendly and professional.  Dr. Perry is great at putting his patients at ease before and during the procedure.  I feel that he listens to my concerns 100%.  The process is quick and clean and the rooms are spotless without smelling like a hospital. I've been to 2 treatments and feel that they have helped quite a bit for my pain levels.|Took my son to the E.R. Very nice doctor.......||||

Shiqiang Tian, MD serves East Providence, Rhode Island and surrounding communities as a distinguished pain management specialist at University Orthopedics. Dr. Tian, who also goes by "Chris," brings exceptional expertise in treating a comprehensive range of pain conditions including headache, spinal, musculoskeletal, post-surgical, neuropathic, cancer, and visceral pain. His patient-centered approach focuses on helping individuals regain functionality and return to their daily activities through innovative procedures and personalized treatment plans.

Through his rigorous training and clinical experience, Dr. Tian offers advanced pain management solutions including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Radiofrequency nerve ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Intra-thecal drug delivery systems

  • Vertebral augmentation

Credentials and Expertise

Dr. Tian is certified to practice pain medicine by the American Board of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation. His comprehensive understanding of pain pathways and treatment modalities allows him to develop customized approaches for patients with complex pain conditions, helping them achieve improved quality of life and pain reduction.

Location and Contact Information

University Orthopedics - Pain Management

1 Kettle Point Ave

East Providence, RI 02914

Phone: +1 401-330-1450

Website: https://universityorthopedics.com/physicians/tian/index.html

column3:
Handel Center for Spine, Sports and Rehabilitation in Providence, Rhode Island offers comprehensive care for patients suffering from musculoskeletal conditions and injuries. Founded by board-certified physicians with extensive training in physical medicine and rehabilitation, the center has established itself as a premier destination for non-surgical treatment options in the greater Providence area. Their integrative approach combines evidence-based medical interventions with personalized rehabilitation programs to address both acute injuries and chronic pain conditions.

At the Handel Center, patients receive individualized care for a wide range of conditions including back pain, neck pain, sports injuries, joint disorders, and nerve compression syndromes. The center's physicians utilize advanced diagnostic techniques to identify the root cause of pain, allowing for targeted treatment plans that may include physical therapy, therapeutic injections, regenerative medicine, and specialized rehabilitation protocols. Their focus on functional restoration helps patients return to their daily activities with improved mobility and reduced pain.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 285 Governor St, Suite 100, Providence, RI 02906, the Handel Center features modern treatment rooms equipped with the latest rehabilitation technology. The facility's design prioritizes patient comfort while providing the clinical resources necessary for comprehensive care. Free parking is available on-site for added convenience during appointments.

Patient-Centered Approach

The clinical team at Handel Center believes in collaborative care, working closely with patients to develop treatment strategies aligned with their specific goals and lifestyle needs. This personalized approach, combined with their expertise in non-surgical interventions, has helped countless patients avoid unnecessary surgeries while achieving significant pain relief and functional improvement.

For consultations or to schedule an appointment, patients can contact the center directly at +1 401-305-5280 or visit their website at http://www.handelcenter.com/ for additional information about services and treatment options.

column40:
My primary physician referred me to Dr. Handel for trigger point injections. I met with Bryant(who no longer works there for personal reasons) I think the year was 2020 or 2019. She explained everything to me gave me the injections and I got relief. The next appointment she also gave me injections for my hips. That went fine. I had an injection done by Dr. Handel in my s.i. joint. I looked this up on you-tube because I wasn't familiar with a procedure like this. The procedure did not go the way I anticipated, it felt rushed and I ended up with a terrible headache for two weeks. I chose to never have that done again. It also didn't last as long as I anticipated from based on all my research.  Bryant told us she was leaving the practice, (not happy, because she was so good and kind and professional).. My next appointment was with Michael for trigger point injections. He was a nervous wreck and I felt like I had to make him comfortable about giving me these shots. Then I knew that I was in trouble. He kept knocking on Dr. Handel's office door for help with the shots because he said he wasn't sure how to give this shot to me. This isn't what any patient wants to hear. My husband and I weren't even on 95 south yet and I was in horrible pain. I never went back again. I called and cancelled all of my appointments. There's a reason why every staff member left the practice. Do your research. Everyone that worked there at that time was a woman. Google his name and see what you find out. I just did and that is the reason for my review today. People need to know. I myself was horrified to learn this.|Excellent physician & center! Patient and kind. Every employee who works here is so nice!|The Handel Center's Michael Cobbs listened to me and did not dismiss my complaints. Michael Cobbs, PA, had a plan of care that enabled me to have a quality of life that I did not have before, and I am so grateful to Michael Cobbs, PA.

Thank you for listening, I am very grateful,
Eboni (E.B.)|Dr. Handel was able to quickly and efficiently manage and minimize my pain post surgery after having some complications. He went above and beyond to accommodate my needs to make sure I was back to work and performing at my full potential. column3:
Rhode Island Health Group serves North Smithfield, RI and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions integrated with urgent and primary care services. Our multidisciplinary team specializes in treating acute and chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Since our founding, we've been committed to providing compassionate care that addresses the physical, emotional, and psychological aspects of pain management.

At Rhode Island Health Group, we offer a wide range of pain management treatments including medication management, interventional procedures, physical therapy, and complementary therapies. Our board-certified specialists work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that focus on improving function and quality of life while minimizing reliance on medications when possible.

Integrated Care Approach

What sets us apart is our unique integration of pain management with on-site urgent care and primary care services. This comprehensive approach ensures continuity of care and allows us to address both acute pain emergencies and long-term chronic pain management under one roof. Our patients benefit from seamless coordination between specialists and primary care providers, resulting in more effective treatment outcomes.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 65 Eddie Dowling Hwy in North Smithfield, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. We prioritize patient comfort and convenience with minimal wait times and flexible scheduling options for both scheduled appointments and urgent care needs.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (401) 356-4046 or visit our website at rihealthgroup.org. Our dedicated team is ready to help you take the first step toward effective pain management and improved well-being.

column40:
We had to take my elderly aunt there twice. They were very good with her.

Right now they are closed. According to the sign, they will be reopening at One Eddie Dowling Hwy. (The old Walgreen's) once Dr. Hussain's office moves there.

There STILL isn't any sign of One Eddie Dowling Hwy opening! I would just expect to continue going to another Urgent Care.|This place needs to be sued,and forced to close. The pain management closed it's door then sent all patients to Pawtucket office ultimately dropping all the north Smithfield patients out in the cold no fore warning or help in finding new pain management. Place is run by clowns.|Used to be a great pain management clinic. Since this new NP it not the same at all. Used to be a kind caring Dr. that listened to you. She is a control freak if you don't want to do what she wants she gets mad at you for having a mind of your own. Changed everything and now wonders why I'm having more of a problem with my pain. She's not understanding or compassionate. Very cold and blunt. She shouldn't be working in pain management.|The website and sign on the door says they open at 8am. Wrong. They open when a provider decides to get there. I waited until 8:40 in the parking lot because they do not open the doors until a provider gets there. What's the point of hours if they don't matter. Mind you - this is the second time this has happened to me there. Previously the LPN took me in and saw me (super nice) and was able to get the meds I needed for a sinus infection.|One of the best experiences I've ever had going to see a doctor. The staff at the front desk where kind and patient. The nurse was gentle making sure to not cause any more pain than I was already in. The doctor didn't waste any time giving me a diagnosis. She seemed genuinely concerned of the swelling in my throat (I had a bad case of strep) to where she had the nurse give me a steroid shot to help me breathe as well as an antibiotic shot to get things moving.
I've gone to the ER many times in my life and I'd be lucky to get a Tylenol for any kind of relief. Plus waiting in the waiting room for hours!!
Never going to the ER (if I can help it) I will always go here. This place is the best place to get real care!|The nurse assistant was very nice but the doctor or LPN was not she was rude talked over me while I was trying to ask questions ,she showed no empathy for my situation. She seemed like she needed some meds herself  and to top it I'm still in chronic pain...|I called yesterday and was told it was a walk in clinic and they close at 4 taking last patient at 3:39. I told them I was in my way and got there at 2:50 and the doors where locked!! Tried calling and the answering machine said they were closed!! There was a young lady in there but she said she was working on the other side and said she had no idea what was going on. Wish they would of just told me they were closing, have a severe sinus infection and was light headed and dizzy and then I had to drive to Cumberland to the next walk in clinic. I was not happy!!!!|I just left this location. I will never recommend or return after the nightmare I just experienced. I understand that being a receptionist can be a difficult task at times. However, the lack of professionalism, empathy, and respect was appalling. First, I will say the main issue was verification of my health insurance. Apparently, your receptionist Jennifer could not handle being on hold with BCBS of RI because she had better things to discuss with another associate about a particular alcoholic beverage she enjoys and purchases it somewhere in Attleboro. I was not only in pain but I was disgusted by her attitude. I let her know that I had just spoken with a BCBS representative and her response was, "well, I was just on hold with them for a half hour and this is the reference number." I apologize for the inconvenience and politely requested the forms that I had just filled out. Since, she had written the reference number on the first page. I was driven straight to BCBS branch in Lincoln, RI to get the issue resolved which took less then ten mins. As I was limping away on a potentially broken ankle stubbed on the side of the chair. I literally thought I was going to pass out from the pain. I returned to the same walk-in which didn't even offer a wheelchair I might add. I handed the receptionist the same exact forms, license, and insurance card. Her exact response, "Is it the same insurance card?" I responded yes and told her everything has been taken care of, and I assured her that she can call to verify once again. She throws her hands in the air and says,  "I am not waiting on hold again she's going to have to call me or you are going to have to pay." I hope that this location has adequate video surveillance with clear audio to review how their employee treats new patients. Once again I collected my paperwork to take my business elsewhere. My mother knew I had to be seen and I was so distraught. she went in someone else quickly attended to her "The original receptionist" dropped the attitude and full of excuses as the other woman assisted my mother. My mom was provided with a phone and fax number and we had to return back to Lincoln where they personally called and was rudely placed on hold by Jennifer once she realized it was for me. BCBS provides her with the information she needed. Honestly, if it wasn't because I'm new to the area. I would have driven back to East Greenwich to receive my care. The rest of the staff members were kind, attentive, and professional and I thank you once again for your humility and compassion. Sadly, I will never return to this establishment ever again.

column3:
Westerly Pain Management serves patients throughout Westerly, RI and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain treatment solutions. Under the expert care of Dr. Woo Jin Lee, patients receive personalized treatment plans designed to address chronic and acute pain conditions using the latest evidence-based approaches. The practice combines advanced interventional techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain function and improve their quality of life.

Dr. Woo Jin Lee, MD is a highly qualified pain management specialist who is board-certified in anesthesiology and fellowship-trained in pain medicine. With extensive training and clinical experience, Dr. Lee offers specialized care for patients suffering from various pain conditions. His comprehensive approach focuses on identifying the root cause of pain and developing targeted treatment strategies that minimize medication dependence while maximizing functional improvement.

Specialized Treatment Areas

Dr. Lee treats all types of pain conditions, with particular expertise in spinal disorders including:

  • Degenerative disc disease and spondylosis

  • Spinal canal stenosis

  • Radiculopathy (nerve root compression)

  • Facet joint arthropathy

  • Sacroiliac joint arthropathy

  • Vertebrogenic and compression fractures

  • Complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS)

Beyond spinal conditions, Dr. Lee also specializes in treating major peripheral joint pain, including hip, shoulder, and knee arthropathy.

Interventional Treatment Options

The practice offers a comprehensive range of minimally invasive procedures, including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Radiofrequency nerve ablation

  • Joint steroid injections

  • Peripheral nerve blocks

  • Sympathetic plexus blocks

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Vertebral augmentation

Contact Information

Phone: +1 401-457-1500

Address: 11 Wells St STE 1, Westerly, RI 02891, United States

Patients seeking relief from chronic or acute pain conditions are encouraged to contact the office to schedule a consultation with Dr. Lee. The practice accepts most major insurance plans and works with patients to ensure access to the care they need.
column11: Dr. Lee is board-certified in anesthesiology and fellowship-trained in pain medicine. He treats all types of pain, specializing primarily in spinal conditions like degenerative disc disease/spondylosis, spinal canal stenosis, radiculopathy, facet joint arthropathy, sacroiliac joint arthropathy, vertebrogenic/compression fractures and complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS). He also treats major peripheral joint pain, including hip, shoulder, and knee arthropathy. He offers a variety of interventional treatment options, including epidural steroid injection, radiofrequency nerve ablation, joint steroid injection, peripheral nerve blocks, sympathetic plexus blocks, spinal cord stimulation, and vertebral augmentation.

Our Expert Medical Team

Entering its second decade of operation, this premier pain management practice has established a reputation for excellence through its integrated and multidisciplinary team approach. Co-founders Dr. Do Chan, MD, MBA and Dr. Boris Shwartzman, MD bring exceptional credentials to their practice, both holding double board certifications in anesthesia and pain medicine. column40:
Today I had my first spinal epidural administered by Doctor Desillier at the South Kingstown location.  I was extremely nervous and not sure what to expect. She was extremely Compassionate and professional and her confidence put my mind at ease.  She took her time and answered all questions. I did not feel rushed at all! The injection was almost painless!  Also, her assistant was very polite and friendly. I go back in six weeks for another injection, and I feel Much less anxious, knowing how capable and kind she is. I recommend this doctor for anyone suffering with chronic pain.|My husband was going here.
They refused to do anything for him. Other than giving him a shot for his foot. That didn't work
We went  to every appointment. We had to reschedule one because my grandfather passed away Unexpectedly and then 2 weeks later. My father ended up in the hospital on His death bed fighting for his life so he had to reschedule again. I told them That we were very sorry. And that I would call to schedule the appointment as soon as we could. Since we were in the hospital every day and night I lost my father not even a month after my grandfather. I have called them 4 times they will not answer the phone. today I called and they answered and told me to hold on and put me on. Hold for 25 minutes and then the phone hung up.  This place is unprofessional, absolutely disgusting. I cannot believe it is still in business. You don't see a Doctor they're very rude. You see a nurse. It doesn't matter how much pain you're in, they don't care.The lady at the front desk has no manners. My husband told them he's in so much pain he couldn't handle it anymore.and they told him they were sorry. He was hurting that bad. There was nothing they could do. They should not be in business.|They saved my life! I can walk again! I don't have to live with the pain anymore! Thank you to the staff at South County Comprehensive Pain management.|I just got home from the office in south county. I normally go to the office in Warwick. The staff is very nice and very helpful. It is a very friendly place and they always put you at ease. When making appointments they really try to work with your schedule. I see Dr. Chan at both places. He is very nice and makes sure you are okay during the whole procedure. Thanks a lot for helping me with my pain.|Will only prescribe opiate medication with monthly visits, pill counts, drug tests, and refuse to increase medications when needed. As a former substance abuse counselor, it's exactly how you would treat someone with a substance abuse disorder on court ordered probation.
It's not pain management, it's pain medication management. I was told "you have the choice to stop taking the medications" when I complained of the control and invasive requirements. I saw it as a gentle threat of "do it, or suffer with pain and withdrawls".
I have no choice. If you do, choose "other".|Liars and idiots. No concern for patients at all. Minimum wage staff at best and different every visit. Call you several times to change your visit time and date every month. Refuse to assist patients communicate with doctors. Better off in pain. Avoid this practice. Just insurance voltures. Put me on oxycodone while I was on clonazepam. Deadly mix! Doctor Adriana Desillier is a dangerous liar. She promised to check with my other docs to see if meds were ok at my first visit, as I refused any meds without approval from my other doctors. At my second visit I waited 3.5 hours in the office while they figured out where my records were. Doctor Desillier then assured my son and myself that she had cleared oxycodone with all my doctors and there were no side effects. I took the oxycodone. After feeling like i was drifting in and out of consciousness I immediately called doctor Desillier's office I was told to keep taking the oxycodone to get used to it. I did not. After contacting my doctors I learned that none of them had ever been contacted by Dr. Desillier or her office. My primary Dr. Had not heard anything from them after sending the referral. After demanding a visit with Dr. Desillier I was given an appointment two weeks later. When I confronted Dr. Desillier face to face her only answer was that they couldent pay staff to check every patients current meds. Complete change of story. When "professionals" like this are too lazy or incompetent to do their jobs and fail to request that they're employees do, people die! This is the same mix of drugs that killed Heath Ledger. BEWARE. COMPREHENSIVE PAIN MANAGEMENT ENDANGERED MY LIFE AND CONTINUES TO PUT OTHERS AT RISK WITHOUT CONCERN.|(Zero Stars) look at these complaints people. Never had a doctor make me want to kill myself before. Thank you Dr Adriana Desillier for discriminaing against me, calling me a disappointment of a human being as well as a disappointment of veteran and a Jerk.
You screamed at me I'm front of an office full of people and then called the cops on me to have me trespassed for your actions. I recorded the entire incident .  I Will  put you on the news. I've filed a complaint with the bar and I will also be suing you. I am a mental and physical trauma patient.  You victimized me and caused irreparel pain and suffering. You put me in such a dark place that I never wanted to go to. Doctors are supposed to help people not hurt them. You had my entire history and knowingly negligently hurt me and then on top of it the defamed my name. This group is disgusting, the doctors are disgusting, don't go here unless you want the same thing to also happen to you or worse. Additionally they sent me a bill for $400 dollars rather then Bill my three insurance cpanies as a form of   retribution. Or they are double dipping. Additionally, they put incorrect information in my medical file has a form of punishment. This place is not to be trusted. If anyone has had any similar experiences please file complaints. Stand up for your self and others.  Don't let someone get hurt for the disgusting, unprofessional behavior and treatment of this doctor's office.

Also I would like to add that they are double dipping for insurance billing me despite the fact that I have three insurances and this is a LOD injury that should be billed to the VA. They sent the bill under another pain company name. Complete Scum!|If I could give this center 0 stars, I would.  They mismanaged my case and I was unable to get a needed prescription due to their provision of the wrong diagnosis to my healthcare program.  You can never speak to the PA you dealt with because it is not allowed; the manager is always unavailable; and seeing a doctor is impossible unless you are receiving an injection.  In addition, I was told that I would need to resolve this myself with my pharmaceutical program....which is absolutely inaccurate since prescribers play the role of dealing with appeals and errors they've made in diagnosis.  After 2 weeks, I still don't have my needed medication and will now go to another location for assistance.  I believe this agency may have good PAs and the female doctor in the So. County office appears competent, but the Warwick staff is uncaring and lack in competency.  Avoid Comprehensive Pain Management..

At Comprehensive Pain Management, Dr. Shwartzman brings years of specialized training and experience to every patient interaction. Our practice offers a wide range of interventional procedures, medication management options, and integrative therapies designed to target pain at its source. We specialize in treating conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain, among others.

Our Approach to Patient Care

We believe in a multidisciplinary approach that considers all aspects of a patient's health and well-being. Dr. Shwartzman takes the time to listen to each patient's concerns, thoroughly evaluate their condition, and develop treatment strategies that minimize reliance on opioids while maximizing function and comfort. Our goal is not just to mask symptoms but to address underlying causes whenever possible.

Visit Our Practice

Comprehensive Pain Management is conveniently located at 2870 Post Rd, Warwick, RI 02886. New patients are welcome, and we accept most major insurance plans. To schedule a consultation with Dr. Boris Shwartzman, please call us at (401) 298-8869 or visit our website at www.comprehensivepainmd.com. Our compassionate team is ready to help you take the first step toward effective pain relief and improved quality of life.

column3:
NRI Pain Management LLC in Pawtucket, Rhode Island offers comprehensive pain management and addiction treatment services to patients throughout the greater Providence area. Established as a patient-centered medical practice, NRI specializes in evidence-based approaches to chronic pain and substance use disorders. Our board-certified physicians and medical staff provide individualized treatment plans designed to improve quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

Suboxone Clinic

Our medication-assisted treatment program utilizes Suboxone (buprenorphine/naloxone) to help patients overcome opioid dependence. This FDA-approved treatment is combined with counseling and behavioral therapies to provide a comprehensive recovery approach.

Chronic Pain Management

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life. Our multidisciplinary approach includes medication management, interventional procedures, and lifestyle modifications tailored to each patient's specific condition and needs.

Alcohol Use Disorder Treatment

Our alcohol use disorder program combines medical management with counseling services to address both the physical and psychological aspects of alcohol dependence, helping patients achieve lasting recovery.

Trigger Point Injections

We offer targeted trigger point injections to relieve muscle pain and tension. These minimally invasive procedures can provide significant relief for patients suffering from myofascial pain syndromes and related conditions.

Patient-Centered Approach

At NRI Pain Management, we believe in treating the whole person, not just symptoms. Our team works closely with each patient to develop personalized treatment plans that address their unique needs and circumstances. We emphasize education, support, and ongoing care to help our patients achieve optimal health outcomes.

Contact Information

Website: www.nrimedicalservices.net

Phone: +1 401-227-9940

Address: 333 School St, Suite 109, Pawtucket, RI 02860, United States

column40:
I recently had a serious back injury due to an automobile accident. I was in pain all the time but  I didn't want to take pain medications. A close family friend recommended I see Dr. Handel, and I can't express enough how wonderful my experience was. His staff was amazing and the office is so clean! They were so compassionate and efficient. They really care about their patients.

Dr. Handel took the time to listen to my concerns and he answered all my questions. I was really impressed by how he provided me with several treatment options because I really didn't want to take pain medication.

I appreciated so much that Dr. Handel followed up with me. It showed me that he is committed to my well-being.  I can't say enough about him and my experience as his patient. Thank you so much Dr. H! Thank you Karen and Sarah! You guys are the best.

I highly recommend Dr. Handel!

Patty|I don't know where to begin when it comes to Dr Handel. He is knowledgeable, compassionate and truly cares about his patients. He should of thrown me out of his practice by my ears for the grief I caused him but he stuck with me and is helping me beyond what a Doctor usually does to get me on the right track. It's one of the hardest things I've ever had to do and there is a lot of fear involved. He is there for you anytime which puts the fear at ease. Dr Handel looks out for your best interests and is right by your side to help you through whatever your going trough. We need more Dr's  like Mr. Handel in the world. I highly recommend him. He will do right by you!|As a truck driver I was in serious tractor-trailer accident thanks to Dr. Handel. I did not need no surgery. He burnt a nerve in my lower back that was 10 years ago. I don't want no more. My back doesn't get stressed from being overworked and I'm 43 years old today. He is an amazing doctor. Kudos to him, hands down|I have gone to Dr. Handel for many years and I was able to work because of his expertise without going to surgery. I  went from crawling on my floor to get to the phone to having a life walking, exercising and enjoying my retirement. I  must repeat treatments but it sure beats an error in surgery. I have met my share of those 2 in family who wish they kept treating with injections. I am thankful for his practice.|With the help of Dr. Handel's injections I was able to put off surgery for a decade. He's gone beyond the norm and helped me through some tough situations. He's a truly empathetic individual. I tried  many other doctors/shots before I found  him. His shots are very effective. He has my full trust. He's truly a top notch professional.|Before I went to Dr Handel, I was a mess.  I could barely get out of bed and tie my shoes, at the age of 43 then, he changed my life for the better.  I am able to work my physical job, and just enjoy the simple things in life because of him and his staff.  He's very caring as well, not just as a Doctor but as a human being.  He really saved me from going down a very dark hole, he helped me get off some pain medicine that was being handed out to me before, I was in a very bad place, but he cared enough to put the time and effort into helping me get off all of it, what a true professional Doctor should do.  A asset to the medical field and to society.  Just an all around great Doctor and human being.  The best!|If I could put 0 stars then I absolutely would! This guy is the biggest quack I've ever met! I can't believe he's a "doctor"! He was absolutely terrible! He walked in on his high horse, questioning if I even have any of the illnesses/diagnoses that I have! Without looking at any images of my neck or any of my paperwork/records, or even evaluating me!! He treated me like a liar, for no reason at all! And he was making jokes about it all and being really rude! Meanwhile I'm in agony and desperate for help, wearing a neck brace and it's all limiting me so much in life but he didn't care to even look at my neck! What a waste of time! & So much aggravation that I didn't need! Save yourself the time and aggravation!!|I suspect Kelli Gonsalves and Dallas Gonsalves didn't have a clear understanding of what a physiatrist does.

Dr. Handel and his wonderful staff keep me walking and as pain-free as possible! I am so thoroughly grateful my primary doctor referred me to Dr. Handel's office and that they accepted me as a patient. They diagnosed and fixed a disabling problem no one else had been able to figure out. They truly keep me walking. There is nothing "snake oil" about his treatments. There is nothing "patching, not fixing" about his treatments either. Some chronic pain conditions cannot be fixed, but can be managed with various treatments like PT, massage, steroid injections, etc. I avail myself of the tools he offers and am able to continue to work full time, despite chronic pain conditions. He is one of my heroes.

No snake oil. Genius.

column2: Dr. Ross Barker, DO - Norman Prince Spine Institute at Newport Hospital
column3:
Dr. Ross Barker, DO at the Norman Prince Spine Institute at Newport Hospital serves patients throughout Newport, Rhode Island with exceptional spine and neurological care. As a board-certified osteopathic physician specializing in spine health, Dr. Barker combines evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate patient-centered care. The practice offers comprehensive evaluation, diagnosis, and treatment for a wide range of spine conditions, from degenerative disc disease to complex spinal deformities.

At the Norman Prince Spine Institute, Dr. Barker provides both surgical and non-surgical treatment options tailored to each patient's unique needs. Services include minimally invasive spine procedures, spinal injections, physical therapy coordination, and comprehensive pain management strategies. The practice emphasizes conservative treatment approaches whenever possible, reserving surgical interventions for cases where non-operative methods have been unsuccessful.

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Barker's philosophy centers on treating the whole person, not just the spine condition. Initial consultations typically include a thorough medical history review, physical examination, and analysis of any previous imaging studies. Patients appreciate Dr. Barker's clear communication style and his commitment to explaining treatment options in understandable terms.

column40: I had a terrible experience 2 years ago. I was  given 2 cortisone shots in my spine by Dr Barker and he punctured the dura in 2 different places. I will follow up with my mri he ordered and take it from there . Maybe he was having an off day . I read a few reviews and he does not seem to be pulling great ratings . Palmetto Pain Management serves Columbia, SC with specialized pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. We at Palmetto Pain Management understand pain and how it can affect your daily activities and those closest to you. Our compassionate team of pain specialists is dedicated to helping patients regain control of their lives through comprehensive diagnosis and personalized treatment plans.

Our goal is to utilize patients' medical histories to correctly diagnose their condition, avoid repeating previously unsuccessful treatments, and determine the most appropriate treatment. Following the principle of "Primum non nocere" (first do no harm), we take a careful, methodical approach to pain management that prioritizes patient safety while effectively addressing chronic and acute pain conditions.

Patient-Centered Care

We are always interested in hearing your perspective as oftentimes you have unique insights into your own pain and can guide us in formulating a successful treatment plan. This collaborative approach ensures that your voice is heard and your experiences are valued throughout your treatment journey.

Our Commitment

Hopefully we can work together to understand your needs and improve your quality of life. Our team at Palmetto Pain Management is committed to providing compassionate, evidence-based care in a supportive environment where patients feel understood and respected.

Contact Information

Website: https://palmettopainmanagement.com/

Phone: +1 803-779-3263

Address: 2611 Forest Dr #200, Columbia, SC 29204, United States

column40:
I have been first, a patient of Dr.Ezra Riber since 2010 for one pain condition. He expertly listened to what my goals were ( move without heart pain), and together tweaking meds, I achieved my main goal.
Then, in 2014 as a result of a car accident, I added yet another rare nerve pain condition. Over months,years and changing symptoms both Drs. Riber and Stanislaus listened to my original goal to move and keep active. I had a Spinal Cord Stimulator implanted in 2019 with pain relief. My symptoms stabilized, but with aging, added arthritis my pain signs changed again. No problem! I understood that meds needed to keep me active may not make all pain types disappear but all the doctors at this clinic made the right decisions to keep me active despite a disability.In past years (and currently in Slovenia) I have traveled through US, all of Canada, Europe, United Kingdom,Mexico and hopefully Asia and all because one new young doctor understands my pain conditions and what it takes to travel out of the US with appropriate medication coverage. Dr. Alan Rejonis can be asked ANYTHING. I admire the entire staff, respect Dr.Riber as one of my original heros, but now add my new Hero: Dr. Rejonis. I strongly recommend this practice.|The care I receive is exceptional! They listen to you concerns and the discussion a plan of action for you to understand and agree upon. I would highly recommend them.
The staff is also exceptionally friendly, courteous and knowledgeable.|I've had the best experience here. The staff are super professional and so friendly. Mr. Lee was a fresh face and super professional and made my experience way more relaxing and light hearted. MD Neeraj was amazing at breaking everything down step by step and making the experience seem less! Great job!|Palmetto Pain Management on 1st and 2nd floors. Everyone is so nice, respectful and understanding. Dr. Jennifer D. Stanislaus and her team are great, funny, respectful and kind. Thank you for everything. Linda Chapman.|I had a wonderful visit to PPM/CIPI. The care I received from Dr. Stanislaus was exceptional. She listened attentively to my concerns and provided personalized treatment that yielded positive results. The entire team at the clinic was friendly, displayed a high level of professionalism and made me feel comfortable throughout my visit. I left the clinic feeling better than I have in a very long time and with the utmost confidence in the care I will receive in the future!|I had my initial visit last wk and am 100% pleased w/ every health care member @ Palmetto Pain, esp Dr. Sriram. He exuded compassion, patience and expertise and I am looking forward to changes in treatment options. He clearly gives individualized care. As a retired/ disabled RN I have seen my share of incompetence and inefficiency in the healthcare field. Palmetto Pain in just one visit has restored my hope. I look forward to working w/ this excellent team to get my mobility and therefore my life improved!|Dr Stanislaus has been an amazing doctor. She makes me feel very comfortable and she listens to my concerns. I have been in pain for 2 years and she has been the only one to help me. If you are looking for a good doctor, she is the one. I travel 2 hours for care here.|PPM is an awesome pain management. been going for years and they always make u feel at home and very personable. I have met some good people that work there and they really care. I went to a couple others until I found a home with them..GREAT Dr's. I would refer anyone to them

Southern Coast Spine & Pain Specialists serves Summerville, SC and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified specialists combines years of clinical expertise with compassionate care to help patients overcome chronic and acute pain conditions. Located conveniently in Summerville's medical district, our practice has established itself as a trusted resource for individuals seeking relief from debilitating pain that impacts their quality of life.

At Southern Coast Spine & Pain Specialists, we provide COMPREHENSIVE pain management including interventional pain procedures, medication management, and cutting-edge advanced therapies. Our multidisciplinary approach addresses various pain conditions, including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that target the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Interventional Procedures

Our specialists are highly trained in performing minimally invasive interventional procedures, including epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and nerve blocks. These targeted treatments provide relief while minimizing recovery time and reducing the need for more invasive surgical options.

Advanced Treatment Options

We stay at the forefront of pain management by incorporating innovative therapies into our practice. Our advanced treatment options include regenerative medicine, neuromodulation techniques, and integrated physical therapy approaches that complement our interventional procedures.

Patient-Centered Care Philosophy

What sets Southern Coast Spine & Pain Specialists apart is our unwavering commitment to patient-centered care. We take the time to listen to our patients' concerns, thoroughly evaluate their conditions, and develop customized treatment plans that align with their goals and lifestyle needs. Our compassionate team guides patients through every step of their pain management journey.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 843-476-4702 or visit our website at https://socopain.com/. Our office is located at 435 N Cedar St, Summerville, SC 29483, with convenient parking and accessibility features for all patients.
column11: At Southern Coast Spine & Pain Specialists we provide COMPREHENSIVE pain management including interventional pain procedures, medication management, and cutting edge advanced therapies.

column40:
Dr. Schuyler is always personable, knowledgeable and willing to answer questions. Anytime I have a procedure he is very positive and makes me feel very comfortable. I love his PA, Casey, that I see. She is so compassionate and explains my options in a way that I can understand them. I appreciate her, making me feel that I am a part of the team. The office is always kind and helpful to me. I would highly recommend Dr. Schuyler.|I have been a patient of Dr Schuylers for a few years now, with a chronic condition, and have always had great care.  At my first consult appt he reviewed everything with me, my test results, diagnosis, options, and recommended procedure. He was very kind and thorough with his explanations. I have had a few procedures done by Dr Schuyler over these past few years, he and his team were always professional, kind, gentle and caring. I would recommend Dr Schuyler to anyone needing a pain management Dr.
The reception staff are also very friendly and knowledgeable.  Very willing to help.|Dr. Schuyler is caring, empathetic, jovial, and gentle!
Willing to get my pain under control! Appointments are easy to schedule and office visits are quick & efficient. I have been a patient for over four years and I will continue with him.|I've been a patient of Dr. Schuyler for nearly 5 years and I can honestly say that he's been the best doctor in treating my chronic back pain. He's understanding and caring. His staff is always on point, precise, efficient, and very personable. They are all understanding to my pain and sincerely care.  I would recommend him to anyone and everyone who needs a conservative, caring, and amazing doctor. They are the best!|My appointment with Dr Schuyler was a very good experience, he was exceptiona at going over the procedure and completely put my mind at rest. He answered all my questions and took his time gooing over my problem.  I was fortunate to get an appointment the next day for the injection.
On both occasions the staff were lovely and very professional.  I would definitely recommend this practice and Dr Schuyler and staff.|I've been a patient for a couple years now. I'm seen once a month for pain management. I've had several injections and nerve ablation done. I've seen Dr. Schuyler several times during these couple years. He's always  friendly and caring. Most of the time I see his PA, which I absolutely love! She's amazing! Staff is always welcoming and friendly. I haven't had any problems or issues with getting appointments or being seen in a timely manor. Most times I'm in and out within 20-30 minutes. I've recommended Dr. Schuyler to numerous family members and friends over the last couple years.|I've been a patient of Dr. Schuyler's for over 5 years now. When I came to him I was in tears from being in so much pain. I had several herniations in my back and could not function, let alone work. After 2 months of seeing Dr. Schuyler I was finally able to function day to day. Eventually, I was able to go back to work, and now I'm even in the gym again.  I now see him every few months for injections, and follow up appointments.

It's hard to find a doctor who not only knows what they are doing, but is also excellent at it. Normally, in Charleston, when you do find a doctor like that, they don't have an office that can actually get you in to be seen. Anytime I find myself needing an appointment, or have a new area of pain, they get me in quickly. Even the appointments are quick and efficient.

Most people set out to review a doctor's office when they're upset. I've had nothing but good experiences from him and his staff. Most of them will laugh and joke with me when I come in for a visit, or ask me how I've been.

Southern Coast has had such an amazing impact on my life. The staff and Dr. Schuyler have been nothing but kind, and caring since I've began seeing them.

I don't know what the other reviews are about, but if you're looking for someone who cares, and can actually see you in a good time frame, this is the place.|I have had nothing but good service here. Dr Schuyler is a great dr. He's easy to talk to and he takes the time to explain things well. He answers your questions and makes sure you understand the answer. Great bedside manner. Everyone at his office are just as great. They will treat you well from the PA's on down to the front desk. They're not overcrowded, well maybe a little around 12 but isn't everyone? But definitely better than 90 percent of the doctors that overbook. If you're looking for a Dr. I highly recommend Dr. Schuyler and his staff.

CMC Pain Management serves Myrtle Beach, SC and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our specialized team understands that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life, from your ability to work and enjoy recreational activities to getting restful sleep. We combine advanced diagnostic techniques with innovative treatment approaches to address the root causes of your discomfort rather than simply masking symptoms.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

At CMC Pain Management, we offer a wide range of treatments for various pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and pain related to injuries or surgical procedures. Our multidisciplinary approach may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and interventional techniques designed to provide both immediate relief and long-term pain reduction.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the pain. Our specialists take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop a personalized treatment plan that aligns with your goals and lifestyle. We work collaboratively with your primary care physician and other specialists to ensure coordinated care that addresses all aspects of your health and wellbeing.

Visit Our Pain Management Center

Location: 811 82nd Pkwy Suite B, Myrtle Beach, SC 29572, United States

Phone: +1 843-839-4598

Website: [https://www.conwaymedicalcenter.com/locations/cmc-pain-management/](https://www.conwaymedicalcenter.com/locations/cmc-pain-management/)

Don't let pain control your life any longer. Contact CMC Pain Management today to schedule a consultation with our experienced pain specialists and take the first step toward reclaiming your active lifestyle.
column11: Pain is a complex condition and can prevent you from doing the things you love. When you're in pain, it's hard to work, play or even sleep. At CMC Pain Management Center, we know the toll that pain can take on your life and we're here to help.

Palmetto Pain Center in Beaufort, South Carolina has been the region's premier destination for comprehensive pain management since 2004. Serving patients throughout Beaufort, Bluffton, Hilton Head, and all surrounding areas, our dedicated team led by Dr. Eller and Dr. White specializes in innovative interventional pain solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. As board-certified Interventional Pain Specialists, our physicians combine decades of experience with cutting-edge techniques to address chronic and acute pain conditions, helping patients regain mobility and improve their quality of life.

At Palmetto Pain Center, we pride ourselves on offering the full spectrum of advanced interventional pain procedures. Our state-of-the-art facility features two on-site Fluoroscopy Suites, enabling our specialists to perform precise, image-guided treatments with exceptional accuracy. This technology allows for minimally invasive procedures that target pain at its source, often providing relief where traditional methods have failed.

Our Expert Physicians

Dr. Eller and Dr. White bring exceptional credentials and compassionate care to every patient interaction. Their specialized training in interventional pain management techniques allows them to address complex pain conditions through targeted treatments rather than relying solely on medication management. This comprehensive approach helps patients achieve sustainable pain relief while minimizing dependence on prescription medications.

Serving Our Community Since 2004

As your local Pain Care Provider for nearly two decades, Palmetto Pain Center has established deep roots in the Lowcountry community. We understand the unique healthcare needs of our region and have built our practice around accessible, patient-centered care. Our convenient location at 41 Marshellen Dr A, Beaufort, SC 29902 serves as a central hub for patients throughout Beaufort County and beyond.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, visit palmettopaincenter.com or call us at (843) 522-3456. Our dedicated team is committed to helping you find effective solutions for your pain management needs.
column11: Dr. Eller and Dr. White are Interventional Pain Specialists who service Beaufort, Bluffton, Hilton Head and all surrounding areas. PPC is proud to be your local Pain Care Provider since 2004. PPC offers the full range of advanced Interventional Pain procedures with two on-site Fluoroscopy Suites.
