Southern Pain Specialists in Columbia, SC provides comprehensive pain management services to patients throughout the Midlands region. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians specializes in treating chronic and acute pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Since our founding, we have been committed to improving quality of life by addressing pain at its source rather than simply masking symptoms.

At Southern Pain Specialists, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain relief that combines interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative therapies. Our specialists are experts in treating conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. We utilize advanced diagnostic techniques to identify the precise cause of your discomfort and develop personalized treatment plans.

Our Approach to Patient Care

We believe in creating partnerships with our patients through education and shared decision-making. Our team takes the time to explain your condition, discuss treatment options, and address concerns so you can make informed choices about your care. This patient-centered philosophy has helped countless individuals regain function and return to activities they enjoy.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Our modern clinic at 7601 Two Notch Rd in Columbia features advanced diagnostic and treatment equipment in a comfortable, welcoming environment. We've designed our space to ensure privacy and convenience for all patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please call us at (803) 419-5345. You can also visit our website at www.sopain.com to learn more about our services and treatment options. Our office is conveniently located at 7601 Two Notch Rd, Columbia, SC 29223, with accessible parking and easy access from major roadways.
column11: Pain Management
column38: Elizabeth Peterson|Jk Vissage|Clarence Bennett|Fred Carleton|Pat Mae|Nate E|Michael Whetstine|John Elkins
column40:
I spent over 4 1/2 years seeing multiple doctors, both orthopedists and multiple pain management specialists and despite trying physical therapy, injections, blocks and medication I got absolutely no relief and none of the providers I was seeing fully explained what was wrong. In my first visit with Dr. Tuel, not only did my husband and I leave with an understanding of what my problem was but, we also had an understanding of what could be done to help me. Dr. Tuel tailored my treatment, explained what I could expect and reassured us that there were additional things we could try and reviewed them with us. He was very caring, gentle understanding and reassuring. Not only was I seen at the appointment time but, we were not rushed and Dr. Tuel and his staff treated us like we were the most important people there. In the short time I've been seeing Dr. Tuel I have improved more than I could ever have hoped. I can't thank Dr. Tuel enough!|I would like to thank Dr.Tuel and his Nurse Crystal and his beautiful Wife, When you walk in you're greeted with a smile and by name. You never have to wait long to be seen. Dr. Tuel gave me my life back. I used to be in the bed 80% of the time because the pain was so bad. In my opinion Dr.Tuel is the BEST!!! I know God had a hand in choosing Dr.Tuel for me;) My family also thanks you! If you want your life back and a Doctor who cares this is the place for you.|I am so glad we came to Southern Pain Specialist (SPS). The name specialist fits them properly. A correct and very thorough exam and analysis was performed to identify my wife's pain. The Staff is Top Gun performance from the moment you show up to the moment you leave. We look forward to our next visit and getting on the road to long-term treatment of my wife's pain. Thank you to all at SPS|Dr. Tuel solved severe back and neck pain (muscle spasms) that 2 other specialists could not. I am grateful! The pain was horrible.|Dr. Stephen Tuel and his staff are absolutely wonderful! While I was in his office, I got sick and the extra lengths they all went to for my husband and me was exemplary! They really are top notch and I highly recommend anyone in need of a pain specialist.

Whereas many doctors' offices are decorated nicely, but are cool in regards to the atmosphere, Southern Pain Specialists is decorated beautifully and possesses both charm and warmth. I felt a sense of peace the first time I walked through the door and it has continued on every visit since. In short, this office doesn't just look nice. It is nice.

The excellent customer service begins at check-in and is consistent throughout the entire visit. Dr. Tuel's bedside manner is one that I wish everyone in the medical field had. Some people in the medical field become hardened to those suffering with discomfort and pain. However, Dr. Tuel, with compassion, patiently and thoroughly explains everything in such a way that the only way a patient can leave his office without understanding their issue and treatment plan is by simply not listening at all.

Southern Pain Specialists deserves a 5 star rating only because that's the highest number they can get. As I stated earlier, I highly recommend any and everyone in need of a pain specialist to consider coming to the best. It will definitely be one of the best health decisions you will ever make!

Addition to my review as of January 2024:

For the first time in years, at least 4, I have been been able to get back into life, thanks to Dr. Tuel listening to me and working alongside my gastro specialists! My gastro doctor ran tests that made him think he'd found the root cause of my pain. He told me to share it with Dr. Tuel. Dr. Tuel ran his own tests and agreed with the gastro doctor that we had possibly found the culprit. He treated me that very day. That was almost 3 months ago.

I am back to enjoying my family, being a
wife, mother and Gigi! I'm back to some cooking, baking, light housework and a little traveling. I am so very thankful for Dr. Stephen Tuel!!!|I started seeing Dr. Tuel a few months ago and since then all I can say is he's the most compassionate and caring doctor I've ever been fortunate to have.

It's not easy having chronic pain and finally having a doctor take the time to try and help me live a better life has truly been a God send.

He's entire staff have went out of their way to help and communicate with me. Other practices claim that they are the best and all that but talk is cheap. When I'm really in need few doctors have shown much interest in helping me.

If only medical professionals could realize just how much of an impact they could have with a patients quality of life by just trying to help and to listen to what the patient has to say. That is the one thing I'll say about Dr. Tuel is that he actually listens to what I have to say and seems to truly value my feedback.  He's extremely down to earth and easy to talk with.

If you're tired of hearing that other places will help you manage your pain but you just haven't been taken seriously then I would say you need to give Dr. Tuel and his practice a chance.  I feel completely confident in having him manage my care and would recommend him to anyone that is needing help.

Thank you from the bottom of my heart to him and his entire staff.  I hope they realize just how much they have helped me and I look forward to growing our relationship.

Thank you so much for everything you've done for me.|Dr. Tuel is an amazing doctor.  I had nothing but top notch, no nonsense care from him and his staff. From check in to checkout each visit was smooth and I barely had to wait.  He really takes the time to listen to you and thoroughly explain everything.  Please don't go anywhere else for your pain management, you will be doing yourself a disservice.  Thank you Dr. Tuel and Staff!!!|He really cares and tries to help you as best he can. His staff are fast and caring. They talk to you as an individual not as a number. I just want people to know his lady at front who runs the office cares about all the patients, she tries to find the best way to get your bill paid. When you give them time she finds away to help.

Pain Specialists of Charleston serves North Charleston, SC and surrounding areas with comprehensive pain management solutions. If you know pain, it's time you know Pain Specialists of Charleston. Our team of Board Certified Physicians is dedicated to helping patients overcome chronic pain without relying on surgery or habit-forming medications. We've established ourselves as leaders in interventional pain treatments, combining medical expertise with compassionate care to help patients reclaim their quality of life.

At our state-of-the-art outpatient facility located at 2695 Elms Plantation Blvd in North Charleston, we offer the latest interventional treatments for various painful conditions. Our approach is designed to address both recent injuries and complex cases involving patients who have undergone multiple surgeries. By utilizing innovative, non-surgical treatment approaches, we provide effective solutions for back pain and chronic pain conditions that have been resistant to conventional therapies.

Comprehensive Treatment Approach

What sets Pain Specialists of Charleston apart is our commitment to staying at the forefront of medical research in pain management. Our physicians continuously incorporate the most up-to-date interventional techniques to ensure patients receive optimal care. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we develop personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs and circumstances.

Patient-Centered Care

Our practice focuses on creating a supportive environment where patients feel heard and understood. We take the time to thoroughly evaluate each case, considering medical history, previous treatments, and individual goals. This comprehensive assessment allows us to recommend the most appropriate interventional procedures to effectively manage and alleviate pain.

Ready to take control of your pain? Contact Pain Specialists of Charleston today at (843) 818-1181 to schedule an appointment. Visit our website at painchas.com to learn more about our services and how we can help you find relief from chronic pain and improve your quality of life.
column11:
If you know pain, it's time you know Pain Specialists of Charleston.

From interventional pain treatments to the latest medical research, our Board Certified Physicians specialize in helping our patients say goodbye to pain without surgery or habit-forming drugs.

Pain Specialists of Charleston offers the latest, most up-to-date interventional treatments to alleviate and manage back pain and chronic pain in our state-of-the-art outpatient facility.

From patients with recent injuries to those who have had multiple surgeries, we treat a wide variety of painful conditions using innovative, non-surgical treatment approaches.

Call us today at (843) 818-1181 to schedule an appointment, get chronic pain relief, and reclaim your quality of life.
column38: Adrian Meadows|Bill Grimes|Jack Nickel|andrew burbank|Alex Milicic|Shelley|Lisa Nick|Dalton Swanson
column40:
I was referred here by SC Sports Medicine and Orthopedics for cervical epidural steroid injection for chronic upper back/neck pain with numbness and tingling in my left fingers. Prior to coming here I never read any of the reviews and for me I think that was good. If I read some of the reviews I probably wouldn't have come, and that would have been unfortunate for me. My experience has been really great. I was extremely nervous about the prospect of having a needle inserted into my neck. And I expressed my anxiety to the front office staff lady, and she was reassuring and that helped settle me down. The medical staff that took my vitals and started my IV was also professional and supportive. At this point I was completely calm. Then they took me to the procedure room where Dr. Vranian and his team explained everything that would happen and what I might feel/experience. It wasn't painful for me as I was sedated. Sure you are aware that something is going into your neck/back but honestly a root canal was more painful than the injection (sorry orthodontists). But that was my experience. Post procedure I'm still feeling better than I had. Periodically I may experience slight numbness, but it doesn't last long. I'm not sure if perhaps they made changes as a result of some of the negative reviews, but I was extremely satisfied with what they provided for me. I also know when you're in chronic pain ordinary tasks become ten times harder. So I just try to manage my expectations and I appreciate every second of relief I get. Good luck to everyone on this chronic pain journey and thank you Pain Specialists of Charleston for providing this service.|I was in a car accident and went in for an MRI and went in recently for massage therapy. The massage therapist was the best I've had. I am glad I found her! Honestly, it has been a great experience all around.  You never know what you are going to have to deal with, and it has been nice to deal with nice people along the way. Thank you for helping me through this! I appreciate it!|My  wife and I see Dr.Tavel and he's absolutely incredible! He's very knowledgeable and and personable, making you feel very comfortable. He's spot on with pain management and services and there's no one else we would see! The new psychologist they have on staff is absolutely incredible! We highly recommend Pain Specialists Of Charleston!!!!|They did not help at all just told me to get in injection that they were told at scheduling that I had the injection covered just needed pain relief so I can work and sleep not in pain. Apprently even if you can bearly walk or at a pretty constant 7 pain wise all they can do is a shot. Don't recommend as it was just a waste of time and money.|I was given multiple tests through Neuro, one of which I was told it takes 3-5 days to get the results. It has been over a month and I had my appointment last week and while I was 10mins away they called and canceled my appointment. They told me that the results weren't in. How do you not know if the results are not in at least the day before your patients appointment, and to cancel it 25min before the appointment!? Now, a week later and they will not reach out to me to reschedule, and I have called dozens of times with no answer.  I am a veteran so I am reporting them today to Patient advocacy to make sure no one else from base gets referred to them.|Helpful and friendly staff! Dr. Drakely is my Pain Management Specialist and is very thorough compassionate and understanding. He's been of great help for me especially with my many complex medical issues!|I can't express just how fantastic this office is! When you go to the doctor with pain, you want a friendly environment and that's exactly what you get at Dr.Tavel's office! Everyone is professional, friendly, and kind! From the front office staff to the nurses, the PAs and the doctors, everyone is fantastic! The level of care is wonderful!|Veteran review,
I have been a patient here for six years, the sole location I have seen for my back pain. I spoke with the director today, and they are refusing to help me for a Nexus letter for the VA. She refused to provide any written policy as "its not a written standard but rather spoken." She mentioned paying another agency to write the letter but was mute when I asked why I could not pay them. It is evident they don't care about me but rather are solely concerned with things they can bill to my insurance. If you could potentially need medical evidence for the department of Veteran Affairs in the future, I suggest utilizing another clinic within the Tricare network.

Lake Carolina Pain & Spine Center serves Columbia, SC and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified specialists combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Located conveniently at 1821 Clemson Rd #2 in Columbia, we've established ourselves as a trusted healthcare partner for residents throughout Richland County seeking relief from debilitating pain.

At Lake Carolina Pain & Spine Center, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain treatment, utilizing both interventional procedures and medication management. Our specialists are experienced in treating various conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome. We develop personalized treatment plans that may include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and other evidence-based therapies.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our patient-centered philosophy ensures that we take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop treatment strategies aligned with your goals. Our modern facility is designed for your comfort, and our friendly staff strives to make every visit as pleasant and stress-free as possible.

Accessibility and Convenience

Conveniently located in northeast Columbia, our clinic offers flexible scheduling options to accommodate busy lifestyles. New patients are welcomed, and we work with most major insurance providers. For appointments or inquiries, contact us at (803) 708-6160 or visit our comprehensive website at https://lcpainspine.com/ where you can learn more about our services and even request appointments online.

Our Commitment to Excellence

Lake Carolina Pain & Spine Center is committed to providing the highest standard of care using the latest advancements in pain management. Our physicians regularly participate in continuing education and research to bring innovative solutions to our patients. We believe in empowering patients through education about their conditions and treatment options, fostering a collaborative approach to pain management that leads to better outcomes and improved quality of life.

column40:
THIS is the BEST Pain Management Clinic I have ever been to!! Dr Koranloo is awesome!! He also has a great staff that are always friendly!!|My husband has been coming here for years with no issues until this spring and summer where Charlotte the office manager did not return his call and get him on the schedule for his back injections. When we finally got in, she complained to us about the doctor not giving her time off and how she was going to leave soon. It was very unprofessional. We finally got him scheduled after his hip surgery and he came down with Covid and had active symptoms. I called and told them he wouldn't be able to come in. She said she would call me back to reschedule. She never did. I called again and got him an appointment. When my husband called to confirm, she informed him that he has to pay $150 no show fee because he had Covid? Beware- a practice that would put its patients' health in jeopardy by forcing people to come in with communicable diseases or pay $150 is not someone who should be treating patients; especially when you consider many pain management patients are immune compromised. Charlotte also told my husband she had told me there would be a $150 fee. She did not. She lies about the patients and family members. She gossips about the office girls and the doctor. Find a more professional practice.|I have dealt with lower back pain for 8 years. I have seen multiple orthopedic surgeons, tried yoga for 6 months, did chiropractic care for 7 months, went to 2 different physical therapists and did multiple rounds with each. I had tried basically everything, not to mention other pain management doctors and using the medicines they prescribed.

I wasn't until that I started seeing Dr. Koranloo that I started to get longer term relief. I gave me a level of patient care that other health care professionals had not given. I hate it took so long to find him, but I'm glad that I did.

If you're dealing with lower back pain....he's the man.|When you walk in to the office you're automatically greeted by two wonderful caring ladies. The office is immaculate. Dr. Koranloo takes his time to listen to you before he responds with advice. I recommend this clinic to anyone and everyone. I've always been given the best  treatment solutions.|Best of the best. Got in right away after my referral. Have suffered with severe pain over two years with severe buttocks pain and lower back pain. Multiple physicians, tests, imaging, PT, chiropractor, ice, heat, TENS unit, massage, muscle relaxers, pain medication, bed rest, etc without much relief. Turns out the primary cause of my pain was overlooked by everyone except the chiropractor and here- sacroiliac joint and hip. Instead my pain was being blamed on old back injuries by others. Glad I got a second opinion. The doctor listened very closely and was the first to really do a physical assessment- actually touch my muscles, joints, reflexes, strength, gait, etc. Scheduled for a procedure right away.|I could go on forever about Dr.  Koranloo and his team with how professional and knowledgeable they are about this practice.  If you have pain anywhere and you need a pain management doctor Lake Carolina Pain and Spine is the place to go.  I highly recommend this place.  I'm a testimony.

Keep up the amazing job!!|Lake Carolina Pain and Spine offer compassionate care that you absolutely will have a hard time finding anywhere else. I've had numerous complex health problems ranging from neck, joint, and nerve pain. Dr. Koranloo (Dr. K) takes his time with you and allows you to explain your health concerns and executes a well articulated plan for you to get back to a healthier place if possible. He has great bedside manner, and listens to concerns. He also offers great feedback and is incredibly knowledgeable. In my experience, I've been offered compassionate care with every visit, a listening ear, and helpful medical advice to help me make informed decisions about my health. Great people, and amazing Doctor, I highly recommend.|From my first time, I felt at that I was in the right place. The two ladies were courteous, friendly and professional . They made me  feel welcome.. Doctor Koranloo has given me a new lease on my life. There isn't enough stars to rate him. I truly appreciate all the care they have given me. Lake Carolina Pain is Awesome !!

Piedmont Comprehensive Pain Management Group, LLC serves Anderson, SC and surrounding communities with specialized pain management solutions. Founded by board-certified physicians with extensive expertise in advanced, minimally invasive techniques, our practice delivers personalized care for patients experiencing various types of pain. At Piedmont Comprehensive Pain Management Group, we believe in a comprehensive approach to pain treatment. Our team of specialists works collaboratively to address pain at its source, utilizing the latest evidence-based techniques and technologies. We prioritize conservative treatment methods whenever possible, focusing on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

Specialized Services

Our practice offers expertise in treating numerous pain conditions, including:

- Chronic back and neck pain

- Joint pain and arthritis

- Neuropathic pain conditions

- Post-surgical pain

- Sports injuries

- Work-related injuries

Patient-Centered Philosophy

We understand that living with pain affects every aspect of your life. Our goal is to diagnose, treat, and manage your pain efficiently and effectively, helping you return to the activities you enjoy. Each treatment plan is developed with your specific goals and lifestyle in mind, ensuring the most appropriate interventions for your situation.

Visit Our Practice

Located at 100 Healthy Way #1260, Anderson, SC 29621, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide the highest standard of care. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at 864-225-3551 or visit our website at [piedmontpain.com](http://piedmontpain.com/).

column40:
DR. Sarah Hensley  is my favorite  Doctor! I have MS and if anyone understands MS it is a challenge  to find doctors. Dr. Hensley listens to me . She is very compassionate and so knowledgeable. She puts her heart into her work. Her staff ( nurses, all staff) are so special too if I went in there so sad they would not ignore me. They would try to cheer me up. A+A+A+ sincerely Lia White.....|I started having severe back pain. I scheduled an appointment to see Dr. Han.
He is very caring and said he could help me. For starters while waiting for a MRI results he prescribed a medication that has
Helped me.. After my MRI I will see him again..|I had an appointment with my pain management doctor today. I was supposed to see Dr. Han.  Or I was supposed to have an appointment. My second visit with this doctor was going to be back in April but I had to change it. When I called back to reschedule they gave me the date of June 4th which is today at 1:45. I called twice to confirm the appointment. Once last week and again Monday. They confirmed today's appointment time in both phone calls. I get to the office and I am told at check in there is no record of an appointment in their computer or written down. The woman at the front desk who scheduled and confirmed today's appointment talked to someone else to see if they could work me in. Nope. They wouldn't make any attempt to work me in while already at the office because I didn't have a voicemail or appointment card to prove I was supposed to be there today. Well, when you call and make an appointment by phone or answer the phone before it goes to voicemail there will be no appointment card or voicemail to show. Looking at reviews for their office online, apparently other patients have had this problem with them. I am so frustrated from not getting the help I need and from doctors not taking me seriously when I say I'm in pain and it's getting worse that I am seriously considering going online and buying pain meds from one of those websites you don't need a prescription for and whatever happens is what happens and I'm willing to take that chance even if it just gives me five minutes of relief.|Very clean and polite. Everyone there have been so nice to me. When I met Dr Loudermilk he had all my records and he and his assistant knew what and how to address my pain. Thank You, Your Assistant and Your Staff|My experience with my doctor(Dr J) has been GREAT, along with his nurses, but upon my follow up appointment, I was pulling into the parking lot, and at the time didn't not realize it was a worker of piedmont management. When I pulled in, I left my car door open to transfer my child to my mom in her vehicle. Upon doing so the lady is in her car wavering her hand up at me, because I had left my door open. I proceeded to close my door, and walk into the office. Only to be checked in by her team member in the front desk(she was great!), further more then proceeded to talk about me to her team mate, as if I was not in the office and could not hear what was being said about me, or as if it wasn't 7:45am and there wasn't a FULL parking lot with MULTIPLE spots. I urged to make a formal complaint, due to being so unprofessional, and just plain rude. I was told "I will talk with her".|3/5.  More thoughts on the following day. I don't want to complain without offering a solution. This is only a Suggestion... incorporate enough time to complete paperwork in the time for appointment. For example, since my appointment was at 10.30, making my appointment at 10a would've been a good idea. What you think?  Giving two appointment times on 2 different days using 2 different ways to communicate can be time consuming and confusing. What you think?

My PCP sent a referral to Piedmont Comprehensive Pain and after 2 months I got an appointment after I made several calls to make this happen. My appt was scheduled at 10.30; I arrived at 10.30. So what's the problem... right? Receptionist asked why I arrived at 10.30 because a voicemail was left for me to come in early to complete paperwork, and I would have to reschedule. This is laughable!!|I was referred to them from the VA. The doctors are really nice and are easy to talk to. My paper work for accommodations for work, was never turned in on time, but the office.
I had to have an MRI done and I had to coordinate the MRI, myself between the VA and doctor's office. For approximately three weeks I had to call between the VA and doctors office, because they did not read the packet the VA sent them when I started there, explaining what they are supposed to do. After finally having the MRI completed, I have tried multiple times to make a follow up appointment and no one will answer or return my phone call. If you are being sent here RUN! You will suffer in pain before they call you back.|These people never call back, I mean never! Nor do they pick up the phone! The worst! Love Dr. Cramer but the entire staff needs to be replaced!

column40:
I have been going to premier pain solutions for a few years. I have never been to a pain management so this was my first one! I definitely would recommend going here! From the time you walk in the front door, till the time you leave everyone is so friendly, they listen to your concers! Dr. B is the best! When it comes time for injections he is gentle and explains everything well!|The Doctor was very attentive and explained some things we may need, after .my consultation.  After test are done, I return in 1 month.  I didn't break in a month, so I can't expect a fix in 1 month . Looking forward to relief over the next few months .|IMPORTANT UPDATE::

I wish I had found this practice years ago, this is truly a first class, pain management facility, focusing on identifying the causes of pain and creating a plan for targeted pain, relief, with many many state of the art, new technologies and techniques and knowledge of how to treat the pain, They seem interested in actually treating the pain, versus just pushing pharmaceuticals. If you truly want your pain addressed, I would highly recommend making an appointment, you will not be disappointed. I am very grateful to be a patient.
UPDATE::
Well, I cannot believe how wrong I was!! They don't listen, don't care, and just want to use as much of your insurance on procedures as possible, and make you give a urine sample every time you go in, even if they aren't prescribing you any opiate!! Yesterday, December 10 was my last appointment, after arriving to my appointment with the building sign saying they have moved, no one received an email letter or anything that they were moving, and I know this because four of us arrived at the new location at the same time And no one knew that they had moved in the provider wasn't even there! I had a severe allergic reaction to a pain, patch, and not one person called to check to see how I was or if it was getting better, I had to call poison control myself. These are the sheep and wolves clothing.! After speaking with the other four patients while waiting for the provider to show up, we The exact same experiences, they don't care!! i'm sorry I was so wrong in my initial review, I was very hopeful and thoroughly frustrated and disappointed. For almost a year now, I have presented 10+ Pain, requested tests to be performed because something is definitely not right, they have no interest in helping people just making money off of their procedures, highly recommend you find an alternative, If you want doctors and nurses that will actually listen to you and address your needs. Good luck.|This was my first visit with Dr. Baksh at the Regent Park office, so I was a little uncomfortable in the unfamiliar surroundings. I was
soon put at ease by the friendliness of the staff. This office is much closer to my home than the Greenwood office where I have been going for years. Dr. Baksh is a great doctor and I would go to the Ashville office to see him if I had to!|I had a total of 3 visits with Javid. The office temperature thermometer was over 80 in the summer, so it actually felt hotter. They claimed the air conditioner was broken but that was story months ago and I have asthma. Not only does he not listen, he does not explain imaging results. My last visit ended with him being pissed off and upset, flailing his arms in the air at me because I told him my neurosurgeon preferred I go to another clinic to receive my cervical epidural. He can't control his emotions so why would I feel comfortable with you sticking a needle in my neck. They kept pressuring me to go ahead and get the injection before I left his office but I said no. They even went as far as to try and hang my pain medication over my head by saying they won't refill my medication. I was disgusted at that point and told them I don't care about that! I'm going to do what my neurosurgeon tells me to do. They even began to bad mouth her. You will never see me again and I will tell others of your behavior!|Dr Baksh is the BEST! When I met him I was in horrible shape and barely getting around with a cane and walker. The pain doctors I saw before him, just threw pills at you and didn't offer any real hope. Dr Baksh really works so hard to get you back on your feet.  While I'll always have spinal problems.  I'm doing better than I have in years. And it's so great to have an awesome doctor, that offers real solutions that get you living again. I have been with him for years.  And highly recommend him. The office staff is also amazing!|I highly recommend this medical facility for any of your pain needs.  Their staff are very knowledgeable and treats you with dignity and respect. The facility is very clean and thorough for their patients. The doctor uses various methods of treatments that's suitable for each individual patient. If you have any needs for pain management Premier Pain Solutions would be the first for my families pain medical needs.|DR BAKSH was very Nice, as was the front desk check in, and nurses. Went in to address shoulder Pain, and took care of it rite away, VERY PROFESSIONAL!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND
If your battling any pain issues you need to get in and be treated. Quality of Life improvement.
Scheduling was very easy, MRIs, procedures, short waits compared to other places. Schedule your next appointment today.

Trident Pain Center West Columbia serves the West Columbia, SC area with specialized pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Located in the heart of West Columbia, our center has established itself as a trusted resource for individuals seeking relief from chronic and acute pain conditions that impact their quality of life.

Why suffer from pain? Many people experience neck or back pain at some point in their life, and this pain may take many forms. It may be short-lived or long-lasting, mild or severe. At Trident Pain Center, we understand that your pain is unique, which is why our pain management treatment plans are carefully tailored to address your individual needs.

Our team of board-certified specialists utilizes advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment approaches to help patients regain control of their lives. From medication management to minimally invasive procedures, we offer comprehensive solutions for various pain conditions.

Our Approach to Pain Relief

Trident Pain Center offers a variety of services designed to target the source of your pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Our multidisciplinary approach combines medical expertise with compassionate care, ensuring that each patient receives personalized attention throughout their treatment journey.

We specialize in treating conditions including but not limited to:

Visit Our West Columbia Location

Why Suffer From Pain?
Many people experience neck or back pain at some point in their life and this pain may take many forms. It may be short-lived or long-lasting, mild or severe. Since your pain is unique, a pain management treatment plan must be tailored to address your individual needs. Trident Pain Center offers a variety of services.
column38: Gena Ruf|Leigh Padgett|Mommy_B _Right|Julie Whatley|Jennifer Graham|Miriam H Samuel (Peaches)|Jeff mathis|Sharon Fisher
column40:
Make sure you READ your visit notes. I came to this clinic by ref from Dr for consistent pain. They decided to give me an epidural they gave me sedation medicine to relax me which was either too soon before epidural or amount was not enough. I was in SEVERE pain I was crying. While "recovering" in waiting room a gentleman nurse (his name was not Hannah) went over all my discharge information. Later, I read my visit summary and a nurse Hannah wrote that at time of discharge I said I had received greater than 80% relief WHICH I DID NOT SAY NOR DID I HAVE RELIEF. I wasn't even asked if I had any relief. Even my driver said I never said that. When I called the office manager she said she would have to look into why they used that "verbiage" and would call me back. Here we are 5 days after I called and still have not heard back from them nor have my notes been updated. Those notes are what are submitted to insurance and primary Doctor. They lied claiming I had relief when I didn't. The Pain Dr even said it would be a few days to a week before I saw any relief so how could I possibly have had any relief immediately after the epidural. I advised my primary of all of this and he apologized for the horrible experience I had and said he would not send me or anyone else back there. I would advise to stay clear of this place. I had heard from other people how unsatisfied they were with Trident, I wish I would have listened.|I had a terrible experience with Dr Devin Antonovic. I am a breast cancer survivor and I have been left with chronic pain in both upper arms & hands from radiation. My surgeon sent me to him to test a stimulator implanted to help with pain.  I felt that he verbally attacked me due to a medication I was currently on. I was defeated before we even started. I will not be going back.|Let me just start by saying that PAIN doesn't always look or feel the same to everyone..... with that being said in this photo below you see the face of myself in severe pain to the point I'm literally crying silently in front of my own husband because all I did was trim some of his hair and that's all it took for me to hurt so badly within 3-5 minutes , seems like such a simple task ,but for myself not so much.. you see i have degenerative disc's and bone spurs in the thorasic region of my spine as well as arthritis in my si joint and my lower lumbar section has something else I can't remember honestly I've been told I have so many different things going on with my back it's hard to keep up.. im only 35 and I feel just like my 58 year old mother ON A DAILY BASIS! I had a tree fall on me at age 11 it's a wonderful i came out not so harmed and alive, multiple work related accidents,  car wrecks, God only knows how many random falls ive taken for no reason whatsoever just walking.... simply walking i get a sharp sudden pain in my "tailbone" that causes me to immediately stop in place and be unable to move.. brain and spine doctor said this is drop foot stemming from my si joint .... I simply bend over and the thorasic region of my spine "pops and cracks" 10 times in 3-4 different places..I WALK AROUND SWEARING MY HIP OR TAILBONE IS FREAKING BROKE...everytime i barely move my tailbone/hip/si joint whatever pops and cracks... I struggle with pain DAILY, I can't sleep at night bc i am in pain and can't get comfortable. If I do sleep, most times I wake up crying in pain. It's not always so easy to just "get up and just go to the e.r." either, and they have more important things to worry about than for myself to go in there how ever many times needed bc im in pain. (Yeah I actually stop to think about that! Insane right!?) THIS IS NOT FREAKING NORMAL...... But for all these doctors to tell me what's wrong with me, then refer me to pain management and pain management basically not give a flying crap and basically REFUSE treatment bc "you're 35 im not giving you pain meds and an ablation is too extreme for someone your age" and then ALL BUT called a junkie and told to "make lifestyle changes,lose weight , quit smoking and ill stop being in pain, you don't need pills, you want to be around for your kids im not giving you narcotics" WHAT!? Are you freaking kidding me.. first off, I am quiting smoking slowly, I am losing weight*thank you ozempic* i have made lifestyle changes, i do try to excersise but it causes only more pain for DAYS, I have specifically sought after some course of treatment for quite some time now and spent years being told " there's nothing wrong with me" , I have specifically stated i don't want to be opioid dependent the way my mother has been forced to for over 20 years due to not being treated medically/surgically the way she was supposed to. Yes I finally through my doctor found something that works (5/325 oxycodone/tylenol ) *woohoo omg i can actually freakin function and spend time with my children happily instead of suffering in silence (bc they notice it all), omg I can actually get things done around my house and not be in complete agony* OK GREAT,FINALLY a medication IS IN FACT HELPING , bc God knows the 14 other medications I've been told to try haven't done a damned thing!* So I want to personally thank Trident Pain Center ON MCSWAIN DR. IN WEST COLUMBIA for NOT treating me the way I was told I needed treatment by lexington brain and spine (pain management,  pain medication and an ablation to kill the nerves that are affecting my pain). Thank you for NOT prescribing anything let alone what I actually need a refill on to function daily the way my 35 year old body freakin "should. " THANK YOU FOR NOT DOING YOUR FREAKING JOB, THANK YOU FOR NOW MAKING ME BE IN SUCH PAIN FOR DAYS bc I havent had medicine to help me function, THANK YOU for making it to where I couldn't do a simple "craft" with my kids this weekend, THANK YOU for making me have to hide my pain AGAIN so that my kids don't see|My husband went and they did nothing for him!!! Doctor was nice and seemed like he was going to help him but didn't. Medications never got sent in to pharmacy and my husband was seen last Thursday. I even called and left a message and still nothing. Haven't heard anything about doing PT. Haven't gotten TENS unit. Can't do injection in his back for over 2 weeks!! Very bad experience!!  Don't go if you need immediate relief because you won't get it!!|While the doctors are nice and take their time talking with you, they don't tell you about the immense pain you will be in during and after an epidural injection. The epidural helped the shooting pain down my arms but didn't touch the neuropathy. I still have neck pain which was to be expected. They prescribed me medication to alleviate my pain, however, it is currently helping no one. The P.A. won't return the pharmacist's calls for confirmation of the dosage of the prescription. The Pharmacy will not fill it without speaking to him. They have sent Trident Pain Center West Columbia 2 request for a return call and I have called once and messaged them per the Pharmacist's request. So basically my "pain management clinic" isn't managing my pain at all. This situation is very ironic after being told "pain contracts are really about good communication".
If good communication and actually having your pain managed is your goal, don't come here. They will give you the warm and fuzzies like they care but then leave you in pain (it's now been 5 days since the first request for a call back) because they refuse to pick up a phone to call a pharmacy. . Oh well, I was in pain before I came here so it's just more of same. Just keep your expectations on the floor and if you are lucky you might be pleasantly surprised or you might get exactly what you expected in the first place.|The staff is very caring, helpful and friendly.   The staff work very well together, this creates a positive office environment.
This team of wonderful people are working together to give the best possible care to their patients.

Having pain disorders issues is  a terrible disease, that is hard to treat!!!
In most cases there is no cure.

For example, some people CAN NOT take steroid medications or NSAIDs.   The use of these medications is one of the most preferred treatments for chronic pain.  For example steroid shots on nerve blockers are offered here.

It is the goal of these doctors, at the Trident Pain Management Center's to help their patient live productive lifestyles, as pain free as possible.

This can be frustrating and challenging to both the doctors and the patients, when the above mentioned medications can not be used.
The doctors and physician assistants, at this Trident Pain Center work hard at facing this challenges.   They try to reach the goals of each individual patient.

Thanks you, to the whole entire team at The Trident Pain Center in Lexington, SC.|Had an appointment today with Dr A. Recently had back surgery a year ago and surgeon recommended pain treatment, Ive been in pain for over a year now and the facility could care less. Had to sign a form to release my MRI images they brought the paper in for me to sign and that was the last I saw of them. No talk about sending any medicine over to help my pain but instead had to pay $50 for them to not care at all. Worst place ever they do not care.|Wonderful doctors and staff. Very knowledgeable and empathetic to your pain. They have many options for individualized treatment and work with you to help you live your best life.

column2: Atlantic Coast Spine & Pain Center: R. Blake Kline, MD
column3:
Atlantic Coast Spine & Pain Center serves Conway, South Carolina with specialized interventional pain management services under the expert direction of Dr. R. Blake Kline. Established with a commitment to improving quality of life for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions, our center offers comprehensive treatment options utilizing the latest medical advancements. Our patient-centered approach focuses on minimally invasive procedures designed to provide lasting relief while reducing dependency on pain medications.

Dr. R. Blake Kline, MD was raised in Clemson, South Carolina and brings a wealth of local knowledge and medical expertise to his practice. He earned his Bachelor of Science degree from Coastal Carolina University and his Medical Doctorate from the prestigious Medical University of South Carolina. With extensive experience in both anesthesiology and interventional pain management, Dr. Kline made the decision in 2012 to focus exclusively on improving patients' lives through specialized pain management techniques when he joined Florence Neurosurgery and Spine as Director of Interventional Pain Management. In 2015, he relocated his practice to Conway, SC to better serve the local community.

Professional Credentials

Dr. Kline's distinguished career includes several notable achievements and positions:

  • Diplomate of the American Board of Anesthesiology

  • Former Chief of Anesthesiology at Aiken Regional Hospital

  • Former Chief of Anesthesiology at Carolinas Regional Hospital, Florence

Our Approach to Pain Management

At Atlantic Coast Spine & Pain Center, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our treatment protocols are individually tailored to address specific pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndromes. We utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and innovative treatment modalities to identify and address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Contact Information

Location: 2767 Cultra Rd, Conway, SC 29526, United States

Phone: +1 843-438-8470

Website: www.atlanticcoastpain.com
column11:
R. Blake Kline, MD was raised in Clemson, South Carolina.
He holds a B.S. degree from Coastal Carolina University, SC, and an M.D. from the Medical University of South Carolina.
He has practiced both anesthesiology and interventional pain management.
In 2012 he decided to focus exclusively on improving the lives of his patients through interventional pain management by joining Florence Neurosurgery and Spine, as Director of Interventional Pain Management. In 2015 he relocated his practice to Conway, SC.
Dr. Kline has held several distinguished positions and honors throughout his career,

Diplomate of the American Board of Anesthesiology
Chief of Anesthesiology at Aiken Regional Hospital and Carolinas Regional Hospital, Florence.

column40: I have been seeing Dr. Kline for ten years. I had an extremely bad accident. The staff has always been pleasant and umderstanding in meeting my pain issues.They explain all the procedures carefully so i can understand what is happening.i would recommend this pain management office to anyone if you are experiencing any kind of pain or trauma.Dr Kline is a wonderful doctor.|Absolutely. Could not ask for a better pain specialist? Dr. Klein and his associates are amazing, caring, and actually won't to work with you to get rid of your pain instead of just throwing pills at you.|Refuse to treat pain without injections. I have trypanophobia. Diagnosed 30 years ago. Did therapy for it and tried hypnosis. So it is not new. Yet, I was refused an appointment because I have a severe reaction to needles and injections. Staff claim that is the "only" pain management they do.|The waiting room is so very annoying.  They have a tv on at the same time as music that is played so loud that you can't hear anything but the music.  Is this a Doctor's office or a night club?|I have always received excellent and compassionate care from Dr. Kline.  He's at the top of the list of the best doctors I've ever seen.  He expertly treats me on the occasions I've received interventional procedures.  His OR nurses ensure that I feel comfortable and are quick to return my call if I have a question.  I also receive excellent and informative care from his PAs, Miriam and Nick.  They both offer me active solutions and a treatment plan for specific issues.  They really listen to me and never make me feel rushed.  I can't say enough good things about their outstanding practice.|All staff is always so courteous and friendly from the front desk to the nursing staff and PA Miriam. Everyone has been awesome. They are always willing to answer any questions I have and have excellent communication skills. I'm so glad I found this office when first moving to SC. Dr. Warden did my recent epidural and it really helped. I can't thank him enough for finally giving me some pain relief.|After 3 months of pain in my hip and not sleeping I went to Dr.Kline.  I am totally impressed by him and all his staff.  I've been to Orthos and surgeons, etc but he knew exactly what the problem was and praying now for 2 days no pain.  He is amazing doctor and knows all the body parts.  His office and staff are the best and very competent.  I grew up having all my docs from John's Hopkins and to me Dr. Kline ranks up there with outstanding excellent incredible doctors.  Thank you ever so much and praying my hip pain is gone.|Can't give them 4 stars. Doctor was professional, explained the procedure clearly. However the staff....very unprofessional. You don't talk about a patient at any point in time. They are there to give a service NOT AN OPINION. I will never return, in fact I cancelled my follow up appointment. There are many spine centers both Conway and Myrtle Beach. No need to go to a place where the staff is so unprofessional. Talking about a patient right in front of another patient! Seriously?? Disgusting. My daughter said she over heard them talking about me after my procedure. She was going to confront the staff but decided not to.  Too many good and professional spine places to go to.  No need to be insulted with background talk about a patient. My suggestion?? Grow up  kids. You should all be fired.

column40:
This office has done a complete turn around!  EVERYONE here is knowledgeable, super kind, and they've gone out of their way to help me.  I no longer have to take any medication.  I'm doing different injections to control the pain, and it's working well.
Dr. Z is so kind and seems truly caring about my health and comfort.  He did an ablation procedure on me today, and the appointment went great!  He explained everything as he was doing it, and it made the visit pleasurable.
The medical technician was fantastic!  Full of personality and truly caring!
Lori at the front desk was amazing and I am truly appreciative of her.  The sweet girl that checked me in was kind and considerate, too!
I'm so happy and fortunate the office is now running things as they should.
Dr. Z...please stay and don't leave!  This place is finally running accordingly, and it's a pleasure to be with you!
Thank you from the bottom of my heart guys!|My mom has been going here for 2 years. Now that Dr Patel is not there anymore and they only have 1 dr she has had to reschedule her appointment and I have been trying for two weeks to get someone to call me back. And now she is about out of her medication. The doctors have been good until recently.|Dr. Has absolutely zero empathy. swear she looked as if she was completely out of it. Never seen a Dr present herself in such a poor condition. Do not waste your time if you truly need someone who has a heart, because she does not. Would give a negative score if possible. Nurse brought in my current MRI results and she never even looked at it. Take my advice look elsewhere.|I'm gonna just put my heart in this review. Leaving a review of any kind for any place is not something I normally(if ever) do, but I feel like this is important.
I've been a patient for well over 2 yrs. and I've experienced both the good and bad within this practice. Let me simply say that I'm so glad that I hung in there with Superior. More than once I almost left for several different reasons. I do agree with the majority when they say some past employees have been unprofessional, unreliable, un-caring, etc...
I made the decision to give the last new Dr. a final chance before seeking another pain mgmt. program and now I'm glad that I did.
Dr.Z' has been great so far and has made me feel as if he really gives a d*#! about my overall health. I don't think all people realize how strict the FDA is on the pain specialist these days. Their hands are tied to a certain extent and their lively hood can easily be at stake if certain guidelines aren't met. It's not always their faults that stupid people abuse pain drugs to the point that those of us who actually depend on the relief it can give us to survive daily have to suffer because of their greed. So, try not to be so judgemental before the whole truth is known.
Also, on a more personal note I'd like to thank Lori. She has gone above and beyond her job requirements for me and I'm sure others. She's a trooper and has stayed with the office thru it all. Thank You Lori, you're the best!|I've been coming here for 6 years and I've never had any problems with the staff or doctors. They really listen to all of your needs. Lori at the front desk is always so compassionate and she helps you really understand the way things work.|1/14/25 - My visit was very pleasant! All the staff members were very professional and polite.
Tatyanna was especially friendly and helpful at my visit. She was very patient and kind.|I went for my visit almost 2 weeks ago had to take a urine specimen and so how it got lost so I had to drive back there remind u I live a hour away and work during the week to go take another one which I find crazy bc how do u lose someone's urine makes no sense but whatever I went and took it again 3 days ago hoping to have my medicine before the weekend but nope nothing and they closed at 12. All I know is dr Patel was way better and got everyone their medicine when it was due not give them the run around everytime u call them. Then the one lady was so rude to me claiming she returned all my calls which was a lie bc I have my call records where my 10+calls was only returned once!! I just don't know about this doctor then wants to change everyone medicine to these patches. Why change things especially for patients who have been on the meds that work for them. Something isn't right about this new doctor and I would love to know how  I can speak to someone over the whole place!! I know there is more people not happy about all this!! Let speak up ppl!!|I have been a patient of Dr. Patel's since 2015 now . This new doctor prescribe me a new medicine that melts in your mouth and I'm fine with trying it but I cannot afford $60 every month. I called back and asked is there anything cheaper he said no so now I'm without any medication ! He probably never had a pain in his life no more than a headache and doesn't understand what chronic pain is. I went and paid 60$ for that medication and it's mint flavored. I know for a fact that I told them it's in my records am allergic to mint Now I'm out 60 bucks and a sore mouth plus I have regurgitating heart and it's giving me flutters!

column38: Michelle M|Gina Booker|Carmen Jacques|Dawn Aquino|Aida Gonzalez|John Coffey|Misty Dyer|james hall
column40:
I was horrified by Dr. Patel's demeanor from the moment he started speaking. Unfortunately, I have gone to a number of specialists and surgeons with  degenerative back issues and chronic pain as a result. Also, my brother and sister-in-law are MD's as opposed to DO. It goes against my professional ethics to speak negatively about another professional and I know that a person can't "make" me feel uncomfortable unless I allow it!
Dr. Patel strolled in, sat down far, far too close in my personal space and just started drilling me with questions. It was VERY rude for him to do this - it is difficult enough to have to deal with talking about pain that has taken away almost all quality of life. He showed no empathy, he told me he would not prescribe the dosage of pain medication I have been taking unless I was a terminal patient. It is 10-15 mg of oxycodone. I was dumbfounded. I thought going to pain management was an effort to work together and find a path forward with the end result being less pain medication and more quality of life. Dr. Patel flipped through my paperwork, told me immediately that he would not take me on as a patient, then he spent a good bit of time telling me how I had to accept that I would never be pain free and pretty much (in so many words) said I had to learn to deal with it. He said there was nothing he could do for me, that I needed to speak with a surgeon AFTER I told him I was very skittish and almost phobic about further surgery due the horrific experience I had with my first surgery.
He sent me out the door with a prescription for pain medication that was less than half of what I've been taking for at least 7 years. He knew I am opioid dependent, did not care and sent me away with, in his own words...(just enough so that I didn't get sick) until I could find another Dr.
The stigma attached to opioids is awful and it is embarrassing enough to have to talk about it and deal with it regularly with any Dr., but Dr. Patel left me feeling dirty, like a criminal practically, that doesn't even include his extreme physical invasion of my personal space. I had to ask him to back away it was so nerve racking. It felt like his face was less than 8-10 inches from mine. It was a creepy and extremely derogatory experience.
I have never and I hope I never will feel obligated to leave a review like this about any other fellow professional again. I hope someone is reading these reviews about Dr. Patel.|I had the unfortunate opportunity to be refer to Doctor Patel.
He is supposed to be an advanced pain. Doctor medicine, well, he doesn't play in my injuries, I have heard he did dissolve. And does the generative disk 5 of them? And I'll draw Arthritis in the rapid.  I've been in 2 car accidents not due to full of my own. When in April 2023 and then another one in November of 2024 in which my car was told t-bone I feel like a human crash stunning, but he came in shook my hand it was like I was shaking him with the devilcame in with a snout.  And didn't want to give me any type obtain medication. He didn't want to do anything but put some type of paying patch that he was probably in with on the phone. I'm a suitable company to get a kick that what is wrong with these doctors? Some of them? I'll never go back there again. And I suggest you don't visit this place either.|I came for my first visit with " Doctor " Patel after suffering for two years. I've had 3 back surgeries in less than two years. I've done injections and physical therapy. This pain is debilitating. I've been an ICU RN for 24+ years. Of course my back would hurt at times. A little Tylenol and a heating pad and I would be good to go.  This excruciating pain did not start until I had a flu shot that cause an autoimmune response. I've been struggling since that time. I never knew I had any structural issues with my back until all the imagine and testing done at that time.  I still felt that the autoimmune response is what caused this to begin. Long story short .. neurologist said " it's your back .. it's your back ". I finally see neuro surgeon. Three back surgeries later and I am still unable to do much of anything. To say my life was ruin by a flu shot sounds ridiculous. This is my reality. My primary care physician is amazing. He has been with me every step of the way. We decided to try pain management to see what they could offer. The NP I saw was wonderful. Dr Patel was horrible. Walks in the room and states " I'll give you 2 5mg a day and nothing more." " you can see someone else if you don't like that ." Not a hello. How are you? Nothing. Absolutely zero compassion. I wasn't arguing him for more meds. I didn't even say anything. He also told me if I've had this pain for two years " it's never going to get better." I bawled like a baby. Why is he a pain management doctor?? To treat people who need help like that?? I'd rather eat glass shards and have explosive diarrhea after than ever see that " man" again. I will be calling CVS cancel anything he sent in for me. I'll suffer before I'm treated like that . Why? Why would a doctor even become a doctor if they don't care?? I want to find a way for my insurance not to pay him. He doesn't deserve one red cent for that visit. Oh and I was told I need the see a psychiatrist... really? That was the " help " I was offered. Almost forgot the Lyrica. Lyrica is an anticonvulsant. It was created to treat seizures 10/10 DO NOT RECOMMEND!|I had my first visit with Dr Patel today September 19, coming from Midland pain n Neurology, who I just reported to the medical board, btw, n this guy basically judges me as a  drug addict.  He doesn't prescribe the high doses of narcotics im on and would basically do nerve blocks n when I said I was looking for both treatments he said he doesn't write for pain medication.  Really?  Then why are you in pain management and why recommend someone to go back to a Dr that they reported for just st leaving the Country n letting their Pt go into partial withdrawal?   I say partial withdrawal because I should of ran out of my meds on the 8th of September, but instead of taking them 3 x a day, I took them only at night to make them stretch to not go into total withdrawal,which if I was an Addict Dr. Patel, I wouldn't be able to do that.  You shouldn't judge someone by the medication they are on, especially when you haven't even reviewed medical records or even given me an examination.  You have no idea the struggles I go thru daily to move.  Your lack of compassion n coldness you showed me today was horrible..no wonder this office has such low reviews.  I wouldn't be surprised if you've been reported to the medical board as well.|This was my worse experience l went there because  l have a rare chronic  condition  among others condition l have to take methadone, other medications. I was expecting  for the doctor to prescribed  my medication.he just gave me an injection. When he finish l told doctor  are  you  giving me my med he said no because  methadone and  clonapen  have an interaction."excuses" I been taking those me medication  for 91/2 years  he didn't  even stop to talk to Me because  of that  l wound up in the E.R. 3 x. The place  is deplorable. That's worse experience|Do not go to this facility!!! 5/23/23 we had one injection that went south in less than 24hrs ending us in the emergency room in a wheelchair. They changed Drs before the injection, would not help get answers for the injection problems, released records that weren't properly timed stamped, ultimately kicked us out of the building on a simple follow up visit (they scheduled and confirmed), refused to release records a year later, and was ultimately told not to contact in any way without an attorney. The picture is 4 days after the injection, and they refused us help. Still currently dealing with the situation over a year later.|I have been with this practice for months now and at no time have I ever had any problems.  The office is nice and clean, the staff is polite and nice and have been very helpful! The receptionist has always been pleasant as well as the lady who makes my appointments and checks me out. There's a male nurse who was exceptionally caring after my back injections and I kept thanking him over and over. I also know that I have to be there and signed in 15 minutes prior to my appointment. That was stated to me on my first visit. So far, they have really helped me and I really appreciate them all.|A Dr was present at intake ONLY. Request to talk with a Dr were denied. At the end was told the docto Ir only see patients for intake, and is TOO busy for patients any further. column2: Carolinas Center For Advanced Management Of Pain
column3:
Carolinas Center For Advanced Management Of Pain serves Spartanburg, SC and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized medical facility is dedicated to helping patients find relief from chronic and acute pain conditions through innovative treatments and personalized care plans. Since our establishment, we have built a reputation for excellence in diagnosing and treating complex pain disorders using evidence-based approaches.

At Carolinas Center For Advanced Management Of Pain, our board-certified physicians offer a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options. We specialize in treating conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, cancer-related pain, and post-surgical pain. Our multidisciplinary approach combines cutting-edge medical interventions with physical therapy and behavioral health strategies to address pain at its source.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Our Spartanburg location at 279 E Kennedy St, Suite 2700, features advanced diagnostic and treatment equipment in a comfortable, patient-centered environment. The facility is designed to provide a calming atmosphere while delivering the highest standard of pain management care. We utilize the latest medical technologies to ensure accurate diagnosis and effective treatment implementation.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in developing collaborative relationships with our patients, taking time to understand each individual's unique pain experience and goals for recovery. Our team works diligently to create customized treatment plans that address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain, improving overall quality of life and functionality.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit our website at www.carolinapain.com or call us at +1 864-583-0053. Our Spartanburg office is conveniently located at 279 E Kennedy St, Suite 2700, Spartanburg, SC 29302, with accessible parking and amenities.

column40:
The worst experience I've ever had.  Dr Hutchinson treated me like I was a drug seeking addict.  The sad part is he didn't even have my medical records to see what was going on with me and still treated me very badly he was saying things I feel like you should never say to a patient so believe me when I say do whatever you got to do to not see this doctor. Try any other pain clinic cuz once you leave this one you will feel like trash.|I will never tell anyone about them. I have been in pain and my PCP sent me here today. I went in pain and left in pain. Worst Dr ever. Please avoid this place at all cost. They wanna send me to PT and do MRI not caring about the financial burden they are putting on people. I explain I have limited to little income. It's hard enough dealing with pain. And I went in pain but I return home still in pain and upset. This is the worst place to go unless you are rich.|5 herniated disc's and  provided zero pain relief, sent me to the surgeon, need surgery, still no pain relief.   All they want to offer is a needle (that didn't help) and gabapentin.    Not everyone is an addict and pill seeking.   Highly recommend going somewhere else. Definitely just another number to  them, didn't treat me as a person at all.|If I could give zero stars I would! Dr. Patel is a joke. As a working professional having to travel and sit in long meetings daily the pain is unbearable some days. On a daily basis I am in constant pain. I was working with Dr. Patel to have procedures done to alleviate said pain. My Insurance had to a couple of placebo procedures in order to be covered.  After going process (which had to be spaced out 6-8 weeks) I was to receive a total of 3 injections from Dr. Patel. I had two out of the three injections performed by Dr. Patel. The office staff rudely and unprofessionally informed me I didn't reschedule ONE appointment with enough notice (which was a mistake on my end)I so I was being dropped as a patient! I had only one procedure left to relieve pain. I wasn't given a warning. I wasn't told that I had missed any other appointments and to be mindful that this could happen. Dr. Patel, the office staff not one person said a word to me until they dropped me for missing that appointment. Unless you want to be treated like a number or dollar sign I would not see Patel! What doctor that truly wants to treat you as a human being would do that with one procedure remaining. I am a professional. I travel for business and I didn't reschedule one appointment with enough notice which was an honest mistake. It felt degrading to be dropped as a patient with only one procedure left to relieve any kind of pain. What doctor that truly wants to treat you as a person not as a $ for insurance would do that.  I have children I want to play with and not have to keep telling my little kids sorry my back is hurting. I needed to get some relief. I was praying that these would help to have one left after going through the placebo and insurance approving it and getting two procedures done by this doctor. I had one left and because I had a work trip come up last minute and was not able to give 24 hours notice I was dropped from their practice. Blessing in disguise perhaps as that is not a doctor I want treating me. I want a doctor that treats me as a person not as a number on a piece of paper. Never go to Dr. Patel unless you want to be discarded and thrown away like trash and that you don't matter .|Grrr! Rude nursing staff.
Emailed appt confirmation warned not to be late but to arrive 15 minutes early or the appointment would be automatically cancelled.
I calculated the drive there and allowed for noontime traffic. 10 minutes ahead of their deadline and nurse complained that I was "ahead of my time" and would have to wait in the lobby (which was fine and expected).

Make up y'all's dang mind!!! But let's not be rude!|Great group of people who explain in layman's terms and get to the heart of the problem. No wasting time either. I'm usually in and out and back home in no time.|Why are you not returning calls?
I been without my meds over a week|Young girl who took my vitals and showed me to exam room had no ID nor did she introduce herself.  Not rude but not friendly either--set the tone for what was to come. Physician introduced himself but not the person who accompanied him (lack of common courtesy). The physician was curt, and repeated at least four times that if I sought any part of my treatment elsewhere (which I never suggested I would),  they would no longer see me. Medical history review was brief as was physical exam. I was told that while federal regulations require office visits every three months in order to prescribe narcotics (which I've been taking for past 3-4 years for back pain) this practice requires monthly visits. Seems to me nothing but greed as this serves no practical purpose that I can think of. I am a retired RN and no way in hell would I go back here due to what I perceive as greed and total lack of empathy. I insist on being treated with respect and empathy.  Everyone should.

column3:
Carolina Spine and Pain Centers serves Anderson, South Carolina with comprehensive pain management solutions for residents suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our experienced team of specialists combines chiropractic expertise with advanced medical treatments to address a wide spectrum of pain-related issues. Located conveniently at 100 Perpetual Square Dr in Anderson, we've established ourselves as a trusted healthcare provider dedicated to improving quality of life through effective pain relief strategies.

At Carolina Spine & Pain, we treat a diverse range of conditions including car accident injuries, sports-related trauma, workplace injuries, chronic pain disorders, and degenerative conditions. Our multidisciplinary approach ensures that each patient receives personalized care tailored to their specific needs. We understand that pain manifests differently for everyone, which is why our treatment plans are individually customized after thorough evaluation.

Expert Team with Decades of Experience

Our specialists bring decades of combined experience to every patient interaction. The team at our Anderson pain management center utilizes world-class techniques and stays current with the latest advancements in pain medicine. This commitment to excellence allows us to offer both traditional and innovative treatment options that effectively address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

24/7 Availability for Your Pain Relief Needs

We recognize that accidents and pain don't follow a schedule. That's why Carolina Spine and Pain Centers offers 24/7 availability for patients needing urgent care. Whether you're experiencing a sudden injury or worsening chronic pain, you can contact our team anytime at (864) 865-8183 for guidance and support.

Visit our Anderson location at 100 Perpetual Square Dr, Anderson, SC 29621 or learn more about our services at www.carolinaspineandpaincenters.com/anderson/.

column40:
The Dr was very nice and informative but I cannot be seen until 5/28 for 1st injection and then how long to get the next trail before the ablation injection to get relief!  This is ridiculous!  I called today to try to get an a sooner appointment and I waited 6 1/2 minutes on the phone with her talking to somebody else saying this lady needs an appointment. When do you think we could get around and then finally she put me back on hold and told me that she was sorry but she had nothing available that she would make a note on my file. If something I'm available she would call me.  That is very unprofessional!!|Dr Roper was called in after I saw 3 others there who didn't spend much time, didn't explain anything, hastily didn't seem to want to bother with me.  Dr Roper, by contrast, seems very understanding, very well informed and took time to explain connections and possibilities and b ordered an MRI to get a clearer picture, since jabbing a needle in my back didnt provide much relief. Prior to Dr Roper, PA Joy seemed genuinely attentive, too.
BUT .... The office personnel leave much to be desired!! They have lost my paperwork, they have sent me running in circles between them and my insurance company saying they don't hear anything from the insurance company who also tell me they don't get any response from CS&P. I took it to them handed it to the front desk worker, and weeks later they still said they don't have it. I took another copy to Dr Roper and handed it to him directly. Like I said, he was great, and ordered an MRI. I requested a sedative because I have a history of not being able to do the MRIS without. The pharmacy said they didn't get it, at first, but they had a new employee and it was back logged. CS&P eventually returned my call a few days later, after I tried to do the MRI anyway, but could not. I can't take anything for pain. I don't take drugs. I can't even use NSAIDS because of allergic reactions, so it's not like I'm one of those addicts who just want pain drugs. I don't. I would like a nerve block in my back after 40 years of crippling pain,  -- I live 25 miles away and it is hard to get there and very frustrating when it's for wasted trips.
I am known for doing my best and voluntarily giving my best and being extremely responsible in any way I can for whoever ....  I don't make money at that. It's flabbergasting that people who do make money to be professional and efficient cannot seem to be!
I am putting my hope in Dr Roper, though; he is a fellow Veteran and knows that doing and giving our best is a matter of honor with a heart of service; characteristics one is born with, not taught to be paid for.

-- and I'm sure pain, stress, frustration, et al, following a panic attack, contribute to my exasperation and hard tone.|I mean looking out watching in it would be a great idea to have AUTOMATIC DOORS for the people that are either healing or in pain. FYI. in God we trust .|I've been using Carolina Spine & Pain Management for several years. I can't say enough about Dr.O'Quinn an Joy, they make me feel at ease when I have anxiety about my health problems. An don't mind sitting an talking to me about it an explaining anything I don't understand about my care. I feel at ease at every appt. The office staff is very considerate at every appt. Now days its hard to find doctors that will listen to your concerns , so I feel blessed to know they care!|I can't say enough good things about my experience with Carolina Spine & Pain Center From the first appointment, I felt a noticeable improvement in my back pain. Carolina Spine & Pain Center is incredibly skilled and genuinely cares about patients' well-being. I highly recommend this services for anyone seeking effective chiropractic care.|I can't say enough about Dr O'QUINN,  Joy and Derek.  They have been more understanding and caring than any other doctor or even my family.  They listen and not only take their time with me,  but they care! I can't thank them enough for the care they give me.|Dr. O'Quinn is great! He made me feel like he really cared. He didn't act like I was just for medication. He showed me he really cared! It really eased my anxiety!|It was an impressive experience at Carolina Spine. Friendly staff, clean environment, and effective care. Highly recommended!
