Located in The Market Common area, this specialized facility provides individualized treatment plans designed to address the unique needs of each patient. The dedicated team of pain management specialists combines years of medical expertise with cutting-edge techniques to help patients regain control of their lives and reduce suffering.

Chronic pain can significantly impact quality of life, whether stemming from injury, disease, or other medical conditions. At Tidelands Health Pain Management Services, patients receive personalized care through a multidisciplinary approach. The facility's pain management physicians utilize innovative techniques and state-of-the-art equipment to deliver effective treatment options, including various medication delivery methods tailored to each patient's specific condition.

Comprehensive Care Approach

The professional team at Tidelands Health works collaboratively to develop customized plans of care that address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain. Their goal is to not only reduce pain but to help patients return to normal daily activities and improve overall quality of life. Location and Contact Information

column2: Carolinas Center For Advanced Management Of Pain
column3:
Carolinas Center For Advanced Management Of Pain in Greenville, SC offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Upstate region. Our specialized medical facility combines cutting-edge treatments with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. With board-certified physicians and a multidisciplinary approach, we develop personalized treatment plans that focus on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

At our state-of-the-art facility located at 10 Enterprise Blvd #201, we provide a wide range of interventional procedures, including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and joint injections. Our team specializes in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our physicians take time to understand each patient's unique circumstances, medical history, and pain experience before developing customized treatment strategies. This comprehensive approach often combines minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and appropriate medication management when necessary.

Contact Information

You can also visit our website at https://www.carolinapain.com/ to learn more about our services and treatment options. column40:
Do not go to this Carolinas Center for Advanced mgm of Pain the are the most unorganized people I have ever came across in the medical field. They told me that I needed an X-ray and MRI and my Dr told me that I was going for only an pain study which is to see if I have nerve pain in my neck before having shoulder replacement. I told the Dr and 2 nurses and they all said I was wrong! After having the X-ray I called my Dr and found out they were totally wrong and I had wasted a day and hundreds of $$$ for nothing just to listen to them tell me I was wrong! The wait was over an hour and half for them just to work up procedures I didn't need!! Beware of this place!! There excuse was they have a new system and they are not sure how to use it yet!!!!!!!!!!I feel sorry for the employees working for them!|I'll  start by saying Daphne the NP is the most wonderful, kind, and compassionate provider. I also have only had good experiences with the front desk staff. However, Dr. Patel on both occasions has been condescending and incredibly rude. I am a healthcare professional and would never speak to a patient the way he did me. I've been on the same pain regimen for years with another clinic in WA state prior to moving to SC. This most recent visit Daphne spoke with him about restarting one of my pain meds for an as needed basis. He proposed a different medication (same exact thing as the first visit) but it didn't exactly sound like what I was interested in plus I know what works for me since I had the same treatment for years. Daphne was going to have him come in to just chat with me. Dr. Patel came barging in to the room, did not even address me, sat down and started going on about how he would not prescribe the medication due to my age and it being addictive. When I slightly pushed back he continued to berate me almost making me feel like a drug seeker. I simply stated I did not appreciate how he was speaking to me. He said "that's fine." I said no that's actually not fine. Ultimately this  "chat" was going no where and I said I was going to end this appointment and leave. At this point I'm in tears and telling him to never speak to a patient the way he did to me ever again. He continued to be dismissive. I was in utter shock to me treated like this at a pain clinic. Safe to say I will never return which is such a shame considering how lovely Daphne is. Dr. Patel's bio on the site needs changed as he does not listen to his patients and does not have a holistic approach. Period.|My pain Dr. Changed careers so I went to this place and saw Dr. Kieber. He was going to totally change my pain meds. To something weaker and would not give me my usual muscle relaxers, I quizzed him a bit about all of my serious conditions and he didn't  answer?! Only then did he start looking at all of the pages of my bad health!?  He made this decision without knowing anything about me!  I said this won't work  coming here. So he wrote me a two week prescription of my usual pain meds until I find a real place that treats pain.  By the way he struggled to figure how many pills it would be for two weeks.  I knew the answer right away it's 84 pills.  He finally came up with 75 pills (wrong)  I just shook my head and excepted his number.  His name is Dr. Alexander Kieber.....place is a joke|Was a wonderful experience start to finish.   From office staff to nurse practitioner to Dr Hutchinson.   My first time going.  I was nervous.  Didn't know what to expect.   Was  refreshing how great they all were.|Been very happy with this office. I first brought my
Mom for treatment and so so pleased with how she was treated by everyone I go there now as well.|I love CPM, My Dr.Hutchinson is great. Christina is the best she listens and cares. Chrisy and Ashley are very helpful at the front desk. I am constantly in pain and they are helping me all the time.|First it should not take more than 15 minutes to get demographic and health history information. I was on the phone with them for almost 40 minutes for the first call. The document I got sent to sign for new patient paperwork was all wrong.  The big things being that they had another patient's birthday, phone number, and address on my paperwork. I called the office and they had the person call me back to fix it. The next document was also wrong. I called the office a couple more times before, finally they sent me a correct document on like the 4th document that they sent me. 3 hours later they finally had my demographics and healthcare information and a correct new patient document.

Next issue, the person on the phone confirmed my appointment for 1pm. I was there for 1pm, then they told me I was 30 minutes late. Then, why not tell me the appointment time is for 12:30. I wouldn't have been able to make it for 12:30. When they called to book my appointment I stated I'm very busy with a lot of appointments and such.

Final issue is that they gave me the wrong address to go to.

This has been my worst experience with any healthcare office and I've lived all over the country.|Worst place, they state it's illegal to use personal health insurance for a motor vehicle crash which is absolutely false. You can use your personal health insurance for vehicle crashes, so don't let these uppity office managers tell you different. They wouldn't allow me to go back to the room with my wife because the room was to small which is a lie, they let another man go back with his wife but not me. When I called them out on it they doubled down saying the room was to small which was false. The nurse couldn't read a height and weight machine. So now my wife is still in pain, they refused to do nerve mapping and bill our insurance so we are back at square one. Shady unethical practice if you ask me.

Thank u guys
Donna|I have been seeing these doctors for over 6 years and they are all wonderful! The assistants and office staff are so kind and helpful! I wouldn't trust anyone else with my care!|AMAZING STAFF, AMAZING DOCTORS!
My first impression was out of this world! Dr. OQuinn was highly efficient in diagnosing a painful issue I've been dealing with for 7 months! He scheduled testing and I finally felt HEARD! He knew the language and he asked me specific questions to understand!

Then when I was checking out, Krista was handling incoming patients, setting appointments for outgoing patients, speaking LOUD AND CLEAR for a hard of hearing patient, she answered my questions on paperwork and even assisted with a urine sample for a patient that had to relieve themselves before their appt.

Krista clearly is cross trained to work as an air traffic controller ANNND her tone was so friendly and bubbly, I thought she was going to offer me an Apple Pie and a rocking chair! This organization is the Chick-Fil-A of Spine and Pain management!

10/10 recommend, do not waste anymore time, go get your life back!|Was referred to this site by my doctor. He said to call to insure order. I will definitely consider them for any pain management needs I may have in the future.|I'm not sure why there's a3*3 rating. From the receptionist's to the nurses and the doctor, I felt well taken care of. If the treatment I received doesn't work, I feel confident that they will get me through this. Thank you all.|had issues with dr. owen's...,.. was very judgmental and didn't believe me about a few things.... when i sent him proof from every single doctor and surgery i had recently, he refused to see me, had the PA talk to me instead who was new, and completely took me off of my medication and instead tried replacing it with a medication that is mainly used for OUD, yeah no thanks. i truly
thought after expressing my concerns to
the office manager, i would be treated differently, but i feel lied to and discriminated against. pain management isn't worth how they treated me. stay far away.|8/23/24 I was a patient of Dr. Jonathan Gardner at the Pain Institute of Charleston in West Ashley in January 2024. During that time, I followed the required process: an initial appointment, an epidural, and a post-epidural appointment. I made sure to attend the post-epidural appointment, despite feeling great, in case I needed to see Dr. Gardner again in the future.

Unfortunately, in July, my back issues returned. I received a letter stating that Dr. Gardner had moved to the Carolina Pain Institute in Ladson. I immediately contacted the new office, only to be told that the office manager, who is the sole person responsible for transferring patients from the old system to the new one, was out for the week. I was advised to wait for her return.

I followed up after a week, only to be told that I needed to "wait my turn." It has now been three weeks, and I have yet to receive a callback. I am in extreme pain and am beyond frustrated with the lack of urgency and care from Carolina Pain Institute. I was a loyal patient of Dr. Gardner, willing to drive to Ladson to continue under his care, but it seems that the Carolina Pain Institute is not interested in accommodating his previous patients.

This level of unresponsiveness and lack of concern for a patient's well-being is unacceptable. I urge Carolina Pain Institute to address this issue immediately, as this experience has been nothing short of disappointing and frustrating.

10/23/24: 2 months have gone by and I still have not heard from this office. I have moved on but at this point as a new patient or existing, I would seriously consider taking your business elsewhere. I do feel justified because all of the reviews since I've written in have also been negative. Glad I didn't trek out to Ladson for this when there are many more great doctors in Charleston.|I had a terrible experience with Dr. Gardner. I felt as if he was accusing me of seeking pain killers that I did not need which is absolutely not the case. He would not listen to anything I said and seemed to brush off my concerns about addiction. I gotta called to the back and MA at the desk was rude. No good morning no manners. As soon as another patient and the Dr. arrived the demeanor changed. This made me feel under valued.
When 5hey brought me back, it was the same thing no good morning. She directed me take off my belt. I asked why, normally I lossen the belt an pull my pants down just passed my waist. She gave no explanation why.
As this was going on to the there was an individual restocking supplies in the same roomwith my while my shorts down waiting for an injection.
I mentioned to the doctor and the answer was she helps with the injection. I guess patient comfortably is not a priority . PMC - Comprehensive Pain Center serves Greer, South Carolina and surrounding communities with specialized pain management solutions. Located within Pelham Medical Center, our facility offers a multi-disciplinary approach to treating both acute and chronic pain conditions that may be interfering with your daily life, relationships, and overall well-being.

When pain limits your ability to function at home, work, or during recreational activities, Pelham Medical Center's Comprehensive Pain Center provides effective treatment options tailored to your specific needs. Our team of specialists focuses on accurate diagnosis and personalized treatment plans designed to help you return to a normal, active lifestyle as quickly as possible.

Our Treatment Approach

We believe in starting with conservative approaches before progressing to more interventional techniques. Our comprehensive treatment options include:

  • Customized exercise programs

  • Physical therapy regimens

  • Advanced interventional procedures

  • Surgical options when necessary

Patient-Centered Care

Throughout your treatment journey, you'll have the continuous support and resources of our dedicated team. We understand that each patient's pain experience is unique, which is why we develop individualized care plans focused on your specific condition and goals.

Please note: A physician referral is required to schedule an appointment at our center.

Contact Information

Phone: +1 864-849-9350

Address: 2755 SC-14 Suite 1450, Greer, SC 29651, United States

Website: spartanburgregional.com/locations/pelham-medical-comprehensive-pain-center
column11:
Pelham Medical Center's Comprehensive Pain Center can offer solutions when pain interferes with your healing, impacts your relationships, or limits your ability to function at home, work or play. By diagnosing and treating your pain, our multi-disciplinary team of specialists will focus on helping you return to the life you want as soon as possible.
Our comprehensive offerings provide options for patients with acute (short-term) and chronic (long-term) pain. Starting with less invasive options before leading to more interventional techniques, our treatments include exercise, physical therapy and surgery. In every case, you'll have the support and resources of our team. A physician referral is required to schedule an appointment.

DeNovo Pain Management in Charleston, SC offers specialized pain management services with a patient-centered approach. Founded with the singular goal of providing a higher standard of care, DeNovo has established itself as a trusted medical practice dedicated to improving quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions. The clinic's philosophy centers on treating each patient as a unique individual with specific needs and personal goals for their pain management journey. Located conveniently at 1483 Tobias Gadson Blvd #208, DeNovo serves residents throughout the Charleston area with compassionate, comprehensive care.

At DeNovo Pain Management, we believe that effective pain treatment requires active participation from both medical providers and patients. Our team creates a collaborative environment where patients have meaningful input into their treatment plans. This partnership approach ensures that care is tailored to address not just symptoms, but the whole person. We carefully evaluate each case, considering medical history, lifestyle factors, and personal objectives to develop customized strategies that align with patients' lives and values.

Comprehensive Treatment Options

Our practice emphasizes reducing medication dependence whenever possible, focusing instead on integrative approaches that address the root causes of pain. We offer a range of interventional procedures, physical modalities, and therapeutic techniques designed to provide lasting relief rather than temporary symptom masking. By combining cutting-edge medical knowledge with attentive care, we strive to restore patients to a new quality of life—one where pain no longer dictates daily activities and limitations.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, visit our website at www.denovopain.com or call us directly at +1 843-609-2309. DeNovo Pain Management is focused on restoring its patients to new quality of life.

column40:
This place was an absolute nightmare! I had a shocking experience this morning that I can't shake off. While Heather was great but  lady at the front desk was rude and I started to leave then but I overlooked it

I saw another patient mention on the review when she walked in the lady at the front desk said we don't do pain medication, and I totally relate. The doctor didn't even bother to examine my wrist before jumping straight to conclusions. He insisted that I was too young for pain medication and needed more surgery, despite me explaining that I've already undergone seven surgeries and am desperate to avoid any further procedures.

Then, in the midst of our conversation, he pivoted to talking about cars! I tried to express my concerns as a Black woman about how we often feel overlooked when it comes to our health and mental wellbeing. Sadly, instead of understanding, his response was dismissive: "We're not playing the racist card here." I can't believe he would compare me to a car! This was a completely unprecedented and frustrating experience with a doctor.oh and he also said we don't expect your insurance you paid cash if I was to give you any pain medication I couldn't because you paid cash it wouldn't make me look good as a doctor.|Dr Arcella is a knowledgable, kind professional. He offers a personalized approach to your care with state of the art options. His Nurse Practitioner Sierra Spencer is friendly, compassionate and proficient in your follow up appointments. The nurse, and front office are also top notch. They go beyond what is required and make you feel at ease. Rarely is there a wait.  It is rare to have both a great physician supported by even greater staff! Highly recommend.|I have seen Dr. David Arcella for spinal injections, nerve ablations, a spinal implant trial, and shock wave therapy. I am a big fan of this doctor and his staff. Dr. Arcella is knowledgeable, sincere, approachable, and generous with his time and advice. He is also helpful with finding other doctors and treatments as needed. Dee, Sierra, and Heather have also been super helpful and pleasant to work with. The care I have received at DeNovo Pain Management has been personalized and scheduled quickly and efficiently. The office is always organized and on time. Chronic pain is overwhelming and life altering. So it's vital to find a doctor who manages these issues effectively and holistically. I have been treated by 4 other Charleston area pain specialists but Dr. Arcella is my top choice. I highly recommend DeNovo Pain Management!|My experience at DeNovo Pain Management was exceptional. The receptionist Dee was helpful & charming, Dr Arcella listened carefully, offered options of treatment, encouraged me to make the best choices for myself, answered questions thoroughly and provided generous time to not feel rushed in the appointment. It was a friendly, supportive setting that provided confidence in care.  Dr Arcella is extraordinarily kind.|Dr. Arcella and his staff have been very helpful in getting my pain issues under control. Their concern for my well being is apparent and Dr. Arcella has done an outstanding job diagnosing and treating my back and hip issues.|I had my initial consultation with Dr. Arcella, completed all of the pre-procedure requirements & called to check in about a possible time frame for the trial week. Dr. Arcella was not available but I received a call back from a NP who was neither helpful nor friendly. I never heard from Dr. Arcella again, ever. Thinking it may be the holidays, I waited. I never heard from him & decided to find another provider. I felt ghosted. No idea why.|For many years I being dealing with Chronic pain, and many doctors treating me with pain medications getting addicted to them and not getting better. My social life was impacted due to this issue, but Dr Arcela set up the correct goal and treatment helping me to manage pain, restoring my social life. I appreciate your care, thank you for your help and for all you do.|Dr. Arcella and staff are wonderful. I've had several injections from Dr. Arcella, and I'm pleased with the results. I must say that these injections didn't even hurt. DeNovo Pain Management is the only place that I will go for injections. It's a joy to work with Dee at the front desk. I highly recommend DeNovo Pain Management.

Our integrated approach combines advanced medical diagnostics with physical rehabilitation, regenerative therapy, cellular detox, and chiropractic care to address chronic pain and health conditions. At Dynamic Health Carolinas, we believe in treating the whole person, not just symptoms. Our unique protocols integrate multiple therapeutic disciplines to address the root causes of pain and dysfunction. By combining medical diagnostics with physical rehabilitation, regenerative therapy, cellular detox, and physical therapy alongside chiropractic spinal adjustments, we create customized treatment plans that deliver lasting results for our patients.

Our Promise to Patients

We offer hope to those suffering from chronic pain and health challenges. Our mission centers on three key objectives: helping patients get out of pain as quickly as possible, stabilizing their condition, and minimizing the likelihood of symptom recurrence. This comprehensive approach has made us one of the most trusted health and chronic pain clinics in the Charlotte area.

Healing Environment

Patients consistently note our attentive and caring staff who contribute to the positive, healing atmosphere of our clinic. We understand that recovery involves both physical treatment and emotional support, which is why we've created an environment conducive to total wellness and healing.

I've never met a doctor like Dr. Bauer. For six months, he took my calls on his personal cell phone, patiently walking me through every detail and answering all my questions about the back stem cell procedure. It's rare to find a doctor so dedicated and accessible.

The entire team, especially Danielle, was incredibly professional and made me feel at ease throughout the entire process. The procedure itself was quick--about an hour--and done on an outpatient basis, but the care and attention I received were exceptional.

I highly recommend Dr. Bauer and his team for anyone considering back stem cell therapy. They made the experience smooth, comfortable, and effective from start to finish!|After experiencing a spinal injury due to my medical job, pain and doubt became my constant companion. Pain from the irritated and inflamed c7 nerve being compressed from a ruptured cervical disk; and doubt and worry from being unable to work.  Time wasn't going by fast enough and the healing was literally painfully slow.  I tried injections, medications and conventional physical therapy for many months with little relief and increasing sleepless nights due to worrying about my job.

I ended up filing for workmen's comp to ensure I wasn't terminated while I recovered. The medical paperwork for WC was daunting and confusing. However, because of Dynamic Health and the amazing team of doctors, pa's, admin and medical aides paperwork confusion became an issue of the past. They knew the process and had it completely streamlined!

With Dynamic Health Carolinas my paperwork was completed timely my numbness and tingling was reducing and so was my pain level!

Amazing therapies, wonderful caring team members and thoroughness is what you get by having your care at Dynamic Health Carolina!!!|I have thoroughly enjoyed my therapy treatment and experience with Dynamic Health Carolinas. They made sure that every step of my medical treatment was fully explained and that I understood the process as I was given a tour of their facility. The appointment check-in is a breeze, and there is very little to no waiting to have my vitals checked, and read before beginning therapy at the different treatment stations. I would definitely recommend Dynamic Health Carolinas to my family and friends.|I have been a patient of Dynamic Health Carolinas few months now. column40: Dr. Joseph O'quinn is a great doctor. He listens to all of your pain symptoms and offers advice. I've had a great experience with this practice. I would recommend him to anyone in pain.|I love Melody and she does a great job but the receptionist is another story. I reported her behavior several times and nothing was ever done so finally after she called me out of my name u der her breath and I heard her and I returned the favor out loud I was the one who can no longer receive services there. So no they really don't care about their patients because more than one complaint should tell them something.|I can't emphasize enough how grateful I am for the care I received from this chiropractor after my car accident. From the moment I walked in, I felt like a valued patient. They conducted a thorough evaluation of my back injury and developed a personalized treatment plan that really worked.|They do a great job here. I don't know what the negative reviews are about, but I get great treatment, they keep my pain tolerable and all the Dr's and nurses are very nice to me. I would be bed ridden if it wasn't for these guys. Very grateful.|Let me start by saying that yes, I was a patient. The auto response from Carolina Spine is they can not confirm you are a patient, and call to discuss your issue. I'm in Greenville, and called number which sent me to Lexington. The administration person hung up on me at the Greenville location. I want go into all the details, but after seeing them for eight months I saw a doctor one, or two times other than the actual procedures I had done. Last month I expressed to nurse, I was getting no relief. She had a doctor come in and he recommended another MRI. When I called today to confirm my appointment, I was told I would be meeting with a nurse. I called back, and told receptionist I needed to see a doctor, and a treatment plan. That is when she began to argue with me, and hung up. I'm fully aware that an issue such as back pain is not always easy to diagnose. What type of clinic orders a MRI, and has no doctor meet with patient. My GP recommend them, and he has apologized has he has confirmed he has had several patients complain. He will not refer anyone else. This clinic is a prime example of 21st century healthcare. I have wasted eight months of my life in chronic pain that I can't get back.|So tried several times to get ahold of Nicki so I could take my urine/blood test in advance of my visit and never got a call back. Been waiting along time to see dr and get my pain meds refilled.  They said o had to use their labs and I offered to go somewhere else and have it sent there but the girl wouldn't let me. And I supposedly can't use anyone else nor can I start my meds with them till another month  I've been taking medicine that's at least 20 yrs or older  that I had on a box ( just moved here) and it's not working well but at least I'm not experiencing withdrawals!! If I didn't have it then most assuredly I would!! Not sure who I saw but he was a bald man.  Do they not care if you experience withdrawals???  I've been on morphine and norco for over 25 yrs because of my neck and low back and I'm in terrible pain. Which I told the girl and she said we don't give meds till at least 2nd visit with your urine coming back. column48: How do I know if my pain is normal or if it indicates something more serious?
column49: Communicating the characteristics of your pain (like duration, intensity, and triggers) is crucial. The specialists will help determine if your pain is typical for your injury or if it suggests a more serious issue.

Carolina Spine and Pain Centers serves Sumter, South Carolina with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our experienced team of specialists combines chiropractic expertise with cutting-edge medical treatments to provide world-class care for patients suffering from various pain conditions. With decades of combined experience, we understand that pain is a deeply personal experience, which is why we develop individualized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs.

At Carolina Spine & Pain, we treat a wide spectrum of conditions, from acute injuries resulting from car accidents, sports activities, and workplace incidents to chronic pain and degenerative conditions. Our integrated approach ensures that patients receive the most effective treatment options available in modern pain management.

Patient-Centered Approach

We recognize that everyone experiences pain differently. This understanding forms the foundation of our patient-centered approach, where we take the time to listen to your concerns and develop personalized treatment plans that address your specific pain issues. Our goal is not just to mask symptoms but to identify and treat the underlying causes of your pain.

24/7 Availability

Pain and injuries don't follow a schedule, which is why our team is available 24/7 to assist you. Whether you've experienced a sudden injury or need guidance on managing chronic pain, you can contact us anytime at +1 803-653-6955.

Visit Our Sumter Location

Our comprehensive pain management center is conveniently located at 100 W Liberty St, Sumter, SC 29150. We welcome new patients and referrals, offering same-day appointments when possible to ensure you receive timely care.

Novo Wellness serves patients throughout Aiken and Hilton Head Island, South Carolina with innovative regenerative medicine and pain management solutions. Founded by William Durrett, MD, who has been recognized as a Top Doc for Pain Management in Aiken for multiple years (2017, 2018, and 2020), the practice has established itself as a leader in non-invasive treatment approaches. For over 35 years, Dr. Durrett has dedicated himself to exploring and implementing cutting-edge treatments that offer patients alternatives to traditional pharmaceutical and surgical interventions.

At Novo Wellness, patients gain access to state-of-the-art treatment technologies specifically designed to minimize pain, optimize mobility, and enhance overall quality of life. The practice's philosophy centers around reducing dependency on pharmaceuticals and avoiding unnecessary surgical procedures whenever possible. This patient-centered approach has made Novo Wellness a trusted name in pain management throughout South Carolina.

Advanced Treatment Technologies

Dr. Durrett specializes in utilizing MLS Laser Treatment, an innovative therapy that effectively relieves inflammation and pain while simultaneously improving oxygenated blood circulation to injured or degenerated areas. This non-invasive approach allows patients to experience significant relief without the downtime associated with more invasive procedures. The practice continually evaluates and incorporates the latest advancements in regenerative medicine to provide optimal outcomes for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions.

Visit Novo Wellness

Patients seeking comprehensive pain management solutions can visit Novo Wellness at their Aiken location: 5110 Woodside Executive Ct, Aiken, SC 29803. To schedule a consultation with Dr. Durrett and his experienced team, call +1 803-642-6500 or visit their website at www.novowellnesscenter.com for more information about their innovative treatment options and approach to pain management.

Palmetto Pain Management, located in Columbia, SC, is a premier medical practice dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Midlands region. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Ezra B. Riber, MD, our clinic has established itself as a trusted resource for those suffering from chronic pain conditions, offering personalized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient. Our state-of-the-art facility on Forest Drive combines advanced medical technology with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives and reduce dependency on pain medications.

At Palmetto Pain Management, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic approaches designed to target pain at its source. Dr. Riber specializes in treating conditions including back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Our multidisciplinary approach may include nerve blocks, epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management tailored to each patient's specific condition.

About Dr. Ezra B. Riber

Dr. Riber is a board-certified pain management specialist with extensive training in anesthesiology and pain medicine. After completing his medical education and residency, he pursued advanced fellowship training in interventional pain management techniques. His approach combines evidence-based medical practices with a genuine commitment to improving patients' quality of life. Dr. Riber takes time to listen to patients' concerns and develops comprehensive treatment strategies that address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

Our practice is built on the foundation of patient-centered care. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, from work performance to personal relationships. Our compassionate staff works diligently to create a welcoming environment where patients feel heard and respected. We emphasize education, ensuring that patients understand their conditions and treatment options, empowering them to participate actively in their recovery journey.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Riber or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 803-779-3263. Our clinic is conveniently located at 2611 Forest Dr, Columbia, SC 29204. For additional information about our practice and services, visit our website at palmettopainmanagement.com.

column40: The only reason why I am giving it a 3 and not a 2 is because Dr Riber has been the one doctor that has helped and worked with my husband since he decided to find an alternative to taking pills for his pain. But seeing his PA and trying to speak to someone on the phone to handle my husband's appointment and billing has been a complete nightmare!! They never answer the phone no matter how many messages you leave, nor answer web messages sent via the portal. I am still trying to understand why my husband has a bill on a date that we had paid in advance and at the time of the visit for a week now! This is insane! Oh and the 3 stars is also due to them being professional and pleasant while there. They just need to work on their back office staff a bit or hire some new staff.|Dr. Riber is hands down the best Dr in the world. He is kind, reassuring, and very understanding and knowledgeable. I can say without a doubt that of the 4 pain management doctors I have seen throughout my military career, Dr Riber is far and away the best.  He was kind, compassionate, and took time to listen and understand what I was telling him.  I have a condition that will never go away, but he has taken every step he could to ensure that I am as comfortable as possible, and can function on a normal basis.  His staff has been nothing friendly and helpful.  I would recommend this practice to anyone.  Thank you Dr Riber!|DR.Riber as well as the other Dr's and P.A.s nurses and staff are THE BEST in SC. I feel truly blessed to have these Drs.taking care of all my pains and doing all they can to relieving my pain to give me a better quality of life.Thank you to all of yall !!|I don't see Dr. Reiber I see the other Dr. She is very professional, appears to have compassion and understanding for those of us whose lives have been impacted by pain. I need the stimulator and honestly it isn't the Dr. But the staff that are the turn off point for me. They seem young, unorganized, and slightly dysfunctional from the one time I was there to now trying to get an appointment scheduled. Communication is weak and no one seems to really know or keep you in the loop. I was seen 4 months ago and still i don't have an appointment for the stimulator.  Its very aggravating when you pay over 500 dollars a month for insurance because I was laid off most likely due to my pain and back issues and your plea for help per say takes a back burner. I think although someone specializes in something doesn't mean they understand the real struggle we face. My life has been forever changed and living day to day at times feels hopeless. Don't forget the type of people you are dealing with, at least not the honest ones who just want help and a better quality of life.|I have Lupus, osteoarthritis in every joint(stage 3) endometriosis, fibromyalgia, tumors. I went to this pain "Managment" for 7 months. I was given the minimum amount of pain medication. And ended up finding out my body doesn't respond well to it. I tried EVERY medication that wasn't an opioid, and had Terrifying side effects. But when I refused to do another experimental medicine, they couldn't help me further. Because they "don't believe in using opioids to help treat pain." They make you feel like your a problem if you don't respond to their non opioid medicine too. You will be urine tested more than Actual drug addicts as well. When I left there, I felt helpless and more alone with my pain than Ever. Please save yourself the emotional pain.|This is my second time sitting in this office and both times have been unpleasant. Even my previous experiences by phone have been horrible and that's if they even answer or bother to return our calls. We arrive to the appointment 15 minutes early. Now here it is 40 minutes past the time of the appointment and we're still sitting here. What's the point in scheduling if we aren't going to be seen around our scheduled time? Yet you want to charge us if we reschedule too late or if we show up late. If it were up to me we would've been moved on to a different doctor. Unfortunately my client is happy with Dr. Reiber so here we may stay.|Dr Stanislause has been understanding and compassionate.  My PA is very smart and always answers my questions and always just seems to be really concerned about my wellness in general. I have been a patient for a few years now and am more than satisfied. I am very content with the care I have received.

He took the time to get to know me and learn my needs. Even shared his life story with me. Literally sat and talked to me for 45 minutes. I felt a connection with him instantly. I look forward to being his patient. Thank you Dr Boatwright for caring it seriously means a lot.|Dr. Boatwright is amazing! My husband and I have been going to him for over four years.  He and his staff are the absolute best we have ever found in alleviating our pains. Dr. Boatwright is very professional, extremely passionate and a caring provider. He truly works wonders for us. You won't find a more caring doctor anywhere. We highly recommend him.|What a wonderful caring doctor with a great staff. Gives you the time you need and wants to help you as much as he could. Respect his time with you as you have to respect his time with others. Wish I was his patient years ago when I got hurt.|The are always patient and actually listen. The office is clean and the office staff is pleasant. Thank you.|This so called doctor treated me for back and neck pain. I paid my co-pay each time I visited his office. After no longer using his practice to manage my pain I received a bill for approximately $450. I called to find out what this bill was for and I was told his previous billing firm was not very good and the company I was speaking with was NEW. When I asked for a detailed invoice so I could pay the "bill" I was told they did not have ANY backup from the previous agency so the current recievable firm could not provide a detailed invoice. Next I find he sent my account to a collection agency. I then called again and this time told that again another NEW company was handling his billing but again no one could provide me with ANY detailed invoice - they simply said "I OWE $450 with no backup). It is now 6+ years, my credit has gone down due to his lack of hiring a professional accounting firm and recently I find he sent my account to a new collection firm so this negative comment hurts my credit and apparently will never end (even though it should have ended a couple of years ago - it appears this bogus "bill" will never go away and has increased to $750 ----- EVEN THOUGH HE HAS NO BACKUP TO PROVIDE ME SO I COULD PAY THE BILL IF I FOUND IT TO BE CORRECT (I know I paid my copay each and every time I meet with Boatright.) As all can see his billing has messed my credit (not by much since I had an 800+ credit rating before his sending these made-up bills to collection.---- like anyone would do I did not and will not pay this bill since it is not something I owe!!!
As a "pain specialist" he rates a "0" in my book and I would NEVER RECOMMEND his practice - I instead have found a professional pain management firm that has now provided facite injections, ablation and epideral injections RATHER THAN ADDICTIVE PAIN MEDS!!!
Thankfully I have found appropriate physicians in the area - I personally feel Boatright is someone who found a great way to use his medical training to increase his fortune by providing addictive medications rather than find solutions to an individuals pain related problems.|I saw Dr Boatwright for the chronic pain in my lower back, right hip and leg. He gave me shots in my back but I didn't get any relief. On my last visit 8/8/19 I went in to get my prescription of 100mg daily changed to 150mg twice daily.  I called and asked the office personal if they could ask to make sure if I brought in my prescription of 100mg I could turn it in and get a prescription for 150mg twice daily and I was told yes.  I asked please could you ask again and make sure because I didn't want to drive 60 miles for nothing.  I was told no it's ok.  When I went in for my appointment 8/8/19 and saw Kerri Frey PA she said she didn't know anything about it and she couldn't do anything about it. I told her that is what I had been told 3 different times and she said I don't know why they would say that. She said I didn't write it so she couldn't do it I had to go back to my PCP.  I told her I was upset because I was expecting to get it taken care of and now  I wasted my time and hers. And, I was upset due to being in pain for more than 3 month without pain relief. The nurse came in and tried to help stating I would have to wait 3 months because the prescription had already been shipped and to come in and then they would be able to write a new one.  When I got to my appointment 10/14/19 I was told my appointment had been cancelled and I had been discharged because Kerri did not like negative comments I made about the office.  I don't think the Doctor had anything to do with it, I could be wrong.

column3:
Prisma Health Pain Medicine-Eastside serves Greenville, SC with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to restore quality of life for patients throughout the Upstate region. Located conveniently at 21 Brendan Way, our specialized medical facility combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. Our team of board-certified pain specialists employs a multidisciplinary approach, utilizing advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative therapies to develop personalized treatment plans. We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we're committed to finding solutions that work for your unique situation.

At Prisma Health Pain Management, our goal is to get you back to living the healthy and active life you were meant to live. Our proactive approach to pain management is designed to prevent pain before it arises through a variety of advanced, proven methods, even in complex cases or when pre-existing conditions are present. We offer interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy coordination, and integrative medicine approaches to address conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome.

Patient-Centered Care

What sets our practice apart is our commitment to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our specialists take time to understand your pain history, lifestyle factors, and treatment goals before developing a customized care plan. We emphasize minimally invasive techniques whenever possible and focus on functional improvement alongside pain reduction. Our state-of-the-art facility is equipped with the latest technology to ensure accurate diagnosis and effective treatment delivery.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please call +1 864-522-5030. Our office is located at 21 Brendan Way, Greenville, SC 29615. For more information about our services and approach to pain management, visit our website at prismahealth.org. We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to making quality pain care accessible to all patients in need.

column38: Mary Lamb|Tyler Olney|Tim Stone|Sarah Lewis|tav wetherbie|John Clem|Tierra D.|Rena Mitchell
column40:
Terrible! They don't help for chronic pain. Dr Delorey was terrible to see. We fired each other. What I see, no one in that pain medicine facility, helps with pain. I live in miserable pain constantly. My Dr can prescribe what I was given. Gabapentin and cymbalta. Really all for nerve pain and 3 depression meds. 2 depression meds were from my primary Dr. This place isn't worth our time or effort. For no help. Looks like all Dr here I've researched, none help. In Las Vegas my pain mgmt. Helped me I had some more quality of life. Because they manage your pain. No problems, these doctors here, don't care!|My grandmother came in to see Dr Joshua Smith. Her appointment was at 10:30. She arrived at 10:29. The receptionist said that she was late because she had paperwork that she had to fill out. They let her fill it out and it took her 6 minutes. They let my grandmother wait and wait and then told her that if someone didn't show up then they would see her. They said they would even allow that person to be late. That is absurd when considering what they were putting my grandmother through. The people did show up and they sent my grandmother home without treating her. My grandmother is about to be 90, she has 3 vertebrae in her back that are completely done for, she is to fragile to undergo that surgery but was able to undergo a different surgery 2 weeks ago to repair her fractured hip. Obviously when someone has been through something like that there should be a little bit of leniency. These are supposedly medical professionals. Someone who is recovering from hip surgery amongst several other things are slow to move around and hard to get into vehicles. My grandmother has been in bed the past month in so much pain she can hardly leave her room let alone the house. Now she has to go so much longer feeling like this. I am completely disgusted with the way she was treated and hope nobody ever gets treated like this again.|My wife and I have been going to this location for over 2 years.  We would normally see Dr J. Smith.  Dr. Smith, I would consider, a perfect Dr. as he would first ask the patient how they are.
My wife has extreme pain all the time.  She cries because the pain is all encompassing for her.  Unfortunately she couldn't see Dr Smith - a busy man.  We had to settle for his associate PA Carlos Arturo Aries.  He knows my wife is in extreme pain, but he was only concerned about her falling down.
She has late stage Alzheimers, what did he except.
He did not listen to either of us about her issue.  When he did listen he became confrontational and stayed that way until we "fired him".  To make it worse, some of his staff was also confrontational toward us.  They must hang around Carlos too much.
When we told him we would be looking for a new Pain Practice, all he said was, "That's your right".
If you must go to this practice, ONLY see Dr. Smith.  He has the 'bed side manner' of what you'd expect from a caring DR.  DO NOT GO TO HIS PA.  If you think I'm making this up, give PA Aries a try but don't expect too much.  (just some friendly advice and this is only my opinion)|Terrible place. My Dr sent a referral. They never called. When I called them they transferred me to another location but told me they were waiting on prior authorization. I left a message and nobody returned my call. My insurance company told me they did not have any pending authorizations. Called back a week later and left another message. What an incompetent place. My dr even called over and they got same run around. Clearly they don't want business. I see a whole lot of people here had same terrible service. I wish they would get shutdown. I received a referral to another dr and they called me same day and got me scheduled. Bye bye Felicia.|Horrible experience. I have a nerve disease and lived in pain for 2 years. Dr wants to give me meds that do not even effect nerve pain. Staff is very rude and will be searching for a different Dr who cares and can actually help me. Do not go here.|Very unprofessional in their tone and how they deal with people who actually are in need of their help. Requested a conversation for the MD to speak to me about my upcoming surgery and was told he doesn't have time ever to take a quick phone call that I need to schedule an in-house appointment to give him this information so I could spend more money on a specialist Visit. The nurse was very short and acted as if I was bothering them to update them on my condition that they sent me out to get looked at by another physician. It's all a money/insurance game and the art of customer service is far beyond reach.|The assistant "Carlos" Told me that the reason I couldn't find pain relief was because it was all in my head! I have never been so furious before! No One has ever said that to me as all my diagnoses obviously are what I suffer with.
I tried to give myself time to breathe from how mad and hurt his words at my appointment made me. But I can't get over the fact that he falsely and rudely decided that my pain is in my head, as he said 4 times in the appointment. I have suffered extremely horribly and cruelly for 15 years with constant and severe pain most of my life. I have been to therapists who all said I handle my pain incredibly and with good cheer and that is to be commended because it is VERY hard to stay positive when anyone has level 10 pain for 6 years.

ANY sane person would be cracking now no thanks to the 0 help I have gotten with this whole medical area! Everything I brought up to them they said wouldn't be a problem but it was. And the medicine they thought wouldn't help me DID
I have lost out on lots of good things these past 4 months with no real help and HUGE bills from appointments and this pain medicine they put me on with no other option. All I want is to get better but since it isn't in my head i can't since this facility doesn't seem to want to try to help me manage my pain as is THEIR job calling.|I did not feel heard at all, and was treated like another customer being sold goods instead of a person coming for compassionate health care.
I was rescheduled for my first appointment because I was 15 minutes early instead of 30 minutes early. The gps routed us to the wrong location. We called as soon as we knew the error which was 35 minutes before the appointment time, and we gave eta and new routing information to the receptionist. Instead of telling us over the phone to reschedule, they waited till we arrived. For a pain prevention care facility, seems like consideration, and compassionate decision making would be paramount. However, filling out paperwork is essential to treatment with them even though most of the questions asked in the paperwork was asked by the nurse and doctor.
Dr. Math was cold and insensitive. My mother was with me, and agreed that she made her feel uncomfortable.
It is very apparent to us that there is a money grab.
My family has not had great service from GHS as a whole, sadly to say.
I really hate to give bad reviews, but I think this place should be avoided.

Renew Pain Solutions serves Greenville, SC and surrounding communities as an independent interventional pain management practice committed to improving patient quality of life. Founded on the principle that effective pain management requires personalized care, our team of specialists works diligently to address chronic and acute pain conditions using evidence-based approaches. We operate from our conveniently located facility at 105 Halton Village Circle, where patients find a welcoming environment designed for comfort during their treatment journey.

At Renew Pain Solutions, we offer a diverse range of interventional treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our practice specializes in minimally invasive procedures that target pain at its source, reducing reliance on medication and promoting long-term relief. By leveraging advanced imaging technology, our specialists can precisely diagnose and treat complex pain conditions with remarkable accuracy.

Cutting-Edge Technology & Techniques

Our commitment to technological advancement sets us apart in the Greenville area. We continuously invest in state-of-the-art equipment and training to ensure our patients receive the most effective treatments available. From fluoroscopic-guided injections to advanced neuromodulation techniques, we prioritize procedures that offer maximum benefit with minimal recovery time.

Patient-Centered Approach

What truly distinguishes our practice is our dedication to personalized care. We take the time to understand each patient's pain experience, medical history, and treatment goals before developing a customized plan. This collaborative approach ensures that treatments align with individual needs and preferences, leading to better outcomes and improved quality of life.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit us online at renewpainsolutions.com or call us directly at +1 864-808-1859. Our Greenville office at 105 Halton Village Circle welcomes new patients seeking effective solutions for chronic and acute pain conditions.

column40:
Renew Pain Solutions is amazing!  Friendly staff, great doctors!  Dr Smith is wonderful.  He always listens to me and gives me a plan to address my issues.  He truly cares about his patients.|The front desk ladies have customer service going on!
The young lady who took me back to a room was pleasant.
Now to the main character...
Dr Bigham is extremely professional yet personable.
Awesome bedside manner!
He seems to be concerned.
He gives you time to ask questions. He shows you on the spine model exactly what he is talking about.
He also was able to get me on his schedule for my procedure quickly.
I would recommend him.
Oh yeah, he is very easy on the eyes|I have been a patient of Dr. Smith for 7 years and have been very pleased with the care he has provided. His knowledge of the science of pain management is incredible. As I get older, the technology gets better, and Dr. Smith seems to be on top of the latest treatments. I am now almost off all oral pain medicines. I look forward to be non- dependant on them.|Dr. Bingham and his staff are amazing! He takes his time to really get to know what's going on and make you feel like you are heard and that you matter. This is unlike any other pain center I have visited. At Renew you are treated like a person, with genuine care for what you are going through and the help you need to feel better. I can't recommend them enough.|Dr.Smith has been treating a disc issue in my neck and lower back, it's amazing to be able to work out and move freely again  without pain. He is compassionate and professional, fully explains challenges both with insurance companies and procedures empowering me to make my own decisions. His calm demeanor and fantastic staff are reassuring and a joy; not to mention the state of the are office space which is clean and modern. It's terrible to be in constant pain thinking you're getting old- get Renewed! Best doctor I have found in the upstate.|I first saw Dr. Smith a few years ago.  I've always been impressed with his thoroughness and attention to detail.  He referred me to an orthopedic colleague to also evaluate me and my scans, and together they came up with a plan for my pain.  I've been doing great and have recommended Dr. Smith to friends.|I am beyond pleased with my pain management with DR J Smith.  He is attentive to what I am saying about my pain symptoms and getting me care I need to maintain my comfort.|Dr Smith and his staff are wonderful!
I was in the most extreme pain in my life with my neck.
My procedure was painless and made my life functional again
I cannot express enough gratitude, and refer him to my friends and clients when ever possible !
Thank you Dr Smith!

column2: HRW Health- Multidisciplinary Clinic (Integrative Pain Management)
column3:
HRW Health serves Greer, SC and surrounding communities with a comprehensive approach to healthcare that addresses both physical and mental well-being. As a multidisciplinary clinic specializing in integrative pain management, HRW Health has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider in the Upstate South Carolina region. The practice combines conventional medical treatments with complementary therapies to create personalized care plans that address the root causes of pain and chronic conditions.

At HRW Health, patients benefit from a wide range of medical services under one roof. The practice offers primary care services for routine and preventative health needs, alongside specialized pain management solutions for those suffering from chronic pain conditions. Their integrative approach means patients receive coordinated care that considers all aspects of their health journey.

Specialized Pain Management

The clinic excels in treating various pain conditions, including lower back pain, musculoskeletal pain, neurological pain, and post-operative pain. Their team of specialists develops customized treatment plans that may incorporate medication management, therapeutic interventions, and lifestyle modifications to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

Mental Health Support

Understanding the connection between physical pain and mental wellbeing, HRW Health provides professional counseling services for patients with mental health needs. Their holistic approach recognizes that addressing psychological factors is often crucial for effective pain management and overall health improvement.

Addiction Recovery Services

HRW Health offers medication-assisted treatment for individuals struggling with opiate addiction. This compassionate service helps patients overcome dependency while simultaneously addressing any underlying pain issues that may have contributed to substance use.

Patient-Centered Approach

As an evolving practice, HRW Health continuously enhances its service offerings to meet the diverse needs of the community. Their patient-centered philosophy ensures that each individual receives attentive care and participates actively in their treatment decisions.

For more information about HRW Health's services or to schedule an appointment, visit www.hrwhealth.com/integrative-pain-management or call +1 864-848-2300. The clinic is conveniently located at 556 Memorial Dr Ext a, Greer, SC 29651.

column3:
Pain & Neurology Specialists of Columbia serves patients throughout Columbia, SC and surrounding communities with comprehensive care for chronic pain and neurological conditions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians combines decades of specialized experience with innovative treatment approaches to address complex medical challenges that impact quality of life. Located conveniently in northeast Columbia, our practice has established itself as a trusted healthcare partner for residents seeking relief from debilitating symptoms.

At Pain & Neurology Specialists, we take a multidisciplinary approach to diagnosing and treating a wide spectrum of conditions including migraines, neuropathy, spinal disorders, fibromyalgia, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our physicians develop personalized treatment plans that may incorporate medication management, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy, and integrative medicine techniques. We believe in addressing not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of pain and neurological dysfunction.

Patient-Centered Approach

Understanding that chronic pain and neurological disorders affect every aspect of a patient's life, we prioritize compassionate, attentive care in a comfortable environment. Our staff takes time to listen to each patient's concerns, thoroughly explain diagnostic findings, and involve patients in treatment decisions. This collaborative approach helps ensure better outcomes and higher satisfaction with care.

Advanced Diagnostic Capabilities

Our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic technology that allows for precise identification of pain sources and neurological abnormalities. This technological advantage, combined with our physicians' expertise, enables us to develop targeted interventions even for patients who have struggled to find effective treatments elsewhere.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us:

Address: 15 Monckton Blvd, Columbia, SC 29206, United States

Phone: +1 803-252-4900

Website: www.paincolumbiasc.com

We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to making specialized care accessible to those suffering from chronic pain and neurological conditions throughout the Columbia region.

column38: Jana Owen|A|Devanne Hughlett|Pablo Berrios|Izzy Watkins|Micah Grier|Pic Services|admiraljimmy
column40:
I wrote a review at the request of this practice, but it does not show up here. I had a Jan 23, 2025 appt. for an EMG upper extremities   On the 22 or 23 rd of Dec, 2024 they called and said they'd had a cancellation on Dec 26, 2024 at 9:15. I accepted it. My husband and drove 90 minutes arriving 30 minutes early as I had been told to get there 15 minutes early. Building locked up tight with sign on door saying they'd be closed all day. I called and left message. A few minutes later someone from the office called back to say Dr.Stickler was running behind as he was working alone so my appointment was moved to 9:45. No patients in the building and physician is behind? We left and retuned at 9:15. Everyone in the office was opening and closing drawers and cabinets. This went on for 30 minutes when finally the PA told me and the one other waiting patient that they could not find keys to the medical equipment room where EMG machine was located. 30 minutes later same PA offered to reschedule both of us; we both declined. Waiting room is uncomfortable, especially for those with spine problems and probably other conditions. Bathroom is yuuuuuck. When I finally saw Dr. Stickler he was kind and professional. He thanked me for my patience. I couldn't help but feel the test was done in haste, but he is supposed to be the best so I am telling myself he is able to work quickly and competently. He told me my results would be sent to my physician's office in a week. Today, January 13, 2025, it has been 19 days and results are not ready. Subtracting weekend days and one holiday it has still been 12 days since my EMG was performed. I was told my ordering physician would receive the EMG results in about a week. Previously, at university hospital Augusta and at Mayo Clinic Jacksonville FLA , results were available within a day. I am ready to call my insurance company to see if test can be performed locally so that I may get results that are timely and accurate.|I would give this clinic a lower rating if at all possible. I called them weeks ago to try and get medication issues resolved but was unable to recieve a call back or hear anything from the providers there. That was until today over a full month later. This is after having tricare cancel the referral do to insufficient level of care, and having a whole new referral set in place. What an absolute terrible practice they run here and I'm sorry for anyone they treat.|People in these reviews are completely opposite of my experiences. They work well, quick. Deal with all my questions.
People have to give some slack because you're working two offices all week.
I 100% would recommend|I have been coming to this clinic for years and have always received great care. Dr. Drakeley and his staff are the best!|If I could give them zero stars I would. For starters they never answer their phones. They don't send out appointment reminders nor emails. Overall I shouldn't have to go to a hospital for treatments for my migraines if I have a whole doctor for that but unfortunately they again don't answer the phones. You can leave messages voicemails and emails, unfortunately whoever is in that office doesn't care about patients nor the practice. With their Botox treatments they don't use any type of lidocaine or numbing cream which you would think would be considered maltreatment due to purposely inflicting pain on your patient when they have other alternatives to make it a slightly more comfortable process. During my first session I was told I did better than most due to her being kicked and or cussed out during the procedure. Why as a pain specialist/neurologist office do you all not offer an easier treatment for your patients. Overall this is one of the worst places to go too for any type of medical needs that I have ever went to in my life. Hopefully this office gets new management or something because the way this establishment has been running the past year I have been a patient is atrocious. The only reason it took me so long to transfer doctors is because the hoops I've had to jump through just to get approved for Botox since again the office sucks at any type of communication or corresponding. Why did the Botox company I was receiving vials from call me trying to reach the office for months to establish why they haven't received the appropriate documents they needed from the office . I should not miss work for a whole week if again I've been going to a specialist for almost two years to try and find some type of relief from persistent migraines. Please rethink getting seen or serviced at this office if you're actually trying to find some relief.|I have had several run ins with this office. First the office is horrible with answering the phone! It doesn't matter if it's two offices or not handling the calls they should pick up. It was one time I called 22x for them to answer as I was out of town for longer than expected and out of medicine. Second I'm  the first patient with this doctor to get the VNS surgery and can't get my device turned on because of insurance issues. It's unbelievable that I have a device in my body with no way to turn it on. There should be someway this could be worked out. But again no one will pick up the phone. The only way to get a response is to leave the negative reviews I guess. But then again all the negative reviews have the same response.|This practice is horrible. I've been a patient for almost 2 years and have had several issues. The only reason I haven't left yet is because there are not many other Neurologist in the Columbia sc area.  I waited several months to receive my medication (copaxon) and after calling them weekly they finally sent the pharmacist what they requested to fill the order. Also, AOPI sent them a letter of medical necessity in order for me to order a brace for my foot drop but they can't give it to me until the PA has the dr to complete the form and send it back to them. Ive been waiting almost 2 weeks now. The biggest issue ive had out of them is Social Security requested medical records and they were the only practice out of 3 that have not sent the records. The records were requested 3 months ago. They didn't send them until I called and complain. They never answer the phone in the Columbia location. I always have to call Charleston to get them to give them my messages. I can tell its not just patients that have a problem with them. I think the staff has issues because every time I visit i see new staff. Do not use these people!!!!|If possible, I'd leave these folks a negative star rating. Any Star Wars fans out there? "You will never find a more wretched hive of scum and villainy," comes to mind. If you want a doctor's office that's pockets are lined with big corporations money to help protect them, instead of actually caring or attempting to help their clients, then you've found the right place. A close family friend has been having to fight with these "doctors" for about a year now, and in spite of his clear and present issues (as indicated by several MRI's, and other actual medical professionals), as well as verbally explaining the amount of pain he's in, they have yet to offer him ANY viable form of pain management.

column40: Extremely difficult to become a New Patient at this practice. Referred a several days ago. I have continuously been in touch with the referring office. When I tried to be proactive the first date, "Melissa", the coordinator, gave me a "courtesy call" so she can say she called me back, but just to tell me the referral hasn't been received yet, and "as her voicemail recording states, SHE will call once it is received" basically. I gave it 48 hours, followed up again and now she claims to not have received the referral at all. I have done my part to follow up, even offered to send the referral myself so I don't have to keep communicating back and forth between offices. She wouldn't accept it. I tried to ask for the Fax number directly to make sure that it was sent to the right place. She refused to give it to me also. She wanted me to call the referring office and have them call her directly. The patient has been in pain this entire time while we are waiting to be scheduled. I cannot wait any longer, We will just go somewhere else if it is this hard to advocate to get an appointment. Extremely Rude every single interaction.|It's difficult to assign a rating to this practice. The doctors seem attentive and effectively deal with most of my issues. I'm 80+ and have had a pretty good amount of experience dealing with medical services, that said I've never come across a group with less attention to communication than here. Countless messages that have never been addressed, and no, I'm not pestering them for pain refills. Emails never acknowledged. There is no patient portal that I can find and I've been trying to access my medical records to no avail, they screen all calls and direct them to mailboxes that apparently are never accessed  by doctors or PAs. I guarantee they will drive you crazy.|My experience here has been great over the 10+ years I've been a patient.  People tend to be angry when they arrive at the place because they're in pain.  I have a bulging disc for which I've been getting epidural injections for years. The treatments allow me to live a normal productive life.  The staff have always been professional and helpful.  Like most medical offices they are busy managing the ridiculous amount of paperwork required by the frigging insurance industry who are the true villains our society .  I've had a great experience.|I didn't even become a patient here and it was the worst experience I've ever encountered. I'm 32 weeks pregnant and moved to SC. I was seeing pain management for years in WA state for CRPS, HEDS, a spinal cord stimulator & multiple rib surgeries. I received paperwork from this office to request records from my previous pain clinic and mailed them back. I called the office 2-3 weeks later just to follow up & ensure they received those for a new patient appointment. I spoke with Melinda and upon answering the she went into a monologue about how many documents could be received, what cannot be reviewed, the doctors are very busy and can't look at too much. Literally was not why I was calling. When I clarified why I was calling she gave a very heavy sigh and went into how that wasn't her job and reiterated how busy they are. I'm a nurse, I work closely with our referrals department at times and appreciate how busy they are, as am I as a nurse. However, I have NEVER treated a patient like this before. I told her I could sense some frustration and how I understand but it was not ok to speak to me like this. I eventually hung up the call as I do not HAVE to be a patient at their facility. She tried calling back two times but never left a VM. I guess if this office is so busy then she's doing a great job deterring new patients.|Was referred to this pain management through the VA. The doctor I was seeing was nice. I was sent to have an MRI done, it took me from Oct 9-Nov 11 to get the MRI approved, because this office did not read the packet the VA sent. I had to call the pain management group to tell them how to do their job. From Nov 11- present no one will return my call or answer the phone. Once I called they said the individual was on the phone and to leave a message, so I did, still no call back. If you are referred to them, RUN.|Was referred due to having RA @ 34 multiple cervical fusions and lower back pain and needed medication management and second opinion. Was never called and told nothing else could be done for me I guess when trying to find someone to help you and have a second opinion pain Management denies you if your young and not within there papered notes so Instead of investigating looking at the patient you turn them away and don't even respond to them then when they call tirelessly then your Melinda lady is nasty when you ask a simple question and she responds it's his office he can chose who he wants and who he doesn't it he reads your chart notes from the prior pain clinic..... that's the clinic me and surgeon wanted a second opinion from. Well he can't do and feel he can't help you anymore than what's been done. Really there's been no imaging of my lower back no nerve testing of my lower back no pain control medication adjustment or anything after my surgery except from my surgeon. So he could he chooses not to. I honestly don't even want medications I want a treatment plan that works and one doctors that has control of all my medications like it's supposed to be. I get Melinda but your nasty attitude towards kind people you should really feel ashamed when you go home at night to talk to people that way that are in pain left in the dark and thrown around like a freaking ping pong ball. And all they want is 5 min and someone to help them and if they can't at least be kind. I'm glad I bit the bullet on this Office understand the hesitancy behind Pain Management, especially with the current pandemic and opioids but you're also doctors who took the oats to help patient in pain at your job, quit looking at a chart and papers that other doctors wrote on bring patients in and look at them for yourself listen to them see what's wrong with them. That's what a second opinion is not going based on what a chart says. Then, if you feel they are not a good fit for your office dismiss them explain to them I cannot help you, but if you go back to this doctor, he will or let me point you in this direction but doing it in this manner is just wrong that's why we have a problem that we have. Well, Melinda, I hope you have a wonderful day and I truly mean that because I do know how stressful your job is, but I truly hope you're nicer to the next person than you were to me.|My name is Patty Patty Arnold. I've been going to Dr. Lower milk for over 15 years. He and his staff are very kind and professional to me. Dr Loudermilk does not give pain medication unless it is absolutely necessary. He is a brilliant Doctor and Anesthesiologist. I have been reading his reviews there not very kind  I don't understand because there have never been unkind to me. Sometimes we need to understand our Dood stress and pressure and sometimes maybe they can't be 100 percent the way we want to be. Dr Lower milk has always tried to get to the root of my pain  I don't no what I would do without him those people that have criticized him maybe it's time you move on to a ctors and specialist are under a lot|Piedmont Comprehensive Pain Management had helped me in so many ways to be Pain free. All the staff honestly are the best and very caring. I appreciate everything they do from the front staff to the middle to the back. Will recommend to anyone. My parents go here as well. And a couple others I know. They will not disappoint.  Amanda Cheek
