column3:
Low Country Pain & Vein Center in Orangeburg, SC offers comprehensive pain management and vein treatment services to residents throughout the South Carolina Low Country region. Our state-of-the-art facility at 793 Cook Road combines advanced medical technology with compassionate care to address chronic pain conditions and vascular disorders that impact our patients' quality of life. Since our establishment, we have been dedicated to providing personalized treatment plans that focus on minimizing pain and maximizing function without excessive reliance on medication.

At Low Country Pain & Vein Center, our board-certified specialists utilize a multidisciplinary approach to pain management and vein care. We offer interventional procedures including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation for chronic pain conditions. Our vein treatment services encompass sclerotherapy, endovenous laser treatment (EVLT), and management of various venous disorders including varicose veins and venous insufficiency.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just symptoms. Our team takes time to understand each patient's unique circumstances, developing customized treatment plans that address both immediate pain relief and long-term management strategies. We emphasize patient education, ensuring you understand your condition and all available treatment options.

Convenient Location and Hours

Located at 793 Cook Rd in Orangeburg, SC 29115, our clinic is easily accessible to patients throughout the region. We offer flexible scheduling options to accommodate our patients' busy lives. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, contact us at (803) 531-8808. Our friendly staff is ready to assist with insurance verification and appointment scheduling to make your experience as seamless as possible.

column40: Very friendly staff and care about your wellbeing. They do their best to keep wait times down and are great at sending messages to remind you of your appointments and other things. They are very knowledgeable and attentive to your health and wellness.|Doctor Gupta and his team are awesome. I highly recommend Dr. Gupta to anyone I know because he is an excellent surgeon and performed an excellent job on my legs. His assistant Mrs. Dale is an awesome lady too, she made me feel so comfortable and is so kind|Dr Gupta is an awesome doctor.  He listens to his patients & I love a doctor who listens & helps his patients.  The staff is very friendly & caring.  I recommend. LOWCOUNTRY PAIN AND VAIN CENTER to anyone idoctor who is  caring &, conpassionrl|My 84 year old grandmother had an appointment here yesterday. Of course the office closes for lunch during their mid day break. However, my grandmother had to go to the rest room, and my mother asked a nurse who was returning to the building if it was possible for my grandmother to use the rest room. Her appointment was in 15 minutes and if she went somewhere else she would would be late for the appointment and thus have wasted an hour drive. The nurse said she would return with a response. The nurse in fact, did not return at all. No one would answer the phone or my mother knocking at the door. I understand mid day breaks. However this is not how you treat an 84 year old woman patient period!!|Are you robbing me or what you call three times already about the bill I only owe 45.00 and it's not like I get paid two a month and I am on disability darn what's up with calling and calling me about the bill on Friday|

column3:
Carolina Spine and Pain Centers serves Camden, South Carolina with comprehensive pain management solutions for residents suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our dedicated team of specialists combines decades of experience with cutting-edge treatments to address a wide spectrum of pain-related issues. Whether you're dealing with injuries from auto accidents, sports activities, workplace incidents, or managing degenerative conditions, our integrated approach offers effective relief through both chiropractic care and advanced medical interventions.

At Carolina Spine & Pain, we understand that pain is a deeply personal experience that affects each patient differently. This recognition drives our patient-centered approach, where customized treatment plans are developed to address your specific needs and circumstances. Our specialists take the time to thoroughly evaluate your condition, medical history, and lifestyle factors to create the most effective pain management strategy possible.

Treatment Options

Our practice offers a diverse range of treatment modalities, including:

  • Chiropractic adjustments

  • Advanced medical interventions

  • Rehabilitation therapies

  • Minimally invasive procedures

  • Comprehensive pain management plans

24/7 Availability

Pain and injuries don't follow a schedule, which is why Carolina Spine and Pain Centers provides round-the-clock accessibility. Our team is available 24/7 to address your urgent pain concerns and schedule prompt appointments when accidents or injuries occur unexpectedly.

Visit Our Camden Location

Our state-of-the-art facility is conveniently located at 718 Lafayette Ave, Camden, SC 29020. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (803) 887-2281 or visit www.carolinaspineandpaincenters.com. Experience the difference that world-class pain care can make in your quality of life.
column11: Carolina Spine & Pain has an experienced team of pain management specialists that provide world-class pain care at their Camden comprehensive pain management center. Our practice treats everything from car accident, sport, and workplace injuries to chronic pain and degenerative conditions. We provide patients with effective relief using a combination of chiropractic care and cutting-edge medical treatments. Our specialists have decades of combined experience. We understand that everyone experiences pain differently, so we take a personalized, patient-centered approach to treatment. Do not hesitate to call us, no matter when your injuries occur. We know that accidents can occur at any time. You can contact us anytime 24/7!

column40:
I was absolutely humiliated by the people at this office. The first thing I noticed was the office was filthy. Dust on the floors and furniture. There was a wad of gum on the floor that looked ancient. No one weighed me or checked my vital signs. A man, who I assumed was the doctor, led me to a room where he began telling me how he "planned to treat me". I had many questions- have you reviewed my medications? Do you know my diagnosis? He became frustrated and spat out, "I can see you're going to be a problem!". He then told me "if you act like this- the doctor will end this. It will be OVER!".
I thought this guy WAS the doctor. A moment later the actual doctor arrived. He expressed his disapproval of how I questioned his "X-ray tech" and then said, "I'm not doing this. Find someone else to treat your pain".
What? My wife was there with me. Neither of us could believe what had just happened. Before the doctor stormed out of the room I asked him if I would be charged for this "visit". He bluntly said "yes you are". I wonder how Medicare would react to these clowns charging for nothing? I would report these unprofessional children but then I will have to pay out of pocket.
Do yourself a favor and DO NOT go here. Drive to Columbia or Charleston and see a real professional group. I suggest Midland Orthopedics. Nice office- good people and outstanding treatment.|I came in as a new patient today. The Dr walked in and DEMANDED I take my Trump hat off because he was offended. When I refused, he didn't even examine me and told me he wouldn't help me and I need to go somewhere else. Now I'm still in massive pain because he wants to play politics with my health.|This place is horrible. The doctor is obnoxious and rude. I scheduled appointment only to get shots in my knees. The doctor came in and was not prepared to do any shots, but rather try and address my medicines that I'm on. I got up and told him I'm not here for medicines, I'm here for shots in my knees and I walked out.|Avoid this place at all costs. After seeing them for almost a year they have done nothing except violate my hippa rights then when I called them out on it they tried to make me leave saying I obviously think they are doing a bad job (they were never once in an 8 month stretch did they call in the meds.correctly or on time) when I didn't leave I was dismissed with an 8 day notice to my next appointment. They provided no referral to another doctor or adequate time to find another doctor which is against the law when they have you on opioids. So if you want your private information shared with strangers online and want nothing more then a pill pusher this is the place for you. I will be filing a complaint to medical board  and seeing an attorney about the 8 day notice of the dismissal too.

And I am well aware you can not confirm or deny I am a patient because that would be another Hippa violation and I am sure one per patient is your limit.|Our appointment was for 1:40 it's now 3:40 and we still haven't seen the doctor. This is ridiculous!|They say when first coming here their plan is for No meds & no pain. Didn't realize they meant that they would not call in meds every single month, with repeat unanswered phone calls and not submitting documents on time with the insurance company for pre authorization. Causing weeks with no pain medication at all and you can not get the nurses to answer the line or call back. Do not recommend if you are in chronic pain and can not go without medication for weeks every single visit. When they do what they are supposed to, the clinic works smoothly, but that has only happened once or twice in a year.|This is a very busy and crowded facility, but they do their best to get  you in and out. The doctors are awesome .Just go in sign in, don't leave because if you are not in their they will replace your spot. They don't have  time to call your  name over and over. All in all I recommend this place.|The staff are awesome people. Dr. O'Quinn is an honest, thorough & patient doctor. He don't rush through with his patients. I absolutely love that he has "bed side manners" and tells you upfront his diagnosis and plan of action.

SC Pain & Spine Specialists serves Little River, SC and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our board-certified physicians specialize in treating chronic pain conditions through minimally invasive procedures and personalized treatment plans. Since our founding, we've been committed to improving quality of life for patients suffering from back pain, neck pain, joint pain, and other chronic pain conditions. Our multidisciplinary approach combines advanced interventional techniques with rehabilitative therapies to address the root cause of pain rather than just masking symptoms.

At SC Pain & Spine Specialists, we offer a wide range of treatments including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. Our team utilizes state-of-the-art diagnostic tools to accurately identify pain sources and develop targeted treatment strategies. We pride ourselves on staying current with the latest advancements in pain medicine to provide our patients with the most effective care options available.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we take time to listen to each patient's concerns and goals. Our compassionate staff works diligently to schedule prompt appointments and create a comfortable, supportive environment. Most insurance plans are accepted, and our administrative team assists patients with navigating coverage questions.

Visit Our Practice

Located at 1569 US-17, Little River, SC 29566, our modern facility is equipped with the latest technology for diagnosing and treating pain conditions. Contact us at (843) 839-7246 to schedule a consultation or visit www.scpainandspine.com to learn more about our services and providers. New patients are welcome, and referrals can be made directly through our website or by phone.

column3:
Self Regional Healthcare Pain Management serves Greenwood, SC and surrounding communities with specialized pain medicine services. As a recognized medical specialty center, they provide comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Their team of physicians brings extensive expertise to the region, offering evidence-based treatments that address both the symptoms and underlying causes of persistent pain. The center stands as a beacon of hope for those whose lives have been disrupted by chronic pain conditions.

The Pain Management Center boasts a multi-specialty medical staff including board-certified pain physicians and a clinical psychologist. These professionals have received extensive training and hold certifications in pain medicine, anesthesiology, and internal medicine. Their academic contributions are significant, having authored or edited 11 medical textbooks and published more than 100 research articles in professional journals focused on pain diagnosis and treatment methodologies.

Comprehensive Approach to Pain Management

Understanding that chronic pain often becomes the focal point of patients' daily lives, Self Regional Healthcare's approach goes beyond symptom management. Their specialists excel not only in treating pain but also in diagnosing the source of complex medical and psychophysiologic disorders. This dual focus allows for more effective treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs.

Location and Contact Information

The Pain Management Center is conveniently located at 1325 Spring St, Greenwood, SC 29646. Patients seeking relief from chronic pain can schedule a consultation by calling +1 864-725-4095. Additional information about services and treatment options is available on their website at https://www.selfregional.org/specialized-services/pain-management-center/.
column11:
Pain medicine is a recognized medical specialty.
Our doctors are extensively trained and board certified in pain medicine, anesthesiology and internal medicine. They've authored or edited 11 medical textbooks and more than 100 research journal publications on the diagnosis and treatment of pain and related symptoms. For some, chronic pain becomes the focal point of daily life. The relief they so desperately need is not a world away - it's close to home.
Self Regional Healthcare's Pain Management Center has a multi-specialty medical staff of pain physicians and a clinical psychologist. Our doctors are not only skilled in treating pain, but also in helping diagnose the source of complex medical and psychophysiologic disorders.

column40:
(Zero star) NOT WORTH THE 2 MONTH WAIT TIME, At my very first appt. I met with Dr. Hewan-lowe and her first question to me was, "what makes you think these are migraines?" Well after 100's of doctors visit from the past 25 years for migraines pretty much let's me know, I have 2 types of migraines- cluster and tension. I was referred to PM for treatment for SC spine due to my ongoing pain.
My appt was at 1230, she walked in 5 after 1 and (HAD NOT READ ANY OF MY MEDICAL HISTORY NOTES TO PREPARE FOR MY APPTS)  to even begin to familiarize herself with my extensive documented medical records.
SHE MESSED UP MY PRESCRIPTIONS by forgetting to send one over and the other one was an entirely different muscle relaxer that makes me drowsy. Dr Hewan-low would not let me finish a sentence when asking me medical history questions, claiming she has "other patients" that deserve their time as well.
An absolute disgrace and waste of 2 months waiting for her to treat you like a piece of paper she can simply write off. I would not recommend this place to anyone I cared about. She even told me she wasn't doing my normal Botox injections for migraines when everyone was hyping the Self regional Pain management up like yeah they can do a ALL the injections but THAT WAS FALSE, ANDERSON IS THE NEXT CLOSET PLACE FOR HELP, don't waste your time waiting on Dr Huwan-lowe|The place sucks. They need to close the doors. Been going here over a year now and still have not received any help. You can't get anyone to answer the phone and when you do you can't get an appointment for at least another month or two. They referred me to PSYCHIATRY which made me feel like they think my pain is all in my head. ITS VERY REAL. Do not recommend this place at all complete joke|They are trying to force me to take epidural injections in my neck and back when I don't feel safe doing so I'm also type 2 diabetic and having issues controlling my sugars they took me off of medication till I can get the injections won't help with my chronic pain so I'm left to deal with my pain and if I can't take the injection they are saying I'm refusing help that should be illegal I've never been on drugs they can drug test and check backgrounds I want injections to be my last resort not the only one it should be my choice as a patient and not be forced and told if I don't I get kicked out jill gilcrest made that threat|Would leave zero stars if I could. They must make a lot of money from the injections because they try to force that on you as your only option. The doctor (LaTourette) has no bedside manner or personality and doesn't seem to care about proper patient care. Will be filing a complaint with the medical board and definitely NEVER going back.|My experience with pain management  is a good working relationship. You have to put in the work, follow advice, etc.

Update: After going to pain management for a year, getting injections, pain medication,  I was told I could no longer get pain meds due to an "anxiety medication" I had been taking for years, and was on my chart.

They, in turn, prescribed liquid cough suppressant for me, a person with COPD.

My family physician is concerned about bone loss in my hip, and with nothing left for me with the exception of cortisone injections,  I feel as if I've been let down by an office that is supposed to offer pain management, but has only given me 1 option to "manage" my pain.|I was referred here for treatment for my chronic pain and the neurosurgeon in the area also said that I needed pain mgt after my latest. MRI. At self regional hospital and I was told over the phone by. Lisa..  that the dr who would see me only gave injections and  no medication for pain and I had already told her that I have had over 50 injections in the past 20 years plus nerve blocks. And I said that the injections only helped me maybe a few days or few weeks after.. Lisa who answers the phone there had already told me weeks before the drs here prescribed certain medications for pain. she also asked me  personal questions about my condition and my health issues and my recent medication etc..  I had heard that dr latourette was a good dr n I am on permanent disability due to chronic pain and she said that she.. thought....   it was dr latourette who said that he would do injections only.  Well I have seen on pro publica..n. my insurance  company also knows that  he does write meds for treatment of chronic pain but I couldn't get past the front desk to even get an  appt!!!!.   That's refusing treatment to a disabled person...and the dr has not even seen the patient yet...?? but I was referred by my family dr and. neurosurgeon. .... Lisa.@ the desk ... whom I've never seen or met.  Did everything she could to keep me from being seen.  Now.. if the dr really said that...ok. but why would I have  been referred here?  And I was!!!  Also.  told by. Lisa. ??. At the phone.?.No... medication will be prescribed for my lower spine and 5 bulging discs and sciatica and deg disc disease. Fibromyalgia ..RA..  chronic pain.  condition inside my back and neck and muscles.  I don't know what to say except that is absolutely ridiculous.  Injections only?  But this site reads. Medication analgesics are prescribed and etc.    I am going to be asking about this.   That's kinda weird and kinda like discrimination against disabled people who have documented proof from their doctors and social security administration and I think that the doctors don't know what goes on at some of these pain mgt offices..idk.   Especially w the receptionists and some nurses and I have had this problem at another office by phone.  But the  doctors always have been nice at the other 2 places. But the
receptionists and nurses  are messing up these drs. N.  their businesses...If they refuse to see people who are suffering.  Why are they in business?  Its a pain mgt office.   Management of pain.   Duh..    Very rude staff.  I don't know about the doctors. I didn't get a appt but waited for 2 months.  Referral was sent.I
will.  Not...**********recommend) due to this experience  ... Theres other places to be treated with respect and dignity. And by compassionate people.  I'd. Ride in pain for 2 hours for better treatment and I probably am going to...   I've had elderly friends of my family who have relocated. Actually. Sold their homes to move in order to receive better healthcare.on down  the coast..thats sad...I might have to do that too.  Its not the best way to earn the patients  trust. I am slowly losing faith in  pain mgt.  The guidelines for chronic pain are. 90mme. That's the CDC guidelines.  This doesn't make sense to not treat people with chronic pain except injections...|The doctor actually cares about your pain! The staff is awesome!!! All genuine, no doubt about it. They also get you in if your pain is too hard to deal with. So sooo happy...they helped me sleep through the night.|I called in April and was told by a very rude lady that they had no openings until July,,then she just hung up,,,,,The old ones that use to be there are now gone,,,,what does that tell you about that place now....

column3:
United Physician Group Pain Management serves patients throughout Spartanburg, SC with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each individual's needs. Our dedicated team of pain specialists combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives and reduce suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions.

At United Physician Group Pain Management, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to treating various pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. Our board-certified physicians utilize the latest diagnostic tools and treatment modalities to address the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Our Treatment Approaches

We provide a range of interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modification guidance. Our treatments may include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and carefully monitored medication protocols when appropriate.

Patient-Centered Care

Understanding that pain affects each person differently, we develop personalized treatment plans that consider your medical history, pain levels, functional goals, and quality of life concerns. Our team works closely with primary care physicians and other specialists to ensure coordinated care for optimal outcomes.

Visit Our Spartanburg Location

Waist of time! Please look for another practice! This one will waist your time!!|I have lifelong chronic conditions and don't agree with opioid use until I've exhausted ALL options. I had a reaction to one medicine and then I was unknowingly prescribed an opioid. When I expressed being uncomfortable with taking an opiod 2x a day EVERY day the doctor refused to see me after I came to my appt. She did say I wasn't charged but I was off the schedule until I talked to my therapist about taking the opioid. The MA (medical assistant) advised that what i was prescribed is a "baby opiod" opioid is opioid. Period. The MA also said that they are a pain management office so their job is to push pills. Uh no. I'm lucky to have found another pain management physician who is offering pain management that does not involve risk of addiction with long term use since I have LIFELONG conditions. I can never support someone who refuses to listen to their patients and pushes pills such as opioids and refuses to care for a patient because they want alternatives to opioids.|Updated 02/04/2025 Dr Lisa and her staff left the office, now they're new doctors and new staff. 5

column40:
Katie @ Trident Pain Center in North Charleston provides excellent care for my Dad during his appointments and over the phone.

She is very polite, professional, and extremely helpful.

Her service is much appreciated.

Thank you for your kindness & flexibility, Katie 

I recommend a raise to her upper management because she's a major asset to Trident, and she's on the front lines for the company.

Katie makes patients feel appreciated and loved on a consistent basis because she sincerely cares.

Respectfully,
Noah Denton|It's fine to sign up here, but be aware you will be treated like a criminal, not a patient. In 6 months, I had two false positive tests. The first they said "don't do it again" to which I asked "how?" and the second they kicked me out via phone call. Unfortunately, clinics like this mistreat those legitimately suffering from chronic pain. Rather than serving their patients, they directly create demand for black market alternatives. After a year here, I can tell you they will guaranteed do the same to you and with a smile on their face.

I have no criminal history or past with drugs. Just a guy who legitimately needs pain medicine and is now guaranteed not to get it. Be aware that signing up here will have consequences, false positives will eventually happen, and there will be no re-test or reprimand of any kind. There is no pain treatment in 2024.|Wonderful Doctor's and PA'S. I had to go to a different pain management because of insurance reasons, and after a year I switched insurance so I could go back to them. Trident Pain is by far the best for Pain management. You will not be disappointed if you choose them to assist with your care. They actually listen and educate you as needed, promotes natural medicine and prescription, do research and stay educated on current health information, and most of all they actually care.|We were seen on 8/23 and had a horrible visit as a new patient just left for 45 minutes sitting in the room waiting to be seen and when I said something I was told that new patients could take an hour or more, ok but not an hour sitting in a room waiting to be seen!!!  Then we were told that the treatment we were looking into had to have prior authorization and that it could take up to 7 business days, well its now been 11 business days so I call the office only to find out that the doctor never made or sent a note for the prior authorization to be processed!  I do not have time to waste with doctors offices that cannot follow through and will never be back to this office, or any other location for that matter, it just is unacceptable to treat new patients in pain this way when there are so many other options out there.|The Doctors and their staff are amazing! I was very scared when I first moved to the area, thinking I wouldn't find anyone to help me and continuing my care when I left the North East.  I was very pleasantly put at ease when I made my first appointment.  They are caring, compassionate, and thorough! I am so happy that I found this group, and I thank them for all they do.|Had an appointment here for 2:30. I was told to get there a half hour early. Get there at 1:50 and wasn't seen until 2:45. I was in a car accident, and it is hard for me to sit long periods of time. So I wasn't very happy sitting there for an hour and have 2 MRIs done, back to back. So I was in a lot of pain, and honestly, no one at the counter cared at all. I know people have bad days, but some compassion goes a Long way!|HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!!! I should have taken past reviews more seriously. From the first appointment Trident definitely had their own agenda. It was impossible to get in touch with anyone in the office directly and they haven't responded to voicemail or messages in a month.|Dr. Nolan and his staff work together so well to give each patient the best care possible. They are so helpful and will answer any question you have.  Dr. Nolan explains that pain management is just not medicines but physical therapy and injections.  Over July 4th I got an extreme exacerbation to my pain level and had to go to the ER three times but they just could not get the situation under control.  Going to the clinic this morning has helped so much.  With the spinal infusions of the meds in my spine done by Dr. Nolan I can say tonight I am better.  I really do not know what I would do without Dr. Nolan and his wonderful staff at Trident.  They are all trained so well to take care of each patient with kindness and the right help I need.  This clinic is my life saver and if you are in need of truly wonderful pain management I can tell you this is the place to go.  There are other locations in this clinic but this is the one I have chosen and GOD led me to them.
Now if you are not willing to work with a pain management team and only expect meds, you are  not participating correctly in your care.  This takes hard work on our parts as well as listening and working with the team.  They have never steered me wrong.  GOD BLESS ALL OF YOU for all you do for us.

It should be noted that this is a PAIN Center. I didn't realize they were in business to cause pain. Upon entering which I did early, I had to answer all the verbal questions as usual. Insurance, ID, credit card, name again, address again, phone# again (I say again because I just handed her all that information on my drivers license)
And was told to have a seat and fill out the new patient questionnaire. (A LOT of pages many of which asked for the same info as page 1)
My hands are very arthritic so it's very hard to write. Especially as much as they were asking.
Anyway it took about 15 minutes to fill out their questionnaire. A lady called me to the back to take my vitals then led me to what I guess is an examination room where I was asked to wait. After waiting for over an hour in a room with the door closed. I walked back to the front desk and asked the nice lady what was going on. She just looked at me like a deer in the headlights and couldn't, I guess, comprehend the question so I stated that after all the questions both written and verbal they had stuck me in what was apparently an isolation ward for an hour. She still couldn't comprehend what the problem was.
1:45 minutes of my life gone $30 copay gone. I told the nice lady to enjoy that copay and take a good look at my back because they would NEVER see it again and walked out. On a side note there was not a single car in their parking lot except mine so they shouldn't have been soooo busy that they just couldn't see me. Pain Specialists of Beaufort serves Beaufort, SC and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians specializes in treating various chronic pain conditions using the latest interventional techniques. Located conveniently on Lady's Island, our state-of-the-art facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies to address even the most complex pain issues.

At Pain Specialists of Beaufort, we understand that chronic pain can significantly impact your quality of life. Our multidisciplinary approach combines cutting-edge interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative strategies to create personalized treatment plans. We specialize in treating conditions including:

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Sciatica and nerve pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

Advanced Interventional Treatments

Our facility offers the most up-to-date interventional treatments available in pain medicine. These minimally invasive procedures target the source of pain directly, often providing relief when other methods have failed. Our interventional options include epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and more.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the pain. Our compassionate team takes time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop a treatment strategy aligned with your goals. We work closely with referring physicians to ensure coordinated care throughout your pain management journey.

Visit Our Lady's Island Facility

Experience relief from chronic pain at our modern Lady's Island location. We're conveniently situated at 135 Sea Island Pkwy, Beaufort, SC 29907. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 843-473-6666 or visit our website at www.painbeaufort.com.

The medical staff's impressive credentials include authoring or editing 11 medical textbooks and publishing more than 100 research journal articles on the diagnosis and treatment of pain and related symptoms. This wealth of knowledge translates directly into superior patient care and innovative treatment approaches.

Comprehensive Pain Solutions

For many patients, chronic pain becomes the focal point of daily life, limiting activities and diminishing quality of life. At Greenwood Pain Management, the relief patients desperately need is close to home. As part of Self Regional Healthcare's Pain Management Center, we offer a multi-specialty approach with pain physicians and a clinical psychologist working collaboratively to address both the physical and psychological aspects of pain.

Diagnostic Excellence

Our doctors excel not only in treating pain but also in diagnosing the source of complex medical and psychophysiologic disorders. This diagnostic precision allows for more targeted and effective treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific condition and needs.

Our experienced team of specialists combines chiropractic expertise with cutting-edge medical treatments to address a wide spectrum of pain conditions. With decades of combined experience, we've established ourselves as a trusted provider of world-class pain care in the Lexington area, helping patients find relief from both acute and chronic pain issues.

At Carolina Spine & Pain, we treat a diverse range of conditions including car accident injuries, sports-related trauma, workplace injuries, chronic pain disorders, and degenerative conditions. Our approach integrates traditional chiropractic care with innovative medical interventions to provide effective, lasting relief. We understand that pain is a deeply personal experience, which is why we develop individualized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs and circumstances.

Patient-Centered Approach

Our philosophy centers on recognizing that everyone experiences pain differently. This understanding drives our personalized, patient-centered approach to treatment. We take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop a customized plan that addresses your unique pain challenges. This commitment to individualized care has helped countless patients regain mobility, reduce pain, and improve their quality of life.

24/7 Availability

Pain and injuries don't follow a schedule, which is why Carolina Spine and Pain Centers offers round-the-clock availability. Whether you've suffered an injury in the middle of the night or are experiencing a pain flare-up during a weekend, our team is accessible 24/7 to provide guidance and schedule prompt care. This commitment to accessibility ensures that you never have to endure unnecessary pain while waiting for office hours.

Visit us at our convenient Lexington location: 321 S Lake Dr, Lexington, SC 29072, or call us anytime at (803) 887-2344. For more information about our services and approach to pain management, explore our website at www.carolinaspineandpaincenters.com/lexington/.
column11:
Carolina Spine & Pain has an experienced team of pain management specialists that provide world-class pain care at their Lexington comprehensive pain management center. Our practice treats everything from car accident, sport, and workplace injuries to chronic pain and degenerative conditions. We provide patients with effective relief using a combination of chiropractic care and cutting-edge medical treatments. Our specialists have decades of combined experience.
We understand that everyone experiences pain differently, so we take a personalized, patient-centered approach to treatment. Do not hesitate to call us, no matter when your injuries occur. We know that accidents can occur at any time. You can contact us anytime 24/7!

column3:
Scott B. Sauer, D.O. serves the Myrtle Beach, South Carolina community as a distinguished pain management specialist at OrthoSC. Based at the Carolina Forest Pain office, Dr. Sauer brings exceptional expertise in interventional pain management procedures designed to address a comprehensive range of pain syndromes. His practice combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care, offering patients effective solutions for chronic and acute pain conditions. Dr. Sauer's approach emphasizes minimally invasive techniques that maximize pain relief while minimizing recovery time, helping patients return to their daily activities with improved function and quality of life.

Dr. Sauer specializes in advanced interventional procedures targeting various pain conditions, including:

  • Spinal stenosis and sciatica treatment

  • Comprehensive management of low back and neck pain

  • Joint pain interventions

  • Targeted therapies for spinal pain of multiple origins

  • Treatment for peripheral neuropathies including occipital neuralgia

  • Specialized care for painful lateral femoral cutaneous neuralgia

  • Management of facial neuralgias

  • Innovative approaches for reflex sympathetic dystrophy (RSD/CRPS)

  • Customized solutions for other intractable pain syndromes

Education and Expertise

Through rigorous training and ongoing professional development, Dr. Sauer has cultivated extensive knowledge in pain management interventions. His expertise allows him to develop personalized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient, focusing on both symptom relief and addressing underlying causes of pain when possible.

Patient-Centered Approach

At his Carolina Forest Pain office, Dr. Sauer prioritizes patient education and collaborative decision-making. He takes time to thoroughly explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to actively participate in their care journey.

Contact Information

Phone: +1 843-353-3460

Address: 210 Village Center Blvd #150, Myrtle Beach, SC 29579, United States

Website: www.orthosc.org/doctors/scott-b-sauer-do
column11:
Dr. Scott Sauer is a pain management doctor at OrthoSC who provides care to patients at our Carolina Forest Pain office in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina.

Through his advanced training, Dr. Sauer has acquired knowledge, skills, and expertise in interventional procedures encompassing the treatment of all varieties of pain syndromes.
Dr. Sauer specializes in minimally invasive treatment modalities for spinal stenosis, sciatica, low back pain, neck pain, joint pain, and spinal pain of multiple origins. He also treats painful peripheral neuropathies, such as occipital neuralgia, painful lateral femoral cutaneous (skin) neuralgia, facial neuralgias, reflex sympathetic dystrophy (RSD or CRPS), and other intractable pain syndromes.

column2: Prisma Health Center for Comprehensive Pain Management
column3:
Prisma Health Center for Comprehensive Pain Management in Seneca, SC offers specialized care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our multidisciplinary team of board-certified pain specialists combines advanced diagnostic techniques with innovative treatment approaches to address the complex nature of pain. Located in the upstate region, our center serves patients throughout Seneca and surrounding communities with compassionate, evidence-based care focused on improving quality of life and restoring function.

At Prisma Health Center for Comprehensive Pain Management, we provide individualized treatment plans that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and integrative approaches. Our specialists are experienced in treating various pain conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and pain related to cancer treatments. We emphasize minimally invasive techniques whenever possible to help patients achieve meaningful pain relief with reduced reliance on opioid medications.

Patient-Centered Approach

Understanding that pain affects every aspect of a patient's life, our team works collaboratively with primary care physicians and other specialists to ensure coordinated care. We take time to listen to each patient's concerns, thoroughly evaluate their condition, and develop personalized treatment strategies. Our goal is not just to manage symptoms but to address underlying causes of pain while supporting patients' overall wellbeing and functionality.

Location and Contact Information

Our Seneca facility is conveniently located at 102 Omni Dr Suite B, Seneca, SC 29672, United States. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (864) 885-7971. Additional information about our pain management programs can be found on our website at prismahealth.org/services/other-services/pain-management. As part of the Prisma Health network, we're committed to providing accessible, high-quality pain care to improve the health of all individuals and communities we serve.

Dunes Pain Relief Center in Myrtle Beach, SC offers comprehensive non-narcotic pain management solutions for residents along the Grand Strand. Established as a trusted medical facility, our specialized team combines advanced interventional techniques with personalized care plans to address chronic and acute pain conditions. We understand that pain affects every aspect of life, which is why our approach focuses on treating the whole person rather than just symptoms. Our state-of-the-art facility on Oleander Drive serves as a beacon of hope for those seeking alternatives to medication-dependent pain management.

At Dunes Pain Relief Center, we provide a wide range of interventional procedures designed to target pain at its source. Our evidence-based treatments include epidural steroid injections, joint injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and regenerative medicine options. Each treatment plan is customized to address specific conditions such as back pain, neck pain, arthritis, sciatica, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our physicians stay at the forefront of pain management advancements to ensure patients receive the most effective care possible.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in establishing meaningful partnerships with our patients through clear communication and education. During your visit, our specialists take time to thoroughly evaluate your condition, explain treatment options, and answer questions. This collaborative approach empowers patients to make informed decisions about their care journey. Our compassionate staff ensures a comfortable experience from the moment you schedule your appointment to your follow-up care.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Located at 4710 Oleander Dr, Myrtle Beach, SC 29577, our clinic is easily accessible to residents throughout Horry County and surrounding areas. We maintain flexible scheduling options to accommodate busy lifestyles and urgent pain concerns. For appointments or inquiries, contact our friendly staff at +1 843-839-1935. Our mission remains steadfast: helping you return to the activities you love with reduced pain and improved quality of life.

column3:
Coastal Pain & Spine Center serves patients throughout Bluffton and Hilton Head, South Carolina, as the region's premier destination for comprehensive pain management solutions. Our state-of-the-art facilities provide specialized care for residents suffering from chronic pain conditions throughout the Lowcountry area. With a commitment to personalized treatment plans and cutting-edge techniques, we've established ourselves as leaders in pain medicine across Beaufort County.

Our clinical team consists of double board-certified physicians and highly skilled physician assistants with extensive training in diagnosing and treating complex pain disorders. We specialize in addressing a wide range of musculoskeletal and neurologic problems, including degenerative disc disease of the neck and back, sciatic nerve pain, joint arthritis, and diabetic neuropathy. Each patient receives a comprehensive evaluation to identify the root cause of their pain before developing an individualized treatment strategy.

Advanced Treatment Options

At Coastal Pain & Spine Center, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that includes:

- Multimodal analgesic medication protocols

- Minimally invasive steroid injections

- Precision nerve ablation procedures

- Advanced neuromodulation techniques

Our goal is to improve your quality of life and help you return to enjoying the Lowcountry lifestyle you love. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of daily living, which is why we work collaboratively with each patient to find effective solutions that minimize discomfort and maximize function.

Convenient Locations

Visit our modern facility in Bluffton at 38 Sheridan Park Circle, Suite F, or schedule an appointment at our Hilton Head location. Contact us today at (843) 757-6744 or visit https://coastalpainandspine.com/ to begin your journey toward pain relief and improved mobility.

column2: Skylyn Wellness Center, Inc & Spartanburg Spine and Pain Clinic
column3:
Skylyn Wellness Center, Inc. & Spartanburg Spine and Pain Clinic serves Spartanburg, SC and surrounding communities with comprehensive chiropractic care and holistic wellness solutions. Established as a trusted healthcare provider in the Upstate region, our integrated clinic combines evidence-based chiropractic techniques with modern pain management approaches to address a wide spectrum of musculoskeletal conditions. Our team of experienced practitioners is dedicated to providing personalized treatment plans that focus on not just alleviating symptoms but addressing the root causes of pain and discomfort.

At Skylyn Wellness Center, we excel in treating injuries resulting from automobile accidents, workplace incidents, and sports-related trauma. Our comprehensive approach includes thorough evaluations, advanced diagnostic procedures, and customized rehabilitation protocols designed to restore function and mobility. Beyond injury care, we offer family wellness programs that emphasize preventative care and maintenance of optimal spinal health throughout all stages of life.

Treatment Approaches and Services

Our clinic utilizes a blend of traditional chiropractic adjustments, spinal decompression therapy, therapeutic exercises, and advanced pain management techniques. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs, considering factors such as age, overall health status, and specific conditions. We maintain strong relationships with other healthcare providers in the Spartanburg area, ensuring coordinated care when additional medical interventions are necessary.

Patient Experience and Facility

Located at 1770 Skylyn Dr in Spartanburg, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology. We pride ourselves on creating a welcoming environment where patients feel comfortable and respected throughout their healing journey. Our administrative team works diligently to handle insurance claims, particularly for auto accidents and workers' compensation cases, minimizing the stress on our patients during recovery.

For appointments or additional information about our services, visit skylynwellness.com or call us at (864) 583-8308. Our clinic is conveniently situated in Spartanburg, SC 29307, with accessible parking and flexible scheduling options to accommodate busy lifestyles.

Dr. Farayi Mbuvah serves patients throughout Myrtle Beach, SC and surrounding communities with exceptional cardiovascular care. As a board-certified cardiologist affiliated with Conway Medical Center, Dr. Mbuvah brings specialized expertise in preventive cardiology, heart disease management, and advanced cardiac diagnostics to the Grand Strand area. His patient-centered approach combines evidence-based medicine with compassionate care, ensuring each individual receives personalized treatment plans tailored to their unique cardiac health needs.

At his conveniently located practice at 811 82nd Parkway, Suite B in Myrtle Beach, Dr. Mbuvah offers a wide range of cardiovascular services including diagnostic testing, treatment for coronary artery disease, heart failure management, arrhythmia care, and preventive cardiology consultations. The state-of-the-art facility is equipped with advanced cardiac monitoring technology, allowing for precise diagnosis and effective treatment planning.

Patient-Focused Care

Dr. Mbuvah is known for his thorough approach to patient care, taking time to listen to concerns and explain complex cardiac conditions in understandable terms. His commitment to patient education empowers individuals to take an active role in their heart health management. The practice welcomes new patients and accepts most major insurance plans, making quality cardiac care accessible to the community.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment with Dr. Farayi Mbuvah, patients can call +1 843-839-4598. His practice is located at 811 82nd Parkway, Suite B, Myrtle Beach, SC 29572. For more information about Dr. Mbuvah's credentials and services, visit his provider profile at Conway Medical Center.

Make sure you're telling your pain doctor what you're going through and this man will make sure that you are living comfortably without being overmedicated. Staff there is amazing. Makes you feel optimistic about relief and does whatever he can to insure that happens.|All talk....No Substance....I was in for an initial consult over 2 weeks ago....vertebrae smashing a nerve, and I'm in crippling pain....When I initially came into the reception area, the receptionist seemed more worried about what was on the Tv, than attending to me immediately....I was early for my appt., and had to wait 30 mins past time set to meet the Dr. He was training others that were with him he said. The consensus was to do an ablation....after not hearing from this office for almost 2 weeks, I call last Friday and got Cody....He said, we are waiting for insurance approval....I knew it wouldn't take 2 weeks, as I've had hundreds of Drs appts., so I called multiple ppl at CMC, to find the inevitable answer that I was to again call Cody in Mbuvah's office, and magically now they had the insurance approval but NOW SAID they needed my GP's approval for the ablation. What Dr leans on a Dr outside of their circle to tell a patient to stop taking a certain Med, and/or the same office not tell u the truth about the insurance issue. Before you make a call to CMC to question their decisions, or lack thereof, please understand they are the thinnest skinned ppl on the planet. STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS.|Dr. Mbuvah is awesome, he takes his time with you and cares. He is very knowledgeable and explains everything so you understand. Cody is awesome, he cares about the patients also
Highly recommend Dr. Mbuvah !!!|He is thee best pain doctor you will ever find. He takes his time to listen, talk with you, and find solutions. Mbuvah will definitely take care of you.

column3:
Piedmont Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation, P.A. serves Greenville, SC and surrounding communities with specialized care for patients suffering from chronic pain and mobility issues. Founded by Dr. Robert G. Schwartz (now Emeritus) and currently led by Dr. Terzella, this practice has established itself as a leader in comprehensive pain management using holistic approaches. Their philosophy—"Your pain is real. We can help."—reflects their deep commitment to validating patients' experiences while offering effective treatment solutions.

At Piedmont Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation, patients experiencing complex chronic pain, weakness, numbness, and other muscle-motor problems receive individualized care plans designed to improve quality of life. The practice specializes in treating conditions that other providers may find challenging to diagnose or manage effectively. Their unique whole-body health approach combines traditional medical practices with complementary therapies to address not just symptoms but underlying causes.

Expert Medical Team

Dr. Terzella works alongside Emeritus Dr. Robert G. Schwartz to provide exceptional care based on decades of combined experience in physical medicine and rehabilitation. Their extensive background in pain management allows them to offer innovative solutions for patients who may have previously struggled to find relief. The entire staff is trained to support patients with empathy and clarity, understanding that chronic pain affects every aspect of a person's life.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets Piedmont Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation apart is their commitment to treating each patient as a whole person, not just a collection of symptoms. Their holistic methodology considers physical, emotional, and environmental factors that contribute to pain and disability. This comprehensive perspective enables more effective treatment plans and better long-term outcomes for patients with complex conditions.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit http://piedmontpmr.com/ or call +1 864-235-1834. The practice is conveniently located at 317 St Francis Dr #350, Greenville, SC 29601.

Our unique holistic approach to whole-body health stems from an extensive background in pain management and is designed to support our patients through injuries and chronic pain with empathy and clarity.

column40: Dr. Tarzella is very caring and empathetic to conditions. He also has a great sense of humor and is very friendly during visits. I had been having morning headaches associated with neck pain, and the pain greatly interfered with my sleep quality for 12 months. Two sessions of Prolo therapy eliminated my headaches. I still have the morning exhaustion, but the headaches are gone which is a huge improvement. I am hoping a few more sessions will help relieve the rest of my neck pain and allow me to get the rest I need.|Dr Terzella and his staff are Fabulous!!!! He is the first Doctor that has truly understood what I'm going through with my Fibromyalgia. The diagnostics and the treatments are helping me have a better quality of life. He really cares about his patients and spends as much time with them as needed. You are not just a number at his practice. The staff are very caring also. If you are wanting pain management without Opioids, this is the place.|8/14/2024 So disappointing! If you have BCBS OF SC insurance & are a NP, they expect you to pay $250 for your initial visit.  They were supposed to call me and let me know ahead of time.  I've had an appt scheduled since 7/17 for 8/28. DR is out of town for my appt so I was asked to come in sooner. I filled my paperwork out and immediately sent it back to them with my insurance info on 7/17. I arrived at 9 am as requested. I was greated & asked if i had filled out my paperwork. I exclaimed that i had on the 17th & sent back to them immediately,  she found that she did have a chart created for me.  I gave them copies of my ins and DL cards. I waited over 1/2 hr to be called back. Got into room and was told that my Blue Essentials BCBS OF SC plan hasn't been paying so I needed to be prepared to pay $250 for today's visit.  "They pay some claims but they've not been paying so they collect the $250 when you leave & "she's" been calling patients and telling them." At no point was I told this.  Unfortunately I don't have $250 to spend at this time.  My OOP ins obligations have been met so I expected this appt to be covered. I was looking so forward to this visit to hopefully finally get it of pain.  I'm so angry now & disappointed. What an unorganized disaster of a front office.  We drove 1/2 hr to the office and waisted 1.5 hrs this morning not to mention the amount of time it took to fill out pprwk. Huge disappointment!!!  I never got to see or meet the Dr so I can not attest to his abilities.|Dr. Terzalla is the nicest most attentive doctor I have ever been to. Suffering for 1.5 years with things no doctor has helped me with so far. He is such a good listener and really cares about helping. An amazing doctor!!!|Got my first prolotherapy injections in my neck for burning pain with Dr.Terzella very funny and competent doc. There were 6 shots after an ultrasound, light pinch. Already feeling a noticeable improvement, will update with further injections.|Dr Schwartz is a miracle worker. I have been able to get my pain under control in a very short amount of time --where all other doctors have failed! I have also been able to get off all my pain medications and regain my mobility, something I never thought was possible! To sit and think that  multiple doctors have recommended spinal cord stimulators and other other crazy devices, yet here I am stronger than ever showing improvements.  Doctors like him are far and few between; If you are experiencing any pain, I highly recommend Dr Schwartz. You will get personalized care and attention to address your issues. My intake was super quick, I did not need a special referral, I just called, setup an appointment and was seen right away. I even got treated on my first visit! Thank you to the amazing staff & Dr Schwartz for the above and beyond patient care.|Robert Schwartz MD is a doctor who takes advantage of patients and fraudulently bills you and the insurance company he does not answer questions about your condition be careful good reputation in the past but current care is extremely poor quality Beware of this crooked doctor no good recent reviews and hides his negative reviews and results. I stopped care because of fraudulent billing concerns at every visit with his office|I visited Dr. Matthew Terazella for loss of cartilage in one of my knees. The care and attention he gave me has been more than anyone could ever ask for. The Doctors at this office spend time with every patient, to make sure they understand exactly what is going on and how to best help with whatever problem you are having. Due to Dr. Matthews treatment in my knee and the referral to a top notch physical therapist I'm on my way to using my knee at least 100 times better than when I first hobbled into his office. I highly recommend Dr. Matthew and his office for their highly professional care.

column3:
Pain Medicine Specialist-Fort Mill serves patients throughout Fort Mill, South Carolina and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified specialists combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Located conveniently in Fort Mill, we've established ourselves as a trusted resource for patients seeking relief from debilitating pain that affects their quality of life.

At Pain Medicine Specialist-Fort Mill, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, utilizing both interventional procedures and medication management strategies. Our specialists are trained in the latest evidence-based treatments for conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient.

Our Comprehensive Approach

We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why our approach goes beyond simply treating symptoms. Our specialists conduct thorough evaluations to identify the root causes of your pain, then develop targeted treatment strategies that may include minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy recommendations, medication management, and lifestyle modifications. This integrated approach helps patients achieve meaningful, long-lasting pain relief.

Patient-Centered Care

What sets us apart is our commitment to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. We take the time to explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. Our friendly staff ensures a comfortable experience from the initial consultation through ongoing treatment.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please contact us at +1 803-802-7100. Our office is located at 342 Patricia Ln, Suite 102, Fort Mill, SC 29708. For more information about our services and to access patient resources, visit our website at fortmillpainspecialists.com.

Trident Pain Center West Ashley serves the Charleston, SC area with comprehensive pain management solutions. Located in the heart of West Ashley, our clinic specializes in treating chronic pain conditions through innovative, evidence-based approaches. Our team of board-certified physicians combines years of specialized training with cutting-edge technology to develop personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain rather than just masking symptoms.

At Trident Pain Center West Ashley, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options, including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. Our multidisciplinary approach incorporates physical therapy, behavioral health strategies, and minimally invasive techniques to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

Patient-Centered Care

Euveda MediSpa & Aesthetics is a fantastic all-in-one beauty destination. They offer a wide range of services, including facials, brows, waxing, and nails, making it incredibly convenient and time-saving. I always look forward to my visits, especially for facials with Anna. Her attention to detail and personalized approach leave my skin glowing and refreshed for weeks. The HydroDiamond treatment is a must-try--my pores have never been so clean! Highly recommend this place for anyone looking for top-notch beauty services.|I just started here about 6 months ago. I had my first injection and that went well. It lasted longer then any other injection I've had.
3 months later I'm needing it again. This time there office and my insurance company couldn't get things going unless I intervened. Finally I got approved and had the same injection but this time it was a dud. So they said there is another injection that I can get so they ordered it to the insurance company. I waited and waited and nothing so I called again and they tell me the insurance rejected it. So I called the insurance company again and go round and round with them. So after a hour they tell me it's good to go, great!! I called the office and they said, yes your on. Come in that day, great!! An hour before the appointment the office calls me and tells me, sorry Mr. Johnson, the approval was for the last injection you had! WHAT? Oh my God what a cluster screw.
I still have not had that injection and I'm in bad pain and now in bed until I go round and round again. SMH|Excellent care- Treated with respect & kindness. Most importantly they listen & explain !

A Grateful patient!|Very convenient location for Pain management.

Not one soul from the Pain Center called to see how I was,  that day or any following.|I have seen many Dr over the years all across the country. column2: Southeast Pain and Spine Care - Piedmont Medical Center
column3:
Southeast Pain and Spine Care serves Rock Hill, SC with comprehensive pain management solutions at their Piedmont Medical Center location. Established in 1997 by Southeast Anesthesiology Consultants, this respected practice has evolved into a regional leader in interventional pain management, offering evidence-based treatments for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions.

What sets Southeast Pain and Spine Care apart is their team of highly qualified physicians. All pain management doctors are double board certified or board eligible in pain management and have completed specialized fellowship training. This advanced expertise ensures patients receive the most current and effective treatments available for managing complex pain conditions.

Extensive Regional Network

From its founding, Southeast Pain and Spine Care has experienced remarkable growth, now operating 14 specialized pain management clinics throughout the Carolinas and Virginia. This extensive network serves more than 85,000 patients annually, making it one of the region's most accessible pain management resources.

Strategic Healthcare Partnerships

While maintaining an independently owned facility in Virginia, Southeast Pain and Spine Care has established valuable partnerships with leading healthcare systems including Atrium Health and Piedmont Medical Center. These collaborations enhance their ability to deliver exceptional care across their North Carolina and South Carolina locations.

Rock Hill Location Details

The Rock Hill clinic is conveniently located at 200 S Herlong Ave, Suite A, Rock Hill, SC 29732. Patients seeking appointments or information can contact the office directly at (803) 620-6067. For continuing care resources and additional information about services, visit their website at https://www.sepainandspinecare.com/continue-care/.
column11: Southeast Anesthesiology Consultants founded Southeast Pain and Spine Care in 1997. Southeast Pain and Spine Care has grown rapidly, currently operating a network of 14 pain management clinics serving more than 85,000 patients each year throughout the region. Our pain management doctors are all double board certified or board eligible in pain management and are also fellowship trained in pain management. Southeast Pain and Spine Care operates an independently owned facility in Virginia but is also committed to working with our hospital partners, Atrium Health and Piedmont Medical Center in providing excellent care and services at the North Carolina and South Carolina locations.

And the thing is they will tell you these shots will work for a day or two. DONT DO IT ITS NOT WORTH BEING IN WORSE SHAPE.....THE PRESCRIPTION DRUG EPIDEMIC IS OVER THESE NEW RULES ARE ONLY HURTING THE REAL PEOPLE IN PAIN.|I brought my aunt for her appointment with Dr Sullivan. 8-30-22

column3:
Carolina Spine and Pain Centers serves Spartanburg, South Carolina with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our experienced team of specialists combines chiropractic expertise with cutting-edge medical treatments to address a wide spectrum of pain conditions. Whether you're suffering from injuries sustained in car accidents, sports activities, or workplace incidents, or dealing with chronic pain and degenerative conditions, our patient-centered approach ensures personalized care tailored to your specific needs.

At Carolina Spine & Pain, we understand that pain affects everyone differently. Our specialists bring decades of combined experience to every case, utilizing a holistic approach that considers your unique circumstances. The Spartanburg center offers advanced diagnostic capabilities alongside innovative treatment options designed to provide effective, lasting relief.

24/7 Accessibility

Pain doesn't follow a schedule, and neither do we. Our team is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week to address your needs. We recognize that accidents and injuries can occur at any time, which is why we've made ourselves accessible around the clock. Don't hesitate to reach out whenever you need assistance with pain management.

Our Approach

What sets Carolina Spine and Pain Centers apart is our commitment to world-class care delivered with compassion. We don't just treat symptoms—we work to identify and address the underlying causes of your pain. By combining traditional chiropractic techniques with the latest medical innovations, we create treatment plans that promote both immediate relief and long-term wellness.

Location: 1923 E Main St, Duncan, SC 29334, United States

Phone: +1 864-651-9446

Website: https://www.carolinaspineandpaincenters.com/spartanburg/
column11:
Carolina Spine & Pain has an experienced team of pain management specialists that provide world-class pain care at their Spartanburg comprehensive pain management center. Our practice treats everything from car accident, sport, and workplace injuries to chronic pain and degenerative conditions. We provide patients with effective relief using a combination of chiropractic care and cutting-edge medical treatments. Our specialists have decades of combined experience.

We understand that everyone experiences pain differently, so we take a personalized, patient-centered approach to treatment. Do not hesitate to call us, no matter when your injuries occur. We know that accidents can occur at any time. You can contact us anytime 24/7!

column38: Sharon Farmer|Starr Foster|Cail Ballenger|Kim Gordon|Skwirl|Ray Simmons|Ronda Shelton|Sara Hood
column40:
I have been visiting the Duncan office for months now with what started as numbness in my legs that was causing me some mobility issues. I have degenerative scoliosis and sciatica. My condition has worsened to the point that many days I am in so much pain I can't even walk.  My husband bought me a power wheelchair so I can at least get around in the house. I called the office in desperation begging to come in and get some help. I explained to the receptionist my situation and was told they  could see me in a month.  She never bothered to check with anyone else.  Totally unconcerned and without any empathy.  It doesn't matter how good the doctors may or may not be if you have to wait a month or more to see someone when you're already dealing with debilitating pain.

UPDATE:  The office scheduled me for an appointment on Jan. 20.  I have called to cancel as I am seeking a second opinion .  I've left a voicemail and a message on your portal.  Does a live person ever answer the phone or even respond to a message?|I was seen in office July 3rd and was supposed to be referred for an MRI. My MRI referral was never put in, so I've called for 2 weeks straight with no call back.. Finally the order was sent but faxed to the wrong place, so now back to calling with no call back. I would love to know who office manager because I would love to speak to them. MRI finally got scheduled for August 26th and this office never sent the pre authorization from my insurance company so the appointment had to be rescheduled, so now I have to wait another month.|I've been a patient since March 2021 with no prior infractions & in one day I was discharged from the program, without any warning, without a re-test of any kind. I was given my regular drug test in January 2024, I went to the doctor a month later on February 27th, 24 and was told by PA- Turner that I failed my drug test in January. That my test showed I had no medication in my system. I tried to explain to him, that there was no way possible because I had just had a knee replacement surgery on January 8th, 24 & that my pre-op medication was Percocet 5mg I was taking along with my normal 10 mg Lortab.  Then he told me that my pill count was short in September 2023, I told him that's when I was in the hospital for 4 days, my medication was at home and I had no supervision over it. PA-Turner told me that there was nothing else he could do and that he would not write my prescription for my pain medication anymore. I feel this was so unfair because he could have re-tested me, gave me a verbal warning. But no he choose to kick me out of the program. I know of previous patients of Carolina Spine & Pain who have failed drug test with street drugs in their system whose been retested, medication lowered, given warnings before being kicked outta the program. Then on Wednesday, I called and left a message for the office manager or Dr. O'Quinn to call me back so I could discuss this with them and to this day, Saturday, February 2nd, 24 neither of them has even returned my call. So unprofessional. I was prescribed narcotics by this facility and have been on them well.over 2years and I was kicked outta the program without the opportunity to find a new doctor, without a refill of my medication to carry me for the next month while I search for another doctor. All PA- Turner gave me was a 14 day supply that I can't pick up because the drug store is out of the medication. All the money this office has made from me being a patient, to just be thrown away like I'm nothing, is so unprofessional. I don't advise anyone to see PA-Turner and if you are his patient switch to someone else. He's rude and has no bedside manner. I should have stopped seeing him in September 2023 when he said my medication count was short. His actions have even left me without a doctor to treat my back issues. Living with daily chronic pain is hell and has diminished my quality of life, my daily medication helped me get outta bed every day to try to go on. Now I left without medication, without a pain doctor or a doctor for my back pain.|I never had a problem until they started making me see this one PA and I complained on two different occasions and they're still making me see him and will not allow me to see any other one that I have seen when I first started coming there, my husband doesn't want me going because they want let me see any other PA and it's not far or right. Then the lady at the front desk that checks you in never told me I had a copay for the whole four months 5 months I was coming so now I have an outstanding bill I explain this to the billing department and nothing was done. I don't understand never been treated like this before from any practice I've ever been|Dr Leche is the best.  Mom loves him.  He's always so kind, patient and empathetic of her pain. His assistant is awesome as well.  Equally as kind, patient and emphatic.  We would follow them anywhere.  Very nice clean facility conveniently located on 290 in Duncan just a few minutes off of I-85.|Just pill pushers who don't answer the phone or return calls.
They also will wait for a year to tell you that you owe money on a bill, that you can't prove that you owe it. It's just a scam that a regular doctor should be prescribing pain medication!
All they do is prescribe medication And they don't know you or your medical history!
But they charge as though they were a real specialist!
Their specialty nothing more than a scam.
Going to talk to senators and congressmen about getting pain medication put back in the hands of the family physicians. Not an extra clinic and expense!
Especially unprofessional people like these who don't bother with the phone!|The dr was very nice but way to many people were scheduled for the same time. Not enough parking at all & so many people that some people signed in & had to go back outside to wait because there was nowhere to sit. They have got so much better about scheduling & I couldn't be happier about that. The people have been very nice & professional & I appreciate that so much. The lady that I see is so sweet & really cares about my health & if I need anything I can call her, I really appreciate that they stay on top of my health needs, everybody that I have dealt with is so nice & that means alot to me. I go to their office in Duncan, I know they have a couple of more locations. They are taking New patients so if you need good dr's I highly recommend them. When I went for my visit today I found out that Loren is no longer working there. She went to work somewhere else, as much as she will be missed I wish her the very best at her new job. At my appointment today I got to meet the Nurse Practitioner her name is Joy & she is very nice. She also works at the office in Anderson & Easley. I have been seeing Mr. Brant since Loren left & he is very nice too, everybody that I have delt with there has been very nice & understanding & I really appreciate that.|My boyfriend has had constant headaches for years and he has tried everything from therapy to medicines and shots. No one wanted to put in the work to have this procedure done that will help give his life back to have the insurance cover except here. Wonderful people and wonderful experience. Callie, thank you again!!
