column3:
Spine & Pain Specialists of the Carolinas in Charlotte, North Carolina is a distinguished pain management practice dedicated to providing comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Founded and led by Dr. Aashish Jay Kumar, MD, D.ABA, this premier facility combines advanced interventional techniques with compassionate patient care to deliver effective pain relief solutions. The practice has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider in the Charlotte metropolitan area, where patients receive personalized treatment plans designed to address their specific pain management needs.

As a board-certified interventional pain medicine specialist, Dr. Kumar brings extensive training and expertise to each patient consultation. His approach focuses on identifying the root causes of pain rather than simply treating symptoms. The practice welcomes adults of all ages in a comfortable, patient-centered environment where comprehensive evaluations lead to targeted treatment strategies. Dr. Kumar's commitment to evidence-based medicine ensures that patients receive the most current and effective pain management options available.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

The practice specializes in treating a wide spectrum of pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, sciatica, complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS), fibromyalgia, and various forms of joint pain. Additionally, they offer innovative treatments such as Stellate Ganglion Blocks for PTSD and anxiety. Using state-of-the-art diagnostic tools, Dr. Kumar and his team develop customized treatment plans that may incorporate peripheral nerve stimulation, DRG stimulation, spinal cord stimulation, and other advanced interventional procedures to provide lasting relief.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Spine & Pain Specialists of the Carolinas is their unwavering commitment to patient comfort and education. The team takes time to explain conditions and treatment options, ensuring patients are informed partners in their care journey. Located at 12610 N Community House Rd STE 100, Charlotte, NC 28277, the practice offers a welcoming environment where patients feel valued and understood. For consultations or more information, patients can call +1 704-817-0147 or visit their website at www.spinepaincarolinas.com.
column11:
Spine & Pain Specialists of the Carolinas is a premier pain management practice in Charlotte, North Carolina, owned and operated by interventional pain medicine specialist Aashish Jay Kumar, MD, D.ABA. The practice serves adults of all ages in a comfortable and welcoming environment.
Dr. Kumar and his staff find the root cause of severe or ongoing pain. They treat back pain, neck pain, sciatica, complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS), fibromyalgia, joint pain, Stellate Ganglion Blocks for PTSD and anxiety and other pain-causing conditions.
Spine & Pain Specialists of the Carolinas specializes in peripheral nerve stimulation, DRG stimulation, spinal cord stimulation, and many other modern day, evidenced based treatments to relieve discomfort.

Dr. Kunar is very knowledgeable and takes time to explain the process. Was supposed to do this procedure with a different doctor and declined because he didn't give the confidence.  Dr. Kumar made me 100% comfortable with the procedure..I

He comes up with the best plan to alleviate your pain. He explains the process fully in detail. He answers my questions I may have.

I'm Soo glad to have Dr. Kumar as one my doctor's on my care team.

It was very refreshing to have a doctor actually listen! I cannot be happier with him and our long term plan!|Dr Kumar is Extremely thorough..sympathic to my needs and understands. Going to have a procedure done and explained in full detail what would be happening. Definitely eased my mind. Great bed side manner!!|I have gone to Dr. Kumar for pain management but yet he keeps sending me back to the emergency room if I'm in excruciating pain and he refuses to give me medication. I need just to get by to get out of bed. Please don't go to him if you were in chronic pain, he will not help you, unless you schedule a procedure with him, this is not the way medicine is supposed to be handled. I feel like I am in "Quota land". He has seen me in very excruciating pain as well as my primary care Doctor Who referred me to him and Dr A  had said I feel your pain. I can see it in you, but nobody will take care of this. there needs to be a resolution and I think the AMA will find an answer. His response to any messages or from his staff go to the emergency room. If you're in that much pain that is unacceptable when I'm going to a pain management doctor, he does not return calls or messages. My daughter has gotten involved and tried to reach out to him and he doesn't get back to her either this is horrible and absurd medicine at its worst|Finally, a solution for a long standing pain. So far, no other Dr. had anything to offer. I liked the office, and staff. Dr Kumar is very easy to talk to and listens very well.|Great doctor. Great physician

column2: Southern Coast Pain Specialists Dr. Schuyler
column3:
Southern Coast Pain Specialists serves Bluffton, SC and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Schuyler, our practice combines advanced interventional techniques with personalized care plans to address chronic pain conditions. We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why our approach focuses on both immediate relief and long-term management strategies tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At Southern Coast Pain Specialists, we offer a wide range of evidence-based treatments for various pain conditions. Our interventional procedures include epidural steroid injections, joint injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. Dr. Schuyler's extensive training and experience ensure that patients receive the most effective and appropriate treatments for their specific conditions, whether related to spinal issues, arthritis, neuropathy, or post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our team takes the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop a comprehensive treatment plan that addresses your pain while improving your overall quality of life. We coordinate with your primary care physician and other specialists to ensure continuity of care and optimal outcomes.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 16 Okatie Center Blvd S, Bluffton, SC 29909, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. The comfortable, welcoming environment reflects our commitment to providing a positive experience for every patient who walks through our doors.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Schuyler, please call +1 843-476-4702. For more information about our practice, our team, and our approach to pain management, visit our website at https://socopain.com/who-we-are/. We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to making quality pain care accessible to all who need it.

Southern Grace Precision & Aesthetics in Mt Pleasant, SC serves as the region's premier destination for comprehensive wellness and aesthetic services. Founded by Dr. Richardson, a double board-certified physician in Anesthesiology and Pain Management with over 17 years of experience, this innovative practice offers a unique blend of medical expertise and cutting-edge treatments. Their holistic approach focuses on helping patients live pain-free without surgical intervention, while simultaneously addressing aesthetic concerns with the latest technology and techniques.

At Southern Grace, patients benefit from advanced regenerative treatments including Stem Cell therapy, which harnesses the body's natural healing abilities to address chronic pain and inflammation. Their Hormone Optimization programs are individually tailored to restore balance and vitality, while their integrated approach to pain management incorporates Chiropractic Care to ensure proper alignment and function. For those seeking weight management solutions, their medically supervised Weight Loss Management programs deliver sustainable results through personalized nutrition and lifestyle guidance.

Advanced Aesthetic Treatments

The aesthetic division offers a full spectrum of services designed to enhance natural beauty and boost confidence. Their popular monthly facial memberships provide ongoing skin maintenance, while advanced Body Sculpting treatments target stubborn fat deposits with precision. The practice specializes in expert administration of Fillers and Tox Injectables to restore youthful contours and minimize fine lines. Additional services include professional Brows/Lash enhancements and comprehensive Laser Hair Removal treatments.

Cutting-Edge Technology

Southern Grace utilizes state-of-the-art laser technology to address various skin concerns with remarkable precision. Their IV Therapy options deliver essential nutrients directly to the bloodstream for optimal absorption and effectiveness, supporting everything from immune function to recovery and overall wellness.

Visit Southern Grace Today

Whether you're seeking relief from chronic pain or a refreshed appearance, Southern Grace Precision & Aesthetics offers complimentary consultations to develop personalized treatment plans. Experience the future of wellness at their convenient Mt Pleasant location: 3520 Park Ave Blvd #105, Mt Pleasant, SC 29466. Contact them today at (843) 783-6088 or visit https://southerngracepa.com to schedule your free consultation and begin your transformation journey.

column2: Southeast Pain & Spine Care - Russell E. Davenport III, MD
column3:
Southeast Pain & Spine Care serves Belmont, NC and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Russell E. Davenport III, MD. Our practice combines advanced interventional techniques with personalized care plans to address chronic pain conditions affecting the spine and musculoskeletal system. Patients throughout the Charlotte metropolitan area trust our evidence-based approach that focuses on improving functionality and quality of life while minimizing reliance on medication.

Dr. Russell E. Davenport III brings exceptional credentials to his role as a pain management specialist. A graduate of St. George's University School of Medicine, Dr. Davenport completed his Anesthesiology residency at the University of Virginia Medical Center, followed by specialized fellowship training in Pain Management at the same institution. This comprehensive training enables him to offer the latest advancements in pain intervention techniques.

Professional Affiliations

Dr. Davenport maintains active membership in several prestigious medical organizations, including:

  • North American Neuromodulation Society (2018-present)

  • American Society of Regional Anesthesia and Pain Medicine (2018-present)

  • North American Spine Society (2018-present)

  • Virginia Society of Anesthesiologists (2014-present)

  • American Society of Anesthesiologists (2012-present)

Research Background

Before his clinical practice, Dr. Davenport served as Research Coordinator for Karen Grewen, Ph.D. at the Social Neuroscience and Psychophysiology Laboratory in the Department of Psychiatry. This research experience informs his evidence-based approach to pain management.

Our Approach to Pain Management

At Southeast Pain & Spine Care, we specialize in treating various pain conditions through minimally invasive procedures, targeted injections, neuromodulation therapies, and comprehensive rehabilitation programs. Our multidisciplinary approach addresses both the symptoms and underlying causes of pain.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us:

Phone: +1 704-931-5580

Address: 275 Beatty Dr, Belmont, NC 28012, United States

Website: www.sepainandspinecare.com

column40:
The staff was very kind & courteous. Dr Davenport was so kind, he took time & explained to me & my husband exactly what he felt after reviewing my MRI & X-rays what he thought I needed for my severe back pain. He performed nerve ablation on my back & explained thoroughly what will take place & the recovery time. My back is no longer in the pain I was in everyday & I would definitely recommend Dr Davenport for anyone suffering with everyday pain in their lower back.|He did an awesome job with my stimulator. He is the 1st doctor that didn't try to put me on prescription drugs, thank God. He doesn't do that. He wants to fix the problem not mask the problem, along with creating another one. I am happy with my stimulator. It has changed my life. I used to not be able to walk my dog for except to take him to the bathroom. But, now, I can take him for walks without any pain. I know that I have to take it slow, but you have to understand my excitement of enjoying the little things in life that I'm able to do now that I couldn't do for over 30 years.
Thank you Dr. Davenport and your staff for the incredible work that you have done for me.|My wife came here for severe lower back pain. Dr. Davenport was very professional and put forth a plan to help her recover quickly. A special shout out to Beverly who really helped and took interest in her plan for Care. Beverly went above and beyond to help my wife Get scheduled for the procedures that she needed.|I'm always treated as if I matter to everyone there, from the front desk on. This was my second procedure with Dr Davenport and he has a very reassuring bedside manner and tells me everything that he is doing. This procedure has been a success. Thank you all very much.|It has been wonderful.   Dr Davenport is an excellent physician who deserves all the accolades given to him.  He  is so kind and patient and his nursing staff as well as the office personnel are amazing.  I am so thankful I am seeing  Davenport.  Best doctor I've ever seen bar none !!!!.|Dr Davenport, Beverly RN, nurse assistant Tyla are always so kind, compassionate.  The front staff are also nice.  I like the care I receive when I go there.  And I like that Dr Davenport takes time to review my options and explain both pharmacologic and non pharmacological treatments.  Thank you for taking good care of me.|Dr. Davenport is awesome! The staff is friendly. I highly recommend going here. You won't be sorry you did.|The nurse practitioner and Dr. Davenport were quite rude. I have nerve pain in my neck and back. He told me that he only does injections which I am not doing as I have had reactions to several medications and am nervous how I would react to something injected into my spine. I hate medication but am willing to take on an as needed basis. He told me that he only does injections and if I change my mind to call him and walked out. Very rude.

column3:
Midlands Neurology & Pain Associates PA in Columbia, SC offers comprehensive neurological and pain management services to patients throughout the Midlands region. Established with a commitment to improving quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain and neurological disorders, our practice combines advanced diagnostic techniques with personalized treatment plans. Our board-certified specialists utilize evidence-based approaches to address conditions ranging from migraines and neuropathy to complex spinal disorders and movement disorders.

At Midlands Neurology & Pain Associates, we understand that neurological conditions can significantly impact daily functioning. Our team provides thorough evaluations and treatment for a wide spectrum of neurological disorders including epilepsy, multiple sclerosis, Parkinson's disease, and stroke recovery. Using state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment, we work diligently to identify the root causes of symptoms and develop effective management strategies.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

Our pain management specialists employ a multidisciplinary approach to chronic pain, offering interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitation therapies. We specialize in treating back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our goal is to reduce reliance on medication when possible while maximizing function and comfort.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets us apart is our dedication to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. We take time to explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. Our compassionate staff ensures that each visit is conducted with respect for patients' time, concerns, and individual needs.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our specialists, please contact us at +1 803-788-0038. Our office is conveniently located at 2601 Millwood Ave #1218, Columbia, SC 29205. For more information about our services or to request an appointment online, visit our website at http://www.midlandsneurologyandpain.com/.

Absolutely disgraceful wait times for the patient without updates or information as to why you haven't been called back after waiting 1 to sometimes even 3 or 4 hours. HOURS. But, don't even think about being a few min late. You can call and they'll tell you not to worry, to still come only to be turned away when you check in. No one knows what the other employee is doing; there is no communication w patients and it is evident the staff hate their jobs. Huge turnover w a clear disdain for Americans. I could overlook some of the extreme wait times, but the lack of respect for their patients and their time/money and forced wait time for prescriptions is unacceptable. Dr. O is a good doctor, but he spends maybe 5 min w you and rushes to the next patient bc he's always behind.
It's very upsetting to drive one hour to his office only to be turned away bc you were 3 min later (after being told no worries!) than "policy", but YOU can sit there and wait on him for hours and it's OK because your time means nothing.
It's very sad because people who legitimately need pain management are there because they truly need help. Doesn't matter though, you are just a nuisance his staff has to endure during their day. The days of trusting in your physician and feeling appreciated are over. Now, it's all about the copay and how many different ones they can get away with charging.|Dr.O is very good about details on what's the next step on your pain management. BUT the person that handle the insurance for pre authorization form is very lack. It's been 9 days and my insurance haven't received the form yet .I've been extremely patiently with midlands neurology pain management and associates. I've call them several times 2/13/25, 2/17/25, 2/18/25 and twice on 2/18/25 . Call my insurance company on the 17th and 19th  2025. My insurance sent midlands neurology pain associates a PA form and so did my pharmacy..so can someone tell me what's the hold up?|If I could give then negative stars I would. I don't think they even deserve 1 star. Everyone is rude and the place is like a crack house. Do yourself a favor and star away. I sat for 4 hours for him to tell me me his management plan and it was what I did 9 years ago before I had back surgery. He basically  in so many words that I'm faking until he seen my scar from the surgery. The surgeon from LMC said my back it to severe to operate  on because it could harm me more. I brought my MRI and first he said it was before my surgery when it was done a week ago. STAY AS FAR AWAY AS POSSIBLE!! Oh I forgot to mention he wanted to do steroid injections when I just finish cancer treatments and my immune system is extremely low. Very very unprofessional office.|The waiting times are ridiculous.  My mother schedules appointments in the mornings usually 10:30/10:45am and she sits in the lobby for about an hour before she gets to the back and then she waits back there for an hour sometimes more. I informed them she had another appointment at 1pm and she missed that appointment waiting on here. Then after 3 hours the Dr comes in and says they don't have the medication for her refill. I drove over and hour to be here and they never called to tell us this. I am so disappointed and angry.i only gave 1 star but they don't deserve that. The review makes u put at least one star to post|I have never had a bad experience with Midlands neurology & pain associates i was with 1 other neurologist for over 15 yrs and they haven't came close to finding out what's wrong with me but Dr O is coming very. Close to finding out why i have this condition i have been admitted in the hospital for 10 consecutive yrs once or twice a month but ever since Dr O has been treating me i have only been admitted in the hospital for my condition once in June of 2023 & once in October of 2023 the whole staff is wonderful my name is Jackie Darry is just my email name i call him Dr.O because i cannot pronounce his name basically everyone calls him Dr.O i guess im not the only one that can't pronounce his name as a matter of a fact all the Drs there do a good job with their  patients as far as i have seen i highly recommend Midlands Neurology and pain clinic to anyone who needs a good Neurologist too all that reads this have blessed day or night|I have been a patient of Dr. O for several years and I am very pleased with my care. The wait times are atrocious but my medication is always called in on time.|Midlands Neurology and Pain Assoc. are not the same as they were 20 yrs ago. They all talk broken English and its hard to converse with them. Evidently the government has them scared to death over issuing pain meds cause they don T want to listen to their patience and help them theirore worried about their license than the patience well-being. I saw him2 weeks ago and still can't get my meds cause theywontsrnd them to my regular pharmacy. OUTRAGIOUS!! Going thru withdrawals and they Ont care!! Pitiful!!!|I was dr.oburu patient  for 4 yrs .l don't know why l stayed  so long. But lately everytime l went to the appt  after l call my pharmacy  to see if my med,is ready the pharmacy, said no.l call the office asking  for my med.the phone took me straight to voicemail.which was always full.there were many times were l wanted to live.the supervisor  were there to take note they didn't care for you.unfortunaly l trust the new one.only to know she told everyone.only because  the other counselor  told me to be admitted to a mental hospital."some help" l waited 2 hours the doctor walk him 2 mins.also in the office they talk. do what they want nothing  serious.horrible experience

column3:
Michael Todd Warrick, MD serves Sumter, South Carolina and surrounding areas throughout the Midlands and Pee-Dee regions with specialized interventional pain management services. Dr. Warrick has established himself as a leading provider of minimally invasive spine procedures, offering innovative solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. His practice combines cutting-edge technology with compassionate care, focusing on treatments that minimize recovery time while maximizing pain relief. Patients throughout central and eastern South Carolina seek out Dr. Warrick's expertise for his comprehensive approach to spine-related pain management.

Dr. Warrick offers several advanced procedures not available elsewhere in the Midlands and Pee-Dee regions:

  • Kyphoplasty for vertebral compression fractures

  • Spinal cord stimulation trials and implant surgery

  • Intracept procedure for chronic vertebrogenic low back pain

  • Conventional and water-cooled radiofrequency ablation (RFA) for joint pain

  • Vertiflex procedure for lumbar spinal stenosis

Coming Soon

Dr. Warrick continues to expand his practice with upcoming services including:

  • Spinal Simplicity outpatient lumbar fusion

  • Regenerative sports medicine treatments

Practice Information

Address: 100 N Sumter St #320, Sumter, SC 29150

Phone: (803) 774-6824

Provider Profile: Prisma Health Physicians

Established in 2018, Dr. Warrick's practice has been delivering exceptional care to patients throughout South Carolina for over 6 years. His affiliation with Prisma Health ensures patients receive coordinated care within one of the state's largest healthcare systems.
column11: Providing minimally invasive options for spine-related pain not available anywhere else in the Midlands and Pee-Dee including kyphoplasty for vertebral fractures, spinal cord stimulation trials and implant surgery, Intracept for bone pain from disc degeneration, conventional and water cooled RFA for joint pain. Vertiflex for lumbar stenosis. Spinal Simplicity outpatient lumbar fusion and regenerative sports medicine coming soon.

column40:
I have went to Dr.Warrick for 4 yrs. He was great in the beginning but I started noticing uneasy things. For one I always seen men coming in and going up to the desk for prescriptions. Not once did I see a woman. Second he started to rush through the procedure and I was not getting any relief. The last visit was the final as I received a cervical injection and I almost didn't make it to my vehicle. I could not move my neck and by the time I got home I had a full blown migraine. All he said was wait it out or come back to the office for oxygen.There must have been an air bubble somewhere. You don't check this before injecting!! Really? I couldn't see to drive or move my head. I contacted my family physician and she prescribed me the migraine medication. I gave 1 star because other than him the other staff are great. The front desk are awesome and Ryan the radiologist and Jane that deals with insurance are spot on!! Would not recommend Warrick to no one|I am heard here.  My pain is taken seriously. We've tried some of everything and they didn't work (well the injections worked for 3 days). Unfortunately I'm not a candidate for surgery and I can't take most pain meds for my back pain because it'll interfere with medication I'm on.  But they found something.  And it's working|I've been with Dr Warrick and his staff for years, which is always a sign of a great physician & staff. I've found him to be helpful & knowledgeable. He & his staff stay extremely busy & it can interfere some in the personality department. I've never felt rushed or pressured. The call backs are wonderful, fast, & usually the same day. Even with all the State & Federal Regulations I've never had a problem with changing or getting my much needed medications. Dr Warrick has always shown
"There may not be a cure but there still can be  Sunshine and Relief."!|It is with great pleasure that I write this review for Dr. Michael Todd Warrick, MD and his dependable RN; Laurie, as well as his medical assistants and all of his wonderful staff. Dr. Warrick's office personnel always greet you with a smile, which makes knowing them such a delightful experience!  I had major low back (L-5 Lumbar surgery) with Dr. DeHoll, MD two years ago and I was thoroughly impressed by how well Dr. Warrick interacted with my surgeon, Dr. DeHoll in Columbia.  Furthermore, my husband and I cannot compliment Dr. Warrick and his staff enough because he does not overprescribe any pain medication whatsoever.  Senator and Mrs. John Edward Courson and I recommend Dr. Warrick and his caring staff highly and without any reservations.|After being with this self important narcissist for years we have finally made the breakaway from this rote individual that will tell you point blank to your face that he doesn't care about you or your pain beyond an aspirin a day and that he is the doctor, not you. He is more interested in his theater and new girlfriend, apparently. The only compassionate person that can speak with kindness in that office is Whitney. Well, contrary to Warrick's belief, there ARE other physicians out there with compassion for those that are unfortunate to have chronic pain. Both my wife and I urge you to find that one and leave this one to play with his numbers on the computer.

Run!|My mom was sent to Dr. Warrick after her regular pain management doctor relocated.  She never complained about the pain of an injection until her first visit with him when she said it hurt very bad.  The injection was not effective and she waited 3 months, in pain from 4 lumbar disc issues, to go back again.  On the second visit, Dr. Warrick apparently missed the spot and she lost feeling in her legs for 3 days and was unable to walk.  That's on top of the much more severe pain she had after that injection.  Dr. Warrick basically dismissed her at the visit when she informed him she couldn't feel her legs.  His response was that "it wasn't unusual and that everything would be fine in a couple hours."  That was the only time I had to bring her out of an appointment for an injection in a wheelchair.  Needless to say he was completely wrong and after 3 days she was able to walk again but still in severe pain.  She called her Primary Doctor who arranged for her to go to see Dr. Van Damm in Chapin after that and for over a year, she had no issues and never felt pain during or after an injection.  She finally after nearly 40 years of dealing with the pain, got a referral to Dr DeHol who performed a successful surgery to repair her back and now she is pain free and active again after all those years because she was scared to have surgery.  I now have a major back issue and I received a referral to see the doctor who hurt my mother so bad and probably got lucky he didn't do even more damage than he did.  I have not even heard back from my referral which was over a month ago which doesn't matter because I wouldn't let him take my temperature.  Too put people in pain and then show no regard or explanation as to why is the reason this butcher will never see me.  Dr. DeHol and Dr. Van Damm both couldn't even say one good word about Dr. Warrick.  I have made my own appointment with Dr. Lamotta in Irmo.  He has taken incredible care of my aunt who has has already had two back surgeries and both knees replaced.  She is pain free now as well.  He actually has a 5 star rating and I can't find one negative comment about the level of care he delivers and is not about putting people on pain medication or injections if at all possible.  I wish I could see DeeHol but he doesn't accept my insurance so I've now made an NHC on my own with Dr. Lamata. It's been a long journey up to today when I scheduled my own appointment with someone other than Dr.Warrick and although it's a much longer distance, it was the only clear choice to make.  I take no pain medication and don't want any.  I just want the root problem resolved so hopefully I can get my life back after 7 months of pain.  Don't let anyone you care at all about be treated by this doctor.  Seems like all the positive reviews are coming from women much younger than my mother.  Pattern?  .  I'm relieved in knowing I'm going to finally see someone who can help me and cares.|Awesome bedside manner, very caring and gets the job done. My other doctor left and left alot of patients high and dry.He took the chance and took a stand. Very impressed with entire staff.
I think all the ones who gave bad reviews had either not seen him yet or just want something to complain about. These doctors who deal with all the pain meds and stuff are under such restrict rules bc of those who abuse and sell the medicine. Honestly the doctors i have or have had dont compare to the compassionate the care he gives. Yes took a few weeks to get an appointment but he also had to review my records. Im sorry people it would be a waist of your time if he cant help your situation. What ive learned over the past year is you have to be your own advocate for your healthcare. These family doctors see so many patients they dont have the time to deal with pity party people. I have a pain pump and was dropped by a pain management practice bc they let the doctor and team go and Dr Warrick made some phone calls. I dont care what bad reviews people on here want to give
But you wont be sorry when he becomes your doctor. Call everyday till appointment. Its up to you to be your own advocate.|I've seen Dr Warrick for many years now. I moved from Sumter to the Charleston area and love Dr Warrick AND STAFF sooo much that i make the 2 hour drive monthly. He's cool, calm and collected at ALL times. He's honest about all treatment options and ALWAYS has time to perform injections to anyone with an appointment. I will continue to make this drive to his office as long as he's here! THANK YOU, DR WARRICK AND STAFF!

column2: Medical Group of the Carolinas - Spine and Pain Management - Pelham
column3:
Medical Group of the Carolinas - Spine and Pain Management - Pelham serves patients throughout Greer, SC and the surrounding Upstate South Carolina region with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized team focuses on treating patients suffering from illnesses or injuries that cause pain and limit functionality in daily activities. Rather than simply addressing symptoms, we take a holistic approach to pain management, considering the whole person in our treatment plans. As an integral part of the Medical Group of the Carolinas (MGC), our practice leverages the resources of a large multi-specialty physician network that extends throughout Upstate South Carolina and into parts of North Carolina.

Our pain management specialists are dedicated to helping patients regain their quality of life through personalized treatment plans. We understand that chronic pain affects not just physical health but also emotional wellbeing and daily functioning. Our team employs advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment options to address various pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, and neuropathic pain.

Part of a Trusted Healthcare Network

As members of the Medical Group of the Carolinas, our physicians collaborate with specialists across multiple disciplines to ensure coordinated care. MGC doctors are committed to providing exceptional healthcare services, from preventive care and wellness programs to specialized treatment for complex conditions. This integrated approach allows us to offer our patients comprehensive care that addresses all aspects of their health.

Visit Our Greer Location

Located at 150 D Street in Greer, SC 29651, our facility is equipped with modern technology and staffed by compassionate healthcare professionals. To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please call us at (864) 560-9646. Additional information about our practice and the Medical Group of the Carolinas can be found at spartanburgregional.com.
column11:

At Bon Secours Pain Management, patients have access to a diverse range of therapeutic interventions including medication management, minimally invasive procedures, nerve blocks, spinal cord stimulation, physical therapy, and integrative approaches to pain relief. The practice specializes in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, and cancer-related pain. CSRA Pain Management serves North Augusta, SC and the surrounding CSRA (Central Savannah River Area) with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified specialists has been helping patients regain control of their lives through personalized treatment plans since our founding. Located conveniently at 1168 W Martintown Rd, we combine advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address chronic pain conditions ranging from back and neck pain to complex regional pain syndrome.

At CSRA Pain Management, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our multidisciplinary approach includes interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and innovative treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs. We specialize in treating conditions such as:

  • Spinal pain and disc disorders

  • Arthritis and joint pain

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Work and sports-related injuries

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets us apart is our commitment to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our physicians take the time to listen, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop comprehensive treatment strategies focused on improving function and quality of life. We work closely with referring physicians to ensure coordinated care throughout your pain management journey.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, contact us at (803) 202-0053. Our office is located at 1168 W Martintown Rd, North Augusta, SC 29841. We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to making quality pain management accessible to all residents of the CSRA region.

Dr Sloan is a poor excuse for a doctor he talks down to you and tries to make you feel like you're less than a human. Please don't go to this place you will be sorry I promise you.|Love the nurses was a long time patient for almost 20 years Dr Sloan let me go.terminated me because I was having a bad day .didn't care what drugs he had me on cold turkey didn't care if I died ..cold hearted doctor treible bed side manner|I've been a patient of CSRA pain management, since 2017. I have degenerative disc disease of the entire spine, with resultant severe stenosis in several locales. Also scoliosis with a 13 degree Cobb angle. I get the injections every 3 months. They work very good for me. I have had, only  good experiences at Dr. Sloan's office. Thank you, Dr. Sloan and staff!! Every time I walk out of there, I feel much better! amen! Oh yeah, he's in a very good band!  Dixie Dregs .|I am writing this with a heavy heart to share our deeply traumatic experience with CSRA Pain Management. My mother, Susie English, was under Dr. Sloan's care for pain management. Tragically, she passed away a year ago today (at the young age of 52 years old) from sepsis secondary to epidural abscess.

Following her spinal injection treatment on Thursday, May 18, 2023, my mother's health deteriorated rapidly following her last treatment, culminating in her untimely and unexpected death on May 24, 2023.

Our family is devastated by this loss and we hope that sharing our story will help prevent similar tragedies from happening to others; ultimately, we urge anyone seeking pain management to consider this experience before entrusting your care to this establishment.|When I came to this practice I thought I was going to have to have surgery as the next step. That was several years ago. Dr. Sloan uses a fluoroscope to position the injections exactly where they will do the most good. I currently receive neck and lower back injections which allow me to have a quality of life I cannot have without them. He monitors my pain meds to keep them at just the right level so that I am not feeling drugged all the time but have the pain relief I need between injection visits.
He also puts me under light sedation for the procedure. That is very important to me.
The most important thing about going to this clinic is the people who support Dr. Sloan. I have found some very good friends who care about me and not just as a medical number. I highly recommend this practice.|Dr Allan Sloan and CSTA Pain Management are incredible. This office has allowed me to work comfortably again. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

I Highly recommend CSRA Pain Management for anyone needing a caring Doctor and staff.|Dr. Sloan has no patience with people who have panic attacks and ADHD. Husband just needed his regular pain meds to function. He was told he was not going to get his regular dose and if he didn't take the shots he would get nothing. He tried the shots again, they still don't work. Now he has no medication because the good Dr. Sloan isn't interested in helping just taking your money.|Been going to CSRA for many years. I have always gotten great service. If you need help he will give it to you. His staff is great. Always treats me nice. I drive 1.5 hours to CSRA and could switch to another practice but keep going back because of the people there. Be warned if you are just looking for a script that you really dont need. Go somewhere else. He is not one to give out meds without you needing them!

Carolina Spine and Sport Rehabilitation Specialists, PA serves Summerville, SC and surrounding communities with comprehensive physical medicine and rehabilitation services. column3:
Erin E. Watson, M.D. serves Conway, South Carolina, as a distinguished physical medicine and rehabilitation and pain management specialist at OrthoSC. With extensive training and expertise, Dr. Watson provides comprehensive care for patients seeking nonsurgical solutions for back and neck pain, as well as various rehabilitation needs. Her patient-centered approach combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans designed to improve mobility, reduce pain, and enhance overall quality of life for residents throughout Conway and surrounding communities.

Dr. Watson earned her bachelor of science degree with a double major in nutritional science and zoology from the University of Florida, establishing a strong foundation in the sciences. Her medical education continued at The Brody School of Medicine at East Carolina University, where she obtained her medical degree and completed an internship. Dr. Watson further refined her expertise during her residency in physical medicine and rehabilitation at the University Health Systems of Eastern Carolina, where her leadership abilities were recognized through her appointment as chief resident.

Specialized Care at OrthoSC

At the Conway office of OrthoSC, Dr. Watson specializes in:

- Nonsurgical back and neck care

- Pain management therapies

- Physical medicine treatments

- Comprehensive rehabilitation services

- Personalized recovery programs

Her integrative approach addresses both immediate pain relief and long-term functional improvement, helping patients return to their daily activities with greater comfort and capability.

Contact Information

Location: 2376 Cypress Cir #300, Conway, SC 29526, United States

Phone: +1 843-353-3460

Website: [www.orthosc.org/doctors/erin-e-watson-md](https://www.orthosc.org/doctors/erin-e-watson-md?utmsource=google&utmmedium=organic&utm_campaign=gmbwebsite)

Patients seeking appointments with Dr. Watson can call directly or visit the OrthoSC website for more information about services and treatment options.

She received her bachelor of science degree with a double major in nutritional science and zoology from the University of Florida. She then went on to obtain her medical degree from The Brody School of Medicine at East Carolina University, where she also completed an internship. Dr. Watson completed a residency in physical medicine and rehabilitation at the University Health Systems of Eastern Carolina, where she was the chief resident.

column3:
Southeastern Pain and Spine Care serves patients throughout Huntersville, NC and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Led by Dr. Jenna W. Lambeth, M.D., our practice specializes in innovative, patient-centered approaches to chronic and acute pain conditions. With state-of-the-art facilities at our Huntersville location, we provide individualized treatment plans designed to improve quality of life and restore function for patients suffering from various pain disorders.

Dr. Lambeth grew up in Lancaster, SC and knew in high school that she wanted to be a physician. Her love for science and helping others eventually led to completing her medical degree at the Medical University of South Carolina in Charleston. She then completed her anesthesiology residency and pain management fellowship at Vanderbilt University Medical Center. Dr. Lambeth is double board certified in both anesthesiology and pain management.

Throughout her distinguished career, Dr. Lambeth has trained medical students, residents and fellows in the field of pain management and truly loves education. She has also authored numerous book chapters and research publications, contributing valuable knowledge to the pain management field. Her professional affiliations include membership in the Pain Society of the Carolinas and the Society of Women Innovators in Pain Management.

Our Approach to Pain Management

At Southeastern Pain and Spine Care, we believe in a multidisciplinary approach to pain treatment. Our team works collaboratively to develop personalized care plans that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications. We emphasize patient education and active participation in the treatment process to achieve optimal outcomes.

Contact Information

Address: 16455 Statesville Rd Ste 310, Huntersville, NC 28078, United States

Phone: +1 980-252-7631

Website: https://www.sepainandspinecare.com/continue-care/

We welcome new patients and referrals. Please contact our office to schedule a consultation with Dr. Lambeth and take the first step toward effective pain management and improved quality of life.

column2: Gisele J. Girault, MD - Pain Medicine Specialists
column3:
Gisele J. Girault, MD - Pain Medicine Specialists in Fort Mill, South Carolina offers comprehensive pain management and addiction treatment services to patients throughout York County and surrounding areas. With a focus on evidence-based approaches to pain relief and opioid dependency, Dr. Girault combines her extensive medical expertise with compassionate care to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. The practice specializes in developing personalized treatment plans that consider each patient's unique medical history, pain profile, and recovery goals.

At our Fort Mill clinic, we provide a range of interventional pain procedures, medication management, and alternative therapies designed to improve quality of life while minimizing reliance on opioid medications. Dr. Girault is board-certified in Pain Medicine with additional expertise in addiction medicine, making her uniquely qualified to help patients who struggle with both chronic pain and substance dependency issues.

Comprehensive Opioid Addiction Treatment

Our practice offers specialized programs for patients dealing with opioid addiction, including medication-assisted treatment (MAT), counseling services, and long-term recovery support. We understand the complex relationship between chronic pain and addiction, and our team works diligently to address both conditions simultaneously through our integrated treatment approach.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Gisele J. Girault, please call +1 803-802-7100 or visit our website at http://www.opioidaddictionspecialists.net/. Our office is conveniently located at 342 Patricia Ln, Suite 102, Fort Mill, SC 29708. We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to providing accessible care to those in need of pain management and addiction treatment services.

column40:
Absolutely rude, callous and dehumanizing institution I've ever gone to. I have been to several doctors, several specialists, tried several medications all to help with one specific problem that is increasingly getting worse. I am now at the point that it is pretty much debilitating due to the amount of pain I suffer from. I went to my first appointment today and the doctor sat down and looked me in my face and told me there was nothing she could do for me. Then proceeded to message my psychiatrist to inform him of how I felt so much "hopelessness", those words never came out of my mouth. She also said she was sending records to my family doctor and told me, with zero empathy, that they probably wouldn't help me either.
If I could give this business a -100, I seriously would. No wonder they're not accredited with the Better Business Bureau.|In my opinion this is not the place to go ! When I told them I wanted to come off Morphin the Dr said "You can't stop taking your Morphin" I said I understood about tapering off and that's what I wanted to do ! She said "No You can't stop taking the Morphin" I said Excuse me ! I will stop taking it and she said fine then got up and walked out and stopped my Morphin right then ! I went through Bad withdrawals which nearly killed me ! But I got off of it ! The reason I quit was because it was shutting down my gut ! I have terrible IBS now and I think years of Morphin did it at the hands of this office ! I don't recommend going here !|I would give you minus 5 review at least.
This place is the worst Dr office I have ever been to.
First:
They sent me bunch of paper to fill it before my App I did and gave it to the front desk. They let me wait in office until a lady came in and start ask me about all my info again, I told her I wrote every thing down and she said sorry I did not have time to enter it in, I said it is okay after she is done she told me the Dr will be with you shortly.
Second:
After sometime a Man come to the office start the same thing about the history, I told him I wrote everything down and the lady before you got it and entered in the system too, he said I'm PA, I start again for the third time and he said I will inform the Dr and she will be with you.
Third:
The PA came back and ask me what I want to feel better I told him I need trigger point in my lower back. He said we do not give injection in this office you need to come to Columbia office is about hour and half from here.
I told him when I made the app no one told me that, how come?? he said sorry I ask him how about some medication he refused. I asked  about the Dr he said she is going in meeting.
Really... I told him why you or the office let me come here and there is no medication, no injection no doctors you think I am coming for fun?
Really I was very upset how come a Dr office do something like that. I will inform the Insurance company and I will let my family Dr to never send any one to this office and I will not recommend it to any one.
If they know the Dr not available that time why they did not call me to cancel and reschedule me other time.
What I went through really NOT ACCEPTABLE TO ANY ONE AT ALL.|Zero due diligence on their part. I was forced to stop my low dose of Xanax 2 weeks before they would make a decision... I went through the withdrawals because I need the help so badly. I was then denied for taking Xanax even though I never got it filled. They never checked any hospital records and seem to be completely incompetent. I was told that you can't quantify kidney pain... Do not recommend.|The best Doctors and Staff anyone could ask for. Ms .Jenny is a sweet heart including dr.girault and the np Doctors. Chad also the sweetest and caring. They make sure their patients are taken care of. I wouldn't go anywhere else|All staff members along with Dr. Gisele Girault, are very nice, considerate, empathetic, concerned and determined to find what is the best course of treatment for each patient. I recommend them very highly!|Dr. G is AMAZING! So nice and easy going. She is very good at what she do. She is very patient and very understanding.|I love this Dr. and the people there.  Very caring and hardly any wait time.

column2: Medical Group of the Carolinas - Spine and Pain Management - North Grove
column3:
Medical Group of the Carolinas - Spine and Pain Management - North Grove serves patients throughout Spartanburg, SC and the surrounding Upstate South Carolina and North Carolina regions. Our specialized pain management practice is dedicated to treating patients suffering from pain-causing illnesses and injuries that limit functionality in daily activities. Rather than focusing solely on symptom management, we take a comprehensive approach to care by treating the whole person.

As a proud member of Medical Group of the Carolinas (MGC), our practice integrates with a large multi-specialty physician network that provides extensive healthcare resources to our patients. Our team of pain specialists develops personalized treatment plans designed to improve quality of life and restore function for those suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions.

Our Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that pain affects every aspect of life—from work performance to family relationships and overall wellbeing. That's why our physicians are committed to providing compassionate care that addresses both the physical and emotional components of pain. Our comprehensive services range from wellness and prevention strategies to advanced diagnostic procedures and innovative treatment options.

Visit Our Location

Our North Grove office is conveniently located at 1330 Boiling Springs Rd, Suite 1800, Spartanburg, SC 29303. To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please call us at (864) 560-9646. For more information about our services and other MGC locations, visit our website at spartanburgregional.com.
column11:
Medical Group of the Carolinas - Spine and Pain Management treats patients who have an illness or injury that causes pain and limits their ability to function at home, work or play. We treat the whole person, not just the symptoms.

Our practice is a member of Medical Group of the Carolinas (MGC), a large multi-specialty physician group serving Upstate South Carolina and parts of North Carolina. MGC doctors are dedicated to meeting your healthcare needs, from wellness and prevention to the diagnosis and treatment of illnesses.

column40:
The VA booked me an appt. It was approx 4 months out.Nothing for three months. They sent me a reminder two weeks later. She blamed me for the reminder not being usable. Obviously they dont understand how reminders work. You send them out the week of the appt.So I rescheduled. I was late because of a wreck on the road and they tell me another 4 months or more before another appt.|My mother has been taking pain meds for years to manage her pain.  Today was her prescription renewal appointment or so she thought. They sent her home with nothing. I took her back in to figure what the issue was. I talked to Sonya who had an attitude from the start. She said we have already went through this before. My mother has the beginning stages of dementia so she gets things confused sometimes. I asked for her records and we will go somewhere else. By the way my mother also had COVID and was trying handle the prescription renewal from the phone but no one returns calls with answer to her questions. So she went to her appointment hoping to get what she needed. I would leave zero stars if I could.|My 82 Year old grandmother was referred here for her severe pain in her hip, knee ath and other areas of her body. The front desk woman Porcha? Was extremely rude to my mother and grandmother, great first impressions. But not to worry the doctor is even worse he does not know anything about the conditions that she was sent there for he had no documentation that he needed and he was completely inept making me wonder if he even has a medical degree, he treated her extremely rudely was rude with her refused to give her anything for her pain and demeaned her for her dementia as she cannot remember certain aspects of her life and cannot answer questions adequately but rather than having patience and understanding he would rather just be sarcastic rude loud and ignorant please avoid at all costs this place is very very bad to take someone to especially elderly as they truly act as if they do not care about anything that's going on with you.|I can see why this place doesn't even have three stars there was only one nice nurse (floater nurse) there today when I  took my 82-year-old mother  The other  staff and doctor we're rude , misinformed and condescending to my  mother with dementia and myself .I  would never ever take her back to this place and if you have another choice to go too  I would suggest you do the same.
This doctor  (Murtado)  and  staff has some awful bedside manner and this office needs to be closed .Spartanburg regional should be ashamed.|Not good, same medication
For yrs. Refuse to change meds
SoI refused  RX not realizing my
Body was used to the medication.
Called  the dr the next day or so
To take the script anyway for
The bad detox I was feeling and
He refused to release the perscription. He didn't care,He new how I would feel not having the
Medication. Very bad experience!
Karma is a bizitch|This review tells a story that speaks for itself and does not necessarily apply to any particular Spartanburg physicians or centers-
CHRONOLOGY
Douglass Allen suffered a left leg, upper calf sports training injury on August 24. Within a week, the upper calf symptoms were almost gone, but mild  lower back pain radiating down the left thigh was occurring, especially in the morning. I took two weeks off before preparing for a sports tournament.
I visited my physicians at Family Group of the Carolinas, Landrum, September 23, before driving to the three day tournament and was prescribed pain medicine which I didn't start taking until after the tournament despite mild pain.
Following that  September 25-27 tournament,  my lower back, and especially  left thigh pain became much worse and debilitating.
I again visited my physicians at Family Group of the Carolinas, Landrum, October 2, and had x-rays of the lumbar region and was given additional  pain and prednisolone prescriptions.  An MRI was scheduled for 10/6.
The 10/2 X-ray results follow-
LUMBAR SPINE SERIES
INDICATION: Left-sided low back pain and sciatica.  Pain severity rated 7/10.
COMPARISON:5/4/2017
Bony density is within normal limits, with no fracture or suspicious legion. The posterior elements are intact. The paraspinous soft tissues are unremarkable for age.
Disc degenerative changes and posterior facet arthropathy findings remain evident ... prominent at L5-S1 and L4-L5.
IMPRESSION:  SIMILAR APPEARANCE TO BEFORE OF DJD FINDINGS MOST PRONOUNCED AT L4-L5 AND L5-S1.

10/6, MRI results-
"The MRI shows multiple levels of moderate degenerative disc disease and narrowing.  At L3-4 there is compression of the exiting left L3 nerve root as well as the L4 nerve root on the left."

October 9- I was referred to Dr. Sonny Gill

October 12, 16, and 19-  I called Dr. Gill's office to see if they had received referral, to tell them that I was an athlete and had suffered complications of an athletic injury, and to tell them that I was debilitated despite two rounds of prednisolone and weeks of pain medicine.

October 19- Late afternoon I received a call that I had been referred to the nearby Pain Center.

October 20 and 23  I left messages at the Pain Center asking if they had received my referral and scheduled an appointment.

October 25- As of today I have not been contacted by the Pain Center.
My comments-  Apparently Dr. Gill's office and the Pain Center do not use the Spartanburg Regional "My Chart" or reply to messages left on their phone system.  I was referred, first to Dr. Gill, and then 11 days later by his office to a nearby Pain Center, I don't know which one.  Now 6 days later, there's been no contact from the Pain Center.

I've wondered for over 3 weeks if perhaps an epidural steroid injection might be indicted and prescribed.  Also, I wonder if the sciatica diagnosis is correct since my symptoms are different. Unlike sciatica, sitting, even driving a car, is my most comfortable position, but lying down and standing or walking is extremely painful.  I get little sleep because lying down is so painful. I hate taking pain pills, but have been taking prescribed acetaminophen-COD, hydrocodon, and gabapentin which help reduce pain only a little.  The gabapentin (or combination of drugs?) has given me dizziness and vertigo, so I recently stopped taking it.

I have been debilitated by pain now for over a month and seem to be no closer to resolution here in Spartanburg County than I was a month ago, so I have successfully made an appointment with the St. Luke  Hospital Pain Center, Columbus, NC, for tomorrow Monday, October 26.  What I think I probably actually need is evaluation by a specialist.                           In 5 weeks, I've gone from being a national class age group athlete to being so debilitated by pain (and some times dizziness) that I have trouble walking and sleeping.|Don't really care. Only worry about getting payments|The doctor cared and listened to my story. He was very thorough and did a lot of X-rays to find out what was causing my pain. Then he treated it accordingly. I am thankful that I have finally found some relief!

column3:
MUSC Health Pain Management at Rutledge Tower serves Charleston, SC with comprehensive pain management solutions. Located in the heart of Charleston at 135 Rutledge Ave on the 9th Floor, our specialized team offers outpatient consultation and interventional pain management services. As part of the broader MUSC Health network, we maintain three different clinic locations throughout the Charleston area, ensuring accessible care for all residents suffering from chronic pain conditions.

Our interventional pain specialists are dedicated to finding effective solutions for chronic pain through a three-pronged approach of education, research, and clinical care. We utilize the latest therapies and technologies to address complex pain issues that may not respond to conventional treatments. Each patient receives an individualized diagnosis and treatment plan based on their unique medical history, physical examination results, and specialized studies, allowing us to precisely target specific pain sources and conditions.

Patient-Centered Care Philosophy

At MUSC Health Pain Management, patient care remains our most important priority. We combine state-of-the-art clinical treatments with a compassionate approach that addresses not only the physical aspects of pain but also considers the emotional and psychological components. Our multidisciplinary team works collaboratively to develop comprehensive treatment strategies that improve quality of life and functional outcomes for patients suffering from both acute and chronic pain conditions.

Contact Information and Location

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, call us at (843) 792-2500. We're conveniently located at 135 Rutledge Ave, 9th Floor, Charleston, SC 29425. For additional information about our services and other locations, visit our website at MUSC Health Pain Management.

column3:
Charleston Pain Relief & Wellness Center serves North Charleston, SC and surrounding areas with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our dedicated team of healthcare professionals combines medical expertise with a compassionate approach to address chronic pain conditions and promote overall wellness. Since our founding, we've been committed to providing non-surgical alternatives that help patients regain mobility, reduce discomfort, and improve their quality of life.

Our center offers a diverse range of specialized services designed to address various pain conditions:

Medical Weight Loss - Our physician-supervised weight loss programs utilize cutting-edge techniques and personalized nutrition plans to help patients achieve sustainable results. We understand the connection between excess weight and chronic pain, addressing both for comprehensive relief.

Chiropractic Care - Our skilled chiropractors provide non-invasive solutions for musculoskeletal issues, focusing on proper spinal alignment to reduce pain and improve nervous system function. Each treatment plan is customized to address specific concerns and promote natural healing.

Specialized Pain Solutions

Neuropathy Treatment - Our innovative Neuropathy Treatment Solution effectively manages symptoms while promoting nerve health and regeneration. We combine multiple therapeutic approaches to address numbness, tingling, and pain associated with peripheral neuropathy.

Knee Pain Relief - Using advanced therapies and rehabilitation techniques, we help patients overcome knee pain without relying on surgery or long-term medication. Our treatments focus on reducing inflammation, strengthening supporting muscles, and improving joint function.

Spinal Decompression - Our non-surgical spinal decompression therapy relieves pressure on compressed nerves and addresses herniated or bulging discs. This gentle treatment option has helped countless patients avoid invasive procedures while experiencing significant pain reduction.

Our Patient-Centered Approach

At Charleston Pain Relief & Wellness Center, we believe in empowering patients through education and active participation in their healing journey. Our holistic approach considers all aspects of health and wellness, creating comprehensive treatment plans that address both symptoms and underlying causes of pain.

Visit us at 2294 Otranto Rd, North Charleston, SC 29406, or call +1 843-604-2276 to schedule your consultation. Learn more about our services at charlestonpainreliefcenter.com.
column11: Charleston Pain Relief Center is a leading healthcare provider specializing in personalized care for lasting pain relief. Spine Pain Center - North Charleston serves the North Charleston, SC area with comprehensive chiropractic care and pain management solutions. Our established practice brings together a team of highly qualified chiropractors with diverse specializations to address a wide range of conditions affecting the spine and nervous system. At our Rivers Avenue location, patients receive personalized treatment plans designed to alleviate pain, improve mobility, and enhance overall wellness through non-invasive techniques.

The practice is led by the husband-and-wife team of Dr. Joe Carew and Dr. Karen Carew, who bring exceptional credentials and experience to their patients. Dr. Karen Carew has dedicated more than two decades to patient care across various specialties, developing a comprehensive approach to chiropractic treatment. Dr. Joe Carew, who graduated as valedictorian from the same chiropractic program as his wife, contributes his academic excellence and clinical expertise to the practice.

A Legacy of Excellence

Since relocating to South Carolina to establish their chiropractic practice, the Carews have successfully owned and managed 11 clinics throughout the state. Their commitment to exceptional patient care has earned them numerous accolades at both state and national levels, establishing Spine Pain Center as a trusted name in chiropractic medicine.

Comprehensive Care Approach

Our chiropractors possess unique skill sets that allow us to treat diverse conditions, from acute injuries to chronic pain syndromes. We emphasize evidence-based treatments tailored to each patient's specific needs, ensuring optimal outcomes and lasting relief.

column40: I dont know anything about the Easley office but the Greenville office is a total joke! Do not waste your time there. I was referred from the previous clinic I was going to due to them closing down. I had been on the same medication for over 10 years and had proof of an injury. The nurse practitioner refused to listen to anything I had to say and prescribed some bogus medication that you could tell was brand new(which means expensive) and being pushed by a sales rep, as it came in a brochure with a voucher attached stating "up to $0 cost". I informed her after reading the fine print that I would not be eligible since I'm a Medicaid patient and Medicaid doesn't work with prescription coupons. Not to mention, when I went to the check-out every other patient in line had the same exact brochure and prescription!  Even after explaining this to her she told me that's all she could do for me and to just see what happened with the co-pay. After getting proof from the pharmacy that I was not eligible and that my insurance did not cover that medication, I tried to contact the clinic and no one would answer the phone and after several messages being left, no one returned a single phone call. That was over a three week stretch. I had withdrawls from my previous medication so badly that had to be hospitalized. If that isn't bad enough, the exam room I was in had dried blood and urine on the floor. Save your money and your time, unless you take joy in being "medically treated" by uncompassionate and obviously unfamiliar providers of pain management.|Dr. Cut my medication in half. column3:
Tidelands Health Pain Management Services in Murrells Inlet, South Carolina offers comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Located at 4040 US-17 in Murrells Inlet, this specialized facility is part of the broader Tidelands Health network, providing evidence-based pain management solutions to residents throughout the coastal region. Their multidisciplinary approach combines advanced medical interventions with personalized treatment plans to address each patient's unique pain challenges.

Chronic pain can be debilitating, affecting every aspect of daily life. Whether stemming from injury, disease, or other medical conditions, persistent pain requires expert management. The dedicated team at Tidelands Health Pain Management Services works collaboratively to develop customized treatment strategies that target pain at its source while improving overall quality of life. Their goal is not just pain reduction but helping patients return to their normal activities and routines.

Innovative Treatment Approaches

The pain management specialists at this Murrells Inlet facility utilize the most innovative techniques and state-of-the-art equipment available in modern pain medicine. Treatment options may include specialized medication delivery systems, minimally invasive procedures, nerve blocks, physical therapy protocols, and integrative approaches. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the specific needs and circumstances of individual patients, with ongoing assessment and adjustment as needed.

Patient-Centered Care

What distinguishes Tidelands Health Pain Management Services is their commitment to patient-centered care. The team takes time to understand each patient's pain experience, medical history, and treatment goals before developing comprehensive management strategies. This collaborative approach ensures that patients are active participants in their own care journey, leading to better outcomes and improved satisfaction.

For appointments or more information, contact Tidelands Health Pain Management Services at +1 843-652-8260 or visit their website at tidelandshealth.org. Their facility is conveniently located at 4040 US-17, Murrells Inlet, SC 29576, United States.

column3:
Palmetto Stem Cell Therapy serves Greenville, SC and surrounding areas with innovative regenerative medicine solutions for those suffering from chronic pain. As we age or experience joint injuries, many of us become vulnerable to painful degenerative conditions and arthritis that can significantly impact quality of life. Our specialized team focuses on providing non-invasive alternatives to traditional pain management, helping patients find relief without relying on medications or surgical interventions.

At Palmetto Stem Cell Therapy, we take pride in our comprehensive approach to treating various pain conditions including:

- Back pain and spinal issues

- Joint pain and arthritis

- Neck pain and associated headaches

- Sciatica and nerve-related discomfort

- Sports injuries and repetitive strain conditions

Our regenerative treatments harness the body's natural healing capabilities, promoting tissue repair and reducing inflammation at the source of your pain.

Why Choose Regenerative Medicine?

Regenerative medicine offers several advantages over conventional pain management approaches:

- Non-surgical solutions that avoid lengthy recovery periods

- Drug-free treatments that eliminate dependency concerns

- Targeted therapy addressing the root cause rather than just symptoms

- Potential for long-term relief rather than temporary management

Your Path to Recovery

We understand how chronic pain can prevent you from enjoying life's precious moments with family and friends. Our goal is to help you reclaim these experiences through personalized care plans tailored to your specific condition and needs.

Contact us today at (864) 538-0090 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward a pain-free lifestyle. Our clinic is conveniently located at 3 Webb Rd, Suite 2, Greenville, SC 29607.

Visit [palmettostemcell.com/greenville/](https://palmettostemcell.com/greenville/) to learn more about our innovative treatments and how we can help you get your life back.

In the fall the nurse instructed me to "continue medication" when I was wanting an apt for labs to be rechecked after concerning symptoms. It took 3 months and 3 phone calls to get labs scheduled because "they don't draw thyroid labs any sooner than every 3 months." In January when labs came back elevated for me, I called again and was told the exact same thing "continue medication your labs are normal." I finally followed up with a specialist who agreed I was not being managed properly and with the medication changes I knew I needed I am feeling much better. As much as I like the physicians at the bedside, I can't go to a practice that has untrained "nurses" on staff giving bad medical advice to patients and that can not be bothered to even speak to the physician on the patients behalf. Our specialized clinic is dedicated to addressing a wide spectrum of pain conditions, providing relief and improved quality of life for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain. As part of the larger Atrium Health network, we combine personalized care with access to advanced medical resources to deliver exceptional pain management services to our patients.

At Atrium Health Kings Mountain Pain Management, our board-certified providers offer expert care for numerous pain conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Arthritis

  • Muscle and joint pain

  • Nerve pain

  • Neuropathy

  • And many other chronic pain conditions

Advanced Treatment Options

We provide a comprehensive range of treatment modalities tailored to each patient's specific needs:

  • Joint injections

  • Nerve block injections

  • Spinal cord and peripheral nerve stimulation

  • Botox treatments for pain

  • Therapeutic massage

  • Medication management

Part of the Atrium Health Network

As a member of the Atrium Health family, our patients benefit from seamless access to additional specialized care when needed. This integration ensures comprehensive treatment plans and continuity of care across the healthcare system.

Insurance and Accessibility

We accept most insurance policies to ensure our services remain accessible to those who need them. Our convenient location at 706 W King St, Kings Mountain, NC 28086 makes quality pain management available to residents throughout the region.

Don't wait in pain any longer. Contact us at (980) 487-5500 to schedule an appointment and take the first step toward effective pain management. Learn more about our services at our official website.
column11: At Atrium Health Kings Mountain Pain Management, we specialize in helping patients manage their pain, including back and neck pain, arthritis, muscle and joint pain, nerve pain, neuropathy, and more. Located in Kings Mountain, NC, our board-certified providers offer a wide variety of treatment options including joint injections, nerve block injections, spinal cord and peripheral nerve stimulation, Botox, massage, medication and medication management, and other services. And as part of the Atrium Health family, you'll have access to more specialized care if it's needed. Don't wait in pain any longer. Call us to make an appointment. Most insurance policies are accepted.

Regional Spine & Pain Management serves Spartanburg, SC and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized medical facility focuses on diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions through evidence-based approaches and personalized care plans. Located conveniently on Warren H. Abernathy Highway, our team of board-certified physicians combines extensive experience with advanced technology to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

At Regional Spine & Pain Management, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain relief that addresses both symptoms and underlying causes. Our treatment options include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and minimally invasive techniques. We specialize in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, sciatica, arthritis, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

Understanding that chronic pain affects each person differently, our physicians take time to thoroughly evaluate each patient's condition, medical history, and personal goals. This comprehensive assessment allows us to develop customized treatment plans that may combine various modalities for optimal results. Our compassionate staff guides patients through every step of their pain management journey.

Facility Information

Regional Spine & Pain Management is part of the respected Spartanburg Regional Healthcare System. Our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology to ensure accurate assessments and effective interventions. We're located at 8311 Warren H Abernathy Hwy, Spartanburg, SC 29301. For appointments or inquiries, contact us at +1 864-560-9646 or visit our website at https://www.spartanburgregional.com/services/pain-management.
