column3:
Non-Surgical Spine Center in Mt. Pleasant, South Carolina offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients seeking alternatives to invasive spine surgeries. Established with a clear mission to provide effective non-surgical treatments for spine and musculoskeletal pain, this specialized medical center has become a trusted resource for residents throughout the Charleston area. Their team of board-certified physicians combines years of clinical expertise with cutting-edge diagnostic technology to address conditions ranging from herniated discs and sciatica to complex regional pain syndrome and failed back surgery syndrome. By emphasizing personalized care plans that integrate multiple therapeutic approaches, the Non-Surgical Spine Center helps patients regain mobility, reduce pain levels, and improve their overall quality of life without resorting to surgical intervention.

The Non-Surgical Spine Center utilizes state-of-the-art diagnostic tools to accurately identify the root causes of pain. Their treatment protocols may include epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and regenerative medicine techniques such as platelet-rich plasma therapy. Each treatment plan is customized to address the specific needs and conditions of individual patients, with a focus on sustainable pain relief and functional improvement.

Patient-Centered Care Philosophy

What distinguishes the Non-Surgical Spine Center is their commitment to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. The medical team takes time to thoroughly explain diagnostic findings and treatment options, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. This collaborative approach, combined with their multidisciplinary expertise, creates an environment where patients feel supported throughout their pain management journey.

Location and Contact Information

The Non-Surgical Spine Center is conveniently located at 526 Johnnie Dodds Blvd, Mt Pleasant, SC 29464. Patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 843-856-9669 or visiting their website at nonsurgicalspinecenter.com. The center welcomes referrals from primary care physicians and specialists, and works with most major insurance providers to ensure accessible care for those suffering from chronic spine and musculoskeletal conditions.
column11: Non-Surgical Spine Center was established with the mission of providing patients and clinicians a non-surgical alternative in the treatment of spine and musculoskeletal pain. Utilizing the most current and innovative diagnostic and therapeutic techniques, our group offers patients a multitude of options for improving daily function and quality of life while significantly decreasing levels of pain.

column40: Barbara Williams: I have been Dr. Alexander patient my mother and I for over 10 years. The staff is very friendly and they treat you with respect. They make you feel at home. Dr. Alexander he listens to you explaining your situation and he's very respectful and understanding and try to get to know you as a person. I feel very safe with him and his Staff. The last injection I gotten from him lasted about 3 years and I'm about to get another injection for the New Year. I thank God for Dr.Alexander other than him being a good doctor he also a good friend.|I went to Dr Alexander in terrible back pain- at least a 10 level. He came up with a plan to do an injection and then some laser treatments. I finished the laser treatments and can say I am out of pain. The other positive thing going on in his office is the staff. Everyone of the people I have encountered were excellent. I am so happy to find the Non Surgical Spine Center. If you are in pain this is your place. Nancy Osborne|Dr Alexander's office is fantastic. Very friendly staff. Herniated disk pain that traveled down my left leg was completely alleviated after two treatment shots. I was very close to scheduling surgery and happy I am pain free.|Dr. Alexander and his staff are extremely knowledgable, caring, and committed to making sure you leave or have a plan to reduce your back pain. I saw tremendous results with the laser treatment. All day walking used to mean a week of soreness, but that was eliminated after the laser treatment.|Dr Alexander is a miracle worker. The spine injections completely rid me of pain with no surgery involved. The office staff is very helpful and accommodating. I highly recommend this practice!|Dr. Alexander was really helpful and helped me a lot with my lower back pain. The rest of the staff were super friendly and understanding. I highly recommend Dr. Alexander to avoid surgery|Overall, an amazing experience! Very professional and kind staff that made my experiences very enjoyable. I would recommend the Non-Surgical Spine Center and Dr. Alexander to anyone seeking out help/care for their spine issues.|I went to non surgical spine center on 10/15 to receive care after still being in immense pain after having back surgery in February of this year. When I got back to the room they asked how I got my back injury. I explained that it was due to a car accident. Apparently I said the magical words and did not realize it. They REFUSED to use my in network insurance and wanted to become apart of the claim for the accident. They still billed my insurance for this visit but I was not seen and to top it all off wanted me to pay $250 for the same visit all before I could even see the Doctor. Obviously I walked out because I was not aware that I could be denied treatment essentially for telling them I was apart of insurance claim for this injury. Don't go here and make sure you don't tell them it's car accident related injury because all they saw past that point were dollar signs. I'm still in debilitating pain and now have to look for a new ortho doctor.

Spine Pain Center - Summerville serves residents throughout Summerville, SC and surrounding communities with comprehensive chiropractic care and pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of specialists has established a reputation for excellence in treating various spinal conditions, chronic pain issues, and injuries resulting from accidents or everyday strain. Located conveniently at 404 N Pine St in Summerville, we provide accessible care to patients seeking relief from back pain, neck discomfort, headaches, and other musculoskeletal concerns.

At Spine Pain Center, we believe in addressing the root cause of pain rather than merely masking symptoms. Our approach begins with a thorough initial examination to identify the specific origin of your discomfort. Following this assessment, our chiropractors develop personalized treatment plans that may include spinal adjustments, therapeutic exercises, massage therapy, and rehabilitation techniques. This holistic methodology ensures not only immediate relief but sustainable long-term wellness outcomes for our patients.

Multiple Locations to Serve You

Beyond our Summerville location, Spine Pain Center proudly operates additional facilities in Mount Pleasant, North Charleston, Surfside Beach, and North Myrtle Beach. This network of chiropractic centers ensures that quality care is never far away, regardless of where you live or work in the region. For those searching for a "chiropractor near me," our multiple locations offer convenience without compromising on the quality of care you deserve.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes our practice is our unwavering commitment to patient education and involvement. We take the time to explain your condition, treatment options, and preventative measures in clear, understandable terms. Our goal extends beyond symptom relief—we aim to empower you with knowledge and techniques to maintain spinal health and prevent future issues.

To schedule your comprehensive examination or learn more about our services, contact us at +1 843-879-9259 or visit our website at www.spine-paincenter.com/location/summerville-sc. The path to pain-free living begins with a single step—let Spine Pain Center guide you on your journey to optimal health and wellness.

Went here because I was dealing with severe sciatica that was going down my leg into my ankle and was having a hard time standing for long periods of time. I've seen good improvement, I still have a ways to go. I know I'm in good hands. The staff friendly makes you feel welcome and they  listen to your needs. They have a great crew. Highly recommend this practice.|Dr. Chandler Farrell is amazing! My husband injured his back at work due to snow on the ground. I was very worried since he was barely walking and in excruciating pain, but I'm so happy we came into the spine center @ Summerville. It was a great experience. My husband feels much better after appointment #1. We'll be back for a 2nd appointment and follow a plan.

Strongly recommend!

New patients, come with time since you'll have to complete new patients form. Totally worth it!|I started coming to the Spine pain Center back in November of 2024. And when I tell you , I feel so much better, the Doctors are so knowledgeable and they listen to all of your concerns, Dr Zee is awesome and the front staff is exceptional nice. I would definitely recommend the Spine Center to everyone.|I'm very much not a review person, but if you're having obscure pain and no luck with doctors, this is the place to go! I've been shut down by 3 doctors and only after coming here have hope of getting better! Huge shout out to the whole team!|After many years of sciatic pain, a friend suggested that I make an appointment with Dr. Murphy at Spine Pain Center. When I walked into their office, it felt like a peaceful place and the ladies that greeted me seemed great. I was right about both things.

I cant say enough about Dr. Murphy. He is so knowledgeable, kind and personable.  He genuinely cares about his patients.

Dr. Murphy takes his time asking me how I am and what type of pain I am in.  His adjustments make me feel so much better and the electrical stimulation really relaxes my muscles.

He has even called my a couple of times just to check how I was feeling.

I trust Dr. Murphy completely with my care and I am so very grateful that my sciatic pain is so much better and that there are many days now without it!|My first impression was walking into the office seeing how warming and comfortable it is while waiting. Ginnette the manager assistant she was able to help me get all checked in and answering my questions that I may have. They were just so welcoming and they were able to help me step by step. Dr Z is absolutely awesome. I walk out with no pain. Those 3 are such a wonderful team! They really show how much they care about there patients. I will only be going to them from here on out, I already told my family and friends where to go if they want to be filling good walking out of the office.|If you want a team that cares, Summerville Spine Pain Center is the place to go! I've avoided getting help for years. After an extensive look at my neck, it will be a long road to recovery but I'm actually excited that a pain free future can exist for me.

Colonial Pain Management serves Sumter, SC and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Located in the heart of Sumter at 325 Broad Street, our specialized clinic has been dedicated to improving patients' quality of life through innovative and personalized treatment approaches. We combine evidence-based medical interventions with compassionate care to address chronic pain conditions, helping residents throughout South Carolina find relief and restore function.

At Colonial Pain Management, we offer a diverse range of treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our board-certified specialists utilize advanced diagnostic techniques to identify the root causes of pain before developing customized treatment plans. Services include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy coordination, and innovative non-surgical approaches to pain relief.

Our Approach to Patient Care

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our multidisciplinary team works collaboratively to address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain. This comprehensive approach helps patients regain control of their lives while minimizing reliance on medication when possible.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please contact us at +1 803-773-5227. Our clinic is conveniently located at 325 Broad St, Sumter, SC 29150. For additional information about our services and approach, visit our website at http://www.colonialhealthcare.com/ where you can also access patient resources and forms to streamline your visit.

Serving the Sumter Community

As an established healthcare provider in Sumter, Colonial Pain Management is committed to community wellness. We accept most major insurance plans and work with patients to ensure access to quality pain management care. Our central location makes us accessible to residents throughout Sumter County and neighboring communities seeking specialized pain treatment solutions.

At Carolina Spine & Pain, our experienced team of pain management specialists provides world-class care for various conditions. We excel in treating injuries resulting from car accidents, sports activities, and workplace incidents, as well as addressing chronic pain and degenerative conditions. Patient-Centered Approach

column38: Mel C.|Kimberly Brannon|Miesha Bobien|Bryan Reynolds|Rhonda Link|Robert Landry "Major" Paraphanelix Inc.|Baxter Schulz|Quality Inspector
column40:
I was a patient here for years prior to my leaving. I had many eventful experiences and many uneventful ones. I am leaving a very honest review here.

I left crying and smiling, idk if it's b/c of how nervous he made me later on that made the ones where I left crying worse. He is a good Dr he does listen and tries to help but some of what he said confused me, ie, came in 1 pill short and he cut me that mo - he had told me "it's ok as long as I let him know" well when it happened a couple months later (1-2 pills short)  I came in I was honest with him and he told me "being honest is telling him before I did it not after.." there was a time I cut pills in half only taking the half when I felt like I needed it and he cut me for that b/c "he is the dr and he doesn't write for one half he writes for a whole pill" I told him I was sorry I didn't understand and told him I'd do anything he asks if he needs to know before hand I'd call before but when it happened it was over night or on the weekend but that I'd call, they wouldn't call me back or it would be days before I talked to them. I went to the ER ONE time during the 5 yrs I was a patient there and I was belittled for it b/c I have a panic disorder and I was having chest pains over 2 days "what made u think this time it would be different" (indicating it was panic). If you change your appt he will cut you (or change your meds altogether) I didn't do it often but I did a couple of times and both times at the end he either cut my mg or count. There were things he said that were contradictory, bad moods seemed to come out in his appts (again that couldve been me/my nerves), he yelled at me and slammed the door on me before, over asking about a lidocaine injection from another Dr (my daughter was in the room the day he did this). He did prescribe me fentanyl at the end of my treatment with him and I have young kids, I went to sleep, woke up, and my son was in the bed with me and it had peeled off. My son 11 at the time could be dead today - after the previous conversations I'd had with him about this medicine I felt like he wouldn't listen to me and/or change my prescription again so I left. The last prescription he gave me was never filled.

That being said - he did help me, he filled out my pa's when I needed it, he did listen to me (most of the time), there were times he'd cut jokes and I didn't get it (again could be nerves), he however did seem kinder to the men than he did me or a couple other women I met in the office, but when I left I can honestly say that the drs I met afterward weren't great either, there have been times I thought maybe I'd be better off going back. I was never able to fully let down my guard with him, I never knew what I was going to walk into but there is some kindness in his heart or soul. if your  nervous he will pick up on nerves and his mood will change if he senses it.
Overall I'd say everyone's experience is similar in some ways but different in others, some mesh well with him, while others may not, especially someone who has nerves or has "white coat syndrome"
Dr Gupta if u read this thank you for taking care of me over the years I do realize how much better I had it then.|After moving back to SC I had to find a primary care physician as well as pain management. I opted to have Dr Gupta be both . After being in the hospital for 7 days and having to reschedule my appt Dr Gupta then proceeded to not refill my prescriptions that I have been on for 10 plus years. I have a laundry list of different Diagnoses that Dr Gupta chose not to prescribe my medication's therefore throwing my entire health at risk . Today I'm the office instead of refilling my normal medications he offered to give me Fentanyl as opposed to hydrocodone I refused then he wanted to put me on Dilaudid what kind of Dr tries to put you on these medications? When I told him I was going to do this review he stormed out of the room saying if I gave him a bad review he would give me a bad review I asked if he was threatening me as he went into the office across the hall and he slammed the door. I would not recommend this Dr as he does not have a patients health history first and foremost. I have never in my 55 years been treated so badly by a physician. I will be filing a formal complaint with the SC Medical Board and I highly suggest that any other patients that have been treated this way by this so called Physician to do the same.|I was a new patient who was hesitant after reading the reviews about even going to my appointment and I'm happy I did!! The doctor was really nice he talked to me asked me questions to determine the best treatment for me!! I'm not sure what doctor you'll are referring to with some of these reviews but it's definitely NOT Dr Gupta!!! His staff was amazing also if I could give him 10 stars I absolutely would have!!!|Worst Dr I've ever had to see and the rudest one too he hates patients to ask him any questions he's always in a bad mood I went to him for 5 years and I one day I had to reschedule my appointment and when I go back to him he changed my medication I asked why he was doing it and all he said was because I'm the Dr very unprofessional I will not be going back to Dr Gupta and I hope nobody else has to ever see this Dr I will be calling the sc medical board and I hope every patient he has does the same|He listened to me but didn't hear what I was saying. Made his diagnosis without looking at my X-rays or MRI. Treated me like I was there to get drugs which I wasn't. I never asked him for any medicines. Lectured me on getting my stress level under control which I told him I was doing. I hope I never have to go back to him.|Dr. Gupta is a great Doctor. I Have been seeing him for 4 yrs. now and truley feel he's one of the best at what he does, I give him a 5 star rating!|Unprofessional behavior is his standard. Always let his bad mood out on innocent and friendly patients, even when in pain, they keep keep it together, staying friendly to him. Just shows a pure carelessness from a doctor, who supposed to be a caregiver!|Great Dr and awesome staff. Very professional, and takes care of all your needs.

Prisma Health Pain Medicine-Downtown serves Greenville, SC with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to improve quality of life for patients throughout the Upstate region. Located in a convenient downtown setting, this specialized practice brings together board-certified pain specialists and advanced treatment modalities under one roof. The team at Prisma Health Pain Medicine-Downtown takes a patient-centered approach, developing individualized treatment plans that address both acute and chronic pain conditions. Their state-of-the-art facility at 111 Doctors Dr. is equipped with the latest diagnostic and therapeutic technologies to ensure optimal outcomes for patients seeking relief from debilitating pain.

At Prisma Health Pain Management, the primary goal is helping patients return to healthy, active lives through proactive pain management strategies. The practice specializes in preventing pain before it develops using a variety of advanced, evidence-based methods. Their multidisciplinary team excels in treating complex cases and managing pain in patients with pre-existing conditions. Services include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy coordination, and innovative non-surgical approaches to pain relief.

Expert Care Team

The practice features a team of fellowship-trained pain medicine specialists who stay at the forefront of the field through ongoing education and research. These physicians work collaboratively with other healthcare providers to ensure comprehensive care that addresses the physical, emotional, and psychological aspects of pain. Their integrated approach means patients benefit from coordinated care within the broader Prisma Health network.

Patient Information

column3:
QC Kinetix (Columbia Downtown) serves residents throughout Columbia, SC with innovative regenerative medicine solutions. Located in the heart of the city, our clinic specializes in natural pain treatments that help patients suffering from chronic neck pain, back pain, and joint discomfort without resorting to surgery or long-term medication. Our team of shoulder and knee specialists focuses on repairing and restoring damaged tissue through advanced biological therapies, enabling patients to return to activities they once enjoyed but abandoned due to persistent pain.

At QC Kinetix (Columbia Downtown), we understand how debilitating chronic pain can be. Many of our patients come to us after having given up hobbies, sports, and daily activities they once loved. Our natural treatment protocols target the root cause of discomfort rather than simply masking symptoms, promoting the body's innate healing capabilities to address conditions affecting the shoulders, knees, neck, back, and other joints.

Proven Results for Columbia Residents

Our regenerative treatments have helped thousands of people throughout Columbia regain mobility and reduce pain without invasive procedures. By stimulating tissue repair at the cellular level, our therapies offer a viable alternative for those seeking relief without the risks and recovery time associated with surgery. Each treatment plan is customized to address the specific needs and conditions of individual patients.

Convenient Downtown Location

You can find our clinic at 2750 Laurel St #101, Columbia, SC 29204. Our central location makes quality regenerative care accessible to residents throughout the Columbia metropolitan area. To schedule a consultation with our specialists and learn how our treatments might help you return to the activities you love, call us at (803) 281-4194 or visit our website at qckinetix.com.

column11: A lot of people who suffer from chronic neck pain and/or back pain are forced to stop doing the things that they once enjoyed out of fear of causing further damage.The good news is that you can get back to doing the things that you love with a little help from our shoulder and knee specialists from QC Kinetix(Columbia Downtown). We offer natural and regenerative medicine that's used to repair and restore damaged tissue in order for you to enjoy life again.Our natural pain treatments have proven to be helpful for thousands of people around Columbia, and our doctors have helped them to return to life with renewed vigor. column38: Rachel Maxwell|Margaret Gettys|Tammy Keeling|eric kiesling|El_guapos_tacos|Tommy Silvester|Battery Street Book Company Booksellers|Chelsea Mckoy
column40: My 91 year old mother has bone on bone arthritis in her knees and was experiencing significant pain with every step she took.  We had tried the traditional gel and cortisone injections to control the pain but they were no longer helping. After a seriies of treatments at QC Kinetix she is walking without pain in her knees and it is such a relief. We were at the end of our rope with how to help her as knee surgery was not going to be an option.  I am so grateful we found QC Kintex and would highly recommend their services. I only wish we had found them years earlier!|I've been very physically active all of my life, so no surprise when in my 50's my knees started complaining. I heard the QC Kinetix commercials on the radio and knew that was the route for me. I could tell a difference when I walked out of their office after the first injection. The procedure is quick and relatively painless. My flexibility returned, and the stiffness vanished. A few weeks after my second injection I had an accident and injured my right meniscus. The pain was excruciating for about 4 days, and the swelling was such that bending my knee next to impossible. Luckily the day for my third injection was a week after the injury. I arrived at the office using a walker. They were able to drain the excess fluid from my knee, and I almost skipped back to my car.  The doctors and staff are a bonus! They are so personable, funny, and knowledgeable. The body is an amazing machine that strives to thrive, and regenerative medicine enhances its ability to heal itself.|I have two treatments left. One in two weeks and the other in three months. These procedures have been amazing for me. I could barely walk in August. Started my treatments and now I can walk with no pain. I can actually get up on my own power now a few months ago I had to have help getting up. It may not work as fast for some but I would definitely say try it and give it a chance to work.|Thank you, QC Kinetix, I had an amazing experience all around. The staff and Dr. Wang are a pleasure to go in and see, each and every visit was welcoming and informative. I feel that I made the better choice going with QC Kinetix vs going through surgery. I would recommend to anyone out there take the time to see if you are a good candidate for this type of medical help. Away I go with smiles, thanks Eric!|Staff is so great! they make you feel like family. Karen was gentle with her blood draw and made me feel calm. Very welcoming. The building was very clean. Greg was excellent and knowledgeable. Thank you QC Kinetix for a great experience.|I will start out by saying this is not an instant fix for whatever your problem is, that is why I waited before I wrote a review.  If you are expecting overnight results it most likely will not happen.  At least that was my experience.  I had my last shot in October of 2022.  I am just now starting to really feel the benefits.  It has reduced my pain and swelling by about 75 percent.  I also began a regimen of turmeric and Osteo Bi-Flex daily.  If you are patient and do not get discouraged, this is worth the money.  Just keep your expectations where they need to be.  The commercials have accounts of folks being completely healed in 3 months.  That was not my experience, but it has helped tremendously over about a 9 month period.  I also highly recommend getting the stem cells instead of just PRP shots.  I gave a 4 because it didn't work as quickly as I had hoped, but it does eventually show results.|The staff was great and the treatment helped a great deal, without my needing to do surgery. Would do it again and would recommend|10/10 the facility and staff are absolutely incredible. Top notch. I'd recommend them 10 times over.

Monument Health Pain Management in Rapid City, South Dakota offers comprehensive pain management services designed to improve quality of life for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our specialized team of board-certified physicians and advanced practice providers combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to address each patient's unique pain challenges. Serving the Black Hills region since 2012, we've established ourselves as a trusted healthcare partner committed to helping patients regain function and reduce reliance on pain medications.

At Monument Health Pain Management, we utilize a multidisciplinary approach that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and behavioral health strategies. Our specialists are experienced in treating various pain conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Cancer-related pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-surgical pain

Advanced Treatment Options

Our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology enabling us to offer advanced interventional procedures such as epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and intrathecal pain pump management. These minimally invasive techniques can provide significant relief while minimizing medication dependence.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in empowering patients through education and active participation in their treatment plans. Our team works closely with primary care providers and other specialists to ensure coordinated care that addresses all aspects of a patient's health and wellbeing.

Contact Information

Address: 1635 Caregiver Cir, Rapid City, SD 57702, United States

Phone: +1 605-755-5228

Website: https://monument.health/services/pain-management/

New patients are welcome with a physician referral. Most major insurance plans, Medicare, and Medicaid are accepted. Call our office today to learn more about how Monument Health Pain Management can help you on your journey toward pain relief and improved function.

The staff are terrific here! They know your name, they're efficient and make the process of visiting a physician easy. And Dr Kelsey Johnson is amazing! She thorough and gets things done.|Dr. Buck is very thorough in his evaluation. He takes time to answer questions, review all information and is incredibly intelligent and experienced in his practice. I feel very safe in his hands.

They are truly caring and compassionate.|Dr Frost was very thorough with explaining in detail of what the procedure was going to consist of. During the procedure both his assistants and himself kept me aware of what to expect during the whole ordeal. I was very impressed and pleased.|They are fine doctors and staff except for the general policy (presented as "it's federal law") that they will not prescribe opioid pain medication if someone is on another prescribed narcotic, such as benzodiazepines. I have managed my pain the last 20 years with 10-15 50mg tramadol. Tramadol is nearly impossible to abuse, and at that dosage, even if one cared to abuse them, it would last perhaps two or three days maximum. And tramadol does not work if injected. Meanwhile, after seeing my therapist today, she told me she has multiple patients on benzos in combination with opioids, and even medical cannabis. She expressed her disbelief in my story because she has so many clients who fit that profile. I get it; I am still in disbelief. Personally, I have met few doctors in South Dakota who don't treat me like a junkie simply because I lived the last 15 years in Mexico, and reported I managed my pain with tramadol. I should have just lied like an addict would have. This whole situation explains why there is such a drug problem here as compared to when I moved to Mexico. When people are suffering, it is only natural for them to seek relief wherever they can when doctors let them down.|Dr. Harper and his team are TOP NOTCH!!! Dr. Harper & his staff go out of their way, and above and beyond for their patients. He is so thorough and takes time to explain what is happening to you. They NEVER make you feel rushed or uncomfortable. Their beside manners are one of a kind. Highly recommended and appreciate his staff.|Dr. Huot was friendly, professional and knowledgeable! He made me feel comfortable that I'm in the 'right track'.|Dr. Harper is such a great aspect to our orthopedics clinic! He has been such an amazing doc to work with. Him and his team are much appreciated|Dr Frost gave me options that another doctor did not even suggest and he listened to me and came up with a good plan to deal with my chronic back pain. I would recommend him to anyone.

column2: Avera Medical Group Pain Management -- Aberdeen
column3:
Avera Medical Group Pain Management - Aberdeen serves the Aberdeen, SD community with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our dedicated clinic specializes in developing personalized treatment plans that address both acute and chronic pain conditions, helping patients regain control of their lives and improve their overall quality of life.

At our Aberdeen location, we take a multidisciplinary approach to pain management. Our team of specialists works collaboratively to evaluate, diagnose, and treat various pain conditions through innovative and evidence-based techniques. We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we're committed to finding solutions that work specifically for you.

Collaborative Treatment Approach

What sets our clinic apart is our integrated care model. We work closely with neurologists, neurosurgeons, family medicine providers, physical medicine and rehabilitation specialists, physical therapists, chiropractors, diagnostic medical imaging professionals, and clinical pharmacists. This collaborative approach ensures that every aspect of your pain condition is addressed comprehensively.

Services and Treatments

Our pain management specialists offer a wide range of treatments including medication management, interventional procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary therapies. We specialize in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Visit Our Clinic

Located at 701 8th Ave NW, Aberdeen, SD 57401, our facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please call us at (605) 622-5123. Additional information about our practice can be found on our website at avera.org.

As part of the trusted Avera Health network, we're committed to providing compassionate, high-quality care that helps you find relief and return to the activities you love.

column3:
Interventional Pain at Rapid City Medical Center serves Rapid City, South Dakota with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our specialized team combines advanced interventional techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives and reduce dependency on pain medications. Located in downtown Rapid City, our clinic offers state-of-the-art facilities where patients receive personalized treatment plans designed to address both acute and chronic pain conditions.

Our team is led by highly qualified physicians including Dr. Lance James Doeden, MD, who joined our practice in 2021. Dr. Doeden graduated from the University of North Dakota School of Medicine in 2012 and brings over 9 years of diverse experience in pain management. He works alongside Dr. Tyler Ptacek to provide comprehensive interventional pain services to the Rapid City community and surrounding areas.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

At Interventional Pain at Rapid City Medical Center, we offer a wide range of treatments including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and joint injections. Our approach focuses on minimally invasive procedures that target the source of pain while minimizing side effects and recovery time.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we take the time to listen to our patients and develop individualized treatment plans. Our goal is not just to mask symptoms but to improve function and quality of life for those suffering from pain conditions.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please call us at +1 605-342-3280. Our clinic is conveniently located at 101 E Minnesota St, Suite 210, Rapid City, SD 57701. For more information about our services, visit our website at rapidcitymedicalcenter.com/rcmcspecialties/interventional-pain/.

column2: James T. Brunz, MD | Non-Opioid Pain Management
column3:
Orthopedic Institute Pain Management serves Brookings, SD and surrounding communities with specialized non-opioid pain management solutions. Under the expert care of Dr. James T. Brunz, patients receive comprehensive treatment for chronic pain conditions using innovative, minimally invasive techniques. The practice operates from its convenient location at 407 22nd Ave, Brookings, SD 57006, where Dr. Brunz and his team provide personalized care focused on improving quality of life without dependency on opioid medications.

As a fellowship-trained pain medicine physician, Dr. Brunz brings exceptional expertise to the treatment of complex pain conditions. He specializes in providing non-surgical musculoskeletal care for patients who either aren't suitable candidates for surgery or haven't achieved adequate relief from previous surgical interventions. Working in close collaboration with surgeons at the Orthopedic Institute, Dr. Brunz ensures patients receive truly comprehensive care that addresses all aspects of their musculoskeletal health.

Specialized Treatment Areas

Dr. Brunz offers specialized treatment for a range of conditions including:

  • Neuropathy management

  • Joint pain relief

  • Neck and back pain treatment

  • Spinal cord stimulator implants

  • DRG (Dorsal Root Ganglion) stimulator procedures

His practice provides comprehensive interventional pain services that serve both diagnostic and therapeutic purposes, helping patients understand the source of their pain while simultaneously working to alleviate it.

Pain & Movement Solutions serves Rapid City, SD and surrounding communities with exceptional physical therapy services designed to address a wide range of mobility issues and pain management needs. Our dedicated team of licensed physical therapists specializes in treating everything from sports injuries and post-surgical rehabilitation to chronic pain conditions and workplace injuries. With our patient-centered approach, we develop customized treatment plans that focus on restoring function, improving movement, and enhancing quality of life without unnecessary medications or invasive procedures.

If you've never considered physical therapy as a SOLUTION, it's time to discover just how good you can feel. Many patients come to us after trying numerous other treatments without success, only to find that targeted physical therapy addresses the root cause of their discomfort rather than just masking symptoms. Our evidence-based techniques combine hands-on manual therapy, therapeutic exercise, and education to empower you throughout your recovery journey.

Early Intervention Makes a Difference

Have a sprain, strain or nagging pain? Let us take the first look. Research consistently shows that addressing injuries early leads to faster recovery times and better outcomes. As direct access providers, we can evaluate and treat many conditions without requiring a physician referral first, saving you time and money while getting you on the path to recovery sooner.

Why Choose Physical Therapy First

Choosing physical therapy first over other healthcare options is the right path to recovery. Our non-invasive approach focuses on natural healing, improved function, and prevention of future injuries. Many patients find they can avoid surgery, reduce or eliminate pain medication use, and return to activities they love faster through consistent physical therapy treatment.

Visit us at our convenient Rapid City location: 3064 Covington St #104, Rapid City, SD 57703. Schedule your evaluation today by calling +1 605-593-4471 or learn more about our services at painandmovementsolutions.com.

column2: K. C. Chang, MD | Physiatrist (Acupuncture/Non-Opioid Pain Management)
column3:
K. C. Chang, MD serves Sioux Falls, SD as a distinguished board-certified physiatrist specializing in non-surgical pain management. At his practice located at 810 E 23rd St, Dr. Chang has established himself as a leading expert in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation (PM&R), offering comprehensive care for patients suffering from neuro-musculoskeletal problems and disabling conditions. His patient-centered approach focuses on minimizing pain and maximizing function without relying on surgical interventions or opioid medications.

Dr. Chang's practice offers a diverse range of non-surgical treatment options, including:

  • Acupuncture - Traditional Eastern medicine techniques for pain relief

  • Epidural injections - Targeted steroid delivery for spinal inflammation

  • Trigger point injections - Direct treatment of painful muscle knots

  • Physical therapy coordination - Customized rehabilitation programs

  • Medication management - Non-opioid approaches to pain control

Electrodiagnostic Medicine Expertise

As a subspecialist in electrodiagnostic medicine, Dr. Chang performs sophisticated testing to accurately diagnose neuromuscular conditions. These procedures measure electrical activity in muscles and nerves, providing critical information about nerve damage, muscle disorders, and other conditions that may cause pain or weakness. This diagnostic precision allows for more targeted and effective treatment plans.

Recognition and Credentials

Dr. Chang has been recognized as one of America's Top Physicians in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation by the Consumer's Research Council of America. This prestigious acknowledgment reflects his commitment to excellence in patient care and his significant contributions to the field of physiatry.

For appointments or more information, patients can contact Dr. Chang's office at (605) 331-5890 or visit the Orthopedic Institute website to learn more about his services.
column11:
Dr. Chang is a board certified physical medicine and rehabilitation (PM&R) specialist and has been treating patients non-surgically for pain management of their neuro-musculoskeletal problems and disabling conditions, using treatments such as acupuncture, epidural, trigger point injections, physical therapy, and medications. He also subspecializes in electrodiagnostic medicine. Electrodiagnostic medicine is a method of medical diagnosis that obtains information about diseases by recording the electrical activity of body parts or by measuring the responses to external electrical stimuli.

He is named one of America's Top Physicians in the specialty of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation by Consumer's Research Council of America.

column2: Dunes Pain Clinic, Dr Sorenson, Neck Pain, Injections
column3:
Dunes Pain Clinic in North Sioux City, SD provides specialized pain management services to residents throughout the 57049 area and surrounding communities in the United States. Under the expert leadership of Dr. Sorenson, our clinic has established itself as a premier destination for patients seeking relief from chronic and acute pain conditions, particularly those suffering from debilitating neck pain.

At Dunes Pain Clinic, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, combining advanced medical techniques with personalized care plans. Dr. Sorenson brings over 15 years of specialized experience in pain medicine, having completed fellowship training in interventional pain management at the renowned Mayo Clinic. Our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology, allowing us to provide precise and effective care for even the most complex pain conditions.

Specialized Neck Pain Treatment

Our clinic has developed particular expertise in treating cervical spine disorders and neck pain resulting from various causes including herniated discs, cervical spondylosis, whiplash injuries, and degenerative conditions. Dr. Sorenson employs evidence-based protocols that begin with thorough diagnostic assessments to identify the exact source of pain before recommending appropriate interventions.

Advanced Injection Therapies

We offer a comprehensive range of injection-based treatments performed with ultrasound or fluoroscopic guidance for maximum precision and safety. These include cervical epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, medial branch blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and trigger point injections. Each procedure is conducted in our comfortable, accredited procedural suite where patient safety remains our highest priority.

Located conveniently in North Sioux City, our clinic serves patients throughout South Dakota and neighboring states. We accept most major insurance plans and offer flexible scheduling to accommodate urgent pain management needs. Midwest Imaging & Midwest Pain Specialists serves Sioux Falls, SD with comprehensive diagnostic and pain management solutions. Located at 716 E 19th St, this specialized healthcare facility combines cutting-edge imaging technology with advanced pain treatment protocols to deliver exceptional patient care. Their integrated approach ensures patients receive accurate diagnoses and effective pain management strategies under one roof, making them a trusted healthcare partner for residents throughout South Dakota and neighboring states.

At Midwest Imaging, patients benefit from access to the latest diagnostic imaging equipment available:

3T MRI

Their state-of-the-art 3T MRI delivers images with pristine resolution and extraordinary detail, helping physicians diagnose conditions more quickly, safely, and accurately than ever before. This powerful technology provides exceptional clarity for detecting even subtle abnormalities.

OPEN UPRIGHT MRI

The Open Upright MRI was designed with patient comfort in mind. Its innovative design makes this scanner ideal for those who experience claustrophobia or anxiety during traditional MRI procedures, while still delivering high-quality diagnostic images.

Comprehensive Pain Management

The specialists at Midwest Pain Specialists understand that most pain can be alleviated, greatly reduced, or controlled to improve quality of life. Their multidisciplinary approach addresses both acute and chronic pain conditions through personalized treatment plans that may include:

  • Targeted injections

  • Customized physical therapy programs

  • Lifestyle modification guidance

  • Therapeutic exercise regimens

  • Psychological treatment approaches

For cases where pain cannot be completely eliminated, their management techniques help patients develop effective coping strategies to maintain functionality and improve daily living.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about their services, contact Midwest Imaging & Midwest Pain Specialists at +1 605-444-8600 or visit their website at www.sfsh.com/midwest-imaging. Their facility is conveniently located at 716 E 19th St, Sioux Falls, SD 57105.

HRMC Pain Management in Huron, South Dakota offers specialized interventional pain management services under the expert guidance of Jason Barnhard, CRNA, and HRMC's dedicated team of Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetists. Established as a vital component of Huron Regional Medical Center's comprehensive healthcare services, this specialized clinic focuses on providing relief to patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions through minimally invasive techniques. The clinic's patient-centered approach emphasizes improving quality of life by reducing pain and enhancing mobility when traditional non-surgical interventions have proven ineffective.

At HRMC Pain Management, patients benefit from advanced interventional techniques administered on an outpatient basis. These procedures are specifically designed to target pain at its source, offering relief where other conservative treatments have failed. The clinic's CRNAs utilize their specialized training to perform precise injections and minimally invasive procedures that can significantly reduce pain levels while minimizing recovery time.

Expert Care Team

Led by Jason Barnhard, CRNA, the pain management team consists of highly trained Certified Registered Nurse Anesthetists who specialize in pain intervention techniques. Their combined expertise allows them to develop customized treatment plans addressing various pain conditions, including back pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical discomfort. The team works collaboratively with patients to understand their specific pain challenges and create effective management strategies.

Patient Outcomes and Benefits

Many patients who undergo treatment at HRMC Pain Management experience significant improvements in their daily functioning. Beyond pain reduction, patients often report increased mobility and the ability to return to activities they previously enjoyed but had abandoned due to pain limitations. This comprehensive approach to pain management focuses not just on symptom relief but on overall quality of life enhancement.

Location and Contact Information

HRMC Pain Management is conveniently located at 172 4th St SE, Huron, SD 57350. Patients seeking consultation or treatment can contact the clinic directly at (605) 353-6334. Additional information about services offered can be found on the official website at https://www.huronregional.org/services/pain-management.

column2: K. C. Chang, MD | Physiatrist (Acupuncture/Non-Opioid Pain Management)
column3:
K. C. Chang, MD serves Brookings, South Dakota as a distinguished physiatrist specializing in non-opioid pain management and acupuncture. Dr. Chang brings extensive expertise in physical medicine and rehabilitation (PM&R) to the Brookings community, offering comprehensive non-surgical treatments for patients suffering from neuro-musculoskeletal problems and disabling conditions. His patient-centered approach combines traditional medical practices with alternative therapies to provide effective pain relief without reliance on opioid medications.

As a board-certified PM&R specialist, Dr. Chang offers a diverse range of treatment options including:

  • Acupuncture therapy

  • Epidural injections

  • Trigger point injections

  • Customized physical therapy programs

  • Medication management

Electrodiagnostic Medicine Expertise

Dr. Chang subspecializes in electrodiagnostic medicine, a sophisticated diagnostic approach that measures electrical activity within the body to identify and assess various conditions. This specialized technique allows for precise diagnosis of nerve and muscle disorders, enabling more targeted and effective treatment plans for his patients.

Recognition and Credentials

Recognized for his exceptional care, Dr. Chang has been named one of America's Top Physicians in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation by the Consumer's Research Council of America. This prestigious recognition reflects his commitment to excellence and patient care in his field.

Contact Information

Location: 407 22nd Ave, Brookings, SD 57006, United States

Phone: +1 605-692-7666

Website: Orthopedic Institute - Dr. K.C. Chang
column11:
Dr. Chang is a board certified physical medicine and rehabilitation (PM&R) specialist and has been treating patients non-surgically for pain management of their neuro-musculoskeletal problems and disabling conditions, using treatments such as acupuncture, epidural, trigger point injections, physical therapy, and medications. He also subspecializes in electrodiagnostic medicine. Electrodiagnostic medicine is a method of medical diagnosis that obtains information about diseases by recording the electrical activity of body parts or by measuring the responses to external electrical stimuli.

He is named one of America's Top Physicians in the specialty of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation by Consumer's Research Council of America.

column2: Midwest Pain & Rehabilitation: Cho Myung J MD
column3:
Midwest Pain & Rehabilitation in Sioux Falls, South Dakota offers comprehensive pain management and rehabilitation services under the expert guidance of Dr. Myung J. Cho, MD. Our specialized clinic combines evidence-based medical treatments with personalized rehabilitation programs to address chronic pain conditions, sports injuries, and post-surgical recovery needs. Serving patients throughout eastern South Dakota and neighboring states, we've established ourselves as a trusted resource for those seeking effective pain relief and improved quality of life.

At Midwest Pain & Rehabilitation, Dr. Cho employs a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, utilizing advanced diagnostic techniques to identify the root causes of discomfort. Our treatment protocols may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, therapeutic injections, and innovative interventional techniques tailored to each patient's specific condition.

Comprehensive Rehabilitation Programs

Our rehabilitation services complement our pain management treatments, focusing on restoring function and mobility while preventing future injuries. Physical therapy, occupational therapy, and specialized exercise programs are customized to address individual patient needs, whether recovering from surgery, managing chronic conditions, or rehabilitating from sports-related injuries.

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Diedrich has been my pain management doctor for years and I trust him completely! He has helped me live a normal life even though I deal with chronic pain daily! I highly recommend him and Black Hills Orthopedic.|Dr. Dietrich is professional and personable. The information he provides is understandable and complete. Absolutely wonderful experience and has my highest rating.|Dr Chris Dietrich is Amazing. He has been helping me for over 7 years. He's an A++|Very professional, kind compassionate care and concern.  Dr Dietrich's approach to my care was exceptional!!|I asked for an earlier appointment than what I scheduled. To my delight I was offered same day appointment. Everyone treated me great. Dr.Gust reviewed my test and prior treatments. Advise an urgent surgery, Staff help me get ready for pending surgery. I am ready to get relief from my constant lower back and leg pain.|Dr Deitrick was ver profesional and caring and concerned and i was very comfortable at the facility . thanks|Very good experience with Dr. Gust. Straight conversation was had no typical Dr. speak. I felt we were very honest with each other and shared a mutual understanding of what my needs are and the best way to achieve them. The staff was equally as helpful and understanding. Very good experience overall and I look forward to working with the team as we go.|I will apologize to start off with, this will have to be quite lengthy to let you have a clear picture of my experience. I am a 59-year-old widowed disabled lady who has to have her oxygen everywhere she goes and that has become a shut-in since 2020. I am trying to address many medical issues that I have. This entails many appointments, many tests and many different doctors at many different locations. Some would say I am easily confused at this point! On Friday, April 19th I had an appointment at 9:00 a.m. for a consultation for carpel tunnel surgery at the Spine Center (4141 5th St.). I had already been to that location for a nerve test on my arms and it was a delightful visit (well, as delightful as a nerve test appointment can be). Everyone involved with that appointment was kind, friendly, efficient and thorough.
I am at the mercy of others for rides, and others refers to my one neighbor and my son. So for this appointment my neighbor dropped me off on her way to Hill City for work. I arrived safely and go inside and wait in line for just a couple minutes and I get up to the receptionists, there's three of them, and I say my name and my appointment time and I am told that I am at the wrong location! I wasn't even aware there was a second location (I had been given the address of the other location 7220 Mt. Rushmore Rd. but obviously that went in one ear and out the other) and was immediately distraught because I had no other way to get to the other location by my appointment time. So all three receptionist are speaking to me about the mix-up and I said "Well I'm going to have to call and reschedule because I'm not going to have enough oxygen to wait and go there" and so on. I didn't get the names of all three  of them but the one name I did get was Donna. I had lost most of my faith in humanity with the way the world has become but Donna restored some of that! She went above and beyond and then some to make sure I got to my appointment on time, she is definitely an angel among Us ( and I am not quite sure that she knows that, but I did tell her)!

column2: Vascular and Interventional Specialists Dakota Dunes Clinic
column3:
Vascular and Interventional Specialists Dakota Dunes Clinic serves patients throughout Dakota Dunes, SD and surrounding communities with comprehensive vascular care. Our specialized team provides advanced diagnostic and treatment options for patients suffering from a wide range of vascular conditions. Using minimally invasive techniques, our board-certified specialists deliver personalized care plans designed to improve circulation, reduce pain, and enhance quality of life for patients with vascular and venous disorders.

At Vascular & Interventional Specialists, we offer complete screening, diagnosis, and treatment for numerous vascular and venous conditions, including:

Arterial Conditions

  • Peripheral Artery Disease (PAD) causing leg pain and artery blockage

  • Aortic, Thoracic, and Popliteal Artery Aneurysms

  • Aortic Dissection

  • Renal Artery Stenosis and other arterial stenosis conditions

  • Non-Healing Wounds related to vascular insufficiency

Venous Disorders

  • Varicose Veins and Spider Veins

  • Venous Insufficiency

  • Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT)

  • Chronic Leg Swelling

  • Venous Ulcers

  • Pelvic Congestion Syndrome

  • Varicocele

Interventional Procedures

  • AV Fistula creation and maintenance

  • Embolization procedures

  • Treatment for Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia

  • Uterine Fibroid interventions

  • Knee Osteoarthritis treatments

  • Hemorrhoid procedures

  • Spine Compression Fracture repair

  • Tumor biopsy, embolization, and ablation

  • Port Placement for medical treatments

  • Dialysis Access management

  • Portal Hypertension and Ascites treatments

Patient-Centered Approach

Our clinic combines cutting-edge interventional radiology techniques with compassionate care to address both common and complex vascular conditions. We believe in educating our patients about their vascular health and involving them in treatment decisions. Many of our procedures are performed on an outpatient basis, allowing patients to return home the same day with minimal recovery time.

Contact Information

Phone: +1 605-217-5617

Website: https://vascularcare.com/

Schedule your consultation today to discover how our specialized vascular care can help improve your vascular health and overall quality of life.

column38: Jessica I|Alan Gage|Christopher South|Randy Liston|LOVE ALL|Jill Cordell|K "LoveBirds"|Debbie K
column40:
Dr. Boetel Is quite possibly the worst provider I have seen at Sanford. I went in to see him for a bulging disk which was a previous work injury. He kept making comments on my weight and that I couldn't have surgery. Yes, I know I'm fat but surgery would be the last option I would choose for me.

When I returned for my epidural, I was lying on the table knowing a needle was going to go in my spine having to listen to him making sexist comments about women and maternity leave. Boetel's RN was due soon and her husband was getting paternity leave. He thought that was the most ridiculous thing. The women in the room got quiet. I did tell him the US is leaps and bounds behind other countries in this department- that Sweden parents get a year. Then he finally stopped. After receiving this epidural, it flared sciatica up on both sides worse than anything before - one thing I will not blame him for because this stuff happens and I do not think/hope it was not on purpose. I was in so much pain I couldn't walk more than 3 minutes at a time because of the burning, searing pain down both of my legs.

But WORST of all is the NEGLECT I received after that epidural. I called Sanford and they said he was on vacation until the next week and they didn't have a covering provider. He went one vacation and NO ONE covered him and I couldn't see anyone else "because dr boetel did not sign off on it." I sat in the worst pain of my life. I could only get up to use the bathroom. All I could do was cry, my husband made me go to the ER. I'm an RN in my 30s I don't go to the ER. That's when I decided I would move to Avera.

During the time where I could not move without being in pain and having been neglected, it made me think about all of his patients that live with chronic pain and wondering if he treated them like me. I should have said something sooner to advocate for these people. I am saying it now because one of my friends asked me who she should see because she didn't want to see the same arrogant provider I saw. She got set up with him...thankfully intercepted that.

So if you want sexist, fat-phobic, neglectful man who thinks too highly of himself he is your choice.

If you want better, go to avera spine! Dr Faryna and Tim his CNP were AMAZING!|I was very happy with in my dealings with Dr. Boetel. I had a back issue and he began a sensible diagnostic approach (physical therapy, MRI, Cortisone, wait a little longer, and finally fusion surgery). It would have been great shorten the diagnostic process but in my case I feel he took the right approach.|The following opinions are my own and not the views of my employer.
I allowed myself a second visit to Dr. Tom Boetel before writing a review since I developed a poor view of the Physician and thought he was just having an off day. However, after coming back for a second appointment, I now know his true character and approach to medicine, and I would like the opportunity to share my experience and opinion of my interaction.
I want to start by saying that the mixed to poor reviews of the physicians on Google and Healthgrades do not reflect Sanford as an organization that provides some of the best services in the region. Nor do the nursing or X-ray staff, who are incredible and some of the best at what they do. They were the highlights of my interactions with Dr. Boetel and shouldn't be penalized as a reflection of the Physician's performance.
I am sure that Dr. Boetel is quite knowledgeable in his specialty and probably pretty good at what he does. However, one of the critical components of medicine is caring, which he is undoubtedly missing. Theodore Roosevelt said, " Nobody cares how much you know until they know how much you care." I think that Dr. Boetel would be served well to learn this quote and relate it to the patients he sees.
Dr. Boetel's bedside manner with me was poor. He was dismissive of my complaints, failed to listen to me, and dismissed my ongoing pain. I came into the office seeking relief from my pain and answers on how this could be improved, but instead, I was left feeling dismissed, unworthy of care, confused, and angry.
I thought the care was poorly handled and that he was pretty rude. I hope that my review is helpful when choosing a provider for your spine issues.|Don't bother, Dr. Tom Botel, has no time for your issues and has very limited knowledge of Spine rehabilitation, associated pain or potential spine related medical problems. Further more he has interest in taking time with you or running further testing, to eliminate  potential conditions. He is basically  a pump you out collect his money, Doctor.  It's an Extreme waste of time to even visit with him. It's really sad so many Doctors are now this way. You'll  spend more time checking in, filling out unnecessary paperwork,  that he doesn't read anyhow, than actual time , visiting with him. Suggest you look elsewhere for someone to even try to help you with your Spine issues as of 02/12/2024|Starting with the courteous receptionist when first walking in that day, each staff member Nurse's, x-ray technician, doctor's assistant, and others) presented themselves in a positive, professional manner. I also appreciated the cleanliness of the waiting room and examination rooms. You all did a thorough job, and although I felt lousy at the time, it was apparent you all worked well together. A special thanks to the doctor for taking extra time to methodically and accurately diagnose the problems and what he was doing step by step. The Nursing Staff and Support was amazing I cannot express enough the compassion and Care . Take Care all of you. Top Notch Staff

God Bless each and everyone of you!|I have fibromyalgia. But I have always had spine issues. He didn't bother considering that it may actually be my a spine issue that's causing my pain. He stuck dry needles in my neck muscles, even when i told him it really hurt. I had a huge bump on my neck were he had stuck a dry needle. This made my pain much worse. I feel like he really just does not care! I also had an MRI before seeing him. It showed a herniated disk. I don't feel like he read my chart.|Not a very good Dr. didnt care about how much pain I am in. Told me to consider a different job if I cant handle my job I have due to pain & didnt even touch my back to figure out where the pain was coming from or see how i did with pain. Only saw the xrays & went by those. Wouldnt recommend him at all. You cant tell patients to deal with pain like they have for years. Just because I have had pain for 8 years doesnt mean I should have to deal with it for life.|Pleasant, very thorough, he listens to me and takes the time to answer my questions. Highly recommend him.

CNOS Dakota Dunes Clinic serves Dakota Dunes, South Dakota with comprehensive orthopedic and neurosurgical care. Located at 575 Sioux Point Rd, this premier medical facility is part of the larger CNOS healthcare network dedicated to treating conditions affecting the musculoskeletal and neurological systems. The clinic combines advanced medical technology with a patient-centered approach to deliver exceptional care for residents throughout the Siouxland region.

CNOS provides specialized medical treatments and preventative services focused on bones, joints, muscles, nerves, and brain health. Their multidisciplinary team includes board-certified orthopedic surgeons, neurosurgeons, physical therapists, and pain management specialists who work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans. From sports injuries and arthritis to complex neurological conditions, the clinic offers both surgical and non-surgical interventions tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Diagnostic and Treatment Capabilities

The Dakota Dunes facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic equipment for accurate assessment of musculoskeletal and neurological conditions. Patients benefit from on-site imaging services, diagnostic screenings, and advanced testing capabilities that allow for prompt diagnosis and treatment planning. The clinic's physical therapy department provides comprehensive rehabilitation services to help patients regain function and mobility following injury or surgery.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes CNOS is their commitment to personalized care. The expert team takes time to understand each patient's condition, concerns, and goals before developing treatment strategies. This patient-centered philosophy ensures that individuals receive appropriate care that aligns with their lifestyle needs and health objectives. The clinic emphasizes education and preventative measures alongside interventional treatments to promote long-term musculoskeletal and neurological health.

For appointments or more information, contact CNOS Dakota Dunes Clinic at +1 605-217-2667 or visit their website at www.cnos.net. Their convenient location at 575 Sioux Point Rd, Dakota Dunes, SD 57049 serves patients throughout the tri-state area with accessible, specialized care.

Sioux Spine and Sport PLLC serves Sioux Falls, SD and surrounding communities with exceptional chiropractic and acupuncture services. With two decades of experience, our team combines traditional chiropractic techniques with modern approaches to address a wide range of musculoskeletal conditions and promote overall wellness.

At Sioux Spine and Sport, we offer specialized treatments including spinal adjustments, acupuncture therapy, sports injury rehabilitation, and preventative care programs. Our patient-focused approach means we develop personalized treatment plans that address your specific needs and health goals. Whether you're suffering from chronic back pain, recovering from an athletic injury, or seeking to improve your overall physical function, our experienced practitioners provide attentive care in a comfortable, welcoming environment.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

We maintain flexible scheduling options to accommodate busy lifestyles and ensure patients can receive care when they need it most. Our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology to deliver the highest standard of chiropractic and acupuncture services.

Our Commitment to Excellence

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, visit our website at siouxspineandsport.com or call us directly at (605) 362-1230. Experience the difference that patient-driven, evidence-based chiropractic and acupuncture care can make in your life.

column2: Avera Medical Group Palliative Care -- Yankton
column3:
Avera Medical Group Palliative Care in Yankton, South Dakota provides specialized healthcare services focused on improving quality of life for patients facing serious illnesses. Our compassionate team works within the broader Avera Health network to deliver comprehensive palliative care that addresses physical symptoms while providing emotional and spiritual support to both patients and their families. Located in the heart of Yankton, our facility serves the community with evidence-based approaches to pain management, symptom control, and supportive care.

At Avera Medical Group Palliative Care, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to managing complex and chronic conditions. Our team specializes in alleviating suffering through expert symptom management, coordinated care planning, and personalized treatment strategies. We work closely with primary care physicians and specialists to ensure seamless integration of palliative services into each patient's overall healthcare plan.

Our Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the disease. Our providers take time to understand each patient's unique needs, values, and goals to develop individualized care plans. Through thoughtful conversations and shared decision-making, we help patients and families navigate difficult healthcare choices while maintaining dignity and respect throughout the care journey.

Location and Contact Information

Our palliative care services are conveniently located at 409 Summit St, Suite 3400, Yankton, SD 57078. To schedule a consultation or learn more about how our palliative care team can support you or your loved one, please call us at (605) 655-1220. Additional information about our services can be found on our website at avera.org.

Part of the Trusted Avera Health Network

As part of the Avera Health system, our palliative care team upholds the organization's commitment to compassionate, high-quality healthcare guided by Christian values. We collaborate with other Avera specialists and facilities to ensure patients receive coordinated care that addresses their complete health needs during challenging times.

Comprehensive Treatment Options

column40:
Dr. Mark is the best. He has the best intentions in helping ease, if not get rid of my back and nerve pain. I drive a long distance just to see them and I'm happy to do it. I honestly love going the this office, from the front office staff, to the nurse and then the doctor, they are all very pleasant, smiling people, nice and professional. I recommend this office to any who honestly wants help getting rid of their pain.|These doctors actually talk to you and know who you are when you come in.  love this place. They're awesome. The staff and everybody is super friendly. It will help you with anything that you need if you don't understand it.|Turned out to be a disappointing experience.
I was glad and even blessed that they got me in right away when I came back to the state;
However, it wasn't all good news. Understand this, my practitioner was the younger Andrew Keller. First thing he did was look at what I was on and say no you can't have this, this was after my Washington doctor and I have worked so hard to find what is workable for my spinal issues. I guess I should've taken mediate Relief and then jump shipped to another practitioner, but I didn't realize I was being set up to fail. I did tell the man it would not work with all of my heart, depression, and all the other little issues I got going on that are spurred on by the extreme levels of pain.
Seems to me that I was set up to fail because today when I went in for my regular appointment, he already had his mind made up. It didn't matter how much pain I was in even though it was worse than it's been since I've been in the state for the last six months.
I was simply told you received no medication. I can't help you because you use more than what I gave you.
Riddle me this Batman; "if you reduced my daily allowance beyond my daily need and then give me more than what my 28 day allowance is, Is it justice to expect me to not eat those other four while I am in terrible pain and not able to sleep, shower or dress.
Really ?!!  ( sadly, Set up to fail I believe).
All I can say, my friends is consumer beware, and be guarded as you go forward.
Didn't bring in his little computer to our meet either, so I told him I would like to remind him of how that first meeting went.  Was not interested in the least. Already had the mind made up as to how things would go.
Not compassionate care. But "C.Y.A as we do the minimal so as to keep cash flow happening".
My fault, should have known better, as soon as care from previous practitioner was disregarded and cut back.|Dr. Mark Jones and his staff are wonderful.  He is a very a intelligent man and always explains things in a way that I fully understand.  He pretty much saved me from a miserable life of pain  so that I can function.  I am so thankful for him.|We relocated from Kentucky to Tennessee at the beginning of the year and had been under pain management care for several years in Kentucky. This week, we had our first appointment with Dr. Mark. We are very selective when it comes to choosing a pain management specialist. After thorough research, we wanted to ensure we found a reputable clinic with quality doctors who do not give the impression of a "pill mill."

I would like to commend Dr. Mark and his staff for their exceptional service. They made us feel welcome, listened attentively to our concerns, took the time to explain our MRI results, and provided us with various treatment options. We highly recommend Dr. Mark and his team to anyone seeking comprehensive care for chronic issues.|Mrs Jones has wholeheartedly been a top notch doctor for me.. he listen explained and cared for all my concerns questions and if you have him for your doctor your blessed. Thank you forever and always Mark I truly appreciate you!|Dr Mark Jones was absolutely wonderful. He was very friendly, professional   and talked to you where you understood his treatment plans. I am very happy that my pcp recommended  this office. The staff  was also very nice. Looking forward to future visits as I feel I can be helped with my pain.|Dr. Mark has always been great with my shots. I just had back surgery, preformed by him. At Montgomery Pain Institute, we address a wide spectrum of pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our multidisciplinary approach combines cutting-edge treatments with compassionate care to help patients regain function and reduce dependence on pain medications. Our Patient-Centered Approach

We ease your pain burden through individualized attention and care. Our physicians and patient services staff understand that patient health and wellness begins today, not tomorrow. This philosophy drives our commitment to prompt appointments, thorough evaluations, and ongoing support throughout your treatment journey. We work closely with referring physicians to ensure coordinated care that addresses all aspects of your health.

State-of-the-Art Facilities
