column40:
Doesn't do buprenorphine for pain management. Even though I verified when I made the apt weeks ago.

ETA. Yes the day of the appointment the facility called 4 items in 2 hours while I was asleep. Presumably to tell me THE DAY OF they couldn't take my meds. When I answered the last call I was told it was an insurance question. So the person calling me relentlessly didn't even know what for. Your staff verified you took my medication the day Inmade the apt. Three weeks prior. Which was false information because you dont take it. Then your staff didn't know why they were calling me 4 times in 2 hours. Your staff is the issue. 1 of 5 star rating stands. I'd give less for only giving half the story in your reply.|I've been going here for several years, outlasting more than one FNP, and have been reasonably happy.  However, the most recent change, was a bridge too far.  The person they stuck me with, is a jerk!  My first visit with him, he ignored what came out of my mouth - in response to HIS questions.  I was shocked, as I've mostly been treated well there.  It was so bad, and uncomfortable, I chose not to return... EVER!

I  cannot understand how Tony got this job, he has zero people skills, and his conversation/language skills, have no place in a professional setting, yet alone a Dr.'s office.  I'm well aware he went to College, as he managed to become a Family Nurse Practitioner, but he spoke like a thug.  I am not exaggerating here, and was appalled.  It is a shame really, since I had few complaints before this, not zero complaints, but only a few.  My last visit, literally, my LAST visit... was a train wreck in Tony's hands.  It was so bad, I vowed then and there not to return, and I haven't, nor will I ever again.

My single star rating, is aimed squarely at Tony, the rest of the  STAFF was wonderful.  Not unlike other reviews here, the dealings with the Owner's husband, were hit and miss, and often pretty difficult to tolerate.  But I cannot say enough good things about the staff itself, and regret that they are unable to keep their FNP's happy enough for them to stay, since their turnover rate is pretty high.

This is an honest review of my own experience at this pain clinic, it has nothing to do with my medication, and up until two months ago, I had no intention of leaving, but a single visit with their newest FNP Tony, soured me on ever returning.  ONE VISIT!

ETA: The recently posted review, was written several years ago, when Tony DID work there.  I'm uncertain why this review was just recently publishe, and it certainly isn't in response to Michael and Debbie's recent legal issues.

However, I do indeed have the correct establishment and expect the DOJ to fully prosecute the Cox's for their deceptive business practices.|I have been coming to CPI for quite some time and I will continue to do so! They are awesome !! From the front desk and all the way back, everyone is very kind and considerate. Always smiling and friendly. I have never had to wait very long to be seen and they listen to me!! I have never had a bad experience with them and I would highly recommend them to anyone who has pain issues. I LOVE YOU GUYS, YOU'RE THE BEST!!!|This business is very professional.  We have access to the owners if there is ever a situation, which I think is a very good trait. . The office manager and staff handle the business part very professionally as well.  Out of the pain mgts I've attended, I rate this one five stars!  The office is very clean and comfortable for the patients.   Thank you so much Michael and Debbie Cox for providing an excellent service in Clarksville, TN and surrounding areas! They also make it easy to get your prescription filled by having a pharmacy right next door.  They thought about us, the patients.  

Thank you again. .  You all do a GREAT JOB!|My husband hates writing reviews, am writing his with my touch. In 2018, I chose to come to this place, heard they were strict yet also cared about the clients.
My first appointment I was assigned to Megan, to us in our book, a hero! Megan literally saved my life, a botched surgery, with a deadly rare blood infection, had no clue at the time in my spine it was growing worse,  I was dying. Megan wasn't happy, highly concerned it wasn't good, a few more hours of not rushing to the ER., I wouldn't be here,  my husband & I will always see her as my hero.
Ok:
The second reason, a place we could trust to treat my many complexed health pain problems, we needed someone knowledgeable, not once has it disappointed us throughout the years.

The front office, to the  back office & technicians who wear many hats, all special to my heart, each treat me with respect even though I can be annoying at times, there is not one mean person whom works here, makes it easier dealing on my worst painful days.

Dr.Brandon Tolman, he is the first doctor since I became chronically sick after 46 surgeries, gave us full attention of listening to our concerns, actually evaluated my X-rays and shared his extensive knowledge and options, really took his time to answer ALL my husbands questions not rushing us out the door, we really never had a doctor who explained my condition and options, really impressed he knew my case & upcoming surgeries.

I'm looking forward to my first epidural here for pain. We highly  recommend coming here, a straight forward doctor who is kind, knowledgeable, and treated us like human beings.

We thank each whom works here, can not say enough great words of work ethics!!! Empathetic, caring, you won't find anywhere else.
If you truly need help, this is the place! 10 stars in our book!!!|I was just dismissed from this clinic. So why 5 stars? It wasn't their fault. I think this has to be the best clinic. Very clean, everyone I encountered was so super nice to me. I have seen both nurses, they are both so nice it would be hard to say one I like the best. Very professional as well. Truly an honor to have been seen there. Oh, and i thought the waiting room chairs were comfortable! lol.|After a very harrowing experience with another local pain clinic, I diligently searched for another. After reading the great reviews for the Pain Institute of Clarksville, I chose to go to them. It was a decision that I will never regret. The atmosphere is very comforting and pleasant. All employees are kind and caring. They get to know you and are knowledgeable about your case. There are strict guidelines, as there should be. I, myself, appreciate it. Times are very hard for true chronic pain patients. I highly recommend coming here if you are. A special thank you for Ashley.|I've been a patient here for several years. I've never encountered or had a bad experience here. The staff are helpful, remember and greet current patients by name, something you don't see very often these days. Most healthcare clinics don't bother to try and remember patients. We are simply numbers to most of them. The rules of this clinic are strictly enforced and made clear to every patient. As a patient, the staff and my provider listen to my issues and I feel respected. Respect is something that chronic pain patients rarely encounter. The provider I have now is hands down the best I've ever had. She addresses needs as they arise, and makes sure that I have access to all non-narcotic and alternative therapies offered at the clinic. This clinic provides many alternative therapies, from trigger point injections to a new, and very effective, neuragenex therapy. A pain clinic is the last place I ever thought I would end up in, but when general providers refuse to listen to or even attempt to address chronic pain, there aren't many other options. Years later, I could not have come to a better place. I would recommend this clinic to anyone without reservation.

column3:
Tennessee Valley Pain Consultants - Huntsville Hospital Pain Center serves Huntsville, Alabama and the surrounding Tennessee Valley region with comprehensive pain management solutions. Established as a premier pain treatment facility, this specialized medical practice brings together a team of board-certified physicians dedicated to addressing chronic and acute pain conditions through multidisciplinary approaches. Their integration with Huntsville Hospital ensures patients receive seamless care within one of North Alabama's most trusted healthcare systems.

As one of the most experienced pain specialist teams in the region, Tennessee Valley Pain Consultants offers a complete spectrum of pain management solutions. Their approach combines state-of-the-art diagnostic procedures with innovative therapeutic interventions designed to identify and treat the root causes of pain. The practice specializes in conditions including but not limited to back and neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and cancer-related pain.

Advanced Treatment Options

Patients benefit from access to cutting-edge treatments including interventional procedures, medication management protocols, physical rehabilitation programs, and psychological counseling. The center's comprehensive approach addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain, providing patients with effective coping strategies and improved quality of life. Their interventional procedures include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and other minimally invasive techniques.

Expert Physician Team

The practice's physicians bring decades of combined experience in pain medicine, anesthesiology, and physical medicine. Each doctor maintains the highest credentials in their specialty areas, regularly participating in continuing education to stay at the forefront of pain management advancements. This commitment to excellence ensures patients receive the most current and effective treatments available.

Patient Information

Location: 201 Governors Dr SW, Suites 300 & 400, Huntsville, AL 35801, United States

Phone: +1 256-265-7246

Website: https://tnvalleypain.com/

The center's convenient location within the Huntsville Hospital medical complex provides patients with easy access to additional healthcare services when needed. New patients are welcome, with referrals available through primary care physicians or specialists throughout the Tennessee Valley region.

column3:
Howell Allen Clinic serves Lebanon, Tennessee and the greater Nashville area with exceptional pain management services. Led by Dr. Forrest P. Allen, DO, the practice delivers cutting-edge interventional procedures and comprehensive pain solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Located conveniently in Lebanon, the clinic has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider committed to improving patients' quality of life through effective pain management strategies.

Dr. Allen brings impressive credentials to his practice as a double board-certified physician with dual fellowship training in Interventional Pain Management and Sports Medicine. His extensive expertise allows him to address a wide spectrum of pain conditions with precision and care. Throughout his distinguished career, Dr. Allen has contributed significantly to the field through participation in numerous clinical research studies and has presented his findings at major medical societies across the nation.

Pioneering Pain Management Techniques

As one of the first physicians in the Nashville area to perform numerous cutting-edge interventional procedures, Dr. Allen remains at the forefront of pain management innovation. He has successfully completed over 15,000 interventional procedures to date, demonstrating both his technical proficiency and vast experience. His commitment to staying current with the latest advances in pain treatment ensures patients receive the most effective and up-to-date care available.

Comprehensive, Patient-Centered Approach

At Howell Allen Clinic, Dr. Allen focuses on providing minimally invasive options to treat pain, prioritizing techniques that maximize relief while minimizing recovery time. His patient-centered approach emphasizes thorough evaluation and personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain rather than just the symptoms.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Forrest P. Allen, patients can call +1 615-327-9543 or visit the clinic at 100 Physician's Way, Suite 110, Lebanon, TN 37090. Additional information about Dr. Allen's practice and services is available on the clinic's website at https://www.howellallen.com/physicians/allen/.

He has performed well over 15,000 interventional procedures to date, and is dedicated to providing his patients with the best minimally invasive options to treat their pain.

Nashville Pain Center serves patients throughout Murfreesboro, Tennessee and the greater Nashville metropolitan area with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified specialists combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to address chronic pain conditions. Located conveniently at 625 N Highland Ave #2a in Murfreesboro, we've established ourselves as a trusted resource for those seeking relief from debilitating pain that impacts daily functioning and quality of life.

At Nashville Pain Center, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that includes interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health support. Our specialists are experienced in treating various conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. We emphasize minimally invasive techniques whenever possible to provide effective relief while minimizing recovery time.

Patient-Centered Approach

Understanding that each patient's pain experience is unique, we develop individualized treatment plans tailored to specific needs and goals. Our compassionate staff takes the time to listen to patients' concerns and thoroughly evaluate their conditions before recommending appropriate interventions. This patient-centered philosophy has helped countless individuals regain functionality and improve their quality of life.

Convenient Access to Care

Our Murfreesboro location provides a comfortable, modern environment designed with patient comfort in mind. We accept most major insurance plans and work diligently to coordinate care with primary physicians and other specialists. New patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 615-661-7888 or visiting our website at www.nashvillepaincenters.com for more information about our services and approach to pain management.

If you're struggling with chronic pain that hasn't responded to conventional treatments, contact Nashville Pain Center today to discover how our comprehensive approach might help you find the relief you deserve.

column3:
Southern Tennessee Spine and Pain Center in Winchester, TN serves patients throughout southern Tennessee with comprehensive interventional pain management solutions. Led by Dr. William Newton, DO, our practice specializes in minimally invasive procedures designed to treat both acute and chronic pain conditions. With a patient-centered approach, we focus on improving quality of life while minimizing reliance on opioid medications through advanced interventional techniques.

At Southern Tennessee Spine and Pain Center, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures tailored to address various pain conditions. Our treatments include epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and targeted nerve blocks. Dr. Newton's expertise in fluoroscopic-guided procedures ensures precise treatment delivery for optimal pain relief with minimal recovery time.

Conditions We Treat

Our practice specializes in treating numerous pain conditions including:

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Sciatica and radicular pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

  • Headaches and facial pain

Our Approach to Pain Management

Dr. Newton believes in a comprehensive approach to pain management that addresses the underlying causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Each treatment plan is individually customized following thorough evaluation and diagnostic testing. We combine interventional procedures with physical therapy recommendations and lifestyle modifications to achieve lasting pain relief and improved function.

About Dr. William Newton

Dr. William Newton is a board-certified interventional pain management specialist with extensive training in osteopathic medicine. His approach integrates traditional medical knowledge with osteopathic principles, allowing him to address both the structural and functional aspects of pain. Dr. Newton stays at the forefront of pain management techniques through ongoing education and implementation of evidence-based practices.

Contact Information

Address: 2230 Cowan Hwy, Winchester, TN 37398, United States

Phone: +1 931-962-8012

Website: www.southerntennesseespineandpaincenter.com

Southern Tennessee Spine and Pain Center welcomes new patients and accepts most major insurance plans. Contact our office today to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management.
column11: Comprehensive Interventional Spine and Pain Management practice focusing on minimally invasive procedures to treat acute and chronic pain conditions.

Southeast Spine And Pain Associates serves Knoxville, Tennessee and surrounding areas with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified specialists combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives. Since our establishment, we have been committed to addressing both acute and chronic pain conditions through personalized treatment plans tailored to each individual's unique needs.

At Southeast Spine And Pain Associates, we understand that pain can significantly impact your quality of life. Our multidisciplinary approach addresses various conditions including back and neck pain, joint disorders, sports injuries, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical discomfort. We utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and evidence-based treatments to provide effective relief while focusing on long-term wellness and functionality.

Specialized Treatment Options

Our practice offers a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options, including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Facet joint injections

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Medication management

  • Physical therapy coordination

  • Minimally invasive procedures

Patient-Centered Approach

Whether you've recently sustained an injury, are managing a chronic condition, or need relief from persistent pain, our team is dedicated to developing a customized treatment plan that addresses your specific concerns. We take the time to listen, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and explain all available options to ensure you're an informed participant in your care journey.

Visit Our Knoxville Location

Our conveniently located office provides a comfortable environment where patients receive exceptional care. We accept most major insurance plans and work diligently to accommodate new patients promptly.

Address: 4713 Papermill Dr NW #301, Knoxville, TN 37909, United States

Phone: +1 865-633-9469

Contact Southeast Spine And Pain Associates today to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management and improved quality of life.

column2: Pain Consultants of East Tennessee - Oak Ridge
column3:
Pain Consultants of East Tennessee - Oak Ridge serves the Oak Ridge, TN area as part of the greater Knoxville region's premier pain management practice. Established in 1998, this distinguished clinic specializes in a multi-disciplinary approach to treating chronic and acute pain conditions. Their comprehensive methodology combines medical expertise with therapeutic interventions to address the complex nature of pain management, offering patients personalized treatment plans designed for long-term relief and improved quality of life.

What truly sets Pain Consultants of East Tennessee apart is their collaborative team of specialists. The practice brings together board-certified, fellowship-trained physicians who work in conjunction with behavioral medicine experts, advanced-practice nurses, and highly trained physical and occupational therapists. This integrated approach ensures that patients receive care that addresses not just the physical symptoms of pain, but also the psychological and functional aspects that impact daily living.

Patient-Centered Care Philosophy

At Pain Consultants of East Tennessee, patients are treated as individuals, not just medical cases. The providers dedicate time to thoroughly discuss all available treatment options, answer questions, and develop customized pain management strategies. This patient-centered approach has established the practice as a trusted resource for those suffering from chronic pain conditions throughout East Tennessee.

Research and Innovation

The practice also maintains a commitment to clinical science and research, ensuring their treatment protocols reflect the latest advancements in pain medicine. This dedication to innovation allows them to offer cutting-edge therapies alongside proven traditional approaches.

Contact Information

Location: 575 Oak Ridge Turnpike #110, Oak Ridge, TN 37830, United States

Phone: +1 865-579-0552

Tennessee Valley Pain Management serves Hixson, TN and the greater Chattanooga area with comprehensive pain management solutions. Established as a premier pain clinic in the region, our board-certified specialists provide personalized treatment plans designed to address chronic and acute pain conditions. We combine advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain mobility and improve their quality of life.

At Tennessee Valley Pain Management, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our multidisciplinary approach incorporates medication management, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health strategies to address pain at its source.

Conditions We Treat

Our experienced team specializes in treating various pain conditions, including but not limited to back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, and cancer-related pain. We understand that each patient's experience with pain is unique, which is why we develop individualized treatment plans focused on long-term relief and improved functionality.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 1012 Executive Dr, Hixson, TN 37343, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. The clinic is designed with patient comfort in mind, offering a welcoming environment where individuals can discuss their pain concerns openly with our compassionate medical professionals.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in building strong doctor-patient relationships based on trust, respect, and open communication. Our team takes the time to listen to patients' concerns, thoroughly evaluate their conditions, and explain treatment options in clear, understandable terms. This collaborative approach ensures that patients are active participants in their pain management journey.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at +1 423-486-1444. Our friendly staff is ready to assist you with appointment scheduling, insurance questions, and any other inquiries you may have about pain management options.

Tennessee Valley Pain Management is committed to helping patients find relief from chronic pain and return to the activities they enjoy. We accept most major insurance plans and strive to make quality pain care accessible to all residents of the Tennessee Valley region.
column38: Daniel Roberts|Stacie Meeks|Dorothy Ullrich|Vonda Burgess|Jason H|jordon Paciorek|Traci Sasser|Kiesha Smartt
column40:
Wonderful doctors and great staff.

Doctor Dreskin Is really nice and remembers everything about his patience. They're willing to help and listen to any concerns whether this is new to you like it is for me or for people who have been dealing with this for a long time.

Dr. Bajwa Is very kind and also very knowledgeable. Truly feels like they care and want what's best for you.

The 2 lady's at the front are very kind and helpful. Danielle and the rest of the staff are all wonderful, kind, and helpful as well. I highly recommend this practice.|Carley is so very compassionate. She takes time with you to listen to your concerns and tries to accommodate all reasonable requests. She is professional with a very loving bedside manner. We love Carley.|Was there today after a long absence due to medical issues.  Carly is my contact and she is a very good counselor and sweet person.

I read a comment about a unhappy customer online.  My experience has been nothing but excellent for four years off and on that I have been going.  No place better in my years of 84 years of doctors.|I really like Dr. Dreskin but the medical assistants and other staff members do not care about the patients. I needed a pre-authorization for a prescription. The first time, it was filled out incorrectly. I called and specifically told them what the insurance company needed. Second time, it isn't completely filled out again. Now either they aren't very smart or just don't care!!!! Either way, it's ridiculous that a place dealing with chronic pain patients can't make sure they can get their meds. Just a warning!
I will be finding another pain managment facility to help me. The receptionists aren't friendly at all and the guy who counts your meds, if he grunts at you, you're lucky. Not a welcoming place at all. If Dr. Dreskin had a new staff, I'd stay with him.|Stay away from TN Valley Pain Management - go see a real doctor! My father had an epidural in his lumbar spine here and they wanted to do twilight anesthesia and ask he not drive to or from the procedure. Well, I have had three of the same procedures and know that is not required. The proper procedure is a local anesthetic and can be done in an office setting. This place is a scam and only enables patients, but not to get better.|This place is great the receptionist are very nice. Carley Mccloskey is an awesome practitioner I can't say enough good things about all the staff highly recommend.|I had my referral sent to Amanda. I tried calling 3 times. Then she called asking for another person. I said no, but I was looking to talk to her. She gave me baloney that I was the next person on her list to call. Yeah, okay. She then said she didn't get the referral. I called my old pain clinic again, and waited on the phone until they got the fax confirmation back, which they did. I asked about the first referral, and the clerk confirmed that, yes, they had the first confirmation, as well. I called Amanda back. Waited two more days for her to say she didn't have it. Oh, but she checked everywhere for it. Uh-huh. This place is unprofessional, and Amanda is incompetent! If you're looking for a pain clinic, I'd suggest you try another one. Obviously, these people are so busy, and lose your referrals to boot, they don't want new business. I'm granting their wish and will find another place that actually  will do their job!|My sister was referred to this clinic by our PCP to see Dr. Dreskin. She has chronic pain, that includes but not limited to: Rheumatoid Arthritis, Osteoarthritis, Blounts disease (bone disease), Diabetic Neuropathy, CKD and is on dialysis. The doctor walked in and immediately explained that they don't prescribe opioids (we didn't ask for opioids). He exclaimed "if I broke every bone in my body, I wouldn't touch opioids." He didn't offer any other options and said if she was already taking hydrocodone, then the clinic policy was not to prescribe and that he'd have to refer her to another clinic in Cleveland TN. They didn't even TRY to talk alternative options. In and out in less than 3 minutes. The little blonde haired nurse was no better. I'm flummoxed.

We also heard from other patients that this same clinic prescribed hydrocodone and oxycodone so why they'd lie to us is beyond me. I'm assuming he looked at a trio of black women and assumed she was looking for pills like a junkie. WRONG. My sister hates taking pills but she's in pain all day everyday, her pain threshold never goes below a 4. Pain Management is not just about opioids and that he didn't even discuss alternatives is very disappointing. Do NOT come to this clinic. This doctor Dreskin is offering treatment based off his personal opinions without consideration for individual patients. I wouldn't send my worst enemy to this clinic.

column2: Southern Tennessee Spine and Pain Center
column3:
Southern Tennessee Spine and Pain Center serves Winchester, Tennessee with state-of-the-art pain management services under the expert guidance of William Newton, DO, MS, and his dedicated team. The practice stands as a beacon of hope for those suffering from both acute and chronic pain conditions, offering comprehensive evaluations and personalized management plans. Their approach combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care, ensuring that each patient receives treatment tailored to their specific needs and circumstances.

At Southern Tennessee Spine and Pain Center, patients find relief from a wide range of painful conditions including back pain, neck pain, shoulder pain, and knee and hip pain. The practice distinguishes itself through its commitment to minimally invasive spine procedures and surgical interventions designed to effectively manage pain while reducing patients' reliance on pain medications. This balanced approach addresses immediate discomfort while working toward long-term pain management solutions.

Advanced Treatment Options

The center offers innovative treatments including Botox therapy for headaches and other painful conditions. Dr. Newton and his team utilize the full spectrum of advanced procedures available in modern pain management, ensuring patients have access to the most effective and appropriate interventions for their specific conditions. Their comprehensive approach considers both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain, addressing the whole person rather than just the symptoms.

Patient-Centered Care

What sets Southern Tennessee Spine and Pain Center apart is their unwavering commitment to patient-centered care. The team takes time to understand each patient's unique pain experience, developing customized treatment plans that align with individual goals and lifestyles. Located at 2230 Cowan Hwy in Winchester, the center provides a welcoming environment where patients feel heard, respected, and actively involved in their pain management journey.

For more information or to schedule an appointment, patients can call +1 931-345-4277 or visit their website at www.southerntennesseespineandpaincenter.com.
column11: About The PracticeSouthern Tennessee Spine and Pain Center is a state-of-the-art pain management practice in Winchester, Tennessee. William Newton, DO, MS, and the team utilize a full spectrum of advanced procedures to help patients get relief from discomfort.Southern Tennessee Spine and Pain Center provides comprehensive evaluations and management plans for acute and chronic conditions such as back pain, neck pain, shoulder pain, knee, and hip pain.Dr. Newton and the team perform minimally invasive spine procedures and surgery to help manage pain and limit their patient's need or dependence on pain medication. They also offer treatments, including Botox, to help address headaches and other painful ailments.
column38: Jean Foltz-Campbell|Mary Huss|Chasiaty Wells|Daniel Klem|Nic Anderson|Ammie Shelton|Gary Beard|Trina Bassham
column40:
I have been dealing with back/neck pain for over 10 years which led to surgery on both.  It was not successful and has been a very long journey.  Someone recommended Dr. Newton and after just 2 visits, I am already having positive results.   I feel very comfortable with him, he explains everything clearly and makes sure I understand what the objective is for my treatment.  I highly recommend him.  He's very knowledgeable, helpful and understanding.  He and his staff are great!!|My referring orthopedic doctor sent my referral to your office 12/29. I never got a call so a week later I called the office and left a voicemail.  A few more days passed and I never got a call so I called again but got the voicemail.  Finally,  2 weeks after my referral was sent over, on my 3rd call in I got someone on the phone and asked to make my appointment for the cervical injection I needed. I spoke to a receptionist who was less than friendly with borderline rude phone etiquette.  So, a couple weeks later here's how my appointment went.
I arrived today at 8:55. My appointment was at 9:00. I was greeted by a sign at the window that states, Be advised: "Poor planning on your part does not constitute an emergency on my part."  Along with a sign saying New Patients must arrive 30 minutes early and existing patients must arrive 15 minutes early. I had no clue of this policy. I gave the front desk lady my name and was given the 5th degree by the receptionist.  She stated to me that her manager told me to arrive 30 minutes early.  I have no memory of being told that whatsoever and whoever answered the phone when I made my appointment was not the manager. The lady at the window then asked me if I wanted her to ask Dr. Newton IF he still wanted to see me. Like, what???!!!??? A couple minutes later she returned and asked me if I'd like to "wait and just be worked in." I asked her what the reason was why I needed to be here 30 minutes early when I had already filled out ALL my new patient forms online and had even uploaded my ID and insurance card. The only answer she provided was that it is Dr. Newton's policy. No logical or reasonable response.
I sat down and began to wait and wait...and wait. At 9:25  a woman walked in for her 9:30 appointment.  I asked the woman if she liked Dr. Newton and she said it was her first visit. The lady at the front desk said ZERO words to her. At 9:51 she was called back and I was still waiting.  I walked out. I will never return.  I wasted an hour of MY because of your ridiculous, unfriendly and unwelcoming policy. Absolutely stupid practice. Referrals by word of mouth go ask long way. I'll be spreading the word to warn others about this Dr. and his silly little practice...|Very unprofessional and lacking in moral integrity. The lab they use has really bad reviews and several lawsuits as well. My husband came here for chronic pain management and got nothing but a very hard time. Defamation of character on my husband's name. All is being looked into with the lab and office staff!

First, I would like to thank you for responding to my review; however for me to even leave a bad review something is wrong. My husband was targeted and he will not speak up for himself. I however will; The test was an oral swab and he also was given a urinalysis. Now I spoke to Aegis myself and they confirmed that the drug that my chronic pain husband was positive for a substance; and there has been up to a 10% fail rate. Not all of your patients is given an oral swab it has to be requested. Now I know and your office staff do to my husband and along with a few others were targeted and if you just wanted to discharge him that is fine but to lie on his character is another. Not to be brutally honest he was short a few meds 1 time not twice but he had confided in one of the providers about break through pain meds! He never got a chance to discuss it again. The office staff is rude; well most! I thought the provider would be a good fit for my husband's pain control. Whom by the way never took an aspirin until he got sick. So yes; I will defend him and others like him and have this looked into. Maybe a better system with office staff needs to be put in place. Have a great day!|The office staff was amazing the nurse in the office was kind and patient she listened to all my health concerns.
The staff at the hospital before during and after my injection were wonderful,  very professional and personal also.
Julie the procedure room nurse is amazing with good music playing and very personal as is the surgical tech working the x-ray with DR. Newton. Well done.
DR. Newton was amazing telling me exactly what he was doing, it was very relaxing to me hearing these 3 professionals working together.  I hope I don't have to see them again soon but I do know when I have to have another injection it is done with the same professionalism and pride as the 1st.
Thanks again,
Dan|If you have a bad review here. Then you are the problem. In and out within 10 minutes each time. Pre registration online. Nice group.|I was terrified to do this back procedure, but my friend Jennifer recommended him and reassured me he was a very understanding and very gentle doctor who cares about his patients and only wants the best for them, their life back.And the too wonderful ladies walked me through it very carefully, understanding the way I felt the doctor came in and proceeded to keep me calm and walk me through everything he did, and yes I would recommend Dr Newton and his staff to anyone who needs this done even if you're afraid, the staff and the doctor are great . they were just awesome at understanding my feelings and my fears. a day later I felt a lot better, 2 weeks later I'm still feeling good. I'm still being careful and watching what I do, the pain still comes and goes but not like it was. I wish I had done this sooner. THANK YOU AGAIN DR NEWTON , and thank God for you and the two wonderful ladies that help me get through it all.|I'm having severe knee pain and they took me in quickly and giving me the treatment I need. Very nice and considerate..|I had my ablation procedure on 4/23/24. At the time my pain level was at about 6. I have suffered with neck pain for years. After my procedure my pain level was 0. I was numb. When the feeling started coming back I was in a lot of pain. I used an ice pack and it helped a lot. Today I'm feeling a lot better. Dr. Newton is the best! I will recommend him to all my family and friends! The nurses were great! They're so friendly and make you so comfortable. Thank you Dr. Newton for all you do to help not only me but for all your patients. Thanks to the nurses for all they do for us all. Y'all are the greatest!!

column3:
Mays & Schnapp Neurospine and Pain serves patients throughout Memphis, TN and Southaven, MS with comprehensive pain management solutions. Founded by specialists dedicated to improving quality of life, this premier practice combines advanced diagnostic techniques with personalized treatment plans to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. Their multidisciplinary approach integrates medication management, interventional procedures, physical therapy, and behavioral health strategies to provide holistic care for patients suffering from back pain, neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndromes.

At Mays & Schnapp Neurospine and Pain, patients receive individualized attention from board-certified pain specialists who take the time to thoroughly diagnose the root cause of discomfort. The practice employs state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and evidence-based treatments to develop comprehensive care plans tailored to each patient's specific needs. Their specialists are experts in both traditional and innovative pain management techniques, including minimally invasive procedures that can provide significant relief while minimizing recovery time.

Comprehensive Treatment Approach

The team at Mays & Schnapp understands that effective pain management often requires multiple modalities working together. Their treatment options include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, medication management, and physical therapy coordination. By addressing both the physical and psychological aspects of pain, they help patients regain function and improve their overall quality of life.

Patient-Centered Care

What sets Mays & Schnapp apart is their commitment to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. The practice emphasizes clear communication about pain conditions and treatment options, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. Their convenient locations in Memphis (55 Humphreys Center #200, Memphis, TN 38120) and Southaven make quality pain management accessible to residents throughout the Mid-South region.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit www.maysandschnapp.com or call +1 901-747-0040.

column40:
My appointment was on time. The receptionist was very friendly and professional, helping me with my Healow cell phone portal.
The Physician's Assistant, Cindy Tran, is always very attentive (No exceptions this time) and had some suggestions for further treatment, one of which I adopted. Her nurse Courtney was very helpful and courteous as well. I always look forward to my visits here.|Staff are all very kind and patient and efficient. I've never had a long wait to see my provider. My provider(s) are terrific also- kind and patient and smart. It's clear they are all committed to quality patient care.|It is always a great experience when I have my appointments at the Mays and Schnapp pain clinic. The staff is always nice and efficient. I highly recommend Dr Schnapp who takes care of my medical needs. He's got a great bedside manner and always takes good care of me. He does a super job of explaining my medical issues and always treat me like I'm his most important patient. Always a great experience.|I feel my husbands pain was not taken seriously when he was not able to get his prescription filled bc of needing insurance pre authorization and the pharmacy saying they would have to order it. We went back to speak with the doctor about getting something else that was available without jumping through hoops and he was pretty much dismissed with no concern for his pain. When someone has chronic pain that is debilitating it also affects their mind and thoughts and attitude. He was so distraught about not getting his prescription, after waiting months for this appointment, I feel like more time could have been taken to understand what he was going through the dr could have taken a few minutes of his time to speak with us again and figure out a different plan. Instead his nurse came out and completely dismissed him and what he is going through. I had high hopes and am very disappointed that now we have to start over again to try to get him help|Everyone are so nice & helpful, and I am grateful that Dr Dodus is my doctor.  I trust him very much for helping me to manage my very hard lower back pain. Everyone from the receptionists Jenny & Haley to each nurse we spoke with are so nice & helpful.|All of your staff are so helpful and compassionate.  Cindy Trans has been such a godsend to me with her needle point injections on my neck and the way she always listens to any problems I am having.  Dr. Dudas has also been wonderful with my piriformis injections.  It is the first time I have received relief.  I also love that I am under their care and can see Cindy every couple of months to see how I am doing.  Just knowing they are there to help with my pain and follow up with them has helped me so much mentally.  I am very grateful to have found your group!|I Don't always do reviews especially about a doctor office.but this was my first visit to see DR.Cindy.Tiu
She listened to me and she done her exam
And came up with a treatment plan.very professional.
So I have another appointment in January hopefully we know more.
So if you think you are out of options then I would give them a call.
The whole staff was very warm welcoming from the ladies at the check in window to everyone in the back that we had met.
Thank you Dr.cindy tiu.|The worst place I've ever been to. They diagnosed me without an X-ray or MRI. You cannot call and speak with anyone about anything. I'm trying to get my records but was told I have to go online to do so. I don't know if I know how and am certain some people don't. They are uncaring and absolutely of no help in n any way. So beware

column3:
Rhea Medical Pain Management serves Dayton, TN and surrounding Rhea County communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized clinic focuses on addressing chronic and acute pain conditions through evidence-based treatments and personalized care plans. We understand how debilitating persistent pain can be, which is why our team is dedicated to improving your quality of life through effective pain management strategies tailored to your specific needs.

At Rhea Medical Pain Management, we offer high-quality pain management services for a wide range of conditions, including:

  • Back and neck pain, including sciatica, arthritis pain, and work-related injuries

  • Shoulder, hip and knee pain

  • Complex Regional Pain Syndrome

  • Nerve damage or muscle spasm pain

  • Shingles pain and Headaches

Our Procedures

Our clinic provides advanced interventional pain management techniques, including:

  • Epidural steroid injections - Targeted relief for spinal inflammation

  • Spinal cord stimulation - Advanced therapy for chronic pain conditions

  • Selective nerve root blocks - Precise diagnostic and therapeutic injections

  • Radiofrequency ablations - Minimally invasive procedure to reduce nerve pain

Meet Our Expert Team

Dr. Gary Chase Black leads our pain management program with a balanced approach to patient care. Board certified in both pain medicine and anesthesiology, Dr. Black brings specialized expertise to every treatment plan. Supporting Dr. Black are Chelsea Massey, BSN, MSN, FNP-C and Christina LeQuan, PA-C, who help ensure comprehensive care for all patients in our pain management program.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us:

Phone: +1 423-285-5220

Address: 9400 Rhea County Hwy, Dayton, TN 37321, United States

Website: https://rheamedical.org/services/pain-management-center/

column40:
I have been a patient here for about 2 years or so, now and I really like it here. I've seen Dr. Black and Chelsea, and both are great! They listen and I don't feel rushed! I feel like they actually want to HELP me versus seeing me as just another paycheck.
The entire staff is very friendly, as well! Overall, this is a great physician's office!|I have several issues with deterioration of the spine and am not a candidate for extensive surgery. My Specialist recommended ablations of the nerves in both upper and lower spine. He agreed to let me get those treatments locally and referred me to this facility. Dr. Black and his staff have been super  in providing my treatments from thorough explanations to kind and attentive treatment and service. This has eliminated distance driving and I have had good results. Without the help I continue to get from this clinic, I would live in constant pain. I would recommend Rhea Medical Pain Management to anyone.|This is the best place I have ever been to. The staff & doctors are very informative & very nice. The property is on a hill & has beautiful surroundings. I thank the good Lord for seeing fit to place me in the care of these good folks.|I've never been to pain management before and Rhea Medical Pain Management personnel made the process more comfortable than I thought it would be. The personnel are so professional and so kind. Dr Black is awesome. I've had my 1st procedure and I can't say enough of how Dr Black has a calming way about him. He has a way of making my fears go away and I feel that he will help me in anyway he can to ease the pain. I can't begin to say how kind everyone has been. If anyone is getting ready to go to Rhea Medical Pain Management, you can rest easy that you will be treated with the utmost respect, kindness and professionalism.|I feel like this man is very unprofessional. Sort of a legal scam. He tells you a shots going to make you feel better. What he doesn't tell you other than it could cause an infection. Is the shot will cause scar tissue. And then you have to have a procedure done for that. And the shot he gives you is very temporary so then you got to have another one and they tell you all your insurance will cover it it's affordable is are not affordable these procedures cost and why I had to have two to three visits in his office before even getting one shot with no medicine being written made no sense they racked me up in bills. And he was willing to give me injections in me and neck as well not telling me what would happen after those I'm sure more stuff that would need in minor surgeries just seems very unprofessional I hope this is not a legal scam|I  highly recommend Chelsea she's GREAT! She listens attentively to my health issues, easy to talk to and is very understanding . The entire staff  at Rhea Medical Pain Management is always willing to help with whatever I need. . I'm so blessed  Chelsea is helping me with my health issues.|It took more than a month to get in for a follow up appointment. Once there, I spent three and a half hours waiting to be called back, with my feral two year old son, just to wait nearly another hour for the doctor to come in. He spent five minutes in the room with me, did not listen to any of my concerns or complaints, and sent me home with a prescription that did more harm than good! My next appointment, another month after I needed to be in, was worse. He wanted to put me on a medication similar to the one that gave me problems just to see if that one would work. He refused to prescribe me a medication that I already had been on and knew worked. He was (and is) more interested in using his patients as test subjects and making money off of them and their insurance than providing proper medical care to decrease or end chronic pain! I marked one star out of five because I couldn't submit my review without a rating. This pain clinic was not worth my time, the gas it took to get there, the insanity I was driven to, or the amount of pain I endured under "Dr." Chase Black's "care."|Well if you are sick with covid or have a daughter passed away from cancer or have a infection in your mouth and was sick for weeks then had to have all your teeth removed and had to cancel some appointments because life just happens and have provided records to them to show that you are telling the truth. Watch out for a certified letter in the mail came and said they have kicked me out of there clinic and in the letter says we will provided emergency 30 day supply of medicine until I find another provider. When I called them about what was going on when I cancel the appointment they said that's find just call back when he gets feeling better to reschedule his appointment then I get that letter today. I really think that was so unprofessional of them not even call me to come in and talk to them or nothing they have treated me like I am a not even person just another number to them to collect from my insurance because they just wanted to do shots on me and I did due some of the shots in my back and it didn't even help. I ask them if they are going to wing me down off the medicine and they hung up on me and my wife because we ask questions we didn't get ugly about it or nothing so beware of what type of business is being run here and how they treat people

Interventional Spine and Pain Center in Manchester, Tennessee offers comprehensive pain management solutions for residents throughout Coffee County and surrounding areas. Our board-certified specialists combine advanced interventional techniques with personalized care plans to address chronic pain conditions affecting the spine, joints, and nervous system. Since our founding, we've been committed to improving patients' quality of life through minimally invasive procedures and evidence-based treatments.

At Interventional Spine and Pain Center, we provide a wide range of diagnostic and therapeutic interventions designed to target the source of your pain. Our treatment options include epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. Each treatment plan is tailored to address your specific condition, whether you're suffering from herniated discs, sciatica, arthritis, or complex regional pain syndrome.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our compassionate team takes the time to listen to your concerns and develop comprehensive strategies that focus on both pain relief and functional improvement. We emphasize minimally invasive techniques that can provide significant relief while minimizing recovery time and potential complications.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 2345 Murfreesboro Hwy in Manchester, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technology. We maintain a comfortable, welcoming environment where patients can receive the highest standard of care in a convenient setting.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (931) 728-5607. You can also visit our website at www.manchesterpain.net for additional information about our treatments and providers. Our dedicated team is ready to help you take the first step toward effective pain management and improved quality of life.

column40:
Edit;   Both Drs have now retired and the drs who have taken over at the Manchester location of ISPC are ghosts, (have never seen them, only the PAs who work under them) though I get billed plenty by them and get treated like I don't deserve help.

This review was for Dr. Marshall Millman and Dr. James Nunley, who were both excellent physicians when this place used to be Anesthesia Pain Management.  I was a bundle of pain and misery before I started seeing Dr. Millman nearly 25 years ago. Through a conservative treatment plan I am functioning at the best that can be expected for my condition.  Dr. Millman has saved my life. All the doctors, PAs, and staff at their office are kind, sympathetic, and compassionate.|The doctor I spoke with seemed very intelligent and helpful. The staff was a different impression all together. From comments on my clothes from front desk employee, to the loud and rude rescheduling employee. This establishment is neither a school nor university, so homework? Any question was answered only with "that's our policy. " Considering I'm disabled and not a child. I find it hard with all the paperwork, I have to fill out. Then  to have to question me about particular things that were explained in the questionnaire. All and all the doctor amazing. The staff unfortunately don't understand the types of patients they maybe seeing.|Dr Nunley is the most caring & concerned doctor I've ever known. He will try everything to help find a solution for your problem, not just seeing you for a few seconds & writing a script to send you on your way. He is an excellent listener & will ask hard questions to get to the bottom of your problem. He will send you for tests or perform them here at his expanding office & he has an excellent staff also very involved in your total care. His nurse Melody, is my favorite of all times. She is a loving, caring personal kind of nurse, she is very special!!|They are the best set of Doctors I've ever had for my conditions. They listen to your concerns, work to validate your conditions and treat you with great respect. I've had multiple procedures done with them. They do not try to rush you through the procedures like cattle. Dr. Nunley has an easy and soft touch when doing a procedure. He also talks the procedure through with you as he is doing it.|I have updated my review from a year ago.. giving them 5 stars instead of 4. The ladies up front are extremely helpful and kind.They put you at ease and make you feel welcomed.
There have been changes in the last year for the better. Love the drs I have seen. Pleasant and ask me how I'm doing. Any new issues I may have they show concern and want to help you feel your best. They see many patients a day but still make time for you and your well being. Always a pleasant experience since the changes from a year ago.|Very professional. I had a return visit and it's very comforting to know that throughout the visit, Dr Newton asked countless questions about my epidural. Even though everything was perfect, I just really appreciated all of the follow-up questions he asked, several of which I had never thought about. Thank You to Dr Newton, the hardworking Nurses and the Ladies at the Front Desks!                     08/30/21 Another EXCELLENT job by Doctor Newton! He went a little to the Right this time, and the results are Wonderful!! Thank You to the Front Desk, the Nurses, and to Doctor Newton! All were So Professional and Caring|Dr. Nunley is such a caring doctor that truely cares for his patients. He takes the time to talk to you and answer any questions you have. His nurses and staff do the same. They are always so nice.|I feel for the first time a doctor, specifically Dr. Nunley totally understood my situation. He validated my feelings and concerns. I am more than happy to continue to see Dr. Nunley for ALL my future visits. It not only was a great experience, it was the best experience I have had with a doctor in understanding my bone disease and my feelings and concerns. His nurse was also as wonderful as he was. I am so pleased to FINALLY have the doctor I feel I need to handle my situation.
I couldn't be more grateful!
Thank You!!

column3:
Highpoint Pain Clinic - Sumner with Ascension Saint Thomas serves Gallatin, TN and surrounding communities with specialized pain management services. Formerly known as Sumner Pain Clinic, this established medical facility partners with Ascension Saint Thomas to provide comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic or acute pain conditions that require treatment beyond standard pain relievers. The clinic's experienced team works closely with referring physicians to develop personalized treatment plans for patients whose painful conditions warrant specialized attention.

When conventional pain management approaches aren't providing adequate relief, Highpoint Pain Clinic offers advanced treatment options. Patients experiencing pain from illness, injury, or chronic conditions can access specialized care through physician referrals. Medicare patients are eligible for the clinic's services but must obtain a referral from their doctor before scheduling an appointment.

Patient Information

The clinic welcomes new patients at their convenient location:

- Address: 300 Steam Plant Rd, Suite 410, Gallatin, TN 37066

- Phone: (615) 328-5089

- Website: [highpointhealthpartners.com/sumner-pain-clinic](https://highpointhealthpartners.com/sumner-pain-clinic?utmsource=GMBSocialClimb&utmmedium=HighpointPainClinic-SumnerwithAscensionSaintThomas)

As part of the respected Ascension Saint Thomas network, patients can expect coordinated care that integrates with their overall health management plan. The clinic's affiliation with this trusted healthcare system ensures patients receive evidence-based treatments from providers who maintain high standards of medical excellence.
column11:
This location was formerly known as Sumner Pain Clinic.

Sometimes pain from an illness or injury requires more treatment than simple pain relievers. When a painful condition warrants special attention, your primary care physician or specialist may refer you to the Highpoint Pain Clinic - Sumner with Ascension Saint Thomas. Medicare patients are eligible for the clinic's services, but do have to be referred by a physician.

Cleveland Pain Medicine, PLLC serves Cleveland, Tennessee and surrounding areas with specialized interventional pain management services. Our dedicated team of pain specialists is committed to providing comprehensive, personalized care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. With our state-of-the-art facility located on Mouse Creek Road, we combine advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives and reduce their dependence on pain medications.

At Cleveland Pain Medicine, we offer a full array of interventional pain management procedures tailored to address various pain conditions. Our services include:

  • Cervical, thoracic, and lumbar epidural steroid injections

  • Radiofrequency ablation of the cervical and lumbar spine

  • SI joint and knee radiofrequency treatments

  • Pulsed radio frequency therapy for peripheral nerves

  • Customized pain management plans

Advanced Treatment Approaches

Our practice specializes in minimally invasive procedures designed to target pain at its source. By utilizing precise diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment methods, we can effectively address pain while minimizing recovery time and reducing the need for surgical intervention. Our goal is to improve your quality of life through sustainable pain relief solutions.

Patient-Centered Care

We understand that each patient's pain experience is unique. That's why we take the time to thoroughly evaluate your condition and develop a personalized treatment plan that addresses your specific needs and goals. Our compassionate team works closely with you throughout your treatment journey, adjusting approaches as needed to optimize your results.

Contact Information

Address: 55 Mouse Creek Rd NW, Cleveland, TN 37312, United States

Phone: +1 423-813-7333

Website: clevelandpainmedicine.com

Contact us today to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management and improved quality of life.
column11: At Cleveland Pain Medicine, we offer a full array of interventional pain management procedures. Cervical, thoracic and lumbar epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation of the cervical and lumbar spine as well as the SI joint and knee. We can also use pulsed radio frequency therapy to almost any peripheral nerve.

column40:
If you call the office to make an appointment or anything along those lines and you happen to be so lucky to have Christine answer the phone to help you. I guarantee you you will be beyond satisfied with the way she helps you and genuinely cares. I don't think in my life I have encountered someone as patient and kind and understanding as her in a job that says frustrating and tiring as hers. Six out of five stars. Can't say enough good things about her sincerely. Christine, thank you.|Actually listen and come up with good game plan to fix your needs. The also pray with me after our appointments which I love bc I'm praying for those doctors before my appointment. Give them an try for a few months I believe you won't be left down|Very disappointed with continuity of care. I called very sick with a medicine issue. I asked for help and was summarily ignored. No one bothered to return my call. I'm no longer a pt there. Guess I'll just have to deal with the pain.|Everyone at this office is so nice i saw Roxie today she was great to answer questions and look at my leg that was hurt i also was thankful i got to come earlier.since she had an opening .|Never had better care from any type of physician than I have experienced with Dr Feslar and every member of his staff. That includes Autumn who generally sets up appointments, and all of the young women at the desk.
Dr Feslar and all of his PA's show true sympathy and empathy, which is rare in pain management. I've never felt that they think of the patients as pill seekers.
From the day I walked through the door, finished up with my appointment Dr Feslar ask permission to pray with me. I have never felt more grateful to know that God put that office and the staff in my path.|From the very beginning and every time I have an appointment everyone makes me feel so comfortable. Such a caring caring staff and wonderful doctors! They really know what they're doing and they truly care about the patient. I would recommend them to anybody that needs help from pain.|I'm writing this in hopes someone won't make the mistake I did and waste their time and money here. The only positive thing I can say is the people up front were nice and always did their jobs. All that changes when you leave the waiting room. I've tried to get 2 prescriptions through them. The first time they didn't even give the pharmacy the basic info needed to fill it. When it was about to run out, they wanted to change dosage. It was to be done a week ago but they have still to do it. No biggie, who needs something to relieve the pain anyway.
Secondly, they don't listen to the patient. I've had numerous steroid shots and none have worked. Their answer?Lets do more of what we know won't work.
I asked them to get records from previous doctors. Not a chance. Why would they when they can ignore me and schedule more procedures so they can make more money?
If you want a place where they care about the patients, this is not the place. They're only interested in keeping you coming back to make more money.
If the lady would spend as much time getting my prescriptions correct as she does praying, I might not be in as much pain.
Will they apologize for their incompetence and greed? Of course not. No money to be made there. Will I hear from them to remove this review? Probably, but it's not happening.|As a Christian woman to have such a caring and positive and professional expertise from the staff as well as compassion for each patient is a rare thing. They explain their procedures very well for me to understand and have my best interests at each visit. And they take their time to pray and work with me for my best quality of life. Such a wonderful group of people. The only concerns that I have are about my pain and it's still not managed well enough for me to have a better quality of life yet.

column2: Tennessee Physical Medicine and Pain Management
column3:
Tennessee Physical Medicine and Pain Management serves Lebanon, TN and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management and rehabilitation services. Our dedicated team specializes in treating acute and chronic pain conditions through evidence-based interventional techniques and personalized rehabilitation programs. Located conveniently on West Baddour Parkway, we've established ourselves as a trusted healthcare provider committed to improving patients' quality of life and functional abilities.

At Tennessee Physical Medicine and Pain Management, our practice is led by board-certified physicians with extensive training in Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation (PM&R) and Interventional Pain Management. Our specialists utilize advanced electrodiagnostic medicine techniques to accurately diagnose nerve and muscle conditions, ensuring precise treatment planning. We take pride in our multidisciplinary approach that addresses both the symptoms and underlying causes of pain.

Comprehensive Treatment Options

We offer a wide range of treatment modalities including epidural steroid injections, joint injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and medication management. Our rehabilitation services incorporate physical therapy, therapeutic exercises, and functional restoration programs tailored to each patient's specific needs and goals. This integrated approach helps patients achieve optimal outcomes and return to their daily activities with improved function.

Patient-Centered Care

Our practice philosophy centers on providing compassionate, patient-focused care in a welcoming environment. We take time to listen to our patients' concerns, thoroughly evaluate their conditions, and develop customized treatment plans that align with their personal health objectives. Our friendly staff ensures a seamless healthcare experience from the initial consultation through ongoing care management.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 615-257-0900 or visit our website at http://tpmpm.com/. Our clinic is located at 1423 W Baddour Pkwy, Lebanon, TN 37087, with convenient access for residents throughout Middle Tennessee.
column11: Dedicated Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation physician with expertise in Interventional Pain Management and Electrodiagnostic Medicine.
column38: Denise Dewey|NanaLife|Randy Hankins|Wooden Eagle|Micheal Fahey|Teruah Tekiah|Stacy Gilder|Donna Samuels
column40:
Everyone was so nice and welcoming.  Dr. Baker listened intently while his assistant took notes, I really liked that. I was given some challenging tasks but I am sure I can accomplish them with their help. I now look forward to bettering my life with less pain and a healthier lifestyle. I would definitely recommend friends,  family and anyone who needs help to relieve their pain to contact them. I came away encouraged, hopeful, and ready to change my path!|Connie was so helpful, getting my records transferred. Dr. Baker and Cammie are a great team.  During my new patient visit, Dr. Baker listened and provided education regarding my medications. He spent the time needed and was very thorough. I am so happy to have found this practice, office staff are friendly!|Dr Baker and his staff have always been extremely understanding.  In the event you need a procedure they take time to explain everything to you including any other options available.
I have been a patient going on eight years nothing but positive experiences.  Dr Baker is the only surgeon I trust with a needle around my spine
I would highly recommend anyone|I've been going to Tennessee Physical Therapy and Pain Management for about ten years now. I've read thru some of the reviews posted here and I can't believe there are negative comments. I have never experienced anything but friendliness & professionalism by their staff. Dr. Baker is an outstanding Physician. He takes his time, actually listens and then gives recommendations. Every PA I have been assigned to has been/is top notch. The nurses are the same. I have zero complaints.

I have come across people who have told me they didn't like going there. Unfortunately, it was their fault they had negative experiences. Dr. Baker and crew do not play when it comes to following the rules and expectations of being a patient at that office. If I had gone to Medical School and spent years of my time and energy to help people, I'd be damned if I'd put my livelihood on the line for a patient that refuses to take meds as prescribed, caught selling, can't pass random urine tests, etc...but that's just me!  (sorry for that run on sentence)

I appreciate their efforts!!|I have been a patient of Dr Baker for about a year and have found him and his staff to be very helpful and accommodating with my chronic pain issues! They have proved to be very caring and helpful in managing my pain. I've been to a few other Doctors but his treatment is the best so far!|The folks at Tennessee pain management are a great group of folks.  Dr. Joy has a lovely spirit and attitude at every visit.  They never make you wait for too long and the front staff is super friendly as well! I highly recommend!|My wife and I Have been patients of Dr Baker on & off for 26+ years. Usually a very positive experience. We have loved this man. Office staff is horrible especially financial secretary. They repeat untruths to Baker. This past week I was having chest pains (I am a heart patient) while in the lobby. My wife told the office staff and Dr Baker that I was having chest pains. Neither staff nor Dr Baker asked "is he ok, do you need an ambulance"? Not even offer to take bp. Comment was made "care and co-pay is due at time of service"! We left going to ER!

Our co-pay should always be $45 and that's fine. Some months office staff will say "your balance is $5 or, your balance is $50"! We have  even gone months with credits. We have NEVER owed this Dr anything. We pay whatever they say. We learned a long time ago if you question why the balance is different each month the financial secretary considers this a personal attack. They have become increasingly aggressive and offensive. This visit,  the office staff shouts through the glass windows, (with at least 7 patients in lobby) our history of financial information. We were shook and in shock that office staff could be so unprofessional and uncaring. She should have called us in the back to say what she needed to say. Dr Baker took the untrue words of office staff without respecting us enough to speak with us. After 26 years of patient/doctor relationship. We are so very disappointed with the integrity of not only a man, but a Dr. A Dr that took an oath to "do no harm"! Me having chest pains in his lobby was of ZERO concern!!
Doctors are a dime a dozen and of course we can choose another. It's the RELATIONSHIP that we will miss.|Great team of folks who listen and care for pain management patients!

The ablations I have had [one side in December and one side in January] - I have pain relief! I still have to take oral medication but gosh - I feel so much better with Dr. Baker's team. Folks answer questions and explains things to me in a manner I can understand.

IF you need pain management relief? I highly recommend this team!!

column3:
Pain Consultants of East Tennessee serves the greater Knoxville region as the premier pain management practice, specializing in a multi-disciplinary approach to treating chronic and acute pain conditions. Established in 1998, this respected medical practice has built a reputation for comprehensive care that addresses not just symptoms, but the whole person. Their collaborative team brings together diverse expertise to create individualized treatment plans that help patients regain quality of life and functionality.

What sets Pain Consultants of East Tennessee apart is their unique collaboration of specialists. The practice features board-certified, fellowship-trained physicians working alongside behavioral medicine experts, advanced-practice nurses, and highly trained physical and occupational therapists. This integrated approach ensures that patients receive care that addresses both the physical and psychological aspects of pain management. Additionally, their team includes clinical science and research experts who help implement the latest evidence-based treatments.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

At Pain Consultants of East Tennessee, patients are treated as people, not just medical cases. The providers dedicate time to thoroughly discuss all available options, answer questions, and develop personalized treatment plans. This patient-centered approach has helped countless individuals throughout the Knoxville area find relief from chronic pain conditions that other treatments couldn't address.

Location and Contact Information

Pain Consultants of East Tennessee welcomes new patients at their conveniently located office:

1540 Member Ln, Suite 100

Knoxville, TN 37909

United States

To schedule a consultation or learn more about their services:

Phone: (865) 579-0552

Website: www.painconsultants.com
column11:
Pain Consultants of East Tennessee is the greater Knoxville region's premier pain management practice and specializes in a multi-disciplinary approach to treating pain. Pain Consultants of East Tennessee has been practicing pain medicine in Knoxville since 1998.
Pain Consultants of East Tennessee is a collaboration of experts in pain medicine with board-certified, fellowship-trained physicians, working in conjunction with behavioral medicine experts, advanced-practice nurses, highly trained physical and occupational therapists, as well as clinical science and research experts. Our providers are willing to take the time to go over all your options and treat you as a person, not just a patient.
