column40:
The service that I have received from the Pain Consultants of East Tennessee has been phenomenal. The staff was very caring to the patient needs. The doctor that cared for me always  took the time to talk to me before the procedure took place. I think that is very important to be known by all the patients. I was very satisfied with the service. Thank you|If you are young, do not go to this place. They treat everyone like drug seekers and will withhold findings from scans in order to not treat you. After asking for copies of my reports from the radiologist, the looks on their faces showed that they did not want to give them to me really. My report included a NEW finding of multiple degenerative spinal nodes that have never been noted before. While these types of nodes are common, combined with my chronic degenerative disease, that's pretty significant and yields at least some discussion. They just weren't going to tell me about the nodes and send me on my way with nothing but a surgical option that I will not do. I can't trust you to even tell the truth. Why would I want a procedure? Dr. Smith judged my issues with needles (a strong trauma-based phobia combined with sensory issues due to autism)  and nearly rolled her eyes at my husband when he asked if there was a way to knock me out for the procedure before inserting an IV. She said no, but there are ways: gas and anti-anxiety meds among others, which have been offered to me at other places before.

They also neglected to tell me that I needed to bring a copy of my scans from the imaging center to my appointment with them (what place doesn't just send those anyway - I have been getting scans for 15 years now and have never had to bring my own copy) so they made all of these decisions to treat me horribly without even seeing my scans that make it very clear that I am telling the truth and am in a lot of very visible pain. Pass on this one. It's a money grab and Dr. Martha Smith can't be trusted at all. Her nurse practitioner actually cared about my pain and situation in the first appointment, but at the second, Dr. Smith clearly had squashed that. I will be taking my scans elsewhere for a more compassionate and honest opinion.|If you need pain relief from neck and back pain, I highly recommend Pain Consultants of East Tennessee.
Dr. Martha Smith is compassionate, knowledgeable, and has been highly successful in treating my neck pain and headaches for several years.
She has saved me from a lot of horrible pain for several years.|I was recently referred by my Doctor. I went to my firsts appointment.My Doctor wanted to referrer me to a surgeon. The nurse was telling that she couldn't really see anything on Mri she couldn't see anything that could be causing me so much pain .I just been  through cancer treatment had radiation and cemo was not ready to take injection,if anyone knows if you got cancer the size of a pin head and take stereo injection in six months it will be the size of a golf ball, but they couldn't give any pain med even though I was already taking them ,but they would give injection. I felt very judged and I know they was not wanting to treat me .These clinics hold back pain medicine to push injection because they make more money, but they don't tell you that injection are making your back problem worse even though you feel better for a short time when the injection  no longer work and it time to start surgery's and probably several but if you what more pain med your a addict|I've had neurosarcoidosis for 21 years and have always struggled to be heard or taken seriously for the horrible pain in my chest due to this rare disease.

PCET and especially Dr. Choo (and his Nurse Practitioner) actually LISTENED to me and took my pain seriously.

I am thankful for finally finding a doctor who listens to chronic pain patients and advocates for them. They treat pain holistically, offering both physical and mental health services in-house.

The opioid crisis has made it very difficult for chronic pain patients to have their pain treated effectively.

Basically, all the drug seeking individuals looking for their next high have ruined it for patients who actually need opioids to have a decent quality of life.

If you are a chronic pain patient who is looking for kind and caring doctors and staff, this is the place to go.|Amy has been very instrumental in helping me recover from sciatica problems.  She has listened very carefully as I tell her about my problems and pain and she has thoroughly thought through her treatment, adjusting as we proceeded until now we can start strengthening exercises.  She becomes  a good, trusted friend in the process.  I can't say enough good things about Amy.|Went to physical therapy at the Member street location and could not be more pleased. Very professional and clean compared to other physical therapy businesses I have been treated at. The doctor who treated me as well as their surgery staff were great as well. Would definitely recommend|I am very satisfied with the kindness and professionalism of the staff at pain consultants everyone made me feels like someone was listening to my challenges  and help me achieve my goals.  Thank you to everyone for helping me keep my dignity.

column38: Leah Capps|Paula Preston|Mike Black|sharandon primm|Carla Trotter|Jennifer Carter|Stephen Hoyle|marc gullen
column40:
So many people have said many of my same thoughts about this clinic and thankfully they did. I myself feel so very blessed to be a patient here and would not go anywhere else because when you find respect, great care along with quality for the care the doctors , nurses and staff are giving you there is no other reason to go anywhere else. I look forward to EACH visit with Miss Mandy for I KNOW she has been so very kind, thoughtful and professional in every aspect as well as the staff in which I truly am grateful to. If you listen while your there you just might get lucky to hear a staff worker singing and to me this shows her talent but also her talent to care for patients. Mary-Ellen is so soft spoken & kind hearted and this makes me feel more at ease being around her & all the staff as well. Dr. G is VERY KNOWLEDGEABLE & PROFESSIONAL with so much grace so if you are looking for a special kind warm place for your pain issues and whatever health issues you are having I recommend coming here AND also VERY IMPORTANT , There is NO JUDGEMENT HERE !! I hope this review helps you to decide ..May everyone have a blessed day !!|I was a patient at the Dickson location and was pleased with my first visit for the care that was given. I went back for my second visit and we talked about different treatments that were available to me to think about. My regular prescription was called in to the drugstore I used only to find my medicine was on back order. I called the clinic to ask them to send my prescription over to another local drugstore that had my medication on hand. The recording on the nurses line said calls would be returned within 24 hours but sadly that wasn't true. Three different days I called in leaving one message a day about transferring my prescription but no one ever returned my calls. By now I was six days without my medication and had gone into withdrawals. I called one more time and told the person that answered the phone what had happened only to be told that she couldn't help me and transfered me to the nurse's line again where I had to leave another message! Later that day the receptionist called and said that they had sent a new prescription to the drugstore I last requested. When I went in for my next appointment at the clinic and saw the doctor and explained concern over what had happened the previous visit with my medication she told me that she had only received one message which was the last one I left and said perhaps I had left my messages on a non responsive line. I explained that I had called 3 previous times and that my messages were left on the nurse's voicemail. Again she brought up alternate methods for pain relief saying they didn't like to keep their patients on opioids. I explained that the dosage she had me on was not working and perhaps I was not getting the care that I required from this facility. I then asked for a release from them so I could go to another pain clinic to receive the care I needed. She went to get the release papers but gave them to her nurse to give to me instead of coming back in herself. I found this very offensive considering what all I had gone through. I was polite and when I was out in the hall I made a general statement thanking them all for their help. Sorry but someone who is 78 years old that had a knee replacement that had to be done twice within 5 days time, that also had osteoarthritis with degenerate joint and disc disease for over 25 years, that also has stress fractures in their lumbar and spine and is now in stage 4 of severe osteoporosis, I can not recommend this facility to anyone in severe pain.|My wife had an appointment at the Dickson office and the doctor and most of the staff were very courteous and professional!  I say "most" of the staff, because the receptionist (I think she said her name was Meagan) was rude and not courteous or respectful!  She needs training in how to speak respectfully to patients.|I just love going in there. It honestly is the best place to go as far as doctor's appointments. Megan, Jessica, and Mandi are some of the most professional and friendly people I know in the medical field. They have really helped me a great deal. They really know their stuff. The Dickson office rocks!!! Thanks you guys for being awesome!!!|Mandi is great! She listens and tries to find the best solution to help with whatever pain you are having. The Dickson office has nothing but great people working in it.|I have seen several different pain doctors before. They usually go out of business, change Doctors's, or they can not seem to get the billing correct. Well Dr.Golamco has changed my pain management journey completely. She was willing to listen and come up with solutions that we could try and if they didn't work then she would try something else. I have had 3 injections for joint pain and she is so good I barely felt anything. Jessica her nurse is so sweet and always has a positive attitude. She's a hard working girl that gets her job done. Megan the front office worker is always on point with my appointments and my payments. I have monthly appointments and my insurance has been billed and my co-pay available before my next appointment. My payments versus my EOB's from my insurance carrier always matched. That's a big plus for me! The Nurse Practitioner Mandy is very nice and was my mom's provider before she passed away. Thank you for doing a good job!|Good people!  Dr. Golamco and Nurse Jessica are a great team.  I always feel I have had their fullest attention and very best efforts to help me manage long-term spinal issues.  Dr. G LISTENS -- and Jessica makes me laugh about something every visit, while providing seriously excellent care.  Wonderful attitudes!|First I must talk about my health care provider Mandi.
She is absolutely wonderful. She's always upbeat, pleasant and very helpful and informative. What a pleasure it is to have found such an outstanding N.P.. I don't believe they come any better!!!!
My nurse Mary Ellen is also quite a treasure. She's always friendly and laughs at my lame jokes and she is polite and friendly.  I couldn't ask for a better nurse. Thanks!!
Now for the downside.
This last month I was scheduled for an epidural. When found out my cost I immediately canceled the procedure. Thus left myself without meds for the month. So I called the office, left a message and received nothing in reply. So over the next 3 weeks I left messages 5 times asking for help each time. And I received absolutely nothing in way of a reply.. So in frustration I made the 70mi round trip to the office which I hated to do as it costs about $20 which I struggle to come up with, hence the unreturned phonecards.
I got immediate help thank goodness. But I have to say that the corporation that runs these offices leaves an awful lot to be desired in terms of how well this operation is run.
The good thing is whom ever does the hiring is on the money, the rest, not so much.

column3:
Comprehensive Pain & Neurology Center, PLLC serves Middle Tennessee with specialized care for chronic pain management. Founded with a mission to improve quality of life for those suffering from persistent pain conditions, this premier medical practice has established itself as a trusted resource throughout the region. With state-of-the-art facilities and a team of board-certified specialists, the center combines evidence-based interventional procedures with comprehensive treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At Comprehensive Pain & Neurology Center, patients benefit from a multidisciplinary approach to pain treatment. The center offers advanced diagnostic evaluations and therapeutic interventions including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. Their specialists are trained to address various pain conditions including back and neck pain, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, migraines, and post-surgical pain.

Multiple Convenient Locations

With multiple locations strategically positioned across Middle Tennessee, Comprehensive Pain & Neurology Center ensures accessible care for all residents in the region. Their Hendersonville office, located at 353 New Shackle Island Rd #201a, Hendersonville, TN 37075, serves as one of their primary treatment facilities, offering comprehensive services in a comfortable, patient-centered environment.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Comprehensive Pain & Neurology Center is their unwavering commitment to personalized care. The medical team takes time to understand each patient's pain history, performing thorough evaluations before developing customized treatment plans. This patient-first philosophy extends to their administrative processes, with staff dedicated to helping navigate insurance and scheduling concerns.

For those seeking relief from chronic pain conditions, Comprehensive Pain & Neurology Center welcomes new patients. Their website, www.tnpainexperts.com, provides detailed information about their services and treatment options. To schedule a consultation, patients can call +1 615-410-4990 to begin their journey toward improved function and reduced pain.
column11: Comprehensive Pain & Neurology Center is Middle Tennessee's comprehensive resource for chronic pain treating. With multiple locations across Middle Tennessee, we provide patients with interventional procedures and therapies to help relieve their pain and reclaim their lives.

column40:
I am so lucky to have found Ashley Pritchard!! She is a gem and a rare find in regard to pain management care. I have a tumor in my spinal cord that cannot be removed because it is embedded in my nerves and would paralyze me. Valentines Day 2022 I was blindsided with the news that I would need emergency surgery. I had trouble walking and using my arms afterward. After weeks of physical therapy I was sent to a different pain man agent clinic. Let's just say that I was treated like a drug seeking addict and talked to very ugly. When I found Ashley it was like a breath of fresh air. She listened and was kind and caring. I believe I cried on my first visit because she was so wonderful. Ashley has given me alternate plans for my pain. My pain is something I will live with forever but she has made it manageable.  I would follow Ashley anywhere! She is a real godsend!!! I could not make it without Ashley - she is that important to me!|I cannot say enough great things about Dr. Prichard - she is absolutely amazing! After years of struggling with chronic pain and going through various pain management programs, Dr. Prichard has been an absolute game-changer for me. Her level of expertise, compassion, and dedication to her patients is truly unparalleled. From the moment I met her, I knew I was in good hands. She took the time to listen to my concerns, thoroughly evaluate my condition, and develop a personalized treatment plan that has significantly improved my quality of life. Under her care, I have experienced relief like never before. I am so grateful for Dr. Prichard's commitment to helping individuals like myself find relief from pain and regain control over their health. She truly is a shining star in the field of medicine!|I went to the office today I was pleasantly surprised all of the employees especially Cheryl and Jamie, were so kind and everyone was smiling and very happy and so kind and very helpful. I highly recommend them...
Thank you to the whole staff for treating me right and with respect...|I have been a patient at the Murfreesboro location for 2 years now.  I would like to thank Ashley and her staff for the outstanding care and concern that they devote to my care.|Ashley is knowledgeable and helpful in regards to my pain management. She gives well thought out advice and possible solutions to my particular problems. I am very pleased with the level of care and support I receive from Ashley|My  experience at the Hendersonville office has been a very friendly one. My front desk angel is miss Kori,  my nurse is miss April, and my blessed doctor is miss Rebekah. They take great care of me. I'm so glad I have them.|I am writing my review for Ashley Prichard located at the Murfreesboro location. Ashley truly takes time to genuinely show her interest in my overall health and well being. She is always kind and consistently has helped me with chronic back pain. I recently had an issue with another health concern and even went to an orthopedic surgeon that got me absolutely nowhere. During my visit with Ashley just a few days later, I told her about the issue and within 2 days she had me in to get a nerve study and I am now scheduled for surgery for the issue. I truly believe that I would have kept searching for answers without being given concrete belief in my pain, getting into the nerve study so quickly, & finally being scheduled for surgery. If I could give both Ashley and her nurse, Faith, 10 stars each, I would! Both of them have been so helpful and kind to me. I'm eternally grateful for their willingness to listen, their kindness, their assistance in facilitating getting me help in other areas of my healthcare, and their attention to detail on paperwork that I've had to submit for short term disability and FMLA. I don't know what I would have done without their help! Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!|At the Hendersonville office of Comprehensive Pain and Neurology they provide excellent, knowledgeable, compassionate and supportive care.

column3:
Comprehensive Pain and Neurology Center, PLLC serves Middle Tennessee with specialized care for chronic pain management and neurological conditions. Established as the region's premier pain treatment facility, our practice combines advanced interventional procedures with comprehensive therapeutic approaches to address complex pain issues. With our flagship location in Murfreesboro and multiple satellite offices throughout Middle Tennessee, we've created an accessible network of care designed to help patients find relief and improve their quality of life.

At Comprehensive Pain & Neurology Center, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life. Our multidisciplinary team utilizes state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and evidence-based treatments to develop personalized care plans. We specialize in interventional procedures including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and minimally invasive surgical techniques that target the source of pain while minimizing recovery time.

Comprehensive Approach to Treatment

What distinguishes our practice is our holistic approach to pain management. Beyond interventional procedures, we incorporate physical therapy, medication management, psychological support, and lifestyle modifications to address pain from multiple angles. Our physicians work collaboratively with each patient to establish realistic goals and develop treatment strategies that align with their specific needs and circumstances.

Convenient Locations Across Middle Tennessee

Our main office at 2548 Rideout Lane in Murfreesboro serves as our central hub, with additional locations strategically positioned throughout Middle Tennessee to ensure convenient access for all patients. This regional network allows us to provide consistent, high-quality care regardless of where our patients live or work.

If you're struggling with chronic pain or neurological conditions, contact us at (615) 410-4990 to schedule a consultation. Learn more about our services and approach to pain management by visiting our website at www.tnpainexperts.com.
column11: Comprehensive Pain & Neurology Center is Middle Tennessee's comprehensive resource for chronic pain treating. With multiple locations across Middle Tennessee, we provide patients with interventional procedures and therapies to help relieve their pain and reclaim their lives.

column40:
I see Kelly. She's Very Quick, Thorough and Smart! She listens to what's going on with you. She will make suggestions or recommendations to try to help.
I'm Very Thankful for her and ALL of her help with my care!|I have 80% 3rd degree burns w/chronic pain & nerve damage. It's not about feeling zero pain at all times. That's how addiction happens. It's about taking the least amount of meds to make your life manageable & restore positive moments. I can't express enough how much gratitude I have for Ashley Prichard & her care. Pain management has such a bad connotation associated w/it. Having scheduled pain meds that are moderated lets me live my life to a fuller extent, & that is worth absolutely everything. I had surgery about 10 days ago to be told by the hospital I wasn't in pain. I had "anxiety" & nothing was given by the hospital for home. They said I had worse surgeries (so essentially you'll get over it). It was horrible. I've been burned since I was 2. I know when I'm in pain. I called the clinic who fixed it. I turned around & had a 2nd surgery 5 days later for Ashley to be in knowledge of. Today, another 5 days later, is the first time I've been able to get up & out. My family came from Louisiana to support & bc of the meds I was able to sit/stand enough for splatter painting & have a family day. That is irreplaceable. That's what pain mang is about. It's not about getting what you think you should. It's restoring baseline quality of Iife for me. W/o proper meds, it would never have happened. I'm extremely grateful for the care here. She listens & responds appropriately. Visits can be short & predictable if nothing new is on the table which I appreciate, or they can be as long as you need to discuss things. People not liking the front desk people, have a sense of humor & do the right thing & you'll be fine. All positive here :)|I have been having pain and numbness in my arm and neck. I was fortunate to get an appointment with in 2 days. Everyone in the front was great. I have been in a suboxone program for a real long time with  another Doctor and I was afraid that I was not going to get help with my pain because of that but I was wrong. When I went back to see Cheryl she was wonderful. She listened and told me what she could do for me. Then I was fortunate again that Dr Schneider was in his office and he came in to talk with me. He examine me and said that he would do test to find out what was wrong in my arm and what was causing the numbness. He was nothing but great. He perscribe a medication that did't interfere with any other medication I already take.  Cheryl is going to give me a shot in my neck that will help with the pain also. Let me say again she was kind and careing and Dr Schneider listened and put me on a path to find out what we can do to fix my problem.
Everyone that helped me in that office was patience and kind and respecfful...|When I was referred to CPS I was hopeful... But that was quickly dashed, I was treated very rudely the front desk staff.. but I've been treated rudely before so I continued... However when I got in to see a doctor things did not get better and I understood why the office staff behaved the way they did.. the doctor was just as rude and judgmental as the rest of the staff... I hope at some point they were able to help somebody....but for me it was no bueno!!|I really love Dr. Kelly & the entire staff!!! Everyone is very nice, friendly & helpful. Dr. Kelly has helped me go down from taking 60mg morphine multiple times daily to 7.5 percocet & I feel so much better yet still manage my pain well with the decrease. I am forever greatful to her for helping me, working with me & being patient & kind on my journey to achieve a better quality of life with my daily pain & aching. Dr. Kelly is  amazing & she really cares about her patients.|The PA kelly is the worst medical professional I have ever seen. She has lied to her patient and has the worst bed side manner if have ever witnessed|Five stars for Tonya Armstrong, New Patient Coordinator at Comprehensive Pain & Neurology Center

Tonya Armstrong is an exemplary New Patient Coordinator who made my experience at Comprehensive Pain & Neurology Center exceptional. Her professionalism, empathy, and efficiency were truly remarkable.

From the moment I contacted the clinic, Tonya's warm and friendly demeanor put me at ease. She listened attentively to my concerns and promptly addressed all my questions and apprehensions. Her knowledge of the center's services and procedures was impressive, and she provided clear and concise explanations.

Tonya's attention to detail was evident in the way she handled my paperwork and insurance information. She ensured that everything was in order and kept me updated throughout the process. Her thoroughness gave me confidence that my medical needs would be well taken care of.

What truly sets Tonya apart is her genuine care for patients. She went above and beyond to make my visit as comfortable and stress-free as possible. Her warm smile and compassionate nature created a welcoming environment that eased my anxiety.

Tonya's dedication to her role is commendable. She exemplifies the highest standards of patient care and is a valuable asset to Comprehensive Pain & Neurology Center. I highly recommend her services to anyone seeking exceptional medical care.

Thank you, Tonya Armstrong, for your outstanding service. You are a true gem in the healthcare field, and I am grateful for the exceptional care you provided.

Sincerely, George Ogden|Had to get a babysitter for 3 kids and wake up for this appointment that I have had scheduled for two weeks just to be told I needed to reschedule when I got here because they didn't have time to see me after my cardiologist said I needed to be seen for my headaches

column3:
Spine & Pain Associates in Bristol, Tennessee offers comprehensive interventional pain management services to patients throughout the Tri-Cities region. Our board-certified specialists utilize advanced diagnostic techniques and minimally invasive procedures to address chronic pain conditions affecting the spine, joints, and nervous system. We take pride in our patient-centered approach, developing customized treatment plans that focus on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

At Spine & Pain Associates, we provide a wide range of interventional procedures including epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and targeted medication delivery systems. Our team specializes in treating conditions such as herniated discs, spinal stenosis, sciatica, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Each treatment plan is tailored to address the specific needs and goals of our patients.

Our Facility and Approach

Located at 350 Blountville Hwy, Suite 105 in Bristol, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology for precise diagnosis and treatment. We believe in a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, often coordinating care with physical therapists, neurologists, and other specialists to ensure comprehensive treatment. Our compassionate staff is committed to creating a comfortable environment where patients feel heard and respected throughout their pain management journey.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please call us at (423) 797-5505. You can also visit our website at http://www.spinepainassociates.com/ to learn more about our services and treatment options. Our office is conveniently located to serve patients from Bristol, Johnson City, Kingsport, and surrounding communities in Northeast Tennessee and Southwest Virginia.

MidSouth Interventional Pain Institute Ambulatory Surgery Center in Germantown, Tennessee offers comprehensive interventional pain management services in a state-of-the-art ambulatory surgery center. Specializing in minimally invasive procedures and advanced pain relief techniques, our facility serves patients throughout the Mid-South region with personalized care plans designed to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Our board-certified physicians combine years of specialized training with cutting-edge technology to provide effective alternatives to traditional pain management approaches, helping patients return to their daily activities with improved function and quality of life.

At MidSouth Interventional Pain Institute, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, joint injections, and targeted nerve blocks. Our ambulatory surgery center is fully equipped with advanced imaging technology that allows for precise placement and maximum effectiveness of treatments. Each procedure is performed in a comfortable outpatient setting, allowing patients to return home the same day with minimal recovery time.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in developing individualized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient. Our team takes the time to thoroughly evaluate your condition, medical history, and previous treatments to determine the most appropriate interventional techniques for your specific pain concerns. This comprehensive approach ensures that we target the source of your pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Facility Information

Our modern ambulatory surgery center is conveniently located at 1365 W Brierbrook Rd, Germantown, TN 38138. The facility features comfortable waiting areas, private treatment rooms, and state-of-the-art surgical suites designed specifically for interventional pain procedures. For appointments or additional information, contact us at (901) 531-8549 or visit our website at https://midsouthpain.com/ to learn more about our services and treatment options.

At Integrity Pain Consultants, we utilize a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications. When the doctor finally came in the room and asked if I was ready, I said calmly that I had been ready for a hour. He went off on me and said that I had attacked his employees (even though I only calmly spoke to one employee) and continued to speak harshly to me about how disrespectful it was for me to come into his business, the one I paid for, and disrespect him and his employees. To avoid continued altercation, I calmly said I meant no disrespect and even apologized. He continued to speak to me very harshly and told me I could take my business elsewhere. I told him I just wanted to receive the procedure I had paid for and not hold him up any longer. It seemed he just wanted to argue. Part of me wanted to walk away, but I refused, after paying them, to give him the satisfaction of leaving. I was getting an injection in my spine which I had to be sedated for. He didn't wait for the sedation to fully kick in as I could feel the needle going into my neck. This doctor is a hack. Interventional Spine and Pain Center serves Middle Tennessee with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Based in Murfreesboro, TN, our specialized medical practice has established itself as a leader in innovative pain treatment approaches that go beyond conventional methods. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of our patients' lives, which is why we're committed to developing personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of discomfort rather than simply masking symptoms.

At Interventional Spine and Pain Center, we recognize that no two patients experience pain in the same way. Our medical team specializes in a wide range of interventional treatments and medication management options designed to provide effective relief. From advanced spinal injections and nerve blocks to carefully monitored medication regimens, we work closely with each patient to determine the most effective combination of treatments for their specific condition.

Serving Communities Throughout Middle Tennessee

Our central location in Murfreesboro allows us to conveniently serve patients from across the region, including Manchester, Lebanon, Clarksville, Tullahoma, Smyrna, Franklin, Nolensville, McMinnville, Winchester, and surrounding communities. We've built our reputation on providing accessible, high-quality care to patients throughout Middle Tennessee who are seeking relief from chronic pain conditions.

Patient-Centered Treatment Philosophy

We firmly believe that effective pain management requires a collaborative approach. Rather than applying a one-size-fits-all model, our specialists take the time to understand each patient's medical history, lifestyle factors, and specific pain challenges. This thorough assessment allows us to develop customized treatment plans that may include interventional procedures, medication management, or a combination of approaches designed to maximize pain relief while minimizing side effects.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at (931) 313-3820 or visit our website at https://www.manchesterpain.net/. Our clinic is conveniently located at 905 S Church St, Murfreesboro, TN 37130.

The Pain Management Group: Murfreesboro serves patients throughout Murfreesboro, TN and surrounding Middle Tennessee communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Established in 1996, this practice stands as Tennessee's most established pain management clinic, bringing over 25 years of specialized experience to patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Their Murfreesboro location at 1547 Warrior Drive provides accessible care in a modern, patient-centered facility designed specifically for pain treatment interventions.

The clinic features a multi-disciplinary team of board-certified physicians and advanced practitioners who collaborate to develop personalized treatment plans. Each provider brings specialized expertise in various pain management modalities, ensuring patients receive the most appropriate and effective care for their specific conditions. This team approach allows for comprehensive evaluation and innovative treatment strategies that address both symptoms and underlying causes.

Services and Treatment Options

Patients at The Pain Management Group benefit from a wide range of interventional procedures, medication management protocols, and complementary therapies designed to reduce pain and improve quality of life. The practice specializes in treating conditions including back and neck pain, joint disorders, neuropathic pain, post-surgical pain, and complex regional pain syndromes. Their evidence-based approach combines cutting-edge techniques with proven methodologies to deliver optimal outcomes.

Patient Experience

Vanderbilt Pain Management Center Clarksville serves the Clarksville, Tennessee community with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to improve quality of life for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. We're committed to our philosophy, "We're in this with you, to help you get the care you need, safely," which guides our patient-centered approach to pain treatment and management.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Our specialized team at Vanderbilt Pain Management Center offers evidence-based treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs. From interventional procedures to medication management and integrative therapies, our multidisciplinary approach addresses the physical, emotional, and psychological aspects of pain.

Safety Protocols

At Vanderbilt Health, patient safety remains our top priority, with measures that follow—and in some cases exceed—local, state, and CDC public health recommendations:

  • Everyone wears a mask - patients, visitors, doctors, nurses and staff
  • Rooms are sanitized between each patient
  • Public spaces are cleaned frequently throughout the day
  • Temperature checks and symptom screenings are conducted before facility entry
  • Waiting areas feature spaced seating and elevator capacity is limited to maintain physical distancing

    • Telehealth Options

    For patients seeking remote care options, telehealth visits may be available for certain appointments, providing convenient access to our pain management specialists from the comfort of home.

    Location and Contact Information

    The center is conveniently located at 800 Weatherly Dr, Suite 201, Clarksville, TN 37043. To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, call +1 615-322-4311 or visit our website at [Vanderbilt Pain Management Center Clarksville](https://search.vanderbilthealth.com/locations/vanderbilt-pain-management-center-clarksville?utm_source=Yext).
column11: We're in this with you, to help you get the care you need, safely. Vanderbilt Health has restarted surgeries, procedures and clinic visits that were paused or delayed. Safety is our top priority, with measures that follow - and in some cases exceed - local, state and CDC public health recommendations. Everyone wears a mask - patients, visitors, doctors, nurses and staff. We're sanitizing rooms between each patient, and cleaning public spaces frequently throughout the day. We're checking everyone for fever and symptoms before they enter our facilities. We've spaced chairs in waiting areas, limited the number who can ride elevators at once and made other changes so we can keep a safe (6 feet) physical distance. And telehealth visits may be...
column38: The Wanderer|Tashia Williams
column40:
I recently experienced an unfortunate and intense illness that saw me hospitalized for around 3 months over 4 stays.  I was fortunate enough to be treated at Vanderbilt hospital and thus was treated by this pain management team.  I was astonished and grateful for their approach, experience and knowledge base.  They were able to offer pain management medications that other physicians would likely not know existed and were fit for my condition.  Additionally, they did not make me feel stigmatized - as I was on a fairly high dose of opiates.  They were able to convert and step down my IV medications and transition to oral meds to facilitate my release and ability to manage my pain at home.

After discharge from the hospital, I continued to seek care from this pain management group at their Clarksville office.  More specifically I was treated by Dr. McDougal.  I cannot fully express how wonderful the experience was.  He made me feel comforted and that he sincerely cared for my condition and experience.

If you have the opportunity to seek treatment from this group, I would encourage you to do so.  I can honestly say that I have seldom ever experienced treatment that met the level that I received there.|

Eric Young, M.D. serves Murfreesboro, Tennessee and surrounding communities with specialized care in pain management and neurological conditions. With a comprehensive approach to treating spine and joint disorders, Dr. Young has established himself as a trusted medical professional dedicated to improving patients' quality of life through evidence-based treatments and personalized care plans.

At his practice located at 1272 Garrison Dr in Murfreesboro, Dr. Young offers expert diagnosis and treatment for a wide range of conditions affecting the musculoskeletal and nervous systems. His areas of expertise include:

  • Spine Conditions: Comprehensive care for lumbar, sacral, cervical, and thoracic spine disorders

  • Neurological Disorders: Treatment for peripheral neuropathy, nerve injuries, and spinal cord injuries

  • Pain Management: Specialized approaches for complex regional pain syndrome and widespread pain conditions

  • Arthritis Care: Therapeutic interventions for both osteoarthritis and rheumatoid arthritis

  • Trauma Recovery: Rehabilitation services for traumatic brain injuries and related conditions

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Young's practice emphasizes individualized treatment plans that address not only the symptoms but also the underlying causes of pain and dysfunction. Patients experiencing fibromyalgia, muscle sprains, overuse syndromes, or other chronic pain conditions receive comprehensive evaluations followed by tailored therapeutic interventions designed to maximize function and minimize discomfort.

Professional Background

As a board-certified physician, Dr. Young combines his medical expertise with a compassionate approach to patient care. His commitment to staying current with the latest advancements in pain management and neurological treatment ensures that patients receive the most effective care available. The practice utilizes state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and treatment modalities to address even the most challenging cases.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Eric Young, patients can call +1 615-867-7971 or visit the office at 1272 Garrison Dr, Murfreesboro, TN 37129. Additional information about Dr. Young's services and qualifications can be found on the official website at www.mmclinic.com.

column48: I thought I knew all about epidurals. However, that limited knowledge was for surgeries. My question is was some type of tube inserted which will have to be removed before future treatment/injections? I am somewhat confused. Feel much better.
column49: "A needle is used to insert a fine plastic tube called an epidural catheter into your back (spine) near the nerves that carry pain messages to your brain. The needle is then removed, leaving just the catheter in your spine. "

Tennessee Valley Pain Management serves Chattanooga, TN and the surrounding Tennessee Valley region with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians specializes in treating chronic and acute pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Since our founding, we have been committed to improving quality of life for those suffering from debilitating pain through minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and integrative therapies.

At Tennessee Valley Pain Management, we offer a wide range of treatments including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, joint injections, and medication management protocols. Our practice focuses on addressing conditions such as back and neck pain, sciatica, arthritis, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. We believe in a multidisciplinary approach that combines interventional procedures with physical therapy and behavioral health strategies when appropriate.

Patient-Centered Care

We pride ourselves on delivering compassionate, patient-centered care in a comfortable environment. Our staff works diligently to minimize wait times and ensure each patient receives the attention they deserve. New patients can typically schedule an appointment within 1-2 weeks, and we offer same-week appointments for urgent pain concerns. Our facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment to provide the highest standard of care.

BAD EXPERIENCE.  Im in 10/10 pain from 5 slipped discs.  I go visit Dr Dreskil (sp?).  He begins to tell me that he doesnt do opioids over and over from the beginning like im a drug addict. I tell him over and over thats not why im here.  I in pain just fix it.  Dont care what I take at this point.  He gives me a nerve pill prescription on friday and tells me to call him monday if its not doing the job and we can adjust. COOL.  After suffering all weekend, I call Monday morning at 8am and get pushed to his voicemail.  I call back Tuesday at 9am and again at 3pm leaving a message both times.  I call again on Wednesday at 9am frustrated and talk to the office manager then this doc.  They tell me every excuse under the sun.  ( had an emergency to deal with, I didnt get your messages, I only see 1 message ). I tell the doc that MY situation is an emergency too.  Its affecting every single thing in my life.  He spends 2 min on the phone with me and tells me to double my meds.  Was that so hard?  120 seconds on the phone.  So I call him today which is 2/10 at 8am and leave another message.  I call back at 1130 am and show my frustration to the front desk and get transferred to my doc.  He tells me that there really isnt anything else he can do bc I take delta 8 ( per my doc for my pain ) and then he tells me that he will just refer me to another place that does opiods.  WHAT THE HECK??!!??  I didnt say one word about pain pills.  This dude is Looney.  I wouldnt go to him if he was the last doc on the face of the planet.  This dude just wants to sell a certain pain solution for whatever reason but he is terrible and not nice to deal with  and just tries to talk over you like your not smart and he is superior.  Will never be back here ever again.|Had my first visit today at the Hixson office, and I am genuinely flabbergasted looking at some of these negative reviews. Dr. Dreskin has to be one of the nicest, and seemingly most genuine, doctors I've seen so far in my autoimmune struggle. Straightforward, non-judgemental, and reassuring. I'm beyond excited to start my journey with this office!|Dr. Dreskin is a dismissive and judgmental man. I was referred to Tennessee Valley pain management by my PCP. There is nothing more I hate than telling a doctor that I'm in pain. I have a complicated past. The cause of my pain is due to repeated physical trauma to my body for decades and injuring myself several times while working. Not only has that left my body traumatized but my mental health as well. In 2023 I had A trimalleolar fracture which is a break in three parts of the ankle joint: the lateral malleolus, the medial malleolus, and the posterior malleolus. It's the least common type of ankle fracture. The surgery was terrible. My foot was put back on my leg internally by plates and many screws and pins. I was on pain medication for 5 months. Non-weight bearing for 6 months. I wasn't weaned off the medication and was told I should do an outpatient detox which used suboxone to deal with the symptoms that I would have from abruptly stopping the high doses I had been on. I'm not sure why doctors don't wean people off of medication that causes these symptoms when the medication is abruptly stopped but I'm starting to think it has to do with money. I'm putting this all out there because Dr. Dreskin asked me what has caused my pain but never listened to my answer. He kept cutting me off after a few words. He asked why I had been on suboxone in the past. I started to tell him and he again cut me off. He had no idea where I was in pain other than a piece of paper with a picture of a body on it and I had that was from a pack of papers I was given when I first got there. I never even got past the first page before he told me there was nothing he could do for me.  He asked me if I was on mental health medication. He asked if had a psychiatrist. I was confused. I have my mental trauma handled. I was referred to him to help me with my pain until I was either surgically fixed or fixed with physical therapy. He had his mind made up about who I was before he ever saw me. I don't matter because somewhere on some piece of paper was a red flag and I didn't matter. I see other doctors and honestly, it seems to me that none of them want to treat me. What I tell them doesn't matter. I'm just a name on a folder  with a red flag on it and I'm not worth the paperwork or risk to medically treat but he will mentally treat me. He's probably got something worked out with a psychiatrist friend or a cute pharmaceutical rep.
What is a person's choices?  What's next?|Funniest thing 4 years of chronic pain and best he could do is epidurals that worked about two weeks.Dreskin wants you to come in monthly to see how you feel and possibly schedule another epidural.What he will prescribe will put you down mentally and physically and once you think your heads clearedup  it'll leave you with a week of suicidal thoughts.Because he sent you to his buddy in Cleveland because you need mental health counseling and he put you on some bs.BE AWARE Then when you choose to leave he will put bs in you're charts.Leave this guy alone. Not to mention they'll send a notice that you owe them well after you've paid youre out of pocket 75 a month when I haven't been there in two months.Pay 35 on a 75 doller doctor's bill nexttime I come I owe 75 again.|Dr. Dreskin is amazing. He listens and gives you treatment that makes you comfortable. He fixed a very painful issue for me within minutes and I am so grateful.|My sister was referred to this clinic by our PCP to see Dr. Dreskin. She has chronic pain, that includes but not limited to: Rheumatoid Arthritis, Osteoarthritis, Blounts disease (bone disease), Diabetic Neuropathy, CKD and is on dialysis. The doctor walked in and immediately explained that they don't prescribe opioids (we didn't ask for opioids). He exclaimed "if I broke every bone in my body, I wouldn't touch opioids." He didn't offer any other options and said if she was already taking hydrocodone, then the clinic policy was not to prescribe and that he'd have to refer her to another clinic in Cleveland TN. They didn't even TRY to talk alternative options. In and out in less than 3 minutes. The little blonde haired nurse was no better. I'm flummoxed.

We also heard from other patients that this same clinic prescribed hydrocodone and oxycodone so why they'd lie to us is beyond me. I'm assuming he looked at a trio of black women and assumed she was looking for pills like a junkie. WRONG. My sister hates taking pills but she's in pain all day everyday, her pain threshold never goes below a 4. Pain Management is not just about opioids and that he didn't even discuss alternatives is very disappointing. Do NOT come to this clinic. This doctor Dreskin is offering treatment based off his personal opinions without consideration for individual patients. I wouldn't send my worst enemy to this clinic.|So I have to be honest about my experiences with this office. After reading the reviews I was very nervous to even show up for my first appointment but I did and everything went wonderful. They ask you lots of questions and the entire time apologized for the depth of questions they asked. They made sure that the plan that my previous doctor had me on was working somewhat and what he wanted to do. I have been seeing him for about 5 months now and the staff has been wonderful and the doctor and I are on the same page. Like he said in my first appointment, I do not care who you where seeing or what you have been prescribed in the past we will continue what you think is working but no opiates. I explained I was fine with that and understood, even though I was on them for the past couple of years. He asked if I could call my old doctor if I really needed them. Took my drug test and a week later he call everything in including a small dose and at my next appointment I showed up with all my medications correctly he said thank you for being honest and doing what you said. Every appointment has been great have had some I wait 45 minutes to see him but less than 1/4th. If you are truly needing help and have the correct perception of what pain management is go see him, if you are just looking for pain pills it won't happen.|Dreskin is the worst person I've ever seen! He walks into the exam room no chart, no tablet that holds said chart nothing!! He never asked about my pain.. location, severity, onset, previous surgeries, allergies, previous medications from other Dr's and side effects of those...  NOTHING! First words from his lips were "I don't prescribe opioids now which of you is Debbie?" Before he even knew who i was he was already judging me! I proceeded to tell him I wasn't there for opioids I was there for something else... he still didn't change his cocky attitude or ask questions he literally had me breathe deep twice, left the room and never came back!! I hope God has mercy on his soul for judging so many people because when you take an oath to help people that need it you do just that not judge them!!

column2: Charles Hilgenhurst MD, Precision Pain Care- Smyrna, TN
column3:
Charles Hilgenhurst MD, Precision Pain Care serves Smyrna, TN and surrounding communities with specialized pain management solutions. As a premier spine and pain specialist practice, Dr. Hilgenhurst and his dedicated team focus on diagnosing and treating both acute and chronic pain conditions that affect quality of life. The practice combines evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate care to address complex pain issues originating in the neck, back, legs, shoulders, and head, including difficult-to-treat nerve pain conditions.

At Precision Pain Care, patients receive individualized treatment plans designed to address the root cause of their pain, not just mask symptoms. The practice utilizes advanced diagnostic techniques to accurately identify pain sources before implementing targeted interventions. Treatment options may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, therapeutic injections, and collaborative care approaches that maximize function while minimizing discomfort.

Specialized Expertise

Dr. Hilgenhurst brings extensive training and experience in pain medicine to each patient interaction. His expertise in spine-related conditions allows for precise diagnosis and treatment of complex cases that may have been previously misdiagnosed or inadequately managed. The practice stays current with the latest advancements in pain management to offer patients the most effective, evidence-based treatments available.

Patient-Centered Approach

Understanding that pain affects each person differently, Precision Pain Care emphasizes a patient-centered approach that considers physical symptoms alongside quality of life concerns. The friendly, professional staff works diligently to create a supportive environment where patients feel heard and valued throughout their treatment journey.

Contact Information

Location: 519 Enon Springs Rd E, Smyrna, TN 37167, United States

Phone: +1 615-223-6200

Website: www.precisionpaincare.com

Patients seeking relief from persistent or debilitating pain conditions are encouraged to contact Precision Pain Care to schedule a consultation with Dr. Hilgenhurst and discover personalized solutions for improved function and reduced pain.
column11: Spine and Pain Specialist office treating acute and chronic conditions causing pain in the neck, back, legs, shoulders, and head including nerve pain.

column40:
Very friendly staff. Doctor H is awesome, I had been dealing with back pain for years with no luck from any doctors. As soon as I had my first visit I knew what was going on and how he was going to fix it. I feel way better than all the years before,  I would recommend this team to anyone dealing with back or leg pain or any pain as they offer so many options for different needs.|Dr hilgenhurst is the best doctor all around iv ever been to. He has empathy and understanding which iv never had with other doctors in this type of practice. Iv been to a few different clinics over the past 13yrs and with each one I felt as if I were some kind of criminal. I felt afraid to even talk about the several conditions I have due to the way I was looked like by those doctors. Even with all the paper work and scans they were more worried about their limitations than they were doing any treatments to help me. Well,,I now have a doctor that listens and gives me hope of getting alot better. Iv been treated with respect and dignity for the first time ever.  Iv only been to a few visits and already getting back to myself. I'd advise anyone that needs help to become a little more normal and live the best they can with there medical conditions to come here.  I give Dr Hilgenhurst a solid 10 in health care treatment. A huge thank you to him and all his staff.!!!|From getting an appointment to my first visit l felt as if everyone actually cared all the staff was kind as well as being professional and l had no doubt Dr. Hilgenhurst knew exactly what he was doing with regards to my care. Thank you so very much.|Very prompt , courteous, informed. Dr Hilgenhurst called in a referral because of the level of pain that I have been dealing with the Doppler, xray, and ultra sound|The Staff are great, answered all My questions and Explained everything in detail on my level. The Physician listened to me and explained in detail, They're working with me on getting my pain management under control. They are Credit to the Medical Field. H.Cothern.|***************************
Very disappointed, I had never been to a pain clinic In my life. I'd waited anxiously to get In with Dr. Hilgenhurst given the fact that he Is the only doctor around that performs these Pudenal Nerve Block procedures, at least that my Insurance would cover. I've suffered from this type of nerve pain for 20 years and seen doctor after doctor for help, I'd traveled 2  hours seeking only a pudenal nerve block for my pudenal nerve entrapment, only to be let down again.

He only offered his opinion, and that Is that a pudenal nerve block would not help me ( I'm desperate here!), although he was quick to recommend a nerve stimulator Implant.
I didn't want his opinion, I'd done my research and sought relief from a disorder that Is categorized as CSD, It's not a laughing matter, it's a painful female (as well as male) nerve disorder, for me It was caused by a traumatic child-birth delivery at the age of 31. I've continued to suffer for 20 years with this life-altering pain In which almost took my life In 2005 due to doctors negligently prescribing anti-depressants (ie., Lexapro & risperdal, Vioxx) In which I did not need, I needed the damn nerve pain to stop. I wasnt depressed, I was In pain that made It hard to have any quality of life due to nerve compression and I'd deserved to be listened to.

I only continue to suffer still, only now It's worse because I've lost total control of my bladder and i have to wear pull-ups now, had doctor's only believed me and not dismissed me, my life would be much different now.

I'm just dumbfounded by the lack of concern shown and the lack of any expertise concerning this mis-diagnosed and biasely named condition women have to suffer with due to the lack of duty & care that Is shown. It's almost too humiliating to talk about.

You sit on this pudenal nerve keeping It aggravated, how will It ever go away?

I could write a book.

**** Update:
After leaving the office upset and after hearing the depth of my story afterwards, thankfully Dr.Hilgenhurst's office reached out and heagreed to doing the procedure.
Hopefully life for me gets better from here.

Mother's you are your own best advocate when It comes to private & embarrassing Issues like this ( ie., nerve pain radiating from the pudenal nerve to the vagina and up through the spine).

Speak up and don't suffer through the pain due to embarrasment like I did.

Kind Regards|No  nobody need to go  down they don't know how likes it so much everyone they nice to me|I've been a patient of Dr. Hilgenhurst for almost 12 years now. He is an excellent physician. He truly gives you the attention needed to help you with your pain issues. He takes the time to go over the diagnosis clearly and treatment options. It's rare to find a doctor that combines such personal touches and care for a patient. Me and my husband travel  3 hours one way to see Dr. Hilgenhurst, but it's worth it. I always get the best quality of medical care in all my appointments. Dr. Hilgenhurst, for all these years I want to say thank you so much for your kind and thoughtful concern in regard to my pain issues. The staff were always polite, friendly and helpful. The clinic is nice and  clean. I highly recommend Dr. Hilgenhurst to be your pain physician.

The Pain Management Group: Centennial serves patients throughout Nashville, Tennessee and surrounding Middle Tennessee communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Established in 1996, THE PAIN MANAGEMENT GROUP has earned its reputation as Tennessee's most established pain management practice, bringing over 25 years of specialized experience to those suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Their multi-disciplinary approach combines the expertise of board-certified physicians and advanced practitioners who work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans for each patient.

At their conveniently located Centennial facility at 2222 State St, Suite C in Nashville, the team offers evidence-based interventions designed to address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Their comprehensive approach may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and innovative treatment modalities tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes The Pain Management Group is their unwavering commitment to patient care. Understanding that pain affects every aspect of life, they take time to listen to patients' concerns, thoroughly evaluate their conditions, and develop treatment strategies that align with individual goals and lifestyles. This patient-centered philosophy has helped countless individuals reclaim their quality of life and return to activities they enjoy.

Contact Information

Patients seeking relief from chronic or acute pain conditions can schedule a consultation by calling +1 615-941-8538. Their Centennial office is located at 2222 State St, Suite C, Nashville, TN 37203. For additional information about their services or to explore their multiple locations throughout Middle Tennessee, visit their website at https://thepainmanagementgroup.com/locations/.

column38: Tina Ward|Jennifer Esther Brown|Wanda carney|Molly Beasley|Rachel Hodges|Rooster Davis|C DE|Khay Williams
column40:
I'm always nervous when I have to start over with a new Doctor because of my complicated medical history. I always go to the clinic website and read reviews and when I read the reviews I was side eyeing and was nervous as I stated previously. I like to get to know the Doctor for myself. When Dr. McHugh walked in he was pleasant, he walked in with a smile and he spoke me like a human being. We were cracking jokes and everything, things that I didn't understand he took the time out to explain it to me. People need to understand Doctors are human too so we are all entitled to a bad day.|49 surgeries general anesthesia
2 urethroplasty transplants
1 suprapubic catheter several months
1 parathyroidectomy
End stage arthritis in right foot
Frozen shoulder
Hiatal hernia
Hashimotos stage 2
Fibromyalgia
Post menopausal
Chronic kidney disease stage 3b
Misdiagnoses with implanted batteries and interstem device that almost killed me
Hypercalcemia, hyperparathyroidism
Severe lethargy from comorbid pain
Ocular migraines Sensitivity to light
Shattered left foot requiring pins with 2 reconstructive surgeries

Every day I wake up I have pain in every part of my body.

I've always been a very productive, highly effective person. Pain management enables me to work at some capacity, not full time unfortunately, but it enables me to move, think, breath which lessens the anxiety, fear and depression I experience on a daily basis, common for those who've experienced long term, multiple, life threatening medical trauma...acute trauma as well as chronic.

I have a recent B.A. in psychology, studied Health Psychology & Medical Sociology at the 400 level.

Different people respond to pain in various ways depending on multiple factors. Each individual's physiology can greatly differ.

CIPA or congenital insensitivity to pain and anhydrosis is a condition where somebody cannot feel any pain. They could jump off a building, break both legs, rupture their spleen and not feel a thing. Most of these people don't live past their early twenties at best.

On the other end of the spectrum, there are also people who experience pain more diversely and prolifically, as has been studied with functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI).

In addition to our endocrine, nervous & parasympathetic nervous and neurological systems as well as other biological factors, some people feel pain way more intensely than the average person. Conditions for example like neuropathy, which can sometimes be cured with simple steroid treatment, but not every pain can be eliminated or mitigated with a nerve block or steroid treatment or other non-narcotic pain medications and treatment including surgery.

Until you walk a mile in a person's shoes, it is beyond presumptuous to assume that anybody who takes pain medication is addicted to pain medication. In fact, to think that way is not only ignorant, it is cruel.

This opioid crisis is happening because not enough people are being prescribed pain medications they need in order to not only function but just to wake up everyday and not cry from the moment they wake up till the moment they go to sleep from pain and how it changes a person's entire life.

When people do not get properly treated for pain, that is when they start seeking medication in non-conventional ways and that's when they unfortunately come across street drugs that have been cut with fentanyl.

This opioid crisis is not happening from the over-prescribing of pain medications. It's much broader and more complex than that.

Many overdoses are happening because patients, or people who are suffering from chronic pain, are self-medicating because they are unable to access pain management either because of their financial situation or because they simply live where there is no access to responsible, compassionate pain management.

It is incredibly difficult to be responsible for even the most educated and safest pain management clinics and their providers because of the opioid crisis.

To be a pain management provider, clinics are a highly criticized area of medicine that in and of itself is part of the opioid crisis.

The less pain management clinics and the less pain management providers we have, the more overdosing and accidental overdoses we're going to see because people are going to be self-medicating if they are unable to obtain professional pain management due to either financial hardship or not being able to access it because of
their location.

To say I am grateful that I have access to a responsible and compassionate pain management provider would be the greatest understatement of my entire life.|I had an appointment at 10:15. They called me back and I had to set in the exam room for an hour. No explanation not even a sorry you've been waiting so long. I'm not happy with the waiting.|I had my 1st visit on 4/15/24 at the Pain Center. Upon being called back from the waiting area the nurse tech found a bedbug on the back my shirt. I'm totally upset and totally disgusted. The tech stated a patient got bite a couple of weeks ago and she thought they sprayed; well apparently not. The sad thing the tech got bit this morning as well.

When I told the doctor Daniel McHugh about the bedbug and me getting bite him and his assistant showed no concern given. Not to mention his bedside manners were blah. They need to have that place fumigated. The nurse tech doesn't work in the waiting room but where the patients are seen so how did she get bite???|My husband doctor didn't even help him at all he kept giving him the run around -1 star there no good doctors office his was Dr McHugh|It is with much disappointment that I write about this clinic that bills itself as a PAIN MANAGEMENT CLINIC.

I live in my city of Nashville Tennessee and I was born 1959 so I am not a young man but I have been working since 1975 and I was working a full time job but I started to have problems with my balance in January of 2023 and I was falling unexpected out of nowhere I started going to the Mid-town hospital emergency room with pain in my left leg and shoulder, I had CT scan Xrays and everything my primary care doctor finally had me take a MRI and it was then that I was advised that I needed spinel fusion and have a plate installed in my spine so I was really scared to get it done but my primary care doctor was very concerned and he informed me that if I did not get it done if I fell it could possibly lead me being in a wheelchair.

On June 16, 2023 I had the procedure done at the Howell Allen Clinic by Dr. Adam Reig I am a 63 year old man and I am a African American citizen my surgery was over $73,000 that was paid by united health care but it was not right now I have pain in my left shoulder but I have also been diagnosed with arthritis in my shoulders both sides and I have been working with a physical therapist who has been coming to my house after I started having issues with my shoulders and my neck trying to establish my range of motion and I was advised by Dr. Reig that I needed to take time to heal and I should use a cane to make sure I didn't fall in the mean time Dr. Reig said that he could not continue to provide me with pain medication and he would recommend that I get a pain management help to help me with my discovery and the above name Clinic is where I wound up with.
07/26/23 was my 1st time visiting this clinic and I had the Misfortune to meet with Dr. McHugh when he walked in the room he had a young lady who was recording the conversation and it went something like this. He walks into the room and he barely shakes my hand he asked me why I was here he asked me why I was walking with a cane and he was very rude and he said that I was pill shopping after he made the statement he tried to move on but I interrupted him and I said that I didn't appreciate that he didn't know me and he was accusing me of being there for drugs something is very wrong with him and I told him that his oath was too treat pain and if I told him that I was hurting he should believe me I was taking a stronger dose of pain medicine and he has cut it down. I don't believe that he could talk to me like that but I have started to let people know and I called me insurance company to advise them about what I was treat like. I have only been out of surgery for less than 6 weeks and I was given the least amount of medication I have some Xrays that he prescribed for me to do and I am going to follow his advice but if your doctor refers you to the Pain Management group you need to find another one the review on here are very real and I feel that he would not have said that a white person was pill shopping.

I am not able to go back to work and I am depressed to know that I am going to have to file a disability claim after working all of my life he thinks that I want to shop for pain medication I would give everything to get back my health and return to work I know what I feel and I just know that something is wrong with my recovery from my spine surgery.

It has been a really long day to have a doctors tell me that I don't need a cane and I am looking for drugs when I am just wanted to not be in pain.

I am signing my name on this one I think he is a racist guy who looks down on the very people who keeps his lights on inside his building.

Please go somewhere else

Rooster Davis
I am not through I am going to let the insurance company know how he is and if you have been treated like this as well please let others know

I really think that he is racist person|DR MCHUGH DOES NOT CARE HOW MUCH I AM SUFFERING! I TOLD HIM I HAVE A LOT OF PAIN ESPECIALLY AT  NIGHT. HE SENT ME FOR X-RAYS AND I TOOK THEM THE SAME DAY BUT HE INSISTS HE CANNOT HELP ME OR LOOK AT THE XRAYS UNTIL MY NEXT APPOINTMENT IN FOUR WEEKS! AND I HAVE RHEUMATOID ARTHRITIS ALSO! HE DOES NOT CARE ABOUT OUR HUMANITY. He gave me tramadol when I can feel my joint popping like they are about to come out of the socket. I wonder if all of his good reviews are from fictitious accounts. He sure did not care about me.|Dr. McHugh is compassionate and serious. I just love how he enters the room. He loves his job and his intent is to make you feel better. I enjoy each visit and his staff are always the same nice, helpful individuals.

column3:
Interventional Pain Consultants serves Knoxville, Tennessee and surrounding areas with specialized pain management solutions designed to help patients reclaim their quality of life. Founded with a commitment to compassionate care, this premier medical practice offers comprehensive treatment options for individuals suffering from chronic pain conditions. Their team of board-certified specialists utilizes advanced interventional techniques and multi-disciplinary approaches to address pain at its source rather than simply masking symptoms.

It is the mission of Interventional Pain Consultants to improve the lives of those we serve with a commitment to care and excellence in all that we do. The practice strives to offer quality multi-disciplinary care that exceeds community standards while providing compassionate, cost-effective and accessible treatment for all patients. This patient-centered approach ensures that each individual receives personalized attention and customized treatment plans.

Comprehensive Pain Management

The burden of chronic pain, regardless of its source, can have a crippling effect on daily life. At Interventional Pain Consultants, the medical team understands that patients deserve treatment plans specifically designed to meet their individual needs. Utilizing a wide variety of pain intervention procedures, the specialists work diligently to improve overall quality of life, enabling patients to return to the activities they enjoy.

Services Offered

The practice provides a range of advanced interventional procedures including epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. Their comprehensive approach addresses various pain conditions such as back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome.

Contact Information

Interventional Pain Consultants welcomes new patients at their conveniently located office at 11416 Grigsby Chapel Rd, Knoxville, TN 37934. To schedule a consultation, patients can call +1 865-218-2100 or visit their website at https://www.ipctennessee.com/ for more information about their services and treatment options.
column11:

Our goal is to offer quality multi-disciplinary care that exceeds community standards while providing compassionate, cost effective and accessible care for all our patients.

Utilizing a wide variety of pain intervention procedures, we strive to improve your overall quality of life, so you may return to the activities you enjoy.

They take the time to listen to you and explain things when you ask. I'm very happy with their caring and professional behavior. I would definitely recommend this practice to others.|Just a wonderful place. Atmosphere is very casual. All of the Dr's and nurses are as nice as they can be. I hated the thought of having to go to one of these places but they have all been so good to me I don't think I could have found anyplace any better.|I have been coming here for years, and all I can say is it is 5 star all the way around. From the moment you check in, to the time the nurse takes you back, then when the Dr. sees you, everyone is absolutely the best. I would not go anywhere else. My Dr., Dr. Crowder, is so wonderful, she takes time to listen to you, to get to know you, and to understand you. I highly recommend her!! I also get injections here, and they are top notch. They take great care of you from start to finish. I can not say enough great things about this place. Highly, highly recommend, 5 stars|My husband and I have been coming here for years and the girls in front are very helpful. The nurses are wonderful and the drs are always great and I have had several procedures that have gone well. I highly recommend them for all your pain needs.|I have been to Intervention Pain 3 times, I have NEVER been taken back to the doctors in a timely fashion.  Three visits and waited a hour past my appointment time each time. They requested me to be there 30 minutes early and have had to wait 1 hour or more past my appointment time.  My time is as valuable as yours and will not be back.
