column3:
The Pain Management Group: Antioch serves residents throughout Middle Tennessee with comprehensive pain management solutions. Established in 1996, this practice stands as Tennessee's most established pain management clinic, bringing over 25 years of specialized experience to patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Their multi-disciplinary approach combines the expertise of board-certified physicians and advanced practitioners to create personalized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient.

At The Pain Management Group, patients receive evidence-based treatments designed to reduce pain, improve function, and enhance quality of life. The team specializes in managing various pain conditions, including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and pain resulting from injuries or surgical procedures. Their comprehensive approach may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Located at 5801 Crossings Blvd in Antioch, TN 37013, The Pain Management Group offers a convenient setting for patients throughout Middle Tennessee. The facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technologies to ensure patients receive the highest standard of care. New and returning patients can schedule appointments by calling +1 615-941-8538.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes The Pain Management Group is their commitment to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. The team takes time to explain pain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. This collaborative approach has helped countless individuals regain function and improve their daily lives despite chronic pain challenges.

For more information about services or to request an appointment, visit their website at thepainmanagementgroup.com or contact their office directly.
column11:
THE PAIN MANAGEMENT GROUP is a multi-disciplinary team of board-certified physicians and advanced practitioners dedicated to the treatment of acute and chronic pain in Middle Tennessee.

As Tennessee's most established pain management practice, we have been seeing patients in Middle Tennessee since 1996.

Wish I could give No stars I was going there for 3 years and never in my life have I ever tested positive for any illegal drugs. Not there or any other doctors office. But NP Shannon told me I did. How is this possible I don't do any drugs I don't smoke weed I don't even smoke cigarettes. So how could I have a positive result. I notice when they take your urine their cups don't have your name on it or birthday. Maybe my urine specimen got mixed up with someone else because how could I ever have a positive test. I'm so upset and embarrassed by this I cried in the office after hearing that a square like me had anything positive in my system and NP Shannon could care less.|This is for pain management and I love my Dr. They are concerned about giving me the best care possible and I feel they care about me. They always answer my questions if I have any concerns. They accept self pay when most places don't. They are very good about not making me wait very long past my appointment time & that means a lot especially since I drive 1.5 hrs to them every month.|I just started going to PMG in Antioch, Tn and from the beginning of my appointment till the end, Arnold at the front desk was amazing!  Also, I had problems getting my meds one day and Dr. Hill stop what he was doing to contact the pharmacy so I could get my prescription.  It took him at least an hour calling them and getting my script sent else where! I see all kinds of bad reviews but I must say, I don't have anything to say negatively!  Thank you Arnold for starting my day off right with your kindness and thank you Dr. Hill for the care you showed me, most doctors would not do that!|Emily Z Philpott, treated me Very Bad to the point she left me in the room without telling me the appointment was over so when I noticed she wasn't coming back,I heard her SCREAMING in the hall ! Her ATTITUDE was SO BAD,so she then KICKED me out of the PROGRAM for a year...I'm Amazed that someone as RUDE as Emily Would be given that much POWER! Over a Human Life!|I really liked Dr. Hill, at first but after I started seeing Mary Hunyh this year, the visits went down hill from there. She makes it clear, she doesn't care about her patients, or their pain. I been going there 4 years or more and I can't believe things turned out the way they did and I still have lots of back pain. It really hurt my feelings, how they treated me and the excuses they use and not try to help the patient.|I can not say enough about the compassion, kindness and really great care that I've received from Dr. Hill. I was able to get a same day appointment with Dr Hill when I was having excruciating pain. From the moment he stepped into the exam room to begin the assessment, and throughout the visit and procedure, Dr Hill was focused, empathetic, and extremely proficient. I left the visit with significant improvement with my pain, and a treatment plan that I participated in and understood. I am beyond thankful for this clinic and for Dr. Hill!!|My visit today left me very unsettled. The level of care, or lack there of, was so horrendous I wish I didn't drive an hour away for my pitiful visit. The doctor was demeaning towards me when I was open about having bipolar disorder. He stated over and over that I should go see my psychiatrist, though I'd spoken with her before my visit. My primary care doctor left me high and dry once she was needed to fill out a prior authorization so I went to a specialist who would follow through with ordering an MRI. Apparently that's "doctor shopping" and is why it's taking so long to find what's wrong with me. I didn't appreciate being talked down to. I was wary of going to a pain clinic in the first place because all of the negative connotations...which turned out to be true. I would give 0 stars but unfortunately that's not an option.|I am always met with friendly, courteous staff at check-in.  My wait time is minimal and nursing staff are professional and  informative.  My doctor is outstanding not only for lthe care he provides but for listening to me and making adjustments that keep my pain under control.

I had back surgery in 2006.  Since that time I have seen doctors in several states but since moving to Tennessee and finding PMG and Dr. Hill, I have had nothing but the best of care.

Nour  B.

column3:
NorthStar Pain Management serves Cordova, Tennessee with specialized physical therapy and pain management solutions. Our healthcare facility focuses on comprehensive treatment approaches for patients suffering from mobility limitations and chronic pain conditions. At NorthStar, we believe in personalized care—creating individualized treatment plans that address each patient's unique physical condition, medical history, and recovery goals. Our team of licensed physical therapists combines evidence-based techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain function and improve their quality of life.

NorthStar Healthcare Cordova offers physical therapy programs designed to evaluate and treat patients experiencing mobility impairments due to illness or injury. Our therapeutic approaches incorporate various modalities including manual therapy, therapeutic exercise, neuromuscular re-education, and specialized pain management techniques. We understand that recovery is a personal journey, which is why our physical therapists develop customized treatment plans tailored to each patient's specific needs, condition, and recovery objectives.

Our Approach to Pain Management

What sets NorthStar apart is our integrated approach to pain management. We combine traditional physical therapy with innovative pain relief strategies to address both symptoms and underlying causes. Our specialists work collaboratively to ensure patients receive comprehensive care that promotes long-term healing rather than just temporary symptom relief. This multidisciplinary approach has helped countless patients in the Cordova area return to their daily activities with reduced pain and improved function.

Visit Our Facility

Located at 1540 Appling Care Ln # 105, Cordova, TN 38016, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art rehabilitation equipment and comfortable treatment spaces. To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, call us at (901) 444-3950 or visit our website at northstarpain.net. Our friendly staff is ready to help you begin your journey toward improved mobility and pain relief.
column11: Northstar Healthcare Cordova physical therapy is designed to evaluate and treat patients with illnesses or injuries that impair their mobility and function. It involves a variety of techniques and treatment modalities that can help patients move and feel better. Since every patient is unique, you can expect a physical therapist to design a treatment plan that is ideal for your particular body, condition, and goals.

I have had the worse experience It has taken about 7 months to get my medicine she keep asking for this paper and that scheduling any type of test to prolong my prescriptions they"re not accepting my insurance for my visit they keep charging me even though my insurance said there is no copay and they discuss your business out in the open This doctor is very rude and most of the staff except for Carla she is very nice. Nothing you do is enough she is stressing me out this my second month of recieving meds I feel like im in the torture chamber just to get relief from pain the turn over is constanly|Would not refer this place to any living thing! The NP is racist and mean. Made snarky remarks about my health with absolutely no bedside manner at all. The front desk people are rude as hell. I gave one star because you have to give at least one...they deserve like a triple double negative!!! DO NOT GO HERE!|I wish I could give them a negative.  I should have stayed with Spectrum Pain Clinic.  Angela Cook is very incompetent, lazy and non caring.  I don't know how she passed anything.  She has refused to treat my 78 year old father who has dementia because she is upset over a phone conversation she and I had.  Don't know how you can sleep at night refusing my elder father's med's because you are upset with me.  I am turning you in to Nashville for Elderly Abuse and Abusing your authority.  You should be disbarred for your unprofessionalism.|I've been going here several years and been through at least 5 or 6 NPs.  The new one is scary stupid.  Dr's keep changing;. Nps keep changing and the remaining staff lies to everyone about why.

Dr Bromley and NP Ashley Pennington are both at Southern Pain on Rex Rd in Memphis.  They're taking new patients and their quality of care is exceptional.  I moved from North Star after digging for 6 months to find out the truth and where they'd moved.|Absolutely love this place & their staff! They are truly there to help you get back the best quality of life. When I came across any problems with the drug store, insurance, or even my workplace, my nurse practitioner was on top of it & got it resolved quickly. Speaking of the NP, they do have Dr.'s whose patients seem to be just as happy, but personally I don't know of any better treatment that could be received. The staff is very professional & friendly. They all work together & make it's a place that assures you help is there & available.|Gerri is the worse nurse practitioner ever. Ashley and Angie were the best. Gerri is there to get rid of patients who are really in need of their pain medications. I would not recommend anyone to see her because she is always in people personal business that has nothing to do with her. However, she is the only one at this facility at the moment. Before Ashley and Angie left, no patients wanted to see her. The only thing  the corporate office has to do is pull her record. I  have never had any problems with my pain meds until she became my nurse practitioner. I pay cash out of my pocket to receive treatment, no insurance or anything.

If all the patients here would not continue to go to this facility since she is still here, then the facility would not make money and could not survive without the patients.  The staff here is great, but the  nurse practitioner is awful and I'm only going to continue to see her until my PCP can refer me to a totally different company.

I have never had any problems with anyone at the facility, especially, nurse practitioners other than this one, which leads me no other choice but to leave this facility because that is her goal to get rid of all the black people from this facility because majority of the patients are black.

I'm sure there might be some backlash concerning this post , but I don't care because others always wanted to say what I'm saying now but refused to out of fear. I fear no one but God and if I am dismissed because of my post and telling the truth we'll so be it and watch for another letter coming from my attorney addressing my issues and suing this company for freedom of speech and being truthful.

I'm not going to pay cash out of my pocket and be treated like I'm no one by Gerrie (FNP).  I am highly disappointed and she is noisy in things that are personal and has nothing to do with her at all.  I never post anything about businesses or people, but this is enough and someone needs to know.|I have loved going to Northstar Pain Mgmt. for the last four years but if you need them when your medication is out of stock in your pharmacy they will not help you you will go a week maybe two weeks at a time before they will get in touch with you and change your medication so you're not sick and hurting. In other words if you don't ask anything of them it's a perfect place to go|The staff is nice, it has a very light and friendly atmosphere.  It may be a great place to work, but it's not so great to visit.  My Mother started going here after her doctor died suddenly several years ago.
Since then, there have been 5 separate FPN's, and now, thank goodness, our favorite has returned.
I'm not sure why that's been happening, but am glad our favorite is back.  We have experienced a few MAJOR SNAFU's regarding prescriptions, but MOST of the time there's no issue.
It's a telephonic nightmare to try to reach anyone.  The receptionist rarely answers and some of the department numbers are not even set up to receive messages!   I end up leaving messages for the maintenance department just to get a message through to SOMEbody!!
Just kidding, they don't even HAVE a maintenance department, which is unfortunately obvious, especially in the restrooms.  Broken, wiggly toilet seats are constant.
At times, the wait can go over an hour, the visits with the a "Doctor" are 10-15 minutes, tops, so most of the time, we are in and out in 2 hours.  This is TONS better than waiting 5-6 hours at her LAST doctor. So, we know how bad it COULD be, which is why, with all the shortcomings, I still give them a 4 star rating.
Since COVID-19 hit the scene, we've been having appointments via telephone, which go quickly and smoothly and that my Mother loves.
We DID have a glitch in THAT process the other day; they never called for the appointment interview, so I called to see why (they actually  answered the phone THAT time) and the receptionist told me that we were supposed to have COME IN for our appointment.  When I asked her how were we supposed to KNOW  that, since we have BEEN having phone interviews and no one TOLD us we had to come in for our next appointment, she said, "we have been telling everyone that if we DON'T call you, then you know to come in."
WHAT IN THE WORLD?!! First of all, you HAVEN'T been tellingly "everyone" because you didn't tell US!!  Secondly, that is exactly BACKWARDS!!  Sigh.
So, in conclusion, the clinic needs to tighten up on their procedures, pay more attention to detail and toilet seats.
We love Ashley Pennington, FPN.
Let's hope that will get us through all the rest of the problems they have!!

column3:
West Tennessee Bone & Joint Clinic in Jackson, Tennessee serves patients throughout West Tennessee with comprehensive orthopedic and pain management care. Led by specialists including Dr. Eric J. Homberg, MD, the clinic has established itself as a premier destination for patients seeking relief from acute and chronic pain conditions. Their state-of-the-art facility on Capital Avenue combines advanced medical technology with compassionate patient care to deliver exceptional treatment outcomes.

Dr. Eric J. Homberg, MD is a distinguished physician at West Tennessee Bone & Joint Clinic specializing in anesthesiology and interventional pain management. Board-certified in anesthesiology, Dr. Homberg brings extensive expertise in managing complex pain conditions through both traditional and innovative treatment approaches. He earned his medical degree from the University of Tennessee Center for the Health Sciences in Memphis, establishing a strong foundation for his specialized practice in pain management techniques that help patients regain mobility and improve quality of life.

Comprehensive Services

The clinic offers a wide range of orthopedic and pain management services, including diagnostic evaluations, minimally invasive procedures, and customized treatment plans. Dr. Homberg's interventional pain management techniques address conditions such as chronic back pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain. Patients benefit from evidence-based approaches that focus on both immediate pain relief and long-term management strategies.

Patient-Centered Approach

West Tennessee Bone & Joint Clinic prioritizes personalized care, ensuring each patient receives individualized attention and treatment plans tailored to their specific needs. The professional staff works collaboratively to create comprehensive care strategies that address not only symptoms but underlying causes of pain and mobility issues.

Location and Contact Information

The clinic is conveniently located at 50 Capital Ave, Jackson, TN 38305. Patients can schedule appointments by calling +1 731-661-9825 or visiting their website at www.wtbjc.com. The facility offers accessible parking and comfortable waiting areas designed with patient comfort in mind.
column11: Dr. Eric Homberg, who specializes in anesthesiology and interventional pain management, treats patients at West Tennessee Bone & Joint Clinic. He is board-certified in anesthesiology and earned his medical degree from the University of Tennessee Center for the Health Sciences in Memphis.

column40: I have always had a Great Experience with Dr. Homberg and West TN Bone & Joint Institute!  The surgery went well and the stimulator is working well!|Dr Homberg has been treating me over many years due to chronic back pain. In April of this year he implanted a pain pump and it has so far finally been the answer we've  have  been searching for. I am now able to enjoy  my life to its fullest!  Dr Homberg is absolutely Great!|Dr. Homberg and his staff have been awesome taking care of my back problems. He has explained the issues and is working to fix me.  I am grateful for their excellent care!|Dr Homberg provided the best care for my daughter. He's very thorough and was so kind to her when she was in a lot of pain. We are so thankful for him!|Dr. Homberg is an exceptional doctor. He cares for his patients and tells them exactly what he's going to do before he does it. He actually TALKS to his patients. I recommend him highly to anyone who has orthopedic problems.|He is absolutely the best! He is very concerned and values you as a person as well as a patient. He will keep trying to treat your chronic and debilliting pain until he finds a solution to your pain. He is just the very best and I would not trust anyone else to treat me surgically for this pain. I am scheduled for peripheal nerve stimulator for my knee. He is so careful and completely thorough as he recommended me for this procedure. I had a trial week for temporary stimulator and I can truthfully say that with the trial I had 95% reduction in pain. I cannot wait for the permanent one to be implanted  and can get back to my active life. He is a very busy doctor and takes about 3 months for an appointment.  It is worth the wait i can truly say. So thankful to be his patient.|I met Dr Homberg close to 8 or 9 years ago after Dr Pucek referred me to him to manage my Complex Regional Pain Syndrome in my right foot and leg. Dr Homberg was friendly, professional and very knowledgeable about my medical condition. It became quickly apparent that Dr Homberg would gain my full confidence and trust. Dr Homberg began treating, not only my pain, but also my underlying fear and concerns. Fast forward to now. Dr Homberg is not only a wonderful doctor, but also one of the greatest human beings I've ever know. He has never given up on me or treating my symptoms or conditions. There have been many times I would get discouraged by the way a treatment was going. He could see the disappointment and discouragement I was experiencing and he would always point me back to hope and he kept my head in the game as well as encouraging me to just keep fighting. He would ALWAYS tell me, "we are going to get this taken care of!". There have been times in which my spirit was low and I was becoming depressed. Dr Homberg would and has went out of his way to ensure me that everything was going to turn out fine. Today, I don't just consider Dr Homberg my doctor. He is so much more than just my doctor. He is my friend! If truth be told, I know I'm not the only one of his patients that feels this way about him. I have friends that have needed his services and they've all came back with the same conclusion that I have; Dr Eric Homberg is so very much more than a doctor. He's a man full of character, conviction and skill. Dr Eric Homberg is and will always be my friend! Thanks doc for ALWAYS having my back!|Dr. Homberg Is a great doctor. He cares about removing my pain.  He explains everything.  I'm looking forward to the next two procedures.

Associated Pain Specialists serves patients throughout Gray, Tennessee and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians specializes in treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Since our founding, we have been committed to improving quality of life for those suffering from persistent pain through personalized care plans and innovative treatment options.

At Associated Pain Specialists, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options designed to address various pain conditions. Our multidisciplinary approach combines medical expertise with cutting-edge technology to provide effective pain relief while minimizing dependency on medication. We treat conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating collaborative relationships with our patients, taking time to understand their pain history, lifestyle factors, and treatment goals. Our physicians develop customized treatment plans that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary therapies. This comprehensive strategy helps patients regain function and improve their daily activities.

Our Facility

Located at 2103 Forest Dr in Gray, TN, our modern clinic provides a comfortable, welcoming environment for patients seeking relief from chronic pain. The facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment, enabling our specialists to deliver the highest standard of care. We prioritize accessibility and convenience for all patients visiting our practice.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please call us at (423) 794-3142. You can also visit our website at https://apspaincenters.com/ to learn more about our services, treatment options, and patient resources. Our team is available to answer questions and guide you through the process of becoming a patient at Associated Pain Specialists.

column40:
This place is ridiculous!!! If you are late by 8 minutes you have to reschedule your appointment!! My mother is elderly and has a hard time getting around and we was 8 minutes late and they tried to reschedule for a whole month! I went off because she would have to go without medication for a month and they moved her to the following Monday.. Today we was 9 minutes late and they wouldn't see her and had to move her appointment again. It is not right they don't give you at least 15 minutes to make your appointment then if you're late then they won't see you. (Every Drs office I know gives you 15 minutes)..... They need to have more care and compassion for their patients especially the elderly because it is not easy for them to get there monthly anyway!!!!. The NP that my mother sees is great but the staff up front is not friendly and not professional at all!!!!|Love my doctor and nurses people at front desk are rude and not professional been here for 6 years never late appointment was 11:45 you have to be there 30mins early I came in at 11:31 had to reschedule till 1:15 it is 2:00 now and they still haven't called me back|The doctors here don't work with their patients as they should. There is no good communication. The doctors and nurses can't keep their story straight. You will get a different story when you call also. I'm surprised they are still open and haven't been sued. Someone does need to sue them for being non compliant with their patients.|VERY poor patient relations. I mean they go out of their way to be problematic. I'm somewhat leary about care as well. I've been going there for quite awhile now, and not once have they done any imaging, even for procedures.
Lastly, even if you ask for sedation you may or may not get it. Apparently the person doing that has the option of being elsewhere at his or her whim. Which part of an appointment don't they understand? They'll give a couple of pills instead on those occasions which don't really do anything. The last time I went, he was there but wouldn't administer the sedation because it was too short of an interval since I last ate. Not one person had informed me that eating schedules were an issue!
Needless to say I'm researching other options. Probably a place that has more than the current 2.5 stars in reviews. I should have known better, but I started with them on the recommendation of my surgeon. Not this time!|They listen and do everything to help.  They don't rush you through your appointment and it's like you matter.|I have been going to this associated since February 2024 had been miserable not friendly they lie to cover there self I went to the beach July 20th though 27th I told the front desk that I was going to be gone so they made my next appointment on July 30th at 2.30 well they did not put it in my chart they called me in on July 22nd around 11.00 am to come in for a ramon pill count I told them I couldn't come in because I was it the beach Josie told me I had 4 hours to get there so Tuesday July 23rd they called me again same time said I have to come in I can't come in then they told me on the second day someone called them and said I was selling my pills I told them I don't sell my medication I was falsely accused of having lied to them I told them I had proof I went to the beach they would not take that my doctors new I was going I am not going back there they said I broke my contract so they were taken my medication away from me so I am going to call the medical board on them they will not get away with this|I really like my doctor and they don't just want to throw meds at my pain.  The doctor and I are still waiting for approval for a new MRI so we can, hopefully, find a treatment that isn't just stronger pain medication.|Some of the staff were friendly and showed some compassion.  However, there is little patient privacy when answering questions, especially in triage before a procedure.  Everyone in the waiting area can hear.   Rather than billing insurance so fees show you, are asked to bring cash to pay for anesthesia and get a hand written receipt.   VERY UNPROFESSIONAL and feels like "back room, illegal" services.  Will not return and will let everyone know about the service.

Everyone from front desk, Medical assistant, X-ray tech and Dr. Were all so nice. Dr. Shannon listened thoroughly to all of my concerns & chronic conditions. I'm glad I was referred to such a great place with such caring providers.|If it were at all possible to give this company no stars I would have. Waste of time and energy going here.|Ive had a total knee replacement surgery and all kinds of shots and procedures done but nothing has helped except medication and because I'm on anxiety medication and its "dangerous" they basically told me that I'll have to go to the street to buy the medication I need that helps me even though my surgeon and family has had me on that medication before just fine before this place is a joke and doesn't care about people.|I went to my first appointment and didn't even get to see the actual physician!! The nurse practitioner was going to examine me and recommend my treatment alternatives before even viewing my blood work, MRI and X-rays!! What a racket!! I walked out of there and reported them to the medical board .|Don't waste your time at this place! They put me through the wringer at my first appointment and didn't give me any pain medication because they did not have my records from my last PM doctor. Nothing was ever mentioned about obtaining any records before my appointment. When they took my urine sample, a nurse wss in the restroom watching me. Then she wanted to do blood work and take another urine sample for some other test. She wanted to see me in 3 weeks and scheduled a follow up appointment. I'm not going back. Trust me! Don't go to this place, because they don't care about you! That's why they're so many bad reviews! I really didn't understand why I got an appointment so fast after my referral was submitted. They're a couple of people in the waiting room, and I got back there fast. The only good thing I could say about APS is that your wait time is very short. They must not have many patients.|This is the worst place I have ever been to. Not only do they make you waste your time and have to show up to your appointment AT LEAST 30 minutes before your scheduled appointment time, and if you're not, they won't see you...even if it's still 15 minutes before your scheduled appointment! My husband has SEVERE PTSD and anxiety, as well as memory issues, so he needs me with him at his appointments to answer the medical questions and keep him calm. They refused to let me in the back, stating that their supervisor (who just happens to be on vacation until next week) said that he wouldn't be seen unless he was alone. They violated their own policy that allows me in the back with him for support. Then, when he was upset because I wasn't there to answer the questions, they told him to leave without finishing his appointment. THIS PLACE IS TOXIC. The discrimination and abuse will not go unanswered. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME HERE WITH THEIR PATHETIC EXCUSE OF MEDICAL SERVICES AND RUDE PERSONNEL.|My daughter got insurance through ACA in 2023 and begin care at this wound clinic called Associated Wound Specialists which has no separate wound care apart from the pain clinic. I volunteered to pay her out-of-pocket expenses thinking that this was required for her to receive care.  I did not know that ACA forbids hassling patients much less well-meaning mothers for this payment nor can participating agencies make out of pocket payments mandatory to receive treatment.  The person placed in charge of collection was a receptionist-"bookkeeper" at the wound care center.   She didn't bother to call me or speak with me directly instead told my daughter I needed to pay $400 a month.  I am a widow who lives on SSA and a small pension and did not have the money so I withdrew the money from my IRA at the considerable consternation of my investment advisor.  I thought I paid them off and, lo and behold, here comes another bill for $300.  I talked to AWS's real bookkeeper, and they told me I was paid in full.   After all this in 2023 and many calls to this agency, my daughter went in 2 weeks ago for a routine appt. and the bookkeeper told her "tell your mother she owes us $700"!!   No bill followed, no nothing. I asked her for itemized bills and never received them.  I have gotten one itemized bill and asked for another to send to my insurance company and have them check it and have never received a second statement. I am willing to even pick it up and pay the standard printing rate if they would give me another one.  I
In April, my daughter went through a session of painful debridement here and had forgotten to bring her phone to call me for a ride and this same receptionist told her "no, you can't use this phone because you have germs". She had to walk 3/4 of a mile in the heat to get to a phone. I went by the next day and asked this receptionist if this happens again, please call me.  She then put orders in my daughter's chart to do that as extending a simple courtesy to a client is beyond her. I think my daughter may need more specialized treatment and we have asked for a referral to a hyperbaric unit or hospital . As you can tell, they have a pain clinic too and the wound care addition is not listed separately by google. It's sad to me to see patient health compromised due to poor management of billing practices and a receptionist that does not practice courtesy and professionalism. Last week the practitioners decided billing, rather than medicine,  was in their purview and  the medical part of the visit included a  front desk person going back to the treatment area and loudly bemoaning the treatment she received while they all castigated my daughter during debridement.  Real class act folks!  They apparently have forgotten my request for an itemized statement as they sent me a request for payment by phone this week and , guess what, no itemized statement.  Am reporting them to the TN Medical Board.

The Pain Management Group serves patients throughout Middle Tennessee with comprehensive pain management solutions. Established in 1996, THE PAIN MANAGEMENT GROUP has earned its reputation as Tennessee's most established pain management practice, bringing over 25 years of specialized experience to the communities of Mt. Juliet and surrounding areas. Our multi-disciplinary team consists of board-certified physicians and advanced practitioners who collaborate to develop personalized treatment plans for both acute and chronic pain conditions.

At our Mt. Juliet location, we offer a wide range of evidence-based treatments designed to address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Our integrated approach combines medical interventions, minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative therapies to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

Our Expert Team

What sets THE PAIN MANAGEMENT GROUP apart is our team of specialists who bring diverse expertise to complex pain conditions. Each board-certified physician has undergone rigorous training in pain medicine, anesthesiology, physical medicine, or related specialties. Our advanced practitioners complement this expertise, ensuring comprehensive care throughout your treatment journey.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that pain affects each person differently. That's why we take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop customized treatment plans that address your specific needs and goals. Our commitment to compassionate, patient-centered care has helped thousands of Middle Tennessee residents find relief from debilitating pain.

Visit Our Mt. Juliet Office

Our conveniently located office at 40 W Caldwell St #200, Mt. Juliet, TN 37122 offers a comfortable environment with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment facilities. To schedule a consultation with one of our pain management specialists, call +1 615-941-8501 or visit our website at thepainmanagementgroup.com for more information about our services and approach to pain management.
column11:
THE PAIN MANAGEMENT GROUP is a multi-disciplinary team of board-certified physicians and advanced practitioners dedicated to the treatment of acute and chronic pain in Middle Tennessee.

As Tennessee's most established pain management practice, we have been seeing patients in Middle Tennessee since 1996.

column40:
I can't rate everyone there but I can say the hand full of people I came across that worked there were rude and disrespectful including the lead physician. They treat everyone the same as if every person is a drug addict. It's unbelievable that they can look at themselves in the mirror in the morning and feel good about themselves. I do understand that there are people out there that have a drug addiction and use the pain management system to get more drugs but there are a lot of people who are in a lot of pain on a daily basis that need their pain managed. I've been going here for almost 8 months and I had just been in a car accident, fresh out of surgery for my second right shoulder reconstruction. I also had many surgeries in just the past 4 years that changed my life. I was in the best Physical shape of my life up until then, so I had been trying to cope with the struggles mentally of unable to do a lot of physical activities like I was used to doing. The chronic pain really has an impact on a persons mentality. I had broken my neck, had Cervical titanium cage at 3 levels. I had a major discectomy of my lumbar spine & was in the hospital for 9 days first but it didn't help me. So, I had to have a 360 degree titanium fusion with all levels of my lumbar spine, removed 2 discs and replaced with prosthetic disc's approximately 19 screws, post and cadaver bone. I also had a full left knee replacement, right shoulder surgery then in December 2023 I was in a auto accident while I was on my way to the doctors with my arm in the sling. The impact destroyed my right shoulder in the sling, left shoulder as well. The force of the airbag threw my right fist into my mouth knocking out teeth and the seatbelt caused internal bleeding and fractured 6 screws in my lumbar.
Amanda was supposed to be my pain manager and instead of coming up with different solutions to help eliminate at least some of my pain she acted as if I was taking up too much of her time and simply wanted to come up with a way to lower my meds, not lower my pain or even know what the cause of my pain was. She would always say that they have to stay at the set threshold of medications.  She never looked at any of my MRI, X-rays, CT scans or medical history whatsoever.  When I asked her if she had gone over any of it she got extremely defensive and lost her temper with me. I was very calm but bothered by this and told her that it wasn't ok the way she was treating me, as if I was an addict. I have extreme nerve damage, arthritis throughout my whole body, hands burning, left leg getting atrophy and loss of function. I couldn't sleep at night due to the level of pain and had been taken to the hospital at 2:00 am. The ER doctor had looked over my medical history and asked me who the pain management doctor was and that this was unacceptable and would constitute Malpractice and patient abandonment.
She never answered me, simply said "I'm done!" And left me sitting in the exam room. I called and asked for a self discharge letter on 11-8-24 and was told they would fax it to the new pain management doctor and put it in the mail to me that day. I have Not received it yet and they never faxed it to the new pain management doctor. I'm not one to cause drama or want to take anything to the level but the way they have treated me and reading o lot of these other reviews is disgusting and should not happen to anyone already trying to deal with the life changing issues that new pains cause and then have to deal with PA or Doctors who don't care or put you in the same basket assuming everyone is an addict! Do NOT go to this place if you truly need pain management care.|My Insurance had this place on list so My doctor Referral me here for severe chronic pain along with pain from cancer. And instead of being treated like a human the staff was 2faced i waited months to get in be seem the dr said quickly without letting me answer his questions that just no we don't do pain medication for people like you a speach about drug laws what pain meds are and then how he recommends cold turkey a cold shower and that I go home and deal with it? It being overall pain from chronic spinal pain & this new cancer pain and quickly to be rude with me and so my blood pressure is 196/114 and feel like this guy just is enjoying himself with the smile he has on I feel horrible already so I politely said no thank you this isn't place for me dr replies fast good glade you understand. I got upset but didn't show it but my mouth slipped thank you for time & thanks for wasting my time.. Dr turned around and tried to punch me in face I'm in a wheelchair so I pulled my head head back and thinking I shouldn't have should have let the punch connect because today I'm In severe pain I don't don't feel well from what happened yesterday stress & pain is overwhelmingly and the pain meds I have right now I havto stretch them beyond what quantity & dosage so I'm in pain anxiety overwhelmingly I'll and I can't do anything. I'm not able to get better im not responding to treatment because I'm in overwhelmingly pain & stress and this dr shouldn't be working such apathetic uncaring and I'm scared I'm overwhelmed and all Dr's tennessee are apathetic to care.|I was a patient up until last week.  I had been seeing them because of a neck fusion I had.  I then had a rotator cuff surgery. My Dr did not increase my meds after my surgery.  So I had over taken them.  I told my surgeon and he wanted a letter from the pain group saying I was fired for over taking my meds.  Well, I had misunderstood him and I just signed myself out with the ASSURANCE  that I could come back a anytime
That is where it all fell apart!!  I was out of medication and had been to physical therapy so I was really hurting.  I went to the clinic to see if I could let them know I had over taken my meds so I could get the exact letter my surgeon wanted.  I initially did not want to get "fired" from the clinic.  So, I never told them that.  I went up to the front desk where the site lady sits and takes your name and checks you in and I nicely told her I needed to speak with someone about an issue I had.  Gave her my name and birthday, she told me to have a seat and I did.  After a minute she called me back up and told me I was no longer a patient so  can't come back for a year because I signed myself out. I tried to explain I was assured I could come back. She kept arguing no I could not and telling me for that reason I could not speak to anyone.  I saw the lady who assured me I could come back and I pointed her out.  She came up to the window as the glass was shut and their heads were turned only to have the receptionist open the window and tell me I FAILED my drug test so I needed to go.  I was a little upset by this point.  Remember, all I came in for was a new letter.  I wanted to see that failed drug test that never was shown but the actual Dr came out and got me.  I thought great, now I will get somewhere.  Not a chance!  He basically said he did not care if his employees lied to me.  Also, I got a new letter alright, it was checked that I was released for threatening behavior towards staff and so on!
If you go there, one ing I know is they will lie to you about anything, even if you fail your drug test or not!  BEWARE|My Dr. I see is Amanda Larson. She's so sweet and always works with me to find a solution to whatever problem I'm having and I have alot of medical problems so for her to put up with me and everything I have going on is awesome! She listens, she cares and you can tell she loves her job and working with people. The office staff there at the Mt. Juliet office are all so nice! There's never a wait more than 5 minutes or so every time I go. Thank you to everyone at this office for always making my visit easy and stress free!|These people are the BEST. Absolutely adore my current NP. I have been a patient for a while. Never a long wait time usually only 10-15 minutes to see NP. Love my RFA procedures. Alleviates the pain in neck & shoulder without meds. Staff super friendly.  Have degenerative disc disease, fibromyalgia, arthritis, previous shoulder surgery. This is BEST PAIN MGMT place in Middle TN.|I absolutely love everything in mt Juliet office
They are......
1) professionalism
2) being held with respect
3) empathy
4) compassionate
5) passionate
6) I'm not only treated as first patient but as a friend /or their last
6) they literally truly help me with my chronic pain to get the right treatment for you!!!|I have been with PMG for almost a year and Dr Tran is one of the only doctors I've had that actually tries to help solve my issues. He tries to get to the bottom of the problem. He is kind, courteous and listens to me and always does his best to treat me and I've never had a bad experience. It is great to be heard out and treated with kindness as I go through a difficult time with all the issues I have going on. I appreciate all you guys do for me and I'm truly disturbed by all the negative reviews as I give them a 5 star rating.|I would have to say they are great, but when your out of meds and going through withdrawals, they don't care so keep your appointments or your going to be hurting. They are very nice and I would recommend  the pain management group I just won't miss an appointment  again

Howell Allen Clinic serves Nashville, Tennessee and surrounding areas with exceptional pain management services through the expertise of Dr. Forrest P. Allen, DO. Located in the heart of Nashville, this premier medical practice offers comprehensive interventional pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Dr. Allen brings his extensive training and experience to the Nashville community, providing relief to those suffering from chronic pain conditions through innovative, minimally invasive procedures.

Dr. Allen stands out in the Nashville medical community as a double board-certified physician with dual fellowship training in both Interventional Pain Management and Sports Medicine. This specialized combination of expertise allows him to address pain from multiple perspectives, offering patients more comprehensive treatment options. As one of the first physicians in the Nashville area to perform numerous cutting-edge interventional procedures, Dr. Allen remains at the forefront of pain management innovation.

Expertise and Experience

With over 15,000 interventional procedures performed to date, Dr. Allen brings unparalleled experience to his practice. He prides himself on staying current with the latest advances in pain treatment, ensuring his patients receive the most effective and up-to-date care available. His academic background includes participation in numerous clinical research studies, and he has presented his findings nationally at major medical societies throughout his distinguished career.

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Allen is dedicated to providing his patients with the best minimally invasive options to treat their pain. His approach focuses on improving quality of life while minimizing recovery time and potential complications. Patients benefit from his comprehensive understanding of both pain management and sports medicine, allowing for truly personalized treatment plans.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Forrest P. Allen at Howell Allen Clinic, please call +1 615-327-9543. The clinic is conveniently located at 394 Harding Pl Suite 200, Nashville, TN 37211. For more information about Dr. Allen's qualifications and services, visit https://www.howellallen.com/physicians/allen/.
column11: Dr. Allen is double board-certified and dual fellowship trained in Interventional Pain Management and Sports Medicine. Academically, Dr. Allen has participated in numerous clinical research studies and has presented nationally at major medical societies throughout his career. As one of the first physicians in the Nashville area to perform numerous cutting-edge interventional procedures, he prides himself on being up to date on the most recent advances in pain treatment. He has performed well over 15,000 interventional procedures to date, and is dedicated to providing his patients with the best minimally invasive options to treat their pain.

column40:
Dr. Allen is very professional,  listens to his patients, gives good medical advice as well as his honest straight forward opinion. Office staff is very friendly and professional.|I have been through 3 appointments to get an ablation on my back. Everyone at the clinic is very helpful and no long waits. I trust and am very happy with Dr Allen and his staff!|Very thorough, he listened to what my concerns were. I will recommend him as well as the Houston Clinic. Thx Dr Allen my first visit with you was on point.|Dr. Allen was great, I got immediate pain relief from a chronic injury that has been getting worse for the past two years. He found the exact area and I literally felt complete pain relief.
He did a wonderful job. Thank you Dr. Allen and your entire staff.
Bob Muir.|My experience has been amazing. All the  staff, nurses, and Dr. Allen have been wonderful to work with. They all seem to have my best interest in mind and strive to ensure my health is their priority.  I have never had the actual doctor in a specialist's office contact me over the phone or through video chat to review my records and to follow up after a procedure. Dr. Allen did this, and it seems like that is his standard procedure.  Kudos to his practice!!!! This made me feel that he is vested in my care, and I'm not just another chart to review. I would recommend the Hughston Clinic, and especially Dr. Allen,  to anyone!|First time here, check in was good! Had a problem checking in at home, so I fill out a paper form, which was easier. Not a long wait after check in. Saw a Nurse Practitioner before the Doctor came in, who went over why I was there, and that went well, then the Doctor came in and told me my options and
ordered a shot for my pain! Had me set up with an appointment for my procedure, explained how it worked. I was happy with my visit!|Very busy but appears to be efficiently run and in order. Staff was great and so friendly. Kept asking me if I needed a blanket or anything else. Doc was cool. Easy to talk to you and very informative of my spinal epidural procedure. Still within the first 24 hours of recovery, but so far, so very good. I am feeling much less to almost no pain right now at 535 am cst. Thank you so deeply to Dr. Allen and the staff.|Dr Allen performed 2 nerve blocks on me and an ablation. I was told that he would call me in 2 weeks to check in. I never got a phone call this or any other time I was told he would call. When I asked if I should make a follow-up appointment, I was told no. He would call. Well I am still in horrible pain and the procedure did not work. All he cares about is the money. I'm still getting bills after months. I've paid about $8000 and they had the nerve to send me a bill for over $200 for a video chat that lasted less than 2 minutes and I had to wait for him for 45 minutes. I am very unhappy with all of this and would definitely go somewhere else if I had it to do over again. I am out of all that money and still in pain every day. They would know this if they had actually cared about their patients.

Elite Pain Consultants serves Oak Ridge, Tennessee, and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our dedicated team of board-certified specialists combines evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. Located conveniently in Oak Ridge, we've established ourselves as a trusted partner in helping patients reclaim their quality of life through personalized treatment plans.

At Elite Pain Consultants, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that includes interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary therapies. Our specialists are experienced in treating various conditions including back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathic pain, sports injuries, and post-surgical pain. This comprehensive approach allows us to address the underlying causes of pain while providing immediate relief strategies that improve daily functioning and overall wellbeing.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Thanks to the doctor and staff for helping me during a very difficult episode in my life.|I didn't start going until May but, my husband started in January. I RECOMMEND YOU FIND ANOTHER PLACE TO GET HELP FOR YOUR PAIN.  HERE THEY TREAT US VERY BADLY.  THEY ONLY CARE ABOUT THAT THEY DO RADIOFREQUENCY ABLATION WHICH IS A VERY EXPENSIVE TREATMENT AND THEY DO NOT GIVE THE INSURANCE THE NECESSARY DOCUMENTS.

Integrity Pain Consultants in Cookeville, Tennessee offers comprehensive pain management services under the expert guidance of Dr. Kenneth Homolya, MD. Serving patients throughout the Upper Cumberland region, our practice combines evidence-based medical interventions with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. We understand that pain affects every aspect of life, which is why our personalized treatment plans focus on improving functionality and quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

At Integrity Pain Consultants, Dr. Homolya brings extensive training and experience in interventional pain procedures, including epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. Our approach integrates multiple modalities to address complex pain conditions such as:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Work-related injuries

  • Cancer-related pain

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in establishing meaningful doctor-patient relationships built on trust and open communication. During your consultation, Dr. Homolya takes time to thoroughly evaluate your condition, review your medical history, and discuss your pain management goals. This collaborative approach ensures that treatment plans align with your specific needs and preferences.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment with Dr. Kenneth Homolya, please contact us at +1 931-372-1799. Our clinic is conveniently located at 929 W Jackson St, Cookeville, TN 38501. For more information about our services or to request an appointment online, visit our website at www.integritypainconsultants.com.

column49:
I don't have a question other than to ask how is this place still in busines? I'm going to make sure they are investigated for elder abuse, abandonment and malpractice. Ashley May FNP and the Medical Director of this facility should both lose their license to practice based on my experience with my mother's treatment here.
After Dr. DeFlumere left the clinic, my mom was abruptly cut off the opiod pain meds they prescribed to her for years along with a strong antidepressant. They did not bother tapering either of these meds. She endured irreparable physical and psychological trauma after suffering through severe withdrawals from these  meds. She was functioning and viable just 6 months ago when she had the meds. Now she is immobile, weak, deteriorating and dying. All because of a pill that she can no longer get for reasons unknown. She will be going to a nursing home after the holidays. The person responsible for her demise will get what they deserve through Karma and legal pursuit.

Precision Pain Care serves Smyrna, Tennessee and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Located in the heart of Rutherford County, our specialized medical practice combines advanced interventional techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives and reduce dependency on pain medications.

At Precision Pain Care, Dr. Graf Hilgenhurst and our team of pain specialists utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and innovative treatment approaches to address chronic pain conditions. We specialize in treating back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome through minimally invasive procedures that promote faster recovery with fewer side effects than traditional surgical interventions.

Our Comprehensive Approach

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our multidisciplinary approach may include interventional procedures, physical therapy recommendations, medication management, and lifestyle modifications designed to improve overall quality of life. Each treatment plan is carefully crafted based on thorough evaluations and the latest evidence-based practices in pain medicine.

Convenient Location

Our modern facility is conveniently located at 519 Enon Springs Rd E, Smyrna, TN 37167, providing easy access for patients throughout Middle Tennessee. With ample parking and a welcoming environment, we strive to make your visit as comfortable as possible.

Schedule Your Consultation Today

Take the first step toward effective pain relief by contacting Precision Pain Care at +1 615-223-6200. Our friendly staff will guide you through the appointment process and answer any questions you may have about our services. column40:
I was referred to numerous pain clinics after my back surgery and I got over 10 call backs from various pain clinics and i originally made several appointments but when one called me back and actually talked to me about my imaging, then she went on to inform me that "Dr. Hilginhurst has reviewed my case and believes he can help me". And All the other clinics just wanted to
know my insurance info and to make sure I could pay.
I immediately canceled all other appointments and went to Precision pain.  Every single staff member has been so nice and helpful. Dr. Hilgenhurst was extremely thorough and helpful.  He new all about my case before he even sat down with me and even new some things about my injury that were not in my file, just from his prior experience.  Overall this has been one of the most professional and effective doctor experiences I've ever had. I am so lucky and thankful for finding Dr. Hilgenhurst and his staff. 10 out of 10|I've been in pain management for many years, and I have been to 3 different clinics since I moved to Murfreesboro.
This is honestly the first one that I've ever found that treats me like a person and not like "just another drug seeker" which is why I left the other pain clinics.
I'm a retired RN and First Responder and I've destroyed my back lifting patients for over 30 years so I live in constant severe pain.
Dr. Hilgenhurst is a very kind, caring and professional physician who treats me like a person, and that's rare in pain management.
His staff are absolutely wonderful! From the front desk to the practitioners and especially the lab technician, Jim.
With the help of all these people, my pain is finally managed to allow me to be comfortable for the first time in decades!
The wait time for appointments is rarely very long; on average 15 minutes or less. The waiting room is large and has plenty of comfortable seating.
I am truly blessed and grateful to have finally found such a wonderful place to go for my pain management!|I had been a patient with Dr. Hilgenhurst for the past 8 months till this morning.  I had been very patient every time I went in for an appointment because it always took at least an Hour and a Half to even see him.  This morning was no different, my appointment was at 9:00 AM, he finally walks in at 10:40 only to tell me I am being kicked out of their pain management program because I got an injection from my Ortho Doctor at TOA instead of using his office for the injection.  I had tried to schedule the injection with Dr. Hilgenhurst's office but due to time restrictions of having surgery in 6 weeks and not being able to get an injection 1 month prior to surgery I scheduled the injection with TOA because they could get me in.  If you plan on using Dr. Hilgenhurst's office be prepared for a VERY long wait at each appointment and be prepared for a very rude doctor.  I can not believe that they would kick out a patient for getting medical treatment they could not provide and then be a rude as he was, literally walking in, telling me I am kicked out and then walking out leaving the room door open and walking off and leaving me to find the check out area myself.  Talk about childish and unprofessional.|I'm so grateful to Dr. Hilgenhurst, he Is the first Dr to help me with my pudenal neuralgia pain, which I suffered from for over 20 years.
The pudenal nerve burn took care It, And solved my pain as well as horrible bladder Incontinence that comes along with pudenal neuralgia. So I thank you!|I have had No Problems While Going to Precision Pain Care.. As a Matter of fact.. They are very Professional.. The Doctor and All the staff is the best!! When I go in and tell the Doctor My Problem.. We Make a Plan.. He also give you Information about What will go on with the Procedure.. I Now understand more about my Spine and how it effects .. Different parts of my body.. I had a problem.. They Got Me back into the Office within 2 days.. I can say only good things about Precision Pain Care.. Also yes.. They Do have rules.. I know for a fact if you do things correctly you will not have any problems.|Horrible and incredibly long wait times and unprofessional staff. I was an hour earlier for my appointment since I had to go to work the same day. I waited 1 hour and 45 minutes just to be called to the back. Prior to being called back, I notified the front desk receptionist that my appointment had gone way past the time I was scheduled and would like to be seen as soon as possible due to work that day. She rudely stated that even if you arrive at the appointment time early or right on time, they cannot promise I will be seen by the scheduled appointment time. Then after finally being called to the back, I was forced to wait an additional 25 minutes in the patient room. After no-one came back to the room, I left without seeing the doctor. I honestly couldn't believe that they run their clinic/establishment so poorly. Patients are already in a lot of chronic pain and are not capable of sitting or standing for long durations of time; therefore why would they purposely make patients wait for extremely long times? To top it off, while I was waiting in the patient room for 25 minutes,  I could hear all of the nurses and the doctor conversing over what they are going to eat and social media. It's really sad that their main focus and priorities are not on the patients. They can do way better than this. Unfortunately, I'll never go back to find out if they have improved.|I've never been taken care of with all of my conditions, as I have with this practice. Each time I go and see the doctors and or associates they make me feel welcome. They listen to me and help me with all my issues. They take time with me and never do they act like they are in a rush. If you need help with all your pain and what goes along with it, Precision Pain Care is the one you need to go to. Check it out, I did and I'm very satisfied 100%.....|I was impressed that the doctor treated the "whole patient." Having had some issues of over medication and adverse reactions to new pain medication, I felt I was in good hands with an extremely knowledgeable physician who was sympathetic to my situation. I felt the staff was also very kind and sympathetic.

Interventional Spine and Pain Center serves patients throughout Middle Tennessee with locations in Manchester and Murfreesboro. For over three decades, this established practice has been providing specialized pain management solutions to residents seeking relief from acute and chronic pain conditions. Led by experienced physicians including Jason Herndon, MD, the center offers comprehensive interventional treatments designed to improve quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

Jason Herndon, MD is a distinguished physician at Interventional Spine and Pain Center who is Board Certified in both Pain Management and Anesthesia. Dr. Herndon brings exceptional expertise to his practice, specializing in comprehensive interventional pain management services that address a wide spectrum of pain conditions. His approach focuses on minimally invasive procedures that provide effective relief while reducing recovery time and complications.

Specialized Services

Dr. Herndon is particularly recognized for his expertise in spinal cord stimulation, an advanced technique for treating persistent chronic pain that hasn't responded to conventional therapies. His practice encompasses both interventional procedures and medication management, offering patients a multi-faceted approach to pain relief. The center's treatment protocols are individually tailored to address specific conditions while focusing on functional improvement and enhanced quality of life.

column3:
Interventional Pain Center serves Hendersonville, Tennessee and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to improve quality of life. Our specialized medical practice focuses on addressing chronic pain conditions through minimally invasive techniques and personalized treatment plans. Located in the heart of Hendersonville, our center has become a trusted resource for patients seeking relief from debilitating pain conditions that affect their daily activities and overall wellbeing.

At Interventional Pain Center, our mission is to maximize our patients' functionality, quality of life and to reduce their pain. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a person's life, which is why our team of board-certified specialists employs a multidisciplinary approach to pain management. Our treatments range from advanced interventional procedures to medication management and rehabilitative therapies, all tailored to address the unique needs of each patient.

Specialized Services

Our practice offers a wide range of interventional procedures including epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and peripheral nerve blocks. These minimally invasive techniques target the source of pain directly, often providing relief where traditional methods have failed. We also coordinate with physical therapists, chiropractors, and other healthcare providers to ensure comprehensive care.

Patient-Centered Care

What sets Interventional Pain Center apart is our commitment to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. We believe informed patients make better decisions about their health, which is why we take the time to explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes. Our compassionate staff ensures patients feel supported throughout their pain management journey.

Visit Our Center

column40:
I visited Dr. Brad Wilson for help with chronic back pain of over two years..and underwent facet block injections. Unfortunately, when the injections didn't provide significant relief, he told me there wasn't anything else he could do. I found this response very upsetting, as I felt my concerns weren't fully explored. I would have appreciated if the doctor had asked questions about my symptoms, taken time to consider other possibilities, or even suggested alternative treatment paths like finding a new physical therapist. Instead, I felt dismissed.Its very hurtful.

Thankfully, I didn't give up on myself..after seeking care elsewhere, I found a physical therapist whose exercises and techniques have been the most helpful to me, proving that there were additional steps to address my condition. I hope Dr Wilson will consider taking a more thorough and empathetic approach in the future to help patients|I have been going to them for years the lady at the front desk was always rude to me because I paid cash 200 to be exact and she would Ridley say each time you still don't have insurance like it was beneath her and when I do get insurance they refuse to help me with the insurance referral process and would not fill my medicine for a week so I could   Work the insurance referral myself knowing  that I had been on it for years and I would have a seizure with out .... Worst patient care|I have been a patient at IPC for extended periods of time over the last several years. I have multiple autoimmune diseases that cause severe abdominal pain and joint pain, in addition to endometriosis, and currently a form of Lupus that developed from taking a biologic medicine (Humira) that was supposed to help my autoimmune diseases (not prescribed by IPC). I have been so sick for months with fatigue and pain due to the reaction. The Interventional Pain Center has been so compassionate, helpful, and understanding. They listen to what I am saying, are thorough, extremely responsible, and truly have tried to help in any way they can. I have been able to get in to appointments quickly, and have always been treated like a person and not just a number. I have seen multiple providers there and have never, ever had a bad experience with anyone. I highly recommend IPC to anyone who is experiencing chronic pain!|My wife had a herniated disk and was in excruciating pain. We were able to make a quick process to get in and the staff was kind and understanding. They made the insurance process easier and got approval quickly. Dr Wilson was very compassionate and thoroughly explained everything. He personally spoke with my wife's neurologist and helped expedite care. I hope we never need to go back, but this place would be my first choice.|I called in about an appointment and spoke to Josh, who texted the "Certification Team" about my procedure. I asked Josh "who that person was, they're name?" He told me all I have to worry about is his name is Josh...
Where's the accountability of giving medical advice but not telling me who said it? Drop the ball on patient care and make me feel like I've done something wrong.
This is a gateway for people to get addicted to pain killers because calling and talking to them is more painful then anything you're experiencing.|I have been going here for around 9 yrs. Now. I trust the drs. Here. I was in a lot of pain when i came here,they have managed to help me be able to function without so much pain. I would highly reccomend dr. Wilson,and his associates.|This place is the best. Dr' Wilson is very knowledgeable and pleasant to deal with. He treats you like a person and not just a number. Can't say enough good things about the PA staff and just everyone. I've never had a pain clinic that cares as much as they do for the patient.|I went to one appointment and when I got to the pharmacy I was going to get charged $150 for the mediation. I called to ask them to change it to a different mediation to which they refuses. I ended up going to another pain management group, but not because of this. My insurance changed so I had to go back to them. They called and told me they refuse to accept me as a patient saying the last time I was there I caused a scene in their office.  This is a complete fabrication because I never went back to their office.  I simply called and told them I couldn't afford to pay $150 for my medication.. They made up a whole story about me. Do not ever waste your time with thre facilities.

The Pain Management Group: Clarksville serves residents throughout Clarksville, Tennessee and surrounding Middle Tennessee communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Established as Tennessee's premier pain management practice, The Pain Management Group brings over 25 years of specialized experience to patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Their Clarksville location at 776 Weatherly Dr Suite B provides a convenient access point for local residents seeking relief from debilitating pain issues that affect quality of life.

The practice features a multi-disciplinary team of board-certified physicians and advanced practitioners who collaborate to develop personalized treatment plans. Since beginning patient care in 1996, The Pain Management Group has built a reputation for combining evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate care. Their specialists are trained in the latest pain management techniques and stay current with emerging treatments in the field.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Patients at The Pain Management Group receive access to a wide range of treatment options for conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and post-surgical pain. The practice employs a holistic approach that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications tailored to each individual's needs and circumstances.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes The Pain Management Group is their commitment to treating the whole person, not just symptoms. Their team takes time to understand each patient's unique pain experience, medical history, and treatment goals. This patient-centered philosophy has helped countless Middle Tennessee residents regain function and improve their quality of life over the practice's 25+ year history.

For consultations or to learn more about available treatment options, patients can contact The Pain Management Group's Clarksville office at (615) 941-8501 or visit their website at http://thepainmanagementgroup.com/. Their Clarksville location at 776 Weatherly Dr Suite B, Clarksville, TN 37043 welcomes new patients seeking specialized pain management care.
