I had a 11am consulting with Dr. Timothy H . When I got there the front desk was rude I ask for a pen to fill out paperwork she said to your right. Then I found out that the paperwork was 10 pages long. So they call me in the office for my consultation with Dr Timothy and was told to pee in a cup. I that it was just to set and talk about your options for the next appointment. But no they made me pee in a cup that was not comfortable doing so I ask The nurse Mary if I can do it on my next appointment and she did you read the paperwork it was in there.She rude to me and she next time read the paperwork. This my last time going there very poor service.|The nurse Mary was rude and so was the staff as well.And I also want online to fill out my paperwork and it keeps longing me out . Got to the clinic to find out the website was old and out dated So the front desk gave some paperwork to fill out and it was 10 pages long. Then I had to go to restroom and one would show me were they were. And parking is bad as well there was one friendly nurse in the office. This was my first time going there and my last.|This is for the Clarksville clinic. I was very hesitant after reading previous reviews to go here. However, I found my experience was very good. The reception lady was nice and my nurse Renae was great! Dr. Miller was very nice and listened to any and all of my concerns. He is a very supportive doctor who really wants to help you! I will be returning here for future visits!
Update:
Had my second visit today everyone was very pleasant again from reception to my nurses Renae and Medora. Once again Dr. Miller was great at explaining what I was having done and talked about what to expect at my next appointment.|Front desk people were rude. No internet access for guests. Can't use a wheelchair unless you give your ID for them to hold. Long wait times.|I appreciate the care of the medical staff.  Dr. Miller and Dusty seem to genuinely care about the 'quality of life' you are pursuing and want to help you achieve your goals .
They are providing excellent care during this time of transition while I am trying to figure out what my new normal is in realizing realistic results for my condition.|Update: The CEO, Brooke Peck promised to schedule me with a different provider and then I didn't hear from her again. She admitted the information on their website is not accurate. I did not receive quality or compassionate care and am in fact being delayed in receiving treatment due to the failures of this provider.

Disregard the list of treatments on their website, as I was told they do "pills and injections" and they "don't know anything about holistic stuff" even though holistic care is mentioned twice on the front page of their website. They continued to prescribe medications that did not work but would not do any other type of treatment for pain. And they will not deal with pain from multiple origins. And I was encouraged to disregard the advice of my cardiologist and use a topical that could cause me to have a life threatening arrhythmia. This is not pain management unless you're just looking for opiates which you will get at the first appointment whether they actually work or not. Other helpful treatments they offered did include the suggestion to use a heating pad. That's not worth the copay.|The front desk receptionist act like they do not want to work. Walking in for my second appointment nobody in the lobby, has me wait as she did the first time. Asked her last month and this month about my referral she says it is not in. I call my doctor that sent referral and states the sent in back in September. So I give them another call she states again no referral. When I tell her I contacted my doctor and they assured me they sent out the referral she then does her job and finds it. She then tells me I should receive a call to set up my appointment. I received the call unfortunately I do work so missed it. When I call back same receptionist answers and tells me I am to wait for a call to be scheduled, I told her I was called she then requests the name of who called I told her I wasn't sure they left a voicemail to call back. All of that should be in the notes which I know they were seeing as she then found where to transfer me. I gave two stars because my Dr. Is amazing but he really needs to not rely on the receptionist to give him accurate information  about referrals seeing as they can not be bothered to actually do their job. They need to hire new ones ASAP|During our initial consult which consists of only ordering tests and talking, I requested a lesser scheduled muscle relaxer to control the extreme pain until our next appointment to go over xrays and potential treatment, he said absolutely not because he isnt comfortable with that, i respected his answer and we quickly ended the apppintment. Cut to our next appt, after seeing "just a mild curveture" in spine that is likely caused by muscle spasms and a neck that is a tad too straight (military neck) rather than ordering the next appropriate tests to narrow down CAUSE OF PAIN and possible treatment plan Timothy Miller told me that Im really not going through anything bad enough for any type of ongoing treatment that he prescribes. He was so disregarding- he made a disgusting statement that i was in there begging for medications and that i was lying about a horrific reaction that i listed as an allergy to ZOHYDRO. WHICH BTW IS NOT HYDROCODONE- if you look up the structure and details about that specific medicine and youll find it is identical to a subutex. I trialed it in October and broke out into hives and Anaphylaxic shock.

After being treated like a dog and crying in response to that treatment he was willing to write me a script for 10mg Oxycontin ER twice per day.
What is so interesting is that the XRAY report showed misalignment from muscle spasms. Why wouldnt you go with a muscle relaxer that literally acts similar to an opioid? But isnt as strong as one. I discharged voluntarily soon after that last appointment.
As of June 2024 i am diagnosed with Multilevel degenerative disc disease and Spondylosis. If Dr Miller would have taken the appropriate steps to better treat a person in definite severe pain with plenty of PT, imaging. and physician reports recorded that he didnt even glance at. I wouldnt be in Debilitating pain right now. I would have had a better treatment plan for the previous two months.
This city is packed full of doctors and NPs that medically neglect and abuse patients. Timothy Miller does not need to practice in medicine involving a persons physical or mental health. I think he would fit better in Radiology reading where patients dont see you.

I finally found a God sent Doctor in Hendersonville. I DISCUSSED THE SAME CONCERNING ISSUES WITH DR. COZART AND RECEIVED PROPER TREATMENT THE SAME DAY ALONG WITH REFERRALS AND 24/7 ACCESS TO DISCUSSIONS RELATING TO MY HEALTH CARE. If you have been medically neglected or mentally abused by gaslighting physicians or by anyone in the medical field and need treatment preformed by a caring team that will literally help you in every possible way, contact Thrive Direct Primary Care in Hendersonville TN. You will begin to appreciate life again.

Center for Spine, Joint and Neuromuscular Rehabilitation in Nashville, Tennessee offers comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Located in the heart of Nashville, this specialized medical facility has established itself as a leader in non-surgical treatment options for individuals experiencing spine, joint, and neuromuscular disorders. Their team of board-certified physicians combines evidence-based practices with innovative techniques to deliver personalized treatment plans focused on improving quality of life and restoring function.

The center utilizes a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, incorporating physical therapy, medication management, interventional procedures, and rehabilitation services. Their specialists are trained in diagnosing and treating complex conditions including herniated discs, sciatica, arthritis, fibromyalgia, and sports injuries. By addressing both the symptoms and underlying causes of pain, the Center for Spine, Joint and Neuromuscular Rehabilitation helps patients achieve sustainable relief without relying solely on medication.

State-of-the-Art Facilities

Their modern facility at 397 Wallace Rd #206, Nashville, TN 37211 is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. The center's comfortable environment is designed to put patients at ease while receiving care. With convenient parking and accessibility features, the clinic ensures that patients with mobility challenges can access their services without difficulty.

Patient-Centered Care

What sets the Center for Spine, Joint and Neuromuscular Rehabilitation apart is their commitment to individualized care. New patients receive thorough evaluations to develop customized treatment plans that address their specific needs and goals. The medical team prioritizes patient education, ensuring individuals understand their conditions and treatment options. This collaborative approach empowers patients to take an active role in their recovery journey.

For more information about their services or to schedule an appointment, patients can visit their website at www.sjnmr.com or call +1 615-872-9966. The Center for Spine, Joint and Neuromuscular Rehabilitation welcomes new patients and accepts most major insurance plans.

Alliance Pain Management serves Maryville, Tennessee and surrounding communities with specialized pain management services focused on improving quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions. Established as a trusted healthcare provider in the region, our practice combines evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate care to address the complex nature of persistent pain disorders.

At Alliance Pain Management, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life. Our team of board-certified specialists employs a multimodal approach to pain management, beginning with accurate diagnosis of the underlying causes. We develop personalized treatment plans that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health strategies to address both the physical and emotional components of chronic pain.

Our Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes our practice is our unwavering commitment to patient-centered care. We take the time to listen to each patient's unique experience with pain, considering how it impacts their daily activities, work performance, and overall well-being. This thorough understanding allows us to implement targeted interventions designed to not only relieve pain but also restore function and improve quality of life.

Conditions We Treat

Our specialists have extensive experience treating a wide range of pain conditions, including but not limited to back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, post-surgical pain, and cancer-related pain. By addressing these conditions with comprehensive care plans, we help patients regain control over their lives and reduce their suffering.

Visit Our Practice

Alliance Pain Management welcomes new patients at our conveniently located office at 1123 E Lamar Alexander Pkwy, Maryville, TN 37804. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (865) 724-0867 or visit our website at alliancepainmanagement.com. Our dedicated team is ready to partner with you on your journey toward improved pain management and enhanced quality of life.

column3:
Green Hills Pain Treatment Center in Nashville, Tennessee offers comprehensive non-narcotic pain management solutions for patients seeking relief without the risks of opioid medications. Located in the heart of Green Hills, our specialized medical facility combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to address chronic pain, addiction recovery, and mental health concerns.

At Green Hills Pain Treatment Center, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our multidisciplinary approach focuses on sustainable pain relief without dependency-forming medications. Our board-certified specialists develop individualized treatment plans that may include physical therapy, interventional procedures, and alternative therapies designed to improve function and quality of life.

Specialized Treatment Services

Suboxone Treatment Program

Our compassionate team provides FDA-approved Suboxone treatment for those struggling with opioid dependency. This medication-assisted therapy helps manage withdrawal symptoms and cravings while patients work through our comprehensive recovery program that includes counseling and support services.

Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS)

As a pioneer in neurological treatments, we offer innovative TMS therapy for treatment-resistant depression and certain pain conditions. This non-invasive procedure uses magnetic fields to stimulate nerve cells in the brain, effectively improving symptoms without the side effects of medications.

Therapeutic CBD Oil Options

We provide physician-guided CBD oil treatments as part of our integrative approach to pain management. Our medical-grade CBD products are carefully selected for quality and efficacy, with dosing recommendations tailored to each patient's specific needs.

Visit Our Center

Green Hills Pain Treatment Center welcomes new patients at our comfortable, modern facility located at 2000 Glen Echo Rd #101, Nashville, TN 37215. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (615) 457-8585 or visit our website at www.nashvillebraininstitute.com. Our dedicated team is committed to helping you achieve lasting pain relief and improved wellness through our innovative, non-narcotic treatment approaches.

column40:
I really wish I could leave a ZERO RATING!! I had an appointment with them on 6 December and they cancelled and didn't even give a call or anything!! And I cannot even reach anyone there. Voicemails are always full. Very unprofessional of them, especially with this being my first appointment. Glad I didn't make the drive at 7a.m., because my appointment was at 8!! Absolutely unprofessional. I finally called to see when my appt was since my provider had it moved up due to their not calling to tell me my first was cancelled and giving me a another appt a month and half later, they tell me this appt is cancelled too, because they claim "I was rude on the phone." Lol. That's exactly why my machine records all my calls, so that's how I know they're lying. And the staff can be heard totally ignoring all I spoke about. It's good that I won't be going there because actual former patients have told me that the staff is rude, they treat patients like drug addicts, and they'll automatically cancel/discharge you for any/every. I refuse to go to a place where I have to bow down and not be treated with respect. I have a clean record with my meds, clean drug tests and all. Makes people wonder about the staff and what they're doing. I'm thankful to NOT HAVE TO GO!!!!!!!|I have been here 4 times every time they make a reason NOT to write a prescription. Every time
I went to Egypt and was given tramadol for pain spectrum said I failed my drug test bc they have no record of the prescription. The first visit they said they didn't have my records and it's illegal to write a prescription. The other visit said they don't have enough records for me .they have my records from memphis,x rays everything. They are not the only pain clinic in Jackson that accepts insurance and I'm not going to let them have any more of my money and tell me they can't help me. Teresa doesn't even know what she's doing and the patient is the one that does everything. She said I have acute pain which is false its been 9 months that is not acute pain. She finds a reason every time not to help me. Meanwhile my general practitioner has bent over backwards to help me and spectrum is able to do and they refuse. Go somewhere else. I wish I read these reviews before I ever went in the first place this is my last time. Teresa ignores anything you say and pushes you along like she's not getting paid to see you. She doesn't deserve the money she gets. They push shots onto people. I'm serious do not give these people your money. You mean after months you don't have enough records to decide anything???? You are  trash  believe these reviews. Also you won't be able to get another appointment for another month ,so it's month to month you won't be helped. One day will come it will be her turn to be in pain and I hope  she goes through as many hoops as she puts her patient through. I wish she would loose her license then she woukd know how it feels to be at the mercy of someone who could help but won't.|I wish I could rate them negative. I had 2 bad experiences with them. I tried again within a 5 year lapse hoping the 2nd time, they would have better management. They sent me to Memphis for a nerve block on my leg instead of my back which I suffer from flatback syndrome. She saidn  if I tried the injection and it didn't work, she'd give me low dosage of pain medication. I tried the injection and she did NOT give me any pain medicine. She called in a pain cream at a pharmacy in Mississippi when my insurance coverage is State of Tennessee.   So that was the first time, and I gave up and started self-medicating.

The 2nd time the nasty FNP told me I had to stop self-medicating and drinking which helped my pain for 30 days before they would even talk about what was the next step. If I could go 30 days with nothing, I wouldn't have been at a pain clinic.

The signs that say DO NOT RECORD are illegal because they know they are doing something wrong.  This clinic should be turned in and investigated.  I moved on and am satisfied with the care I am now receiving.  If I weren't in constant pain 24/7, I would not be at a pain clinic.   Baffles the mind why they won't treat each individual  patient to his or her  own needs. (Opinion from some of the reviews sounds similar)|I went to Spectrum for a pain management procedure on my neck. This would have been done elsewhere but my doctor moved to Memphis. I was not there for pills. The NP arranged the procedure that an MD would perform. The MD never saw my face or spoke my name. He came into the procedure room after I was anesthetized and face down on the table and left after he gave me the injections.
The procedure room is separated from the waiting area by a door and while waiting on my procedure I listened to two patients having theirs performed. The nurses and MD were yelling the name of the patient telling them to be still. It was embarrassing. Then once the procedure is complete the patient is rolled out to sit in the waiting area for recovery. No privacy. No dignity preserved.
The office is noisy with the workers talking loudly and cutting up with one another. I could literally hear way too much information about other patients. Doors were open that shouldn't be open. Honestly, the whole experience was like something from a bad movie. Very unprofessional. Go elsewhere!|My S.O. has been treated by Spectrum Pain Clinic since 2021. We've been through several providers, most recently Teresa Kee. Her lack of common sense and lack of knowledge about the disease process of one who is in end stage Renal disease and on dialysis is a joke. She referred my S.O. to psych because the disease process of his kidney failure causes lethargy, extreme generalized pain, fatigue, and periods of time where he sleeps a lot throughout the day. An appointment has yet to be established. Ms. Kee determined he's at risk for opiate use.... Well umm you prescribe them. Most recently, they cancelled his pain contract stating his drug test came back positive for a medication he is no longer taking, and it's been two years. When told this, we went to his patient portal, and they had blocked him from viewing it, therefore we cannot see the results of his lab. Ms. Kee further stated that He is being noncompliant with the psych referral, when we are still waiting for an appointment. Lastly, as a nurse, I know that opiate pain medication cannot be stopped abruptly, and the pain clinic is refusing to prescribe more or ween him off the medication he is on. This can cause further damage to his heart and kidneys, and they do not care. There is no compassion for the medically vulnerable, or those with a terminal diagnosis.|BEWARE!! I have been there to see Harmon twice and now and it was a horrible experience!! He minimized my pain, doesn't listen, lies, rude, uncaring. I suffer from chronic pain with many ailments. Osteoarthritis in all joints, I have a bad spine, and a muscle disease, etc. Harmon does NOT listen to the patient!!! Why in the world is he allowed to work with people who are hurting when he is the most uncompassionate person I have met in this field. I have NEVER had any problems with any of my nurses or doctors.  He purposely will argue with you even when he is wrong. I left both visits and cried all the way home. He made me feel like I wasn't even a human being. I have also heard from others he treated them the same way. I now see what others who left reviews, as to what they went through.  I wish I could give zero stars!!! Does the owner of this establishment not read people's reviews?|Wish I could give Zero! Ronald Harmon is awful...he used to be a prison nurse if that gives you a rough idea of his bedside manor. My first apt, after years of well controlled meds, he cut mine in half and said "see you next month". Two months later it was ZERO! Refused to write a Rx for any. Awful care, should have his license stripped! I'm 62 and have never been treated so badly. He will question your diagnosis and call you a liar. Go back to the prison Mr Harmon!|I am so impressed with Crystal Hill, who is the NP in charge of my pain.   She is so knowledgeable, as well as caring.   She thinks "out of the box" with options that other doctors don't mention.  I really appreciate her going out of her way to help me so many times!

column2: Isaac Spine Joint & Pain Institute PLLC
column3:
Isaac Spine Joint & Pain Institute PLLC in Nashville, Tennessee offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our specialized medical practice combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care to help patients regain mobility and improve their quality of life. Located in the heart of Nashville, we serve patients throughout Middle Tennessee with compassionate, patient-centered care.

At Isaac Spine Joint & Pain Institute, we provide a wide range of interventional pain management procedures and treatments. Our board-certified physicians utilize advanced diagnostic techniques to identify the root causes of pain, allowing for targeted treatment approaches that address not just symptoms but underlying conditions.

Our Treatment Offerings

Our comprehensive services include spinal injections, joint injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and minimally invasive procedures designed to provide both immediate relief and long-term pain management solutions. We specialize in treating conditions such as herniated discs, sciatica, spinal stenosis, arthritis, and complex regional pain syndrome.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that consider each patient's unique medical history, lifestyle, and goals. Our team works collaboratively with patients to develop strategies that minimize medication dependence while maximizing function and comfort.

Visit Our Practice

Located at 2004 Hayes St #655, Nashville, TN 37203, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to ensure accurate diagnosis and effective treatment. We welcome new patients and accept most major insurance plans.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (615) 866-9040 or visit our website at www.isaacspine.com. Our dedicated staff is ready to help you take the first step toward a pain-free life.

column38: Benetta Sears|Bridget Byrnes|Beth White|Sandra Sargent|Ashley Dunnam|Angela Hudson|Karen Wolf|Charles Watts
column40:
I love the entire staff!! Always friendly Always professional Always on time as much pain as I have been in I needed a physician who listened and got it right the first time.|The most amazing staff that takes the time and effort to actually find out what's wrong. They have truly changed my life for the better. And they care deeply for their patients. I am most grateful to have found Dr. Isaac and Alexandra.|Yesterday was my 1st time going there.  I was very impressed the staff up front was super nice. After I filled out my paper work it didn't take me to be called into a room. Wasn't even 5 mins Dr Isaac and his pa come in the room Kristi Duffield they were very respectful to me. They didn't look at me as a druggie I would recommend to go see them. I'm hoping they will be the ones to fix my back.I got a couple things to do like xray and mri. My 1st visit was amazing. I have been to different painclinic, by far this was the best one
They talk to and listen to you, I was very impressed. Anyone that wants a great pain clinic go see Dr Isaac. Just talking to him for a few mins i though anyone that could help my back its him. I've been to 8 different surgeons and all they say is they were impressed I was walking. That's the only help I got And these drs were in Nashville. But I felt so comfortable at Dr Isaac office. They made you feel like we can help you. And his PA she is amazing. She sat down and we talked everything out. She is the best. I have searched and searched for a great Dr. Im so glad and thrilled to be going to Dr Isaac's. I really do think they can fix my back. What I'm trying to say you want a great Dr and a great PA go to Dr Isaac's office. You won't regret it.|Kristie Duffield is absolutely the best and caring professional. Nothing but wonderful people in both offices.|Dr. Issac is an absolutely amazing Dr ! I had a cervical spinal fusion done about 2 years prior to seeing him. I had no quality of life and couldn't rotate my head much at all! We agreed upon a small noninvasive procedure that he explained very well to me. 2 of those procedures down. I have movement of my head and my movements have came back. Monica is the representation of what a nurse is supposed to be. I have also been to his Antioch location as well they are absolutely amazing also not to mention that location has a beautiful office amazing artwork! All together if I could give this medical team a 10 I would.|You know, I've been looking at the reviews and I feel that the bad reviews are unjust for various reasons.

I was recommended by a POOR Neurologist and am VERY grateful, as this clinic was a Godsend!

Dr. Isaac and his staff, both front desk AND medical team are EXCEPTIONAL! They actually go above AND beyond to address what issues you have WITHOUT shoving different and tons medications down your throat, even when all other treatment plans have failed! They listen to your concerns and offer suggestions on how to address the pain outside of medications and the wait time in between appointments, unlike the Neurologist I see.

Oh! Don't let me forget! That review about racism, I think you need to look within yourself on who's being racist because they show no signs as that clinic is VERY diverse in ethnicity! Maybe control your attitude and respect the hard work that these individuals offer just to treat you! Respect is EARNED not given! You must give respect in order to receive respect!

As long as people are honest with doctors, you will get the treatment you deserve both as a human and medically.

Thank you team AND Dr.  Isaac for what you do!  You are amazing souls! Much respect and VERY thankful you are a part of my health and spine journey!|Dr. Isaac and his staff are so nice and the office runs very smoothly. Saw a couple of other pain physicians in the distant past and quit going altogether because of the way I was treated and how unorganized they were.Dr. Isaac and his staff have really helped keep me moving!|Give respect to get respect and I have never gotten anything other than respect from the front counter people,the nurses, and the doctors.Dr. Kristy Duffield is doing a great job for me. I have no complaints with this place they are wonderful. They go above and beyond to help their patients. I can't understand why anyone would have any complaints about this place or it's Doctor's. Especially about Dr. Duffield. They are also careful with the injection's and nerve blocks, making them almost pain free. I would recommend them to anyone. They treat me better than any where I have ever gone. I was hospitalized for a heart attack and when I returned to their office I felt like I was visiting a family member.

column3:
Clarksville Pain Clinic serves Clarksville, Tennessee and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Established as a trusted healthcare provider in Montgomery County, our clinic specializes in diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. Our board-certified physicians combine evidence-based medical approaches with compassionate care to help patients regain functionality and improve their quality of life.

At Clarksville Pain Clinic, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our services include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and medication management. We take a multidisciplinary approach to pain relief, addressing both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain.

Our Expert Medical Team

Our clinic is staffed by experienced pain specialists who stay current with the latest advancements in pain medicine. Each team member is committed to providing compassionate care while helping patients understand their conditions and treatment options. We believe in building strong doctor-patient relationships based on trust, respect, and open communication.

Convenient Location and Accessibility

Located at 482 Warfield Blvd, Clarksville, TN 37043, our facility is designed with patient comfort in mind. We offer convenient parking and a welcoming environment to ensure a positive experience from the moment you arrive. Our clinic is easily accessible from major highways and serves patients throughout Clarksville and neighboring communities.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we develop individualized treatment plans that address each patient's specific needs and goals. Our team works closely with referring physicians and other healthcare providers to ensure coordinated care and optimal outcomes.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please call us at +1 931-906-6644. You can also visit our website at https://weence.com/medical/doctors/clarksville-1/clarksville-pain-clinic/ for additional information about our practice, treatment options, and patient resources.

column40:
If you're chronically ill stay away from this lady. She spent one appointment trying "save me" then the next said she didn't believe in breakthrough pain! Wouldn't prescribe TRAMADOL! Worst pain doc experience in 15 years of dealing with my illness.|Dr.Bethi has always been an amazing doctor by far. Been with her for the past 18 years and she is the most caring and had always looked out for me in my best interest! I definitely recommend seeing her if you are looking for genuine help!!|The Doctor is pleasant and the treatment received was good but the customer service and    getting access to my own records and notes from my treatment there has been horrible. After attempting to receive my own notes from my treatment there received over two months ago, I was informed my notes would be available in a few weeks, the notes were never sent to the VA upon completing my treatment there. I then went through the Va to have him request them on my behalf and for days they sent fax requests with no answers. The Va finally called the clinic and asked them about the requests for my progress notes and they told them it would take weeks (2-3) to be sent to the Va. I have been done treatment at the clinic for two months now. Would not recommend unless you absolutely have no other choice. Still waiting on my progress notes from treatment.|I was scared at first when Dr Bethi said injections. I even started having a panic attack. But her and her staff calmed me and we did the injections. Since then I have had 3 rounds and am feeling better.. I can actually sleep now a full 8 hours. The staff and Dr Bethi are pleasant funny and you feel right at home.|I'm giving this place two stars only because Dr. Bethi DOES prescribe Suboxone to her addict patients that need it. However, after she prescribes you the medication to stay off of the harsher opiates, communication becomes key between you and your Clinic as written in your patient policy you must sign that you agree to... which becomes impossible because the only people you get to talk to, other than your short 15 minute appointment window with the Dr., are the staff and believe me, they are not listening... I had a tough weekend and tried to call in to leave the Dr. a message and they never passed any of my messages along.  I asked Dr. Bethi on what became my final appointment with her, if she had received my messages and she said no and she was obviously surprised to hear that I had left one... Her staff doesn't care about the addiction treatment side of this Clinic and business which is absolutely unfair, unpleasant and unwelcome to any of the addicts enrolled in the program.  Honestly, the only way this program is right for you is if you are a part of the few (less than 1%) addicts that never have a slip up or the opportunity for one during treatment.  All it takes to fail at treatment is for your family and friends to have a lapse in support for you because of their own concerns.  Addicts aren't always going to make the right decision when they an opportunity comes time to make one, that's part of the point of Suboxone, to make it where they don't need to make a choice because they don't feel they need to.   Anyways props to Dr. Bethi for prescribing it but if she prescribes you less than 1 strip per day per month... get out.  It's proven that less than that per day per moth has a high likelihood of program failure so don't waste your money... and save yourself the heartache and embarrassment!|I have past experience in usingThe place they want me to go for an MRII want to go to Paris Hospital imaging as I always did them There in the past. The trailor is very hard and it takes me two trays to get an MRI there. Why cant I go where I am comfortable? I never had to pay at Paris imaging but I got a bill from a bill colecti
?|Dr Bethi and staff are amazing ive seen Dr Bethi for over 14yrs now and shes always been very attentive to my needs and so compassionate dhes my miracle worket if it wasnt fpr her i eouldnt be able to function and have the quality of life with my condition would recommend her to anyone!|Worst suboxone doctor I have ever gone to. And the staff are the worst and you can tell they just throw you in with every other addict and treat you like you aren't even human.

column3:
John C. Welker, M.D. serves Columbia, Tennessee and surrounding areas as a distinguished pain medicine specialist affiliated with Maury Regional Medical Group Interventional Pain Management. With a focus on comprehensive pain solutions, Dr. Welker brings specialized expertise to patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. His practice combines evidence-based interventional techniques with personalized treatment plans to help patients regain function and improve quality of life.

About Dr. John Welker

Dr. John C. Welker has established himself as a trusted healthcare provider in the Columbia community. His approach to pain management emphasizes identifying the root causes of pain while developing targeted treatment strategies. Patients benefit from his extensive training in interventional procedures and his commitment to minimizing reliance on medication when appropriate alternatives exist.

Services Offered

The practice offers a comprehensive range of pain management services, including:

- Diagnostic pain evaluations

- Interventional procedures

- Medication management

- Minimally invasive techniques

- Collaborative care with other specialists

Location and Contact Information

Address:

1222 Trotwood Ave, Suite 101

Columbia, TN 38401

United States

Phone: +1 931-490-7372

Website: Patients can learn more about Dr. Welker's credentials and services by visiting the [Maury Regional Medical Group physician directory](https://www.mauryregional.com/find-a-doctor/find-a-doctor?type=1&id=292).

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Welker's practice is built around a patient-centered philosophy that recognizes the complex and individual nature of pain. As part of Maury Regional Medical Group, patients benefit from coordinated care within a trusted healthcare network that has served the community for decades.
column11: John C. Welker, M.D., is a specialist in pain medicine associated with Maury Regional Medical Group Interventional Pain Management in Columbia, Tennessee.
column38: Christina Davis|Shelly Pierce|Patrick Ellison|Brenda Chapman|Shirley Vaughn|Petunia Mae Witherbottom|Robert Lang|Doug Taylor
column40: Wouldn't listen to a word my elderly dad said about his chronic pain. Called my dad a liar so there's no way he looked at his extensive long term medical history. Called all his other doctors stupid and that he's the only one that's right or knows anything, even though he himself was in the wrong. Like the other reviews state he is dehumanizing and only listens to his own voice. I'm shocked he's even employed there.|Dr. Welker is a very kind, compassionate and informative doctor. He listens and tries to help! His staff is friendly and makes you not dread coming to your appointments! Great clinic I would highly recommend!|This clinic took me on as a patient when few would. I was a patient of Dr.Murphy's and at the time he was considered persona non grata. Long story short,they've been nothing but nice and supportive to me since taking me on. I saw Welker for a year and now I see Jack Garrett who's equally nice. They're strict,as they should be,so if that's a problem then this might not be the best place for you. With a little discipline on your part,they can help you the way they've helped me. I appreciate them both|Welker had an attitude, when he came in..didn't listen to anything, except his own voice..a know it all, that has no compassion, or human kindness in him. I have not had any problems in the past, with taking meds or anything, that would make him prejudge me..he is on his own power trip, and I would never go back to him, under any circumstance..we came to a parting of the ways that day, and if you look at the reviews for that clinic, you will find that I'm not alone In feeling this way.|Great MD if you want a caring and top notch care. His team puts the icing on the cake. I feel I have and getting the best care when I step into Dr Welker's office.This has been a hard year for me. But Dr Welker and his staff didn't give up. My quality of life maybe changed for the better. No words are enough. Thank you.|I absolutely dreaded going to a pain clinic, but my first visit was today and I am literally thanking God for Dr. Welker.  First of all, it surprised me that I only had to wait a few short weeks for an appointment.  Secondly, registering was easy, although I struggled to answer some of the written questions about pain.  Thirdly, Dr. Welker's exam and diagnosis makes perfect sense to me and made me realize my main issue was VERY worth coming here.  He answered all my questions and, perhaps unknown to him, made me feel "justified" about my pain.  Thank you, Dr. Welker and staff - you made my day.|Happy with the doctor. He treated me with respect and kindness. I was explained everything. He has a plan for me. I  think I'm finally going to get the help I need. He showed confidence in his ability to help. I have had pain for over 10 years from a devastating fall. Take the Raines doctor do your stuff.|My first visit with Dr welker was fantastic. He explained to me about a device that is the stabilizer that I do plan on trying to get. He understands people's pain and it was a very good experience.

column2: Center for Spine Joint and Neuromuscular Rehabilitation
column3:
Center for Spine Joint and Neuromuscular Rehabilitation serves Hermitage, TN and surrounding areas with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our multidisciplinary facility brings together diverse specialists under one roof, eliminating the need for patients to travel between multiple providers. We recognize that each patient's pain experience is unique, which is why our team develops personalized treatment plans tailored to address specific conditions and symptoms.

At the Center for Spine, Joint & Neuromuscular Rehabilitation, we pride ourselves on our integrated team of board-certified physicians and therapists. Our specialists bring expertise from various medical disciplines including anesthesiology, physical medicine and rehabilitation, orthopedics, and physical therapy. This collaborative approach ensures that patients receive well-rounded care addressing all aspects of their condition.

Specialized Treatment Options

Our facility offers advanced diagnostic and therapeutic interventions for a wide range of musculoskeletal and neurological conditions. Whether you're suffering from chronic back pain, joint issues, sports injuries, or neuromuscular disorders, our team has the expertise to provide effective solutions. We emphasize evidence-based treatments that focus on both symptom management and addressing underlying causes.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

We understand that living with pain can significantly impact your quality of life. Our patient-centered approach prioritizes not only physical relief but also emotional support throughout your recovery journey. From your first consultation through ongoing treatment, our compassionate staff works to ensure you receive attentive, personalized care in a comfortable environment.

Contact Information

Visit our state-of-the-art facility at 5651 Frist Blvd #712, Hermitage, TN 37076. To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, call us at (615) 872-9966. Additional information about our treatments and specialists can be found on our website at www.sjnmr.com.
column9: Pain control clinic|Physiatrist|Physiotherapy Center|Sports medicine clinic
column11:
At the Center for Spine, Joint & Neuromuscular Rehabilitation, we offer a variety of pain specialists under one roof. This team approach allows us to treat a wide range of issues. We understand that you are unique, and we will develop solutions specific to the pain that you are experiencing.

You won't have to visit numerous doctors and specialists to get the treatment that you need. You can expect to work with a top doctor for our team of board-certified physicians and therapists. We have experts with experience in a variety of specialties including anesthesiology, physical medicine and rehabilitation, medicine, orthopedics, physical therapy, and more.
column38: Taylor Hopkins|Belinda Newborn|Tex Duke|Rosie Grogan|Rose H|Christa|Lee Shand|Creative Design
column40:
Very very disappointed and do not recommend them at ALL! I Was in a bad car accident about 5 years ago. Have nerve pain down my arm and neck  still today. I went in and saw a male doctor and he immediately didn't even give me a chance to talk and all he said "oh 5 years? You should be better now" but I am not. Continue to say that I am fine didn't want to look at my X-rays , MRI and doctor notes. The fact he never look at it and didn't care AT ALL ABOUT MY HEALTH! Raises big concern... horrible place I will have to fly back to Philly and actually get real treatment and the doctors or much educated too. DO NOT GO HERE !|This office has been my saving grace. I've been dealing with pain since the 80's. They are fun to interact with and sensitive to my condition. After four years of trusting them with my pain issues I would never go anywhere else. They are diligent in finding ways to give their patients a better quality of life despite the pain. I really appreciate how, as a patient, I have input in my pain management. Being with this provider I can say without a doubt, they've shown me how to live my best life. I say thank you!|Always friendly and courteous,  from the receptionist to Dr. Le himself,  I have been to several pain management practices and I have never had one I would give a 5 star review until I came here. I had an epidural in the office at a previous practice and left in tears. Dr Le addressed my anxiety about this, because I told him I would never do it in office again, I wanted to be sedated. He promised he would not hurt me, so I said I would try it if he would stop if I said it was painful.  He said he would, and he was right, there was very minimal pain and I have done it in his office ever since. I highly recommend Dr Le to everyone!|This place was literally the biggest waste of my time and money. Was a patient for almost a year before getting the hint that this place was not going to change. Each appointment I would typically have to wait at least 2 hours to see a doctor (most I've ever waited was 3 hours and I told the receptionist I was going home because there were STILL people waiting in front of me). Then when Dr. Song Le or Dr. Mitchell saw me it was pathetic. They spent a max of 10 mins with me, told me to stretch, and then left. THIS WAS EVERY SINGLE TIME. Their attitudes were equivalent to "I have 3 more patients left for the day and I am on auto pilot". There was zero plan of action, and all they would offer were "muscle relaxers" that are essentially the same as baby aspirins. I gained absolutely nothing from coming here and my back pain remained. The Mount Juliet location was so much better (on time, attentive drs, etc) but it still seems if your issue doesn't require surgery, they don't have a way to treat you. Please look somewhere else for pain management. I had to find a physical therapist, chiropractor, and massage therapist in order to feel any sense of relief. And all 3 of these other practices treated me like a human who valued my time and what I had to say. This place will not help you but rather cash in on insurance. The worst doctor's office I've ever been to.|The staff and physicians at SJNMR are so kind and thoughtful every time I call or visit. They have worked with me to control my pain and worked to get me in quickly when I needed to come in before a scheduled appointment.  They really care about their patients and do everything possible to help and show compassion.  They each one have my deepest thanks.|Dr Son Le performed a RF ablation on my husband's lumbar arthropathy that causes him intense, debilitating pain.  The ablation helped his pain and mobility dramatically.  Dr Le identified exactly where and how to perform the ablation with expert care and precision.  We are beyond grateful for Dr Le, his expertise, and exceptional care.|I visit this office on a regular basis and have also had the highest standard of care. column3:
Pain And Spine Consultants serves Columbia, Tennessee and surrounding areas with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of specialists focuses on treating a wide range of chronic and acute pain conditions through personalized treatment plans. Since our establishment, we have built a reputation for compassionate care that addresses the root causes of pain rather than just masking symptoms.

At Pain And Spine Consultants, we are committed to decreasing pain and increasing function for patients with physical disabilities and pain conditions. Our practice combines advanced diagnostic techniques with innovative treatment options to help patients regain mobility and improve their quality of life. We understand that pain affects each person differently, which is why we develop individualized care plans tailored to each patient's specific needs.

Conditions We Treat

Our specialists have extensive experience treating various pain conditions, including but not limited to:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Sports injuries

  • Work-related injuries

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

Our Approach

We believe in a multidisciplinary approach that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and lifestyle modifications. Our goal is to help patients return to their daily activities with minimal discomfort and maximum functionality.

Visit Our Practice

Located at 2602 Trotwood Ave, Columbia, TN 38401, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide the highest standard of care. We welcome new patients and accept most major insurance plans.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at (615) 331-5536 or visit our website at painandspine.com.

column40: Don't go here, long wait times for people who get snappy at you for being old and basically deaf, only offered pills. Developed back pain waiting. W hours of our time just for a drug test and we went on our way|I don't personally go here,but my wife does, and she says everybody's very pleasant. She said they listen to you and they seem to care about their patients and their concerns. She said she has no complaints|I was not impressed at all . The waiting room smelled of body odor , it was too small . Employees were not friendly or informative . I waited an hour for my appointment and I could not stand it any longer . I had to leave . I left and call my physician that referred me there ( I was interested in the spinal nerve stimulator , which by the way they had never heard of , all they did was pass out pills which I did not want a part of ) and ask him what the hell he could have been thinking sending me there. He did apologize stating he did not realize they were pain pill only folks Just a nightmare .|I have never given a 100% Positive review to any Doctor previously. However, I feel compelled to share my experience with Dr. Nwofia and his entire team at Pain & Spine Consultants in Columbia, Tennessee. They have shown compassion and care in my struggles with the extreme pain I endure every day. I fell 40 feet in March 2011, and I have not been close to the man I was before. My lungs collapsed, I broke multiple bones and seriously damaged so many other parts of my body. I have been riddled with pain ever since that day. I have had multiple surgeries and procedures. I've been under the care of doctors and while I have received different forms of treatment, I remained in pain and without hope. After the in-depth physical exam by Dr. Nwofia and his thourgh evaluation of my history he set in motion a plan that includes cervical epidural and prescribed pain medication's that have started me on a path of hope.|Dr huddleston has been amazing I would refer my friends any time. I love that we pray at the end of every session. He has helped with my pain tremendously. He definitely cares about his patients. He is a good listener when I go in and talk about my family like my mother's second boat with cancer. He always has something positive to say. He is an Amazing Dr.|Horrible first visit for a pain clinic.  Dr Evans first words out of her mouth after waiting over 2 hours to be seen was that I was too young and did not look like I was in the amount of pain I was describing.  I was very open and honest with the treatments I had and use for pain management and she said she could not treat me.  She discriminated against me based on my looks and acted like my chronic silent illnesses did not warrant any further pain management.  I did not ask to be diagnosed with such horrid diseases at a young age or to be born with them.  She down played results of testing and stated they were not serious enough.  She had me in tears by the time I left the appointment and so discouraged.|I love this place! column2: Vanderbilt Pain Management Center Spring Hill
column3:
Vanderbilt Pain Management Center Spring Hill serves patients throughout Spring Hill, Tennessee and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. We're committed to helping you get the care you need, safely and effectively. Our specialized team of pain medicine physicians provides personalized treatment plans designed to improve quality of life and restore function for those suffering from chronic or acute pain conditions.

At Vanderbilt Pain Management Center, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain treatment, combining advanced medical interventions with therapeutic techniques. Our specialists are trained in the latest evidence-based treatments, including minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and integrative therapies. We treat a wide range of conditions, from back and neck pain to complex regional pain syndrome, ensuring each patient receives individualized care.

Safety Protocols

Your safety is our top priority. Vanderbilt Health has implemented comprehensive safety measures that follow—and in some cases exceed—local, state, and CDC public health recommendations. Everyone in our facilities wears masks, including patients, visitors, doctors, nurses, and staff. We sanitize rooms between each patient visit and clean public spaces frequently throughout the day. Temperature checks and symptom screenings are conducted for everyone entering our facilities. We've also reconfigured our waiting areas with spaced seating and limited elevator capacity to maintain safe physical distancing of six feet.

Convenient Access to Care

Located at 1003 Reserve Blvd, Suite 130 in Spring Hill, TN 37174, our center offers convenient access to specialized pain management services. We've resumed all surgeries, procedures, and clinic visits that were previously paused or delayed. For added convenience, telehealth visits are also available for appropriate cases, allowing patients to receive care from the comfort of their homes.

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, call us at (615) 322-4311 or visit our website at www.vanderbilthealth.com/painmedicine. At Vanderbilt Pain Management Center Spring Hill, we're in this with you—committed to helping you find relief and improve your quality of life.
column11: We're in this with you, to help you get the care you need, safely. Vanderbilt Health has restarted surgeries, procedures and clinic visits that were paused or delayed. Safety is our top priority, with measures that follow - and in some cases exceed - local, state and CDC public health recommendations. Everyone wears a mask - patients, visitors, doctors, nurses and staff. We're sanitizing rooms between each patient, and cleaning public spaces frequently throughout the day. We're checking everyone for fever and symptoms before they enter our facilities. We've spaced chairs in waiting areas, limited the number who can ride elevators at once and made other changes so we can keep a safe (6 feet) physical distance. And telehealth visits may be...

Dr. Nunley was so friendly and kept telling me to let him know if pain from injection was too much. It wasn't. He was very caring how I felt and! I felt comfortable around him. Also his nurse was very sweet and caring.|I have been seeing Dr. Nunley now for a couple of years with him treating my severe arthritis that afflicts several of my major joints.  My right shoulder is bone on bone with zero cartilage in the joint and is very painful.  When it gets to where I can't deal with the pain, Dr. Nunley gives me a shot and most of the time the steroid shot helps.  Dr. Nunley knows exactly where to place the shot after viewing with the ultrasound unit.  Dr. Nunley is one of my favorite doctors because he takes the time to talk with you and listens to you to the point where he understands your problems, makes sure you know your options and proceeds with the unanimous agreed upon action.|"The best service". Dr Nunley is wonderful. He makes me feel at ease ...Dr. Nunley is  smart , caring and knowledgeable about all subjects. He really wants to take care of his patients and stop their pain or control what he can. He's honest and will tell you the truth about what's going on. He also has the best nurses.I especially love Donna.|Pain is not easy to deal with in life, especially chronic pain. I feel blessed that I have a doctor like Dr. Nunley who is compassionate and caring in his approach with chronic pain management. He doesn't just look at the patient, but the patient's overall wellbeing. He treats his patients with dignity and respect. Armed with his genuineness in caring for patients, Dr. Nunley's process includes the arsenal of not just medicine, but genuine care for the body, mind, and spirit, The nursing staff and the office staff are the same way. They are the very best. If you have to have care for chronic pain, I recommend the Interventional Spine and Pain center.|I love Dr. Nunley,
He is kind and caring and explains every single detail of his findings. He offers some solutions he thinks will help me. I have suffered with pain for years and he truly listens and cares. I am not judged or treated like a "junkie or pill seeker."|Dr Nunley was personable, professional and concerned about my condition. He met with me and explained the procedure before we entered the treatment room. The staff is helpful, respectful and one couldn't  ask for a better experience.|As always the nurses, especially Melody has been very helpful and kind. Dr. Nunley is the kind of Doctor all patients want to be seen by. He sits down and listens to your concerns and always makes the process easier|I've been through many years of suffering and treated as a drug seeker by certain Doctors that obviously did not understand chronic pain. I have been made feel shame and embarrassment by the very professionals that I did expect to help me.
My choice to have a gastric bypass was the wrong choice for me. The effect of this surgery has caused  damage in multiple organs with permanent health deficiencies and  pain causing suffering that I struggled to endure.
Once I was seen at the Interventional Spine and Pain Center,
I was evaluated in depth mentally and physically for my condition and have been treated consistently from day one. Their professionalism and ability to empathize with my health situation has saved my life. Treatment has been with total and holistic care for my well being. There is follow up and monitoring with all of my outside specialist.
I am thriving, surviving and able to endure each day because of the close monitoring and care I receive from my Doctor and Nurse at The Interventional Spine and Pain Center in Manchester Tennessee. My care here is a Blessing in my life and my journey is not over yet.

I have been a patient with them for over a year. They truly are compassionate about their patients. They are very very professional which these days you don't get from people very often. Thank you for your great company.|Wonderful doctor's and nurse practitioner and staff that care about what is going on with your pain and want to get to the point.If you got to have test done they get it set up as fast as they can. The staff treat you like family they joke around with you to make you kind of feel better when you are hurting so bad you don't want to smile. Yes I would send other to them if they where looking for this kind of doctor|Very professional staff. Lately it seems hard to find care from kind and understanding even qualified individual's, but, I have been coming to this doctor since last year and have never had any issues with the skyline or centennial locations. Doctor Schmidt really listens to you and wants to help you with your problem area. His nurses are great! I would recommend this office 10/10|I have been to Premier Pain and Spine twice now and both times the entire team has been wonderful.  A recent phone call to the office resulted in the staff going above and beyond to address my concerns and pain prior to a long holiday weekend.  Thank you Dr. Schmidt and team for all you do.|Dr Alex Schmidt, I had a procedure done, I was kinda afraid but he is amazing and awesome I didn't feel anything. Him and his staff are amazing. So thankful for them. Forever thankful for them.|Treatment at Premiere gave me my life back.   At 38, I've done everything and searched everywhere to find relief from my painful, insomnia and symptoms that made life impossible.  I searched everywhere for help.
I walked out of my first appointment at Premier empowered and hopeful.  I'd tried everything possible to manage my pain since I was a child and it often ended feeling hopeless. Suffering with chronic pain only can be relieved if the practitioners are aware of the whole picture. I know well what it feels like to be suffering and met with stigma often causing many patients who are just like me to give up on treatment altogether. At premiere I can absolutely feel heard which often is the first hurtle when searching for help. I am treated with dignity and compassion by a knowledgeable staff who actually care.  Bottom line, I am treated like a human being by people who know what they are talking about.
Premier is a huge factor in my ability to live life with dignity.  I quit smoking, drinking and am able to be present today.  My sleep improved greatly! If I have a concern or question I am met with knowledge and compassion.   The experience of being seen is a powerful one when searching for relief and proper care.  The difference is apparent from Day 1.
Martha, Wendy and truly the entire staff operate with a standard of care I'd never experienced before and will forever be grateful for.  You will absolutely be given holistic care that you won't find anywhere else.   Thank you all so much for treating me like a human being after a long road of frustration.  I got my life back.|I have been going here just about a year now. Started with jessica than with lauren. BOTH are AWESOME doctors. Dr schmidt i have meant once he was also really awesome and they ACTUALLY listen to the problem. I have a rare autoimmune disease and they are very patient, and they try to understand more of what my APS affects my body and idk what else to stay honestly. I'm so happy to have found a great team of docs. The staff is always awesome and friendly. Very helpful. I would highly highly recommend them to anyone!!|The doctors and nurses here are wonderful. They treat you respectfully and they care about the pain you're going through. I love it here and the office is always clean. Oh yeah they always greet you and most of them no you by name.I'll give more stars than you can ever give.

Howell Allen Clinic serves Hendersonville, Tennessee and the greater Nashville area with exceptional pain management services through the expertise of Dr. Forrest P. Allen, DO. As a distinguished member of the medical community, Dr. Allen brings his double board certification and dual fellowship training in Interventional Pain Management and Sports Medicine to provide comprehensive care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. His practice combines cutting-edge interventional procedures with personalized treatment plans to help patients regain mobility and improve their quality of life.

Dr. Allen stands out as one of the first physicians in the Nashville area to perform numerous innovative interventional procedures. With over 15,000 interventional procedures performed to date, his extensive experience translates to confident, skilled care for each patient. Dr. Allen remains committed to staying at the forefront of pain management advancements, consistently incorporating the latest evidence-based techniques into his practice.

Academic Contributions

Throughout his distinguished career, Dr. Allen has made significant contributions to the field of pain management through participation in numerous clinical research studies. His commitment to advancing medical knowledge is further demonstrated by his presentations at major medical societies across the nation, sharing insights and techniques with colleagues in the field.

Patient-Centered Approach

At the core of Dr. Allen's practice is a dedication to providing patients with the best minimally invasive options to treat their pain. His comprehensive approach considers each patient's unique circumstances, developing customized treatment plans that address both symptoms and underlying causes. Patients benefit from his expertise in sports medicine and interventional techniques that promote healing while minimizing recovery time.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Forrest P. Allen at the Howell Allen Clinic, please call +1 615-327-9543. The clinic is conveniently located at 114 Saundersville Rd, Hendersonville, TN 37075. For more information about Dr. Allen's qualifications and services, visit https://www.howellallen.com/physicians/allen/.

The Pain Management Group: Hendersonville serves patients throughout Hendersonville, Tennessee and surrounding Middle Tennessee communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. column40:
This is by far the worst pain clinic I have ever been to in ten years! Dr. Hill treated me with suspicion and rudeness on my very first visit! I got an appt right away, but when I got there he started grilling me about my last pain mgmt doctor, that I needed a discharge letter and that he was going to  get my records. FINE! Most places do that BEFORE you get scheduled! He said he looked up my xrays at Premeir on the web! So they just post your xrays on the internet??? Yeah, right!! He had me in tears on my second visit over a drug I used to take showing up on my drug screen! NEVER happed before!  His NP was a jerk, too, and put a date lock on my script, so I have to wait 31'days instead of 30. I will go back to where I went before and only left because it was an hour's drive away. DO NOT GO TO PMG! I wish I had seen all these bad reviews before I changed clinics.|I've been going to PMG for a year and Chris and everyone else takes time to listen to the issues . That makes living through chronic spine pain alil more manageable  .|Update: This is a long overdue update. I see Dr. Hill and Chris now. They are amazing, as are most of the nursing staff. Misty (nurse), is awesome and super compassionate and friendly.  I try to make my appointments on the days she is there. Dr. Hill and Chris are both amazing, they take their time, listen and dont try to rush me out the door. They are both super friendly and empathetic to whats going on.  I have change my review from 1 star to 5 based on Dr. Hill, Chris and Misty.

Front desk staff still needs work. I feel like they hate their job. Never a smile, never a hello, good morning/afternoon, how are you, etc. I have just come to expect that when I get there.

2020 Review Below
Dr. Reddy and his nurses are amazing. However, it is almost impossible to get anyone on the phone. I tried for 3 hours today and was just left on hold every time for over 30 mins. This is an everyday problem,  not just today. Been trying for weeks to get through. In addition, most, not all, of the front desk staff are rude and will ignore you while you are standing at their desk to check in. One day I stood their for 6 mins and they completely ignored me until I asked if I could check in.  Then I got an attitude. My pharmacy has been trying to reach them for over a week to fill my prescription and they do not respond. I haven't had my nerve medication in over a week now. They need to fire most of the staff and get ppl in there that actually want to do their job. Not even sure how they're even open. There is never anyone there no matter what day or time I go. Makes no sense why they dont answer the phones.|Haven't even been able to schedule yet and I've already had to deal with someone incredibly rude on the phone. Please train your customer service people in how to service a customer without catching a tone|I wouldn't advise you see Chrissy Moore. Her office staff will chat with patients in front of you,stalling you from checking in in time. When that office staff asks if you could still be seen (conveniently leaving out their long convo making you later, too late) Chrissy will turn  you away for being too late. Perhaps if they didn't have just one person working the desk that apparently doesn't care about whether or not you make your appointment, this would have been completely avoided. My mother is a person and patient first. She is not a billing claim or a paycheck. She deserves to see providers that will value and actually care about her, not about how quickly they can eat their delivery. This is why we will leave this practice and now go closer to home. Two providers there are losing a very good patient. Perhaps Chrissy and the practice as a whole can use this as a learning experience and improve their procedures for their other patients.|It's hard reading all these reviews that talk Dr. Reddi wasn't compassionate or the front staff was awful and no one could get through on the phone. That hasn't been my experience at all. I've been able to reach someone on the phone each time I've called. When I came back to see Dr. Reddi after a 2 year break because my chronic pain became unbearable again, he remembered exactly who I was and what I was suffering from. He's always taken the time to listen to me and I felt very validated and heard when I left his office. If you are suffering, please give them a chance because they are a great group of people.|Not happy with the level of care, or how the system is set up... not being able to dial up a particular office or even reach the last person you spoke with is maddening! The support staff is severely lacking manners, office etiquette, as well as a sense of urgency when the waiting room queue is steadily backing up. The Doctors these folks are representing would be well advised to clean house and try again! Some of the PA's could seriously use some work on listening, empathy for your fellow man, and bedside manners as well!! Believe the reviews, keep shopping!|They've done an excellent job of reducing arthritis pain in my lower back. They've done a couple of procedures,cans I was quite satisfied with the experience. They sedate you, and work with individual idiosyncrasies.

If you're looking for someone who will throw painkillers at you, you need to keep looking. They use painkillers, but they keep close tabs on you, including testing and pill counts.

The office staff is a bit hit and miss. Some staff are more charming than others.

column40:
Had my Dr get me a expedited appt after months and half the wound clinic received a message saying sounding like I was wanting rx meds and they did not prescribe any even the Drs were joking saying and it's a pain clinic that don't prescribe.|I have never left a medical facility in tears as I did when I left this place. First of all I am going to start with the fact that I am not a drug seeker frankly I avoid taking prescription pain medication unless it is to the point I have to so I am not an addict but do have chronic pain that I deal with daily and interferes with my quality of life.  I seen Dr Ward after waiting 2 months to get an appointment and an hour in waiting room he spends a total of 3 minutes in the room with me. He ask me nothing about my pain and never examines me at all.  He did say he wasn't going to give me pain medication ok that's fine I was more interested in injection or something for relief.  I was offered nothing no muscle relaxer injection nothing I am left to suffer. I have never been treated like this before.  I hope this doctor never gets treated like I did today. And Thank you Doctor Ward my kids Thank You as Well|My husband who is not a drug seeker saw Dr Jain and he had never been rescheduled for a return visit even though he prescribed him medicine. Called last night to be told that the dr had recommeded a spinal stimulator however that had never been discussed with him and that he would have to see a psychologist to have this done. Today they called and the Dr has decided not to see my husband anymore because they are unwilling to prescribing anything more nor was my husband willing to do the shots which was a lie so what I was told last night must have been a lie. This is the worst place on earth and the nurses are rude and disrespectful! Why did this ignorant doctor prescribe something if he had no intention of following up.|This was the worst place I could have gone for treatment. They treated me as if my pain really wasn't as severe as I was telling them. They made me feel like a junky every visit. The nurse practitioner they stuck me with was atrocious. Her name was Rebecca. She made me feel unworthy of being there at all, even though I had back surgery while being a patient. I have multiple herniations of discs in my neck and lower discs that ruptured as well as nerve damage that can't be fixed. My last visit I was one pill short on my pill count and she kicked me out. She said it doesn't matter if it's one or a hundred your short. I explained that I may have over looked one in my daily dose pack at home and She said that was a personal problem. She made it clear to me that she doesn't like poor folks so if you aren't affluent I wouldn't even consider going here.|When Dr.Pearson was there, she cared about your pain level and your well being. After she left the place has done a complete turn around. They care nothing about how bad your pain is and all they want to do is injections, which would be fine if they worked for me. Every visit they cut my meds down and tell me I could have a injections. I am in so much pain I am unable to do anything, my blood pressure is running out of control, I have diabetes and was keeping it under control by walking now I have been put on diabetic meds. When I told Painter about it she did not care and told me to lose weight and then cut my meds down more. Dr. Pearson told me that painter was uncaring and that she would never put me with her, after Dr.Pearson left I was stuck with her. If you are truly in pain stay away from these Doctors.|I absolutely loved Dr Pearson. I been with them for a few months and have reactive arthritis , degenerative disks, three bones that need fused. Recently had a flare, a bout with Flu, and a stomach bug. I have had 1 injection but missed 2 due to having infection. Called and cancelled 1 and the other in office. Even was prescribed more than normal on last visit, had pharmacy call with deacrepance and give me the regular amount. Well I get called for a medication count and drug screen same day as a drug screen for DOT card. Some how they say I had no medication in my system there but at my DOT I did. Explain this?

I am now dropped, won't even finish with my injections or nerve ablation. Kick out the pill seekers faking the issue and let us who want to work be treated. I've had various drug screens for employment and all have read lortab over the past few weeks. My pain keeps me from working. I can barely even pee to get y'all a good sample because of my urinary inflammation. I have taken a driving position so hopefully, but doubtful, I won't need medication.  I even asked if decreasing it so I could take this job was a option and asked for a letter to be sent to my DOT appointment that would allow me to pass. If not back to disability and you doctors can pay my bills. I would have came right back in if you would ask. I'm tired of jumping through hoops wearing ankle boots, taking 12 medications, and having to rub compounds on me everyday just so I can work.  Shame on you. Get rid of Rebecca or you are going to lose patients. Everyone else there is great.

And furthermore both test were done at Ballad facilities but you can't except the one done just a couple hours later at Occupational Medicine? Or follow through with your responsibilities as a nurse to cancel a procedure when I asked you too?|I'm a 24yr combat Veteran I could not get the care and treatment from the VA mountain home. I sent up an appointment and 30mins later I knew these people  actually cared and came up with treatment  plan. The doctors and nurses here are top notch! NP. Weaver is a great doc! She actually listens!|This office is the only one that I feel really listens. They are friendly and helpful. I have had to go in a few times to get things straightened out like a prescription that my insurance wouldn't cover ect. Alway got things fixed same day and normally within a few minutes. I love the Drs I have seen they really listen to me and care. They also do not try to push pain medication as a magical fix.

column40: I gave my friend's mom a ride to her appointment the other day so I just came inside with her. The woman that helped her at the desk was nice and the nurse that came in and helped her was also very sweet. However, her actual Doctor, Dr.Hall, was extremely unprofessional. Mind you this is my first appointment with her and him, but he was calling her "trouble" and scolding her like a child. He was saying things like "this is your fault not mine" and treating her like she was incompetent. Regardless of what she was failing to do for their appointment the way he behaved and spoke to her was extremely unprofessional. The receptionist at the desk while we were leaving also said said some out of pocket things and began apologizing to us for what she'd just said.... overall just not a great place for professional care|I have liked Dr. Tolman from day one. He is easy to talk to and he is the only administer of injections that have ever worked for me. The office and medical staff have always handled any issues with a sense of urgency.|Dr's Homoyla & former Partner, Dr. Tolman were a gift to me!  They have continuously made adjustments to my treatment in order to relieve my pain. My PA, Tom just gave me a Steroid Injection that has totally solved my extreme Hip Pain from Bursa!  My pain is more manageable than with previous Pain clinics. Although it's a long drive for me, Integrity Pain Consultants is totally worth the time!  They do have 2 offices, 1 in Hermitage and 1 in Hendersonville.|Dr Tolman and his staff treat me with respect and marvelous care. I have had numerous procedures and my pain has been greatly reduced. I would recommend this office to anyone with chronic pain conditions.|I have been seeing them since my work injury.  Their care is amazing, they listen and get to the source of your problem. They listen and help without being judgemental.|Tried to make an appointment for my mom here because it's close to her house. Called several times and left messages. Called every day for 3 weeks because of excruciating pain after first injection and nothing. No body else will touch you after being referred here and hes too busy care
