column40: Gracepoint adds a human touch to pain management that is unmatched by the other pain management facilities, they show genuine care and concern for every patient they see. I am proud to consider these fine men and women family. Grace point does way more than distribute medication they do an excellent job of assessing your pain, and offering the most effective treatment. I personally have never experienced this level of professionalism and efficiency from any healthcare provider, i am always in and out in a very timely manner yet all of my questions and concerns are always addressed. Grace Point operates like a well oiled machine. Tracy B.|I am very impressed by the care and professionalism Grace point has shown me.A five star review is really not enough to describe their caring and level of efficiency. As a patient I really couldn't ask for a better pain management, and would definitely recommend them to family and friends. Kenneth U.|Grace point their entire staff are the kindest group of folks that are there to help you , they offer alternatives to manage your pain. I'm so excited to go to my next appointment cause I will be starting the RPW treatment.  I'm hoping it helps my pain in my shoulders and neck.  Ever since 2018 when I was in a ATV accident and flipped off the four-wheeler and landed on my neck and shoulders at first I thought I had a broken neck thankfully no broken bones but I still was banged up pretty good and since then tho I have had pain in my neck and shoulders and back.  And I recently tore both rotator cuffs the left one much worse than the right,  I was told I really needed surgery.  I have had 11 surgeries for multiple health reasons so I didn't want a 12th surgery. Instead I came to grace point to find ways to successfully treat and manage my pain so that I can have somewhat of a normal life and do the things people without chronic pain enjoy. I've been going here for 5 months now and can say I am able to do more things I enjoy and am managing my pain successfully.  Thanks to the ladies here they're beautiful and wonderful caring souls|Grace Pain Management is a very nice environment and The Staff is Very Friendly and Helpful and Concerned about your pain and I have been to several Facilities and Grace Point is by far the best I have been associated with in the past 10-12 years and would Recommend anyone having pain Issues To call and set up a appointment  and I promise you will not Regret it and will leave with a Smile.i know I'm happy I made the decision to come Come to Grace Point|Excellent staff, and I mean every one working there.||

column38: Tracy Smith|Tammy Ogburn|Vernon Jones|Christine Evans|Angie Ross|randy nelson|Pam Wiseman|OnTheGoNailz Salon & Spa
column40:
There has to be a place that's more professional, upstanding and empathetic than this. My son is quadriplegic and in chronic pain every day. His prescription was due to be filled on 2/15. After dealing with reminder calls since last week (their request), repeated unanswered calls, voicemails, line holding, hangups, and even the text line that they have, I drove 45 minutes to the office to witness signs on the door stating that they aren't opening back up until the 25th and that they will be closed every Monday. There was absolutely no notice. Now, we are stuck trying to connect with the insurance company and other agencies to try to get my son the help he needs. My son has been a patient for years and the last two years have given rise to high attrition from doctors and staff, piss poor standard of care, constant forgetting to send in prescriptions, witnessing patients come in as directed but staff input wrong information and then the patient be rescheduled, and etc. When you finally reach someone on the phone, it more often than not someone from another country who basically conveys that they will have the messages forwarded to the office and then you wait and wait some more. Please, find someplace else to go. Save yourselves this constant stress, aggravation and pain if possible. It was not like this in the beginning. Now, it's atrocious. He's been assigned to 5-6 different doctors/NPs since he's been here...four have left.|Please don't let this reviews fool you. I started here two years ago following my doctor from another facility. Hugh mistake!!! You can never get anyone on the phone besides foreigners that's stationed somewhere is stationed outside the office. The doctor does not have proper bedside manners and don not care if your meds are on time or not. Expect to be at the least a week behind on refills so if you can manage your pain without your meds then this the place to go. If you don't care how your doctor treats you then this the place to go. If you want the proper treatment for your pain management then don't go here.|Shawne Martin , FNP.  I love this doctor she cares about her patients, She takes time to ask questions and she takes equal amount time to answer questions. She is  very insightful, compassionate and helpful. She understands pain management and how it affects your body.  She has great bed side manners, you are a patient and not a number.

My only complaint is systematic issues when needing prescription filled in timely manner, I have waited for up to 7 days before my prescription was called in, medical withdrawal is pain and it does a number on your body.

You MUST be mindful of your therapeutic level, It may have decrease and that causes you to sleep a lot until your body regulates itself back to your prescribed dosage.

The young ladies at the front desk is kind and always has been professional, when I was having an issue with getting my prescription, she called management to the front.|I've been coming to this office for nearly 7 years? I've gone through several Dr's and turn overs. I stay here only because it's the closest to me and I do like the staff there.  It has happened more than once and this week I've been calling and leaving messages on every extension,I spoke to someone 2 times, and was assured my medicine would be called in,I stayed on hold 3 separate times 1 for a hour and 36 minutes while on a 2nd phone for 56 minutes only to get disconnected on one and had to leave a message on the other. 3 days now and I'm out of my medicines that were due to be picked up 3 days ago!!  There's ABSOLUTELY NO EXCUSE for this to have happened.  I truly hope leaving this review will get someone to contact me and help in some way fix the issues this office has.  I'm going to do more research to find a way to contact corporate offices to report and get this worked out.  Until then I would ABSOLUTELY advise any & everyone to find another office.  If anything changes or comes from this I will repost to help others.  Lastly I am NOT the only person whom has gone through this so beware.|I saw Shawna Martin, N.P. and she was amazing! She took her time with me and really listened. In the past, I have felt like other doctors have rushed me in and out and didn't really stop to listen to what I was saying. Shawna addressed all of my concerns and did her best to help me find a treatment plan that worked for me. I really hope she stays at this location!|They kicked me a 100% disabled vet out for not wearing a mask in 2021 when I was fully vaccinated, no symptoms, and they wouldnt furnish a mask or covering as they did previous appointments. No sympathy no compassion they just refused me pain treatment. To this day im without and being treated less than if I took an injured dog to the vet for pain. Pathetic what has happened to chronic pain sufferers in the name of bad drs and worse addicts stealing. I hope to god I get help and these people get fired for what they did.|I  have visited the Cordova office several times and every time I see Dr McCoy he claims to send in all my refills only for me to go to the pharmacy and find out he did not do the job he was paid for. I call and call and call leaving voicemails and text messages to no avail.
I'm in search of legal council for pain and suffering as I am Now having to hunt someone down there who has a brain and can call in meds for me.  I've read the reviews and I'm not the only one with this issue.|I have been here only 3 times.  The first time I was turned around because my paperwork was complete. This didn't bother me. The 2nd Time the doctor needed records.  January 19th I came and Dr McCoy discusses my treatment.  I have called twice a week sometimes 3 to the pharmacy and to Pain Management Centers of America about my prescriptions.  Their customer service line Which shouldn't have access to my records told me that they see prescriptions for my other pain meds and they will be sent over twice week I called Monday and asked that dr. McCoy or His give me a call back I have not done a return call. Dr wants me to let him manage all of my other medication my primary care doctor writes but I can't even get one prescription He told me would be called to the pharmacy , now I'm sitting in front of the building and they are not even open but Google says they are

Dr. Madhu Yelameli serves patients throughout Columbia, Tennessee, and surrounding areas as a dedicated pain management specialist. With a compassionate approach to patient care, Dr. Yelameli combines evidence-based treatments with personalized attention to help individuals suffering from chronic pain conditions. The practice offers comprehensive evaluations and innovative treatment options designed to improve quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

At his practice located at 1040 N James Campbell Blvd, Suite 108, Columbia, TN 38401, Dr. Yelameli provides a range of specialized interventions for pain relief. Patients benefit from his expertise in treating conditions including:

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain disorders

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Yelameli's philosophy centers on developing individualized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient. By combining interventional procedures, medication management when appropriate, and rehabilitation techniques, he helps patients achieve meaningful pain reduction and improved function. The practice emphasizes education and active patient participation in the treatment process.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Madhu Yelameli, patients can call +1 615-661-7888 or visit the practice website at www.nashvillepaincenters.com/physicians. The office welcomes new patients and accepts most major insurance plans. The convenient Columbia location offers accessible parking and a comfortable, modern facility designed with patient comfort in mind.

Center For Spine Joint and Neuromuscular Rehabilitation serves Murfreesboro, TN and surrounding areas with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our multidisciplinary facility brings together diverse specialists under one roof, eliminating the need for patients to travel between multiple providers. We take pride in our team-based approach that addresses a wide spectrum of pain conditions through personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique circumstances.

At the Center for Spine, Joint & Neuromuscular Rehabilitation, we understand that pain management often requires multiple perspectives. Our integrated team includes board-certified physicians and therapists specializing in anesthesiology, physical medicine and rehabilitation, orthopedics, and physical therapy. This collaborative environment ensures that patients receive thorough evaluations and coordinated treatment plans that address the root causes of their pain.

Personalized Treatment Approach

We recognize that every patient's pain experience is unique. Our specialists work together to develop customized solutions specific to the pain you're experiencing. Whether you're suffering from chronic back pain, joint issues, sports injuries, or neuromuscular conditions, our team has the expertise to provide targeted interventions designed for your specific needs.

Expert Team of Specialists

When you visit our center, you'll work with top doctors from our team of board-certified physicians and therapists. Our diverse expertise allows us to offer comprehensive care for a variety of conditions, ensuring you receive the most appropriate and effective treatments available.

Contact Information

column40: MY experience  has been excellent!  Asha, is so kind and considerate.  The nurses couldn't be sweeter. The receptionists are all very sweet and patient.  Everyone that I have had contact with have just been great.  The office is clean and spacious for walkers or wheel chairs.  There is a water machine.  There is also a large screen TV.|I have been a patient here for almost 8 years. There has been an issue or two, years ago. They were resolved. Doctor Le really cares about his patients. He took the time with me, I'm terrified of needles, to earn my trust and ease my nerves so that I was able to allow myself to have very helpful treatments. I had had a horrible experience immediately before coming here. That's why it will be terrifying to go elsewhere. Unfortunately I can't afford self pay anymore and the only insurance that I can afford is not accepted. I will truly miss this place and pray I can find another doctor that I feel I can trust.|I have been a patient at this office for appx 9 years. I have an illness which has required multiple types of treatment, including medicinal, physical therapy, in office procedures, & a yearly behavioral therapy check up. Before settling on Dr. Le's office for permanent care of my illness, I had tried 2 other offices. I chose this office for my permanent care, because #1, it is truly a full care facility. Any treatment I need specific to my illness can be done within this office. This includes doctor visits, small procedures, physical therapy, behavior therapy, and multiple testing procedures. There is also a pharmacy across the hall if you should need it. I feel this is very vital to the high level and continuity of my care, having all treatments through this one office means, to me, that the doctors and practioners have full access and knowledge to every part of my illness and it's treatment. They are aware if something does or doesn't work for me, and I never have to repeat a treatment that isn't beneficial to my care, which I appreciate. The second reason I chose this office is due to the wonderful people who work there. In 9 years, I have never had any negative experiences with anyone. Everyone from reception, to nurses, to doctors and to check out, is very kind, pleasant, and accommodating to any special needs you might have. Dr. Le is spectacular at his profession, he has performed back procedures on me that truly improved my quality of life, which involved almost no additional pain and very little recovery. He is amazing. Dr. Bryant is my primary care physician within this office, and she is also amazing at her job. She has patiently answered every question I've ever had, and taken into consideration my own feelings towards aspects of my treatment. She has performed treatments that were extremely beneficial to helping me increase activity levels, while also helping decrease my pain in those areas. I have really appreciated being under Dr. Bryant's care. I have referred this office to other people who needed this type of care, and they too, have had really successful experiences. I would definitely refer Dr. Le's practice to anyone in need of his services. I go to the office in Summit Medical Center, but there are other offices that might be better located to your home. I feel this practice is very focused on good patient care and is fully equipped to give every patient as comprehensive care as possible.|Great place! I'm always in and out and never have to wait over 30 minutes. My doctor always is attentive to my needs and the whole staff is very professional! I would reccomend the Center for Spine Joint and Neuromuscular Rehabilitation at Summit Medical to everyone who has chronic pain. They rock!|I am not comfortable with new people or places like most people I'm assuming but Dr. Lee made me ease. I would strongly recommend him and the facility|In my opinion Center for Spine and Neurological  made me feel welcome and comfortable. The staff is very professional and friendly. I considered it a blessing to be treated with such experience and confidence by Dr. Lee's staff.|Absolutely love the care and detail they give here.  Truly works with you to find solutions and different ways to treat you. Very professional but also very friendly. They take great care of you.|I was referred to SJNMR for treatment of my neck & back injuries after a car accident. Dr. Overfelt & all of the staff was very polite & they were always nice & super professional when handling anything. My treatment was a very thorough & accurate process. I would definitely recommend them to anyone!

column3:
Tennessee Pain Surgery Center serves patients throughout Antioch, TN and the greater Nashville metropolitan area with specialized interventional pain management services. Established with a mission to provide comprehensive care for chronic pain conditions, our state-of-the-art ambulatory surgery center offers minimally invasive procedures designed to improve quality of life while reducing reliance on pain medications. Our board-certified physicians combine decades of experience with the latest evidence-based techniques to address a wide spectrum of pain disorders.

At Tennessee Pain Surgery Center, we provide targeted interventions for various chronic pain conditions, including spinal pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our procedures include epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and peripheral nerve blocks. Each treatment plan is customized to address the specific needs and circumstances of individual patients.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Our Antioch facility features advanced medical technology and equipment in a comfortable, patient-centered environment. Located at 5811 Crossings Blvd, Antioch, TN 37013, our surgery center was designed with patient comfort and safety as top priorities. The center meets rigorous accreditation standards and maintains strict protocols for infection control and patient monitoring.

Expert Medical Team

Our physicians are fellowship-trained in pain management and anesthesiology, bringing specialized expertise to each procedure. The clinical staff includes experienced nurses and medical technicians dedicated to providing compassionate care and support throughout the treatment process. Our team works collaboratively to ensure optimal outcomes and patient satisfaction.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in empowering patients through education and shared decision-making. During consultations, our specialists take time to explain pain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes. This collaborative approach helps patients make informed choices about their care plan and actively participate in their recovery journey.

For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit our website at https://tnpainsurgerycenter.com/ or call us at +1 615-941-4820. Tennessee Pain Surgery Center is committed to helping patients find relief from chronic pain and return to the activities they enjoy.

I was told that this was done because, I had been the last person of the day, and I would take too long to wake up as they all wanted to go home. But, after making sure that this would not happen again, this last time, I was treated cheerfully by the anesthetician Tony who took an who took into account what had happened seriously and I also treated nicely by the nurses. I got a great greeting from Dr. Miller before I went under. I am waiting for the nerves to settle in order to see if this particular ablation worked. The ablation eight months ago did not have any effect on my pain. why it sometimes works and sometimes it doesn't is a mystery.|I have been having nerve blocks and radial ablation for about 5 years. I've never had a bad experience and the staff has always been comforting and kind and go out of their way to do so. I just want them both to know they are great and thank them for being so kind to me each time I was there. They really made the experience bearable.|Dr Fritz was amazing. Two more of these epidural shots and I'm done with them in my C 5 and C6. He is so good! All I felt was a small pinch from the numbing before the epidural shot and woke up this morning like new. Haven't slept this good in years  Thank you Dr. Fritz great Job!

column40:
I had a Nurse named George. Absolutely awful. I have Parkinson's. He treated me as if I were not a person. Called to make appointment to come in to see a doctor. I had a spinal stimulator put in. My doctor left. I wasn't seen after my operation by any doctor.only George Miers, the Nurse. He yelled at me on the phone. I was on speaker. Everyone in car heard him. He told me I couldn't come back to that office, my doctor want there any more. Because of  Nurse George, I am never going back. I may be handic but I'm still a person George! I wouldn't give you a 1 out of 5 stars. You ruined that office for me!!! Also, he was flirting with the women who worked in the office!!!|Very professional. Extremely knowledgeable, they are a legitimate pain management clinic. They offer a lot of different types of pain management And procedures to Target your pain with many different types of combo type therapies and treatment. I deal with chronic pain they have been able to help me considerably. They really put in focus and effort on targeting your pain.|HORRIBLE OFFICE! They charged me an office visit when I did not receive any visit/procedure. I called to speak to the office manager and billing department and nobody helped look into it. On my patient portal it shows notes that were falsified and notes from my first visit pasted again, with information that never occurred.

On another visit I signed a form to put my procedure through with insurance because they said it wont be covered. They sent me a bill of the cash price. I reached out to insurance and they explained nothing was ever filed with them and insurance reached out and it was completely covered. They then started billing more things on this procedure to gain extra costs.

I would ABSOLUTELY STAY AWAY from them, only cause more pain and frustration.

UPDATE! After months of speaking to them, they said they will look into it. Well they just instead ignore it and don't get back to you.|THIS IS A LONG READ BUT SOMETHING YOU SHOULD KNOW!!
Initially I thought I had found the best Dr ever when I saw Dr Vanterpool, but as it turned out it was the worst experience of my life going to the pain clinic there! She was able to diagnose my CRPS right away and started a treatment plan but it didn't work and there was no kind of backup plan in between my appointments which would be weeks apart and I was in a lot of pain. Anytime I would call, I I seldom got an answer but the voicemail says your call will be returned the same day if it's before 3 pm, but I never received a call at all most of the time! If I did, it was from the receptionist at the front desk. She would put me through to someone in the back and I would get their voicemail and they would not return my call! When I had appointments I rarely saw Dr Vanterpool but rather someone who I thought was a PA of hers, but was told he was only a Nurse Practitioner. Dr. Vanterpool has taken on too many patients to see them all very often and she takes off a LOT of days from work! She micro manages the office and doesn't allow anyone who works under her to do ANYTHING! She is the only person that can order a prescription or make a decision for a patient about anything....even her pharmacist cannot call in a refill for you! This is no way to successfully run an office of any kind. It is doomed to fail! They had 3 people to quit in a short time and the ones left were throwing their hands up trying to keep things going. I wonder why THEY all left??? She put me on a pain patch that was addictive. It never helped my pain and I kept calling the office telling them it was only giving me terrible side effects such as dizziness, nausea, vomiting, sweats and Insomnia. FINALLY after a few weeks something was called in to help those symptoms! My last visit to see her was to help me taper off the patch. I go in and there is her Nurse Practitioner...not her of course
Then he decides, he'd better ask the boss, so he gets Dr. Vanterpool and when she comes in, rather than telling me how to start getting off this pain patch, she tells me that I
don't seem to be getting helped by her and she dismissed me from her care! She didn't give me anything to help me get off the addictive pain patch and I had to do it alone! What kind of Dr does this? Not a very good one. So all you people be very careful of what you let her do! I had withdrawal symptoms having to come off that pain patch and it was a miserable experience! She could have prevented that and that's what she was supposed to have done since she put me on it. That was a cruel thing to do!|Dr Vanterpool & her staff are great!  Physician Assistant, Jennifer Mitchell & her Medical Assistant, Amanda, have been very caring, attentive & persistent in making every effort possible in getting my husband all the help & assistance needed since his spinal cord stimulator placement.  I feel assured their goal is for him to be as pain free as possible!!|I've been going to UCPM for close to a year now. I've found them to be extremely professional from the front desk, to the exam rooms, to talking to any of the NPs working there, or any of the doctors who perform procedures there at the office or in Day Surgery.  Every single employee that I have ever met in my office appointments and Day Surgery have been knowledgeable, polite, courteous, kind, and encouraging, plus, and this is a big plus - they have a sense of humor.  Everything has been spelled out to me, my questions answered and they treat me as a person, asking me questions, what they can do to help me, and they pay attention.  I recommend this office to any and all that tell me they have pain.|Horrible Office, This is the second time my husband had a appointment with them and we have the appointment card showing the date and time, the office staff saying my husband does not have appointment till following week. We have a long drive to get to this office and such a waste of time for us going there.  The front desk does not know what they are doing and can not established the appointments correctly for the patients. My advice to you all is either go to another clinic with a better professional staff or call before going to be sure you are supposed to be there.|I had a spinal injection for lower back pain that gave me no relief.  When I went back for my follow up appointment my doctor was Jennifer Q. Mitchell, PA-C.  She was very knowledgeable and sympathetic that the first shot had not worked. She suggested where she thought it might need to be placed from the location of the symptoms I gave her.  She explained it very simply and professionally.  The second shot gave me 85 to 90% relief in about a week.  All the people at UCPM that I saw were good but she located the problem area that helped.

On my follow up visit for my second spinal injection Jennifer was glad to hear that it had worked. The stinging in the back of my legs was gone but I still had pain in my groin area on the right side. Jennifer, on further examination, ascertained that it was not my back causing that, it was my hip. She arranged for me to have an x-ray and a shot in the groin area of my hip which relieved 95% of my pain.

On my follow up visit for the injection in my hip I saw Audrey Wohl,MSN,FNP-BC. Jennifer had taken maternity leave to have her baby.  Audrey has taken up my care in Jennifer's absence. Audrey was very knowledgeable and gave us some very good advice concerning my continued care.  She suggested I do physical therapy on my hip and set me up with the UT physical therapist in Sevierville.

Apex Spine and Pain, PLLC serves Nashville, Tennessee and surrounding communities with comprehensive interventional pain management services. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Phillip Beaulieu, our practice specializes in addressing complex chronic pain conditions through minimally invasive techniques and personalized treatment plans. We combine cutting-edge medical technology with compassionate care to help patients regain mobility, reduce dependence on pain medications, and improve their overall quality of life.

Dr. Beaulieu is a highly qualified Interventional Pain Management Specialist with board certifications in both Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine. His extensive training and experience enable him to accurately diagnose and effectively treat a wide spectrum of pain disorders, from common back and neck pain to complex regional pain syndromes. Dr. Beaulieu takes a patient-centered approach, carefully listening to each individual's concerns and developing customized treatment strategies that address the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Our Services

At Apex Spine and Pain, we offer a comprehensive range of interventional procedures and treatments including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Facet joint injections

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Peripheral nerve blocks

  • Joint injections

  • Medication management

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life. Our team works diligently to provide prompt appointments, thorough evaluations, and clear communication throughout the treatment process. We collaborate with primary care physicians, surgeons, physical therapists, and other specialists to ensure coordinated care that addresses all factors contributing to a patient's pain condition.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Beaulieu, please contact us at +1 615-815-1560. Our office is conveniently located at 310 25th Ave N #203, Nashville, TN 37203. For more information about our services or to request an appointment online, visit our website at apexspinepain.com.

column40:
We were left in the exam room for about an hour before the doctor came in and we were only there to review results from a CT scan. When he did come in he was there for MAYBE 5min. We then went to schedule a procedure and get a referral and the people behind the desk were so disorganized and unable to figure out what the doctor was wanting. They couldn't find the referral, gave us wrong instructions for the procedure telling my dad not to take his heart meds the day of his procedure! Then to top everything off, the day of the procedure they kick me out of the EXAM room bc of my service dog claiming he can't be there when placing an IV!!!! Except I KNOW this is not true as my service dog and I have stayed in the HOSPITAL with my dad for over a week with IVs and blood draws happening all the time.
Save yourself the trouble and go somewhere else. I had a weird feeling about this place the first time I met the doctor and he had terrible bedside manner and I should have just listened to my intuition.|Dr. Colin Crosby recommended Dr.Bealiu and I'm so glad he did.  I needed a injection so bad before leaving for 3 weeks of vacation, did I say the week before Christmas and tornado hitting.
The office got me right in and the doctor was calming and so pleasant. I haven't had a speck
of pain since he did it. I would let him do any procedure and hope I don't have to go back though.
Thank you  Dr Bealiu and team!|My name is Rick and let me start by saying Dr. Beaulieu all but walks on water as far as I'm concerned! It was my first time for anything like this procedure so I was apprehensive. Dr. B made sure I was comfortable and talked to me making sure I trusted him and the procedure. He gave me a play by play of everything he was doing. I felt no pain. Only pressure from the medicine going in. It lasted 5 to 10 minutes tops. Got up after and went to work. The staff is so helpful! I've seen negative reviews. The staff consists of 3 including Doc. B. They field 100's of calls a day so it is a little difficult to get through. This is a good thing! Leave a message and they will get back to you as soon as they can. All questions can be answered on the day of your appointment. I will go to no other Doctor for this!|I've been seeing Dr. Beaulieu for several years now, he's helped me so much with spinal and knee injections along with the joint replacements I've been through. His office staff is always friendly and prompt in response to inquires. I'm thankful I found a great doctor who takes time to listen and his welcoming office staff.|Love my doctor, he helped me tremendously! The only complaint I have is that front desk lady doesn't stay in her seat to answer a phone that doesn't ring out loud. She is up talking to others all day!|10 years of back and neck pain...GONE!!!|

Great place to go.  Staff has always been nice to me.  The Dr added something new to my meds.  And wow!! What a difference it made.  After 10 years it's nice to wake up and to be in little to no pain. I can finally enjoy life. And miss Wendy is amazing.  She has a big heart.  She can always tell when something is bothering me and she will talk to me about it.|I feel heard and understood during my visits. The care is excellent and the staff is supportive. I was having a very rough time in my life and they were patient with me and what I needed. Would recommend!|Just wanted to share my experience that I had today.  Dr Bunker and Dr Wendy have always been very professional and caring with my issues. I have been a patient of Dr bunker for several years and he has always taking time to make sure that I have the care that is required for diagnosis. Dr bunker and Dr Wendy have always went above and beyond to provide excellent care for myself and other  members of my family. I always have had a good experience with all of the employees.I would and will continued to recommend Dr bunker and Dr Wendy And there colleagues to anyone that would value their services.|Dr Bunker and Wendy are very friendly and listens to you. The staff is great and I would recommend them to anyone|Worst pain center I have ever gone to. So unorganized! My last appointment was 9 days ago and today in 11/16/23. Still did not get a refill sent in. They pass the buck at to excuses. Mean while I have been out of meds for two days. Driven over 2x now to facility with still no results except them blaming Kroger. Funny, I never have had as issue with Kroger before. The doc is ok but hard to understand when he speaks. He kind of talks looking down. I guess they now have a NP helping but she can't call in meds so that didn't help. Just an unorganized place that each passes the buck to someone else. Finding new place to go. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND IF LAST PLACE ON EARTH!!|Waiting 3 months to get to see Dr Bunker Finally got into see him very Satisfied with him.He told me he could tell I was in pain. That he would call me something for pain.That was a week ago. After repeated calls at least 7 to 10 calls a Day 90 % of the time answer machine came on said office was closed please leave a message and they will call me back. Never did return any of my calls. Got my Granddaughter who's in the medical field who's in Cookeville TN. I asked her to go by Dr Bunker office to see if they would call me. The manager got very hostile with her. Told her to leave And she followed her out to her car The whole time trying to keep arguing with her. Then I got a hold of the DR Bunker office. My drug test was clean and told me that they were not going to see me. If you're in any kind of pain. Please find another clinic Perimeter Pain clinic. Is not a good place does not return calls let you know what is going on. The whole thing could have been avoided if the staff professionals.  Staff is the worst I have ever seen, Simply doesn't care. I'm going to see if I have any recourse going to medical Board.|I'm sorry you have stayed that it was the pharmacy that made the mistake, but I've had the same pharmacy for 20 years and they writhe the order as it is sent to them. And I am not the only patient that has had this problem. But congratulations to your new staff and I pray this change will be a positive one, especially for the patients needing quality care from professionals...
Good luck with your new staff and God Bless you all|Dr. Bunker is great. Understands my pain issues and does all that he can for me. I'm sure that if the state would relax some of their rules that he could do more. But I also see the other side of people complaining of pain, people that sell their meds. It's shameful in the way they act towards their pain issues.
So with a failing liver and 20 years of pain I'm thankful for any relief that they can offer me. Kudos to Dr. Bunker.

Tier 1 Orthopedic and Neurosurgical Institute serves Cookeville, Tennessee with exceptional interventional pain management services under the expert care of Dr. David Burstedt, MD, PT. As a double board-certified physician in both Anesthesia and Pain Management, Dr. Burstedt brings specialized expertise to patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions throughout the region. The institute has established itself as a premier destination for comprehensive pain solutions, combining advanced medical technology with compassionate patient care.

Dr. Burstedt's extensive training in both basic and advanced image-guided interventional procedures allows him to offer a wide range of treatment options tailored to each patient's specific needs. The institute specializes in treating various spine and joint pain conditions through minimally invasive techniques that promote faster recovery and improved outcomes. Patients benefit from Dr. Burstedt's holistic approach that addresses not just symptoms but underlying causes of pain.

Specialized Treatment Options

At Tier 1 Institute, patients have access to numerous evidence-based treatments including:

  • Epidural steroid injections for nerve pain relief

  • Radiofrequency ablation for longer-lasting pain management

  • Sacroiliac joint injections for lower back and hip pain

  • Advanced spinal cord stimulation for chronic pain conditions

  • Peripheral nerve stimulation for targeted pain relief

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Burstedt's dual credentials as both an MD and physical therapist give him a unique perspective on pain management that integrates medical intervention with functional improvement strategies. This comprehensive approach helps patients not only find relief but also regain mobility and improve their overall quality of life. The institute prides itself on developing individualized treatment plans that address each patient's specific pain challenges.

Visit Tier 1 Orthopedic and Neurosurgical Institute

Located at 105 S Willow Ave, Cookeville, TN 38501, the institute welcomes new patients seeking effective pain management solutions. For consultations or to learn more about available treatments, patients can call +1 931-253-1973 or visit their website at www.t1institute.com. The facility offers state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technologies in a comfortable, supportive environment designed to facilitate healing and recovery.
column11:

column40:
The staff is always very friendly they are welcoming the lobby is always decorated very nice they have a TV for entertainment the women at the front desk are so sweet and helpful they always have a smile on their face they always compliment me I really like the atmosphere

Update I still go here I e been going for 5 years the care is still the best the people are like family to me they treat patients like humans and are so caring it's already hard having medical issues and constant pain but they treat you like a human|When you first go there watch what they put you on what kind of medication they give you had an allergic reaction I tried to tell her that I could not take that but gave it to me anyway make sure you have your X-rays and everything before you go|This pain center has been amazing to me throughout the past 15yrs I have been a patient with them. Their PA Wendy Houseright is so precious and has such empathy for her patients. When I lost my mother and brother both in the same year she and the rest of the staff especially Joy, Sabrina, and the office manager Barbara offered so much kindness and support that you just don't find at most other places. Joy toes the drug screens and pill counts and has always had great advice and support for me as I have endured many healt battles and struggles. Sabrina is so friendly at the front dest and she is always smiling. There is another nurse who is in the room who is putting the information in the computer and she is always willing to listen or offer advice. Barbara is the office manager and she is always on top of anything that needs handled in the office. She's very professional but is supportive and friendly as well. All together, this pain center is one I would and do refer my family,  friends,  and anyone else who needs their chronic pain managed. I will add this though, if you are planning on going here based on this review, please make sure you are planning to follow the rules because they will find the ones who are truly there for the wrong reasons and stop them from coming there anymore. If you are doing what you're supposed to, this is the perfect clinic for you!|I am a very close friend of someone that was going here and from the start it was a bunch of harassment,  from false accusations of drug screening,  they're computers went down, they rescheduled him, then had it marked as he rescheduled,  and of course it was past his due date so nothing was in his system and they used that against him,  my friend has 4 fractures in his back past the point of surgery and it was no big deal,  according to them every one has a messed up back, they require you to purchase narcan, which he was told was fda required, well I myself was in pain management and NEVER had to purchase it... he was on a very low dose of medicine compared to other people and got treated like an addict, which his pharmacy record showed within a year he had 1 prescription,  but they gladly accepted 295.00 in cash, he was out of town working,  couldn't make the appointment and they said take a picture of your pills  well he did , supposedly they never got it...hmmmmm, then released him !!! I  know first hand about management clinics and they definitely pick and choose!!!|They truly are the best. They take the time to talk to you and answer any questions that you have. They also take the time to get to know you & explain everything you need. They truly do care about their patients and it shows. Everyone in the office makes you feel very comfortable and welcomed. They feel like extended family and have listened to every good and sad news I have shared with them. They have cared about my feelings and have gone beyond to make me feel better both physically and emotionally.|I am a former patient of 5 years, until April of this year. My reasons for leaving were purely financial. I was at a point to where it was pay rent or go to the doctor, regardless of the pain. I find myself now looking for a clinic and comparing reviews. I am shocked that there is even one bad reviews of TNPC. I was treated with nothing but kindness, professionalism, and respect from day one. Alot of the staff became like extended family members. I had shared alot of experiences with them in 5 yrs. Births of grandchildren, most recently the death of my father. My appointment just happened to be within a week of his passing. The empathy and compassion I was shown are unmatched. I appreciate everything they did for me. They made life much easier to live, as I am on my feet 12 plus hrs a day. And now am completely miserable. I would reccomend them to anyone. They have an amazing staff. You won't be disappointed.|I had the worst experience ever. I have never been afraid in a doctor's office before, so today was a first. First, what I was told on the phone and what I was told when I arrived was different. Second, while waiting to be called back they refused to allow me to use the bathroom even though I repeatedly asked. I finally had to drive to a gas station to use it. After I returned, I decided I did not wish to go to a doctor's office that refuses people common rights. I then requested that my appointment be cancelled and that I wanted a refund. I was told Angela would have to issue the refund and to wait. A few minutes went by when the office manager and another lady, neither ladies identified themselves (names), called my name across the waiting room. When I went to speak to her she wanted to take me in the back, to discuss the refund, which I was willing to do if my daughter accompanied me. She not only flat out refused to allow anyone to come back with me but physically placed herself between me and my daughter while raising her voice, which frightened me that she should behave in such a way. She then told my daughter that unless she had medical power of attorney she was not allowed in the back while we were discussing the refund. At that point I left. I never received a refund, they rendered no services, and I had to go straight to the bank to try to cancel the transaction. It took my bank calling them in order for me to finally find out the office manager's name, Barbara.|They don't take insurance at all but want you to pay for their "Family Concierge" program for between $65 to $170 per month and has copay charges. I am in desperate need of a doctor because I haven't had insurance in almost 7 years and I'm suffering with chronic issues that are completely untreated at the moment. I have just received insurance through my husband's work and am looking for a doctor.

The staff was wounderful!|The only good things is mostly what the reviews are mainly saying the nurse Lisa is rude and the doctor is prejudiced judge u as soon as u enter don't care about what u have been threw just rude I even had a important lady discussing what happened to me my two visits I received a phone call about a medication I was missing and as I'm talking to the lady Lisa as i don't understand the issue why my prescription wasn't called in twice the doctor screams just tell her to tell them what ever she was saying I never been treated like they treat a human people like that shouldn't be allowed im taking this further because they shouldn't be able to get away treating people un human the lady  Danielle at from desk and the doctor assistant went out there way to assist me other then that this place gets nothing good of a statement I already was aware because I always read reviews|Over the last 5 or so yrs I've been to Specialists in Pain Mgmt for my back, my shoulders and my knees. column40:
Dr. Peace , my doctor and John Carroll, my PA were the ones that actually saved my safe. After 26 yrs of suffering from a fall that led to 349 falls ,244 subsequent procedures , surgeries, and 140 concussions, my doctors chose
to send me to the greatest Orthopedic Surgeon on the planet,  Dr. John Cornelius. He was the 34th surgeon I interviewed for my devastating hip/pelvis injury. By the time Dr. Peace sent me to Dr. Cornelius I had worn the ball of my leg bone completely away - my leg was bouncing around on the many bone spurs that had developed in my pelvis. I was prescribed 3 -60 mg Oxycontin and 4-20 mg oxycodone just to get out of bed. Dr Peace and I started reducing my meds just prior to my surgery and we continued to reduce them after my successful hip replacement.  After the best physical therapist lead my physical rehab I began walking for the first time in 26 yrs without constant pain- after falling 349+ times after my pelvis was cracked 4" I had no pain in my leg/hip. Dr. Peace and John successfully took me down to 30mg Oxycontin and 40mg oxycodone. My pain clinic gave me back my life. I want everyone to know what a GREAT pain clinic this is. I will always owe my life to them and I love them to the depths of my soul!!! Thank you all for everything!!!|All staff are very caring and do everything they can to help manage my pain|Worst pain clinic ever. They are just like drug pushers. They deal in volume and loosing 6 or 8 people every couple of months is nothing to their overall Extreme Income.  They advertise well!

I'm a 51 year old retired veteran, with over 30 years of service to my country. I have had 34 surgeries from my time in the Afghanistan and Iraq wars. I've been seen, here, for the past 4 years.

What did I do wrong:  I couldn't pay them anymore money. Tricare pays minimum. So, they invented ways to get rid of me.  It worked.  They lied stating my surgeon didn't report my medication after my surgeries, so it's my fault, even though there were vebal and written records that state otherwise. They called in for a pill count, for the first time since I started with them over 4 years ago, after they KNEW I was on vacation in another country. Europe isn't a 6 hour drive. The one that really gets me is "Failed to bring in bottle" after they do a urinalysis.|They do not listen. At least to me. I have more than one spine and pain issue. I have no understanding of why, with all my issues, that they are NOT considering the intense constant pain issue I live with everyday. It's like they are playing God and supposedly know what's best for me which is so wrong. How dare they judge my pain? I wake up in the early morning hours contemplating going to the emergency room! Not only on my first visit cut down the mg I was already on four times a day. They also cut the lower dose to three times a day. I saw Dr. Stone for the first time in January.  He raised the mg but still cut down four to three times a day. I met with the nurse practitioner on 02/05. I told her how I wake up everyday between 2:00am-4:00am in pain because I am missing that fourth dose. Did she listen to my pain? NO! She turns around and cuts my dosage back to the lower one four times a day!!! What? I am extremely disappointed with this office because obviously they make judgments rather than listening to a patients needs. I'm so frustrated and continue to be in incredible pain! Drs are supposed to do what's best for their patients.  Not what THEY think is best. Why are they even pain management drs if they ignore a patients true pain. It is just so wrong. Sadly I have no choice but to go there so I am at their mercy. It sucks.
If you have a choice to go elsewhere,  GO please...|The staff are very outgoing and really nice. The doctors here are also very nice and really care about your well being. They want you to get better. They take the time to listen to your concerns and questions and get you on the right path to recovery. The best place for pain management. I highly recommend them.|I am reviewing this for my 77 year old Father.  He was in Vietnam, lost an eye, spent 6 months in a hospital, has so many medical problems and said out of all the doctors he has seen in his life he has never been treated more inhumane than here. A Dr. Stone, after he was hit by an 18 wheeler on the interstate examined his neck by pushing down as hard as he could and twisting it. This left my father James in extreme pain and he screamed stop and he just walked out saying nothing. My dad is forgetful and would keep some meds beside his bed and if he forgot to add to his count he would say I'm sorry, I can run and grab them, to which they would reply you could by them off the street for all we know. I told dad to come here bc I was enrolled to go to school to be a Nurse practitioner with a dear friend a d she worked at a different pain clinic. I apologize for sending my fatherchete to him all the time because I am his advocate.|Great doctors and NP's.  Very caring and doesn't over supply pain meds unlike other pain offices.|Understanding and helpful with my pain.the people are very nice and professional. Keep any emergency care papers to show in case you go to emergency room. Medications at the emergency room could cause a failed test on your  drug test.but they are good.

column40:
I initially started at this practice with a doctor I really liked, but after they left, I was reassigned to Dana Simpson. From the very first appointment with her, I felt judged and uncomfortable. Instead of offering support or compassion, her demeanor made me feel ashamed for even seeking care. Living with excruciating pain is hard enough without being made to feel like there's something wrong with me for needing help.

Her bedside manner is poor, and she comes across as though she's judging every patient who walks through the door. It's clear she lacks the empathy and understanding that patients deserve. While she is a nurse practitioner, she receives the same fees as a doctor, yet she doesn't come close to delivering the same level of care.

I dreaded every visit with her and ultimately decided it would be less stressful to switch to a different practice altogether. If you are assigned to Dana Simpson, I strongly recommend looking for another provider who will treat you with the respect and compassion you deserve. This was one of the most disheartening healthcare experiences I've ever had.|They absolutely suck if you are under 45 do not go there!!!! I needed pain medication and procedures. done I held out as long as I could. I kept saying we're working on it for the procedure. After 6 months I gave up and found another place. Other place did the procedure in less than a month.  Without that procedure I was excruciating pain, and the pain pills they were giving me, did not cut it one bit. A pleaded in begged for the 6 months I was there if they weren't going to give me the procedure please up the pain meditation. And they said nope cuz I'm under 45. And the only reason I'm giving them a 1 rating it's because they gave me the pain pills that was less than I've been taken for 10 years... There's better places out there don't mess with them|I think any type of pain management is an absolute joke! Every time u go through that type of thing they make u pee in a cup take blood, ask a gazillion questions! It's a massive invasion of privacy! It's bad enough that when u see an actual PCP u go through basically the same thing! My husband was asked to do pain management just to see what they would say! He was diagnosed with narrowing of the spine it's very debilitating he also has some other heath issues going on!  doctor came in to see him ! She basically said because of his mental problems were that bad! That his PCP was poorly managing his mental health! That the pain isn't that bad! That she wanted him to do water therapy! That she would have some patch sent to the house ! The whole appointment was a complete joke!               When a person is diagnosed with severe spinal cervical issues or anything like or other severe health issues that cause severe pain! Of any sort! We as human beings have to go through so much just to get a little help! Which is not right! NOT everyone should be put in a category ! It's a disgrace that we have to go through all these hoooops just to get help and for someone to LISTEN !|Dr. Kaplan is very neglectful. She goes on multiple vacations and has her staff reschedule appointments with the promise that your medication will be sent to the pharmacy. When your medication is not sent to the pharmacy and you call the office multiple times to get your prescriptions sent to the pharmacy while doing without for DAYS at a time. She does not care that you have withdrawals. She does not care about the time it takes to call her office month after month because she fails to send in your medication to get you through until your next appointment. Don't ever let them reschedule your appointment until your medication is at the pharmacy. You have been warned.|Waited a month for this appointment. They sent me multiple text reminders with the address in the message. I arrived an hour before my appointment as requested. Turns out the Doctor i was meant to see was working at their other office. Unprofessional and disappointing.|I've been coming to this Office for some time, It all starts them moment you walk I'm the front door, and I mean in a good way. The front desk Girls are on the ball and the same way with the young Lady(drawing a blank on her name) who does your vitals on right side of the office, That Girl is a go getter, very personable, hard working and just a very well rounded Nice Person, another great part of CPM Team. My Provider Lisa Gilliland and Her assistant are top notch as well. She spends quality time with me, asking and answering questions for me,, I feel like I get the care I need and they have helped me in so many ways and everyone's efforts are much appreciated. High 5 to Doctor Ball and His staff he has provided me with. You all Rock !!|I went two times to the Jasper location and both were terrible experiences. My first visit there they came into the room and immediately accused me of pain medication shopping because she thought I had 5 different doctors writing me 3 to 5 tremadol over the past 4 years, these doctors and nurse practioners all work for my same Dekalb doctor office. She apologized after I corrected that for her.
The second visit I was scheduled for 7:40 am , was the first person in the door when the office clerk unlocked it and over an hour later when the NP came to my room after I asked how much longer it was going to be, I asked her what time I needed to schedule my appointment to be seen at a more reasonable time and she , Christie, got offened. She then said I assure you that you were not the first person on the office and I asked her how the others got in and she said so you were standing outside the door when it was unlocked and I said yes. I also told me the only thing she assured me of is that she is a liar. She also told me the other patient had more issues than me, how she knows this I have no idea because I have never seen her before today. She then proceeded to ask me at what doctors office have I ever been seen at my appointment time, I assured her Dekalb you are always seen at your appointment time. She then stormed out of the room and was talking loudly about me to another lady in the office outside my door. I stood in the door and corrected her again since she obviously don't know how to tell the truth and was told to get out of that office that it was a medical office. The door was open and no where did it say do not enter. This place is a joke. They think your time is not as valuable as theirs even though they work for you as a patient. She also made it clear that they over book their appointments from the start of the day.
Do better people, MY TIME IS JUST AS IMPORTANT AS YOURS AND IF I WAS AN HOUR LATE FOR MY APPOINTMENT YOU CAN BET I WOULDNT BE SEEN AND I WOULD BE CHARGED.|Nice office. Friendly staff. I've never had a bad experience. I would recommend to anyone.

3 stars because it isn't always easy to get through to talk to someone. You must leave a message and wait for a call back. Sometimes it's hours later or the next day. Occasionally it can be 2 days later. If you happen to miss the call you have to start the process all over. Also it is hard to call and get through on the weekends if having issues filling a medication.

If your pharmacy is out of your medication you may not be aware of this until it is time to fill it. If needing a script sent to a different pharmacy on the weekend because of this it is very difficult to even get the answering service to send the doc a message. They say you must wait until the office is open to discuss prescriptions.

They would definitely get 5 stars if it were an option to leave the doctor a message on the weekend, and receive a call back about it, if needing a script sent to a different pharmacy. It isn't ok to expect someone to go 2-4 days without medication that has been prescribed to them.

Another fix would be to give patients paper prescriptions instead of electronically sending it to the pharmacy where it can't be transferred if the pharmacy is out of the medication.

I'm sure this is an issue at all doctors offices, so ask any practice ahead of time what you need to do if this issue arises.

column40: The ladies in the front desk were full of life, polite, understanding and caring. The nurse who's been there 8 years was rude right off the start for no reason and honestly didn't seem like she cared about anything but her script she was reading off of, didn't let me get a word in and also was rude when I was leaving, making snarky remarks. I guess she's god, at least in her little world. Also the doctor was rude, uneducated &  seemed like he was on some type of speed by his movements, and itching swiftly - often with pinpoint pupils like he himself was on opioids. 10/10 front desk, 1/10 everything else. Definitely worth a look into to see if they are worthy of a medical license. Will be reporting nurse + the doctor to the appropriate agencies for a deeper review. No one who just wants help for a serious autoimmune condition should be treated how I was. The customers came in and left so fast reminded me of how pill mills ran pre-opiod epidemic. They assumed I was ignorant, had no connections ,and uneducated. The previous reviews are mostly correct, just from what I saw. Good luck.|This clinic refused to help me with my back pain and labeled me a drug addiction because I'm a convicted felon. I was manging my pain and than was put in jail for 2 1/2 years and when I got out I returned to this clinic looking for help and before they even had a mri done they asked me why it had been so long since I had seen a dr for my back and leg pain and when I told them it was because I had been in jail the dr immediately told me he would not help me because I was a drug addiction, he didn't even ask me why I was in jail. I never failed a urine test while I was there patient and always had an accurate pill count in the 4 years that I had been there patient before I went to jail. I pray that some day people are no longer discriminated against because they have a past. We all have a past.|Very heart breaking to go to this office for years.  And then one day, just treated horribly.  Would not even let me speak. Just talked over me.  Gave me an ultimatum that I could not even do.  We pay you for services!!! Yes you are a doctor and I respect that.  But you obviously had a God complex.  You have no reason to talk to people like they are the mud on the bottom of your shoe.  At least take time to talk to your patients.  You may learn something. Yes you're a doc. But you are in no way better than me.  I left that office knowing I would never step back in. No matter the pain my body will be going through. Pray for people who come against you.  Which I will. Just wanted to let people know who not to pay their money to. (Cookeville office)|Today was my wife's first visit and definitely her last. I went with her as I always do to be an advocate for her medical well being as I am more familiar with the field than she is. To say Dr. Quoc Tran was unpleasant to deal with is a severe understatement. He was exceptionally rude and condescending when asked a simple question about general success rates he has had with a nerve pain blocking implant. He boldly proclaimed it doesn't matter I don't talk numbers here's a pamphlet research it yourself. His general attitude and demeanor suggested that his intelligence far surpassed his need to show any common courtesy. He lacks the ability to carry a quality conversation in regards to his patients care. Truly disappointed with his behavior and overall rate of disrepair of this facility. If you are so miserable that you're carrying a loathsome attitude with you and displaying that towards your patients when asked a simple question you don't need to be in this field period!|I was treated very rudely. No one would listen to me. They had three of there staff in the room with me. Provider had her notes on her phone and nobody else looked at them . She accused the pharmacy of filling my prescription early. They were filling it every thirty days. Provider was not taking into account months that had thirty-one days. So on my last prescription, she told them to fill it on the same day as the last month. May has thirty-one days so, I was without my meds for one day. That was a horrible day for me to say the least. Please don't go there. Go anywhere else but there.|I personally am very satisfied with my care at PMG.  I know there are a number of other practitioners and many do different types of treatments..To be seen they require a recommendation from your primary provider.|Visited here 1-22-25 and was amazed at the service. Was anxious being my first time but was instantly relieved of all fear with the staff and Dr. Would highly recommend this Dr. And staff|The neurosurgeon that sent me here in January told me not to get a steroid shot as we were doing testing the next week to see if my fusion had fused. Dr Tran got mad, then tried to say my med count was off. He told me he was kicking me out, I argued, and they recounted dates to find out my count was right. Then he tried to say my UA seemed off from January, so I needed to do a saliva test. Fine, no problem. What they don't realize, in February, I had a hair follicle for a job, so I knew he was reaching. I feel like just because I didn't do a shot in the neck, he was trying to find a reason to kick me out. He told me that if my neurosurgeon was thinking he may have to do surgery, he could take over care for 3 months. Well, SIR, he won't know until after Myelgram March 28th, that's why he instructed me to wait until after that procedure. I will be finding a new pain clinic.

Spine & Pain Associates serves Kingsport, TN and the surrounding Tri-Cities region as the area's premier interventional pain management practice. With a commitment to comprehensive care, our board-certified physicians specialize in diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions through minimally invasive techniques. Located conveniently at 2202 N John B Dennis Hwy, Suite 200, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide patients with the most advanced pain management solutions available.

At Spine & Pain Associates, we offer a wide range of interventional procedures designed to target the source of pain while minimizing recovery time. Our treatment options include epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and targeted medication management. Each treatment plan is customized to address the unique needs of our patients, focusing on both immediate pain relief and long-term management strategies.

Expert Medical Team

Our practice is led by fellowship-trained pain management specialists who combine years of clinical experience with the latest research in pain medicine. The physicians at Spine & Pain Associates are dedicated to staying at the forefront of interventional techniques, ensuring that patients receive the most effective treatments available for conditions such as back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life, which is why we take a holistic approach to pain management. Our team works closely with each patient to develop comprehensive treatment plans that may include interventional procedures, physical therapy, behavioral health support, and medication management when appropriate. This multidisciplinary approach helps patients regain function and improve their quality of life.

column2: Vanderbilt Pain Management Center One Hundred Oaks
column3:
Vanderbilt Pain Management Center serves Nashville, TN with comprehensive pain management services from its convenient One Hundred Oaks location. Our specialized team of pain medicine physicians, nurse practitioners, and support staff work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans addressing both acute and chronic pain conditions. We utilize evidence-based approaches combining medical interventions, physical therapy, and innovative pain management techniques to improve patients' quality of life.

The center is located at 719 Thompson Ln #22200, Nashville, TN 37204 within the One Hundred Oaks medical complex. Free parking for medical appointments is available throughout the facility. Patients with mobility concerns can utilize the covered pull-up access with wheelchair accessibility located on the southeast corner of the building complex at entrance A. Alternatively, you may park on the west side of the building in the general shopping parking lot and access medical offices via entrances C, D or E. For your convenience, elevator and escalator access is available at all entrances.

Transportation Options

Free shuttles are available to transport patients and visitors between One Hundred Oaks, Monroe Carell and Medical Center East. These shuttles operate regularly from 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. on weekdays. To catch a shuttle, simply go to the patient drop-off area outside of Medical Center East, Monroe Carell's main entry, or One Hundred Oaks Mall G, A and E entrances.

Contact Information

For appointments or inquiries, please call +1 615-322-4311. Our staff is ready to assist with scheduling, insurance questions, and other patient needs. Additional information about our services can be found on our official website at https://search.vanderbilthealth.com/locations/vanderbilt-pain-management-center-one-hundred-oaks.

column40:
I'm sad to see so many poor reviews. It takes time to establish as a patient but once Dr. Sobey got to know me, he was able to diagnose and treat my conditions. I have my life back thanks to Dr. Sobey. There have been times when I had to see one of the fellows and had to hold back laughing when I was asked about using ibprofen (if that worked I wouldn't be a pain patient!) but I'm not going to come on here and leave a terrible review. Pain conditions are tricky, I think they do the best they can. I also know Dr. Sobey has had to go to bat with my insurance company many times, and I'm so appreciative. If you are considering becoming a patient, it's realistic to know you won't walk out of your first appointment pain free! That's not how it works. I've also had amazing care from the nursing staff.|My husband had 3 obligations.  Not much relieve. He saw nurse practitioner in September.  He was given a prescription for muscle relaxer.  He went to pharmacy today and they cancelled his prescription because they are not going to take Blue Cross Blue shield.  That is not right!! He was given excellent care but cancelling his prescription is just wrong.  He is a 77 year old Vietnam Marine veteran.  He never asked for pain medicine just the muscle relaxer.  That is how our veterans are treated.  You should be ashame.  Just bad.|They prescribed me an anti inflammatory without telling me the damage that it could do to the kidneys.  Never kept an eye on the kidneys.  I was admitted to the hospital
And stayed for a week because of the damage that one pill did to the kidneys.  They don't care.  The patient representative place that they tell you call.  WASTE OF TIME.  They back the doctors that don't know what they are doing.  No one cares about the patients!!!!!!!!|If I could leave less than 1 star I would. I was sent to them with SEVERE back pain from degenerative disks. The only thing they wanted to do to pad their bankroll was invasive, non-FDA approved, injections into my spine. I gave it a chance out of desperation and I'm in worse shape. They don't care about the patient. Only doing procedures to make mountains of cash. My back is worse from their "help". DO NOT LET THEM TOUCH YOU. If you need medication for pain, forget it here. Do not make these people rich at the expense of your health|OMG just when you thought patient care couldn't get worse, along came Vanderbilt Pain Center. Been trying for 17 days to get an appt merely scheduled and they said I needed to send prior spinal surgery records and a referral. So I've had not one but 3 prior doctors send the requested docs and yet they say none have been received. Have called 8 times and every time they say someone will call me back, but not one returned call. INCOMPETENT, UNCARING, and down right EMBARRASSING that this place bears the Vanderbilt name. Save yourself more PAIN and go somewhere else!|Dr Sobey treated me for chronic back pain and I can say he and the entire team were professional and treated me with respect.  The treatment suggested and completed by Dr Sobey resolved back pain I had for more than 25 years.  I am very pleased by my results and I have been pain free for more than 6 years.|This ablation is a miracle for me. I was born with scoliosis and continued to have degenerative problems. I have been going to this clinic for 7 or 8 years. The treatment lasts for about a year and it is 100% better than taking pain pills.|You would think they would tell you before hand they don't do pain medication. I drove an hour to be seen for them to just give me a list of different doctors that do pain medication. I've been in pain management since 2015. All they mentioned was gabapentin and lyrica. I'll never come back. And to top it all off instead of helping me Dr mishra asked if I'd be interested in getting a referral to the weight loss clinic next door. He might as well just said you're fat I'm not helping you, but I'll give u this referral so you can lose weight. Way to make fun of someone with out knowing their story.

Mays & Schnapp Neurospine and Pain serves patients across Memphis, TN, Southaven, MS, and now Jackson, TN with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of specialists combines decades of experience with cutting-edge techniques to address chronic and acute pain conditions. We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we take a patient-centered approach to develop individualized treatment plans that target the root cause of your discomfort rather than simply masking symptoms.

At Mays & Schnapp, we offer a wide range of diagnostic and therapeutic interventions designed to identify and treat various pain conditions. Our board-certified physicians utilize advanced imaging and assessment tools to precisely diagnose pain sources, whether stemming from spinal issues, nerve damage, joint problems, or other complex conditions. Treatment options include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and innovative interventional techniques that provide lasting relief.

Three Convenient Locations

We're proud to serve the Mid-South region with three accessible locations. Our newest facility in Jackson, TN at 58 Murray Guard Dr provides the same exceptional care that patients have come to expect from our established Memphis and Southaven practices. Each location is equipped with state-of-the-art technology and staffed by compassionate professionals dedicated to improving your quality of life.

Patient-Focused Approach

What sets Mays & Schnapp apart is our commitment to treating each patient as an individual with unique needs and circumstances. We take the time to listen, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop customized treatment strategies that align with your lifestyle and goals. Our multidisciplinary approach ensures you receive comprehensive care that addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain management.

To schedule a consultation at our Jackson location, call +1 901-747-0040 or visit www.maysandschnapp.com to learn more about our services and approach to pain management. Let us help you reclaim the active, comfortable life you deserve.
