column38: Beverly Haywood|Bill Yuss|Brandon Dove|John Abernathy|Janice Mcclure|Vickie Jones|Gina Butler|Mr K
column40:
I brought a friend in on   8/19. We got here @ 8 am. She did NOT even have procedure till after 1:00 pm. Still sitting here @ 3:08 pm to be dischared. Absoutely RIDICLOUS & UNACCEPTABLE. And this is the 2nd time.|Dr Walker has been very helpful.  I have a spinal column stimulator in my back that has been very helpful with my pain!!  Thank you for listening and your treatment plan!!|This is the worst place I have EVER been. Right out the gate they thought I was seeking meds like a junkie!! My doctor referred me over to them because I have fractures in my spine. Well we don't treat people with opioids that are young. So I guess if you not 80 and crippled you will not get treatment! They subscribed me some generic meds over the counter I tried it and same results. Not to mention they are charging me 500 a visit!! So I go back same thing!! Do not waste your time or money here just a bunch of educated morons!|I saw Dr. Schuster for arthritic pain, I was told he would do a procedure nerve ablation, this was fine as I had it done years earlier. The problem is, I went there for pain relief, not looking for pain pills but it would have been nice to receive some pain relief untill my procedure, haha he would not help! If I'm not mistaking the name is "PAIN MANAGEMENT" so where was my pain management? It's not hard to find out that I'd never had an opioid problem! I'm sure like many young doctors they JUDGE you first, then they decide if you deserve help with your pain! Sad when you rely on specialist and they don't care about their patients!
Thank God they were not the only pain management in columbia!
I'm guessing I was judged on my tattoos, I'm 65 yrs old, had both hips replaced,  I never had a problem with opiods, actually I only asked for 1 refill.
You would think when you have had problems for 30 yrs that pain management wouldn't be a problem. I'm not sure about the other doctors there, but Schuster is just another HACK!

DOCTORS WILL CONTINUE TO WALK ALL OVER US, NOT HELP US UNTILL WE STOP LETTING THEM. DON'T BE PASSIVE, SPEAK YOUR MIND, CHALLENGE THEIR DECISIONS AND REPORT THEM!

File grievance with state medical board!|Jack is very judgmental, talks down to you. Doesn't listen to the patient. They said I didn't have enough medicine showing up in my urine test. Tried to tell him I had been able to take it because I was driving and had several dr appointments because I was get ready for surgery. All but outright talk to me like I was selling or giving away my meds. I absolutely do not, and I also only take them when nothing else I do will help! He also has no problem talking about other doctors and their practice, find this very unprofessional. Stood across the room like I had something contagious! Seen some not so good doctors but he's the worst! If you need help go somewhere else!|Outstanding!  Front office staff is so efficient, friendly and helpful.  The same goes for the nurses in the back.  Dr Welker is Amazing, kind, easy to understand when describing the issues and procedure.  He sincerely cares about his patients.  I absolutely recommend his practice to anyone that has pain that doesn't go away. I can't thank them enough. Vickie Jones|I have NEVER been treated as inhumanely at a physician's office as this one in my life! Would NOT recommend this pain clinic to ANYONE.  The staff are very rude, won't let you explain anything without cutting you off, the walls are thin and I could hear them talking about me outside the exam room, AND they make you feel rushed to get in and get out! I don't know if the appropriate individuals will ever read this review or if it will make a difference. But, as a healthcare professional myself, I felt it necessary to take time out to write this review. My pain issues are chronic, however, I just recently underwent a very painful surgery that has put me in EXTREME pain. Despite that pain, I kept a daily journal recording exactly when I took my regularly prescribed pain meds by the MRMG Pain Management nurse practitioners verses the ones prescribed to me by my surgeon. That was not sufficient enough at this clinic, as they released me as a patient on a contract technicality stating that I needed to have picked up the phone and called the clinic to tell them EACH time I had a prescription filled that was prescribed by my surgeon. The control substance site has a record of the fillings, notes from my surgeon were accessible to them via the Maury Regional computer system, AND my prescriptions were filled at the Maury Regional Outpatient Pharmacy with a date and time stamp on them.  Additionally, at my July 6th visit at the MRMG Pain Management Clinic, I informed the nurse and nurse practitioner that I had a surgery scheduled on July 14 th there at Maury Regional...AND, all of that was not enough! Really?!  What happened to grace for patients in compromised situations?!  I am and have always been a rule follower. I, personally, strive to treat my patients (no matter what meds they are taking) as human beings with feelings. I cannot AT ALL say that about this place! My hope and prayer is that for their existing, as well as future patients, this group will exercise grace and understanding with their patients. After all, patients like us who enter their clinic don't feel good in the first place! This entire experience has left me disturbed and very upset, all of which does not help with my recovery process from surgery.  Now, I am left to search for another pain management clinic feeling like I have a red X on my back. Why should I be left feeling upset and fearful that I will now be unable to be seen by another pain management clinic?!!!!  Furthermore, I will most likely have to go to a new clinic that is out of network causing me to have to pay $60 a month per visit!  Right now, that's a lot of money for me to spend, as I am unable to return to work due to recovering from surgery and because of situations secondary to Covid-19!|I have seen Dr. Welker who reviewed my medicines and made helpful adjustments. His explanations were well informed and appreciated. My regular NP and nurse have been patient and kind. After suffering at the hands of the scofflaws at PainMD it is awesome to have reliable, compent professional care available. I have serious doubts about the motives of the unhappy reviewers. For honest quality care this is where to go.

Comprehensive Pain & Neurology Center, PLLC serves patients throughout Middle Tennessee with specialized care for chronic pain management. Founded with a mission to improve quality of life for those suffering from persistent pain conditions, our practice has established itself as a leading resource in the region. With our main facility located in Columbia, Tennessee, we extend our reach through multiple locations across Middle Tennessee, ensuring accessible care for all residents in need of specialized pain treatment.

At Comprehensive Pain & Neurology Center, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management, combining interventional procedures with comprehensive therapies tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our team of board-certified specialists utilizes advanced diagnostic techniques to identify the root causes of pain, developing personalized treatment plans that address both symptoms and underlying conditions. From spinal cord stimulation and nerve blocks to medication management and physical therapy coordination, our practice delivers evidence-based solutions for even the most complex pain syndromes.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life, which is why we prioritize compassionate, attentive care at every step. Our dedicated staff works closely with each individual to establish realistic goals and create treatment strategies that align with their lifestyle and preferences. By focusing on minimally invasive techniques and innovative therapies, we help patients reduce their reliance on medication while maximizing functional improvement and pain relief.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, visit our website at https://tnpainexperts.com/ or call us at +1 615-410-4990. Our main office is located at 1400 Hatcher Ln, Columbia, TN 38401, with additional locations throughout Middle Tennessee for your convenience. Let Comprehensive Pain & Neurology Center help you reclaim your life from chronic pain through our specialized, comprehensive care approach.

Courtney Hollis is an Amazing Comprehensive Pain & Neurology Practitioner!

Recently, I had the privilege of consulting with Courtney Hollis, a healthcare practitioner at the esteemed Comprehensive Pain & Neurology, located at 1400 Hatcher Ln in Columbia, TN 38401. From the moment we met, I was struck by her exceptional professionalism and her genuine concern for my well-being. She took the time to actively listen to my concerns, ensuring that all my questions were addressed with clarity and thoroughness.

Courtney is not only knowledgeable and experienced, but she is also compassionate and caring. She made me feel comfortable and at ease during my visit. I left feeling confident that I was in good hands.

I highly recommend Courtney Hollis to anyone looking for a Pain Medicine Specialist center practitioner. She is truly an amazing healthcare professional!

Here are a few specific examples of Courtney's exceptional care:
She took the time to review my medical history and ask detailed questions about my current health.
She performed a thorough physical exam and explained her findings in a way that I could understand.
She developed a treatment plan that was tailored to my individual needs.
She followed up with me after my visit to make sure that I was doing well.
I am so grateful to have found such a wonderful Pain Medicine Specialist center practitioner. Courtney Hollis is a true asset to the medical community.

Kristy is the best receptionist!

I recently visited this medical practice and was greeted by Kristy, the receptionist. She was incredibly friendly and helpful and made me feel welcome and at ease.

Kristy was efficient and organized, and quickly checked me in and got me settled in the waiting room. She also kept me updated on my appointment status and made sure that I was seen by the doctor on time.

I was very impressed with Kristy's professionalism and customer service skills. She is a true asset to this medical practice, and I highly recommend her!

Pain Comprehensive Pain & Neurology has been a beacon of hope and healing for me during a challenging time in my life. From the moment I stepped into their clinic, I was greeted with warmth and empathy by the friendly staff. The Comprehensive Pain & Neurology doctors at Pain Medicine Specialist Center are highly skilled and compassionate professionals who genuinely care about their patients' well-being.

Nurse Menoguisa took the time to listen to my concerns. Comprehensive Pain & Neurology offers a range of services, including medical consultations, diagnostics, and treatment, and I have always felt confident in the quality of care I have received.

One of the things I appreciate most about Comprehensive Pain & Neurology is their commitment to patient education. The medical professionals at Comprehensive Pain & Neurology take the time to explain my condition and treatment options in a way that is easy to understand. This has empowered me to make informed decisions about my healthcare and take an active role in my recovery.

The staff at Comprehensive Pain & Neurology are also top-notch. The clinic is clean, modern, and well-equipped with state-of-the-art technology. I have never had to wait long for an appointment, and the staff is always accommodating and efficient.

In conclusion, I highly recommend Comprehensive Pain & Neurology to anyone seeking exceptional healthcare. Their dedication to patient care, personalized approach, and commitment to patient education have made a profound difference in my life. I am grateful for the support and guidance I have received at Comprehensive Pain & Neurology and would not hesitate to recommend their services to anyone.

Sincerely, George Ogden|The doctor took one look at me and judged me from the start never-mind I'm passing there piss test bc I don't use but the tattoos had her looking down her nose at me like she knew me smh ...|I went here back in August of 23, wasted my time. I didn't go for pills, I wanted to discuss a permanent solution for my problem. The nurse basically came in, I told her and she said I would have to meet with the neurologist and they would call to schedule an appointment. I called them every week to follow up after a month I gave up and went to Maury Regional and had a great experience. Then 4 months later I received a bill, in my opinion they should have never given me a bill.|The entire staff at the new Columbia office are nice. Jamie is my doctor. She's easy to talk to and very professional. Dee is usually my nurse. He's very helpful. The girls at the front desk seem anxious to help.
Mike Bass|I can't say enough about this office. There was a mix up with my appt so they fixed it and got me in same day. Everyone is so nice in this office from front staff to back. The Dr was very nice and genuinely cares about what's going on. I look forward to my injection and feeling better soon!|My first appointment with Dr Schneider was great!  We set up a treatment plan for my severe migraines (I was having 20-25 days per month).  However, after the first visit, Dr Schneider didn't have time for me and his PA and NP decided to change the regimen that the doctor had set up.   Did I mention the constant turn over in this office?  I never saw the same person twice. I was not asking for narcotics or muscle relaxers,  I was desperate to be out of pain and I began to feel hopeless.  Of course my headaches came back with a vengeance and not to mention, I missed work several times with appointments, not drop-ins, only to get be told my Botox had never arrived when, in reality, it had never been ordered or it was being held in another office and they hadn't prepared for my appointment. The staff was flat out rude and did not have time to even say hello at check in.  I am a nurse, don't ask for much, but courtesy and competent care are nice to receive when you are in pain. I don't recommend this office unless you enjoy being treated like you are insignificant   This office cares about money, not people.  I would not recommend this office to anyone.|I sincerely thank the doctors, nurses, and all the office personnel for always treating my husband with all the great care and kindness.  I thank them for understanding his need to have me with him during his visits although COVID19 rules required differently.  If you need an understanding group you can't miss here.  They were always concerned about his pain level and worked for improvement|I would not recommend this place to anyone at all. The Dr. Does not care about the patients at all, she literally talks to you like you have a problem. My girlfriend was going here and we have her medical records and she is in very bad health and in a lot of pain everyday and instead of the Dr caring, the Dr walked in there and basically said she had a problem with pills qand that she wasn't taking them right! She only got them twice from this place, honestly, it wasn't even about that it was how the Dr spoke to her and treated her. No Dr should speak or fed ewaf someone that way!

Active Pain Treatment serves Knoxville, TN and surrounding areas with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of specialists has been helping patients overcome chronic pain and mobility issues since 2018. Located conveniently in West Knoxville, we combine evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to address the root causes of pain rather than just masking symptoms.

At Active Pain Treatment, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain relief that includes physical therapy, chiropractic care, and advanced interventional procedures. Our treatment protocols are designed to reduce dependency on medication while improving function and quality of life. Each patient receives a thorough evaluation to determine the most effective treatment pathway for their specific condition.

Our Treatment Approach

We specialize in treating various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, sciatica, and sports injuries. Our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and therapeutic equipment to ensure precise treatment delivery. Many patients experience significant improvement within just a few sessions, though comprehensive care plans are developed for long-term management when needed.

Patient-Centered Care

What sets Active Pain Treatment apart is our commitment to patient education and involvement in the healing process. We believe informed patients achieve better outcomes, which is why we take the time to explain conditions and treatment options thoroughly. Our friendly staff ensures a comfortable, supportive environment from the moment you walk through our doors.

Visit Our Facility

Located at 300 Prosperity Dr #103, Knoxville, TN 37923, our modern clinic offers convenient parking and accessibility features. Contact us at +1 865-246-0143 to schedule your initial consultation. We accept most major insurance plans and offer flexible scheduling options to accommodate busy lifestyles.
column38: Robin Julian|Kandi Knaff|Tess Mustaffa|Nicole Herndon|Charlene Perry|ray bolton|Kate Robinson|Juanita Jones
column40:
I have been a patient there for over six years . Great medical help with my painful back condition! I love my NP , her medical assistant, and Dr Fox !! They sincerely listen to my personal health issues and provide excellent advice and treatment. I highly recommend them!|I've been going there for aprox 10 years. Dr. Fox and Rachael Payne are Fabulous, so are my nurses and all the staff. They do a pill count and urine test  every visit to keep their patients safe. They don't give prescriptions without carefully evaluating us. They're the real deal.
Thanks everyone for such good care for the last decade. I so appreciate it. I wouldnt think of leaving!|When Pandemic first started I noticed that hardly no one wore a mask. I thought I had a very good relationship with them. There incompetence, their level of care was quite evident in the past year. You would think being a doctor's office they would know they need the a signature before sending a script to a pharmacy right? Or sending a script back with PA signature not Doctor. Waiting a week or more to get back with me when I left voice message. Everything seemed harder and complicated.

I used to love coming here & is such a shame how much this office changed this past year. I have been going here for 4 yrs and thought I had great relationship with them. They were always personable, very caring, chatted with me longer than 5-10 min, were on top of things, took great care of me and were very good at what they did. I even gave them excellent review 4 yrs ago. So I'm not just basing this bad review on 1 visit. It's based on many visits and many things. Provider even said to me that I was one of her favorite patients.

In the past my appointments usually lasted less than 1/2 hour & I was never late in 4 yrs and very rarely had to leave a voice message. Which they would return that day or the next day. Because I got caught in traffic jam, and (I had to go back home to get my mask bc I brought another purse & forgot it), I was 6 min late. I have never been late before. When I went out of my room to see what was going on I happened to have seen my provider go to another room & & I know that patient came way after me Ignored me and said I can make you wait 3 or 4 hours or as long as I feel like it! Im one person & your not the only patient here. You might be thinking this is stupid for me to react this way. But making me wait 2 hours bc I was 6 min late? It was based more on principle & thought I established personal relationship with them. It really bothered me. Now I have waited plenty of times when I went to doctor even 3 or 4 hours in fact. But never have I waited this long on purpose. And Im in my 50s. So this wasn't the only doctor I've been to and i know how things go by now.

Teresa|Was there for 4yrs, the nurse i had at first was great but when she quit. The other nurses kept asking me isn't there a clinic closer to you. They was determined to kick me out. I got covid and was at the doctors due to my symptoms getting worse which led me to be admitted to the hospital.  Before I went was admitted, I called to explain and they had dismissed me. Pretty sure that is illegal...|I have been going to Active Pain Treatment or about seven months and have had excellent care. Today I have my first injection appointment. Unfortunately, Dr. Fox does not provide injections at The Active Pain Treatment Center. He provides them at Fort Sanders West. When given the appointment I was told to go to "Fort Sanders, 2nd Floor". I should have asked for the street address. Instead I assumed their was only one "Fort Sanders" in Knoxville. After searching the facility for over an hour I finally figured out that I was at the wrong location! Please do not make the same mistake that I have. The correct location for injections with Dr. Fox is 280 Fort Sanders West Blvd. Knoxville, TN.|This is not a pill mill. If your looking for one dint waste your time.  I was with Active for 5 yrs and left due to personal reasons.  I was with a different pain clinic for 2 yrs. I regretted leaving.  I had no clue what my physical condition had in store for me.
These guys are top notch. They care. The 2 physicians I have are excellent.  Highly recommended pain clinic.|Really disappointed in their Covid precautions. Front office receptionist not masked and the nurse told us we didn't have to wear our masks. When asked why masks weren't enforced the nurse responded "well if someone has a medical condition like claustrophobia we can't make them wear one". What an absolute joke. My mom is extremely immunocompromised and this lackadaisical approach to health and safety is putting her life as risk. Shame on Active Pain Treatment. We will be seeking another practice that takes things seriously.|The Dr and NP treat you as though you're stealing from them. I was told that I should get use to my pain because they weren't upping my medicine. What a thing to say to someone. I'm reporting them.

Southern Pain Institute serves Smyrna, Tennessee and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Established as a premier medical facility dedicated to alleviating chronic pain, our institute combines advanced diagnostic techniques with innovative treatment protocols to address a wide spectrum of pain conditions. Our board-certified physicians bring decades of collective experience in interventional pain management, offering personalized care plans tailored to each patient's unique circumstances.

At Southern Pain Institute, we utilize state-of-the-art technology and evidence-based approaches to treat various pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our multidisciplinary team employs both interventional procedures and medication management strategies to provide effective relief while minimizing dependency risks.

Treatment Options

Our comprehensive treatment options include epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and targeted medication therapies. We emphasize minimally invasive techniques that promote faster recovery and improved quality of life for our patients.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in empowering patients through education and active participation in their treatment plans. Our compassionate staff ensures each visit is comfortable and productive, with transparent communication about treatment options and expected outcomes.

Contact Information

Visit us at 739 President Pl #220, Smyrna, TN 37167. To schedule a consultation, call (615) 459-3244 or explore our services online at www.southernpaininstitute.net. Our convenient location serves patients throughout Middle Tennessee, offering hope and relief to those suffering from chronic pain conditions.

column40:
I been going to this pain management for ten years. When l started this pain management l was a mess! I had lots problems l was depressed because my health problems was so bad. I had to go in to early retirement yes sometimes l wouldn't like what Dr. Mollett and Michelle said however they listen to me and l listen to them and lam better now! I have two Bionic knees due knee replacement and my other problems are manageable.If you want a doctor that will fight with you on your health problems this the right place! Now l feel like my old self and l am  no longer depressed and l can't Thank you enough for putting up with Me Thanks Sallie Moreland|I recently became a patient of Dr Molett Nov 2023 due herniated disc (degenerative disc) , bludgeoned disc  diagnosed.   For the past 5 months, I've always was seen by the nurse practitioner (Michelle Lee). ! Whom is nice and professional!  My appointment in January was for a  nerve study test and I arrived on time, only to have to wait 30 minutes before the front office advised that the doctor would be another 30 minutes before arriving to the office. As a result I rescheduled the appointment.  I went to the rescheduled appointment, and the nerve study dr mollette completed was very painful and at the time I never was advised she was my actual doctor until yesterday !  She never introduced herself as my doctor!  She just came in asking me questions! Her interpersonal skills were very minimal in my experience with her! She talked to me as if I was a child, questioned me  about the integrity of my diagnosis my physician made! How professionally inappropriate, I was there for her to treat my diagnosis not for her to challenge my diagnosis!  During the nerve study she left the room serval times ! Yesterday appointment she had the Same lack of patient courtesy ! Not only did I have a urine test she also requested a swab test! Why 2 tests?  When I left the appointment yesterday I had a panic attack! I will not be returning!  And the front office (Santora) is very rude|PLEASE READ THIS REVIEW: My elderly mother was going there until today because she originally chose this doctor because it was close to her living arrangements (Antioch Office) but after two months they told her that she had to start going to the Smyrna office which is difficult for her due to transportation. They tried to string her along saying it was temporary only to learn they no longer have an office in Antioch.
Upon taking her to the office in Smyrna, I learned that she has to take her medication in every month putting herself and others in danger of a someone mugging her for her drugs. I understand having to do a pill count randomly, but to make patience bring their pills to the office each month is very risky. I wouldn't be surprised if this Clinic has been in previous trouble with the DEA And that's why they do that.
I also noticed that the office in Smyrna was very dingy and dirty, They have a TV in there but it's from 1999 when you could hardly see what it was showing Due to the screen and it being so small.
I would never allow my mom to go back to this Clinic Or do I recommend anyone sign up for I wished out to read the reviews before she made any type of appointment.|Showed up for my appointment 15 min early. They took me back to a room on time and the medical assistant told me that they are just cleaning the room where I would have my EMG test done and then they would move me into that room. I sat in the room for 1 hr and 10 min before they came to get me to move me into the correct room. Then, during my EMG test the doctors phone kept going off and she kept leaving the room to answer her phone. I understand if there is an emergency and you need to answer the phone but she left multiple times during my procedure and it felt very unprofessional. The whole feel of the clinic was very unprofessional and I really didn't feel super comfortable having my procedure there. I would 100% go somewhere ELSE next time.|I have been a patient for 10 years and can't say enough good things about Dr. Mollette and her staff. They have always been helpful and pleasant with me no matter what the issue was. Having been a patient of other clinics I realize how good this one is !|Had been going here for about 5 years. Had 3 back surgeries and major nerve damage...which Dr. Mollett diagnosed herself. All the great nurses have since quit, the office Mgr. is rude and extremely unprofessional. The best person still there is Michelle Lee, and the only reason I've stayed as long as I did. Like others who have left their reviews your generally not treated respectfully. There is a reason for so many negative reviews. Find another Dr. who will help you not take your money and mistreat you.|First off I've been in pain management before & I know you don't get meds on 1st visit, that's not what this is about. Before I went to my 1st appt I called to ask how much they charge to fill out paperwork (disability placard) because I wanted to just be prepared. The lady I talked to was so rude. She asked how could the Dr fill it out if she hasn't seen me. Of course I knew that. I told her I was just inquiring because all drs have a set fee. It was ridiculous. Well I go to my appt with my paperwork already filled out & I was early. I was called back quickly. I sat in the back 45mins before the Dr came in. She ran in & out handling something else each time cutting me off. She did apologize. But as I was trying to answer her questions & let her my problems she would interrupt & rush in to something else. Then turn around & ask me about what I was trying to explain. As someone else reviewed she was stuck on the back problem, when that's not my major problem. I even said to her that I had a problem with a Dr at my PCP office with Dr not listening to me repeating the same things to me & making me repeat myself because Dr wasn't listening. Dr molette said, I'll try not to do that. Then preceded to DO JUST THAT. I don't have a problem with taking drug tests. I did the urine. Then some very rude nurse came in & said they needed saliva which was fine. I had washed my hands from urine test & when she came in I was putting cream in my hands. She said uhh you put something on your hands. I said yea I DID. I didn't know she was coming. Then she said put this in your mouth & don't talk I mean don't say anything for 10mins. I was thinking who am I gonna talk to it's just me & her in the room. I will be changing. I see my PCP before I go back to them because I have appt for EKG. Overall I was in that room for 2hrs before the drug screening because the Dr was in & out & only spent maybe 30mins in total speaking with me. I would've appreciated if she would've finished up whatever she was doing before coming in to speak to me.|THIS PLACE GET ZERO STARSBUT IT WOULD NOT LET ME POST WITH OUT A STAR!  I have never been treated so badly in all of my life! I was treated like I was a drug addict trying to get a fix. I have been on 1 pain med for at least 15 yrs and have only gone up 5mgs in that time. She did not want to hear anything I had to say about anything. Because they did not get my medical records which my Dr's office tried to fax over 5 times she scheduled me for 3 MRI'S!!! I also had a letter on my medication that I do not tolerate acetaminophen and the 2 week script she gave me dated for a day after my meds run out has it in there!  I called when I left and noticed and I was told she was in a room someone would call me back well it is 10am the next day and I have still not heard from anyone!Had I read the reviews on this place I would have NEVER gone there it was close to my new job and in network for my new insurance. I will pay my deductible to go back to my original Pain Management Dr. Lesson learned read reviews this woman is a disgrace to the medical field!!!

South Healthcare & Pain Associates serves Maryville, TN and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management and healthcare services. Established with a mission to improve quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions, our practice combines evidence-based medical approaches with personalized treatment plans. Located conveniently at 1103 E Lamar Alexander Pkwy, we've become a trusted healthcare provider in Blount County through our commitment to compassionate care and effective pain relief solutions.

At South Healthcare & Pain Associates, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management. Our team of board-certified specialists utilizes advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment protocols to address various pain conditions, including back pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and post-surgical pain. We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that may incorporate medication management, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications to achieve optimal results.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life. Our compassionate staff takes the time to listen to each patient's concerns, thoroughly evaluate their condition, and develop comprehensive treatment strategies that address both the symptoms and underlying causes of pain. This patient-centered philosophy ensures that everyone who walks through our doors receives the attention and care they deserve.

You can also connect with us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/southhealthcarepain to stay updated on our latest news and health information.

Our Commitment to the Community

As an integral part of the Maryville healthcare community, South Healthcare & Pain Associates is dedicated to improving public health awareness and providing education about pain management options. We work closely with other healthcare providers in the region to ensure coordinated care and the best possible outcomes for our patients. Our goal is not just to treat pain, but to enhance overall wellness and help our patients return to the activities they enjoy.

Pain Management Group serves patients throughout Antioch, Tennessee and the greater Nashville metropolitan area with comprehensive pain management solutions. Led by Dr. Clayton Erin E, our specialized medical practice focuses on diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches tailored to each patient's unique needs. Located conveniently in the Crossings area of Antioch, our facility combines modern medical technology with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives.

At Pain Management Group, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our multidisciplinary team offers a range of treatments including medication management, interventional procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and complementary therapies. Dr. Clayton specializes in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, arthritis, neuropathy, fibromyalgia, and pain resulting from injuries or surgeries.

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets us apart is our commitment to treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. We take time to listen to each patient's concerns, thoroughly evaluate their condition, and develop personalized treatment plans that address both immediate pain relief and long-term management strategies. Our goal is to improve functionality and quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

Our Facility

Our modern clinic at 5801 Crossings Blvd in Antioch provides a comfortable, welcoming environment for patients. The facility features state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment equipment, private consultation rooms, and a professional staff trained to assist patients with compassion and respect.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Clayton and the Pain Management Group team, call us at (615) 941-8501. New patients are welcome, and we work with most major insurance providers. For more information about our services or to request an appointment online, visit our website at http://thepainmanagementgroup.com/.

Center for Spine, Joint, and Neuromuscular Rehabilitation in Mt. Juliet, Tennessee offers comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions and musculoskeletal disorders. Our multidisciplinary team specializes in non-surgical interventions and rehabilitation services designed to improve mobility, reduce pain, and enhance overall quality of life. Serving the greater Nashville area since 2005, our practice combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans to address a wide range of conditions including back pain, joint dysfunction, sports injuries, and neuromuscular disorders.

At SJNMR, we provide a variety of advanced treatment modalities including interventional pain management, physical therapy, regenerative medicine, and specialized rehabilitation programs. Our board-certified physicians utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools to accurately identify the root causes of pain and develop targeted treatment strategies that minimize medication dependence and avoid unnecessary surgeries whenever possible.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in empowering our patients through education and active participation in their recovery journey. Each treatment plan is customized to address individual needs, goals, and lifestyle factors. Our compassionate staff guides patients through every step of their rehabilitation process, ensuring they receive the support needed to achieve optimal outcomes.

Contact Information

Visit our modern facility located at 5003 Crossings Cir, Mt. Juliet, TN 37122. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 615-872-9966 or visit our website at www.sjnmr.com. We accept most major insurance plans and offer flexible scheduling options to accommodate our patients' busy lives.

column40:
Finally. A group of doctors that actually LISTEN to the patient. I will say that it took me two days to get in here so just be prepared for that possibility. I assure you that you will be satisfied with the respect and actual CARE coming from this Team!
I thank you ALL!!|I am not a patient but my father is. I take him every month for his monthly visit. He is handicap and has to have assistance. Everytime we pull up no matter the time or day there is absolutely no parking what so ever. The parking they do have is either filled by the doctors for the men's clinic, you know those who have ED or the patients with ED. The handicap door never worked and the only reason why it works now is because my brother fixed it. There is absolutely zero care for these patients. Regardless of who they are or where they come from, to be and do what these people do they should have some kind of care. Not just in it for the paycheck. The kicker is being a pain clinic and dealing with the pharmaceuticals (which keep in mind makes BANK) they would be able to provide better parking for their patients but we all know how that goes. But at least they are paid.|I would never recommend this place to anyone. They are rude and unhelpful at best. I was discharged for negative urine analysis which was fine with me because I already was looking for another pain clinic closer to my house. They wouldn't help me with my insurance to get a nerve block and then sent me a letter stating they could not see me anymore. These people are rude, lazy and completely unprofessional. Plus, there's no parking spaces available and your lucky to get a spot. All around,  my experience was not helpful at all. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.|I would gladly recommend pain and spine consultants.  They are compassionate about helping people with pain. If you treat people with respect . I've found I get it in return. People I see leaving negative remarks, obviously...well, just read. lol. I'm feeling comfortable with my treatment and pain level.  I hope my review will leave the reader of this with the attitude that it's possible to be honest, respected,  and probably pain free. May peace be with you!|They have one job to do. Manage pain. They do not have your best interest in mind. If you are truly in pain, and need help this is not the place to go. Also,.Debb Deos a very rude and lazy receptionist.|What a wonderful group of people  left the Nashville office highly impressed with the amount of kind , caring , compassionate Care I received..

N8 Health Centers - Franklin serves the Franklin, Tennessee area with a comprehensive approach to natural healthcare. Located in the heart of Williamson County, our wellness center focuses on identifying the root causes of health issues rather than merely treating symptoms. Since our establishment, we've been dedicated to helping Franklin residents achieve optimal health through personalized care plans that address their unique needs. Our integrated approach combines evidence-based natural therapies with patient education to create sustainable health improvements.

At N8 Health Centers - Franklin, we find out what is causing your problem, and put together a solution based plan to restore your health. Unlike conventional medical practices that often rely primarily on medication, our methodology centers on four key pillars:

  • Chiropractic Care: Specialized adjustments to improve nervous system function and structural alignment

  • Nutritional Guidance: Personalized dietary recommendations to support healing and wellness

  • Exercise Protocols: Customized movement plans that strengthen and rehabilitate

  • Health Education: Empowering patients with knowledge for long-term health management

Comprehensive Health Solutions

Our team of healthcare professionals works collaboratively to address a wide range of conditions, from chronic pain and digestive issues to fatigue and autoimmune disorders. We utilize all natural healthcare methods to achieve fast results while avoiding the side effects often associated with pharmaceutical interventions. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual, taking into account their health history, lifestyle factors, and wellness goals.

Your Health Transformation Journey

Imagine what you can achieve with health and vitality! Our patients consistently report improvements in energy levels, reduced pain, better sleep quality, and enhanced overall wellbeing. We believe that optimal health is the foundation for living your best life, and we're committed to helping you reach your full potential through natural, effective healthcare solutions.

Visit Us: 1227 Lakeview Dr, Franklin, TN 37067, United States

Contact: +1 615-996-2057

Website: www.n8healthcenters.com/franklin/

column40:
Dr. K. is really phenomenal at what he does and has such a wealth of knowledge and experience under his belt that you can't help but feel like you're in great hands- literally. Manny, the front desk Administrator is awesome and super easy to deal with and makes the overall experience very enjoyable.

I can't recommend enough- Go see Dr. K and change your life.|I have been seeing Dr. K for about 3 weeks now and he and Manny both have been nothing short of amazing. I herniated a disc a couple of years ago and recently was having symptoms of another bulge including severe pain and very limited range of motion.

My first visit Dr. K did a thorough exam and X-rays prior to any treatment. He explained everything to me each step of the way which made me much more comfortable with the process.

After just a couple of visits, I saw a huge improvement in my pain levels in addition to my range of motion and I have recommended N8 Health Center to many people who are dealing with aches/pains.

Looking forward to continuing being treated here!|My husband and I have been seeing Dr. K for a few years on and off now. I am 24 weeks pregnant and getting adjusted during my pregnancy has been game changer! We will never see another chiropractor.|I started seeing Dr. K at the Franklin location in October of 2024. My husband started seeing him in May 2024 for shoulder and knee treatments and suggested I schedule a consultation to see if he could help me as well with issues stemming from a couple of childhood injuries and a car accident when I was 18. The consultation visit was very non-threatening, he listened to what I said, and asked questions as necessary. On my first visit, he carefully explained everything before he started, and made sure I understood what he was going to do. After only 4 treatments, I am moving and feeling better than I have in over 20 years (I'm currently 52). I don't wake up in the middle of the night because of stiffness and pain, my back doesn't constantly ache, I can sit comfortably longer than I ever have, and I have a renewed enthusiasm for life again. Once we adapt my diet and schedule recurring maintenance adjustments, I am excited to continue with my active lifestyle - pain free! Dr. K and his assistant, Manny, make you feel comfortable, they listen to you, and they offer appropriate solutions to your specific issues. I honestly can't say enough great things about them!|I have been seeing chiropractors since I was 9 in 1957 and have had several outstanding chiropractors over the years including taking my brilliant chiropractor at the time to the 1984 USA Olympic Swimming Trials along with my 13 swimmers. Three of my swimmers made that Olympic team and I attribute a portion of the success to my chiropractor having every muscle in their body at top form as he worked with them weekly for a year. As an aside, by putting 3 swimmers on the Olympic team, I earned a spot as one of the USA Olympic Swim Coaches. But Dr K tops them all with his vast knowledge of the human body and his incredible ability to make adjustments including knowing which muscles are affected and how to stimulate them in a way that reactivates them. It is not just adjustments you get from Dr K, but advice on nutrition, exercises, how to treat an ailment without drugs and recommendations for such things as feasibility of stem cell injections or decompression therapy on one of his many decompression tables. If you have issues with joints, muscles, or pain, I highly recommend you see Dr Brandon Kassinger!|Best rehab/recovery experience I've ever had! Dr.K has helped me recover from an injury I've had for almost a year now. This is by far the best I've ever felt and I am at my all time best thanks to him. Cannot recommend him enough if you are looking to not only rehab injuries, but prevent them from happening all together. I only wish I found him sooner.|Dr. K provides incredible chiropractic service, expertise, and knowledge to assist the body in healing. He's not your typical chiropractor who just expects a crack and a pop with no lasting results. He will work with your body's needs so it can thrive again! Highly recommend him! Me and my husband have both experienced lasting healing results!!|Dr.K is the absolute best! I have been dealing with back pain from 20+ years of wear and tear on my body from playing sports. My overall health has improved immensely being in his care .

Cordova Pain Specialists in Cordova, Tennessee offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Memphis metropolitan area. Our board-certified physicians specialize in treating chronic and acute pain conditions using evidence-based approaches that minimize medication dependence. column40: The APN Ashley Pennington is the best and kindest medical practitioner I have ever dealt with.  She is kind and very empathetic.  She is thorough when you need her to be and is very quick when you need her to be.  Medical service here is by far the best for pain management.  I have only had one negative experience in my time there as a patient which was with one of the people whose job is answering phones and admitting patients.|They are rude treats everyone like they junkies sit at the desk and act like they don't see you to busy on their phones|I took my dad to Cordova Pain Specialists yesterday and things went amazingly badly. His appointment was at 3:45, but they ask for people to show up 30 minutes before their appointment They, therefore, wanted him there at 3:15. Life got in they way and we arrived at 3:34. They told him that he was four minutes past their cut off time and they wouldn't see him, he would have to reschedule for Monday. He had run out of his medicine that morning and I knew the arthritis and small fracture in his back would cause him to be in terrible pain in a matter of hours. I told them that he needed his medicine refilled and needed to be seen, we were only four minutes past the cut off, and not even officially late for the appointment, but they said rules are rules and if they broke them for an 87 year old man they would have to break them for everyone. I feel it is my job to advocate for my father because he is not very able to do it for himself so I told them that was unacceptable, he needed his prescription. They repeated that they would not see him, one person even came out and at first told me that it was the law, they couldn't see him that day. I told her I knew that was not a law at which point she admitted, it wasn't a law it was just their rule. My father was sitting down and did not hear any of this. I informed them that I was going to sit with my father until they found time to see him. A nurse then came out to be their muscle and told me I had to leave, to which I responded," You're actually going to kick an 87 year old man who needs his medicine out of your office?" He told me he wasn't going to kick him out he was going to kick me out. I then pointed out that that was the same thing as kicking an 87 year old man out because I was not going to leave my father there when I left. This nurse bouncer then told me he would have me forcibly removed. To which I repeated that my father simply needed a prescription and asked if they couldn't just give that to him. It's a narcotic so, no they couldn't, which is understandable. I suggested again that they see him for just a minute so they could write his prescription. No. At this point my dad knows what's going on and is having a panic attack. While he's in this state I remind them that the Hippocratic Oath states that they shall do no harm. They insisted that they were doing no harm even though my father was having a panic attack right in front of them. I then started asking them if they felt good about what they were doing, if they were going to go home feeling good about the job they had done that day. I was saying all this calmly by the way, They then got on the phone to the sheriff's office to have me and my panicking, 87 year old father removed. I had started recording all this, except in my upset state did not actually do what needed to be done to record it so, no video. I had my arm inside the sliding glass so first they tried to close the glass on my arm then had a man grab my arm and push it back so they could close the window. I waited outside for the deputy so I actually could make a video of that. The deputy was wonderful and was sympathetic to an upset daughter trying to take care of her distraught father. He went in to talk to the people in the office to hear what they had to say, then told them that their rules were far to strict and if they had treated his father that way he would have done much worse than I did. Thank you Shelby County Sheriff Deputy for being so wonderful, shame on you Cordova Pain Specialists for being, in my opinion, so awful to an 87 year old man who was in pain and distraught. He felt totally betrayed by people he thought were there to help him. Maybe you think I was wrong or maybe you think I was right to insist, unsuccessfully, that they help my father but I thought it was important enough to make it known how he was treated.|My wife goes here she has sickle cell lupus and fibromyalgia. They take good care of her she been going for four months now. Her pain is managed fairly well. She smiles more and little more active her over all out look is good. Thanks CPS. I APPRECIATE YOU|Horrible they treat you like a criminal and if you are 1 minute late too bad rescheduled for 6 weeks out.  If your appointment is for 1:00 they count you late at 12:31.  They will call the cops on you if you dare to say ANYTHING at all about them, the staff has major attitude, you can only see a nurse, the doctors stay at home to count their money.  Stay clear of this place at all cost !!|This clinic was really good until they gave me a drug test and it came back positive for cocaine.  I was never monitored or further testing done to see if I was truly on cocaine.  Further testing from my pcp discovered I was not on cocaine it was kidney disease. Now I am seeing a doctor that under treat my pain and I really suffer from a very painful disease sickle cell|I used to like this place, until they got a new NP. Her bedside manner is terrible, she has the worst attitude, and is very short. She doesn't give you the time to talk to her about whats going on and she has a very accusative attitude. I learned that she used to work in a jail prior....and that is exactly how you will be treated. I don't trust her with my health and that is important when dealing with these situations. Beware!!!!|Go anywhere else. Cordova Pain Specialists is staffed by terrible people who have no business working anywhere near the medical industry. They do not honor their appointment times and they display a disgusting willingness and tendency to threaten and intimidate caregivers while refusing service to patients who show up more than ten minutes prior to their appointment time. Shame on you, Cordova Pain Specialists. May you reap what you sew.

column3:
Advanced Pain Institute of Texas serves Lewisville, TX and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized medical practice focuses on non-surgical, minimally invasive treatments for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. With a patient-centered approach, our board-certified physicians develop customized treatment plans addressing pain from head to toe, helping residents throughout the Dallas-Fort Worth metroplex reclaim their quality of life.

At Advanced Pain Institute of Texas, we offer a wide range of interventional pain management techniques designed to target the source of your pain without extensive surgery. Our services include advanced spine care, joint injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and regenerative medicine options. Each treatment plan is tailored to address specific pain conditions while minimizing recovery time and maximizing effectiveness.

Conditions We Treat

Our experienced team specializes in treating numerous pain conditions including but not limited to:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Sciatica and radiculopathy

  • Joint pain (shoulder, knee, hip)

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Headaches and migraines

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Work-related injuries

Our Approach

We believe in addressing the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Our physicians combine their extensive training with state-of-the-art technology to provide accurate diagnoses and effective treatment strategies. By emphasizing minimally invasive procedures, we help patients avoid the risks and extended recovery associated with traditional surgery while still achieving significant pain relief.

Visit Our Lewisville Location

Located at 500 W Main St Suite 230, Lewisville, TX 75057, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technology. We're conveniently situated to serve patients throughout Denton County and the greater Dallas-Fort Worth area. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (972) 866-4246 or visit our website at www.apitexas.com.

column40:
I've been dealing with chronic pain for years and have seen multiple doctors, but none have been as knowledgeable, compassionate, and effective as Dr. Anderson and team is. They took the time to understand my specific situation, explained everything clearly, and developed a personalized treatment plan that has made a huge difference in my quality of life. The staff is also friendly and efficient. I finally feel like I'm getting the help I need, and I'm so grateful to have found this practice.|My first visit whole staff very nice and helpful of my needs very detailed, the Doctor very patient very good listener and concern he got other doctors lined up he had a plan before I left his office before the week was out the doctors he referred me to called for appointment so all would fall in place before I see him for 2nd visit he even gave me medicine on first  visit because he cared about the pain I've been in for 5plus years thanks so much outstanding service the whole team is blessed so happy I found them! DOCTOR  Broadnax was the doctor very nice .|Dr. Anderson, Broadnax are lifesavers! I was struggling to manage my chronic pain and was feeling hopeless until I found this practice. The doctors and staff are kind, understanding, and truly care about their patients. They took the time to listen to my story, explained my options clearly, and developed a treatment plan that has significantly reduced my pain. I appreciate their holistic approach and willingness to try different terminologies until we found what works best for me. I highly recommend Dr. Anderson, Dr. Broadnax to anyone seeking effective pain management and compassionate care.|Dr. Anderson did a cement injection for a cracked vertebrae I had. I received immediate results, I couldn't believe all my pain was gone with this problem. I was over joyed|Dr Broadnax is an extremely caring doctor. My first visit he responded with a thoughtful plan for a complex case. The second visit his PA came in when I'd scheduled with him. They did have Dr Broadnax come in which helped bridge the gap. I don't know why they haven't followed through with returning my call and scheduling the plan we made for treatment. I even checked with my insurance to see if they were waiting on approval from them and nothing has been submitted a week after my appointment. I was excited that he works with my PT, but their appointment was rescheduled and the rescheduled hour appointment  (for several patients) was shortened to 5 min total leaving little time to discuss progress or a plan moving forward. So many reviews are wonderful and Dr Broadnax and his MA Kaycee were so caring my first visit. I hope this is simply a something fell through the cracks experience.|I've been a patient at Advanced Pain Institute since 2017 and I've had a few procedures and a nerve stimulator implant and I must say that I am now pain free and no longer on opioids. Thank you Dr Anderson and your support staff.|I have extremely painful small fiber neuropathy. Dr. Broadnax spent nearly an hour with me at my first appointment discussing treatment options for my rare condition caused by my autoimmune disease - Sjogren's. He just completed my first outpatient procedure on my feet yesterday. Everything went smoothly. His staff was well prepared and organized. So far I've had exactly the side effects he said I'd likely have the first two-three days afterward. I think I'm already feeling some benefit. This will be a long haul journey because there is currently no cure for my condition. I'm so glad Dr. Broadnax and his staff are here for me now!|This was literally the worse place I have ever been here in Texas! The wait time was almost two hours and there was NO ONE in the office in the waiting area or anything!!!
How this place has 5 stars is beyond me!!! If I could give it zero I would !!!!
Dr Broadmax was horribly didn't even listen to us!!!! Did absolutely nothing to help!!!! Completely just shut us out!!! He wasn't even listening to us I also had to explain to him multiple times why I was there!!!
The lady that took my info and the reason why I was there got the whole entire story wrong and I have to repeat myself multiple times!!! Which was absolutely insane!!!!
I literally would not recommend this place to my worse enemy!!!
This place is a joke !
And when you walk into this place you get such an eerie feeling !!!!! No compassion whatsoever!!!!!

column2: Pain and Wellness Institute of Texas
column3:
Pain and Wellness Institute of Texas serves the Bulverde-Spring Branch area with comprehensive pain management solutions designed to restore quality of life. Our dedicated team of specialists combines compassionate care with evidence-based treatments and cutting-edge technology to address chronic pain conditions. We understand how debilitating persistent pain can be, which is why we offer personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs and circumstances. Our holistic approach integrates conventional medical therapies with wellness treatments to provide relief and improve overall functioning.

At the Pain and Wellness Institute of Texas, we offer a wide range of interventions to address various pain conditions. Our state-of-the-art facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and therapeutic technologies that allow us to precisely identify pain sources and deliver targeted treatments. We specialize in managing chronic pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and pain related to injuries or surgical procedures. Our goal is simple: to help you return to the activities you love without the burden of constant pain.

Wellness-Focused Approach

Beyond traditional pain management, we provide complementary wellness services that support overall health and enhance pain relief. These additional therapies address the physical, emotional, and psychological aspects of chronic pain, offering a more complete path to recovery. Our integrated approach recognizes that effective pain management often requires addressing multiple factors that contribute to a patient's discomfort and limitation.

Visit Our Practice

We welcome new patients at our conveniently located office in Spring Branch. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 830-515-5131 or visit our website at painandwellnesstx.com. Our practice is located at 19750 TX-46 #104, Spring Branch, TX 78070. Let us help you take the first step toward a life with less pain and more possibilities.
column11: We are a comprehensive pain management practice serving the Bulverde-Spring Branch area. We focus on providing compassionate care with proven treatments and state-of-the-art technology; therapies to get you back to living life. We also offer other wellness treatments related to helping those suffering from chronic pain.

column3:
Pain Partners of Texas serves the Austin, Texas area with comprehensive interventional pain management solutions. Founded by Dr. Vije with the fundamental belief that every patient deserves respect, compassion, and active participation in their treatment plans, our practice has established itself as a leader in innovative pain relief approaches. We combine cutting-edge interventional techniques with personalized care to address chronic and acute pain conditions, helping patients regain control of their lives and return to activities they enjoy.

At Pain Partners of Texas, we offer a complete range of interventional pain management services with particular expertise in Regenerative Medicine. Our advanced treatments include:

  • Stem Cell and PRP Therapy - Harnessing the body's natural healing abilities

  • Percutaneous Disc Decompression - A minimally invasive alternative to traditional disc surgery

  • Sacroplasty Procedures - One of the few practices in Austin offering this specialized treatment

  • Kyphoplasty Procedures - Excellence in treating spinal fractures with minimally invasive techniques

Our Approach to Pain Management

What sets Pain Partners of Texas apart is our patient-centered approach. We believe in creating a caring atmosphere where patients actively participate in developing their treatment plans. Our interventional techniques focus on addressing the root cause of pain rather than merely masking symptoms, allowing for more effective long-term relief and improved quality of life.

Innovative Disc Treatments

Our outpatient Percutaneous Disc Decompression procedure offers patients an alternative to traditional disc surgery. This minimally invasive technique creates space within the disc nucleus to promote healing of herniations, resulting in reduced recovery time and less trauma to surrounding tissues.

Contact Information

We welcome new patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Our state-of-the-art facility is conveniently located in Austin:

Address: 14425 Falcon Head Blvd, Building F, Unit 103, Austin, TX 78738

Phone: +1 512-534-5039

Website: www.painpartnerstx.com
column9: Pain control clinic|Pain management physician|Specialized clinic
column11: Dr. Vije created Pain Partners of Texas based on the core belief that patients deserve respect, a caring atmosphere and to be involved in shaping their own pain treatment plans. That said, we are an Interventional pain practice that also specializes in Regenerative Medicine such as Stem Cell and PRP therapy. We offer an alternative to Disc Decompression Surgery in our out patient Percutaneous Disc Decompression procedure which allows us to create room in the nucleus of a disc to heal Herniations. We are one of the only practices in the Austin area that does Sacroplasty procedures and we excel at Kyphoplasty procedures, both of which are to fix fractures of the spine. We are pleased to bring our high level of service to the Austin area!!

Pain Partners of Texas has been a great experience for me. The team is kind, patient, and truly listens instead of rushing to conclusions. I felt heard and understood, which isn't always the case in healthcare. They truly take a thoughtful approach to treatment.
I highly recommend them to anyone looking for thorough pain management.|Turns out I had some pretty serious issues in my cervical spine, primarily two herniated discs that were causing some major pain, numbness, tingling, and general discomfort that made the mundane difficult, Nevermind my normal pace and athletic activities. My friend and chiropractor referred me to Dr. Vijae and his team and I am so grateful. They were able to see me almost immediately, ran me through my options, and got me in for treatment the next day. The pain is gone! Still a long road ahead with a full compliment of spinal decompression and healing, but it's made possible by the team at Pain Partners of Texas. I finally got the first full nights sleep in a month!|I understand the common apprehension about engaging with the healthcare system - it's a feeling I've carried throughout my life, and often with good reason. However, Pain Partners of Texas and Dr. VJ stand as a remarkable exception to this rule.
Dr. VJ and his team demonstrate a level of professionalism and care that truly sets them apart in the medical field. Their expertise and approach to patient care are exceptional, making them a rare find in today's healthcare landscape.
Speaking as a 50+ year old Austin resident and native Texan who has dealt with hip injury issues, I can confidently say they are among the finest medical professionals I've encountered. If you're seeking quality care in Texas, you'd be hard-pressed to find a better|I recently fractured a vertebra very badly, while on vacation in the UK. Upon my return, I immediately called Dr. Vije's office only to learn that he was in India. Tarra Campbell, one of his outstanding nurses, contacted Dr. Vije and an appointment was made for me to have a medical procedure almost immediately upon his return.  I highly recommend Dr. Vije for his exceptional dedication to his patients. Despite his very busy schedule, he made the time to accommodate me, demonstrating not only his professionalism but also his genuine care and compassion. His ability to prioritize patient needs and deliver excellent care is truly remarkable. Dr. Vije exemplifies what it means to go above and beyond, and I'm deeply grateful for his efforts.|Dr Vije and his staff are wonderful! Texas Pain Partners really cares about their patients and providing pain relief. Dr Vije is so nice and he really cares about his patients and takes the time to actually listen to them and work with them. This place is a true blessing.|I have suffered from multiple back "issues" for years.  Chiropractic and physical therapy have given give me "temporary" relief; but did nothing to solve my underlying physical "issues".  I was referred to Dr. Vije and I began a series of procedures to solve problems with spinal stenosis, degenerative disc disease and SI joint pain.  I can finally say that I am virtually pain free.  Dr. Vije has been a true blessing!  He worked diligently to find the source of my pain and provide the precise treatment/procedures to give me the relief that I desperately needed. He listens to his patients with a "caring ear" and adjusts his treatment protocol to meet the needs of the patient.  His office is a testament to how a doctor's office "should be" run.  If you need to contact their staff, you just go to your portal and send a message.  A member of the team will contact you shortly and move forward to manage your request.  Every member of the staff is wonderful, and I would like to give a special "shout out" to Tarra (RN) and Alicia (NP)...two staff members who have been especially helpful.  If you have major "pain" issues, please do not hesitate to contact Pain Partners.  They will diagnose your problem and move forward to bring you lasting relief.|I had a epidural yesterday and I'm already feeling a bit better this morning. I am so happy!! I have severe neck pain and am so pleased with the experience I had at Pain Partners. The nurses and Dr were so nice and caring. Thank you so much Dr. Vije!|After Dr Vije did 2 diagnostic injections, he found that my right SI joint was where the real pain was. Next he gave me an injection just for that area. It's been a week now, and  I have had zero pain. I am a much happier patient now. Thank you Dr Vije and the staff. Such a wonderful and organized place to go!! I highly recommend Pain Partners!

column2: Greater Austin Pain Center - Pain Doctor
column3:
Greater Austin Pain Center serves Austin, TX and surrounding communities as a premier destination for comprehensive pain management solutions. Our clinic has established itself as a top-rated facility where patients find lasting relief from chronic and acute pain conditions through evidence-based treatments and cutting-edge medical techniques.

Our distinguished team consists of board-certified anesthesiologists, pain management specialists, and physicians dedicated to providing conservative yet effective pain treatment options. With extensive training and experience, our medical professionals develop personalized care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs and circumstances.

Comprehensive Treatment Approach

At Greater Austin Pain Center, we pride ourselves on our multidisciplinary approach to pain management. We offer a diverse range of treatment modalities including:

  • Minimally-invasive procedures such as nerve blocks and steroid injections

  • Advanced diagnostic services to accurately identify pain sources

  • Surgical interventions when conservative measures aren't sufficient

  • Integrative pain management techniques backed by modern research

Patient-Centered Care

We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why our approach focuses on full recovery and improved quality of life. Our team takes the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop a treatment plan that addresses both symptoms and underlying causes.

Visit Our Austin Location

Located at 5920 W William Cannon Dr Bldg 6-150, Austin, TX 78749, our modern facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide the highest standard of care. Contact us at (512) 298-1645 to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward effective pain relief.

Learn more about our services at www.greateraustinpain.com
column11:
Greater Austin Pain Center is a top-rated pain management clinic located in Austin, that's known for providing lasting pain relief, backed by modern research and the latest medical techniques. Our team of pain management specialists, physicians, and board certified anesthesiologists know how to treat pain effectively and conservatively, and would love to help you recover fully!

At Greater Austin Pain Center, we take a multidisciplinary approach to treating pain, and offer a wide range of treatment options depending on the type and severity of your condition. We can provide both minimally-invasive, non-surgical options, such as nerve blocks and steroid injections, as well as surgical options, should they be necessary.

column3:
Ajay K. Aggarwal MDPA serves Houston, TX and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management and anesthesiology services. Dr. Aggarwal brings decades of specialized medical expertise to patients suffering from chronic pain conditions, offering compassionate care through advanced treatment protocols. His practice combines cutting-edge medical techniques with a patient-centered approach, ensuring each individual receives personalized attention and comprehensive pain management solutions.

Dr. Ajay Aggarwal is Board Certified in Anesthesiology and holds the distinguished position of Diplomat of the American Academy of Pain Management. His impressive educational background includes training at prestigious institutions such as Albert Einstein Medical Center and Hahnemann University (Alleghany General Hospital) in Philadelphia, PA, as well as the University of Miami/Jackson Memorial Hospital in Miami. Dr. Aggarwal's expertise is further enhanced by his Post Graduate Education in Pediatrics and Anesthesia, complemented by Advanced Fellowships in Cardiac-Anesthesia and Pain Management.

Professional Experience

As the former chairman of the Anesthesia Pain Department at Methodist Hospital in Baytown, TX, Dr. Aggarwal has demonstrated exceptional leadership in the field of pain management. Throughout his distinguished medical career, he has successfully treated thousands of patients, consistently delivering care characterized by kindness, dedication, and medical excellence. His patients frequently commend his professionalism and unwavering commitment to their wellbeing.

Comprehensive Care Approach

At his practice, Dr. Aggarwal implements multidisciplinary treatment strategies tailored to each patient's unique needs. His holistic approach to pain management addresses not only the physical symptoms but also considers the emotional and psychological aspects of chronic pain, resulting in more effective and sustainable outcomes for his patients.

Contact Information

For consultations or appointments, patients can reach Dr. Aggarwal's office at +1 713-663-7246. The practice is conveniently located at 2010 Naomi St A, Houston, TX 77054. Additional information about services and treatment options is available on the practice website: https://www.multispecialtycare.com/
column11:

He did Post Graduate Education in Pediatrics and Anesthesia while further Advanced Fellowships in Cardiac-Anesthesia and Pain Management.

He has treated thousands of patients in his distinguished medical career with kindness and dedication. His patients vouch for his professionalism and his sense of commitment towards his patients.

column3:
Trinity Pain Medicine Associates serves Fort Worth, TX with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our dedicated team of specialists combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives and reduce suffering from chronic pain conditions. With a patient-centered approach and state-of-the-art facilities at our Pennsylvania Avenue location, we've established ourselves as a trusted provider in the North Texas region.

Trinity Pain Medicine Associates is pleased to announce the addition of a new physician to our group, Dr. Ashley Bailey-Classen. As a North Texas native, Dr. Bailey-Classen graduated from University of North Texas Health Science Center - Texas College of Osteopathic Medicine. She then moved north of the Red River to complete an anesthesiology residency at the University of Oklahoma Health Sciences Center and is a Diplomate of the American Board of Anesthesiology. Her exceptional training continued in Ohio, where she completed a pain medicine fellowship at the prestigious Cleveland Clinic. Dr. Bailey-Classen plans to sit for her Pain Medicine Board Certification in September of 2019, further enhancing our team's expertise.

Family Legacy of Care

Since her graduation, Dr. Bailey-Classen has joined her parents, Eva J. Bailey, MD and Ashley M. Bailey, MD, creating a unique family practice dedicated to pain management excellence. This family connection strengthens our commitment to treating patients like family and providing continuity of care that spans generations.

Contact Information

Location: 823 Pennsylvania Ave, Fort Worth, TX 76104, United States

Phone: +1 817-332-3664

Website: www.trinitypain.com

Visit our website or call us today to schedule a consultation with our expert team and take the first step toward effective pain management.
column11: Trinity Pain Medicine Associates is pleased to announce the addition of a new physician to their group, Dr. Ashley Bailey-Classen. Dr. Bailey-Classen is a North Texas native who graduated from University of North Texas Health Science Center - Texas College of Osteopathic Medicine.
