column40:
I was at the surgery center today for shots in the cervical spine . When Dr. Abc came in, I tried to tell her of problems I have had with their office and the fact that they had a medication list that showed me taking meds I haven't taken in over a year  . Also, they sent me out a prescription for pain meds, then immediately canceled it, and I have been dealing with this for over 2 weeks always call get told will let the Dr know never hear back.  She then got defensive and said while I was lying on a bed waiting for procedure, they had already given meds, for she said I was hostile, and she refused to do the procedure.  This is a bunch of quacks that would not take my dog to see them.|Dr Bailey gave my husband the best exam he's ever had with this back pain.  She even ordered more X-rays to make sure it was exactly like she thought onto but wanted some different angles.  We saw ABC next and she made a couple suggestions including a small surgical procedure.  Since we are going in vacation we decided on epidural for now to get him over the hump.  They send out a review to patients now to make sure they are doing a great job.  I think they are more thorough than the Odin management we went to before .  Great job|I had 1 procedure that was failed and caused my spinal fluid to leak so Dr. Classen said I need a different procedure, so I scheduled another procedure. I get to the outpatient clinic, he's running and 1 1/2 behind. First I was scheduled for 8 am, the day before clinic called and said 10:15. Mind you I can't eat or drink after midnight. So I'm already not happy being switched to a later time with out anyone asking if this was acceptable. Then so at past 10:15 he's running a 1 1/2 behind. So I get into pre-op around 12 pm. Eventually Dr Classen sees me pre-op. I'm told he is now doing a different procedure than the one I was scheduled for; I should have left right then and there. I didn't because I felt forced to after waiting all that time, paid my account for the surgery center, and he has a month plus waiting time to get in a procedure. So that procedure failed too. Next step according to him was ablations which I specifically said in no way or form was I having ablations from the first appointment because I received them before in my neck it didn't work and was extremely painful recovery. I am in no way going back to him for anything. Take away 1) 2 failed procedures 2) will make medical decisions for you and not even tell you.|I am a vet tech and if I treated a dog the way I was treated I would be fired. 3 hours waiting to be seen, with absolutely no explanation. This new year of nursing students needs to learn common decency and compassion for others since all they care about are themselves. Nobody in this place ever seems to be working. Both times I've been here were like this.|DR. Classen and his staff are some of the most caring medical personnel I've ever had the pleasure to be seen by. While it can be hard to reach office staff sometimes, I fully understand why. They are so busy trying to take the needed time with every patient. That's something I can definitely live with, because when they do get back to you, you're never rushed and every member of the staff takes the time you need.

DR. Classen's skill in the O.R. so far has been beyond expectation. I can currently only have local anesthesia for my injections, and out of the couple handful I've had for various joints, with various doctors over the years, he is the only one, that when it comes time for the injection I feel no real pain.

So far my experience has been a blessing in an otherwise very difficult few years dealing with progressively worsening medical issues.|Do NOT expect any follow up - my  wife had a procedure last week and, despite multiple daily telephone calls and a personal visit from me, we still have no pain medication.
If there were a way to post negative stars, this would get a minus 5.|I feel the best I have felt I'm 10 years after dr ABC did my spinal injection 10 out of 10 recommend her and her staff thank you so much!!!!!|I read the positive and negative comments on this page. I have to say I had the best positive experience here with customer care. Everyone was absolutely nice and very positive. I read someone said the building is old and creepy. It's not. Greater Houston Interventional Pain Management Associates serves the Houston and Victoria vicinity with exceptional interventional pain management services. For the past 15 years, our board-certified pain management doctors have helped thousands of patients achieve significant relief from chronic pain conditions. We combine advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to deliver personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique needs.

At Greater Houston Interventional Pain Management Associates, we strive to provide the most advanced pain management treatment options available today. Our approach focuses on interventional techniques that target the source of pain while minimizing medication dependence. Our modern clinics in Bellaire and surrounding areas are specifically designed with patient comfort in mind, featuring state-of-the-art equipment and a welcoming environment.

Patient-Centered Care

We pride ourselves on delivering exceptional care and personalized attention to every patient who walks through our doors. Our team takes the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop a comprehensive treatment plan tailored to your specific needs. This patient-centered approach has earned us numerous positive reviews from those who have experienced significant improvements in their quality of life.

Insurance and Accessibility

We accept most major insurance plans, including Medicare, making quality pain management accessible to a wide range of patients. Our clinic at 4747 Bellaire Blvd #101, Bellaire, TX 77401 is currently accepting new patients, and we look forward to the opportunity to help you manage your pain effectively.

To learn more about our services or to schedule an appointment, visit our website at www.ghpain.com or call us at (713) 622-1700.

column40:
I really like Dr Chaudri, she has been a godsend, and her staff is always polite when I'm in the office. Randy is so polite and friendly, it's nice to see a smiling face when you enter. Chelsea is great and tries to help as much as possible, in office. My problem is when I call the office. I called in after my last SI injections bc I was concerned about the way I was feeling. I called in during business hours the same day. I told the person I spoke to that it was urgent that I get a call back before end of business day and no one EVER called back. Not that day, the next day, never! This is not the first time that I've had problems getting in touch with the office staff during business hours, it's impossible!!!|Dr. Burgess walked in and was very distant and flat in his tone. Didn't examine me, only glanced at my MRI imaging notes and immediately minimized my injury as only being "small", but he magically could see my pain was severe enough to schedule an injection within a week.

Even his scheduling coordinator said he never overbooked his procedures "so he must see that you're in a lot of pain"(her words)

Even still, he only prescribed 1 week's worth of meds on an "as-needed" basis. He prescribed a month's worth of muscle relaxers, but only a week for pain. If you've ever experienced a herniated disk then you understand. When I called to inquire about the quantity, I was then dismissed again and told it was an issue with my insurance and their policy for prescribing pain medication.

Of course, I called the insurance company and that was absolutely NOT the case. They(Dr. Burgess' office) brushed me off AGAIN!!

Thankfully, my insurance company rep was willing to advocate on my behalf to get the office to prescribe another week of meds to at least get me to my procedure because they so obviously dismissed my concerns. They were also very slow about doing this.

The day of my procedure I never saw him before it was done or spoke with him after it was done. I never received a follow-up call about how I was doing or feeling. The injection provided approx. 12 hours of relief and then the pain was back worse than before.

I requested a refill of another week of meds to at least get to my next appt on 02.28 and was told no. I would need to discuss it with him at my visit. I have been in constant severe pain for DAYS!!!

It felt as if Dr. Burgess had a preconceived notion that I was a pill abuser and that my pain and discomfort didn't matter one bit to him. If I could give him '0' stars I would|I have been going here for over a year and a half... I wait EVERY TIME I go for at least twenty minutes after checking in. Then they never get my medications correct and I am always having to do all the footwork (I have neuropathy, so pun intended) just to get the prescriptions I NEED. I jump through all of their hoops and STILL I am currently waiting on a call back (50 mins now) just so I can pick up my prescription! It's insane, they are wildly unprofessional when it comes to handling their patients medicinal needs. Unreal, definitely looking for a new doctor/clinic.|If I could give ZERO stars I swear I would! Unfortunately the NP & the front office staffs I  have experience is great but OMFG that horrible prescriptions department, back office staff & Mira the Oncall person. They have made my experience there HELL. I have only been there just a few months & I hated it with a passion. Since dealing with them I have had to wait 2 different times each time with an almost 20-30 days gap in between my pain medication. Currently dealing with 2 torn rotator cuffs in 1 arm & a tear in the other. Let's not talk about if the pharmacy calls them to request ANY information to help with getting your medication to you they don't return call not even to them. I have never felt like a $ sign in my life until transferring to here. Please avoid this company at all cost until they staff realize your part of the reason their salaries are being paid. I'm in the medical field as well & best believe I am a patient advocate!|Dr Choudhri and her staff have picked up their game since I first started with them. I can not imagine going anywhere different now. As they get to know the patients.  They understand the needs and Dr Choudhri has a way that is appreciated and a problem solver|Dr. Burgess is the best he listen to you and concerns with your health. The staff is polite and professional. Overall a great experience.|Everything went nice and smooth.  I was in there no more than an hour. That's the way it should be. The staff are all so kind and understanding. They help you anyway they can. Especially if ur having a bad day. I recommend Dr. Choudhri to anyone in pain. (9/24)|Very helpful show much concerns  about pain therapy Great doctor  wonderful staff. Thank  Best P,D in a long time
Satisfied

Pain Specialists of America serves patients throughout Texas with comprehensive interventional pain management services. With over 13 locations strategically positioned along the I-35 corridor from Waco to Seguin, PSA has established itself as a premier destination for those suffering from chronic pain conditions. Their team comprises nationally recognized thought leaders and educators who prioritize patient-centric care and exceptional outcomes. What truly sets PSA apart is their physician leadership—medical professionals trained at prestigious institutions including Harvard Medical School and the Cleveland Clinic, bringing world-class expertise to Texas communities.

At Pain Specialists of America, patients receive access to the most advanced therapies and diagnostic techniques available in modern pain medicine. The practice specializes in identifying and treating the root generators of pain, rather than simply addressing symptoms. This comprehensive approach allows for more effective, long-term pain relief solutions tailored to each individual's specific condition and needs.

Convenient Locations and Accessibility

The Round Rock location, situated at 7201 Wyoming Springs Dr Suite 400, Round Rock, TX 78681, serves as one of PSA's key treatment centers. Patients can easily schedule consultations by calling +1 512-953-8133 or visiting their website. This accessibility extends throughout their network of locations, ensuring that quality pain management care is available to patients across central Texas without requiring extensive travel.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

What truly distinguishes Pain Specialists of America is their unwavering commitment to patient-centered care. The practice understands that chronic pain affects every aspect of a person's life, which is why they develop individualized treatment plans that address both the physical and emotional components of pain management. By combining cutting-edge medical interventions with compassionate care, PSA helps patients reclaim their quality of life and return to the activities they love.

Tricity Pain Associates of San Antonio, Texas stands as a premier destination for individuals seeking relief from chronic pain. Established with a patient-centered approach, our specialized clinic offers comprehensive pain management solutions for residents throughout the San Antonio metropolitan area. Our team of board-certified physicians combines decades of clinical experience with innovative treatment modalities to address pain stemming from aging, medical conditions, injuries, and trauma.

At Tricity Pain Associates, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our multidisciplinary approach encompasses both conservative and advanced interventional treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs. From medication management and physical therapy to cutting-edge procedures like radiofrequency ablation and spinal cord stimulation, our providers develop personalized treatment plans designed to maximize function and improve quality of life.

Our Expert Team

Our seasoned pain management specialists bring extensive training and expertise to every patient interaction. Each provider stays current with the latest advancements in pain medicine, ensuring you receive the most effective and evidence-based treatments available. We pride ourselves on creating a welcoming, compassionate environment where patients feel heard, respected, and actively involved in their care decisions.

Patient-Focused Approach

What sets Tricity Pain Associates apart is our unwavering commitment to patient education and collaborative care. We take the time to thoroughly explain your condition, discuss all available treatment options, and answer any questions you may have. Our goal extends beyond simply managing symptoms—we aim to help you regain control of your life and return to the activities you love.

Visit our conveniently located clinic at 110 Stone Oak Lp Suite 103, San Antonio, TX 78258, or call us at +1 844-789-7246 to schedule your consultation. For more information about our services and to request an appointment online, please visit our website at https://tricitypainassociates.com/.
column11: Tricity Pain Associates of Texas specializes in simple and comprehensive treatments for chronic pain management that is caused by advanced age, certain medical conditions, and trauma. Our seasoned providers are committed to delivering high-quality care in a welcoming environment and helping you discover the best solution for relieving your pain.

column40:
This is the place to have your pain/medical needs addressed. Everyone from Martha the front desk assistant administrator to Dr. Mehta (in the picture) was exceptional and professional.

It looks like we planned these outfits for the pic but Dr. Mehta is just FLY like that! That how you dress when you're the TOP DOCTOR in the field for 2025|I came here after an accident and my experience started out great, then went downhill. Getting an initial appointment was very quick in one day's time. Dr Mehta was great about referrals to physical therapy and pain medication/ordering imaging. Great doctor and no issues with him.

Getting a follow up appointment after imaging took a few weeks and when I finally did get the appointment, it was with FNP Cassandra Danek. Her bedside manner was very dismissive and for lack of a better word, lazy. I can tell she read my MRI results for the first time in front of me because she missed the very last page that showed a crucial result of my spine. I had to point it out to her on my end. What kind of physician skims MRI results? And so poorly?

Then she tried to diagnose me with a chronic disease for my clearly acute problem. I kept having to ask the questions and it felt like pulling teeth trying to get her to explain clearly why she thought I had this chronic disease. From there, she wanted to jump straight to an invasive surgery for me. I don't work in ortho, but I am a registered nurse who has taken care of plenty of acute pain injuries and it seemed like quite a stretch to give an otherwise healthy person such an alarming plan.

Thankfully I was able to get a second opinion elsewhere where the new physician disagreed with the diagnosis, gave less invasive treatment, and I'm doing much better without the procedure suggested here.|Everyone always takes great care of me. They also have sedation here. They take extensive measures to prevent mistakes, and the entire process is amazing from check in, to pre, intra, and post procedure. They also call to check on you which feels great.|When I called this office, Keisha was EXTREMELY rude and gave me nothing but attitude. She was not honest about the tasks she stated she completed and was super disrespectful. I could not believe how bad the customer service was. I have never written a bad google review before but I felt this time it was necessary.|PSA clinic & surgical center in Kileen, TX have the friendliest staff from receptionists , nurses, anesthesiologists,  nurse practitioners, etc.  Everyone is always happy & smiling when I'm there!  I've been seeing Dr. Mehta for years now.  He always explains things to me  & has helped me tremendously.  My husband & I trust him completely.  We live over an hour away from Kileen so that shows how much faith we have in PSA Kileen staff & Dr. Mehta!|Dr Chen. Was the rudest and worst dr I have ever had the misfortune of coming into contact with. He belittled me, made me feel unsafe not only while alone in a room with him. But also about my care. He would basically call me a lier on anything and everything I would say. He made me feel like I was not worthy of his care. Treated me like a lowlife recorded our conversation going aginst hippa. Dr Chen is hands down the dr from hell. His bedside manner is less than stellar. His ability to treat a patient with dignity and respect is gone. I do not believe he took his hypocrite oth seriously as all he did was harm. Treating me like I pill junkie while talking to me like I was. I do not need his kind of medicine or help. His help should be given out of care for his patients not forced on patients useing fear tactics. As he did me. He prescribed a medication that did not help only caused my already ability to not sleep to become worse. And then the kicker of this all. They get us on these pain meds. Then dangle them over our heads to sit up and bed. But when you fight back then you get treated like a second rate human. I didn't ask to be sent to him. Nor would I recommend anyone being subjected to this person. He needs to be locked out of the medical field as he is not fit for dealing with anyone who he deems not worthy of his time. I have filed a complaint with the medical licensing bord of texas and plan to take this as far as I can. Believe me when I tell you I have been being treated by Dr's since I was 7 years old and had many surgery's. I have never been treated as poorly by any of them as I was by Dr Chen. He makes me feel unsafe, threatened, and his general demeanor towards me. Was less than human as I had NO SAY in my treatment. He took that power away. If the people who over see him would listen to his dictaohone recorded inge they to would hear how he treats his patients.|The staff was friendly and helpful. The Dr was as well but she went straight into an exercise program without knowing anything about my issues or my limitations. I was told it's a process with insurance and I needed 6 weeks of physical therapy before any diagnosis. I'm already on a home therapy program but I was rushed through the whole appointment process.|This clinic is fair, considerate with referrals, and Dr. Meta is by far the most caring Dr. in the Central Texas area. They have dealt with my difficulties with VA referrals, managing medication and procedures through the VA, and multiple times I've had to forego care due to my insurance dropping the ball. The front of house staff, NP's, billing and care coordinators are all patient and kind when dealing with issues and keep me as pain free as my insurance allows me to be. They answer quickly, schedule in a timely manner, and go above & beyond to help. I wouldn't use anyone else.

Pain Specialists of America serves patients throughout Texas with comprehensive interventional pain management services. With over 13 strategic locations positioned along the I-35 corridor from Waco to Seguin, they've established themselves as the premier destination for those seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Their team comprises nationally recognized thought leaders and educators who prioritize patient-centric care and exceptional outcomes.

The physician team at Pain Specialists of America brings impressive credentials to their practice. Many have trained at the nation's most prestigious medical institutions, including Harvard Medical School and the Cleveland Clinic. This elite training ensures patients receive care informed by the latest advances in pain management techniques and research.

Comprehensive Pain Solutions

At PSA, patients benefit from access to the most advanced therapies and diagnostic tools available. Their specialists excel at identifying and treating the root generators of pain, rather than simply addressing symptoms. This comprehensive approach leads to more effective long-term pain management solutions.

Austin Location Details

Their Austin facility, located at 4316 James Casey St, Building B, Suite 200, Austin, TX 78745, provides convenient access to their full range of services. Patients can schedule consultations by calling +1 512-498-1029 or visiting their website at [www.psadocs.com](https://www.psadocs.com/locations/austin-james-casey/).

Whether you're suffering from back pain, joint issues, neuropathy, or other chronic pain conditions, Pain Specialists of America offers the specialized care needed to improve your quality of life and restore function.

column40:
Review for Dr. Daniel Frederick.

Avoid this doctor. He does not even feign interest when you share your concerns or symptoms. He prescribed me medication to help with symptoms I don't have. He completely brushed me off when I offered to connect him with my physical therapist regarding ongoing pain and medical conditions so that he could gain a better insight. I had even brought notes from said PT, and he did not want to look at them. My PT knows my condition better than anyone, so it makes no sense why Dr. Frederick was so disinterested in this information. He wanted me out of the door ASAP and did not want to discuss any options. *Not* LGBTQIA friendly.|Each time I see Dr. Gutierrez I am impressed.  He is easy to talk to and answers my questions thoroughly.  Dr. Gutierrez is truly an advocate for his patients and has really helped get the care I need for my back approved.  I highly recommend him!!|I was referred here by another practice where I was getting my chiropractor physical therapy treatments from. Although it may have taken a while for me to actually get my initial appt scheduled and then a little longer before I actually saw the Dr, well I can see why now. Dr. Gutierrez is amazing with an excellent bedside manner. He listens. He cares. And he understands. He genuinely wants to help get to the root of your pain and nip it in the bud. On a side note, I really love how this Dr is also from Austin. Born and raised.  true Austinite. Not too many of us still around but ironically somehow we still seem to always end up finding each other along the way... making it feel like it's still a small town. Idk it just makes me feel like "home." There couldn't have been a better referral choice for a pain specialist. I'm happy with the turnout so far. All the staff  from the front desk to the nurses station to the surgery center have all been extremely nice and pleasant to work with. Thank you.|I would like to say ' THANK YOU!! ' to the entire staff. I receive EXCELLENT care from the time I enter and check-in, to being seen promptly and even early (when I get there early) by the practitioner ,to my labs. My time is valued without feeling rushed. Thanks to the staff efforts to educate me I have a better/comprehensive understanding of my healthcare as a whole to include and how my medical plan benefits work.|My first appointment with them, but my wife has been a patient there for a few months. I was seen by Kaycee - and wow, what a blessing she is! Very kind, empathetic, and knowledgeable. In a half hour, she diagnosed me with something that no one has ever mentioned to me in decades of looking for relief. Dr. Gutierrez will be treating me for it soon. An entirely positive experience.|I loved how fast and nice they were! Once the doctor realized i had numbing in my body during my first appointment he was worried! The staff was so polite even to the older patients that most other places tend to not be very impatient! Can't wait for my follow-up appointment in a month.|My experience was more than what I anticipated; the staff was very friendly, efficient, helpful, knowledgeable, and expressed a great deal of patience. My overall medical experience was painless, above average, and I was left with a positive impression; being that it was a first time experience for me. Without hesitation would refer the office to others in need of their medical expertise. Thank you Dr. Massey, and Staff!|The staff at PSA were all very nice and accommodating. I particularly liked Dr Gutierrez and found his detailed explanation of my condition to be educational but still comforting. We have a plan for treatment that I am encouraged by.

column3:
Pain Specialists of Frisco serves the Frisco, Texas area with advanced regenerative medicine solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions and sports injuries. Our specialized clinic focuses on non-surgical approaches to treating arthritis, joint pain, and soft tissue injuries through cutting-edge regenerative techniques that promote the body's natural healing processes.

At Pain Specialists of Frisco, we offer Softwave Therapy (Shockwave) as a non-invasive treatment option that stimulates healing in damaged tissues. Our clinic specializes in Regenerative Orthopedics with advanced procedures including Bone Marrow Concentrate treatments containing stem cells and Platelet-Rich Plasma (PRP) therapy. As a certified Regenexx Clinic, we maintain the highest standards in regenerative medicine protocols.

Conditions We Treat

Our expert team provides effective treatment for a wide range of conditions including:

- Joint Conditions: Knee Osteoarthritis, Meniscus injuries, ACL injuries, Hip pain, Hip Labral injuries

- Upper Body Pain: Shoulder pain, Rotator cuff injuries, Shoulder labral injuries

- Lower Extremities: Ankle arthritis, Various tendon injuries

- Spine Issues: Lumbar disc tears, Disc bulges, Sciatica/radiculopathy, Lumbar Spondylosis

- Neck Problems: Chronic neck pain, Facet joint pain

We also offer specialized sexual wellness treatments including the P-Shot and O-Shot for patients seeking regenerative solutions in these areas.

Joint Replacement Alternatives

Our regenerative treatments serve as effective alternatives to joint replacement surgery for many patients, allowing them to avoid invasive procedures and lengthy recovery times while achieving significant pain relief and improved function.

Contact Information

Website: [painspecialistsfrisco.com](https://www.painspecialistsfrisco.com/)

Phone: +1 214-380-1617

Address: 13052 Dallas Pkwy Ste 220A, Frisco, TX 75034, United States

column2: Texas Pain Intervention Clinic: Ankit Maheshwari, MD
column3:
Texas Pain Intervention Clinic serves McKinney, Texas, and surrounding communities with specialized pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Ankit Maheshwari, MD. Established with a commitment to providing comprehensive pain relief through minimally invasive techniques, the clinic has become a trusted healthcare provider in the North Texas region. Patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions find personalized treatment plans designed to address their specific needs while focusing on improving quality of life and functionality.

Dr. Ankit Maheshwari brings exceptional credentials and experience to his role as founder of Texas Pain Intervention Clinic. Board certified by the American Board of Anesthesiology in Pain Medicine, Dr. Maheshwari completed his specialized training in Anesthesiology and Interventional Pain Medicine at the prestigious Cleveland Clinic, widely recognized as one of the nation's leading medical institutions. His academic background includes serving as an Assistant Professor of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine at Case Western Reserve University in Cleveland, Ohio, where he contributed to advancing pain management techniques and educating future specialists.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

The clinic offers a wide range of interventional procedures and treatment options for patients suffering from:

- Chronic back and neck pain

- Joint pain and arthritis

- Neuropathic pain conditions

- Post-surgical pain

- Sports injuries

- Complex regional pain syndrome

Dr. Maheshwari's approach combines cutting-edge interventional techniques with evidence-based practices to deliver optimal outcomes for patients struggling with both acute and chronic pain conditions.

Contact Information:

- Website: [www.texaspainclinic.com](http://www.texaspainclinic.com/)

- Phone: +1 469-815-7622

- Address: 4510 Medical Center Dr STE 207, McKinney, TX 75069, United States

Patients seeking consultation can easily schedule appointments through the clinic's website or by calling directly to discuss their pain management needs with Dr. Maheshwari's compassionate team.
column11: About Dr. Ankit MaheshwariDr. Ankit Maheshwari is the founder of Texas Pain Intervention Clinic in McKinney, Texas, and is board certified by the American Board of Anesthesiology in Pain Medicine. Dr. Maheshwari received his training in Anesthesiology and Interventional Pain Medicine at the world-renowned Cleveland Clinic. He also served as an Assistant Professor of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine at Case Western Reserve University in Cleveland, Ohio. Learn More

column3:
Greater Austin Pain Center serves Kyle, Texas and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of specialists takes a multidisciplinary approach to treating chronic pain conditions, focusing on both immediate relief and long-term management strategies. Since our founding, we've been committed to understanding each patient's unique pain journey, creating personalized treatment plans that address the root causes rather than just masking symptoms.

At Greater Austin Pain Center, we believe effective pain management requires thorough understanding before treatment. Our specialists take the time to review your complete medical history, previous treatments, and specific pain experiences before recommending any intervention. This patient-centered approach allows us to develop customized treatment plans that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy, behavioral health support, and advanced interventional techniques.

Our Kyle, Texas Location

Our modern pain clinic in Kyle is equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and treatment technology. Located at 4210 Benner Rd, Kyle, TX 78640, our facility provides a comfortable, supportive environment where patients can receive expert care close to home. The clinic is easily accessible for residents throughout Hays County and the greater Austin metropolitan area.

Services and Specialties

We specialize in treating various chronic pain conditions, including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and pain resulting from injuries or surgeries. Our multidisciplinary team works collaboratively to address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain, helping patients regain function and improve quality of life.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation at our Kyle location, please call us at +1 512-298-1645. You can also visit our website at https://www.greateraustinpain.com/locations/kyle-location for more information about our services, team members, and to request an appointment online. We accept most major insurance plans and are committed to making quality pain management accessible to all who need it.

column40:
I was very impressed with my appointment at  Greater Austin Pain Center in general, and with Dr. Jonathan Julia in particular. Everyone from the practice that I had any contact with was very nice and helpful with anything that I needed. As I looked online at reviews for some guidance with which pain management center to go to, I kept reading how many patients commented on how pleasant and helpful the office personnel and doctors were. I found this to be very true.
Dr. Julia was on time for my appointment, and he was very personable and he took time to listen to what I had to say.
Dr. Julia was aware of my issues as he had already studied my X-rays, MRI's, and previous doctors notes. We discussed various details and possible treatments. We agreed on a treatment, and to my surprise there was an appointment available in only two days in which I eagerly accepted. I am eager to begin treatments with Dr. Julia, and I feel like I will be getting top notch care.|I'd like to give a shout out to the admin staff as well as Dr. J!

My wife and I were in an urgent care situation, and stumbled across the office in San Marcos at 5pm on a Wednesday. The medical assistant on duty gave us intake paperwork and got us scheduled first thing the next morning. We stopped in at the Kyle location the next morning and learned that the doctor we needed for treatment was in Austin. We were promptly rescheduled, and checked in within an hour. This is what medical care should look like!

Dr. Julia rapidly diagnosed the situation without making my wife jump through hoops that would cause more pain. He promptly provided treatment, coordinated follow-up, and gave us next steps.

After a tough week with little to no help from other care providers, Greater Austin Pain Center was a breath of fresh air!|I felt heard about my back pain history and received constructive feedback from doctor Hynes. He patiently answered my and my wife's questions. I had a great experience with my appointment. Additionally, all of the staff were courteous and helpful. Overall very positive.|Dr Hynes is a greatly skilled, friendly and knowledgeable physician.  He always takes the time to explain everything in a way that even I can understand, actually listening to my concerns and answering all of my questions. I feel very fortunate to have found such a caring physician with staff who are both friendly and professional.|I had a good visit with Dr J Julia. He listened to me and we discussed a treatment plan. Overall the office staff was very nice.|Bryant was awesome. It was very refreshing to find someone so upbeat in a doctor's office. He addressed all of my concerns. Highly recommend|Dr Hynes has been wonderful to work with. He listens to what you need and how you feel!!  Kyle location has a great staff and always has a good attitude and a smile!!  Been going to pain management for 30+ years and this practice is the kind you stay with!!|Very happy with my recent appointment.  Dr Hynes was very thorough and answered all my questions. He took the time to explain a recommended course of action, in order for me to alleviate my chronic back pain. I'm very optimistic!

column3:
Sigma Pain Clinic in San Antonio, TX is a premier medical facility dedicated to comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Founded on the principle that quality care begins with exceptional medical expertise, Sigma Pain Clinic has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider in the San Antonio metropolitan area. The clinic's state-of-the-art facility at 3415 Paesanos Parkway offers a welcoming environment where patients receive personalized treatment plans designed to address their specific pain management needs.

At Sigma Pain, patient care is entrusted only to the most qualified medical professionals in the field. Every physician on staff is dual board certified and has completed a subspecialty fellowship in pain management, representing the highest level of specialized training available in the field. This advanced expertise, combined with years of clinical experience treating patients with various chronic pain conditions, ensures that each patient receives care from doctors who truly understand the complexities of pain and how to effectively manage it.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

The clinic offers a wide range of interventional and non-interventional pain management techniques, tailoring treatment approaches to each patient's unique circumstances. Their holistic approach considers not just the symptoms but the underlying causes of pain, working toward long-term relief rather than temporary solutions. The physicians at Sigma Pain Clinic are committed to helping patients regain functionality and improve their quality of life through evidence-based treatments and compassionate care.

Patient-Centered Approach

Understanding that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life, Sigma Pain Clinic emphasizes a patient-centered approach that prioritizes communication, education, and shared decision-making. Patients benefit from detailed consultations where their concerns are heard and addressed, creating treatment plans that align with their goals and lifestyle needs.

For more information or to schedule an appointment, visit www.sigmapain.com or call +1 210-600-9766. The clinic is conveniently located at 3415 Paesanos Pkwy Suite 100, San Antonio, TX 78231, United States.
column11: At Sigma Pain, we only want the best physicians treating you. Our physicians are all dual board certified and have completed a subspeciality fellowship in pain management. Integrated Pain Associates - Killeen serves residents throughout Killeen, Texas and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of spine and pain specialists combines years of medical expertise with innovative treatment approaches to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Located conveniently at 3800 S W S Young Dr #201 in Killeen, our clinic has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider committed to improving patients' quality of life through personalized care plans and advanced interventional procedures.

At Integrated Pain Associates - Killeen, we understand that pain affects each person differently. Our physicians are experts in diagnosing and treating various pain conditions, employing a multidisciplinary approach that considers each patient's unique circumstances. We firmly believe in exploring all conservative treatment options before recommending invasive procedures like major spine surgery. This patient-centered philosophy ensures that treatment plans are tailored to individual needs, maximizing effectiveness while minimizing unnecessary interventions.

Advanced Treatment Options

Our clinic offers state-of-the-art diagnostic and therapeutic procedures designed to address the root causes of pain. From advanced imaging techniques to innovative interventional treatments, our specialists utilize the latest medical technologies to provide effective pain relief. Patients throughout Texas benefit from our comprehensive approach that combines medical expertise, cutting-edge treatments, and compassionate care to achieve optimal outcomes.

Patient-Focused Care

What sets Integrated Pain Associates apart is our unwavering commitment to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. We take the time to thoroughly explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering patients to make informed decisions about their care. Our supportive staff ensures that every aspect of the patient experience, from scheduling to follow-up care, is handled with professionalism and compassion.

If you're struggling with chronic or acute pain, contact Integrated Pain Associates - Killeen today at +1 254-566-5176 to schedule a consultation with our experienced pain management team. Learn more about our services and approach to pain management by visiting our website at https://ipaclinic.com/locations/killeen.

Title: Excellent Spine Care Provider with Fast Service

I recently visited Spine Doctors, the number 1 choice for spine care, and I was thoroughly impressed with the level of service I received. From the moment I walked in, the staff was welcoming and attentive, ensuring a smooth check-in process. The waiting time was minimal, which was a pleasant surprise.

The medical professionals at Spine Doctors are undoubtedly experts in their field. My doctor was knowledgeable, compassionate, and took the time to thoroughly explain my diagnosis and treatment options. I felt listened to and cared for throughout the entire visit.

Moreover, the efficiency of Spine Doctors is commendable. Despite the busy schedule, they managed to provide prompt and effective service without compromising the quality of care.

Overall, I highly recommend Spine Doctors as a top choice for anyone seeking exceptional spine care and fast service. Their commitment to patient satisfaction is exemplary, and I will definitely be returning for any future spine health needs.|I have been going to Dr C. Trey Mouch of Pain Specialists of America in New Braunfels,TX for the last couple of years. All of the employees are so nice, friendly, caring and concerned about each patient's welfare. Dr Mouch is awesome! He answers all of your questions and all injections are given under fluoroscopy to make sure they are in the right spot. I have been to other pain management offices before and PSA is night and day different. They Never treat you like you are less than human for taking pain medication. I highly recommend this office if you have chronic pain of any kind!|I always have a pleasant experience when I go to my appointments.  The staff are always friendly and caring. Dr. Mouch and his listen and do there best to help elevate my pain and concerns. Very professional thank you!!|Dr. and Staff were wonderful . I only had 2 Days relief from Steroid Injection . Steroids just don't work for me . Probably have to go with Carpal Surgery .|Getting both hip and lower back injection. The best that can be done to stay off getting cut on. They are very eager to listen and form a plan to kept my comfort at my acceptable levels.

I have been going there since they started. They are very good as a pain SPECIALISTS!
It has been my experience to only see the Dr. for injections. PA for everything else.|The pain in my back was so disabling I could only stand 10 minutes before needing to lean on something or recline. Even sitting up was painful. I was barely over 65. When PSA started treating me it took 2 years to get to where I can function up to an hour at a time pain free. They were persistent in diagnosing the many problems a lifetime of hard work and genetics had built up. Not miraculous, but they don't claim to be God! I am happy to be able to care for myself and pets. You might have even better outcomes if you start before becoming disabled.|I've been receiving pain management procedures for my back for over 15 years.  I just had my first procedure with Dr Mouch and the difference in pain relief outcomes are beyond words.  Dr Mouch provided treatment that left me virtually pain free within 24 hours after RFA treatment.  I've been a patient of four different pain management doctors over the years and Dr Mouch is head and shoulders above all the rest.  He really knows what he is doing, he stays up on all the latest medical treatments, and he is very gentle and has a five star bed side manner.|They are very professional & understood my concerns with my pain issues. Discussed my ailments & provided me with medication that will be a big help with managing my pain. I definitely would recommend this practice to take care of anyone dealing with pain.

column40:
Had my 1st visit with Dr. Massey and I really liked him. He had great bedside manner, listened to me very well while explaining my medical conditions and the best part is that we created a game plan that I felt was right to help me get back to an active lifestyle. I would definitely highly recommend him to my family and friends.|Dr Massey is awesome. Like in every way you would want (especially Pain Mgmt) a Physician.
I'm what I call a professional patient so I see numerous Dr's all the time. I would rank his as Number ONE on my list of top Dr's.|The doctor was very thorough. I just moved from a big city where doctors don't take the time to find out about the patient. Doc in the box med. Not here. I was impressed.|I would normally post 5 stars, but I got my meds discontinued without any prior notice or explanation even after I have been with them for years because of a urine test that didn't show enough of the meds that they prescribed in it. I had to call back in to the main office for an explanation from someone who wasn't even my caregiver to tell me that. I never got a good direct answer, but they apparently think I wasn't taking the meds every day even though I was taking it religiously every night. Guess my word means little to nothing.  I am 66,  have been a chronic pain patient for 16 years and have never had this experience or had my integrity called into question.|I went there because of this pain that was so bad. Terrible experience ever. I asked the PA to stop evaluation because this was not what I needed. I need a doctor to help me with my concerns. I broke down having a mental break down . She wouldn't stoped and continued. I left upset and had the nerve to schedule me another doctors appointment with these people.  As soon as I left, I asked to speak with billing department because this was not fair. I paid $175 for a visit. That I asked the doctor numerous times to stop, touching me and to stop the visit . I am still waiting for a call from the billing department to handle this matter|Actually saw the doctor. He didn't seem very interested in what I had to say. But I guess since my pain is chronic generalized pain. He can say he saw me, refill my meds and collect his money.|Everyone there at Pain Management of America are awesome! They are so nice and they get right back to you if you call. I'm so glad I found them!|From J. Ramirez who greeted me upon check in, to the nurse who prepped me for my procedure, ro the assistant who got me comfortable on the table, and then to Dr. Massey who was more than patient answering all of my questions before and after, I had a fantastic experience! The entire staff is friendly, professional, but fun too. This was my first procedure with Dr. Massey since Dr. Frederick retired. I was truly nervous! I believe anytime you have a sudden change in doctors I think nerves get to us all. Dr. Massey evaluated me throughly and suggested I try a different procedure I hadn't before. His suggestion was spot on! Will definitely continue seeing Dr. Massey and his staff at this location in San Marcos, TX.
Thanks to all!

Modern Pain Management - Houston, TX serves the greater Houston area with specialized interventional pain management services designed to address chronic pain conditions through minimally invasive techniques. Our dedicated team of pain specialists creates personalized treatment plans that focus on both pain reduction and improved functionality, allowing patients to return to their daily activities with greater comfort and mobility.

At Modern Pain Management, we believe in treating the whole person, not just their symptoms. Our comprehensive approach combines cutting-edge interventional procedures with supportive therapies to address the root causes of pain. We specialize in treating various chronic pain conditions including:

- Back and neck pain

- Joint pain

- Neuropathic pain

- Post-surgical pain

- Sports injuries

- Work-related injuries

Patient-Centered Care Philosophy

What truly sets us apart is our commitment to creating a warm, welcoming environment where patients are treated like family. We understand that living with chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we take the time to listen to each patient's concerns and develop individualized treatment plans that align with their specific needs and goals.

State-of-the-Art Facilities

Our modern clinic at 902 Frostwood Dr #235 in Houston is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies that enable our specialists to provide the most effective pain management solutions available. Our facility is designed with patient comfort in mind, creating a healing environment from the moment you walk through our doors.

Schedule Your Consultation Today

If you're struggling with chronic pain, don't wait to seek relief. Contact Modern Pain Management at (713) 298-0120 to schedule your consultation with our experienced pain specialists. You can also visit our website at www.modernpainhouston.com to learn more about our services and treatment options.

Your journey toward a pain-free life begins with a single step—reach out to Modern Pain Management today and discover how our interventional techniques can help you reclaim your quality of life.

column40:
If I could give them a zero star I would! I was so lucky to find Dr Candice Burnett at this practice and was so happy to hear she was leaving this practice last MAY! I have been requesting my chart to be sent for 6 months now! They don't answer my phone calls or return them!

Dr. Hirandi was my original doctor for 4 years! When I first met him I was so hopeful at this point you can tell he is burnt out. He told me he hates being a doctor anymore because of insurance companies! He spoke to me so disrespectfully that I immediately requested to be transferred to another doctor as he couldn't care less about me as a patient! Now they are holding my chart/imaging hostage.

Also in 4 years Dr. Hirandi would keep me waiting a minimum of two hours. Appointment times here don't matter. They have no respect for the patients time.

I promise you can find a better Pain management clinic!!!|Dr. Zehra Hooda is the kindest, most caring, and brilliant physician I've met. She wants to help and does everything possible to improve quality of life. You can tell she cares deeply about her patients. I live two hours away, and she is worth every time I have to stop to stretch and every traffic jam to get there. Their facilities and staff are excellent, and the name "Modern Pain Management" is the perfect description. Many services offered I was not even aware of. I was scheduled for a fusion surgery in my lower back, but I had them take me off the schedule after my consultation with Dr. Hooda. She has discussed multiple treatment options that I never heard of from local physicians. I had a caudal injection with anesthesia in their Sugar Land location. It was so much easier than having to do it at an outpatient center, get checked in, and not being charged extra facility fees. I actually felt much more at ease and was given better attention at their facility. Dr. Hooda even came in before the procedure and explained what she was going to do, what to expect, and asked if I had any questions or concerns. If you're scared of another surgery, or have pain that affects your quality of life, then I definitely recommend Dr. Hooda and Modern Pain Management.|Just leaving this review on general principles. Never actually been there. They called my office mistakenly and said I had missed an appointment and they were applying a no show fee to my account. Firstly, how can you be so disorganized that you call the wrong number and then not even make note that the name on the voicemail doesn't match the name of the patient being called? Super unprofessional. Secondly, no show fee? Really? Who actually does that to their patients? Anyways, this seems like a sketchy place to be avoided.|Had lumbar injection yesterday and today I am feeling much better.   Surprised I was not given any information on what to do, or not to do.
A bit of a problem communicating with the office, but I'm happy with Dr. Harandi.|He is exceptionally knowledgeable and truly cares about his patients. His expertise in pain management, combined with his compassionate approach, makes him stand out in his field. I highly recommend him for anyone seeking effective and personalized pain relief.|I have been in a lot of discomfort for years. My neck and left shoulder has been the cause of so many painful days. A neighbor of mine suggested Modern Pain Management. I had all my paperwork done in advance which really helped speed up the process. I also collected all my MRI results in advance and brought them with me. I certainly didn't want to go through another MRI if I didn't have to.
Dr Atallah met with me. He listened to me. He didn't rush me. He was prepared. I'm not going to lie they will weed out scammers and people just looking for meds real quick. I'm clearly not one of those people. I didn't want any pain pills at all. It's not my thing.
Dr Atallah is a cool guy. He is not stuffy, he jokes with you, he listens to you and asks questions. Caroline one of his nurses stood out to me. She was super friendly and helpful. I didn't feel rushed in the least.
I was able to have 4 trigger point injections on my first visit. Two days later I feel a lot better. I'm not perfect. But it's a very good start. I'm able to do all of my normal tasks without discomfort. My goal is to have better range of motion with no pain. I'm not sure if this is going to be possible but only time will tell. I highly recommend Dr Atallah.|I have severe arthritis that  I have been seeing Dr Harandi for over 5 years. I have undergone several rounds of spinal injections and then a spinal cord stimulator  implantation. As a chronic pain patient there is a medication regimen the Dr has instigated.  I have a monthly tele visit as well as quarterly office visits. The purpose being to continue the medication plan as Dr prescribes. He has always been empathetic to the fact that I want to continue to work in my business and use his treatment plan to that end.
However, the office staff is the most aggravating group of people I have  ever dealt with. The simple task of  renewing prescriptions has been done wrong for the last 7 months.When I try to get some help with the issue I was blamed, the pharmacy was blamed, in spite of the fact that this office has been notified  via 3  separate means7 times over the last 90 days of this issue, no one will listen at all to what is told to them. No one answers the phone when a lab calls to try  to clarify the orders sent, a pharmacy cant get any response, and dont even try to speak to anyone as a patient. When I called to try to get  this confusion sorted , I was told it would be 90 dollars to speak to Dr Harandi, in spite of being in office last week  paying the 90 dollars for a 4 minute visit. The staff was unwilling to even listen to my points, talking over me the entire time I attempted to make a point and there is no way to reach anyone there directly, texts and emails are ignored.  After finally getting a human on the phone I was placed on hold for 54 minutes, then hung up on. The IRS has better customer service skills.
I am scheduled for a neck surgery next week and Dr Harandi stated he wants to be on the case, yet it is impossible to speak to him about it. Due to the intransigent nature of his office staff I dont see how he ever gets anything accomplished.  I have near zero confidence in this office staff to be able to perform as needed for post operative care.
A review posted yesterday was scrubbed from Google.|This office was recommended to me by a customer a few years ago. Dr Harandi, has been very empathetic to my maladies. However, his office staff is absolutely the most aggravating group of people I have ever dealt with. The lab orders and the prescription refill orders  are seemingly simple tasks. Yet month after month, 7 months running they have been done wrong. I have endured 43 days of no medications in the 7 month period due to the sheer ineptitude of this staff. The issues at hand have been discussed, emails sent, voice mails left and all are ignored.It is IMPOSSIBLE to get the phone answered, and you will never be able to speak to Dr. Harandi unless you pay first, even though I was calling about a problem with the staff that they will not admit to or attempt to remedy. They simply dont care at all.
I have an upcoming surgery that Dr Harandi stated he wants to be involved in post operative care.I  have no confidence in the ability of this office to be of any help in spite of his good intentions.

Tricity Pain Associates - Carrollton Clinic in Carrollton, TX stands as a premier destination for patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Established with a commitment to improving quality of life through advanced pain management techniques, this specialized medical practice has become a trusted resource for residents throughout the Dallas-Fort Worth metroplex. The clinic's team of board-certified pain management specialists focuses on delivering personalized care plans that prioritize non-surgical and minimally invasive approaches to treating persistent pain conditions.

At Tricity Pain Associates, patients have access to a wide spectrum of innovative treatments designed to address various pain sources. The clinic specializes in targeted interventions including nerve blocks, which temporarily interrupt pain signals to provide relief and diagnostic information. Their expertise extends to facet joint pain treatment, addressing discomfort originating from the small joints along the spine that can cause significant back and neck pain. For patients suffering from vertebral compression fractures, the clinic offers vertebroplasty, a procedure that stabilizes fractured vertebrae and provides rapid pain relief.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Tricity Pain Associates is their commitment to developing individualized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient. The medical team conducts thorough evaluations to identify the root causes of pain before recommending appropriate interventions. This patient-centered philosophy ensures that treatments are tailored to specific conditions rather than applying one-size-fits-all solutions. The clinic emphasizes minimally invasive procedures that can significantly reduce recovery time and minimize complications compared to traditional surgical approaches.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at Plaza III, 4325 N Josey Ln # 206, Carrollton, TX 75010, the clinic features modern medical equipment and comfortable treatment spaces designed to enhance the patient experience. The facility's convenient location makes it accessible to patients throughout the Carrollton area and surrounding communities. With a focus on creating a welcoming environment, Tricity Pain Associates strives to reduce the anxiety often associated with medical visits.

For those seeking relief from chronic joint, neck, or back pain, Tricity Pain Associates offers hope through advanced medical interventions. Prospective patients can learn more about available treatments or schedule a consultation by visiting https://tricitypainassociates.com/ or calling +1 844-789-7246.
column11: Tricity Pain Associates in Carrollton, TX is a medical practice that offers nonsurgical and minimally invasive procedures for the treatment of chronic joint, neck, or back pain. Their services include nerve blocks, facet joint pain treatment, vertebroplasty, and more.

column3:
Texas Interventional Pain Institute in Houston, Texas serves patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions through advanced interventional techniques. Our specialized medical practice focuses on identifying the root causes of pain and developing customized treatment plans that minimize medication dependence. With state-of-the-art facilities at our Park Row Boulevard location, we provide comprehensive care for patients throughout the greater Houston metropolitan area who struggle with debilitating pain conditions that affect their quality of life.

At Texas Interventional Pain Institute, our approach centers on procedure-based interventions designed to provide lasting relief. Our double board-certified physician conducts thorough evaluations to precisely identify pain sources, then develops multi-modal treatment strategies tailored to each patient's specific needs. We specialize in a variety of minimally invasive procedures that target pain at its source, helping patients reduce their reliance on medication and return to their normal activities.

Expert Care from Board-Certified Specialists

Our practice is led by physicians with dual board certifications, ensuring the highest level of expertise in pain management. This specialized training allows our team to offer advanced interventional procedures that many general practitioners cannot provide. We stay current with the latest developments in pain management to offer our patients the most effective treatment options available in modern medicine.

Comprehensive Pain Solutions

We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we take a holistic approach to treatment. Our goal is not just to mask symptoms but to help you reclaim your life from chronic pain. Through our personalized care plans, we've helped countless Houston residents return to work, family activities, and hobbies they thought were permanently beyond reach.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us:

Website: www.texasipi.com

Phone: +1 832-391-6870

Address: 19002 Park Row Blvd #200, Houston, TX 77084, United States
column11: Welcome to the Texas Interventional Pain Institute! We are here to help control your pain with procedure-based interventions that will allow you to get back your life! Our double board-certified physician will provide a full evaluation to find the source of your pain and develop a multi-modal approach to treat it.

Texas Pain Physicians: Waxahachie has been a trusted leader in pain management services throughout Ellis County since 2008. Located at 600 Ferris Ave in Waxahachie, TX, our dedicated team has successfully provided comprehensive pain relief care to thousands of patients in a caring and comfortable environment. We understand that chronic pain can significantly impact your quality of life, which is why our approach combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care tailored to each individual's needs.

Our skilled team of physicians understands the importance of proper diagnosis and treatment. We utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and innovative therapeutic approaches to address various pain conditions, including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndromes. Each treatment plan is customized to address the unique circumstances and goals of our patients.

Our Patient-Centered Approach

At Texas Pain Physicians, we believe in creating partnerships with our patients. Our doctors take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop effective strategies that align with your lifestyle and recovery goals. We emphasize minimally invasive procedures whenever possible and offer comprehensive follow-up care to ensure optimal outcomes.

column40:
Referred by my neurosurgeon. Was not greeted upon entering clinic by the blonde girl (no nametag).

Clinic signs expressing things like 'Karen will NOT see late patients so PLAN AHEAD' were all over the clinic, made it look cluttered, unprofessional and unwelcoming (honestly, tell me you don't trust your patients without telling me you don't trust your patients...). It's ironic because when you sign up to go to this clinic, you sign pages upon pages of acknowledgements basically agreeing to similar demands. It'd be nice if they didn't treat patients like forgetful children. Edit: for the record, I was on time.

Front desk girl threw urine cup at me when I asked to go to the bathroom after I'd waited in the exam room for an hour. Her excuse was "depending on what the doctor will give you" but I was not there for narcotics (which frankly was none of her business anyway).

The doctor was thorough with my health history and questions (which is the only reason I'm not giving a one star).

However the doctor took over an hour to arrive in exam room (honestly I almost left, and the blonde front desk girl was catty and rude when I indicated such to her). I was not the only patient to complain, as I overheard other patients talking to the front desk about the delay time with waiting for providers while I was leaving. If the patients are being demanded to be on time, the doctors should also comply.

When I got outside, another front desk staff was in heated discussion with a lost driver and patient in the parking lot (from what I'm assuming was another facility). Not a great experience, won't be back.|Dr Terry Latch and NP Karen Albright are a great team. Dr Latch has a light touch with injections. I'm a nurse, and pleased!|Dr Latch is cool but the foreign people that answer the phone for appointment cancellations are ridiculous.   I canceled 8 minutes shy of 24 hours and he insisted I still had to pay the cancelation fee.  I'm glad I'm moving to my new provider just so I can speak to US based call centers and stop getting nickel and dimed for nonsense.|I literally made appointment in the morning with sonterra clinic. Grace or someone called me, claiming I didn't talk to her in a scolding, disrespectful manners. Then punish me but canceling my appointment. They wouldn't tell me if she is CMA, CNA etc. I want to complain on her and fake boss to the texas license board. Please post the license of your staff and don't let them run the place to ground. I hope then can hire people who grow up with manners.|I was referred to Texas Pain Physicians by another doctor a little more than a year ago.  The main pain management doctor has left and now Dr. Latch is in the lead.  Today I had a routine visit with RN, AGACNP-BC Karen Albright.  As I entered the waiting area, I was greeted by Connie and Nikki.  Connie logged me in and Nikki took my vital signs.  Both of the ladies were very polite, courteous and friendly.  Then I visited with RN Albright.  I had visited with her before and this time was all the same.  She is a very professional, attentive, caring, and patient health professional.  We had a thorough conversation and she immediately ordered the medications I needed.  I could not have asked for anything more.  Though I have not been seen yet by Dr. Latch, both Connie and Nikki were very complimentary about him.  I highly recommend Texas Pain Physicians.  Great clinic!!|This practice was top-notch with Dr.Escontrias. Unfortunately, he left the practice and they brought in the worst doctor I've ever met. Dr Neleson! I think he gets pleasure from sabotaging treatment for patients that truly suffer from chronic pain! Even performing back procedures without an MRI to fully understand the areas needing to be addressed. Then bending my daughter in all kinds of contorted positions telling me I'm fixed. She began to feel pain that she never felt before. And then questioning lab results even after her being under a doctor's care in a hospital. Unbelievable! I'll never take her back there!|Everyone is so nice and proactive. From the front desk to the procedure rooms, Sarah (nurse), Joseph (nurse), financial department (Josie), Kiki (aid), Conny (nurse & manager), and the doctors Karen & Dr. Neleson are all super helpful & professional. I can trust my health at this place.,|Karen is truly exceptional! From the moment I entered the doors to the office, I felt welcomed, cared for, and completely at ease. She has always gone above and beyond to be sure that my complete health and wellness have been made a first priority.
She's extremely knowledgable and personable. Not once have they ever run late for any of my appointments.The office is inviting and the staff members are friendly and helpful in every way.
Truly, I would recommend this pain management office to anyone seeking answers to better their health and do so in a very personalized and professional way. I'm treated as if I was one of their family members. Thank you

OmniSpine Pain Management serves Mesquite, TX and surrounding areas with comprehensive chronic pain management solutions. Our specialized clinic offers a multidisciplinary approach to treating persistent pain conditions, combining innovative medical techniques with personalized care plans. With a focus on improving quality of life and restoring function, our team of pain specialists works closely with each patient to develop customized treatment strategies that address their unique needs and circumstances.

At OmniSpine Pain Management, we provide a wide range of advanced treatments for chronic pain, including:

  • Botox injections for neck pain and related conditions

  • SphenoCath Migraine Headache Block for migraine relief

  • Nerve block injections for knee arthritis, joint pain, and headaches

  • Steroid injections for inflammation reduction

  • Opioid medication management with careful monitoring

  • Viscosupplementation injections for joint lubrication

  • Radiofrequency nerve ablation for longer-term pain relief

  • Specialized treatment for chronic spine conditions

Our Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in providing our patients with a comprehensive array of treatment options tailored to their specific needs. By delivering personalized attention and care to everyone we treat, we strive to create the most effective treatment plan for each patient's unique situation. This individualized approach allows us to achieve better outcomes and improved quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions.

column40:
2nd Visit. So after the spinal ablutation procedure done, I felt I am new person must of my pain in lowe back and right leg was gone and I was able to walk and do my regular work like driving and doing my own groceries etc. I will highly recommned
Dr. Mahreen Iqbal and her Husband for the pain treatment.
Thank you Dr.Mahreen Iqbal for given back my life.

First visit. Staff is very friendly and courteous Michelle helped me getting referrals from my PCP to expedite the process and Dr.Iqbal is very nice and understand my concern.I would recommend to my friend and family 
2nd Visit for the follow up with Dr.Mirza was also very positive and pleasant.|Dr. Iqbal has truly been a blessing in my life! After a difficult year of surgeries and pelvic/ back chronic pain, I felt like other doctors were just brushing me off, not taking my pain seriously or trying to find a solution. But Dr. Iqbal listened to me from the very start, something I hadn't experienced in a long time. She took the time to understand my concerns and came up with a thoughtful treatment plan that would help alleviate my pain. Gave me options and explained in depth why I should take which route of treatment plan and etc , felt super comfortable and confident with the treatment plan we decided to go with.  Michealle, Dr. Iqbal's medical assistant, Called  multiple pharmacies to find a pharmacy that could make a specific compound medication for me, super thankful.  She's always so welcoming and takes the time to listen to my concerns. Michealle is not only sweet and kind but also incredibly informative.
When I went in for my epidural injection, the entire team made sure I was completely at ease. Her entire staff is just as amazing! From the moment I walked in, Aly  greeted me with warmth and made sure I felt welcomed and comfortable during pre-op and the procedure. They helped me relax even though I was nervous, and during the procedure, I didn't feel any pain--just a small pinch. It was quick, and when I stood up, I could already feel relief, which I hadn't felt in a long time! I am so grateful to Dr. Iqbal and her entire team for their compassion, dedication, and outstanding care. They've made all the difference in my journey to healing!!!!!!|Marvelous visit . Everyone wad so kind knowledgeable and concerned about my needs.   They were transparent and talked with clarity.  They immediately gave me help so as to make me comfortable, remove my fears, established rapport.   I am so happy I went to them, and my doctor was kind and thorough.  Anxiously awaiting my  results, which I just feel will be great and long lasting.  If I were to give this place a report card grade,   A+....... Oh yeah!'n|This office is a joke.  The girls who answer the phone are rude and condescending and have ZERO Customer service skills! My daughter, who has 2 insurances, was told they would not accept insurance for the nerve block shots she needed.  She called me crying, she was in pain, she needed the shots.  I didn't have time to think or question why they wouldn't bill insurance, so I just paid the $500.  Later I found out the shots would've been covered under our insurance had they allowed her to use it. I made numerous phone calls to them, and their explanation was that since she chose to have the shots the same day as the office visit , they only take insurance for the office visit. Huh? That doesn't make any sense to me.
I asked to speak to the doctor, and they said the doctor doesn't come to the phone. like I said ZERO customer service.  They Did not offer to take a message for her or anything.  I asked for the Person who does their billing, And they said she doesn't work in office.  Ok... So how do I contact her? They gave me her email so I emailed her but She never replied.  I contacted our insurance, and because they never received a claim from the doctor (bc remember the doc wouldn't bill them)  they said the only thing we can do is file a grievance against the doctor.
In my opinion, What this doctor did is bordering on unethical.|Dr. Iqbal is great! The whole staff is professional and welcoming. They care about their patients and actually listen. Best place for any back or spine related issue. I've been suffering with sciatica for years and now after one procedure my back and leg pain is gone. I highly recommend Dr. Iqbal and Michealle!|Dr. Mehreen is a very professional and a very patient listener and gives full attention to the patient. Her PA Michelle is very courteous and polite. I recommend this center for consultation and treatment any time|Dr. Iqbal is a great doctor.  She listens and asses your problem throughly.   Great staff as well|Dr. Iqbal is amazing! She takes the time to thoroughly go over the procedures. Staff is also great. I highly recommend.

BCS Pain Clinic serves Bryan, Texas and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions.
