column40:
I love Dr. Chouteau and Shefali Patel. However, their office staff leave MUCH to be desired. They are not only unfriendly, many are downright rude. As a pain patient, I feel like compassionate, kind, patient, and understanding staff should be a given. But that has not been my experience. I know they have a lot going on to run the office but patient care should be at the forefront of their priority list.

I was turned away and rescheduled because I was four minutes late. I was told they do not have a grace period for late patients. When I pushed back, I was given a print out of paperwork I had signed in January that they had highlighted to show me their "policy." It would only said "be on time for you appointments."

I see MANY doctors for my condition and have never been turned away if I'm within 15 minutes of my appointment. The office staff were dismissive, rude, and uncaring.

It's unfortunate because once I see Dr. Chouteau or Dr. Patel, I do feel very valued and cared for. Their nurses are kind, as well. But up until then, the office staff treat me as though I'm just an interruption and that they could care less about me as a patient.|I love Dr Chouteau. I dont like having to come every month just to refill medications and vitals and urinate in a cup. I have been disabled since 2009 and have been through different therapy and medications. I dont like all the calls from different people just to satisfy Well Med and other programs. This is really annoying and makes me not happy. I wish someone will listen and stop interferring with my personal life. I use to see the pain doctor every 3 months but Well Med changed it to every month for everyone. I dont think it is necessary for me. I am discouraged and dont want to do it. I try now but dont know how long I can continue. I have other doctors to see but often put them off because of pain and barely able to move sometimes.|Dr. Chateau and her staff are very professional and everyone has such positive attitudes.  I absolutely love my NP, Miss Patel. She is extremely knowledgeable and has the perfect demeanor. I never feel as if I am just a number.  I know I am  in good hands, which means the world!  I highly recommend Dr.  Chateau !|I love love here. I am well taken care of and I highly recommend Dr. Chouteau and her team.
Shefali is one of the nurse practitioners and I saw her and she was so kind and listened to me and wasn't in a rush.
Her nurse today was Bailey and she was fantastic!|I have been coming to the clinic for over a year. They're very professional,curious and polite. All the doctors actually listen to you. It's hard to find a good doctor and one that shows empathy|Dr. Chouteau has been treating me for spinal stenosis pain for five years. The care has been excellent. I feel fortunate to have Dr. Chouteau managing my care. Everyone at Texas Pain Physicians is professional and friendly.|I've been a patient of Dr. Whitney Chouteau for about 3 years. Ultimately, I wish that she and her physician's assistants could be my primary care doctors. In addition to the nurses and staff, they all represent the best medical team I've ever seen.

Here's the main reason:

Relationships are best judged by how a person handles the tough days. Dr. Chouteau and her team are there for me on my toughest days. They're steady, they don't get rattled. You'd never know that they have bad days, too. They operate by the book, but the human element is never lost.

You don't often find an entire medical team who can balance empathy with professionalism, and this office has consistently perfected that balance during the 3 years I've known them.

This is essentially a thank you note to this facility. They've listened to me, reasonably managed my pain issues, and helped me maintain the healthiest life I can live.|I have been coming to Dr Choteau for years now. Today trying to verify insurance coverages and which way would be cheaper, over 30 minutes and whomever handles that part, because it's not the ladies in the front, taking their sweet time as if I can sit here and miss my appt time and other things that need to be done. I don't know what in heck is going on but they need to do their jobs when someone is waiting to be seen, because taking your time IS NOT an option, busy lives here people.

The Woodlands Pain Institute serves patients throughout The Woodlands, Conroe, Spring, Tomball, Cypress, Houston, and Montgomery, Texas with comprehensive pain management solutions. Every day, our dedicated team brings hope to hundreds of patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. With a patient-centered approach and advanced treatment options, we strive to improve quality of life and restore function for those experiencing debilitating pain.

At The Woodlands Pain Institute, we specialize in treating a wide range of pain conditions using evidence-based approaches and innovative techniques. Our board-certified pain specialists develop personalized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient, focusing on both symptom relief and addressing underlying causes.

Conditions We Treat

Our expertise extends to numerous pain conditions, including:

- Spinal Disorders: Degenerative Disc Disease, Herniated/Bulging Disks, Low Back and Neck Pain, Post-surgical Pain

- Neuropathic Conditions: Complex Regional Pain Syndrome, Neuropathic Pain, Phantom Limb Pain, Pinched Nerve

- Chronic Pain Syndromes: Fibromyalgia, Myofascial Pain Syndrome, Musculoskeletal Pain

- Specialized Pain Management: Abdominal Pain, Pelvic Pain, Endometriosis Pain, Tailbone Pain

- Neurological Disorders: Multiple Sclerosis Pain, Headaches

- Other Conditions: Acute/Chronic Herpes Zoster (Shingles), Arthritis, Cancer Pain, Carpal Tunnel Syndrome, Osteoporosis

We also provide specialized services for patients dealing with addiction issues, including Opiates and Benzodiazepines Detoxification, and comprehensive care for those experiencing Chronic Pain with Concomitant Depression and/or Anxiety.

Contact Information

Website: [https://www.thewoodlandspaininstitute.com/](https://www.thewoodlandspaininstitute.com/)

Phone: +1 281-292-7246

Address: 1006 Windsor Lakes Blvd #150, Conroe, TX 77384, United States

Take the first step toward pain relief by scheduling a consultation with our experienced team today. At The Woodlands Pain Institute, we're committed to helping you reclaim your life from pain.

Dr.Bishai has been absolutely amazing. I went from severely depressed and suicidal to highly productive and loving life. He understands mental health more than any doctor or psychiatrist I have encountered. And I have been through quite a few. I also want to mention that his staff has always been amazing and empathetic. Frankie is such a warm person and even during my difficult moments she has been supportive and helpful. This institution has been a blessing and I am so grateful that I was fortunate to have found a place that has turned my life into one I genuinely enjoy living.|Dr. Bishai has been professional and thorough with questions and explanations.  He has made me feel comfortable from the first visit. The office is flexible with in-person and telehealth. They have plenty of parking and friendly staff as well. And answer their phones quickly- so rare to find these days.|Dr. Bishai is very down to earth and easy to talk to. He checks in with me and cares about my wellbeing. I also like how he has encouraged me to lower my anxiety/depression meds slowly at a rate that I feel comfortable with. I've been very pleased with my time with him!|Dr. Bishai and his front desk staff, Frankie and Shelby are wonderful. We never have a wait, you can actually reach him if you have any issues outside of office hours. Dr. Bishai is very caring, you feel listened to instead of talked at. He has been a real Blessing for our family. I am so happy we found him .|Very nice staff. Dr. Bishai is also very knowledgeable and caring about his patients, you can tell he really loves what he does. The only issue I have is that you have to wait at least 45 mins for your appointment before anyone actually sees you, even if you show up on time/early. He is always there for you when you need him and is the reason I was able to turn my life around!  His front desk staff, Frankie and Shelby always take great care of me as well.
Thank you Dr. Bishai!|Dr. Bishai is a compassionate and caring doctor. He has been helping me during a difficult time in my life and has truly made a difference in the way I view my health. Frankie and Shelly are extremely caring and work their absolute best with assisting Dr. Bishai on the front end/back end of things, and everything in between!

Advanced Pain Management Medical Office in Webster, Texas offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Greater Houston area. Established with a commitment to improving quality of life, our board-certified specialists utilize evidence-based approaches to address acute and chronic pain conditions. We combine innovative medical technologies with personalized treatment plans to help patients regain functionality and reduce dependence on pain medications.

At Advanced Pain Management Medical Office, we provide a wide range of interventional procedures and therapeutic options tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our multidisciplinary approach includes:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Nerve blocks and radiofrequency ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Joint injections and viscosupplementation

  • Medication management

  • Physical therapy coordination

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life. Our compassionate team takes time to listen to patients' concerns, thoroughly evaluate their conditions, and develop comprehensive treatment strategies that address both the symptoms and underlying causes of pain. We emphasize minimally invasive techniques whenever possible to promote faster recovery with fewer complications.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please contact us at +1 832-930-9001. Our clinic is conveniently located at 220 W. Medical Center Blvd, Webster, TX 77598, serving patients from Clear Lake, League City, Friendswood, and surrounding communities. For more information about our services or to request an appointment online, visit our website at www.apmclinic.com.

column40:
He never showed any concern about my condition or my pain. He had an X-ray of my hip and treated me for months with no relief. I even had to be wheeled back in a wheelchair. When I finally decided that was enough and said I was going to my orthopedic surgeon for an xray. Azzam wanted to do an X-ray there. HE HAD AN XRAY WHEN I CAME TO HIM because I was referred by my spine surgeon. I went to my orthopedic surgeon and he asked me with just a short exam, "What took you so long?".  So I was in severe pain for months while Azzam "treated" me. My family can attest to the FACT that I could not walk at all without being bent over and holding onto things the entire time I was being "treated" by Azzam. I couldn't stand up or sit down without excruciating pain.. I needed a hip replacement which Azzam knew I needed from the start! This man must be blind or just doesn't care. You decide!|I have been a patient of Dr. Azaam's for years.  He is an amazing doctor, and has given me back my life by eliminating my back pain.  Rachael Thompson, P.A.,  is extremely knowledgeable and solved my headache issues.   The staff is incredibly kind and professional. I highly recommend Advanced Pain Management to anyone who is seeking pain relief.|My first visit to Advanced Pain Management with Dr. Mohamad Azzam was definitely a 5 Star Visit. I was greeted from his staff with smiles and promptly finished up with paperwork and co-payment. Only a very short wait before being escorted into the exam room. This is where I met Dr. Azzam. He showed genuine concern on the amount of time I was in pain. Went over my X-rays and MRI results with me and all forms of medication and treatments I had already received. We discussed my options. This was on a Wednesday. I was scheduled to come back on Friday just two days later. I chose to get an injection in my SI joint to start treatment for my hamstring/sciatic nerve pain. I chose to have the injection without anesthesia.
Truthfully, I was a nervous wreck, which I kindly explained to Dr. Azzam. He had a warm bedside manner and explained everything step by step. He was very gentle, and the best part is, it was not bad at all! I did experience some pain 1 hour after returning home. He told me this might happen. His nurse contacted me on the following Monday, assuring me everything I was experiencing was Normal!
Each day I started feeling better and better. I feel I was 75% better after 1 week. Now it's been 2 Weeks and I feel I'm 100% pain free. I highly recommend Dr. Azzam. If you've tried PT, Chiropractic Care and manipulations, acupuncture  & pain meds with no success, I suggest you give Advanced Pain Management a try! I did, and couldn't be happier with my outcome. 6 months of constant pain was way too long! I hope this review is helpful.|Great place to receive care! Dr.Azzam is very caring/professional and does his best to make sure my needs are met. His nurse practitioner is amazing as well! Love this office and the staff.|Dr. Azaam was a very nice doctor but his front office was very  rude and not helpful at all. I was going there to get a  couple injection and I needed a Prior Auth for my insurance to cover it. My first scheduled injection was cancelled the day before because they had not got my PA back. Okay fine I understand. I call Monday because I called my insurance to see they did my Pa and the insurance company said they never got anything from this office. So Dr. Azaam office staff tells me well we havent done it because I have to call your insurance and stay on hold for an hour so we havent done it. So what were you going to do call me Thursday and cancel my appointment again?? Thats not how you treat patients I was in alot of pain. But thankfully I found a Pain Clinic that actually cares. Beware if you're in pain they don't care.|Be sure to check other sources for reviews as well.

This place does not care about you whatsoever. They care about your money. Some compassion when dealing with people who have life altering injuries could go a very long way.

This is a very cookie cutter healthcare kind of place. I have an L4/L5 injury. The disc is over half way out and pushing on the nerve affecting my right and left leg.

I went to my first visit desperate for help. I tried asking questions (because not being able to feel your leg can be extremally scary turns out) Dr. Azzam talked over me and told me the plan was for a pack of steroids and a spinal injection which we did.

It offered temporary relief but not sustainable. The questions I had were which exercises I could do, what stretches would help, what the next plan would be, but he only had interest in getting to the next patient.

I was told to do core work but not which ones are safe, I was told light weights only but couldn't give me a number. So I tried working out again based on the extremely limited information I was given between my $500 worth of visits and the pain got worse.

I was supposed to have a follow up the day after Christmas and I did not have another $150 available for it, so now that I got that money together and attempted to schedule they have a $35 fee tacked on that they refuse to take off because I didn't come to my appointment (even though I left a message, its all I could do they were closed)|Dr, Azzam and staff are always friendly and courteous to my needs. They continue to identify different avenues of treatment in an effort to relieve my pain permanently, rather than just coping with the pain. They have went above and beyond helping with my insurance to get approval for procedures and  they are always focused on my needs during each appointment and I never feel rushed. I would recommend this office for all your needs, if your looking for someone to focus on your health in a clean and a respectful environment, than this is your  place.|So a few years ago they were great! Apparently they have had some office staff turnover and it's horrible. I called on Monday got an appointment for today  Friday at 10:00 am just to arrive and find out there was no appointment on the schedule for me. I asked the receptionist if she could ask one of the providers if they would see me. She simply replied "No they are with patients."  Which was a full on lie. I saw Rachel, NP go into an office on the side of the front reception and Dr Azaam walk through the reception desk area. Neither were in a patient care room at the time. I've gone here since 2020 but I guess this girl is new and didn't realize I know the providers. They actually made a point to tell me my employers didn't send them referrals.  Anyhoo, go somewhere else. Don't waste your time.

Texas Pain Physicians serves Rockwall, Texas with comprehensive pain management solutions that have transformed thousands of lives since 2008. Our dedicated medical practice specializes in diagnosing and treating chronic pain conditions through personalized care plans designed to restore quality of life. Located conveniently in Rockwall, our practice combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate patient care to address everything from back pain and joint issues to complex neurological pain disorders.

At Texas Pain Physicians, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our board-certified physicians utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and innovative treatment approaches to identify the root cause of your pain. We pride ourselves on creating individualized treatment plans that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and interventional techniques to provide effective relief.

Comprehensive Pain Relief Services

Our practice offers solutions for numerous pain conditions including but not limited to:

  • Neck and back pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Sports injuries

  • Work-related injuries

Patient-Centered Approach

Since establishing our practice in 2008, we have maintained our commitment to providing care in a comfortable, supportive environment. Our team takes the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop treatment strategies that align with your lifestyle and goals. As our motto states: "Texas Pain Physicians can manage your pain so you can manage your life!"

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our Dallas-area doctors, please contact us at +1 972-636-5727 or visit our website at www.texaspainphysicians.com. Our Rockwall office is located at 3013 Ridge Rd #101, Rockwall, TX 75032.

column38: Somaia Hassan|Eve S.|Bryan|Michael|Erica Prettyman|lorena peralta|Kelly Wesson|Suzanne Walsh
column40:
I've been going for 3 years and my experience has been great! Dr Morsy listens, he takes care of his patients and I'm always referring him to my family and friends. He's taken care of my pain and I can't be more thankful|I do not recommend this office. They clearly view patients as numbers and not individuals. I have been a registered nurse for 17 years. I have suffered from chronic pain most of my life and simply needed a Tramadol prescription, which I use responsibly 2-3 times per week for rheumatoid arthritis pain. Unfortunately, I cannot get this from any of my 6 other doctors, due to the strict narcotics laws in place. I spent 3 hours for a new patient visit. I was told to come one hour early to fill out paper work. Who does this anymore? Medical history papers should be emailed or filled out online before the visit in this modern era. I arrived 30 minutes early, because I am a pro at filling out my medical history. After finishing my paperwork, I proceeded to watch everyone else in the office who had arrived after me be taken back to a room. After mentioning this to the receptionist, they promptly found a room. While waiting for the doctor, I heard a nurse loudly gather all the staff to celebrate a birthday party in their break room. What a sign of disrespect...keeping patients waiting while the staff is socializing. They also kept all the exam room doors open, thereby violating HIPAA. The doctor was kind but brief, like most doctors. Again, patients are a number and billing code, not an individual. There are better pain management practices out there. My motto is the doctor is only as could as their office staff.|If you look at the 1-star reviews, they're here for a reason and aren't a joke. After going to his office for over a year he severed our relationship due to... get this... asking questions. He didn't want to allow me to use my insurance's pharmacy anymore so I asked why. Apparently that's asking for too much and makes his nurse practitioner "uncomfortable." I tried to get them in touch with my pharmacy (which is a government-run one, not a small one), and they refused to speak to them while just stating that they can reject any pharmacy they want and don't have to say why. It's the only pharmacy I could use that wouldn't be charging ridiculous amounts since it's the only one in-network with my government insurance and he ended up just deciding to tell me I was dropped as a patient due to asking questions that made them uncomfortable. That's the amazing service you'll get there -- I guess it's good for someone that wants to just sit lifeless while his office staff does whatever they feel like and you're walking on eggshells afraid to say or ask anything because you don't know how they'll retaliate. Seriously, if you don't believe this, read the other reviews. If one is a coincidence and two's a pattern, what is it when 15+ are all complaining about the same issues?|The experiance was extremely painful. Since visit have pain from treatment that my prescrition pain medicatin cant stop. My treatment has put me in such pain at wakes me up at night and have lost use of right arm witout pain from treatment|I would never recommend this place.
I have never been so dismissed by a doctor like I was by Dr Morsy and his assistant. I had MRI's done and he said we will do injections I asked him to explain to me why I needed them, he said he would hand me the report to read. Umm no explain it to me. He told me a few things and then said his assistant could tell me, handed her the paper and walked out. She said I can tell you are frustrated and then she handed me the report and walked out. I was shocked at the way I was treated.|Im not the one to normally rate and much less write a review. But I have never been so upset with a doctors office until today. Worst experience thanks to a nurse practitioner. I have not been a patient very long. Dr. Morsy is wonderful. And his staff is great as well. His office manager is outstanding! But Dr. Morsys nurse practitioner is a JOKE. I have never met such a terrible nurse practitioner like her. She does not care one bit. The first time I told myself maybe because I was new. But this last time I saw her she did not give me one chance to tell her my problems. She walked in didn't say one word or ask one question and much less did not give me a chance to ask or tell her anything. She's a waste of time for sure. But again thank you to the office manager Mrs. Olga she listened to my concerns and problems. For now on I will make sure to see Dr. Morsy and him only.|I have been a patient of Dr. Morsy for several years and he and the staff at Tx Pain Physicians are always so nice and helpful. If you have a problem or question you will always get an answer. The girls at the front desk always greet you with a smile and the nurses in the back are very comforting if you are nervous about a procedure you are scheduled for. The office manager comes up to speak to me every month when I have my appointment just to check on me and ask how I have been doing. I highly recommend if you need pain management.|I am a patient at Texas Pain Physicians in Rockwall. My doctor Amr Morsy is wonderful. I have been with them several years and have received the finest of care. His staff, especially Olga and Joey are exceptional! Warm, caring, and professional. Dr Morsy performed the Minuteman procedure on my back and only nominal pain, only 10 days out I am great. I am so fortunate to be in their care. With a set of debilitating back conditions, I have received all the right treatment. My love and appreciation to them.

Ascension Medical Group Providence Pain Management Clinic serves Waco, Texas with comprehensive pain management solutions designed for those suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our specialized team combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care to help patients regain control of their lives through effective pain management strategies tailored to individual needs.

At our clinic, we offer a multidisciplinary approach to pain management utilizing minimally invasive procedures, targeted injections, and medication management protocols. Our comprehensive treatment options are designed to address various pain conditions, from back and neck pain to neuropathy and complex regional pain syndrome.

Expert Medical Team

Our distinguished care team includes highly trained neuro-anesthesiologists, physiatrists, and neurologists who specialize exclusively in pain diagnosis and treatment. This diverse expertise allows us to provide a thorough evaluation of your condition and develop personalized treatment plans that address the root causes of your pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. That's why we take time to listen to your concerns and work collaboratively with you to establish realistic goals for pain reduction and improved function. Our focus remains on enhancing your quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please call us at +1 254-537-6550. We're conveniently located at 405 Londonderry Dr # 311, Waco, TX 76712. For more information about our services, visit our website at healthcare.ascension.org.

column48: When will the COVID-19 vaccine be made available?
column49: We are following local and state government and health department guidelines for COVID-19 vaccine distribution. column3:
Chronic Pain Relief serves Dallas, Texas and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our practice understands that chronic pain sufferers are more than just their symptoms—they are individuals whose pain often stems from complex, multifaceted causes requiring personalized treatment approaches.

At Chronic Pain Relief, pain management specialists Dr. Basem Abdelfattah and Dr. Ali Tareen implement a holistic philosophy that addresses both the physical and psychosocial aspects of chronic pain. This multi-modal approach combines medications, minimally invasive procedures, and physical therapy to help patients achieve maximum relief and improved quality of life.

Our Specialized Approach

What sets our practice apart is our commitment to treating the whole person. We recognize that effective pain management goes beyond simply masking symptoms—it requires understanding how pain affects every aspect of a patient's wellbeing. By addressing both the physical causes and psychological components of chronic pain, our team helps patients find significant, long-term relief rather than temporary fixes.

Advanced Treatment Options

Our specialists stay at the forefront of pain management techniques, which are continually evolving and improving. We offer the latest evidence-based interventions designed to provide relief while minimizing risks and side effects. Each treatment plan is customized to address the specific needs and circumstances of the individual patient.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management experts, please contact us at +1 214-983-1787 or visit our website at www.cprelief.com. Our office is conveniently located at 3453 St Francis Ave, Suite 100, Dallas, TX 75228.
column11:
Patients are not just a collection of symptoms; they are unique individuals experiencing pain that often has multiple causes. Pain management specialists Basem Abdelfattah, MD, and Ali Tareen, MD, believe relieving symptoms should involve addressing every patient's overall health and well-being.
At Chronic Pain Relief, we treat pain with a multi-modal approach utilizing medications, procedures, and physical therapy. Our team helps patients achieve maximum pain relief with minimally invasive procedures. We address not only the physical cause of chronic pain, but its psychosocial cause allowing patients to find significant, long-term relief.
Pain management techniques are continually evolving and improving.

column40:
Dr. A is the best! He helped me when I had really given up on getting any pain relief in my lower back. Was recommended to him from surgeon who asked me to give him a try before moving forward with surgery (I wanted to try ALL my options before having any surgery). I didn't expect any different results than the previous injections, therapies, and procedures but I was pleasantly surprised! He listened to me and came up with a great plan that has given me the most relief to date. He has a great support staff helping him as well. You will not be disappointed!!|Dr. Abdelfattah is truly dedicated to improving his patients' quality of life. Dr. A's approach is not only comprehensive but also tailored to meet individual needs. I've noticed significant improvement in my pain management since being under his care.  If you're looking for a pain specialist who is knowledgeable, compassionate, and genuinely invested in their patients, Dr. Abdelfattah is an excellent choice.|I have been with Dr. A since January of 2014. He is very knowledgeable; he is trustworthy, and I trust his judgement. He has great people skills, and he really does care about his patients. I drive over 60 miles to see him, and I would not trust any other doctor with my health concerning my chronic pain.|I am so happy I found Dr. A! He is very compassionate, straightforward, and explained treatment options clearly. He asked for my input into my treatment plan and gave me pros & cons for each decision. Lone Star Spine & Pain Institute serves New Braunfels, Texas and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management solutions. Founded on principles of patient-centered, collaborative, and compassionate care, our practice brings together a team of double-board certified physicians with specialized fellowship training in interventional pain management. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we're committed to developing personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique circumstances and goals.

Our dedication to excellence has earned our physicians recognition as Top Doctors of 2022 by Texas Monthly Magazine. This distinction reflects our commitment to providing the highest standard of care while staying at the forefront of pain management innovations. At Lone Star Spine & Pain Institute, we combine medical expertise with genuine compassion to help patients reclaim their lives from chronic pain.

Comprehensive Treatment Options

We offer the full spectrum of pain management solutions, from conservative approaches to minimally invasive interventional procedures. Our treatment philosophy emphasizes non-surgical solutions whenever possible, focusing on quick recovery times, restoration of function, and meaningful improvements in quality of life. Each treatment plan is tailored to address specific pain conditions while considering the patient's overall health and wellness goals.

Visit Our Pain Management Center

Located at 2115 Stephens Pl Unit 1400, New Braunfels, TX 78130, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, call (830) 715-0583 or visit our website at https://redefineyourpain.com. Let us help you redefine your relationship with pain and rediscover a more active, comfortable lifestyle.

Advanced Pain Solutions in Mesquite, Texas is a premier pain management clinic dedicated to providing comprehensive care for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our patient-centered approach combines innovative treatment protocols with compassionate care, ensuring each individual receives personalized attention for their unique pain management needs. Since our establishment, we have built a reputation for excellence in diagnosing and treating various pain disorders using evidence-based methodologies and cutting-edge technologies.

Our primary clinic is conveniently located at 3865 Childress Ave Suite A, Mesquite, TX 75150. To better serve our patients throughout east Texas, we've expanded with an additional office in Greenville, Texas, making quality pain management more accessible to residents across the region.

Our Approach to Pain Management

At Advanced Pain Solutions, we understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. Our multidisciplinary team works diligently to identify the root causes of your discomfort and develop targeted treatment plans that address both symptoms and underlying conditions. We prioritize non-invasive and minimally invasive procedures whenever possible, focusing on sustainable pain relief and improved quality of life.

Services We Offer

Our comprehensive services include diagnostic evaluations, interventional pain procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and ongoing support for long-term pain conditions. We specialize in treating back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, sports injuries, and pain related to various medical conditions.

Patient-First Philosophy

What truly sets Advanced Pain Solutions apart is our unwavering commitment to putting patients first. We take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly explain treatment options, and involve you in the decision-making process. Our friendly staff ensures a comfortable experience from the moment you schedule your consultation through your entire treatment journey.

Contact Information

Ready to take the first step toward effective pain management? Contact us today to schedule your consultation:

Phone: +1 972-681-7246

Website: www.advancedpainsolutionstx.com

Address: 3865 Childress Ave Suite A, Mesquite, TX 75150, United States

Don't let pain control your life any longer. At Advanced Pain Solutions, we're committed to helping you find relief and return to the activities you love.

Dr K is amazing he has taken the time to help me understand what I have been going threw and why , as well as he's told me ways to get better . I am truly blessed for his office and staff . Keep doing what y'all are doing love you guys .. will definitely refer any friends or family|I have been a patient of Dr. Kikkeri for approximately 20 years.   Dr. Kikkeri is kind, compassionate, and knowledgeable with a great sense of humor. He takes the time to explain to you his treatment plan. I never feel rushed.  From his friendly receptionists to his office manager Karen, you always feel welcomed. I've also seen Ms. Phillips and she is just as kind, compassionate and knowledgeable. Jaquila and Jasmin are 2 of the nurses who are super friendly and just makes the entire process less stressful.  I would be amiss to leave out the physical therapist Dr. Paul.  Dr. Paul is very caring as well. He has a great sense of humor and feels like a friend rather than just a physical therapist. You can't go wrong with his office.|Ms. Tennille is awesome! She's warm and friendly.  I had to have a procedure done and she kept me informed all the way. From getting it approved through insurance to the scheduling. It was an absolute pleasure working with her. A true professional!|Advanced Pain Solutions has great staff and great Dr's. My doctor provides me with the best care that I need, and details every aspect of my care and what procedures are best for me.|As both a patient of Dr. Kikkeri and an employee at NTTC, I can attest to his exceptional care, knowledge, and skill. During my first pregnancy, I struggled with SI joint pain. An orthopedic surgeon recommended physical therapy, which helped alleviate the pain, but it never fully subsided.

During my second pregnancy, the SI joint pain became unbearable. Walking was excruciating, and I couldn't find comfort in sitting or lying down. Towards the end of my second pregnancy, I began working for Dr. Kikkeri. Postpartum, I resumed physical therapy, but this time with Dr. Paul. Dr. Paul is a kind and gentle soul, with great knowledge in physical therapy and rehab. His expertise significantly eased my SI joint pain.

As time went on and I juggled life with a toddler and a baby, I began experiencing severe lower back pain. Once again, Dr. Paul's physical therapy provided immense relief. However, when the pain persisted, I received a pain injection from Dr. Kikkeri, which gave me seven months of pain-free living. I was able to be an active mom, chasing my kids at the park and returning to yoga.

Dr. Kikkeri, Dr. Paul, Dr. Sandhu, and PA Trent have been incredible in educating me about my imaging and explaining everything in terms I can understand. Their compassion and expertise have been invaluable.

I can always count on Karen to greet me at the front desk, and I see her provide other patients with the same warmth and professionalism she shows me every day.

I am profoundly grateful not only to work at NTTC but also to be a patient of APS. The care I've received has been exceptional.

column3:
Advanced Pain Care in Waco, Texas has been a leading provider of comprehensive pain management services since 2002. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Malone and a team of specialized pain management physicians, the practice has grown to become one of the region's most trusted resources for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. With a patient-centered approach and access to cutting-edge treatments, Advanced Pain Care has established itself as a beacon of hope for those seeking relief from debilitating pain.

At our Waco location, patients have access to specialized care for a wide range of pain conditions including post-surgical pain, cancer-related discomfort, degenerative disc disease, joint disease, fibromyalgia, migraines, and musculoskeletal issues. Our physicians are particularly skilled in addressing chronic pain affecting the back, shoulder, hip, neck, sacroiliac joint, and spine, as well as managing sciatica symptoms. Each treatment plan is customized to address the unique needs and circumstances of individual patients.

Meet Our Waco Specialists

The Waco clinic features two distinguished physicians:

  • Dr. Adam W. Spjute - Pain Management Specialist

  • Dr. Andre Chen - Opioid Stewardship and Behavioral Health Specialist

Extensive Network of Care

As part of a larger network, Advanced Pain Care offers patients exceptional convenience and continuity of care through its 15 locations, 4 surgery centers, 3 pharmacies, and a dedicated physical therapy clinic. This integrated approach ensures that patients receive comprehensive care addressing all aspects of their pain management journey.

Specialized Treatment Approaches

Beyond traditional pain management, Advanced Pain Care offers specialized services in Opioid Stewardship and Behavioral Health, recognizing the complex interplay between physical pain, medication management, and psychological well-being. This multidisciplinary approach sets Advanced Pain Care apart as a truly comprehensive pain management resource.

To schedule an appointment at our Waco location, please visit austinpaindoctor.com or call +1 254-741-6641. Our clinic is conveniently located at 3500 Hillcrest Dr Suite 1, Waco, TX 76708.

column40:
I was at the point of losing hope when I made an appointment with Dr. Spjute concerning my longterm back pain issues. In fact, I had become very depressed and wasn't sure what to do.

Dr. Spjute was so kind and spent quite some time explaining things to me, and also told me about Spinal Ablation.  Now, the sound of it was something that might have put fear into me if I hadn't heard him out and also researched it.

It's been the best decision I've made for myself in many, many years. Dr. Spjute is both professional and kind and also possesses a great sense of humor. He treats his staff so well, and you can tell a lot about a person that way.

I feel like living again.  I think I have more issues to address where my health and spine are concerned,  and I guarantee that Dr. Spjute will be the doctor I will go to for help.

I cannot thank him and his staff enough for improving my life. I only regret not getting there sooner. Don't postpone your health or live in pain out of fear when there are answers and solutions that are life changing.  You're not too old and it's not too late to live a better life.

Thankyou so much to everyone at Advanced Pain Care!!|New patient everything was great. Explained everything very well and came up with a plan of care to address my issues. Staff very friendly and Great doctor.|3 points to follow:
1st:  Dr. Jake Huntzinger is Kind and Knowledgeable and Patient beyond his years. I have suffered with extreme pain for several years and was not sure about seeing ANOTHER Dr and asking for help...Again. This Doctor reviewed my treatment history with me...asked about my current concerns and came up with a treatment plan that included the most current/new interventions that may be helpful for Me; Also, HE discussed Educational materials that  Answered "The Why"  for THIS PART OF MY JOURNEY.  All of this was done in a relatively SHORT Amount of Time.

2nd: Heather his Assistant AND the Check in Staff: Amber and Ari were EQUALLY Professional, Effective, Patient and Kind.

Easy to make appointment. Dr Hynes is wonderful. Listens to all you say, asks questions, explains your issues and comes up with a plan for you to follow and hopefully heal and feel better.|A little back ground about me. I've had my back pain for  2 years and have been to 3 different  pain management doctors, until I found Dr. Hynes.

I had the MILD procedure on my L4 and L5 yesterday (12-3-24) and woke up this morning  with my stabbing pain gone. Im sore from the procedure but my pain of 2 years is gone.

This was a minimal invasion procedure with no down time to speak of, I strongly recommend this procedure in lieu of full blown surgery of the spine.

When, I meet Dr. Hynes I knew I found the right doctor. His professionalism and knowledge of this procedure is stellar. He explained it and made it so clear on how and what I should expect. His bed side manners are unremarkable and something I needed since, I have been to so many others .

Greater Austin Pain Center staff were so polite and courteous as well with professionalism. Made me feel like it was the right choice and it was the case for me.

Good luck to all on your journey to get pain relief. I strongly recommend at the very least a visit to Greater Austin Pain Center. I really belief you will find it here.|Amazing experience wouldn't go any where else. Dr Hynes is great! He pays attention and doesn't judge. And for that am great full thank you. Look forward continuing getting better. Thanks to him.|Dr. Hynes was very personable and professional. He had no problems answering any questions that I did have, but he pretty much covered the way his practice worked. Very positive .experience|Brittney was very interested in what I had to say. With a patient-centered approach, our board-certified pain specialists utilize advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment protocols to address the root causes of pain rather than merely masking symptoms. At Comprehensive Pain Management Center, we treat a wide spectrum of pain conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Our specialists are trained in the latest minimally invasive procedures such as epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and regenerative medicine therapies. We pride ourselves on staying at the forefront of pain management advancements to offer our patients the most effective solutions available.

Multiple Convenient Locations

With four strategically located facilities across the Dallas-Fort Worth metroplex, we make quality pain care accessible to patients throughout North Texas. Our McKinney location at 4833 Medical Center Dr #6E serves as one of our primary treatment centers, equipped with state-of-the-art diagnostic and therapeutic technology. Each of our facilities maintains the same high standards of care and compassionate approach that has established us as a leading pain management provider in the region.

Patient-Focused Care

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we take time to listen to our patients' concerns and develop comprehensive treatment strategies that address both the physical and emotional components of pain. Our goal is not just pain reduction but improving overall quality of life and helping patients return to their daily activities. To schedule a consultation at any of our locations, call us at (972) 316-3344 or visit our website at www.lewisvillepaincenter.com for more information about our services.

A graduate of the prestigious University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center in Dallas, Dr. Nieves brings exceptional medical expertise to patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. column40:
I have seen Dr Moore for a year. Yahaira is the first person you meet & is the start of this incredible staff & Dr Moore's help.  She is always pleasant, very kind, understanding, informative and unbelievably helpful.  You will most certainly meet Kim and Irma too & they only continue the great experience, help & ensuring you get the schedule for injections & appointments that work for your availability not just theirs.  They treat you as if you were a good friend.

Dr Moore has truly helped me with my incredible pain & burning to where I can live my normal life. Dr Moore, Chris & staff have helped prevent two major surgeries that would guarantee future pain & surgeries for me.  He and his staff actually listens to you, understands your pain & actually help you.|Dr. Moore is one amazing Pain Management Physician.  I have been seeing him for over 7 years and I have been through more than the average Joe but he is very passionate about his patients and takes the time to hear what you have to say and He will go the extra mile to truly help you so long as your honest and forthcoming.  It is very hard to find any doctors that consider you anything other than a number and Dr. Moore is a very compassionate, caring  and dedicated man.  If you are looking for true Quality Care and  one on one care then you most definitely need to check out Dr. Robert Alan Moore.  He treats you like you are family and that is basically non existent in this day and time.  I have had Fusions, nerve ablutions and far more than my share of Spinal Stimulators  and this man is still working as hard  today as he did the first time I ever saw him after my lumbar fusion.  If you have a tough case then take it to Dr. Moore and he will go above and beyond to try and make your life better|I have been seeing Dr. Moore and his staff for a while now. He keeps amazing staff and  I couldn't be more happy with how my quality of life has improved with his treatments. They understand there is no cookie cutter treatment for everyone and they work hard to find what's right for you. He performed an SI Joint fusion which has drastically reduced my back pain. I also have received a neurostimulator implant in my neck post surgery pain which cured my chronic headaches and prevented another major surgery. Very happy! Thanks Dr Moore!|Dr. Moore and Chris are fantastic. I've felt with numerous pain management docs for about 15 years. These professionals are the best ever. They listen to what you hope for. They have never forced anything on me as others have. I will continue with Dr Moore and his staff until I draw my last breath. They respect that I have numerous issues and a terminal illness also. They have without question or doubt helped with not only the joint pain but consider the pain associated with my disease. I shudder at what shape I'd be in without them.
Thank you all for such wonderful and compassionate care.
Cheryl Hahn|I've been a patient here for nearly a decade and been very pleased with their care.

The physicians and staff have been nothing but kind & caring. I have now received a total of 3 spinal cord inplants that have allowed me to live a full life without need of the pain medications I was having to take and living in a mental fog.

I highly recommend the physicians and their staff to anyone in need of quality pain management.|It all starts with the front staff. They are professional yet very friendly and fun spirited. When you are dealing with pain, this is what you want in your office staff since they are the first office staff that you see.

Dr. Moore was very attentive and did not rush me out of his office on to the next patient charge that is so often common. He recommended a treatment for me that was based upon a good analysis. He recommended cold laser therapy.

I was very skeptical of cold laser. I committed to six treatments. To my surprise, I saw improvement in my deep muscle pain after the first treatment. Each treatment was progressively better. It did not completely eliminate the pain, but it made it tolerable so that physical therapy could become an option. This is the approach that I am taking. In short, it put the fire out and now it is up to me to strengthen the injured area.

Finally, no addictive medications were recommended to me!

Give it a shot.|Everyone has been very, pleasant and helpful. It's nice to see a staff that enjoys where they work, you can tell by their smiles.
I have been many places looking for relief from foot neuropathy and also nerve pain in my shin from a bad knee replacement.
After prescribing a non- addictive drug to help that pain Dr Moore suggested trying a laser procedure.
After six sessions, I had approximately sixty percent improvement in my feet. I decided to try it on my shins and am halfway through the process and am feeling relief in my shins also.

I highly recommend Dr Moore and his staff, you will be respected and well treated.|Dr Moore is fantastic! I dealt with severe chronic pain for 5 years until I was referred to him. He assessed me and implemented solutions that reduced my pain by 70% making a life changing difference in my outlook. The staff is professional and friendly. Always a great experience! I will be a patient for life!!

column2: Jonathan Koning, MD: ReGen Pain Management
column3:
ReGen Pain Management serves Plano and Frisco, Texas with exceptional chronic pain solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Jonathan Koning. As a board-certified specialist through the American Board of Anesthesiology, Dr. Koning combines advanced medical training with compassionate care to address a comprehensive range of pain conditions. Our practice specializes in innovative interventional treatments that help patients regain function and improve quality of life without excessive reliance on medication.

At ReGen Pain Management, we offer cutting-edge treatments including platelet-rich plasma (PRP) injections, which harness the body's natural healing abilities to address chronic pain conditions. Our comprehensive approach targets numerous conditions including:

- Back and neck pain

- Joint pain and arthritis

- Persistent headaches and migraines

- Complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS)

- Peripheral neuropathy

- Sciatica and radicular pain

Personalized Treatment Approach

Dr. Koning develops individualized treatment plans that consider each patient's unique medical history, pain patterns, and lifestyle goals. Our interventional techniques focus on addressing the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms, allowing for more sustainable relief and improved function.

State-of-the-Art Facilities

Our modern clinic in Plano features advanced diagnostic and treatment equipment in a comfortable, patient-centered environment. Located at 6020 W Parker Rd, Suite 300, our facility is designed to provide a seamless care experience from consultation through treatment and follow-up.

Take the first step toward effective pain management by calling 469-252-4777 to schedule your consultation. Learn more about our services at [www.regenpainclinic.com](http://www.regenpainclinic.com/?utmsource=gmbauth).

column49:
The entire email for answers I found completely inefficient and unreliable. Communication there is next to impossible. If you need a refill on your meds on a Friday be prepared for the "Office Policy" "Office Protocol" speech with Zero exceptions. Then wait until Tuesday after hours in my case to get the prescription you needed the previous Friday. If you are hospitalized and therefore were unable or sick enough to let your available med date get away from you, you can forget getting your meds in time for YOUR individual health needs. This happened to me not once but TWICE.
I was also told by a staff member Dr Koning would contact my cardiologist to work out a more  reasonable weaning schedule for my case. I have Congenital Torsades de Pointes and Long QT syndrome and Stage 3 Chronic Kidney Disease. The weaning schedule which is designed for otherwise healthy patients should not have applied with my underlying health conditions. He Never had my cardiologist's  name right after emails.

column40:
I must say, when I really needed Dr. Warfield, he showed up.  I really appreciate his concern and support. Throughout my treatment he has consistently operated more like PCP Dr. than simply a pain management specialist. His bedside manner and the concern shown for my overall health has always been something that set him apart. The supportive office staff that surround him are second to none! Pain management can be a difficult scenario with many factors to navigate. Put your trust in a clinic who will guide you to a life free of pain, as well as, a freedom from dependency.
Texas Intergrative Pain Institute is the ONLY choice for genuine, complete care.
Ebonni Green-Owens|This was supposed to be a 5 star review. My first appointment with the Texas Integrative Pain Institute was the first week of February. It went really well. Dr Warfield and all of his staff were amazing...kind, compassionate, caring and so very sweet. Dr Warfield gave me hope and he said the office would call me to set up some procedures. I left that appointment so excited about finding an excellent Dr and possibly finding some relief from the chronic pain I've had since 2016.  About a week later, the office called to tell me that Dr Warfield was working on getting my pain prescription going, as he'd never prescribed it before so they had to set it up in their system. That was totally fine as I still had a few weeks of my meds left to get me by.  Since then, I have called them on Feb 28, Mar 18, Mar 25, Mar 30 and Apr 9, all with no one answering the phone or returning my messages or calls. I've not been able to actually speak with anyone there since they called me about my prescription in Feb.  I have no idea what's going on. The last couple of messages I've left, I told them that I was still waiting for my procedure(s) to be scheduled, rationing my painkillers and I really needed someone, anyone, to call me back. I am also waiting to have gallbladder surgery and I can't schedule it until TIPI advises if they would prescribe my post-op medications or if the surgeon could. They haven't once called me since Feb. I'm on long term disability and my case manager sent a records request in Feb and Mar and she did confirm that someone at TIPI sent my records back to her on Mar 25 but for some unknown reason, they refuse to call me back!  I'm really worried that my LTD will now be cut off as they were waiting for me to get treatments with TIPI before determining if I could stay on it or if they were going to cut me off. I have no idea what to do. I am unable to drive to his office to see if there is anyone there and my husband can't take time off right now to take me. We just moved here from Oregon and it's just him and I. I'm so extremely disappointed. My first (and only) appointment went so well, I don't understand what's happening. Tomorrow I'll be forced to find a new pain Doctor in Houston, which I really don't want to do but I'm almost out of my meds and need treatment and I have no other choice at this point. I hope no one else has to go through this incredibly disappointing experience.|Very informative doctor. Listens to your concerns.  staff are excellent as well.|Very clean and great staff, doctor is very knowledgeable and makes sure you understand your treatment.|One of the best doctors in Houston they actually care about there patients|Great doctor and staff, show understanding and care for patients.|Love it here and wont coming. Love my dr.warfield|Doctor definitely knows his stuff and actually cares about his patients.

column40:
Dr. Tariq saved my life! I had been to dozens of doctors over the last 47 years for pain in my face (trigeminal neuralgia) to no avail. I became suicidal because I just couldn't endure it any longer, but thoughts of my grandchildren gave me the grace to hold on. I am so grateful that I did! Roughly nine months later I am 99% PAIN FREE! I cannot thank you enough Dr. Tariq!
With Gratitude,
Brenda Kinney|Dr Tariq and Dr Aleem are fantastic. They both take the time to listen and give a thorough explanation of what to expect with your treatment. They are extremely professional and have made me feel comfortable trusting them and their pain mgmt plan for me. They truly take the time to look into all aspects of your health when determining your needs. The staff is amazing as well.  I would recommend them to anyone needing help with pain mgmt. They don't just throw pills at the problem. They truly seek to find a solution for your pain.|Dr Tariq and staff are fantastic. They care about the patient's overall well-being and answer any questions. I definitely recommend. Have been seeing Dr. Tariq for several years and get the best medical treatment and care.|Dr. Tariq & Dr. Aleem are two of the best pain management doctors I've had the pleasure of knowing. Their professional care demonstrates a productive means of achieving a good quality of life. They use all means to mitigate whatever you may be going through. I highly recommend their care.|If you're suffering with chronic pain you should visit Comprehensive Pain Management Center. I have been a patient of Dr. Tariq's for a few years, but I discovered very early that he was a doctor that I could truly trust. His staff is not only extremely skilled, they are kind and they really care about your well being. I could go on and on about how awesome Comprehensive Pain Management Center is, but if you're reading this review you should go see for yourself.

Thank you Comprehensive Pain Management Center for all the care you have given me!|Dr. Tariq is an excellent pain specialist who cares about the well-being of his patients. His office staff are also very professional and accommodating. Great service and wonderful practitioner.|Front office staff May is absolutely wonderful!!! Dr. Tariq is nice. The new Dr Aleem is amazing! Took his time listened to my concerns.|5/11/23 - Edit made for clarification:
To be clear, I am referring to a more recent situation. I just mentioned 2015 was the initial appointment. This last appointment situation occurred in the last year during the recent office changes...

My daughter was so disgusted with this place that she did not want to take the time to write a review, so I am writing one on her behalf.  She is an Air Force veteran who was initially a patient at this clinic in 2015.  In the last year, she needed to schedule an appointment to have her device replaced and these people gave her the runaround, not to mention, they were rude.  Every person she dealt with (office staff) was rude, obnoxious and uncaring.  It's sad that they treat people this way, especially veterans who have already been through so much.  This place should be shut down permanently.  I watched my daughter go through so much agitation while she dealt with these people. I told her she should definitely find a new doctor and she did.  In my opinion, this place is hot stinking trash and they do not deserve to have any patients under their care.  Hopefully, someone will see fit to shut them down.

OmniSpine Pain Management serves the Frisco, Texas area with comprehensive chronic pain solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. Our specialized clinic combines advanced interventional techniques with personalized care to address a wide spectrum of pain conditions. With a focus on minimally invasive procedures and evidence-based treatments, our team of pain management specialists works diligently to improve quality of life for those suffering from persistent pain.

At OmniSpine Pain Management, we offer a diverse range of treatment options including:

  • Botox injections for chronic neck pain and muscle spasms

  • SphenoCath Migraine Headache Block for migraine relief

  • Nerve block injections for knee arthritis, joint pain, and headaches

  • Steroid injections for inflammation reduction

  • Opioid medication management with careful monitoring

  • Viscosupplementation injections for joint lubrication

  • Radiofrequency nerve ablation for longer-lasting pain relief

  • Specialized treatment for chronic spine conditions

Our Patient-Centered Approach

We believe that effective pain management requires personalized attention and care. Our specialists take the time to understand each patient's condition, medical history, and treatment goals before developing a customized treatment plan. This individualized approach allows us to deliver better outcomes and improve our patients' quality of life.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists, please contact us at +1 214-705-1200. Our clinic is conveniently located at 8380 Warren Pkwy #100, Frisco, TX 75034. For more information about our services, visit our website at https://omnipainrelief.com/.

column3:
Tricity Pain Associates in New Braunfels, Texas offers comprehensive pain management solutions for residents throughout Comal County and surrounding areas. Established with a mission to provide personalized care, our New Braunfels Generations Drive Clinic combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate service to help patients regain control of their lives. Our board-certified physicians specialize in treating chronic pain conditions through minimally invasive procedures, medication management, and innovative therapies tailored to each patient's unique needs.

At our state-of-the-art facility located at 717 Generations Dr Suite B, New Braunfels, TX 78130, we address a wide spectrum of pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathy, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our multidisciplinary approach incorporates interventional procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and comprehensive treatment plans designed to target the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes Tricity Pain Associates is our unwavering commitment to patient education and involvement in the treatment process. We believe informed patients achieve better outcomes, which is why we take the time to thoroughly explain conditions, treatment options, and expected results. Our friendly staff ensures a comfortable experience from the initial consultation through ongoing care management.

Advanced Treatment Options

Our New Braunfels clinic offers cutting-edge treatments including epidural steroid injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, joint injections, and regenerative medicine therapies. These evidence-based interventions are performed with precision using fluoroscopic guidance when appropriate to maximize effectiveness while minimizing discomfort.

If you're struggling with chronic pain, contact Tricity Pain Associates today at +1 844-789-7246 to schedule a consultation. Additional information about our services and approach to pain management can be found on our website at https://tricitypainassociates.com/. Our New Braunfels team is dedicated to helping you achieve lasting pain relief and improved quality of life.

Texas Pain Institute serves Keller, Texas and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of pain specialists provides personalized care for patients suffering from both acute and chronic pain conditions. With a patient-centered approach, we combine innovative treatments with compassionate care to help restore quality of life and improve daily functioning for those affected by persistent pain.

At Texas Pain Institute, we offer thorough evaluations and evidence-based treatments for a wide spectrum of painful conditions. Our specialists are trained in addressing complex pain issues including but not limited to back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, post-surgical pain, and pain related to injuries or medical conditions. We understand that each patient's pain experience is unique, which is why we develop customized treatment plans tailored to individual needs.

Our Commitment to Quality Care

We believe in a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that may include interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications. Our goal is to not just mask symptoms but to address the underlying causes of pain whenever possible, helping our patients regain control of their lives and return to activities they enjoy.

Visit Our Practice

Located at 651 S Main St, Suite 105, Keller, TX 76248, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. We welcome new patients and referrals from healthcare providers throughout the Dallas-Fort Worth metroplex. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (817) 348-8600 or visit our website at https://txpain.us/.

At Texas Pain Institute, we're dedicated to one simple mission: helping our patients get back to living a quality life free from the limitations of chronic pain.

column38: Andrew Emery|Donna Lancaster|Destiney Lehew|Kathy Rial|Ckjake58|mike king|Tricia Douglas|Crissey C
column40:
The front office is a particularly special mix of unwilling to help, disinterested, unfriendly and seemingly uninterested in helping anyone but themselves do less work.  Every single interaction has been a headache.  The only reason for the two positive stars is that the providers are helpful, caring and work to find sustainable solutions for patients.|The dr is AWESOME... but his front office staff are very discourteous!!! I had called the office to verify our appointment times because my husband and I were both going and I wanted to make sure that I didn't have it wrong. The person on the phone told me that our appointments were at 11:30. I even asked about my husband as well and they said yes. We drove an hour and a half to the doctor and arrived at our appointments by 11:27 and when we walked through the door; the dark haired staff member looked up and simply said, "Name?"... no greeting or anything!   I said our names and she rudely said, his appt was at 11:15 ... I immediately said, " I called and verified that they were both at 11:30 because I was confused about the times..."... Her response was," That must've been the main office..." And I said, so you won't see him?" and she rudely said, "No!"
First of all, who cares if it was the main office or not!   I called!  there should've been some kind of polite response from her. Such as, "I am so sorry that that happened, but we can't see him today." I would've been upset, but not as upset as I was with her rudeness and condescending attitude towards me!" So, I asked her why when we weren't even 15 minutes late and it wasn't my fault they confirmed it wrong!  She just stood up and walked away.  So I leaned in and asked the other lady are you guys gonna see him today and she rudely looked at me and said, " I'm with a patient" ... I apologized and stepped back.  I wasn't sure what was happening since the other lady had just walked away.
About 3 minutes later the dark haired lady came back to the window and just blurted out, "Driver's license and insurance card!"... so I looked at her and I said, "are you gonna see my husband today?" and she bluntly and with a rude smirk said, "No!"  So, I said. "I'm not seeing the Dr if my husband can't!"  We left.
We will be getting a new pain dr!  When you're in the kind of pain that we are in you expect to have some kind of courteous, caring staff, and it's really frustrating to be treated like that!
It's also sad because we really loved the doctor!|The scheduling/front deck staff that work at the keler location are the worst. From the time you walk in they are rude, can't make eye contact and overall just seem like they hate their lives. The only thing that keeps me coming back is my actual doctor. I've already tried to be seen at another location but can't due to my insurance.|Due to the extreme adverse reactions to chemo and radiation, my body has been put through the ringer and I have had 110 surgeries or procedures since 2008. Thank goodness this Dr.'s office doesn't treat me like a drug seeker, as I am not, I am just in constant pain due to the erosion of the bones and all the scar tissue I have all over my body.  They show and give excellent care and empathy!|My first appointment was great. Dr. Bahtla is awesome.  We agreed to start injections with anesthesia. Two days later I decided I didn't want the anesthesia.  I called the office to cancel that part of the procedure. I was assured my procedure date remained the same otherwise and was told the facility would call with a time to arrive. When that didn't happen I called them and was informed my appt. Was canceled. I did not cancel the procedure. I've been trying to call for a week (for another reason) and can not get anyone to answer. I left Messages, including to office mgr, to no avail. I've waited at least 3 weeks for this procedure and now this. Complete incompetence|Worst experience ever. They told me my urinalysis showed a high amount of heroin in my system. I have never done illegal drugs in my life. They refused to show me the results and cut me off my meds immediately. I went through withdrawals for a while. This all happened after I canceled a procedure they wanted me to have. I spoke with my surgeon and he said that procedure would not help me at all. Now I am blacklisted from ever getting pain meds again, I have osteoarthritis and multiple spinal surgeries. These people are terrible. I went for a hair follicle drug test through Quest Diagnostics the week after and it came back clean.|We would gladly give 5 stars for all the staff except the gal who greeted us.  We left the house 1 hr before our appointment, got stuck in traffic, but made it 12 mins before our 10AM scheduled time.  Our greeting was "I was just fixing to cancel you for being late".  I said "We made it thru traffic and are only 3 mins late" (for the last minute 9:45 change).  She snared back "you are 6 mins late".  I was on the verge of tears and offered to leave, but was told she would 'try to fit me in'.
The waiting room was empty, we were called back to the exam room immediately and waited nearly 30 minutes.  For someone working with patients in pain, she is not very welcoming, caring, or compassionate.  She is the only one who made our visit less than a 5 star experience.|Neerav J. Bhatla, MD is amazing! Very very intelligent and great bedside manner. He is treating my condition with the upmost care. Thankful is not even enough to describe how appreciative I am to have found Dr. Neerav J. Bhatla, MD
My pain was excruciating, I didn't know what to do. Now I have peace of mind, pain under control and able to heal fully
I want to THANK THIS OFFICE! For getting me in so soon and compassion towards the urgency to be seen! Thank you all! Highly recommended

column2: North Texas Comprehensive Spine & Pain Center
column3:
North Texas Comprehensive Spine & Pain Center serves Rowlett, TX and surrounding North Texas communities with specialized pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians combines extensive experience with compassionate care to address various chronic pain conditions. We understand how debilitating persistent pain can be, which is why we develop personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs and circumstances.

At North Texas Comprehensive Spine & Pain Center, we offer a broad spectrum of pain management options for chronic pain, including minimally invasive injections, procedures and medication management. Our approach focuses on identifying the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms, allowing for more effective long-term relief. We specialize in treating back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, and complex regional pain syndromes.

Our Integrative Approach

We utilize physical therapy and counseling with a goal of minimizing the use of opioid medication. This multidisciplinary strategy helps patients regain functionality while reducing dependency on prescription medications. Our team works closely with physical therapists, psychologists, and other specialists to ensure comprehensive care that addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 7700 Lakeview Pkwy Suite 100B in Rowlett, TX, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. We prioritize patient comfort and safety in all our procedures, from epidural steroid injections to radiofrequency ablation and spinal cord stimulation trials.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at (469) 653-0222. You can also visit our website at www.ntxspineandpain.com for additional information about our treatments and patient resources.

Dr. Vattam is an amazing and understanding doctor. He went through her records and although she takes a lot of medicines in order to function daily Dr. Vattam agreed she was responsible with her meds and treated her well.
Unfortunately, he then turned her over to the Nurse Practioner whi from day one with my wife had an attitude like every person coming through the door is drug seeking. She cut her pain meds back from 3 to 2 7.5 mg hydrocodone which did nothing for her pain. Her plan was to cut them out again because my wife also takes xanax. She's taken both for years. She doesn't mistake them. She's very aware of what could happen if taken together or close together. This woman thinks she's God and plays with peoples lives and pain by taking the meds away when she wants not because it's a necessity. They push procedures down the patients throats. There's a reason Europe refuses to do all this injections. They DONT help 99% of the patients. My wife has 13 diagnoses all that cause brutal pain at times and this nurse practioner released her. Gave her one refill and out the door she went. Its been a month and half. She's now on a walker or wheelchair thanks to no help from them. No pain medication and no hopes. Please don't waste your time if you should need pain meds as they will give you minimal and want to constantly do injections that don't help. My wife has since seen a spine surgeon who said she should've been sent to a surgeon years ago.|Punctual with timing. Always clean and Amber is very polite and always sweet. column2: Pain and Spine Physicians | Chronic Pain | Southlake
column3:
Pain and Spine Physicians serves Southlake, Texas with specialized care for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our board-certified physicians combine advanced interventional techniques with comprehensive treatment plans to address pain at its source. We understand that chronic pain affects not just your physical wellbeing but your entire quality of life, which is why we take a multidisciplinary approach to pain management.

We provide world class pain management care with compassion for those who suffer from pain. Our team is singularly focused on using any necessary methodology in our repertoire to decrease pain and improve our patients' physical and emotional status to its fullest. Whether you're dealing with back pain, joint issues, neuropathy, or complex regional pain syndrome, our specialists develop personalized treatment plans tailored to your specific needs.

Our Approach to Pain Relief

Your specific pain may come from any number of causes, and it is our life's work to not only find these causes, but then also to treat them with our interventional procedures, comprehensive care, and behavioral health programs. We combine cutting-edge diagnostic tools with evidence-based treatments to provide lasting relief rather than just masking symptoms.

column11: We provide world class pain management care with compassion for those who suffer from pain. We're singularly focused on using any necessary methodology in our repertoire to decrease pain and improve our patient's physical and emotional status to its fullest. Your specific pain may come from any number of causes, and it is our life's work to not only find these causes, but then also to treat them with our interventional procedures, comprehensive care, and behavioral health programs.
