column40:
My mum has been a patient of Dr Ali for over two years now. Dr Ali and has staff are very helpful and caring. They are always open to having conversations with patients about any questions and concerns they may have.|We had the worst time getting the office to help even setting up the appointment. Not great service when we finally talked with a person. Lots of waiting and holding. We never had a problem with insurance until this office.|Where do I begin? They are almost impossible to get a hold of to talk to a person, the nurses are rude, and the billing is a complete nightmare. 7 months later, I am STILL going back and forth with them for over charging and not getting a refund back. I would not recommend to anyone to even consider going here. There are pleny of pain drs in the DFW area.... try one of those!|This was my first experience with pain management. The staff and doctor were very professional and informative. The process was straight forward. I am scheduled for additional procedures. The first procedure has elevated a substantial amount of my pain.|Everyone is great at Dr Ali's office, friendly and supportive. Dr Ali has helped tremendously with helping me to manage my pain.|I had appt to schedule pain injections. I talked to PA and they had an opening with Dr Ali for next day. I have seen Dr Ali before for lower back pain.  It was quick and I was pleased with the pain injections. Thank you Dr Ali.|Wonderful and professional care per usual!
Dr Ali's staff has been consistently kind, courteous, & efficient for the past 4 years of my care. Dr Ali's exquisite integrity, expertise,  competency, professionalism, & dedication to his patients remain unparalleled. I recommend Dr. Ali without question to family, friends, & colleagues.|I have been very impressed with Dr. Ali and his staff.  Dr. Ali is very caring and a good listener.  He has been extremely patient with all my questions.  I have felt valued as a patient and not just a number.  Also, his staff has been very helpful when I have called the office with questions.  They are very responsive and call back, if they say they will.  In my opinion, the attitude in his office reflects good leadership.  I have been pleased with the results of my procedures and was informed what to expect beforehand.  Initially, I had two rounds of 6 shots (3 on each side) in my lower back that he was certain would not be effective (in my situation) long term.  The shots were a 1st step required by insurance before having an ablation.   (The first 2 or 3 days after the shots were great, but it didn't last.)  I had the shots without anesthesia, and it wasn't bad.  I liken it to getting a shot in your mouth by a dentist.  There's an initial discomfort but then everything goes numb.  You might feel a little prick during the quick procedure, but I was glad I didn't have anesthesia.  Next came the ablation on both sides of my lumbar spine.  For those two procedures I did have anesthesia.  I was chicken to have an ablation without it and was told it was a good decision.  The anesthesia wore off very quickly following the procedure, but you have to fast 8 hours before so one must forego morning coffee! I was totally fine the rest of the day.  Overall, I would say my back pain is 75% better and I only take a muscle relaxer occasionally if I need to.  Life is much better!  I'm very thankful for this relief because my lower back is not bad enough to warrant surgery at the present time.  From my experiences, I highly recommend Dr. Ali for his pain management expertise!  Angie Carl

column2: Modern Pain Management - Sugar Land, TX
column3:
Modern Pain Management - Sugar Land, TX delivers comprehensive interventional pain management solutions to patients throughout the greater Houston area. Our dedicated team of board-certified specialists combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address both acute and chronic pain conditions. We believe in creating personalized treatment plans that target the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

At Modern Pain Management, we utilize state-of-the-art diagnostic tools and innovative treatment modalities to provide relief for patients suffering from various pain conditions. Our interventional approach includes minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and holistic pain relief strategies tailored to each individual's needs.

Conditions We Treat

Our practice specializes in treating a wide spectrum of pain disorders including but not limited to back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, sports injuries, work-related injuries, and post-surgical pain. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we're committed to restoring your quality of life through effective pain management.

Our Sugar Land Location

Conveniently located at 12930 Dairy Ashford Rd #501-504, Sugar Land, TX 77478, our modern facility is equipped with the latest technology to ensure accurate diagnosis and effective treatment. We proudly serve patients from Sugar Land and surrounding communities in a comfortable, welcoming environment.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please call us at +1 713-360-1574 or visit our website at www.modernpainhouston.com. Our friendly staff is ready to assist you on your journey toward a pain-free life.

column40:
Dr Atallah is very thorough, knowledgeable, skilled, kind and caring. He spends plenty of time with you and answers any questions explaining well. Definitely wants to relieve your pain! He will do what's necessary to relieve pain too! You are included in decisions and choices as to what has worked for you and what's best medically for you. He looks at all surgeries and injuries causing ongoing pain. I loved when I asked about the nerve pain I have due to surgeries, chemo, neuropathy and such. He told me I've had a lot of nerves affected with the many surgeries, injuries and chemo I've had then said - but we can make it better. Increased nerve pain I've been taking for several years. Took care of the intense pain with an injection on Christmas Eve that got me through two back to back services that were my responsibility in the things I needed to do. Could
not have endured without the injections for pain. Thankful beyond words for that. Then had another minor surgical procedure December 31st on lumbar spine after he'd asked which was worse lumbar or cervical spine pain. Lumbar first then and deal with cervical spine after that. The lumbar minor surgery December 31 made the 11 day cruise he knew I was taking in January much much better with more pain relief than it definitely would have been. He is dedicated to helping and I cannot say enough about his caring and understanding people who have severe pain. His staff is excellent as well. Professional and caring. You are definitely an individual person and not a number to him at Modern Pain Management. Thank you Dr Atallah!|Dr. Hooda is an exceptional doctor. She has done a great job with my injections. She really cares about her patients. I'm so grateful to have her as my doctor.

Dr. Hooda's medical assistant, Brend M. is always so positive, has a great attitude, and is on top of her job.

I highly recommend Dr.Hooda and her team.

Sincerely,
Coyan Smith|Dr. Harandi is an awesome doctor. One who treats his patients with the care and compassion that is sometimes absent with successful doctors. I was lucky to find him. Always is eager to work out a treatment plan that is best for you.|Dr G. Atallah is a fantastic physician! I statred treatment in Los Angeles for severe back pain ad in a month the procedure failed to take. Dr. Atallah reviewed my MRI from LA as well as my records, we spoke, and he created a focused treatment plan. 3 months later, I am still going strong with a 80-95% reduction in overall pain. Yes, the next day after doing yard work sucks but medication gets me through easily and I am back to my new normal in a day or two.  In top of that is the only physician I've met that can actually operate his own computer system, scheduling, everything. He knows his business inside and out, his staff is beyond amazing and the perfect extension of the doctor. Each are knowledgeable, competent and friendly.This office is the gold standard all private practices should be held to and learn from.|I am extremely satisfied with Doctor Attalah and his staff. They are extremely attentive to my needs and help to properly manage my pain while I wait for my 5th procedure/surgery. I would recommend Dr Atallah to anyone who respects professionalism and understanding in a world that shuns those who are in constant pain.|I would not recommend this clinic to anyone.  While I have never met the doctors, the office team that they employ are horrible!!!  They don't answer the phone, nor do they return calls timely.  I have called on previous occasions several times to set up an appointment.  Each time, it was someone's voicemail by the name of Alexis.  She doesn't return calls timely as her voicemail states.  So my doctors office reached out to them to set up an appointment that should have already been done, now Alexis gives me a call back and seems very unprofessional on the call as she sets up my appointment, as well as rushing the call. So I called their office to let them know that I needed to reschedule, due to the fact that everyone in my home is sick with the flu, and I may have it as well.   Let's just say that I never had a chance to tell them that, because the unprofessional young lady left me on hold, and never came back to the line.  Nor did anyone answer the phone after I continued to call back over several times!!!  I will say this, no physician that I has ever cared for me, nor his team has ever displayed such incompetence as these people!!!  Nor any referrals!!!  This is absolutely sad in the Healthcare system!!  Now this leads me to question the integrity of my NP that referred me to this so called office!!!  I'll be giving her a call ASAP!!  I don't appreciate the lack of transparency and foolishness when it comes to my health and well-being.  So again, I don't recommend this clinic, and I advise you to seek a clinic that has real doctors and a medical team that actually cares about the patients.  Also, real receptionist that truly knows their job!!!|I visited this office about 6 months ago. The doctor was nice but office staff not friendly. I wanted to see the doctor again. My insurance changed so I gave my new insurance information to the person that made the appointment. She indicated that the doctor was in the network and accepted my insurance. Wasn't told about needing urine sample nor completing the forms which could have been emailed to me to save time in the facility. After over one hour then I was told about my copay higher after checking with the insurance company.
I asked to talk to the doctor. Both the front office staff which was unfriendly and the office manager didn't allow me to talk to the doctor saying that I had to stay all day in order to talk to him. They need to change the office staff including the manager to make it more patient friendly. They have this hazed glass window that you can't see the office staff. You have to keep knocking on the window to get their attention. What a shame. I left called the office and the office manager was even more rude and unfriendly. She indicated that it tskes long time to check with the insurance at the time to make the appointment like my time is less valuable. Stay away unless they change the office staff and manager.|I have suffered from lower back pain radiating down my leg for months. After an eval and injection from Dr.Atallah I have no pain. His entire staff is professional and nice. Shoutout to Nurse Rosemary and Edwin, CRNA for their expert care as well.

Republic Pain Specialists in Bryan, Texas offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Brazos Valley region. Established with a mission to provide accessible care, this specialized clinic focuses on treating various chronic pain conditions using evidence-based approaches. Their team of board-certified physicians and medical professionals work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient, combining interventional procedures, medication management, and rehabilitative therapies to achieve optimal pain relief and improved quality of life.

At Republic Pain Specialists, patients benefit from a multidisciplinary approach to pain management. The clinic specializes in treating conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Their interventional procedures include epidural steroid injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and joint injections. What sets them apart is their commitment to developing individualized treatment plans that may combine multiple modalities to effectively manage pain while minimizing medication dependence.

Patient-Centered Care

Understanding that chronic pain affects every aspect of a patient's life, Republic Pain Specialists prioritizes compassionate, patient-centered care. No referral is needed to schedule an appointment, removing barriers to accessing specialized pain management services. The clinic accepts most insurance plans, including Medicare, Medicaid, and commercial insurance, making quality pain care accessible to more patients. Their administrative team assists with insurance verification and authorization processes to ensure a smooth experience.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 3201 University Drive East, Suite 370 in Bryan, TX, Republic Pain Specialists operates from a modern, comfortable facility equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technology. The clinic environment is designed to provide a calming atmosphere for patients dealing with chronic pain conditions. Their central location makes them easily accessible to residents throughout Bryan, College Station, and surrounding communities.

Contact Information

If you're suffering from chronic pain, Republic Pain Specialists offers treatment options that can help improve your quality of life. To schedule a consultation, call +1 979-703-1426 or visit their website at www.republicpainsp.com. Their office is conveniently located at 3201 University Dr E, Suite 370, Bryan, TX 77802.

column40:
Dr. Gaskin and his team are amazing. Experienced alot of issues post covid and wish I would have found them sooner. Came from out of town for the sgb injections and have been the best thing I've ever done for my health and totally worth the money spent.|After losing my sense of smell and taste for three years due to COVID, I tried a ganglion block in New Jersey last year, but it didn't work for me. Then, I traveled to Texas to receive treatment at David Gaskin's clinic, and I was absolutely amazed by the results. In just 20 minutes, I regained about 60% of my taste and 20% of my smell. The improvement was incredible, and I'm beyond thrilled with the outcome. David Gaskin and his team were incredibly professional and welcoming. I highly recommend them --it's truly worth the visit! Now a month later, results are still the same, I am thrilled! May even go back for another visit!|I flew in from Canada to get treatment for Parosmia and I am so happy I did!!! Anyone who has done research on Parosmia knows this is the spot to get cured. They have an 85-90% success rate and have treated over 3500 people with Parosmia from as far as South Africa! The staff are lovely and super friendly. David takes the time to discuss everything with you, you aren't rushed at all and it's very clear he cares about his patients. At this time each shot is $500 USD. You have one shot scheduled in the morning and then you go try eat and smell all the things that you haven't been able to eat for months/years. If it's not 100% better you can go back for the second shot. I was about 75% improved after the first and 95% after the second. I am so happy I came. The money is so worth it to get your life back.|Highly recommend David Gaskin and his team for SGB/Parosmia treatment. David truly cares about the patient and it shows tremendously when you talk to him. He takes time to explain everything, educate, answer questions, and give expectations. (Crystal was fantastic too!). I love that he is big on educating others, doing peer studies, consulting with other medical teams and researching constantly. David gives detailed instructions on things to do at home to help overall wellbeing/health in conjunction to his in office treatment. We live in a world that is filled with doctors that are quick to simply write a prescription and send you on your way, and its staggering. So to have someone take your issues seriously and get to the root cause of the problem, while showing concern and wanting to help you improve really says something. I saw David for bilateral SGB to treat Parosmia from Covid nearly 3 years ago. I had both sides treated about a week apart. 2nd injection was definitely my dominant side, as I had a significant amount of resolution quickly after this side was done (30 minutes after). I could smell the freshly cut grass as left the office; peanut butter, coffee and Oreos taste as they should! Now I'm adjusting to the new and old smells/tastes that I've lived without for so long. I'm not sure what percentage I have back but it's high and makes life better for so many reasons. If you're on the fence, go for it! You won't regret it.|I came from Canada to the clinic for treatment for parosmia. David and his staff are the best and take the time to really explain the condition and treatment.  Everything about the experience was positive and I have a good outlook now for my condition. I highly recommend them.|I went in to talk about finding help for my neuropathy of my feet. As you can see in other posts that all they want to sell is a nerve block. Mr. Gaskin took offense to me questioning the effectiveness of this treatment for neuropathy of the feet. He cussed numerous times during some of our conversation ( using the F word during a consultation is not professional at all ) . All they want to do is give you a shot  ( may work for some, but very little to no research on neuropathy ) . No shot in the neck for me at five hundred a pop.|Dr Gaskin took the time to explain everything and has the best bedside manner of any doctor I've been to, and I've been to a lot! After suffering from autoimmune symptoms and parosmia for 3 years, I've finally found some relief. Great experience!|Dr. Dunlap is wonderful, he helped me with my pain issues, he made me feel very important, he looked me in the eye and explained everything he was going to do to help with my pain problems.
The nurses were also wonderful, Jessica was with me and caught me just before I fell, JR was very friendly and helpful. The lady at the front desk was super helpful and was very friendly, the other two ladies at the front were also very friendly and all three smiled a lot and I love that so much. They made feel at home and so comfortable. I thank everyone at Dr. Dunlaps office you are all Awesome!!!

column2: North Texas Center for Pain Management
column3:
North Texas Center for Pain Management serves Plano, TX and the surrounding North Texas region with specialized pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of board-certified physicians and pain specialists is committed to providing personalized care that addresses the root causes of chronic pain. Since our founding, we have helped thousands of patients reclaim their lives through innovative treatment approaches that combine evidence-based medical interventions with holistic wellness strategies.

At North Texas Center for Pain Management, we offer a wide range of treatments designed to address various pain conditions. Our multidisciplinary approach includes interventional procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and advanced diagnostic techniques. We specialize in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe that effective pain management goes beyond simply masking symptoms. Our philosophy centers on helping patients not only find relief but also improve their overall functionality and quality of life. Each treatment plan is customized to the individual's specific needs, medical history, and lifestyle goals. Our compassionate staff ensures that patients feel heard, respected, and actively involved in their care decisions.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 3108 Midway Rd STE 206 in Plano, TX, our modern clinic is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technology. The comfortable environment is designed to put patients at ease during their visits, whether they're coming in for an initial consultation or a follow-up procedure.

Contact Information

To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please call us at +1 972-612-3800. You can also visit our comprehensive website at northtexascenterforpainmanagement.com for detailed information about our treatments, physician profiles, and patient resources.

At North Texas Center for Pain Management, we're dedicated to our mission: helping patients experience comprehensive pain treatment while empowering them to feel their best and function at an optimal level. We welcome new patients and accept most major insurance plans.
column11: We want our patients to experience comprehensive pain treatment in North Texas, but more than that, we want them to feel their best and function at an optimal level.

column40:
I have seen Dr. Gajraj for years. The doctor and office staff used to be amazing, but now they seem like they don't care & you're just another number. When there are issues, like a pharmacy not receiving a prescription, it is extremely time consuming and frustrating to get things fixed. You can call and leave messages & if you are lucky, just maybe that office will call you back, maybe. The doctor used to talk to you and listen to what is going on in your life and sometimes even make good connections to how things could be connected, but now it seems like they just don't have time for you & in my opinion, in talking to the office staff, it feels like they couldn't care less.

Of all the doctors I've seen over the years, this is the only one that consistently seems to have issues with their electronic prescription system. It's about 50/50 if the pharmacy will receive the new prescription & if there is some issue, forget about it, because they only submit scripts at the end of the day & even if there are issues, don't expect them to actually call the pharmacy and confirm receipt.  When things get messed up, don't expect any help, empathy or concern, but if you leave a message out of frustration and in pain, DO EXPECT to get a call and to be read the riot act & threatened by the withholding of medical care by the office manager, not the doctor. This place used to be a good place for healing, but something has drastically changed & now it's more like visiting the DMV than a care provider.|Dr Garjaj is an egoistic who is more interested in quantity and not quality. He is extremely unprofessional and yells at his patients. And don't be surprised if you get a bill long after seeing him for treatment you never received. The practice is chaotic and confusing and when you arrive for treatment you must pay or not be seen no matter your condition and pain. The dollar is the only motivation for this practice. Please don't trust him.|Dr. Gajraj has been able to pinpoint my source of pain and it is under control at this point. I also have had several appointments with his PA, Sarah Levy, and she has also been very helpful. She listens well and makes very good suggestions. She is obviously very sensitive to patient problems. With all this I can highly recommend the North Texas Center for Pain Management.|I love Dr. Gajraj and his staff! I am coming off an ACL tear in my right knee and they have taken such good care of me. I absolutely adore his 2 nurse practitioners (whom I meet with each time I go) and they are the sweetest, most caring people I've ever met. Always offering suggestions, asking about my newborn son (he's 1), and always making me feel warm and welcome. I've never been happier!|I drive a long distance to see Dr. Gajraj and his office has always been very accommodating.  I suffer from chronic pain due to Systemic Lupus.  After 2 long years of dealing with many awful doctors, I was referred to Dr. Gajraj from another physician.  I've been seeing him well over a year and my quality of life has improved dramatically. I've found that many pain docs take advantage of the patients needy position with degrading behavior that one's expected to just tolerate. This physician is always very respectful, professional and extremely knowledgeable.  I've never felt uncomfortable or judged. If there is one thing I know it's Doctors...this one is a great one!|I can't say enough great things about Dr. Gajraj! I had terrible pain in one of my back muscles for weeks. I tried everything to make it better and it just kept getting worse until a friend recommended Dr. Gajraj. I didn't know pain management doctors even existed! Dr. Gajraj got me in the very next morning and was so kind and knew exactly what I needed. He even called the next day to check on my progress. He fit me in every 3 days for 10 days and I'm so happy he got me back to normal. If you have pain go see Dr. Gajraj!! You'll be so happy you did!|I'm a newer patient of Dr. Gajraj but have been dealing with chronic pain for over a decade.  I have been to many doctors and have experienced many procedures and surgeries, so I feel like I have a good idea of different doctor offices, what works and what doesn't.  I'm so glad to have found Dr. Gajraj.  He is so knowledgable about pain and what things can be done for your pain.  He takes the time to listen and isn't trying to rush you along which is very important to me.  We have tried some new things for my pain and he has some other ideas to try. I am very hopeful that in the near future, my pain will be in a holding state instead of constantly increasing.  His office staff is very nice and personable and helpful.  I also trust that Dr. Gajraj is recommending procedures that he feels confident that could work and not just because he wants to have monetary gain.  He has been very truthful with me, and I appreciate that more than my words can express.|I've been a patient of Dr. Noor Gajraj at the North Texas Center for Pain Management for approximately 3 years, and cannot be more pleased with my treatment and the progress I've made since I've been under his care. Not only are Dr. Gajraj's medical credentials impeccable, but so are his bed side manners.  He is truly caring, attentive and compassionate. He goes out of his way to create a plan of action that is within reach physically and financially, especially important to me as I have no health insurance. His office is conveniently located on the first floor of a free standing building to you don't have to mess with hospital or garage parking. Further, "prompt" is his middle name-he is always on time!   I would highly recommend Dr. Gajraj, and his fantastic front office staff to anyone in need of the range of services offered by North Texas Center for Pain Management.

column40:
Dr. Zidan, the NP, and especially Mrs. Laws, the receptionist in the NRH office are great! Something is definitely off in the axillary help department. They want to be able to conduct themselves any way they choose, but you'd better not complain. They can be as slow as they want, or hours late. If you do it, you will be charged. An office visit can start over an hour late your choice is to take it or leave it. A 30min visit can extend well beyond 2 hrs. You're exorcist to wait with NO update. My mother loves her Dr. Zidan, her NP, and Mrs. Laws. They are the only reason we still come. She won't change doctors.|Do not use this doctor's office. They harassed me repeatedly to show up 30-45 minutes early and then made me wait almost 2 hours (no exaggeration) to see the doctor. This is a very unprofessional business. I asked the nurse to let the doctor know that I was upset and she said he did not want to speak to me. What a piece of trash. Not man enough to come apologize for wasting my time. The office is also not well air conditioned. It was hot in the tiny, cramped waiting room. People were having to stand up. Please do NOT use this doctor. He is the WORST.|The staff, up front such a nice person at the front desk. The nurse who checked me in also extra nice. Very pleasant demeanor. And Dr Zahir sorry bad speller. Is a good soul. He listens. He knows his stuff. If your honest and want pain relief not just pain meds he is your Dr.
Radio Frequency Oblation I was getting back home every 8 months on the dot. Been here 3 years and 1 treatment. Here is your pain management Dr. Amr Zidan|From the front desk area to the medical staff in the back office, including Dr Zidan, they all are very professional and friendly. I go to the office every 8 weeks for a nerve block. I would not have any quality of life if it wasn't for Texas Pain Phys. I would recommend Dr Zidan and his staff they deserve 5 STARS!!|Dr. Zidan is so very nice and very thorough. His staff make me as comfortable as possible! I give them 5 stars!! Unfortunately, I have been to many pain management doctors who would NEVER receive this high of a rating!!|This would have got 3 stars because of the front desk...This doctor would not write me the pain medicine that I know works and tried to write me a medicine that I could get at my primary care. Texas Pain Institute serves Fort Worth, Texas and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Established with a mission to improve quality of life, our team of board-certified specialists provides personalized care for patients suffering from both acute and chronic pain conditions. We combine evidence-based treatments with compassionate care to help patients regain functionality and return to their daily activities with minimal discomfort.

At Texas Pain Institute, we offer a wide range of evaluations and treatments for various painful conditions. Our multidisciplinary approach addresses pain at its source, utilizing advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment protocols. Whether you're dealing with back pain, joint discomfort, neuropathy, or post-surgical pain, our specialists develop customized treatment plans tailored to your specific needs.

Our Approach to Pain Relief

We believe in treating the whole person, not just the symptoms. Our physicians take time to understand each patient's unique pain experience, medical history, and lifestyle factors before recommending appropriate interventions. This comprehensive approach often includes a combination of minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy, and behavioral strategies to maximize pain relief while minimizing side effects.

State-of-the-Art Facility

Located at 1000 Lipscomb St, Suite 110 in Fort Worth, our modern facility is equipped with advanced technology for accurate diagnosis and effective treatment of pain conditions. The comfortable environment is designed to put patients at ease during their visits, with a professional staff committed to providing exceptional care and support throughout the treatment journey.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, please contact us at +1 817-348-8600. You can also visit our website at https://txpain.us/ for additional information about our practice, treatment options, and patient resources. Our team is ready to help you take the first step toward a life with less pain and improved function.

When I arrived @11:27 I was greeted with these words front desk -Your appointment was at 11:15 (Erin his PA ) not will NOT see you" I explained there was a miscommunication about the time + did not received a text/call or email to confirm.
How my time is so limited and I couldn't come back another day.
She asked the PA and her response was- that's why we give out cards with time/date of appointment. She won't see you".

He attentively listens to your concerns, reads over all notes from your other doctors and comes up with a plan that fits your needs. Whether it be medication, injections or recommending surgery he's there for you. Also, his staff is reflection of his leadership. I highly recommend Dr. Mitchell @ Pain Management Institute.|Easy scheduling, little wait time, overall a good experience.

Edit for update: All I'm going to say is this- I've been in excruciating pain since 2001, but refused to even consider back surgery. No pain meds, just a high tolerance for pain and a progressively souring attitude. Injection? Sure thing. Another one, but maybe 3. Uh, ok. But then when the actual PAIN MANAGEMENT PHYSICIAN dismissed my very valid question as irrelevant, proceeded to degrade my PCP for her choice of muscle relaxer, that's it. She didn't pick it, I did. Because in 20 years, there haven't been enormous medical breakthroughs in that particular area. Once again, someone who's actual JOB TITLE is Pain Management/ Anesthesiologist, has clearly stayed far past her expiration date on compassion. When your PCP says "Wait, aren't you seeing a pain management doctor? She's not managing much." I should've pulled the e brake immediately. Instead I foolishly trusted it was just a bad day, I'm super anxious so etc etc. No, it is not me. And I get it's really a sh1t job where you're lied to all day. Everyone knows that. It's not my fault that the rubber glove treatment finally got to physicians. But if you can't get past your own indignation to effectively treat the patients you see? It's time.|They never answer their phone3 to reschedule appointments, they DON"T return any messages. Been trying for 2 weeks now and left several messages. Nothing don't recommend them for anything|My Mother & I one of Her caregivers made a hour trip to her appointment to get her pain medication refills.  I ask the assistant and the nurse to make sure Her medications were sent to CVs  " if they had my Mom's medications in stock, and shocking, they didn't even receive the orders from Dr Mitchell.  Will you please remedy  that mistake.  Also,  when we came in for the appointment, last month, which I was there, it as well was not entered into your office and was told She didn't have an appointment, until my Mom showed proof with Her card.  My Mom's shoulders are hanging on by a sliver ( both), & she has to scoot 5 steps max at a time, as Her knees are so bad at 82, with a walker moving slower and than a snail from pain.  Please stop applying the torture.  She is a beautiful person inside and out and our family wants to knows you care enough to remedy the problem, as it's the weekend and it takes pain medication to help her make it to church to help teach Sunday School, which is the 1 thing She loves doing and can barely do it, but does for Jesus.  WWJD???????|The staff is wonderful and on top of everything.
Dr Alexander Satin is one of the best surgeons I have ever encountered. I HIGHLY recommend Texas Back Institute.  I am pain free.|It was difficult to get ahold of the referral desk to get an appointment scheduled. At San Marcos Pain Clinic, we pride ourselves on offering the most advanced therapies available for treating chronic and acute pain conditions. Our state-of-the-art facility is equipped with cutting-edge diagnostic and treatment technologies that allow us to provide effective solutions for:

Comprehensive Approach to Pain Relief

column3:
Diagnostic Pain Center - North serves the Austin, Texas area with comprehensive pain management solutions at two convenient locations. Our dedicated team of specialists has established a reputation for excellence in treating a wide spectrum of pain conditions with compassion, precision, and ethical care.

Led by Dr. Robert S. Marks, Dr. Sauman A. Rafii, and Dr. John R. Gburek, our practice brings together fellowship-trained, double-board certified physicians with extensive experience in pain medicine. We specialize in diagnosing and treating various pain conditions including back pain, neck pain, hip pain, knee pain, arthritis pain, migraines, and other chronic or acute pain disorders.

Our Approach to Pain Treatment

What sets us apart is our thorough diagnostic process. We take the time to carefully examine each patient, identify the root cause of their pain, and develop personalized treatment plans using the most current, evidence-based approaches. Our goal is always to provide the safest, most cost-effective solutions that address pain at its source rather than merely masking symptoms.

Prompt Care When You Need It

We understand that pain doesn't wait, which is why our physicians make every effort to see new patients by the end of the following business day when necessary. This commitment to accessibility ensures you don't have to suffer needlessly while waiting for an appointment.

Proven Results

Our team has successfully helped thousands of patients resume normal function and live life pain-free. We take pride in our patient-centered approach that emphasizes education, collaboration, and comprehensive care.

Visit Us

Our north location is conveniently situated at 12176 N Mopac Expy d, Austin, TX 78758. To schedule a consultation, call us at (512) 981-7246 or visit our website at www.diagnosticpaincenter.com for more information about our services and treatment options.
column11: Now at Two Locations! Robert S. Marks, M.D., Sauman A. Rafii, M.D. and John R. Gburek are Austin area pain management doctors who compassionately treat all types of pain in the safest and most cost effective, ethical manner. Whether it is back pain, neck pain, hip pain, knee pain, arthritis pain, migraine, or any type of pain, we will thoroughly examine you, diagnose the origin of your pain at its essence, and take the time to discuss the most current treatment options available. Pain doesn't wait... If necessary, our doctors will make every effort to see you by the end of the following business day. Fellowship trained and double-board certified, we have helped thousands of patients resume function and live life pain free!

Thank you from the bottom of my heart!|I recently moved from Massachusetts to Texas, and did not establish care for my debilitating migraines. After they started interfering with my ability to be reliable at work and socially, I made an appointment with DPC. They had appointments available within the same month and take my insurance. He was thorough, gentle, and professional. We reviewed my history and he was open to working on a plan together vs telling me the plan without room for feedback. Texas Pain Specialists serves Arlington, Texas and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our multi-disciplinary team of highly-trained pain medicine and spine specialists is committed to providing accurate assessment, diagnosis, and treatment of all pain-related disorders and spinal conditions. With a patient-centered approach, we combine traditional therapies with cutting-edge minimally invasive treatments to address even the most challenging chronic pain conditions.

At Texas Pain Specialists, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life. Our practice is dedicated to managing various chronic pain syndromes that are often intractable and difficult to treat. We approach each case with empathy and compassion, recognizing that pain is a deeply personal experience requiring individualized care.

Our comprehensive approach involves several medical disciplines working together to create customized treatment plans. By integrating different specialties, we can address the complex nature of chronic pain from multiple angles, increasing the likelihood of successful outcomes.

Advanced Treatment Options

We provide a variety of interventions and therapies, including the latest cutting-edge minimally invasive treatments. Our specialists are trained in advanced techniques that can provide relief while minimizing recovery time and reducing the need for more invasive surgical procedures. These innovative approaches allow many patients to find relief when traditional methods have failed.

Visit Our Arlington Location

Located at 1119 W Randol Mill Rd, Arlington, TX 76012, our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to diagnose and treat various pain conditions. We welcome new patients and referrals from throughout the Dallas-Fort Worth metroplex.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 817-860-2700. Our dedicated team is ready to help you take the first step toward effective pain management and improved quality of life.
column11: Texas Pain Specialists is comprised of a multi-disciplinary team of highly-trained pain medicine and spine specialists committed to providing an accurate assessment, diagnosis, and treatment of all pain-related disorders and disorders of the spine. We provide a variety of interventions and therapies including the latest cutting-edge minimally invasive treatments. Our practice is dedicated to the management of various chronic pain syndromes that are often intractable and difficult to treat, and we aim to treat such disorders with empathy and compassion. We believe that the best approach to pain management is a comprehensive one that involves several medical disciplines.

Had an appointment with this doctor yesterday. My first issue is, my surgeon sent them a referral for pain management over a month ago. They never even called to schedule me. I ended up having to call them. They received my referral on October 7 and I did not get an appointment until yesterday October 30. The doctor himself is extremely rude, and makes you feel stupid. I am scheduled for a major back surgery on November 11, not only about The surgeon doing my back surgery, he spoke to me like I was stupid and like my issues did not exist. I'm not sure If it's because I'm a woman or because I'm white or both he would not write me any prescription My pain and he did not seem interested in helping me surgery either. I will never be returning to this office. I would much rather continue paying. Dollars out of pocket and to deal with this guy|This is a great place with 2 wonderful pain doctors who will help you with all your needs. They took good care of me|Dr. Phan is amazing and takes care in hearing your concerns. He's been great for me!|i am new patient here. dr phan is awesome he listens to your pain and issues. if you need medication refill simply call in dr will refill. dr. phan will understand and show empathy to your situation. i have no issues at all with the office people everyone there is nice and professional and will listen to you. i have had no issue at all with wait time!!|Dr Phan has been the most excellent pain management Dr I've had in 15yrs. I appreciate the Dr, Patient relationship and the efficient attentiveness in managing my chronic pain and monitoring my medication. Dr Phan is Pain Management Hero.|Waiting time is horrible.  If your appointment is at 9am, don't expect to see the doctor anytime soon. If you are lucky you may see your doctor around 1045am or 1100am.  I didn't want to write this review but I got sick and tired of the waiting time. No professionalism at all. JPS and Parkland do better than this.|Been ill for over 2 decades. I have trigemina neuralgia, occipital neuralgia and autonomic neuropathy. In the past 24 years I have seen over 100 specialists throughout the U.S. For the past 19 years I was seeing a Pain Dr. in San Antonio. She is 1st class, honest and brilliant. But the trip became too difficult for me painwise  ... travel, hotel, etc. too expensive.

I was referred to Dr. Phan locally. I had a patient for 8 months or so. He prescribed morphine tablets ... as well as a few other meds which were $600 to $700 per month! Couldn't afford! This happened over and over ... like he was trying to pull a rabbit out of a hat.

After a few months his asst. said I had failed a urine test, actually 2. But they waited until my next appt. to tell me. Dr. Phan was too scared to tell me, saying 'it's ok from the hallway after his asst. condemned my HABIT. But his assistant was adamant that the test results were 100% correct. She said I was using HEROIN or Oxycontin. I told them it was impossible. Never used heroin, not ever and wouldn't. And it had been over a decade since I had used Oxy!

On the 3rd test I failed again ... but after waiting for an hour in the waiting room
the office attendant took my copay, and in the waiting room she told me I had failed AGAIN in front of all those in the waiting room! Of course, I wanted to talk to someone ... Dr., asst or in-house LAB?
No way! No one would talk to me. Finally, I was refunded my copay.

I showed the test results to other doctors and they LAUGHED and were dismayed ... after looking at the test results. For years I had been using Fioricet w codeine which 'Peter Phan' knew. Adding morphine to the mix caused a reaction that created a false positive? I even tried to explain this on the 2nd fail ... but was scorned as a druggie and one using heroin or Oxy! I had read about these interactions from years past. But they wouldn't hear it!

Finally, during this MESS I had begun falling and gasping for air. Phan sent me to a heart Dr. Thousands $$ in tests! Heart Dr. sent me to pulmonologist, thousand$ again in scans and tests! Finally, the drug test fiasco proved to be an eye opener! A blessing! All this time ... It had been the MORPHINE which had constricted my LUNGS! After failed tests I had no more morphine ... so I went cold turkey over a few days, and began BREATHING again! And this pain clinic never ever mentioned this! They should never be in business!

I've been encouraged to sue but I'm not the suing type. If you read this please rethink going to this place. If I could have rated this place a ZERO I would have! Good luck?|The first pain management specialist I had was so bad Jeremy Epstein don't go to him he had me scared to visit this pain specialist. But once I arrived I felt welcomed here from front desk to the assistants they treated me so nice!! Ailene and Dr. Fann are fantastic! Dr Fann saw my pain and took action I'm very appreciative! I recommend this place!

Sigma Pain Clinic in Live Oak, TX serves patients throughout the San Antonio area with specialized pain management solutions. Founded by Dr. Soliman, the clinic was established with a core philosophy that prioritizes ethical, patient-centered care over high-volume practices. This approach ensures each patient receives thorough, individualized attention for their unique pain management needs.

Dr. Soliman brings exceptional credentials to Sigma Pain Clinic as a dual board-certified physician in both anesthesiology and pain management. His comprehensive approach combines cutting-edge treatments with compassionate care, addressing both the symptoms and underlying causes of chronic pain conditions.

Beyond his clinical practice, Dr. Soliman maintains several prestigious academic appointments, serving as a faculty member at the University of Texas Health in San Antonio where he educates residents, fellows, and medical students in pain management techniques. He further contributes to medical education as an adjunct professor at The University of Incarnate World.

Commitment to Medical Excellence

Dr. Soliman's expertise is recognized at the state level, where he serves as an expert panelist on the Texas Medical Board, helping to establish and maintain high standards for medical practice throughout Texas. This involvement demonstrates his commitment to advancing the field of pain management and ensuring ethical practices industry-wide.

Patients seeking comprehensive pain management solutions can visit Sigma Pain Clinic at 11227 Toepperwein Rd, Live Oak, TX 78233, or call +1 210-600-9766 to schedule a consultation. Additional information about services and treatment options is available at www.sigmapain.com.
column11: Dr Soliman is a top physician and dual board-certified in the fields of anesthesiology and pain management. He started his own practice as he wanted to build an ethical practice that is completely patient-oriented and not motivated by seeing a high number of patients, but by providing quality care to each and every patient. In addition to Sigma Pain Clinic, Dr. Soliman works at the University of Texas Health in San Antonio teaching residents, fellows, and medical students. Additionally, he is an adjunct professor at The University of Incarnate World. Besides this, Dr. Soliman also works as an expert panelist on the Texas Medical Board. Dr.

Sigma Pain Clinic serves New Braunfels, TX and surrounding communities with specialized pain management services designed to improve quality of life for those suffering from chronic pain conditions. Founded on the principle that effective pain management requires both expertise and compassion, our clinic has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider in the Central Texas region. Dr. Starr is an excellent doctor.  His genuine concern for me is greatly appreciated.  He comes fully prepared to discuss your medical problems and is well informed.  He also treated me with the utmost respect and gave me a down to earth treatment plan.  I would recommend Dr. Starr to anyone dealing with chronic pain.  Thank you!!|Dr. Starr has been my doctor for almost three years now. After my back surgery, I struggled to get my pain under control. My surgeon recommended a different pain management doctor, but they weren't able to address all my needs. Fortunately, my primary care doctor, Dr. Kellum, referred me to Dr. Starr. I feel incredibly lucky to have found him. There were times I didn't think I would be able to continue working, let alone travel for my job. Though I still live with pain, Dr. Starr has been able to manage it effectively, and I've regained the ability to lead an active, fulfilling life. Thanks to his care, I'm able to work and travel, and I can look forward to growing older with a higher quality of life. His office staff is also amazing--so professional and compassionate. I'm truly grateful for the care I've received.|I went to see Dr. Starr and I am happy with is attentiveness. He didn't brush me and my complaints off.  he made eye contact most of the visit and actually listened to what I had to say. He gave me options to think about and choose. This is called pt care. Great stay all around.|Convenient only 5 minutes from my house. Facility is clean and welcoming. Staff and doctor's are professional and courteous. Doctor's listen to and address your concerns and explain everything so you understand it. Great place.|I have had a pleasant experience each time I've come into the clinic. column40:
I highly recommend this clinic to anyone in pain. From the staff to the provider, everyone takes great care of their patients. Thank you to Britney, Kenia, Richard, Eileen, and Jessica for making my appointment great.|This place is awesome the staff are very nice and involve with what's going on with you . The Dr .Garbriel rodriguez remember your first name how awesome is that and he takes time to listen he don't rush you . This would be the perfect office for any kind of back in jury.|This clinic was a referral from my PCP. I called several times to make an appointment. Finally got a hold of someone. They took my name, number and insurance information to verify benefits.

Got a call back stating they are not accepting new patients. Why didn't someone tell me that when I called?

Got a call a few days later to make an appointment. Receptionist took all my information and confirmed an appointment date.

Get a call the next day "there was a miscommunication, we are not accepting new patients. The appointment you had needs to be cancelled" - not very professional.

Yes, I was a potential new patient. As a manager in customer service, the back and forth was unnecessary and clearly a sign of how the practice is run. Definitely dodged a bullet.|They let me go from the office after their mess up. The office manager was VERY unprofessional! So sad to have seen Dr Chen go. Don't waste your money on this place! The manager is quite the joke and has no respect. You would think he is on the patients side but nope. Beware of him only caring about money. Steer clear of here!|I cannot explain enough in words what The Pain Relief Center in Plano, Texas has meant to me in the last 14 days. Dr. Chen has the best personality, experience, and knowledge of any Dr. I have ever met. He listens and explains the issue and plan in a way that I have never experienced before. I moved to Texas a year ago and recently had an issue with back pain that was very debilitating. Dr Chen was quick to diagnose, and get me in for an injection and immediately control my pain. He surrounds himself with an impeccable staff, Jennifer, April, Randy, and Nancy and so many more I have not met. I am sure Dr. Rodriguez is absolutely the same way! They care about you, listen, want you to get better and never judge. If you have pain and want a place that is not only state of the art, but REALLY CARES about you! I implore you to choose The Pain Relief Center in Plano, Texas. Words cannot thank them enough and I will be a patient here as long as I need to be! I would experience on your own! You will NOT be disappointed.|Dr. Rodriguez, Debbie and staff are amazing. They have changed my life! I am able to enjoy life and thrive due to the Pain Relief center! Their treatment plans are effective and they always explain everything to ease my mind. The staff is super friendly and there is just such a positive vibe within the office. I highly reccomend them.|WOW is the only thing I can say! I've been dealing with back pain for 10+years and I've seen a few different doctors and pain mngmt and all I can say is Dr Rodriguez cares and listens and helps. In my 30 min visit he did more for me then any other doctor I've ever seen! Lab work DONE, knee&back brace DONE, range of motion test DONE, relief DONE!!!! I almost cried in happy relief! His staff from from office to back office was sweet and compassionate and genuinely ready to listen and help in any way. They took care of EVERYTHING for me. If you have chronic pain/injury you will not be disappointed with this office/nurses/Doctor.
Dr Rodriguez ISN'T the kind of Doctor to throw medication your way, he's willing to get to the root of your pain. Hands down the BEST doctors visit I've EVER had. I can't say enough about my visit in terms of how fabulous it went. I ABSOLUTELY recommend this Doctor and office. If you want quality care, if you want a Doctor who going to listen and care, if you want a Doctor's office who's staff is A+, then please call them. They'll help you!|I met with Dr. Chen today and he spent at least 25 minutes diagnosing my issues. He was confident he could get me back to normal. It has been 25 days since my injury with little to no relief, but seeing Dr. Chen gave me hope that I can get my life back. He is compassionate, caring and listens which in his field is basically unheard of. The entire place is A+ status. I checked in the girls at the front desk were amazing, the girls that took my paper work and had me do the UA were unbelievably and it wasn't an act. I could hear Dr. Chen corresponding with the staff before my visit and it was genuine interaction. I called the nurse line with a question and they were 100% prompt and amazing as well. I moved from MN and took the first pain clinic I saw. I did not do research. I did this time on this move and it paid off. I was with 1 doctor for 15+ years and trust in your Dr. and trust in the patient are important. This is the last place I will ever go for back pain. If I could give them 10 stars I would. I know I will get my life back! That is a great feeling.

7/16/20- The staff from Randy at the front desk to April and Jennifer on the Nurse line are first rate caring people that make every effort to help! Dr. Chen by far the best Dr. I have ever dealt with, caring best personality and Cares about what you have to say! I will Never go anywhere else! Lifelong patient!

column40:
Texas Pain Physicians was a referral from my surgeons office.

I have been to this office twice.

Let me preface this by saying, I live about 40 minutes away. There are plenty of pain clinics closer.

The first time I met Dr Golden and her Nurse Assistant (I have completely forgotten her name, I'm sorry), I knew I was in the right spot. They are compassionate, caring, understanding and most of all, I don't feel judged. I am not an easy medical case. Anyone with chronic pain knows what I mean.

I recently had an issue with one of my prescriptions. The Office Manager, Sue took care of it immediately and then called me back to let me know. Customer service is exceptional when the Manager actually calls you back to let you know something has been handled.

Thank you Dr. Golden and your Staff for showing empathy and true genuine kindness.|My experience on this first visit was great!  The staff is wonderful!  NP Onuwali is knowledgeable, professional, compassionate, and caring. I cannot say enough about the amazing staff. I have hope now!|Met with Dr. Alex Golden (she) yesterday.   A little chaotic as the team had just moved into the new office space, not sure if it was 100% of the team, but Dr. Golden was there.   Nice space.

Team very friendly and courteous as I watched the patient interaction (even one guy that asked the same questioni 3x, always a friendly response).

Met with Dr. Golden, found her to be patient, open to questions and fully explaining things.  She has recommended a course of action for treatment that I will follow.|Rude staff, rude doctors.

RUN! GO ANYPLACE BUT HERE!

The staff and doctors are awful! They don't explain things and constantly say one thing and do another and then blame you.

Even after I canceled my appointment and told them they were fired, they called and left another rude message.

Also, WARNING, if you have a procedure with them that involves a groin area shot, they take you into a hospital type setting and then tell you to get on a table and drop your pants. No hospital gown or anything. Very unprofessional and honestly it didn't feel right at all! I now have another complaint to put in to the medical board on them!|Was seen Monday for severe sciatic pain limiting my ability to walk and was scheduled for epidural injections the following Monday. Was called on Wednesday because they needed me to reschedule to a later time on the same day. Ok fine. Was called by an after-hours answering service again Friday at 6pm and told my upcoming appointment for Monday was cancelled. Thanks for wasting my time. I could have found another doctor instead of dealing with this injury for a week waiting for nothing. Absolute garbage. Look elsewhere for help!!|Arrived at designated time for an appointment to see a staff member sitting on the floor outside the office. Google shows the office opens at 8am and the appointment was at 830am. The young lady seemed very passive & nonchalant about office possibly opening at 9am but didn't seem to care much about us.

This probably showcases how they run their business and practice so we left.|Got here at 1:15 it is now 2:23. Looks like it's going to take another 30 to get me checked out. Never rush for this pain doctor. They are always slow on leaving|Awful place. Office manager Enrique treats you like trash and expects you to do his job for him and won't give answers as to why they hide things from you. I was told on the phone I would see doctor Howard (individually a wonderful doctor) but I was passed off to a PA, not even an MD. I specifically moved from the Greenville location because they too were horrible, but this place is also. Can't say enough bad things. Oh, and they don't return phone calls and good luck getting ahold of the actual offices. Chronic pain is not a joke, but this office sure likes to play games.

So if anyone ever ask me about this office I will definitely let them know this is not the place to go|Have been treating with Dr. Basava for my pain. Georgetown Interventional Pain serves the greater Austin area from our convenient Georgetown, TX location. As a small, independent practice, we bring specialized pain management expertise to patients seeking relief from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team of three fellowship-trained physicians combines advanced interventional techniques with compassionate care, offering personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs. We pride ourselves on providing an alternative to large corporate medical facilities by maintaining a patient-centered approach where you'll receive individualized attention from highly qualified specialists.

At Georgetown Interventional Pain, we offer a wide range of evidence-based treatments for various pain conditions. Our interventional procedures include epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and other minimally invasive techniques designed to target pain at its source. We take a multidisciplinary approach, combining interventional procedures with medication management and rehabilitation recommendations when appropriate.

Our Expert Physician Team

What sets our practice apart is our team of fellowship-trained pain management physicians who share a common vision of delivering exceptional pain care. Each doctor has completed specialized training beyond their medical education, ensuring they possess the advanced skills needed to diagnose and treat complex pain conditions. Our physicians stay current with the latest developments in pain medicine to provide the most effective treatments available.

Patient-Centered Philosophy

We understand that living with pain affects every aspect of your life. That's why we take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and develop a treatment plan aligned with your goals. Our compassionate approach focuses on improving your quality of life and helping you return to the activities you enjoy.

Visit Our Georgetown Location

Georgetown Interventional Pain welcomes new patients at our office located at 1900 Scenic Dr #1108, Georgetown, TX 78626. To schedule a consultation, please call us at (512) 400-4195. For more information about our services and approach to pain management, visit our website at www.austininterventionalpain.com.
column11: We are a small, independent practice comprised of three fellowship-trained pain management physicians who share a vision of comprehensive, compassionate pain care in greater Austin.

column40:
I have been a patient of Dr Pecks for several years and l have tremendous respect for him and his staff of professionals.  Rarely have I ever had to wait and Dr Peck never makes me feel rushed or that I'm asking "too many" questions.  I so appreciate the pain relief as well as the feeling of camaraderie and team work the staff at Austin Interventional Pain have.  I Highly recommend|We love Dr Khan so much we drive from N Dallas to see him. He is professional, caring and the best pain management doctor.
The staff is friendly and efficient: Miguel, Sierra, Kahnal are kind and helpful.
Best practice and my favorite doctor|Dr Adnan Khan's treatment of my back pain has been amazing! He is an attentive, caring, and professional man. I have never had a better experience with a doctor. He evaluates and explains options in detail. I feel better than I have in many years. Thank you Dr Khan!!|I had my right Total Knee Replacement (TKR) in September 2023.  I am scheduled to do the other knee next week.  Dr. D. Peck performed  nerve block before the two operations. I am very happy with the outcome of the procedure.  Dr Peck is very kind, professional with a wide smile on his face.  The staff is very helpful,  professional and courteous.   They do the extra mile to explain insurance coverage to you. I am very grateful for the service I received.|Today, I went to the clinic and saw Dr. Peck for an epidural shot. The procedure it's self went amazing, I didn't feel nothing until the medication went through and felt that for sure. Thank you Dr for your amazing help. Definitely, definitely recommend seeing him if you need injections!|I cannot say enough good things about Dr. Peck and Georgetown Interventional Pain. Dr. Peck is extremely knowledgeable and is very passionate about providing the best possible care to his patients. He is very skilled and analytical, and has worked diligently to pinpoint the cause of my pain. He is adept at presenting the best treatment options in a way that I can easily understand.
Dr. Peck is supported by a great health care team, all of whom are very professional, responsive, and friendly.
Scarlett is the clinic's CRNA and she takes great care of me when I opt to have sedation for a procedure. I always feel completely safe and quite comfortable in her very capable hands. I especially appreciate her nurturing and compassionate nature!|Except for those lidocaine shots, which were pretty painful, everything went smoothly. The staff was professional and polite. I saw them 3 weeks ago, then had total knee replacement surgery last week. The pain was much less than my previous knee surgery so I think the procedure was well worth it!|Dr. Khan and his staff have been amazing to work with!  Had an earlier issue with a staff member, but that person no longer works there.  Dr. Khan personally called me re: the earlier issue and relieved my concerns.

The entire staff seem to genuinely enjoy their work and have been very cordial and yet professional during my in person appointments, as well as my follow-up phone calls.  They are extremely responsive and accommodating when I've had questions or concerns.

Just one example, I kept a log of my post-injection symptoms and called the office today to see if there was any way I could get that info to Dr. Khan and not wait for my virtual follow-up appointment scheduled for next week.  Jennifer gladly provided me with an email address I could send my info to.  She said she'd be sure to get it to Dr. Khan who was off site.  I received a callback from Jennifer 30 minutes later.  She told me Dr. Khan had reviewed my notes and agreed there was no reason to wait until next week.  They were able to squeeze me in for tomorrow to see Dr. Khan in person.

Dr. Khan's office called me again as soon as the next injections were approved by Insurance.  They were once again able to squeeze me in that same week.

I had a few questions for Dr. Khan before my next injections and he took the time to listen to my concerns and answer all of my questions.

Dr. Khan and his staff are superb!

column40: Takes for ever to be seen! Highly annoying.... Some nurses/ staff are really nice and helpful. The other's.... I'll keep those thoughts to myself. But feel free to use your imagination. They will use medical terminology in explaining and you may not know. So if you have to just point on your body where you're getting treated...|Dr. Osmani is unlike any doctor we've ever seen and we've seen a lot so has my family and a lot of my family go to him as well now! The problem is the staff at the surgery center off of Duvall Road in Austin is terrible and they don't match up to him in any capacity! With the exception of one nurse!  She was great!  They are all very cold, rude, run you through there like cattle!  they treat you like you're just nothing and then he walks in the room and it's 180% difference in the type of person he is. D3 Pain Management serves Willow Park, TX and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Dan DuBose, MD. Located in the heart of Parker County, our practice combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients overcome chronic pain conditions and improve their quality of life. We understand that pain affects every aspect of your daily activities, which is why we develop personalized treatment plans tailored to each individual's specific needs and circumstances.

At D3 Pain Management, Dr. DuBose utilizes his extensive training and experience to offer a wide range of interventional and non-interventional pain management treatments. Our approach focuses on identifying the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms, allowing for more effective long-term relief. Our Approach to Patient Care

column38: Matt King|Ricky Nall|Waymon Patterson|Greg hogue|Michelle Shields|Jeanann Smith|Christina Martinez|Pamela Steege
column40:
One of if not the WORST doctor to go see. Dubose does NOT care or concern himself about his patients. Office staff are unprofessional as well. Dubose, with a ream full of my VA medical records documenting all my injuries, told me he would NOT prescribe ANYTHING to  help me. Other patients have said he will just reduce their meds without warning or concern. He is in the business to make money, not help people and that reflects in his attitude towards his patients.|First off my wife loved Dr. DuBose and he was her favorite Dr. She had been under pain mgmt. for 5+ years in Ft Worth. Another Dr. recommended him and he was 25 miles closer for us. For 2 or more years it was great. No problems until one day at her monthly appt. He told her she failed her last drug test. We were floored. We never even gave drug test second thoughts because she was a stickler for following the rules. In 7+ years never a blip on her record. She is an RN and did everything right to make sure she never had a problem. She was prescribed and took morphine but the test supposedly said she had taken Tramadol recently and he said he was dismissing her. Tramadol would be like taking aspirin compared to the morphine , so it made no sense at all why she would take it. We racked our brains trying to think of where it could have been introduced to her. She takes many other meds and we googled what would give a false positive for Tramadol. Her anti depressant medicine was the first thing that popped up. We informed Dr. DuBose and he asked the lab , they said it wouldn't cause it. My wife had Dr D look it up , sure enough he pulled the same info up. Even after he saw the lab had seemingly lied to him he still didn't listen. She offered to take any test he wanted to give but he didn't offer. You wouldn't offer to take a test , if you knew you had taken something you shouldn't have either. We wanted to know and have peace of mind if she had inadvertently taken some somehow , so I ordered a 13 panel hair sample test that test a minimum of three months previous drug use. We completed the test and sent it in. When we got the results , NEGATIVE for Tramadol use. At least we knew for sure it wasn't a mistake on her part

Like I said , we like Dr.Dubose and his office very much. I don't know how it happened , maybe a bad test or bad chain of command getting it from the bathroom to the lab , but it happened. My wife was SO embarrassed , humiliated , and devastated knowing she had done everything to the letter right for 7+ years and then felt like she was getting the bums rush for something she didn't do. It makes it harder finding a new Dr. too when you have this on your record. It still bothers and humiliates her months later. We harbor no ill feelings for him or his office. I don't know what caused the false test but I feel like it could have been handled differently. Do you know how hard it is to prove you didn't do something ........ that you didn't do ??|Dr. Dan is great! Very empathetic with a great bedside manner. The staff of D3 Pain Management is consistently helpful and professional as well and friendly.|Dr DuBose was wonderful. I was worried about pain management as just pain drugs. Dr DuBose had a great plan with out drug.  I'm 62 and a retired firefighter.  I'm experiencing pain in my neck.  He had solution.  I go to Israel often to teach young firefighters and it requires me to be in top shape to go in to fires with these young hero's.|They are super caring and helpful. They made sure I fully understood what is going on with my body, was able to make the right decision for myself at this time, and took great care of me!|His staff is very nice, professional, and acommodating. I would not go anywhere else. He makes sure you understand the procedure and what he is doing every step of the way, and that you are comfortable. I have never met a doctor with a better bedside manner and cares about his patients well being. I love thee the staff and doctor.|I came for an epidural shot injection in my back. I chose this location based on my surgeon's recommendation and also, the excellent reviews. I can say that D3 Pain Management is a wonderful office, run by an amazing team, and lead by an incredible Doctor.

Dr. Dan Dubose and his staff is truly wonderful. I was so anxious about the shots and their team put me at ease. Five million stars.|Dr Dubose was very informative and clear regarding my procedure. He was kind , and understanding to me regarding my situation. His staff was kind and helpful. He was timely, and engaging. I will return for the 2nd half of my knee ablation and have confidence in his abilities.

River City Pain Management serves San Antonio, Texas with comprehensive pain management solutions. Located in the heart of San Antonio's medical district, our dedicated team combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Since our founding, we have established ourselves as a trusted healthcare provider, helping thousands of patients reclaim their quality of life through personalized treatment plans and innovative pain relief approaches.

At River City Pain Management, we offer a diverse range of evidence-based treatments designed to target pain at its source. Our multidisciplinary approach incorporates both interventional procedures and conservative therapies, ensuring that each patient receives the most appropriate care for their specific condition. We specialize in treating various pain syndromes, including back and neck pain, joint discomfort, neuropathic pain, and post-surgical pain.

Our Expert Medical Team

Our clinic is staffed by board-certified pain specialists who stay at the forefront of pain medicine advancements. Each team member brings extensive training and experience in diagnosing complex pain conditions and developing effective management strategies. We believe in collaborative care, working closely with primary care physicians, physical therapists, and other specialists to provide comprehensive treatment plans.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we take the time to listen to our patients' concerns and goals. Our patient-centered philosophy ensures that treatment plans address not only the physical aspects of pain but also its emotional and psychological impacts. This holistic approach has consistently resulted in higher patient satisfaction and better long-term outcomes.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation, call us at +1 210-692-0101 or explore our services online at www.rivercitypain.com. Our convenient location in the medical district offers easy access for patients throughout the San Antonio metropolitan area.
