column40:
My experience with River City Pain Management was disappointing. The practice lacks effective communication and professionalism. Brandon, the receptionist, was quite unhelpful. Brandon struggled with basic tasks such as scheduling appointments, had poor communication skills, and displayed concerning behavior. Instead of providing the practice's availability, he asked for mine.... This shows me that River City Pain Management lacks organization and has a poorly structured scheduling process.

I scheduled an appointment months in advance to simply pick up my cast and was told that my ankle cast would be ready. However, I took time off work AND drove 45 minutes to River City Pain Management. I was greeted with disorganized and unacceptable behavior. Rather than updating me beforehand that the cast was not going to be in my treatment plan, the staff unknowingly scrambled around and screamed out searching for the cast outside the exam room. This made me feel uncomfortable, awkward and frustrated knowing that there was no point of me going in the practice to pick up my non existent cast. A simple phone call to address the situation in advance would have been considerate.

After I told my lawyer about my experience and decided to not continue with the practice, Brandon called me multiple times back-to-back like a toxic person would. As I was not able to pick up, Brandon used a different number to reach me when he could have left a voicemail or text...highly unprofessional.

Additionally, despite deciding to discontinue treatment, I was sent medication without my knowledge, which increased my bill unnecessarily. This felt exploitative, and the lack of transparency was troubling.

While Dr. Arnold de Leon was helpful, the management and staff made my experience a complete waste of time and resources. I cannot recommend this practice to anyone. If I could give 0 stars, I would.|This place is awesome  Dr Hunter and the  staff Is super cool. I highly recommend this clinic . The girls in the back are very helpful and friendly and personable me and my son both had pain injections shots and Dr Hunter was superb and  anesthesiologist come here you won't regret it !!!|I Highly recommend Dr Hunter! I have been in severe neck pain with 4 herniated disc's in my neck since October 2023 causing pinched nerves in my back and neck and affecting my arm and hand, and he was so kind and patient and caring. The most kindest compassionate Dr I have ever seen. He recommended a cervical epidural steroid injection. I was scared to have it and had severe anxiety. His surgery nurse Mona talked me out of some of my fear of having the procedure yesterday. And Dr Hunter was so sweet and kind and understanding and except for a little sting at the injection site with the numbing medication I didn't feel anything other than a little pressure of the medicine going in. I worked myself up and my blood pressure up for no reason.|I have had several injections in my spine, knee, and hand. Dr. DeLeon is by far the best pain management Dr. in San Antonio. He is knowledgeable, effective, and compassionate. All of the staff are thorough, friendly and efficient.|I just wrote a review and the whole review disappeared!
So here goes another shot at telling everyone with pain issues, Go DIRECTLY TO DR. MICHAEL HUNTER!
I have been under his superb care and pain management supervision since DECEMBER 23, 2020!

I have told him and everyone I know that HE is the first and only doctor that has really listened to me and provided precisely the best care ever!

He and I have reached such a high level of trust, understanding  and he always knows exactly what my condition requires and treats me accordingly. Dr. Michael Hunter is exactly where he should be and doing what he needs to be doing. He is very humble and has the heart of a loving servant. I trust him and respect him like no other doctor I have EVER encountered in my entire life.

I know that some of this is sounding perhaps a bit gushy to some of you...but this is my honest opinion of him and it's all true.

I knew early on that because of his true empathy for his patients,  that he would become wildly popular at the clinic, and that is exactly what has taken place. His character and integrity are admirable to behold.

The staff, of course, all function like a well-oiled machine with no bottlenecks present to interrupt the flow of billing and record-keeping, etc. Although everything runs smoothly this way, the entire staff is made up with sincere, caring and respectful employees always ready to go that extra mile with a smile on their face.

When you are in serious pain, this is definitely the BEST PLACE for you to go. Just get there according to your appointed time, answer all the questions clearly and honestly-- then just let go and let God work through these exemplary health care providers.|My previous pain doctor retired after me seeing him for 20 years and by the grace of God I found Dr Hunter. He has referred me to 2 surgeons to see if i can be helped with surgery instead of the same old month after month pain meds like my other doctor did. Dr Hunter is very caring, he spends all of the time with me that I need and never rushes me out the door. He seems to honestly care about my pain and wants to do everything possible to help.
The staff is very good and hasn't let me slip  through the cracks. I highly recommend River City Pain Management!|Dr. Michael Hunter, MD is The Very Finest Pain Specialist. He truly cares deeply about the outcome and well-being of all his patients! Dr. Bryan Lai, MD works together with  Dr. Hunter. He is such a truly caring Dr and gives all his patients such amazing care. The team of Doctors all truly care about everyone. I've watched them help people who were suffering with much pain. Some didn't have prior authorization  but were suffering with pain. These Finest Doctors truly care and helped them right away. It touched my heart to see how they put the Patient First and helped them right away! God bless these Finest Caring Doctors at River City Pain Management. I thank God for blessing me with them.

Sincerest Blessings,

Lisa Jackson|My experience at Riverside Pain Management is above expectations every time the staff is the best never a long wait . Professional Doctors and PA Emily Scudder is just Awesome she listens and explains every detail so I leave knowing all I need to know about a procedure that's up coming or whatever the case maybe. Blessings to all the staff your Awesome thank you!

Thomas Heil, MD serves Fort Worth, TX as a distinguished Interventional Pain Management specialist at Physician Partners of America (PPOA). A graduate of West Virginia University, Dr. Heil brings extensive expertise to the field of pain management, offering comprehensive solutions for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. His patient-centered approach combines cutting-edge interventional techniques with personalized treatment plans to help patients regain their quality of life.

At PPOA's Fort Worth location, Dr. Heil provides a wide range of interventional procedures designed to address various pain conditions. His practice focuses on minimally invasive techniques that target the source of pain while minimizing recovery time and side effects. Patients benefit from his thorough diagnostic process and commitment to finding the most effective treatment options for each individual case.

Conditions Treated

Dr. Heil specializes in treating numerous pain conditions, including but not limited to back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. His comprehensive approach may incorporate interventional procedures, medication management, and collaborative care with other specialists to ensure optimal outcomes.

Practice Location and Contact Information

Dr. Thomas Heil practices at the Keller Pain Relief Group, a PPOA facility located at 4364 Heritage Trace Pkwy #112a, Fort Worth, TX 76244. Patients seeking consultations or appointments can contact the office directly at +1 817-722-5042. For additional information about services offered, patients are encouraged to visit the official website at www.physicianpartnersofamerica.com.

Patient-Centered Approach

Dr. Heil is committed to providing compassionate care that addresses not only the physical aspects of pain but also its emotional and psychological impacts. He works closely with each patient to develop customized treatment plans that align with their specific needs, goals, and lifestyle considerations. This holistic approach has earned him the trust and respect of patients throughout the Fort Worth community.

Advanced Pain Care has been serving Austin, TX and surrounding communities since 2002, establishing itself as a premier destination for comprehensive pain management solutions. Founded by Dr. Malone and staffed with dedicated pain specialists, the practice has grown to meet the increasing demand for specialized pain treatment across Central Texas. With a patient-centered approach and multidisciplinary treatment options, Advanced Pain Care has become a trusted resource for thousands of individuals seeking relief from chronic and acute pain conditions.

The team at Advanced Pain Care specializes in treating a wide spectrum of pain-related conditions, including post-surgical pain, cancer-related discomfort, degenerative disc disease, joint disease, fibromyalgia, migraines, and various musculoskeletal issues. Their expertise extends to specific pain locations such as back, shoulder, hip, neck, sacroiliac joint, and sciatica. By offering both interventional procedures and medication management, the practice provides customized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Extensive Network of Facilities

With 15 locations and 4 surgery centers strategically positioned throughout the region, Advanced Pain Care ensures convenient access to quality care. The practice further enhances patient convenience through its 3 in-house pharmacies and dedicated physical therapy clinic, creating a seamless healthcare experience. This integrated approach allows patients to receive comprehensive care under one medical umbrella, eliminating the need to coordinate between multiple providers.

Specialized Expertise in Austin

The Austin clinic features renowned pain management specialists including Dr. Paul Le and Dr. Jeffrey Higginbotham, who bring years of specialized training and experience to their practice. For patients with autoimmune and inflammatory conditions, rheumatology services are available at the South Austin and Georgetown locations. Additionally, the practice offers specialized Opioid Stewardship and Behavioral Health programs at their South Austin and Round Rock facilities, addressing the psychological components of chronic pain while ensuring responsible medication management.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Advanced Pain Care's expert team, patients can visit their website at https://austinpaindoctor.com/ or call +1 512-244-4272. Their Austin clinic is conveniently located at 3418 N Lamar Blvd, Suite 100, Austin, TX 78705, with additional locations throughout Central Texas to serve patients from various communities.

column40: Dr. Adepitan  is very smart and knowledgeable.  She is actually my favorite doctor. I would highly recommend her practice to anyone struggling with pain. I am forever thankful to her helping me with the debilitating pain  caused by central post stroke pain syndrome.|I highly recommend PainMD Associates for all your pain treatments. They are a group of highly professional and friendly doctors that deliver unsurpassed care to their patients.  They provide fast services in a clean environment. They make sure all their patients are comfortable and relaxed while they are in the Clinic and they even follow up with their patients to ensure the treatment worked and the patients are well.|Every possible category you can think of earns 5 stars for Dr Adepitan and her staff...compassionate, knowledgeable, professional, short (if any) wait time, flexible and friendly to name a few. I have dealt with chronic pain for many years and have seen other pain doctors in the past. Dr Adepitan is the first one that has truly listened to my concerns and always seeks out solutions that help ease my pain. She does not just hand out medication and send you on your way like other pain doctors may do. She thoroughly listens to what you say and explains your situation in a way you can understand what is going on with your body. She is so patient and makes sure all your questions are answered. She never makes you feel rushed in any way. Esther is always super friendly and inviting as soon as you walk in. It's unfortunate all establishments are not like this. On the upside, it absolutely makes them stand out and above from all the others. I have referred friends and family to pain MD Associates and will continue to do so. I cannot say enough wonderful things about Dr Adepitan and her staff.|Dr. Adepitan is extremely compassionate and has recommended many successful therapies for my treatment.  I know that she cares, and listens to my concerns, and her clinic responds quickly to phone calls with questions or status updates.|Great staff!!! Dr. Adepitan and her staff are always friendly and accommodating working with you and your schedule.  Highly recommend them to anyone needing pain management and actually wants someone who listens to you.|I highly recommend Dr. Adepitan.  The staff is very friendly and the doctor tries to stay on schedule, not making patients wait an hour before seeing the doctor.  Also, she doesn't rush through the appointment.  She takes her time and gives you her undivided attention.|If there were a zero rating, that is the rating I would choose.  I would like to express my deep disappointment in the services received from Dr. Adepitan.  My disappointment stems from the fact that she was not responsive to calls and text messages when her guidance was mostly needed.  In times of enormous pain and discomfort and a desperate need to contact her, all I was given was an office number where only a recording was heard.  Messages were left but no response was made.  Additionally, once I received her personal cell phone number text messages with desperate pleas for help and guidance were not responded to.  Requests for how to wean myself from the prescription drugs prescribed, can I split a dose in half, what interaction drugs had with others, among some of the requests, were never answered.  I felt like there was no one monitoring the opiods that had been prescribed.  I do not recommend Dr. Adepitan to any patient needing pain management assistance.|My father had a car accident and had some pain with the mri showing problems with his spine.  But Ms.Adepitan was wonderful she fully heard our problems and thoroughly explained everything we need to fix his pain problem. I would recommend her to anyone who is in any type of pain whether from a car accident to old age pain.

column40:
If you need help with controlling your pain, do not hesitate to visit Dr Malik at Texas Pain & Orthopedics. Dr. Malik is very patient and is willing to work with you and he really listens to you. My pain in my knee is so much better!  I don't have to take pain killers on a regular basis - just a couple of Tylenol every now and then. I am so thankful!
Allison at the front desk is so welcoming and helpful. !!|Dr Malik is very professional, and he and his staff are very likeable also, which is always a plus. He diagnosed my pain, and we decided on a treatment plan that will allow me to continue my outdoor and other activities. A true blessing for which I am grateful.  Ya know, I just scrolled back through All of the reviews, as of now, 3-23-24, all are 5 star, ALL. ok??

Ok, now, 4-11-24, let me tell you that I got an epidural yesterday, and pain that has been effectively crippling me is gone or greatly relieved today, Dr Malik has cautioned me this may b a temporary effect, but this is miraculous...
And
Ok. So, the Epidurals were great,lasted a few months.
Thursday we completed a nerve ablation procedure, a facet block.
idk how long this will last, nerves can re generate, but if you have been living w lower back pain like I have, for 30> years, being as pain free as I am now is Miraculous. Typically this lasts 6 months- years and years maybe forever.
It's just, well it's enough to cause EXTREME GRATITUDE.
THANK YOU Ike, Allison,and my dear sister that introduced us.
You've been a God send to me lil bro.Today is 8-24-24, b.t.w., so from epidurals to facet blocks took approximately four months, you know, you have t try the least invasive first,as in anything,. I think that's really great, especially as I mentioned this has been over 30 years of living in constant pain.
I cannot gush over this enough, I have my mobility back, I have my ability to be more, much much more, active. Be a part of my children's and grandchildren s lives again...
Hugs all around guys. God bless us, everyone.
Hi .
Treatment continues,Dr.Malik has helped me tremendously since we started this, and even more relief from my hip,thigh and back pains than I'd hoped has been accomplished.
I'm extremely grateful.
God bless you all, may you find relief also.|Dr. Malik was wonderful. He listened carefully to everything I had to say and seems genuinely interested in finding a solution to my pain issues. I'm very happy to have found him.|I played sports for many years into my adult life and suffered from severe knee pain as I got older. I wanted to avoid knee surgery as long as I could. Dr Malik had a different approach with physical therapy and  In-office procedures that made my pain more manageable. I have also recommended friends with shoulder and back pain, and they have received similar results. I highly recommend Dr Malik and his office for pain management and professional care.|The facility was so clean and beautiful.  Dr. Malik is very nice and professional. The dr wanted me to introduce myself and he listened to everything I had to say and he asked questions about me.   After talking about myself, he introduce hisself that was awesome. Dr. Malik made me feel comfortable.  if i had questions he was listened to everything I had to say. .  So far I would recommend my family and friends.  This was my first day and they made me feel so comfortable.|Great services and patient care I've tried several places but this one works and great results.i can doing things I haven't been able to do in years like 7miles in 60 minutes.|I had an exceptional visit for a follow-up with Dr Malik. He is very friendly, knowledgeable and understands the concerns of his clients and patients. The office is extremely clean. His staff, Allison, Is very friendly and kind. Overall, I give them 10 .  I'm happy to put them in my trusted health network provider. He truly cares about his patients and takes care of them the way he promises, he's great, definitely the best pain doctor I've ever been to and I've had a spinal lumbar fusion for 30 years. On a scale of 1 to 10 I've had chronic pain that was 8.5-10, Dr Malik has brought it down to 2 at times of a due visit. He is a good person.
F$PS!Z|The office very clean, staff is friendly. Dr. Malik very professional, Explain everything very carefully.  Does not rush you into anything, let's you make your decision on your own pace.

column40:
This was my first visit to the Austin location. The staff there were very welcoming and attentive to my insurance status, updated it and processed my copay. My visit with Dr Jarzombeck was pleasant, informative and professional as usual. I am always treated respectfully and enjoy the interaction with all the folks who work there as well as the Dripping Springs location.|So far I have only had an initial intake appointment but the office was great at getting me in ASAP to the location with the earliest availability with the understanding that future visits could be scheduled at one of their more convenient to me locations. They let me know the initial paperwork takes 45 minutes but after I was scheduled I was able to print and complete the paperwork from home so my wait time at the office was minimal. The front desk ladies were wonderful and supportive of each other (one gal was having her computer updated and the others made sure she could access what she needed until it was done). The medical assistant was patient, thorough and kind. The doctor was already well read on my situation (thank you PCP for sending a thoroughly written referral) and my visit was exactly what I expected. I know my plan of care and what to expect moving forward. I felt listened to and understood. I look forward to working with this doctor and clinic until I am well again.|She was a wonderful doctor. I had used her because my doctor was on vacation. She came out and personally met me in the hallway prior to going into the surgery room. She thanked me for my military service. And I gave her a few of my conditions while I was going to be there and she was very accepting
Highly recommended doctor, and even more, if you have anxiety or issues being in a surgery center, she provides a very calming atmosphere along with her staff. Highly recommended.|I was very pleased that the staff were able to get same day approval from my insurance, moving my injection appointment up into an appointment that was opened by a canceled appointment.  When you are eager for pain relief, this is a real gift.

Dr. Jarzombek is friendly and really cares.|Great experience on all 3 procedures. I hope the results are life changing for me! Thank you and all your team Dr. J|Greater Austin Pain Center -- Dripping Springs is a great medical provider, and Dr. Jarzombek is the best I have ever dealt with in her field of medicine.  The staff is courteous, and the nurses, PA -- all of them are wonderful.  They take the time to listen to me and deal with any concerns I may have, and put things in terms I understand.  It's so reassuring that I have people like them caring for my medical needs.  They are my favorite in all of my medical care!  Thanks to them for all they do|I just saw Dr. J this morning, as a new patient, and I don't think I have EVER met a more caring doctor. Very sweet!  And she listened to me!  I am honestly looking forward to seeing her next time.|The process went smoothly and everyone on intake and discharge was very nice. They also kept me updated on when I would be taken back.
Once I entered the procedure room, although everyone knew their tasks, and all went well, I had no idea what to expect. Finally I asked and someone answered, "I'm going to tell you. You'll feel a sharp pinch", (I did), and now some pressure, the meds going in, you're done"!
I have no idea who was talking or if a Doc or nurse preformed the procedure. No one introduced themselves. As I was being wheeled out, a person in the corner with head covering and mask turned and said, "Have a happy Thanksgiving". Maybe it was the Doc, maybe not. Couldn't tell.
I was wheeled to the recovery room, checked over, and then right outside and I walked to my car. Done.
This was my first visit and while all this may be normal, it seemed a bit impersonal to me. I had hoped to see the Doc either before or after as I had a couple questions, but, no.
I did ask, in the procedure room, how many of these they did in a day. Someone said up to about 40!
So... they herd them in an out pretty fast. But maybe do 35, and take a minute to say hi to the person on the table.

Ron Shimek

column40:
The Dr and the receptionist were very nice and friendly. Their scheduling department is a mess. The Dr told me they would call to schedule for my procedure within 2 weeks, never got a call, I did get a text (6 weeks later) telling me they got the order from the dr and would contact me soon. Never heard from them.  Got a call from them after 2 months telling me they needed to reschedule my follow up (I didn'teven know i had), I asked what the follow up was for and was told rudely that everyone has a follow up. I told her the procedure was never done and she argued with me! I attempted multiple times to contact the appointment line for procedures, was transferred to "my" scheduler, left multiple messages but they never called back. So frustrating, I finally gave up and won't ever be back.|Got my referral send from my doctor at md andersonn . Waited 9 days called the office lady told me they were waiting on paper work from other clinic waited 10 more days called back lady did not even know what was going on told her what last lady Said was told oh she don't know what she was talking about though I all ready was a patient and that I need to sign forms and wait for paper work  have been in pain going on a month waiting for this office witch has no idea what is going on now have to have my doctor give me another referral if I had 10 arms I would give this place 10 thumbs down they do not care about you as a person that only care if your insurance pays|The BEST patient portal communication ever!! I was really surprised how quickly they responded to my question. Literally less than 30 minutes. I am definitely using that way from now on.

Also, Dr. Jones is wonderful. I'm grateful for his kindness and patience with my 71 year old mom and helping her with relief from her chronic pain.|Dr Iyer is absolutely amazing. My Nina is almost 80 and for the first time  she had an amazing experience. She had stuff injected in her knee and it's always been a horrible experience anywhere she's had something done at. He was amazing! Highly recommend him!!!|I had a new patient appointment that I was 20 minutes early for. Filled out there multiple forms of repeat information. I sat in the waiting room for 40 minutes past my appointment time so I was there a total of 60 minutes. Everyone that was there before me and after me were seen. I sat there with no updates for 40 minutes. No one said anything to me. Then I heard someone say "is she still here did she leave yet". At that time I stood up said I wasn't waiting anymore and asked to reschedule. Two days later and the $161 dollars I paid has not been refunded. They are claiming it was a missed appointment. This office was a mess from the receptionist who wouldn't look me in the eye and was just rude to the statement by them that all the current doctors are leaving anyway and it will be all new staff February 1st. I wasn't told about all the doctors leaving until I went to reschedule, so I could've decided if I wanted  to see someone who was leaving or reschedule with another provider.
I do not recommend the Texas City location.|Doctors and nurse practitioners are great but the administration, medicine, and billing department is the worst in the business.  If the ball can be dropped they will drop it every time.  I know 6 different people go through the same thing I do with them every time.  Half the time they loose your results, late getting you your prescriptions.  P.s.  if you loose receipts don't ever pay with cash.  They also try to charge twice for visits and drug screens and I've had to prove from bank statements multiple times.  Also if you are over 10 min late they charge a no show fee of $50, but multiple times over the years I've got there early and waited over 2 1/2 hours to be seen.  If you talk to someone to make changes or communicate with the doctors to find out why your medications haven't been sent to the pharmacy which is pretty common, be sure you get the  name and location of whoever you talk to because as soon as you hang up the phone it will be like you never called and whatever they were supposed to make notes of or put into their system in regards to your call, chart, etc  won't be in the system. Constantly the worst infrastructure and accountability I've ever seen in any business.  There are multiple locations and I've been to four of them and all four are the same results.   I thought when they changed over from International Pain & Spine to Principal Pain and Spine it would get better but nothing has changed.|I have been going there for years now. I have something there is no cure for. In pain 24/7. I have always been treated with respect from Doctor Reyes to the two other what I would call PAs in pain management. Some times the office staff is not polite but those never seem to last long. The girls in there now seem just fine to me and I hope they stay and continue to be polite.  Hate to even be a patient but I do not have a choice and glad for this clinic!!! Good place!!!!!|Dr's don't care about the patient. They have re-scheduled my appointment over three times one because the doctor has an emergency and the other two they did not even could tell me why. The wait is extensive while you hear laughter in the back. Not professional at all. I do not recommend this set of doctors to anyone that want to be consider a patient . I don't see the health care not the health in this office. Just recently I was called by the office and they rescheduled my appointment. I took a day off and when I came to the office the lady said I was not scheduled. In the meantime I had to deal with the pain, pain management doctor really! No meds for over a month.  What's going on with our medical system.

column3:
Texas Pain Institute serves Denton, Texas and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of pain specialists provides personalized care for patients suffering from both acute and chronic pain conditions. With a patient-centered approach, we combine innovative treatments with compassionate care to help individuals regain control of their lives and reduce their suffering. Our state-of-the-art facility in Denton offers a comfortable environment where patients can receive the specialized attention they deserve.

At Texas Pain Institute, we understand that pain affects each person differently. Our specialists conduct thorough evaluations to identify the root causes of pain and develop customized treatment plans. We address a wide spectrum of painful conditions, including but not limited to back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, post-surgical pain, and complex regional pain syndrome. Our goal is not just to mask symptoms but to provide lasting relief that improves quality of life.

Our Approach to Pain Relief

We believe in a multidisciplinary approach to pain management that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, physical therapy recommendations, and lifestyle modifications. By treating the whole person rather than just the symptoms, we help our patients return to their daily activities with reduced pain and improved function. Our team stays current with the latest advancements in pain medicine to offer the most effective treatments available.

Visit Our Denton Location

Texas Pain Institute welcomes new patients at our convenient Denton office located at 1218 N Bonnie Brae St #102, Denton, TX 76201. Our facility is equipped with modern technology to provide accurate diagnoses and effective treatments in a comfortable setting. To schedule an evaluation or learn more about how we can help you manage your pain, call us at +1 817-730-9451 or visit our website at https://txpain.us/. Let us help you get back to living a quality life free from the limitations of chronic pain.
column11: We provide evaluations and treatments for painful conditions of all types, acute and chronic. We help our patients get back to living a quality life.

column38: Brenda Klein,Harris|Dagmar Sigrid Manon de Nijs - Blake|Shea Rose|Yvonne Perdue|Keisha Whitehead|Regina Perry|Roscoe D. Cawyer|Julie Kelsey
column40:
I have been to many doctors of all professions and in my own opinion Dr Alvarado is a great Dr he listens to me he always treats me with respect and kindness I usually only wait 5 min most times and at most only 15 min now that's a lot due to the office staff scheduling patients correctly as I have been to some doctors whom I've literally waited from 1pm to 6pm to only be seen basically in glancing. There's always plenty of parking and the offices and rest rooms are very clean. It sounds to me like most of these other reviewers must have went in the wrong entrance lol. Thank you all Dr Alvarado and staff.|I have been going to the Texas Pain Institute for 3 years now. My first Doctor was Dr. Alvarado, he left for Arizona. Although Dr. Alvarado was my first pain doctor that really helped me when he left Dr. Aggrawal (the head doctor became my new pain advisor and pain doctor.) I was nervous at first, now he has also become one of my favorite pain doctors. (I have had pain doctors since 2011) I would recommend Texas Pain Institute.

New update: September 9, 2024 -- this office was one of the best! Now trying to get an appointment in Denton is like pulling teeth. Also, there has been  a problem with my prior authorization of medicine (That I had for years) and cannot get a hold of anyone to call us back or help us. I assume the only way to get help is to go to whatever location the office people are that day. I don't know what to do anymore. The government rulings about chronic pain have become the maze of mazes.|If I could give less than a 1 star I would. I went to Dr A for about 5 years and then they hired Christopher Humphrey. From the moment I met him he was argumentative told me that I looked "worried" without even introducing himself. Talks down to women. He seems to be a very very unhappy person. Warning - this PA will make sure that you are no longer able to see a pain management doctor again. Be aware and stay away from Christopher Humphrey. They will make up lies saying that your urine test are negative so they can no longer treat you. He has no concern or care about an individual being in chronic pain.|I have to say that after all the pain doctors I have seen through the years Dr. Alvarado has been the best most professional understanding and compassionate dr I have seen. He actually explains the whole situation to where you can understand the treatment he is wanting to go with. He won't push surgery on you unless it is the last option. I've been seeing him for the last 5 yrs and he has done more to help control my pain including placing a spinal cord stimulator in and finally had me on the right medication to help control the pain. I also have to say that he was so very compassionate and caring when I was diagnosed with cancer and he totally would work with me if I couldn't come in due to being so sick from the chemo he would work with me and let me come in when I was feeling good enough to come in for my follow ups. We need more drs like him but it's sad to say he has left the TPI office and he will be surely missed. The new dr that came in isn't as caring or understanding of my situation and is very rude and doesn't take time to explain or even listen to your concerns on certain issues you may be having. Unfortunately now I have been forced to find a new dr due to they informed me that they do not take my insurance as of 2yrs ago but yet they've been seeing me with no problems until yesterday and the new staff in front were extremely rude and wouldn't even help me with suggesting how to be able to help me in what to do to continue being able to see them, or what I could do to find a new dr. They just said you will not be seen again there and basically don't try to go through them for anything. Nothing like feeling helpless and being thrown out to the wolves! I most definitely will not recommend this office to any of my friends that need a professional dr to help with their pain. Now I'm stuck with no pain management routine and stuck with a stimulator in my back with no chance of getting help with it anymore. Very disappointed in how fast this office has gone downhill in the last couple of months! Good luck to anyone who can actually get the help they need from them. I gave a five star rating while Dr. Alvarado was there, but now in my opinion I would give it a 2!|Dr. Alvarado is the greatest!! Very nice, friendly, warm and inviting. He actually listens if you have concerns/problems and really advocates for his patients and not just a pill pusher. The front office staff is also great. They are very friendly and helpful. If you have a schedule change or billing questions, they'll find you an answer before you leave the office.
Seriously the greatest doctor's office.|Dr. Alvarado and his staff are amazing, however, I had a really horrible experience with his male PA. He was argumentative, spoke aggressively as well as condescending to me. He was defensive and threatening even going so far as to tell me I need a med clinic, not their office because if I'm not willing to do a more invasive procedure such as surgery that they have every right to stop prescribing my meds. I have been on the same meds for years, and they work. I'm not taking any kind of hard core opiate, and I have never run out of meds, go to all my appointments, and am always engaged in my care. The way he treated me was despicable, and as a former nurse, not how we're tought to treat our patients...as if they were one of our own family members! It makes me wonder how he treats the elderly that come in and can't stand up for themselves or even know the right questions to ask! Because of my medical knowledge, and previous experience with pain management and this office specifically, I was able to call him on some of the things he told me, and I've refused to see him in the future. He talks a good game, but he's rude, disrespectful, and clearly in the WRONG career!|I have been a patient of Dr. Alvarado's for 3+ years (Shirley Cawyer ) (above is my husband)  He has helped give my life back.  He surgically implanted an intrathecal pain pump in 2019 and my quality of life has greatly improved.  I am so thankful to you Dr. Alvarado.  I am sorry to say I cannot give such glowing reviews of the rest of his staff.  The front office is like a revolving door. Of course I have been a patient during the pandemic and that could have something to do with it.  Dr could be a better communicator.  I didn't understand what Drs policy on Rx refills and requests were.  That could have been smoother.   I don't know if he thought I knew more than I knew.  I should have come to my visit prepared with all the questions and concerns I had.  It has taken a while to get to the "sweet spot" with my therapy.  I am sorry he is moving.  Denton patients will sorely miss him.|Dr. Alvarado and his staff have always been really great with me. His bedside manner is awesome. He makes you feel really comfortable. He really cares about you being able to manage your pain! I recommend him to anyone needing to manage their pain. A great doctor, a great staff and they have always been able to give me the appointment I needed. Definitely 5 out of 5 stars.

column3:
Texas Interventional Pain & Spine Specialists (TIPSS) serves Victoria, Texas and surrounding communities with comprehensive interventional pain management solutions. Under the expert guidance of Dr. Umar Mahmood, TIPSS delivers personalized treatment plans designed to address chronic pain conditions and improve patients' quality of life. The practice combines advanced diagnostic techniques with innovative therapeutic interventions to target the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms.

Dr. Umar Mahmood brings exceptional credentials to his practice as the lead physician at TIPSS. He is board certified in Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation and has completed specialized fellowship training in Interventional Pain Medicine. Dr. Mahmood's educational journey includes graduating from Midwestern University - Chicago College of Osteopathic Medicine, followed by residency training at NYU Langone Medical School—ranked among the top 10 residency programs nationwide. His expertise was further refined through fellowship training at New England Baptist Hospital, a prestigious teaching affiliate of Tufts University School of Medicine.

Comprehensive Services

At TIPSS, patients benefit from a wide range of interventional procedures and treatment modalities tailored to address various pain conditions. The practice specializes in both acute and chronic pain management, offering solutions for back pain, neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic conditions, and complex regional pain syndromes. Treatment options may include epidural steroid injections, facet joint interventions, spinal cord stimulation, radiofrequency ablation, and other advanced techniques.

Patient-Centered Approach

What distinguishes TIPSS is their commitment to patient-centered care. Each treatment plan is customized based on thorough evaluations and the latest evidence-based practices. The team takes time to educate patients about their conditions and treatment options, ensuring they are active participants in their recovery journey.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation with Dr. Mahmood and the TIPSS team, patients can visit their office located at 2700 Citizen Dr Ste 207, Victoria, TX 77901. For appointments or inquiries, call +1 361-360-3264 or visit their website at painandspinetx.com for more information about services and treatment options.
column11: Dr. Umar Mahmood is board certified in Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation and fellowship trained in Interventional Pain Medicine. Dr. Mahmood completed medical school at Midwestern University - Chicago College of Osteopathic Medicine. He then underwent his residency training at NYU Langone Medical School, ranked as one of the top 10 residency programs in the nation. After completing his residency, he then completed his fellowship training in pain medicine at New England Baptist Hospital, a teaching affiliate of Tufts University School of Medicine.

column40:
Dr. Mahmood and his staff are wonderful!  He is a good listener and works with you on your pain treatment plan.  The staff is always smiling and is helpful in any way needed.  I can't say enough about Dr. Mahmood and his staff.|I am a type 1 diabetic and my sugar was very low during my 1st appointment and the staff was more than helpful and assisted me with candy because I had nothing on me at the time , I come from out of town and I can't thank the ladies in the front enough for being so patient and helpful with me. It's never a long wait. Dr Mahmood and his PA work so well together to make me feel so comfortable with all my health issues and procedures,  they make sure to explain everything to me in depth, so grateful for the whole team at Texas Interventional Pain & Spine. People like that really make the difference in health medicine! They are the reason I make the 2 hour trip every month!|Absolutely love this place , all the girls are so very nice !!! The nurse treats me as if she's known me forever. When your hurting they make you better !!!!!! Dr.Mahmood is greatly appreciated thank yall for caring|Dr. Mahmood and his team have been a saving grace for me.  When I arrived to Dr. Mahmood's office due to a workout injury that left me with a bulging disc pressing on my S1 nerve, I was walking with a cane.  It was one of the lowest moments of my life, I have always been active and fit.  Dr. Mahmood and his team gave me the confidence I needed to start my healing journey.  His treatment plans are realistic and attainable.  After my second treatment my cane was officially gone!! Although, my recovery is still a work in progress (nerves take time to heal) I would recommend Dr. Mahmood to anyone suffering from pain.  He truly takes his time to listen to his patients and really wants the best outcome for them.  He and his staff are true professionals!|Great Dr. and staff, he has controlled my pain and listens to your needs to control pain.

Great staff|Absolutely love the staff and Dr. Mahmood! They have been a saving grace and treat you with compassion!|Grateful for Dr. Mahmood and his friendly team. He listens carefully and explains the treatment options thoroughly. Victoria is blessed to have a spine specialist with his expertise and genuine care.|Worse place ever......ridiculous wait time of 2 or more hours and staff is very rude and unprofessional

column3:
Advanced Pain Care serves Georgetown, TX and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions since 2002. Under the leadership of Dr. Malone and a team of dedicated pain specialists, the practice has grown to become a premier destination for patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. With an extensive network of 15 locations, 4 surgery centers, 3 pharmacies, and a specialized physical therapy clinic throughout the region, Advanced Pain Care has established itself as a trusted healthcare provider committed to improving patients' quality of life.

The medical team at Advanced Pain Care specializes in treating a wide spectrum of pain-related conditions, including post-surgical pain, cancer-related discomfort, degenerative disc disease, joint disease, fibromyalgia, migraines, and musculoskeletal issues. Patients suffering from specific pain in the back, shoulder, hip, neck, sacroiliac joint, or experiencing sciatica or spinal complications can find expert care tailored to their unique needs. The practice's multidisciplinary approach ensures that each patient receives personalized treatment plans designed to address the root cause of their pain.

Georgetown Location Specialists

At the Georgetown clinic located at 3316 Williams Dr #150, patients can schedule appointments with Dr. Allen Dennis, a pain management specialist focusing on chronic pain and neuropathy. For those with rheumatological conditions, Dr. Samuel B. Pegram offers expert care in diagnosing and treating autoimmune and inflammatory disorders. This dual specialization in both Pain Management and Rheumatology allows Advanced Pain Care to address interconnected conditions that often contribute to chronic pain.

Additional Specialized Programs

Advanced Pain Care demonstrates its commitment to responsible pain management through its Opioid Stewardship program available at the South Austin and Round Rock locations. This initiative focuses on appropriate medication management while exploring alternative treatment options. The practice also recognizes the psychological aspects of chronic pain by offering Behavioral Health services, creating a truly integrated approach to pain management that addresses both physical and emotional well-being.

To schedule an appointment or learn more about available treatments, patients can visit austinpaindoctor.com or call +1 512-244-4272. The Georgetown office welcomes patients at 3316 Williams Dr #150, Georgetown, TX 78628.
column9: Medical clinic|Neurosurgeon|Pain control clinic|Pain management physician|Rehabilitation center|Rheumatologist|Surgical center

Book an appointment at our Georgetown, TX clinic with our Pain Management Doctor, Dr. Allen Dennis for chronic pain & neuropathy or our Rheumatologist - Dr. Samuel B. Pegram. column40:
The staff there are super nice, Tiffany from radiology is stellar. She is that kind of person that comes off as genuine, selfless and has an ability to make you feel great. Her spirit is infectious and incredible. Chris is my provider, he is attentive and thorough. He is easy to talk to and always addresses my concerns. I was moved around from provider to provider for a while until I landed with him. I am extremely happy with him and he was worth the wait to get to. The office is eager to help with appointments. I actually forgot an appointment one day even with being reminded. I was notified and I felt so dumb. I was seen the very next day as they were able to squeeze me in. I am only doing 4 stars because the first provider I saw wasn't agreeable to me. She came off as snobby and didn't want to listen to what I was saying. I addressed this with the office manager and I haven't had to deal with her again. Sometimes when you lodge a complaint you can be labeled a troublesome patient. I was nervous this would happen at Advance pain care. I assure you this is not the case. They all treat me with dignity and care. Please do not forget about Tiffany. Say hi to her. She will brighten your day. She certainly brightened mine, even though I was sad and depressed just receiving news my father was rushed to the Hospital by an ambulance. I did not let them know this was weighing on me, so it makes Tiffany's warm nature and ability to help people seem so much more profound.|I can not believe this location has a 4.6?
I waited 45 minutes in the room while listening to laughing, and personal conversations.
The nurse's aid asked if I could leave a sample, and I said I need some water. She said she'd bring me some then walked out. After 20 minutes I just fill my cup up from the sink in the room and started drinking water. Once I finally had to go, I asked where the restroom was at and was directed.
Walking through the sea of staff just talking and chatting it up, (which to me, Ive never seen anything like it). It was like a house party. I think it's rude especially when the people that are there are sick, and in pain. It was a very unprofessional environment. I went and left a sample walked back through the sea of employees, looked at the nurse's aid chatting it up with another employee and went back to the room but left the door open to get some air and to hopefully remind them I was waiting. At 40 minutes I went up to the counter to ask what the hold up was? I was told I'm next. I went back to the room and sat down. The nurse's aid walked in and said the PA would be here shortly. I looked at here and said, did you forget to bring my water? She said, I was on the phone. I knew that was a straight up lie because I walked right by her while she was laughing and talking to a coworker. She didn't even offer me water. It was like the conversation never happened.
When the PA came in she apologized for the wait. I didn't say anything. She asked what hurts? I said nothing has changed. She didn't even know what is wrong with me. She continued to ask me what hurts? She didn't know 1 single thing about my condition.
Then she turned into a used car salesperson try to shove procedure down my throat. We discussed treatment of steroid injection which does help temporarily but I told her I don't want to do it if my insurance won't pay for it because I just has prostate surgery which the insurance approved initially but then after, I had it denied, so I have to pay for it. She said the insurance would pay but they needed another MRI. I told her I have to get an MRI and CT scan next week for my prostate and I don't want to do another MRI. She said fair enough. She had a look on her face like she lost a sale. Like she failed a sale.
As of today 2/6/25 my RX medication is supposed to be refilled. I called the pharmacy before they closed and they said your doctor hasn't sent anything in. This HAS NEVER HAPPENED.
I'm really glad that at least I have medication to get me through until I can call the doctor tomorrow.
This place is 100%  AN ABSOLUTE JOKE.
( with the exception of the front desk).
I'll never go to this location again. My normal office was short staffed so I went to this location.
I've been to the Cedar Park, and Round Rock location and they are awesome.
If you are sick and in pain DO NOT GO HERE. I felt like I was treated like cattle, and some idiot.
I'm writing this 3 hours after this experience and I'm still upset.|I have been a patient at Advanced Pain Care  (APC) off and on for a number of years. I have been treated for the following issues: fractured vertebrae, open wound VAC healing/debreadment as well as extreme muscle pain.  I have found everyone with whom I've come in contact to be enormously attentive, concerned, and dedicated to helping me through my issues. I'd like to highlight the attention I receive regularly from Nurse Destiny, and the Physicians Assistant named Chris.   Thank You APC, Georgetown!|Great rheumatologists but the billing takes forever still dealing with an infusion billing issue since 4/11/24 it is now 10/15/24. They set me up with a copay program and I've basically had to make every call to them to figure out how to get reimbursed because they wanted to bill me for something the copay program covers. I keep calling and they say they will do it but I have yet to see it done.|Advanced Pain Care in Georgetown Is absolutely the best. We moved to Georgetown six years ago. I was leaving beloved doctors that I had had for over 25 years. I wanted someone closer to where I live now and I needed a Rheumatologist. I saw Dr. Pegram and he took the time and cared for me like he had known me for a very long time. I have seen other doctors and P.A.'s  there as well and they are all amazing. In the past when I've left their office, I thought about doing a review. I've never done one anywhere., , but today was an exceptional experience. Their computers were down and there were several people waiting to get checked in. Emma was at the front desk and she took care of each one of us like she always does, she's calm under fire and always has a smile. I still got in on time and left on time. Each person in the office I've met is special, I think they're all there for a reason. They all are compassionate and do everything that they can to help people feel better. They see people who are hurting with chronic pain with heavy hearts and for a lot of us, it took all they could do-just to get there that day. They don't get good sleep, they're fatigued and have been in pain for years and every single day is hard, just to get through the day. They understand THAT , they care and they work with you to help you. They can only do as much as we can tell them and try to explain what is going on with us and sometimes we just don't have the words. Nikki (Dr. Pegram's (M.A.) ) is always amazing. She helps me find those words and then she helps me feel better. I wonder how many stories they hear like mine and how much pain they see every day, I am so thankful for them. Through the years since I've been here, I have been slowly feeling better and better. Today when I left the office, I realized, that I feel better now - Than when all of this fibromyalgia and rheumatoid arthritis started so long ago.  I was in my 30s when I first got fibromyalgia and rheumatoid arthritis. For 30 years, I've been living in pain, chronic pain, Which brought on depression and each day I was just trying to get through day. I'm 66 now and for all this time I have felt old and tired, like I was 100. Today I'm going to go play with my great grand-babies and see my friends and  go for a walk with my husband. Advanced Pain Care and the people who work there have given me back my life and I can't tell you how good that feels.
I'm always so cautious of peoples time and try to keep things short. I know everyone's time is precious. I'm sorry,  but I don't care if this is so long.  The people at that office changed my life, day by day and year by year.
I talked to Daniel today. He's the manager,  and just seeing his smile melts your heart, and he keeps everything running like a well oiled clock. Andrea usually checks me out and again with a smile. Today Tiffany checked me out, they were overloaded because she usually does x-rays. She's wonderful, I could go on, but now I'm feeling guilty, but I have to mention Dr. Dennis and his staff, Stephanie and Shannon , And the 15 other people that make that office work. I haven't met them all but I see them working. and again, I am so thankful for each of them. If you've been hurting, you don't have to , or at least not that bad.  There are things they can do. They can help you if you give them a chance. It breaks my heart to see so much pain. They are a family of compassionate and caring professionals that truly want to do all they can to help you. I started feeling better in little ways, just helping me to sleep better and have a little bit more energy. It seems like it's just baby steps, but in time when you look back , You will be able to see the difference. I hope you can give yourself the gift of going to Advanced Pain Care for help, and give it time because I promise it will help.
I'm done, gotta go  
Thank you, thank you to each and everyone of you working at Advanced Pain Care. You are a hard-working, compassionate, and special group of people and I am so thankful that you are there.|This team is amazing, PA Jordan Waldron has given my life back to me, she's an awesome person. With all the hard work and determination shown by the entire staff and group of DRs, I feel like a new person. I've been treated with nothing but respect, listened to, cared about, and they have helped me when others brushed me to the side. I truly appreciate all the care the entire staff has shown and would wholeheartedly recommend them to anyone looking for a great group of people trying to help.|I love it here. I love all the staff. They really listen, very helpful, do what they can to help you, polite, always seems happy. Best place I've ever been. Southwest Pain Management serves Irving, TX and surrounding areas as the premier destination for comprehensive pain management solutions. Our specialized team combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care to address a wide range of chronic and acute pain conditions. With years of dedicated service to the Irving community, we've established ourselves as trusted pain relief specialists committed to improving our patients' quality of life through personalized treatment plans and innovative therapies.

At Southwest Pain Management, we offer a comprehensive suite of treatments designed to address various pain conditions affecting our patients:

Sciatica Treatment

Our specialized sciatica treatment protocols target nerve compression and inflammation along the sciatic pathway, providing relief from radiating leg pain, numbness, and weakness. We utilize both conservative approaches and advanced interventional techniques to address the root causes of sciatic discomfort.

Carpal Tunnel Syndrome Treatment

We provide effective solutions for carpal tunnel syndrome, including specialized hand exercises, wrist splinting, anti-inflammatory treatments, and minimally invasive procedures when necessary to relieve median nerve pressure and restore hand function.

Joint Pain Treatment

Our joint pain management strategies incorporate cutting-edge therapies including targeted injections, physical therapy recommendations, and innovative regenerative approaches to address arthritis, sports injuries, and degenerative conditions affecting joints throughout the body.

Long COVID Treatments

Recognizing the emerging challenges of post-COVID pain syndromes, we offer specialized treatment protocols for patients experiencing persistent pain and discomfort following COVID-19 infection, addressing both physical symptoms and their impact on daily functioning.

Anesthesia Services

Our team provides expert anesthesia services for pain management procedures, ensuring patient comfort and safety throughout interventional treatments while minimizing recovery time and side effects.

Why Choose Southwest Pain Management

Patients throughout Irving and neighboring communities trust Southwest Pain Management for our patient-centered approach, board-certified specialists, and commitment to utilizing the latest evidence-based techniques. We work closely with each individual to develop customized treatment plans that address their specific pain concerns while focusing on functional improvement and enhanced quality of life.

Contact Information

Location: 220 O'Connor Ridge Blvd #105, Irving, TX 75038

Phone: +1 214-305-8004

Website: https://reliefbeginshere.com/

If you're searching for "pain management near me," "sciatica treatment near me," or "anesthesia services near me" in Irving, TX, contact Southwest Pain Management today to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward effective pain relief.

I am hopeful about what his protocols can do.|Dr. Groysman & his team are so wonderful.  I came in for 2 SGB's and an EAT procedure.  I flew in and felt so comfortable with the staff.  I got some relief from my long covid and dysautonomia as well!  I came back the next day for an ANS test and you couldn't ask for a more knowledgeable doctor and staff who have experience!|When I first engaged with Dr. Groysman I was at the point of desperation due to intense long Covid symptoms. Before seeing him I had seen numerous doctors who were unable to provide much help. Some of their recommendations actually made me more sick. Dr. Groysman developed a treatment protocol specific to my situation and my needs. I'm not being dramatic when I say with these treatments I have been resurrected.
I'm no longer struggling with debilitating cognitive, emotional and physical fatigue. My crushing headaches, head pressure and tinnitus are gone. The horrible cough that kept me from sleeping for more than a year and a half is gone. My body feels like I'm alive again.
I still have to pace myself as my body continues to heal. But it's simply life changing to be able to hold a conversation without feeling as if I'm going to collapse, to enjoy cooking again, walk my puppy, grocery shop, or go to the nursery.
Thank you Dr. G and your amazing staff. You saved my life!|Dr. Groysman patiently listened and made great suggestions during a telemed visit. column40: I met with the nurse on my first appointment who made it clear medication is not the answer. That immediately through me off! The doctor came in and had me stand, wal, bend over and stick my hands out to test strength. He literally said one sentence to me. They immediately placed me on list to have numerous injections with no anesthesia unless I paid $100 cash everytime. I was given a minimal dose of an opioid and muscle relaxers. I went ahead with the first injection without the costly anesthesia. It hurt so bad for weeks. I've had chronic pain since I was in my late twenties. Several accidents, severe arthritis, Lupus pain, Connective Tissue Disease and osteoporosis. Every part of my body hurts 24/7. I don't remember ever not having pain! It's horrible! I continued going in against my better judgement. I believe it was my 5th visit at 9am. I literally got out of bed, dressed, brushed my teeth and used my listening as I have for 40 years, did my hair and makeup. Got there did my urine test and 45 minutes later get called in the back that my urine test was positive for alot and recent alcohol. I don't drink and haven't since I tried a drink when I was 17. Hated it and never drank again. There were the nurse, an office worker and finally the doctor all in my face interrogating me. I told them only thing it could of been was my listerine and I don't drink it I swish it. Doctor said swishing listerine wasnt strong enough to show up in pee. I was livid! I asked for another pee test because they pile all these pee cups on the counter with a stick in it right close together.  My guess someone made a mistake during the test. I asked for another test and they said no but to feel free to go elsewhere and pay out of pocket which I didn't have so I left with no prescription and feeling down. About 9 months-a year later I had been sick with covid then pneumonia. I was given antibiotics and the cough pearls tesla I think. They also called in another liquid medication for my cough. I called the pain management office told them what was happening. Also, had to leave a message for the nurse. I took exactly 2 doses of the liquid medicine and she called me told me not to take it anymore and bring it to them mind you I'm still sick. I told her I could not come until I was over the pneumonia and covid. She then told the doctor and by being sick as hell I wasn't supposed to take anything unless they approved first. I was released as a patient for being severely ill. This place is a joke! They push the injections and want to charge for anesthesia for injections. They really don't give much meds to help your pain. And, in my opinion they need to be closed down! Period.|I been seeing Dr Chouteau since 2014. I have been pleased with her care as well as her staff. She gives back injections and I do not use any anesthesia besides the local to numb where she puts the needle in. What a magician.|The young girl working at the front desk she's been so polite and very professional and she touched my heart from listening to me on the computer working with Empower I just want to say thank you you have made a difference in my life and thank you for caring. Sincerely Mr Pete Rivas from Wichita Falls Texas she's only been their for only 6 months again thank you  have a wonderful Christmas and a Happy New Year|Dr.Morsy is disrespectful and unprofessional. He only assessed my problem area for one second and pushed way too hard even though I was there for pain in that area and it was very tender. No bed side manner. No respect for his patients. He's a bad listener! I had to repeat the same things over and over to him! He medically gaslights and talks down to you, being very condescending and confrontational. He was very argumentative. I was there for a completely different nerve than the one he wanted to schedule for injection. He kept looking at his watch the whole time!! Rude! I will go somewhere else.|I was very pleased to meet the Dr Elhady, she was the best Dr I ever met,  the reason I am putting my review because of lack of communication with their staff with the patient. I was out of pocket patient and being very bad pain after consulting the Dr she prescribed medication but after 3 days I tried to contact the Dr office to pass my message that I am not getting relief for my pain. But unfortunately despite I am keep contacting the Dr office with their staff I didn't hear from them,  every time they said all staff are busy. It's very surprising for me not a single person contact me and I got another email for my next appointment. How can an out of pocket patient can pay such a big money all the time, so I have decided to find another Dr. But I must say that there is a big lack of communication with their department which creates really bad impression. I already sent an email to the Director of business as well.  Very disappointed|Dr. Alex Golden has truly been an answer to my prayers! I recently relocated to Texas from out of state, and as many of you who are  reading this know, it is often a challenge to get a new pain management team set up to meet your needs. Dr. Golden not only recognized my previous plan but added several new modalities. Also, she is very gifted when administering injections. Additionally, the support staff is knowledgeable, professional and caring! Even the phone support team is an A++++! Thank you, Dr. Golden for your compassionate care!!|Dr. Dalya Elhady is a caring, compassionate, and very learned medical professional and surgeon. She recently placed an SCS implant in my back to in an effort to help reduce the need for oral medications and injections. It seems that a lot of people are leaving negative reviews and complaining about her cutting their meds back. Dr. Elhady's desire to help people deal with chronic pain without a constant and/or increasing need for opioids is not only her desire to do what's in the best interest of the patient, but also to treat patients in accordance with government regulations that are beyond her control.|Arrived on Friday at 2:00pm for a 2:15pm appointment for medication refill. There were quite a few other people in the waiting room. I ended up waiting until 3:00pm to go back into a room. After speaking with the medical assistant, I ended up waiting another 30 minutes for the doctor to show up. We went over what the next steps were. And was told he would send in refill my medication.When I went to check out (4:00pm) I asked how long it would take for my pharmacy to receive the prescription. I was told he has until the end of day, at 5pm. Ok, I understand. We'll 5 o'clock came and passed. I called back up and left a message at 6pm. Didn't receive a call back. At 9ish, I messaged the doctor on the portal stating my pharmacy never received the prescription. It's now the next day, Saturday. Wouldn't you know the offices are closed until Monday. I understand sometimes you have to wait a while to see the doctor. However I shouldn't have to wait 3 days for a prescription. I had a very unprofessional experience, that quite literally left me in pain.

Everyone is nice and very willing to answerany and all questions. I have had nothing but the best experiences coming here. I wish I had them 10 years ago when I 1st had my accident.|My experience with spine and pain clinic was absolutely outstanding, the staff was very friendly and helpful Dr. Mohammed Arif was very nice. I highly recommend Spine and Joint Clinic.|OMG!! I can't believe how simple and unpainful my procedure was. Without any anesthesia!!! Dr. Arif Muhammed told me I had nothing to worry about and he was Right!!! I've been put under anesthesia for so many years for my procedures, and didn't feel comfortable not having being put to sleep. Now, I'm just in Awwwww. Thank You to all employees at this clinic......IF YOU'RE HAVING IN BACK, KNEE, SHOULDER, BONE PROBLEMS THIS IS THE PLACE TO COME|Dr Arif is an awesome  dr as he listen to what you tell him and show him where exactly  the pain is located  in my back and help me reduce  the pain I just wish we can fix it completely  and be pain free. Thanks Dr Arif  Deb|I went to see Dr Arif 2 months ago for chronic pelvic pain that I've been dealing with after years of pain and adenomyosis & endometriosis after my old doctors practice was shut down. As we all know, gaslighting of women in medicine is a huge issue and this doctor is no different. First of all, i am not permitted to take NSAIDs and also have to be extremely careful of steroids because of a previous stomach surgery and ulcer risks, and was told at my first appointment he understood this and that hed prescribe some rescue meds for days when my pain is unbearable. Not only was i not prescribed anything, at my next appointment 2 weeks later, i was given an injection in my hip (which is NOT the source of my pain) and told that it would "make my pain go away." When i asked what was in the injection, i was not given a clear answer and had to google, only to find out that i was injected with steroids after i was explicit that i was not comfortable with steroid injections because of possible systemic effects. Not surprisingly, my chronic soft tissue pelvic pain was not fixed by this injection and in fact it caused me additional pain in my hip for several days that wasnt there previously. Dr Arif, if youre reading this, do not insult my intelligence. I am not dumb, and your gaslighting is not okay.
To make it worse, I was referred to your practice by a friend who did receive at home pain management medications, but he is a man so I guess his pain is more legitimate than mine? Is that what it is? I understand the difficulties faced with prescribing medication, but if you were not going to do that then be honest with your patients. Do not waste my time and money and send me on my way.
I left your office feeling defeated, with more pain in a place I never had pain to begin with, and angry because I was injected with something I told you I wasn't comfortable with. Not okay. I didn't even receive the back brace you insisted on, which also by the way doesn't begin to address my pain but I was willing to try everything just to get help. I will not be coming back, and if you are a woman with chronic pain that may be considered "invisible" (pain that is apparently comparable to a heart attack) DO NOT GO HERE. This doctor is a joke. Again, do not I insult my intelligence.|I visited with Dr. Arif today for spinal pain and arthritis of the neck. He is a very compassionate and knowledgeable Doctor. I would highly recommended him based on my experience.|The best Pain Clinic I've ever been to!! Trust me when I say the Doctor and the entire staff is knowledgeable and they listen to your needs and put a plan of action in place that you agree to. They care! I was treated with respect and they were compassionate and kind!! We will continue to travel from McKinney just because of how wonderful they are! Switch pain Doctors to Spine and Pain Clinic of Texas in Plano! Don't wait!! Awesome care!|My first visit with Spine&Pain clinic in Plano, TX with Dr. Muhammad Arif was great. He was amazingly perceptive of the pain I was feeling and immediately healed my discomfort.  I appreciate his professionalism, and advice for alleviating my particular health concerns. He was clear and precise in the diagnosis of my ailment. I felt comfortable with his excellent skill. Thank you!

Likewise, I commend Christopher who worked with Dr. Arif. He was helpful in processing my paperwork expeditiously.

PAINnovations Fort Worth, Texas serves as a premier destination for those seeking relief from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our specialized pain management clinic combines cutting-edge interventional techniques with compassionate care to address a wide spectrum of pain-related issues. Founded by Double Board Certified Anesthesiologists, our practice has rapidly established itself as the leading choice for comprehensive pain treatment in the Fort Worth metropolitan area.

At PAINnovations, we understand that pain affects every aspect of your life. That's why our mission is to provide comprehensive pain management using a multidisciplinary approach designed to improve your quality of life and increase functionality. Unlike traditional physical therapy centers that may offer limited relief, our clinic emerged specifically to address the needs of patients whose pain persists despite conventional treatments.

Specialized Expertise

Each of our Double Board Certified Anesthesiologists brings extensive training and expertise to your care. We utilize the most advanced and latest treatment modalities to create customized treatment plans tailored to your specific condition and needs. Our physicians specialize in minimally invasive procedures that target the source of your pain with precision, promoting healing while minimizing recovery time.

Patient-Centered Care

PAINnovations has quickly earned a reputation among patients, doctors, and other healthcare professionals as simply the best place to be treated for pain symptoms. Our patient-centered approach ensures that you receive individualized attention and a treatment strategy that addresses your unique circumstances. We take pride in helping our patients return to activities they love without the burden of chronic pain.

Every time I have an appointment I am seen promptly and my concerns have been addressed. I have also had several procedures and am quite satisfied with their procedure staff and also with their front desk ladies. I highly recommend Dr. Skulpoonkitti.|After 19 months of being in excruciating pain and being referred everywhere, I found pain innovations.  After the initial eval and the first treatment I was pain free.  The staff, Drs and PA are wonderful, and professional.  I returned for a different pain and that was resolved with 1 treatment.  These people are miracle workers.  They are the ones to go to for pain relief.|Upon first impression the building appears redone and painted boldly dark on the exterior (which is not typical of a clinic) however when you walk in the space is very bright. There is one TV in the waiting room.  Dr. Lee is very kind and compassionate and ensures that you understand what he has identified and diagnosed. He takes his time to make sure that you understand and are very clear in the medication process. If you arrive during their lunch hour, the sliding glass window at reception is closed which makes it seem like nobody is there but they open promptly after lunch and take care of you. Thank you Dr. Lee.|Have really helped manage my pain. I don't get my pain meds there. Get shots. They offered to manage my meds but I get what I need from primary care doctor and don't want to change. Very nice and not a long wai|I'm 61 years old and have chronic back pain I've had a fusion, injections, therapy you name it I've done. I met with Dr Lee today for the first time and I learned more from him in my hour long office visit than I have my entire life about my back pain! He was very personable and his explanation of terms were amazing. Right when I walked in the door I was greeted with "Good Morning" and smiles from the entire crew. I didn't even wait 10 minutes before they called me back to the room Folks you just don't get service like that these days!  This is a 5 Star rating from me|They've moved to a different location and didn't tell their patients. Address on their website is not correct. That's the level of care you can expect from them.|This experience with this office is quite exceptional. Dr. Lee is the most compassionate  person I have ever met. All of his procedures have been very successful in relieving  my pain. The staff has been very nice and professional.|Firstly Dr Lee is great. He is compassionate and listens and also takes time to inform you of exactly what is happening.
My only issue with the clinic is a misrepresentation of insurance in network services. I was casually asked to sign a form when checking out of my 1st appointment consenting to pay the anesthesiologist bill if not covered by my insurance. I was uncomfortable signing and stated at the time that I would like all services to be in network and was told that they would confirm that along with a total $ for procedure.
Over 3 weeks I have called 3 times.
2 days before the procedure was booked for I called again to request a total and to confirm that the anesthesiologist was in network.
After speaking to 3 very nice people it turns out they do not have nor ever did have an in network anesthesiologist and I would be responsible for a max out of pocket of $400.
I was told about third party billing, new set of code and rules etc which I'm sure all apply. My disappointment is that this was never explained to me despite repeated phone calls requesting the info until I had to insist 2 days before my procedure. My advice to anyone that is looking to use this clinic is to confirm the services and billing ahead of time and DO NOT FEEL PRESSURED into signing a form agreeing to pay for anything out of network if you are uncomfortable and without the cost up front. You are entitled to this by law.
