Dr. Gordon & Dr. Shah are the finest doctors I have ever known. They are very compassionate and knowledgeable.  The staff is great too.  These jobs aren't easy because patients with chronic pain are often depressed and hopeless which makes them hard to work with sometimes.  I highly recommend Utah Pain Specialists.|Dr Shah has been my Doctor since 2004 when I was referred by a surgeon to see him. I was at the time active duty and sustained a back injury. Surgery at time wasn't a something that I wanted to do and so I decided to see if he could help. He took the time to listen and assess the issues I was experiencing. I have went from a pain level of 10 to a 2 and able to function in my job in construction to this day. Omega Interventional Pain Clinic serves South Salt Lake, Utah and surrounding communities with specialized pain management solutions. Our dedicated team of pain specialists employs advanced diagnostic techniques and innovative treatment protocols to identify and address the root causes of chronic and acute pain conditions. At Omega Interventional Pain, we understand that pain is a complex and deeply personal experience, which is why we develop customized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique circumstances and medical history.

We are constantly working to find the cause of your pain, recognizing that effective treatment begins with accurate diagnosis. Your specific pain may come from any number of causes—whether it's spinal conditions, joint disorders, nerve damage, or post-surgical complications. It is our goal not only to find these causes but also to provide you with meaningful pain relief that improves your quality of life and restores functionality.

Specialized Interventional Treatments

Our clinic offers a wide range of interventional procedures including epidural steroid injections, facet joint blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and regenerative medicine options. These minimally invasive techniques are designed to target pain at its source while minimizing recovery time and reducing reliance on pain medications.

Patient-Centered Care

The Omega difference lies in our commitment to compassionate, patient-centered care. We take the time to listen to your concerns, thoroughly evaluate your condition, and explain treatment options in clear, understandable terms. Our multidisciplinary approach ensures that all aspects of your pain are addressed, from physical symptoms to emotional well-being.

Contact Information

Location: 3838 S 700 E # 300, South Salt Lake, UT 84106, United States

Phone: +1 801-261-4988

Website: www.omegapainclinic.com

Schedule your consultation today and take the first step toward effective pain management with Utah's trusted pain intervention specialists.

column40:
I've been having neck & back pain for as long as I can remember. They were very thorough and made sure to do a full exam and x rays before any type of treatment to ensure they weren't doing more harm than good. After just the first adjustment, I felt so much relief and had more energy. Everyone is super nice. If you have the financial ability, definitely worth it.|This place is absolutely fantastic! My wife started working here administering the touch point injections. I came in to meet her coworkers and to see this amazing facility she had been telling me about. Upon entering the building, I was blown away by how clean and organized the flow of patients was set up.
I went to say hello to my wife but ended up having a lymphatic massage followed by a chiropractic adjustment by Dr. Jackson.
Before my adjustment, I was asked my medical history. I have had back surgery to fuse my lower back, so Dr. Jackson recommended some x-rays to ensure the adjustment wouldn't cause damage or hurt me.
After reviewing the x-rays, Dr. Jackson was able to adjust me and did such an amazing job. I had great movement throughout my entire body. Dr. Jackson's technique was soft but very affective.
Long story short, I'm scheduling an appointment for an overall wellness check and to create a care plan with Integrated pain specialist.
I can honestly say I'm excited to start feeling healthier/ better in mind and body due to the fantastic doctors, NP, and overall incredible staff this company has put together.|About two months ago I injured my neck and it was absolutely horrible. I started going to integrated and have been going there for the past six weeks, the knowledge they gave me about my neck and what we need to do to get it better was so eye opening. Most chiropractors are just adjust them and send them on their way, they way integrated does a detailed plan to not just give you temporarily relief but have a way to be forever pain free is amazing. Definitely would recommend to anyone|I have to admit, when I first came to Integrated Pain Specialists, I was skeptical. I didn't believe it would really help, but I was very pleasantly surprised. My back and neck are feeling so much better. After a week of coming, I had a better range of motion in my back. It was amazing! I have also been able to sit crisscross on the floor with my students. I didn't think I would be able to do that again, but I can and it's relatively comfortable.

Also, everyone at the clinic is kind, knowledgeable, sympathetic, and genuine. It's nice to come to a place where you actually feel like everyone is as invested in your health as you are. I would recommend Integrated Pain Specialists, in Bountiful to anyone.|When I came to Integrated I was having severe lower back pain.  They came together with a personalized plan just for me, focusing on not just getting me pain free but more flexible and mobile.  It has been a whole health approach, combining physical therapy with chiropractic work, and so many other things. The staff is amazing. They are friendly, they all take the time to get to know you, and have been committed to me seeing the results that I want. Overall they have exceeded my expectations. You aren't just a patient. They genuinely care about your wellness. I would highly recommend them to anyone!|In my constant quest for wellness, I stumbled into Integrated Wellness a few weeks back. My daughter recommended a chiropractor there. Dr. Jackson is one of the best I have ever worked with, and a most excellent replacement for the chiro that was keeping me going. They did comprehensive tests and recommended physical therapy in addition to the chiropractic I sought. The program I am on has returned me to feeling like myself, and we're only a third of the way through. In the words of one of the therapists, "Don't come here! Unless you want results..." They know their stuff, and use it to the patient's best advantage. Come here if you want to feel better!|Dr Jackson and his team have been beyond amazing! We took my daughter to several other Dr.'s and none of them could help us. After the first appointment we saw improvement and within 3 visits my daughter no longer had crippling headaches and blurred vision. Incredible team, flexible hours, so helpful.|This place is great.  For a one year and half that is could not sleep without twisting and turning in bed.  After my first week visit I could sleep  all night.  At work I could not stand my back pain from standing and sitting on my work chair.  Now I am Pain free.  I would recommend this place.

Lifespring Pain Management Center in Kaysville, Utah stands as the region's premier destination for comprehensive pain management solutions. As a specialized clinic dedicated to alleviating chronic pain, we combine advanced medical techniques with a compassionate approach to restore our patients' quality of life. Our team of board-certified pain management specialists understands that chronic pain affects not just your physical wellbeing but your emotional health and daily functioning as well.

At Lifespring, we take pride in our dynamic, team-oriented approach to pain management. Our doctors provide world-class, professional care tailored to each patient's unique needs. We specialize in treating a wide range of conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Knee pain and joint discomfort

  • Sciatic nerve pain

  • Abdominal and pelvic pain

  • Peripheral and diabetic neuropathy

  • Migraines and chronic headaches

  • Thoracic pain

  • Herniated disc complications

  • Failed back surgery syndrome

Our Patient-Centered Philosophy

What sets Lifespring Pain Management Center apart is our unwavering commitment to providing compassionate, loving, and nonjudgmental care. We understand that living with chronic pain can be isolating and frustrating. Our mission goes beyond simply treating symptoms—we focus on restoring hope and dignity while improving your overall quality of life. We work diligently to help you "spring back to life" from the limitations imposed by chronic pain.

Visit Our Kaysville Pain Management Clinic

Located at 275 W 200 N Suite 7, Kaysville, UT 84037, our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to provide effective pain management solutions. Whether you're suffering from recent injury pain or have been dealing with chronic conditions for years, our team is ready to develop a personalized treatment plan for you.

Contact us today at (801) 546-1300 to schedule your consultation, or visit www.lifespringutah.com to learn more about our services and approach to pain management.
column11:
Kaysville Pain Management Clinic

Lifespring Pain Management Center is the leading pain management clinic in Kaysville, Utah. Our goal is to provide compassionate, loving, caring, nonjudgmental service to you, treating your pain, restoring your hope and dignity, improving your quality of life and eventually helping you to spring back to life from the limitations of chronic pain.

column38: Samuel Vetter|Nancy Barajas|Chantee & Bryan Eby|Emily Brown|Daniele Christensen|Gus Crittenden|Chelsie Zamora|Brock Ricketts
column40:
*20+ year chronic pain problems, 6+ months now at Lifespring under Dr. Obah.*

I'll give a background on why I give a five-star review. The clinic has been outstanding and I want to recognize that just give people my journey so that they know what to expect.

For those who want a TL:DR: Dr Obah and Mina are excellent, they will take plenty of time with you and your appointment to hear your concerns. If you need a full hour for a visit they will give you a full hour and you will never feel rushed to leave. Every member of the staff knows me by first name. I have no trouble reaching them by phone. When necessary, I've been be worked in for a same day procedure or exam. It has been done with friendly smiles. They leave nothing off the table, but are most concerned with getting to the root causes of your pain rather than simply wanting to prescribe you something and expect you to forget about the rest.

Most of this probably goes without saying but I will say: Be aware, it is not an huge franchise clinic. Do check in with the office. Sometimes they will have short days or some of the staff might not be available, so they might be closed or scheduled for a half day. I can only foresee this being problematic if you don't keep in communication with them.

Now, to go a little bit longer just to give more details for those who want them to see what my treatment has been like-

For over 20 years now I have dealt with chronic pain due to several injuries from sports and a life of hard work. I have nerve issues, a neck injury, lower back injuries, knee, shoulder and other injuries. For the last two decades I have had a few different clinic experiences as I've moved. I've experienced the full range of good, bad and middling doctors and clinics. This past year some chronic health problems, the state of my injuries, and my pain had gotten so bad that life was becoming impossible. I couldn't stand up straight to walk, sit for long periods, sleep, take care of myself, dress in the morning, or simply live a normal life.

Lifespring, Dr. Obah, Mina, the other assistance, receptionists and staff have all been fantastic. They've helped me get to a point where I can stand up straight and walk upright again, clean my house like a normal person, dress myself, and get back to working, studying and being a normal person again. I had stopped even being able to engage in social activities and was becoming a shut-in. Things are back to normal! I hope others can experience the same.|I'm writing to express my concern about the poor customer service at the clinic. While Dr. Obah is a great and caring doctor, the reception staff, medical assistant's  and clinic systems are inefficient. They often don't answer calls or return voicemails, and even go on holiday closure  without addressing patient concerns and returning calls. This  has significantly impacted my experience at the clinic.|I initially started seeing Dr. Obah, because I was trying to utilize injections to pin point my pain. 2018 crushed me in many ways, the trauma & pain made it difficult to regulate my emotions at times (crying ALOT ). I have been approaching things with a multidisciplinary approach. I have had years of PT, counseling, surgeries, etc. I switched to Dr. Robison after deciding I wasn't going to do injections anymore. I adore Dr. Obah & the time he spends with his patients, which was needed for me at the beginning, but seeing as he is so...busy & the only one that does injections I felt like transferring to a different doctor was fair so others can benefit from his compassion that I feel is rare. Recently I have gotten new pain & have been working with Robison & Obah getting injections again. Because these 2 Dr.s have helped manage most of my pain & been diligent in helping find a resolution, my emotional regulation has improved substantially, which has helped me to be able to advocate for my self. Dr. Robison has given me multiple suggestions after listening to me, those suggestions have worked wonderfully with my health plan. She is hands on & thoroughly tries to help find resolutions. I have had one hiccup with billing. Out of the many injections I have had here, only one I paid $50 for sedation, which later happened to be refunded fully to my lifesprings account. The balance started getting lower, and I was told it was co-pays but the balance didn't reflect that. I didn't realize this was happening & I called and confirmed balance was $50 previous to scheduling an injection that insurance wouldn't cover sedation, after they looked to see who I spoke with, it was detetmined this was a new employee that gave me inaccurate information. I showed up thinking I had a $50 credit ready to cover the cost of the needed sedation. I felt horrible that I was in this situation again. I realized that Dr. Robison & I had discussed 2 injections, insurance coveres the sedation for the other so I suggested we switch so the time wasn't wasted. I was thankful for the resolution. In the past when I was new I recall a miscommunication & ended up in the injection room being asked if I had paid for sedation. I was devastated because I didn't have the funds, I started to get ready to leave & they said they'd take care of it. Since then I have noticed needed policies have been implemented to avoid this happening again, pre-approval & informing which injections insurance covers sedation for. After thinking of all they have done for me I decided to leave it be, it evens out. I hope to continue with them as they help me on my journey to get back to the healthy lifestyle I desire.  I have loved all the nurses, I only had one unfortunate encounter with a nurse I never worked with, luckily I was in a good place, I was able to be compassionate myself & realize they must've been having a bad day just like everyone else does, and although it seemed aimed at me I knew I didn't do anything wrong so I didn't own it, instead I killed it with kindness. So thankful for these 6 years working with lifesprings.|I had been seeing Dr Oba for years, but as I make my medications last longer than prescribed it was hard to guess when I would need to come in next. I had been through a few different providers that had come and gone, but then I started with NP Stacey Robison. Not only is she invested in my pain and physical quality of life. I do miss Liz her now moved on nurse, but her current nurse is wonderful too b|My sister sees this clinic and referred me.
I had my one single apt over a year ago (feb 2023)!!!
I see a clinic in ogden and considered transferring and being seen at this location due to having my medical card and it would of been easier dealing with it all in one place. One dr.
The dr i requested to see isn't who I was scheduled with. The clinic isn't comfortable or welcoming. And clearly completely unorganized which is absolutely unsettling being incharge of such a critical part of people's livelihood.
The apt was uncomfortable and I immediately left and called the previous pain clinic and rescheduled with them.
I never filled a script. I never went back.
So nine months after my apt the office receptionist calls to ask all of my address information so she can send me the refund for the apt. That was in October of 2023. I have literally called and left 5-10 voice-mails. Spoke to different humans. Including specifically the billing female. And still have never relieved the "refund". Or even follow up at this point.
I cannot imagine letting this clinic be incharge of my pain management.
The unorganization is embarrassing and scary!|Compassion is the last word I would use to describe this place. They are concerned with getting your money, NOT patient care. I would highly recommend finding a different pain management clinic.|If I could give zero stars and let you know do not waste your time with this clinic. Read half of the reviews they all mean it. This place is judgemental and do not care about your pain and will make you wait 3 months just to tell you no you are not an adequate client here. Are you serious? So getting my arm cut off and being in miserable pain doesn't qualify me? this place needs to shut down.|My husband and I have been going here for 5 years.  Dr Stacy and Dr Obah are amazing.  That's only if u can get by the rudest scheduling person, Jenny, who has time after time hung up on us rather than transferring then accusing us of hanging up on her.  After 5 minutes of hold I did call back assuming I wasn't on hold any longer.  I then called back and when she answered I quickly told her I simply needed to be transferred to our amazing Medical Assistant, Lindsey.  Perhaps a little more customer service and respect training for the gal who has full control of the phone system.   Again amazing doctors terrible reception.   Thanks for nothing Jenny.

Integrated Pain Specialists in South Jordan, Utah offers comprehensive pain management solutions for residents throughout Salt Lake County and surrounding areas. This specialized clinic takes a unique approach to treating chronic pain conditions by focusing on natural pain relief methods that target the root cause rather than simply masking symptoms. Their integrative treatment philosophy combines evidence-based therapies with personalized care plans to help patients regain mobility, reduce dependence on medications, and improve overall quality of life.

At Integrated Pain Specialists, patients find effective relief from a variety of chronic pain conditions including back pain, neuropathy, knee pain, joint discomfort, and post-surgical pain. Their multidisciplinary team utilizes advanced diagnostic techniques to identify the underlying causes of pain, allowing for more targeted and effective treatment approaches. By addressing pain at its source, patients often experience longer-lasting relief and improved functionality.

Treatment Approaches

The clinic offers a comprehensive range of non-invasive and minimally invasive treatments including physical therapy, chiropractic care, regenerative medicine, therapeutic injections, and customized rehabilitation programs. Their holistic approach may incorporate nutritional counseling, stress management techniques, and lifestyle modifications to support long-term pain management success.

Insurance and Accessibility

Integrated Pain Specialists works with most major insurance providers and proudly accepts Medicare, making quality pain management accessible to a wide range of patients. Their convenient South Jordan location at 10376 S Jordan Gateway, South Jordan, UT 84095 serves patients throughout the region with ample parking and a comfortable, welcoming environment.

To schedule a consultation or learn more about their innovative approach to pain management, visit https://integratedpainspecialists.com/ or call +1 801-816-0332. Their dedicated team is committed to helping patients find lasting relief from chronic pain and return to the activities they love.
column11: Pain Management Clinic specializing in natural pain relief methods that eliminate pain from the source rather than masking the symptoms. Find relief from back pain, neuropathy, knee pain and more! Medicare and Insurance accepted.

column40:
I have had the BEST experience with Integrated Pain Specialists. I've struggled with constant back pain for years and visited 4-5 different chiropractors, physical therapists, you name it. I never got better and sometimes I felt like the pain got worse. From the very beginning, I felt like Integrated does things completely different, and very much for the better. They make you feel like they truly care about helping you get better, and not just to treat the symptoms, but to actually get to the root of what is causing the problems. They explain everything to you so well throughout the whole process. Every person you encounter is so friendly and I genuinely enjoy spending time there. Who knew physical therapy could actually be fun? (Special shout-out to Price for making the PT portion the best part of the whole visit, which is usually NOT the case.)

I've been going 3x a week for about a month and have been wearing a brace and orthotics and as of this week, I have seen an 80% improvement. I can't even put into words how much this has already changed my life for the better. I can't possibly recommend them enough for anyone else who has been suffering from pain. Thank you all so much!|I am a former employee but also a patient. I ended up getting severe neck pain out of the blue from a muscle spasm and I called and team was quick to get me the treatment needed. They truly care about making sure you are taken care of. Sam is a fantastic PA and one of the only people I trust to inject. He is fantastic with his injections and knowledge when it comes to needing treatment. Learning from him and getting treatment from him has been exceptional throughout my time knowing him. The chiropractors are also just as great. I left with my neck way more improved having more movement than I did before the appointment because of the adjustment and injections. Kristina at the front desk and the Clinic Manager Wayne are also so good about making sure you get the treatment needed at the time you need it. Huge shoutout to Integrated!|Everyone from the doctors, to the aids, to the people working the desk, and the case managers are absolutely amazing. My appointments have become a highlight of my week. Not to mention the pain in my neck is  almost gone completely only halfway through my treatment plan! If you have persistent pain, you're doing yourself a disservice by not coming for a consultation.|I just finished my 12 week treatment and have made 76% improvement overall and significant increased mobility. The friendly faces and positive atmosphere always left me feeling 100% better than when I walked in the door. I highly recommend integrated pain specialists if you want to improve your life.|My experience at Integrated Pain Specialists has been TOP NOTCH!
From the initial review, to education, to treatment plan and implementation the team has been amazing!

For context: I was in a car crash prior to discovering IPS- and dealing with daily 8/10 pain that was causing me to miss work. I'm now 8 weeks into my 12 week treatment plan and I am happy to say that my pain is down to an average of 3/10.

The staff here makes you feel welcomed, and I seriously always look forward to coming!|After the first three weeks, it all  went downhill.  You are expected to come in and tote your chart around like a passport.  Otherwise, the chiropractor does not know what he is seeing you for and simply wants to "crack your back."   I was meant to have different treatments that I wasn't receiving because apparently, it's a self-serve facility.  You are expected to know you are responsible for asking for your care eventhough your paying them to care for you.  I had scheduled reoccuring appointments but couldn't get into get shots because I had to stand in line and wait around until I could weed my way in.  There were weeks that people were off, so no care was given nlthose weeks.  There is no backup person for injections.
I had appointments scheduled (reoccurring), and I would show up and be told that I wasn't scheduled because they forgot to schedule me out more.
I was also scheduled to have procedures done and needed a driver.  We scheduled time off work, and I have had those appointments both changed because Dr. Reed decided to "not work on Tuesdays anymore."  I had to reschedule a month later.  They set up two appointments, and Dr. Reed, yet again, was not available for one of them and got pushed out again.
Dr. Reed was doing a procedure on my back  and laughing at me because I was in pain.

Price their PT is amazing.  If they don't have 8 people occupying his area at the same time, he is great to work with and genuinely cares.  The issue is they herd people in there like cattle, and there is no room to do PT, but they definitely want to charge you for standing around.

Sam, their nurse who gives TP injections, is great as well.  Again, the  issues are he has no backup person when he takes time off, and you literally have to wait around in a crowd to get in to see him some days.

I've missed so much care that I should have had and am more pain now in my back than when I started.  My back and legs give out to where I collapse a few times a week.   I am so sad because I had high expectations for recovery and getting my life back.  

I am expecting a refund for the care not given AND something done to make it right.

A standard I'm sorry doesn't even come close to acceptable.  You all should know better than that.|Integrated pain specialists bas been the reason for my improvement! i have struggled with low back pain for 2 years and have seen significant results since coming here. The staff is wonderful as well!|I am so glad that I found these guys!! This is a one stop shop to address all of your needs with professional staff that really care. In one visit you can address things ranging from Estim to chiropractic to laser therapy to physical therapy to trigger point injections. This has made a world of difference in my life!!

Spinal Interventions serves Provo, Utah and surrounding communities with comprehensive pain management solutions focused on non-surgical approaches. Our dedicated team of healthcare professionals understands that chronic pain can significantly impact your quality of life, which is why we've developed a multidisciplinary approach to address various pain conditions. Located conveniently in Utah County, we've built our reputation on providing personalized care plans that combine innovative treatments with compassionate service.

At Spinal Interventions, our board-certified physicians, physician assistants, and nurse practitioners work collaboratively to deliver high-quality care for patients seeking effective pain relief. Our practice emphasizes minimally invasive procedures that can provide significant relief without the risks and recovery time associated with major surgery. These include:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Facet joint injections

  • Radiofrequency ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Nerve blocks

Comprehensive Treatment Approach

Beyond interventional procedures, we offer medication management services tailored to each patient's specific needs and medical history. Our team also incorporates cognitive-behavioral therapy techniques to address the psychological aspects of chronic pain, providing patients with coping strategies and tools to improve their overall well-being.

Patient-Centered Care

We believe in creating partnerships with our patients through education and shared decision-making. Our team takes the time to explain conditions, treatment options, and expected outcomes, empowering you to take an active role in your pain management journey.

Visit Our Practice

Located at 280 W River Park Dr # 200, Provo, UT 84604, our modern facility is designed with your comfort in mind. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 801-223-4860 or visit our website at www.spinalinterventions.com. Our team is ready to help you find relief and restore your quality of life.

Pain Management Center in Salt Lake City, Utah offers comprehensive solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our specialized team of board-certified physicians and pain management experts work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient.

At the Pain Management Center, we understand that chronic pain can significantly impact your quality of life. Our multidisciplinary approach combines advanced medical interventions, physical therapy, and behavioral health strategies to effectively treat and manage various pain conditions, including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Joint and musculoskeletal pain

  • Post-surgical pain

  • Cancer-related pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

Patient-Centered Approach

We believe in creating individualized treatment plans that address not only the physical aspects of pain but also its emotional and psychological components. Our goal is to improve function and quality of life while reducing reliance on medication when possible.

Location and Appointments

The Pain Management Center is conveniently located at 615 Arapeen Dr 100 #100, Salt Lake City, UT 84108. All visits are by appointment only, ensuring that each patient receives the dedicated time and attention they deserve. To schedule a consultation, please call us at (801) 581-7246.

For more information about our services or to request an appointment online, visit our website at healthcare.utah.edu/paincenter.

Olympus Pain Group in Murray, Utah offers comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Salt Lake Valley. Our board-certified physicians specialize in treating chronic and acute pain conditions using evidence-based approaches that minimize reliance on opioid medications. With a patient-centered philosophy, we develop customized treatment plans that may include interventional procedures, physical therapy, medication management, and innovative therapies designed to improve quality of life and restore function.

At Olympus Pain Group, we address a wide spectrum of pain conditions including back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain. Our interventional procedures include epidural steroid injections, facet joint injections, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and regenerative medicine options. Each treatment plan is tailored to the individual patient's needs following thorough diagnostic evaluation.

Our Patient-First Approach

Alturas Pain and Spine Specialists serves St. George, Utah and surrounding communities with exceptional pain management services under the direction of Dr. Stacie Oliver. This comprehensive pain management clinic specializes in treating a wide spectrum of pain conditions with particular expertise in interventional spine care. Patients benefit from evidence-based therapies and minimally invasive techniques delivered in a compassionate, patient-centered environment.

Dr. Stacie Oliver brings impressive credentials and extensive experience to her practice. After graduating from the University of Utah School of Medicine in 2010, she completed her specialized pain medicine fellowship at UCLA in Santa Monica in 2015. With over 7 years of dedicated experience in pain management, Dr. Oliver established Alturas Pain and Spine Specialists in June 2022 with a clear vision: creating a truly patient-centered practice focused on achieving better outcomes through compassionate care.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

The clinic offers specialized treatment for numerous pain conditions including but not limited to:

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Interventional spine procedures

  • Joint pain management

  • Neuropathic pain conditions

  • Minimally invasive pain interventions

Patient-Centered Approach

What sets Alturas Pain and Spine Specialists apart is their unwavering commitment to patient-centered care. Dr. Oliver and her dedicated staff create personalized treatment plans that address each patient's unique pain challenges, focusing on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence.

Convenient Location

The clinic is conveniently located on the first floor at 295 S 1470 E, Suite 102, St. George, UT 84790, making it easily accessible for patients with mobility concerns. This thoughtful location choice reflects the practice's commitment to patient comfort and accessibility.

Phone: (435) 222-5527

Website: www.alturaspainandspine.com

column3:
Utah Valley Pain Management serves Provo, UT with comprehensive pain management solutions as part of Intermountain Healthcare's extensive network. Located in the heart of Utah County, our specialized clinic combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help patients overcome chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team of board-certified physicians and pain specialists work collaboratively to develop personalized treatment plans that address the unique needs of each patient.

At Utah Valley Pain Management, we offer a wide range of interventional and non-interventional pain management treatments. Our multidisciplinary approach includes medication management, minimally invasive procedures, physical therapy recommendations, and behavioral health support. We specialize in treating conditions such as back and neck pain, joint pain, neuropathic pain, complex regional pain syndrome, and post-surgical pain.

Part of Intermountain Healthcare's Network

As one of 180 medical clinics within Intermountain Healthcare's system of 22 hospitals, Utah Valley Pain Management benefits from shared resources, expertise, and integrated care coordination. This connection allows our patients seamless access to additional specialists and services when needed, ensuring comprehensive care for even the most complex pain conditions.

Location and Contact Information

Our clinic is conveniently located at 395 Cougar Blvd #803, Provo, UT 84604. To schedule an appointment or learn more about our services, please call us at (801) 235-7246. We accept most major insurance plans and work closely with patients to navigate coverage options.

Patient-Centered Approach

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life. Our goal is not just to reduce pain but to improve function and quality of life. Each treatment plan is developed with the patient's goals in mind, whether that's returning to work, enjoying favorite activities, or simply performing daily tasks without discomfort.

For more information about Utah Valley Pain Management and our services, visit our website at intermountainhealthcare.org.
column11: Utah Valley Pain Management is located in Provo, UT and is part of a system of 22 hospitals and about 180 medical clinics operated by Intermountain Healthcare.

column40:
It was a little slow at start. But having been in and out pain management for 15 years. I am happy for some of the protocols. After you go through it it becomes easier and easier month after month. My dr Travis diamond has a real sense for care. He is also patient and knowledgeable, h e answered all my wife's questions and concerns helped with; also understand a new condition and state I was in understanding the seriousness of it. Thanks an ton Travis I hope we can work together for many more year I appreciate your help!|My experience was wonderful. Everyone was very efficient and nice and Dr. Benfield is exceptional. He always prepared me for what was going to happen next, so there were no surprises and my appointment went perfect!|This is a great clinic. I've been working with them for a number of years now and they really have helped me with chronic pain that isn't going away, ever. Ive needed to learn to cope, exercise, learn and change many things as well minimize pain.

I've worked with a couple of different providers and they all treat me like a person, not just some chart number. Sir Travis Dimmond (lots of initials here}, Dr. Jeffrey CJ Bentley (lots of initials here too) are two providers who have taken care of me as if was their bestie or something.

They don't have a foot out of the door as soon as they walk into the room like many other physicians and practitioners do.  The others who assist are excellent as well! Tracy, Teresa, to name a couple who are awesome.

Anyway ... This is the place.

Update on 1/7/25
They are as good as they ever was

Update 1/8/25
I got a response from Intermountain after I gave the update. Just the pre programmed text.
I took the time to write a review.
I would appreciat it if you took the time to write a response.
I realize you're a big company, and perhaps many people are leaving responses every day. I am also positive that you have a very large PR team. So Even Steven.
Having a computer, send a thank you, is not a thank you.
Imagine getting the exact same computer-generated happy birthday email from your brother every year. While it was just pre programmed into his email system. And your brother just kept moving along on his path and didn't miss a beat.
Like that... downscale that by 99%, that's the example to make a point but on a lot less meaningful scale lol.

I still give this place FIVE STARS!
Doctor Bentley and Travis Dimmond are the two people I work with the most and I can't tell everybody how much I appreciate those two. They have helped me so much along my journey. They are the definition of medical professionals.

The front desk and scheduling staff are amazing too. I know a few of the names, and I really want to say thanks personally to each of those as well, but there's others I don't know their names and I don't want them to feel left out. So I won't leave names, and I will just say all of them are awesome.
It is true, you wouldn't think a front desk staff has that big of an influence on my health. They certainly do, in many ways! Sometimes I feel they have moved mountains on my behalf.
So thanks to them too. A good team like that probably doesn't get recognized enough but they have my thanks and appreciation.

Ok. Enough for today.|This is an amazing clinic.  Everyone is so so kind.  Rob Harkness is especially amazing, he is kind and takes the time to listen and actually help me manage my pain (without judgment) so that I can actually have a better quality of life.  Thank you.|Working with Dr. Rob Harkness has been for me, a great fit. He is compassionate, highly qualified; He meets or excells in the highest definition of competency as well in providing the highest standard of professional care, and support. All this combined, Dr. Rob Harkness has in working with me, added significantly to my quality of life.  I highly recommend Dr. Rob Harkness.|It was a very good experience.  The pre procedural nurse was very instructive and Dr Hruska was caring and willing to answer all my questions.  She talked me thru every step and explained what I would be feeling.  It was so helpful.  I handled it very well because of her expertise.|Dr Tiemann was so great. He really listened and helped me understand what the problem was.  Highly recommend him and this clinic|When I really new that I couldn't take care of myself and LOST EVERYTHING and went down hill fast they HELPED ME AND I THANK ALL THE STAFFF AND DR.
ALSO THE CLEANING STAFF THANK YOU . TOPNOTCH WITH BEDSIDE MANNER
YOU GUY ARE AWESOME    

This is for the hole IHC

Utah Spine Specialists serves patients throughout Davis, Salt Lake, and Weber Counties as a premier full-spectrum pain management center in Northern Utah. Our dedicated team combines exceptional professional expertise with compassionate personal care, offering the highest qualifications among pain specialists in the region. We understand that pain manifests in numerous ways and impacts quality of life significantly, which is why we've developed comprehensive treatment approaches for patients suffering from various pain conditions.

At Utah Spine Specialists, we address a wide range of pain conditions including:

  • Spine-related pain

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain from nerve damage

  • Arthritis-related discomfort

  • Pain resulting from degenerative disk disease

  • Herniated disk complications

  • Spinal stenosis

Personalized Treatment Approach

We recognize that each patient's pain experience is unique. Our specialists take time to thoroughly evaluate your condition, identify the underlying causes, and develop tailored restorative therapies that address your specific needs. This individualized approach ensures more effective pain management and improved quality of life.

Our Convenient Location

Located at 1551 S Renaissance Towne Dr, Suite 540, Bountiful, UT 84010, our modern facility is equipped with advanced diagnostic and treatment technologies. We're centrally positioned to serve patients throughout Northern Utah with accessible, specialized care.

Contact Information

To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services:

Phone: +1 801-294-7246

Website: https://utah-spine.com/

Let Utah Spine Specialists help you reclaim your life from chronic pain with our expert care and comprehensive treatment options.

column11: Utah Spine Specialists is a full spectrum pain management center servicing Davis, Salt Lake, and Weber Counties. Our staff excels professionally and personally with the highest qualifications of any pain specialists in Northern Utah. Our patients suffer from all types of pain and the other syndromes pain can cause. We help patients with spine-related pain, back and neck pain, as well as joint pain caused by nerve damage and arthritis; different manifestations of pain developed from many different sources. Whether your pain is the result of degenerative disk disease, arthritis, a herniated disk, spinal stenosis, or conditions that cause neck, joint or back pain, we can tailor a restorative therapy to address your needs.

column40:
What a great staff and especially  Konny .. I've never met a Physician that has been so caring and took the time to explain my condition.  I felt so comfortable  and cared about .. also Konny's diagnosis was spot on even though I doubted it at first. .. I really don't write reviews but if anyone is considering pain management give them a try. I Guarantee you won't be disappointed !!|This was a beyond frustrating experience for my wife and myself. They gave a shot on the wrong side to my wife at first, and the nurse said she had done this before and apologized. The doctor ended up missing this as well. It's been well over a month, and my wife is still in pain on the side that never needed it. I approached numerous lawyers and DOPL and continuing to do so. I have called 6 times and left voicemails as well as walked in personally, and there are no responses from them to recommend something to help or at least apologize at the complete bare minimum.|Really good. Life changing for me. A surgeon referred me to have surgery, but I tried going here to get by for longer without it. After a series of visits my pain minimized each time and eventually was gone for 5 years - without surgery. I went back recently when it started to return and had an equally great experience and results. I see Dr Westin and PA, Konny.|I am writing this after only one visit, so it is only based on an initial consultation with Dr. Weston, also attended by Jared, who assisted with initial questions and in recording the discussion. Even though I have yet to receive treatment, I am writing now because some of the more recent reviews have been a bit salty toward Dr. W and the atmosphere of the office. I found Dr. Weston completely personable, bright, and articulate. He explained his interpretation of my MRI patiently. He took the time to answer all of my questions. I will be getting a second opinion, because a screwed up spine is serious stuff, to me. But Dr. W completely impressed me with his intellect and demeanor. He took my questions and concerns seriously, and I believe he is interested in helping me with my quality of life.Jared was awesome too, and seemed happy with the whole scene.  So that's cool. Peace.|The shot I received did nothing,  I was told they would give me 2 shots, my invoice said I received 2 shots,  one was supposed to be in the right side of my spine the other in the left,  they gave me both shots in the right side.  I then returned to talk about possibly getting a different procedure for my pain, and asked for a doctors note for my work for light duty, I basically have no disc left between L5 and S1 and the three above those are bulging and torn. They said it's not severe enough to get a note! I'm only 48, I'm not overweight or unhealthy.  My pain is so severe I can't sleep,  play with my children,  sit up out of bed, run or jump. And this is not severe enough to warrant a light duty note?  This place only wants your money. They don't care about individual circumstances or your well being, or health.  They also never answer the phone,  return emails, or phone calls.  Find someone else that actually cares about you and your individual medical needs.|I made an appointment for pain from a neck fusion. They didn't even let me speak to a doctor. The PA. "Josh" refused to help me with any pain medication and referred me to another doctor in their office. Another co-pay and more office visit. He did give me a prescription for Diclofenac without asking me if there was a history of heart issues. Being in my sixty's , I researched Diclofenac. There are many studies that claim this drug is related to and can cause heart attacks. This pain clinic appears to me to be just a money maker for the doctors. With no help for the patients. I will be looking for another clinic that has better educated staff. I recommend don't go here.
Also, The nurse assistant had a disgusting nose-ring. That was a definite clue  this office is not professional.|This place is pretty bad. The doctor started off the conversation by telling me he doesn't prescribe pain killers, even though I didn't ask. The said my neck warrants a surgery, but all they can do is give me an injection. They wouldn't even tell me what the injection was or how/if it would help me. Save your money and time and go somewhere else.|Prior to my appointment I read a ton of reviews for Dr. Stevens and was surprised at all the people who expected to meet with a surgeon and gain a friend. He didn't hug me when I walked in. He did, however, educate me on the extent of my back injury and what my options were. He took time to answer all of my questions in a kind and professional manner.  He was kind and respectful. I haven't had my procedure yet but expect that it will go well.

Edit:
I have since had the procedure and it has changed my life in the most positive way possible. I was walking directly after surgery, the next day I helped my Wife clean and felt the best that I have felt in a very long time. More importantly than bedside manner, which was good, Dr. Stevens is a world-class surgeon.

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Phusion Wellness serves West Jordan, Utah and surrounding communities with comprehensive wellness services designed to address both physical and mental health needs. Our dedicated team of healthcare professionals takes a holistic approach to wellness, treating each patient as an individual with unique concerns rather than simply addressing symptoms. Located conveniently in the Jordan Landing shopping area, we've become a trusted resource for residents seeking to improve their quality of life through evidence-based treatments and personalized care plans.

At Phusion Wellness, we offer a diverse range of services including specialized pain management solutions, behavioral counseling, and integrative wellness programs. Our pain management protocols combine traditional medical approaches with complementary therapies to provide effective relief while minimizing medication dependence. The behavioral counseling services address anxiety, depression, stress management, and other mental health concerns through individualized treatment plans designed to build resilience and promote emotional well-being.

Personalized Patient Care

What truly sets Phusion Wellness apart is our commitment to personalized care. We take the time to understand each patient's medical history, lifestyle factors, and personal goals before developing treatment strategies. This patient-centered approach ensures that all recommendations are tailored to form a solid foundation for long-term health and wellness. Our practitioners work collaboratively with patients, empowering them to take an active role in their healing journey.

Visit Us

We welcome new patients at our comfortable, modern facility located at 7611 Jordan Landing Blvd #103, West Jordan, UT 84084. To schedule a consultation or learn more about our services, call us at +1 801-486-1616 or visit our website at [https://phusionwellness.com](https://phusionwellness.com/?campaign=GoogleListing&keyword=GoogleListing). Experience the difference that truly personalized wellness care can make in your life.

column40:
I have been in pain management for over 10 years and have seen all the challenges a reputable doctor faces trying to help their patients. Overprescribing was such an issue the results have hurt so many. Unfortunately my doctor retired early because of all the headaches from being a caring, professional provider. Phusion Wellness is none of those things. They only care about $! They charge $250 per visit no matter of what your insurance covers. They have no doctors I'm aware of and at best a Physician Assistant will help you. They have you do a "behavioral health" appointment each month to help look like they've been proactive. It's trying to sell more services you don't need. You don't even get to be seen in office more than 1 every 6 months. The minimum requirement of the FDA. I failed a UA after all the years of not ever having any issues. I was told it corner from touching money or anything so simple. They only care about their $ and possibly getting in trouble for having that effect them. If you want a place that will prescribe to basically anyone as long as you follow all the rules and pay the bills this is the place. Katelyn is an unqualified person to have your life in her hands. She decided to kick me out of the program. Not my doctor, because I didn't even have one, but not even my physician assistant. She, not a medical professional, decided to kick me out of the program. I should have left there already. Looking for a new doctor is daunting. I know this happening is for the best. If you have true needs for pain management DON'T go here! If you're looking for the new face of "pill mills" this IS the place for you.|Phusion Wellness providers and staff are among the best in the business. They lead w empathy, compassion and truly care about their patients and their long term pain management. They provide many resources and forms of therapy to guide you to healing and maintaining your pain management over the long term. I would recommend if you're looking for a staff that truly cares and puts their patients first, reach out to Phusion Wellness, Greg is my provider, Michelle is amazing as well.|So very pleased with the level of care that I have received from Phusion Wellness Pain Clinic & Behavioral Health Specialists where I have been a patient for 3+ years.
This pain clinic is unlike any other clinic that I have experienced in my decades-long quest to manage chronic pain.
The staff demonstrates sincere care and compassion re: your well-being. They are far-more authentically-supportive than other clinics that I've dealt with throughout the past  20 years (namely while living in the Midwest), while attempting to manage chronic pain.
Truly, Phusion provides a world of positive difference in contrast to what I was used to dealing with in a pain clinic setting.
The clinic in Mesa, AZ. is phenomenal!
The doctors are wonderful and strive to help you achieve the highest level  'quality of life' possible for your particular health situation and needs.
The counselors are absolutely top-notch and provide excellent support for the patients in many capacities and utilize various therapeutic modalities.
The entire staff, (from schedulers to intake nurses), are friendly and efficient.
If you're in need of knowledgeable and caring pain specialists, give Phusion Wellness a try!
Kris B.|Phusion Wellness has been life changing. From my intake interview to present day the Staff are caring, understanding and I never feel judged for disabilities and need for more than being a pin cushion my previous providers. The addition of Behavioral Health Therapy monthly is invaluable. I am able to work again and function in society. Thank you to the entire staff.|Phusion Wellness has been a life saver for me. I never expected to be a chronic pain patient but due to a neurosurgeon destroying my cervical spine I do experience regular pain. Greg and Chad are fabulous and I love the consistency of setting up appointments. The behavioral workshops help so much because it helps me realize I am not alone.|I am pleased with my visit. Very stress free and calm. Everyone was extremely nice. Dr. Taylor Jenkins was very nice, up front about the type of treatments they offer and listened. I'm highly impressed!|Phusion Wellness is absolutely wonderful! I can't say enough good things about Renee--she's simply amazing at what she does! Renee has such a kind and gentle nature, and she really takes the time to listen. FNP's  like her are truly one in a million, and I wholeheartedly recommend Phusion Wellness and Renee to anyone in need of exceptional care!|This place saved my life. I had to leave my last pain management place due to bad management practices by the physician,  I found this place by shear accident,  they have been a God Send. Even though they are a long way from home , I only have to make 2 visits in person per year. The rest are all telemed visits. Which are totally awesome!. Plus the classes that follow are so educational & have helped greatly.  I love Phusion Wellness so much more than my old situation.  It's like night & day between the 2. If you need a place to go to I highly recommend this one if you are in chronic pain. Once you get in their schedule & get into the routi n e you will see life better than you have.

column2: Alpine Pain and Rehabilitation of Utah
column3:
Alpine Pain and Rehabilitation of Utah serves the Lehi, Utah area with comprehensive pain management solutions designed for those suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our integrated pain clinic brings together multiple treatment modalities under one roof, creating a holistic approach to pain management that addresses both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain. At Alpine Pain and Rehab of Utah, we understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why our compassionate team of specialists works together to develop personalized treatment plans focused on improving function and quality of life.

Our multidisciplinary approach combines various therapeutic interventions including medical injections, physical therapy, guided physical activity, psychological counseling, and medication management. This integrated strategy allows us to address pain from multiple angles, providing more effective and sustainable relief than single-modality approaches. Each treatment plan is customized to the individual patient's needs, conditions, and goals.

Our Holistic Philosophy

At Alpine Pain and Rehab, we believe in treating the whole person, not just the pain. Our goal extends beyond simply reducing pain levels—we aim to help patients reclaim their lives by improving their ability to work, enjoy family time, and shift focus away from their pain. Our team is dedicated to teaching patients effective coping strategies and pain management techniques that promote long-term wellness and functional improvement.

Expert Team of Providers

Our clinic features a collaborative team of pain specialists, physical therapists, mental health professionals, and support staff who work together to deliver coordinated care. This team approach ensures that all aspects of your pain condition are addressed comprehensively, maximizing your chances for meaningful improvement.

Contact Information

To learn more about our services or to schedule an appointment, please visit our website at www.alpinepainandrehab.com or call us at +1 801-766-6055. Our clinic is conveniently located at 3051 W Maple Loop Dr # 125, Lehi, UT 84043.
column11: Alpine Pain and Rehab of Utah is an integrated pain clinic encompassing multiple modalities to treat the patient in chronic pain. We bring together a compassionate group of providers who use injections, physical therapy, physical activity, psychological counseling, and medication management in a holistic approach to managing and improving function in those patients who have been struggling with keeping their jobs, trying to enjoy their family, and trying to focus on something other than their pain. We want you to truly be at peace with your pain by teaching the chronic pain patient how to deal with the difficulties of life in pain.

EGAN.Thanks for the help|I have some pretty rare health issues that cause me tremendous pain. I have been under the care of a pain specialist since starting my journey to a diagnosis 10 years ago. Once my diagnosis was made my previous specialist did not bother to listen or care to learn about it or me. I was given a pill to shut me up for every issue I had. I was referred to Dr. Child by my best friend. I have never been more thankful to find this provider and his team. They are always, kind, professional and willing to go the extra mile for me and I am sure every single one of their patients. They have a multi step therapy plan to help you reach your best pain free goals. I am no longer just thrown pills and if I need an increase in something after doing procedures and therapy, I am never looked at or meant to feel like an addict because I am not. I never wanted to live my life in pain, I never wanted to need to be medicated but I am glad that Dr. Child and his staff are empathetic and understand that sometimes it is necessary for people who suffer from debilitating pain day in and day out. His bedside manner is next to nothing that I have ever seen and I am lucky to have many top specialist over my care and his is top of the top. Do not hesitate to come and see Dr. Child because I have no doubt that he will do what is right and necessary for your individual needs. I am so lucky to have found him, I just wish it was sooner.|I have been a patient of Dr Egans for about 4 years. I thought he was a wonderful Dr until today. My appointment was at 8:30 this morning, it came and went. I didn't receive a phone call or text nothing. After I called repeatedly they finally called me back. I am Extremely Disappointed in how they handled this situation. I really love all the ladies in the office, I will miss them. But the Doc, I expected more from him.  I thought he was a great Doctor and actually cared about his patients but in truth it's all about the money.  Sad but true!!|I've never seen them, because they demanded "proof" I have chronic pain. They asked for a doctor's referral, which I provided. Then they said that's not enough. When asked what I should provide that would be enough, they would not tell me. I hope they help people, because they sure didn't help me. Very rude and unhelpful.|I am always greeted warmly by the front desk.  Brent Egan is a truly kind person who honestly cares about his patients.   He always takes the time to go over anything you need him to.  He explains things to make sure you understand.  I'm so happy I found him.|Forced to wait 45 minutes for an appointment.
They are unprofessional - disorganized and rude.
I walked out after waiting and being told they can't do injections where I needed them.
